name: user_0
review: Nice lot if activities need entire day to cover all

name: user_1
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers an unforgettable experience packed with excitement, adventure, and fun for all ages! From thrilling rides like Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy to family-friendly attractions like Madagascar and Shrek 4D, theres something for everyone. The park is well-organized, clean, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The attention to detail in each themed zonefrom Hollywood to Ancient Egyptis truly impressive. We especially enjoyed the WaterWorld showan action-packed performance that left us in awe. Queues can be long during peak hours, so getting the Express Pass is highly recommended. Dining options are varied and cater to different tastes, and the souvenir shops offer plenty of fun memorabilia. Overall, its a fantastic way to spend a day with family or friends, making memories that will last a lifetime. Highly recommended for tourists and locals alike!

name: user_2
review: Mummy ride was great but cost way too much for express pass and food around the park. Transformers ride was completely closed and waterwork show, battlestar galactica was a nuisance to get on as your not allowed to have anything in your pockets but then have to sit in a 90 minute queue then come out to the locker and have no way of paying. Not even a slimline bumbag holding only a credit card was allowed. They dont have many ways to combat the heat around the park so express pass is the only way unless you wanna sweat all the way through hours of queueing and not enough thrill rides, cyclon was just a bit janky and made me feel sick and human was too slow and boring for such a long queue. I wouldnt recommend.

name: user_7
review: Must visit place of Singapore. Please download and use Universal Studios app toknow about wait times, minimum height needed etc Major attractions Revenge of the Mummy Transformers Jurassic Park ride Canopy Flyer Roller Coaster Light, Camera, Action Minion world Enchanted Airways Shrek 4D adventure Wait Times Express entry might help you to reduce wait time, but it is additional cost. Single riders will be available for few rides and it would be useful to reduce wait times.

name: user_8
review: Very good place for all kids and adults and even adventurers too. Totally it is worth it if you can cover whole universal studios

name: user_10
review: While Universal Studios Singapore is smaller than other Universal Studios. There are several must try rides that are definitely worth the line. Dont miss the mummy ride, the Jurassic park ride and the puss and boots ride in far far away. They also recently opened minion land that was pretty interesting. Make sure to bring sun screen and a poncho as you can get wet in some rides.

name: user_14
review: Fantastic park and had a great day with friends , tip is to enter at entry time and youll get a few rides free of queueing

name: user_18
review: Reach early, install the universal app, plan on advance the rides you want to ride and enjoy

name: user_21
review: Not bad to play! However, kindergarten children are more afraid of some facilities. You can visit all the rides in half a day with a quick pass!

name: user_22
review: Worst place for vegetarian, not much options to eat , you could get icecreams or juices but overpriced. They didn't allow outside food , they want kids to starve?

name: user_23
review: Had an awesome time with 2 kids , initially there was rush but afternoon it was almost empty. Maybe weekends you will need an express ticket.

name: user_28
review: So much fun! Recommend to go if youre in Singapore. Fun with family or friends. All the rides are a must.

name: user_32
review: Went on a sunday Mothers Day! There wasnt so many people if i were to compare it with Disneyland but going home during closing time is a different story, the line to the sentosa express can be very long and takes a while, i suggest going around other areas in Sentosa thats walkable if you still have the energy for that. The overall theme park experience is honestly nice and its easy to go around, can be very hot in the afternoon. Also have a number of restaurants you can chill out to when youre too tired midday. The latest addition minion land is my favorite part as a minions fan :) love all the meet and greet, download their app to keep yourself updated during your visit. All worth it :)

name: user_33
review: It is a very fun park, I recommend you go during the week. If you go on the weekend, I recommend you get a VIP ticket, there are long lines. CYLON is incredibly fun, I rode it twice. There were long lines at noon, so I got on it very easily when I went in the evening. My advice is that if there is a line longer than 30 minutes somewhere, you can skip that place and go to places where there is no line. Definitely download the app. It tells you how long you will wait there. You can plan accordingly.

name: user_35
review: Went there again after 10 years. Place looked and smelled like Serangoon Road. Mels Drive in suddenly had a new burger called tandoori. 1 ride closed. Another ride closed for cleaning. Hot as hell.

name: user_37
review: one of the staff named Tiara who was assigned to be at the Minions ride was VERY VERY RUDE to me! yes it was probably my fault because i didn't use the way they "instructed" to and i went to walk behind her and accidentally tripped over her feet. I said I'm so sorry and guess what she said? "NO YOU DO NOT DO THAT!" right in front of me and my partner. I expected more good hospitality from the workers as we came to enjoy. Please train her with more of a common sense.

name: user_38
review: Have a great time

name: user_40
review: Too crowded. Went on a school holiday by mistake. Express passes were sold out in advance although the express queues mostly seemed empty. About 1 hr waiting on every ride with some rides even having 2 hr waiting. Queues for even meet and greet with characters made it worse. Could only take a couple of rides due to high waiting times Recommend to check in advance about public and schools holidays and only go if you are able to get an express pass on a holiday. DO BUY THE EXPRESS PASSES IN ADVANCE IF YOU WANT TO TAKE IT. It gets sold out if you wait till the last day

name: user_42
review: We had a fantastic day out here! We got here from Vivo City via the Sentosa Express train which is very convenient. The park is very well maintained and clean. We bought our tickets online so the entry to the park was no hassle. The energy inside the park is just awesome, everything was well organised from meet & greets to shows. There are plenty of food options too- from quick snacks and drinks to proper meals at theme styled restaurants. Overall it was a great experience from morning till evening with great memories to take home!

name: user_43
review: My experience was on 17 May 2025 (Saturday) Some Issues I Faced: -The roller coaster seat smelled like sweat and it honestly made me feel like throwing up. I was one of the earliest people to get on too. -The ticket price was still full price even though some major attractions like Transformers: The Ride and Waterworld were closed. No discounts offered. -Waiting time not accurate. -Some rides, like Canopy Flyer, suddenly broke down and we had to wait ages for them to fix it. The staff didnt take the initiative to explain things. -The park closed early at 7PM. The lights had just turned on and everything looked so nice for photos, but we had to leave. No light show, water show, or fireworks either. -The Q system was ok la.. but there were no chairs. Standing for so long was exhausting! -The restaurant was too crowded and the food was just ok. Tips if Youre Planning to Go: -Get there before 8.30AM to avoid the crowds and long queues. -Bring your own water bottlethere are refill stations. -Check the Sentosa website for maintenance updates, opening hours and etc. -Hit the popular rides first, and then pick ones with shorter waiting time as you go. -Always check the weather forecast beforehand, even if its not 100% accurate. -Do some research and read reviews or other peoples experiences before buying tickets and planning your day. -Go on weekdays and avoid peak months and public holidays. Overall: This is my first theme park, but I think it might be average compared to others. Thankfully, I didnt run into any really serious problems like some others did. Despite the issues, I still managed to enjoy myself but i'm still sad that Transformers: The Ride was closed that day (i can't changed my fixed date ticket) y

name: user_44
review: Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is Southeast Asias first and only Universal Studios theme park, located within Sentosa Island. The park features 24 rides, shows, and attractions across seven themed zones, each inspired by blockbuster movies and television series. Great place to visit with your family and the kids will just go bonkers. USS is divided into seven immersive zones: Hollywood: Experience the glamour of Tinseltown with its iconic Walk of Fame and street performances. New York: Features attractions like Lights, Camera, Action! hosted by Steven Spielberg. Sci-Fi City: Home to Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, a pair of dueling roller coasters, and Transformers: The Ride 3D. Ancient Egypt: Offers the thrilling Revenge of the Mummy indoor roller coaster. The Lost World: Features Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure and Canopy Flyer. Far Far Away: Brings to life the world of Shrek with attractions like Shrek 4-D Adventure. Minion Land: Opened on February 14, 2025, replacing the Madagascar zone, this area includes attractions like Despicable Me Minion Mayhem, Buggie Boogie carousel, themed restaurants, and shops.

name: user_45
review: Visited recently and explored the new minions land. Fun and enjoyable for family with several roller coaster rides.

name: user_48
review: Didn't have to wait very long for rides, 15 to 45 minutes max as it wasn't any particular holiday for the 2 most populous countries in the world. We enjoyed ourselves very much. Definitely cater some times for the meet n greets as some are really worthwhile. Minions area has great details for minions fans.

name: user_50
review: Not a patch on Universal in Florida but the price reflects this. Not many rides - the 2 roller coasters are worth a visit. Disappointed that with so few rides compared to Florida, Transformers and Waterworld were both closed on the day we went. They cant afford to have rides closed with not many there!

name: user_52
review: Children over 12 years old will definitely enjoy the rides. It's worth trying, and the safety measures are very Good Must Try 2 Roller Coaster Transformer Jurassic Park Water Ride Egypt

name: user_53
review: It was so much fun. If I have the chance, I will definitely go play it again. Even if I have the chance, I can have fun alone.

name: user_54
review: Always a pleasure visiting this place. My kids had a blast as did my husband and I. Only hang up is the long waiting time for the rides and express tickets are heavy on the pocket. There should be a better way to manage this.

name: user_56
review: wow i actually cant believe how fun it was it was absolutely superb if you havent gone there i think you should go as soon as possible dont miss out on something great!!

name: user_61
review: Went mid week got express pass , the wait time without it was 40-50 minutes per ride so I think worth it , also got it discounted since purchased early online . The rides are fun the food is great and plenty of nice souvenirs around , overall a very fun. Super clean and organized with awesome rides

name: user_62
review: Food isnt great ,considering its tourist place could have been better options for ppl travel across countries ,toilets arent well maintained ,ride are good not too much waiting times,cant compare with other studio

name: user_65
review: I visited USS on 18 May and, despite the heavy rain, had an overall enjoyable experienceuntil the end (5.15pm), when my girlfriend and I were heading for the Cyclon ride. We had an unpleasant encounter with a staff member named "Cedric" (as shown on his name tag). He scanned us with a handheld metal detector and directed me toward the right side of the queue. My girlfriend, who came after, was unsure of where to queue due to the lack of clear signage and accidentally entered the express queue. We looked back at him and he corrected us. However, we then heard a remark right after (either directed at us or him speaking to his colleague) that had an extremely sarcastic and rude tone, that went along the line of "Already say queue that side right?" which was so uncalled for and made us feel disrespected. We hope this feedback can be used constructively, perhaps as a reminder to ensure all guests are treated with basic courtesy.

name: user_66
review: So fun , have activities all day

name: user_67
review: Universal Studios Singapore is one of the best entertainment destinations for families with children. The park offers many attractions inspired by popular films, and its various themed zones mean that everyone will find something for themselves. Attractions for children This place was created for the youngest! Many attractions are adapted for children, and meetings with cartoon characters add magic to the entire visit. However, it is worth checking whether a given attraction is suitable for your child before entering - the staff does not always pay attention to this, which can result in an unpleasant surprise. Queues and VIP tickets Some attractions are very popular, which means long queues. It is possible to buy a VIP ticket, which allows you to use priority entry, but in my opinion it is not worth overpaying for this privilege - it is better to plan your visit to avoid the largest crowds. Rollercoasters and thrills The park offers amazing rollercoasters that provide a solid dose of adrenaline. Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. is especially worth trying. CYLON, which is one of the most exciting rollercoasters in Asia. Planning your day and returning You can spend practically the whole day at Universal Studios Singapore, but it is worth leaving a little earlier to avoid long lines for the return train. The park is very dynamic - there are many shows and performances on the streets, so there is always something going on. To sum up, Universal Studios Singapore is a great place for a family trip, full of excitement and unforgettable attractions. However, it is worth planning your visit well to avoid long waits and unpleasant surprises. If you like fun and movie atmosphere, this place should definitely be on your list!

name: user_68
review: Had an unforgettable day at Universal Studios Singapore! The thrill rides like Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers, and Battlestar Galactica were absolute adrenaline rushes. Loved exploring the fantasy-themed zones and shopping at the Minion and Jurassic Park stores. Highly recommend for an action-packed adventure! 5 stars.

name: user_69
review: Rides are awesome..we did 13 out of 18 and rain did play it's part.... outdoor rides are closed when it rains

name: user_70
review: We had a blast. Fun attractions and timely themed rides made it extra fun to experience it all. Minions and the Jurassic park themes were our highlights. Was also very pleasantly surprised that some the food in the themed minion restaurant was actually of high quality and tasted good, compared to other parks I've been to. Queues were also not so bad, usually 25-60 min wait times. Felt like I didn't need the express pass and still managed to take 6 rides or so

name: user_72
review: If you're familiar with Universal Studios from the US, you'll be a bit disappointed, as the park is obviously much smaller. We weren't that impressed, except for two or three attractions. It's certainly great for children and teenagers, but not so much for adults without children. We had an express pass, which wasn't really necessary.

name: user_73

review: Nicolas Big Bird Emporium is very nice

I've been there many times but have never experienced a restaurant that I thought was delicious. When I tried to eat outside I was told I couldn't re-enter. In that case, I should make an effort to make delicious food.

name: user_81
review: Even during the week there are a lot of people. I recommend buying an express ticket so you don't have to wait in lines. Compared to universal studios in Los Angeles, Singapore is much worse. However, if someone is there for the first time, they will have fun :)

name: user_82
review: Great place for kids and adults to spend an entire day in Singapore. The Minion show is the silver lining among all the shows. There is a heavy rush at the Jurassic ride so opt for an express ticket if possible. The rides were amazing and definitely not for the weak hearted.

name: user_84
review: 45 to get in , rides are busy over an hour wait for rapids ride ( maybe 10 mins on ride).the rest at least 40 mins. Very hot and limited shade available. Beer small bottle 11 dollars . Rides are old and waterworld and transformers closed. You can happly skip this in the 2 days suggested for expensive singapore.

name: user_85
review: Super fun. You can reach here by bus from Vivo Mall city, or by MRT to Sentosa Island.

name: user_86
review: Just to clear things up, this park is not owned or operated by Universal Parks & Entertainment. Instead, the park uses Universal licenses and has a mix of familiar and unfamiliar attractions based on Universal franchises. I mention this because the park looks very much like the other Universal Studios parks but feels a little cheaper. Even identical attractions had corners cut so the magic isn't quite the same. If you are familiar with the typical Universal experience, set your expectations accordingly. That said, the park is fun. Is it the best Universal Studios themed park? Not even close but that doesn't mean it is horrible. The most unique standout attraction is Battlestar Galactica. This is a pair of roller coasters, one a calmer sit down coaster and the other a thrilling inverted coaster, that intertwine with each other. It feels like a cross between Dueling Dragons and Incredible Hulk. I wouldn't prioritize Universal Studios Singapore as a top thing to do in Singapore but if you are looking for something to do, it is worth a visit.

name: user_88
review: Felt its over hyped and 5000 inr is bit to high for this stuff. Transformer and jurassic park are definitely superb. Key call out, prayer hall in universal studio is a very good thing.

name: user_92
review: If you play a lot, you should buy a priority ticket I went during the week and had to wait 30 minutes - 1 hour for each game. The games here are quite interesting. You can bring food in. The restaurant here is boring, just eat for a quick meal. Note that for the dinosaur park game, you should buy a raincoat from home to bring. It sells for 6/piece here. Lockers are also expensive, 4/hour. Any game that takes a long time has to be stored for 2 hours The campus is smaller than Vinpearl. Walking around is not as tiring as standing in line. The shows are small and boring. Just for the kids to watch.

review: By tiket online Any more discount For place and all so good

name: user_95
review: Great but the day we went, there were huge queues for all rides so we couldn't do everything

name: user_97
review: I cannot praise this place enough very very good place my suggestion all people in side come

name: user_98
review: Okay, buckle up, thrill-seekers, because Universal Studios Singapore isn't just a theme park it's a full-throttle adventure that blasts you straight into the heart of your favorite movies! From the moment you step through those iconic gates, you're immersed in a world where fantasy becomes reality, and the excitement is absolutely contagious. For me, the highlights were undoubtedly the pulse-pounding rides and spectacular shows that brought cinematic magic to life. The Transformers: The Ride was an absolute game-changer. The seamless blend of 3D visuals and motion simulation made me feel like I was right there alongside Optimus Prime, battling Decepticons in a truly epic showdown. Seriously, the sheer scale and intensity of this ride are mind-blowing hold on tight! Then there's WaterWorld, a live-action stunt show that left me utterly speechless. The incredible acrobatics, pyrotechnics, and jet ski stunts performed right before your eyes are nothing short of breathtaking. The sheer commitment and skill of the performers, combined with the explosive special effects, make this a must-see spectacle that will have you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. Be prepared to get a little wet in the front rows it's all part of the fun! For a dose of fairytale charm and heartwarming humor, the Shrek 4-D Adventure is an absolute delight. This immersive experience perfectly captures the wit and charm of the Shrek movies, with fantastic 3D effects and in-theater sensations that bring the story to life in a whole new way. It's a perfect break from the high-octane rides and a guaranteed smile-inducer for all ages. And speaking of bringing movies to life, Lights, Camera, Action! Hosted by Steven Spielberg is a masterclass in special effects wizardry. Witnessing the raw power of Hollywood filmmaking unfold before your eyes, from raging storms to dramatic explosions, is truly captivating. It offers a fascinating behind-the-scenes glimpse into the magic of cinema and leaves you with a newfound appreciation for the artistry involved. But Universal Studios Singapore offers so much more beyond these incredible highlights. Wandering through the various themed zones, from the ancient Egypt of Revenge of the Mummy to the lost world of Jurassic Park, is an adventure in itself. The attention to detail in the set design and atmosphere is remarkable, making you feel truly transported to these different worlds. The thrill rides are diverse and cater to all levels of adrenaline junkies. Whether you're soaring through the air on the Battlestar Galactica dueling rollercoasters (HUMAN vs. CYLON is an experience you won't soon forget!) or braving the rapids of the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, there's something to get your heart racing. Beyond the rides and shows, the park is also filled with fantastic dining options and opportunities to meet your favorite characters. From snapping a photo with the Minions to indulging in themed treats, the entire experience is designed to immerse you in the world of movies. In summary, Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking for a day of thrilling entertainment and cinematic magic. With world-class rides, spectacular shows, and immersive themed zones, it delivers an unforgettable experience that will leave you wanting more. So grab your tickets, unleash your inner movie buff, and prepare for an adventure of a lifetime! Here are a few extra tips to make the most of your visit: * Arrive early: This will give you a head start on the crowds and allow you to experience more rides and attractions with shorter wait times. * Plan your day: Take a look at the park map and show schedules beforehand to prioritize your must-see attractions. * Utilize the Universal Express Pass: If you're short on time or visiting during peak season, the Express Pass can significantly reduce your wait times for many popular rides and shows. * Stay hydrated: Singapore's tropical climate can be hot and humid, so remember to drink plenty of water throughout the day. * Wear comfortable shoes

name: user_99
review: Recommended for a first visit in SG. The no re-entry policy is garbage though. Be warned.

name: user_100
review: One of the best part to go I. Singapores Pretty cosy and easy to go around. If you can go to the off peak season, you do need to have to wait for a long time. Good for family, good for group of friends, good for couple, it is fun and good to be there.

name: user_102
review: Lots of amazing rides and attractions. The price was 85 Singapore currency, and its unlimited rides.

name: user_103
review: External and internal areas are under upgrading, overall is enjoyable.

name: user_107
review: Worth visiting this tourist attraction at Singapore. There are lot of theme based activities, roller coster rides, 4D activities on various famous movies like Transformers, Jurassic park, Minions, Shrek, Mummy etc. Indian and Chinese eateries are also available within the theme park. Start by 10 AM to enjoy and complete all activities before the closing time of 7 PM. Human roller coster ride on Battlestar Galactica is the best and must life time activity for all. Ceylon roller coaster ride is for those who enjoy the human roller coster ride.

name: user_108
review: Park is small so if you go to the park by 2pm you should be able to go on every ride with little to no wait time without the need for a fast pass. My fienc and I went on a Thursday though so I'm sure weekends get busier

name: user_109
review: I am a postgraduate student in Singapore. On Sunday, May 4th, 2025, I visited Universal Studios Singapore for the second time. I bought the ticket in advance on Ctrip in China. I came alone and didn't need to queue to enter the park. Many attractions also have express lanes for single people. The queuing time for each attraction is much shorter compared to Universal Studios in other countries. The longest queuing time is forty minutes, but only for individual projects. Moreover, there is a limited park - Hello Kitty that is not available in other countries. The Sanrio characters in it are particularly cute and good-looking. I bought a lot of goods, and if there are any unsatisfactory quality issues, you can return or exchange them at any time with the receipt. Especially, an intern clerk named "Joycelyn"mylamerilyn has a particularly good service attitude. She is serious in her work and has a good attitude. She is willing to run around to help customers find flawless goods. Because of her, I saw the service attitude of this chain amusement park, a big brand and a big company, towards customers. I am particularly satisfied. Next time, I will bring my family or classmates to Universal Studios Singapore again!

name: user_111
review: This place just too good You must visit here in mid weekdays to avoid rush, you must be physically fit to visit this place as there is lot of walking, good thing is you can purchase a stroller for kids at jus my 30 SGD There is very limited options for food if you are vegetarian Most rides are good and are worth doing

name: user_112
review: Wonderful experiance, would suggest to take express entry if u wish to enjoy all rides without waiting, only if there is rush. U can add after entering in park also, they have counter

name: user_115
review: Its a diff experience if you go with young kids, teenagers, as a couple or solo. The park is huge and they have decent attractions that are updated periodically. Check on their website about which ones to go for. Many rides have age/height restrictions for kids, so do check before getting in the line. Its a commercial and expensive place, they have strategically placed toys and other things that kids would want you to buy. So be prepared. Ample eateries, water and toilets are available. Id highly recommend buying their VIP pass if you can afford it. Average waiting time for good rides is 30-60 mins. And standing in the queue tires you quickly in Singapore heat. Id recommend wearing good sandals or waterproof shoes for few rides. They have paid lockers available in some places. We enjoyed Transformers and shreks show.

name: user_117
review: Such a fun place. Has such a great time with my family of 4. The rides were all exciting and fun. Loved their family swap program so both parents could go on a ride while one waited with the pram. Best theme park Ive been to in a long time. The food options however are expensive as I expected but they all tasted really really bad. Wish I took my own food.

name: user_119
review: It was really nice, the rides and experience were good

name: user_123
review: Oasis spice cafe have good vegetarian options Loved the bhalla chaat and the mango lassi Reasonably priced

name: user_124
review: We went here for my daughter's first birthday celebration as a family. Not many rides for very small kids. But we all had a good time. The food inside is expensive. Rides have less wait time during weekdays. Try visiting on weekdays. They have an app that allows love wait times for rides and meet and greets.

name: user_126
review: A Magical First Visit to Universal Studios Singapore Fun, Thrilling, but Be Prepared for Long Waits! I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore for the first time, and overall, it was a fantastic experience filled with excitement, nostalgia, and adventure. As someone who has never been to a Universal Studios park before, I was genuinely impressed by the vibrant atmosphere, the immersive themes, and the sheer scale of the park. It truly brings your favorite movies and characters to life in a way that feels magical. Theming & Attractions: From the moment you step in, the level of detail in the parks design is jaw-dropping. Each zoneHollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascaris beautifully themed and transports you into a completely different world. I particularly enjoyed the Revenge of the Mummy ride in Ancient Egypt and the Transformers 3D ride in Sci-Fi Cityboth were thrilling and well worth the hype! Shows & Entertainment: The live shows and street performances were also a pleasant surprise. The WaterWorld stunt show was incredibly well-executed, with amazing effects and high energy. There were also plenty of characters walking around for photos, which added to the experience. Food & Facilities: Food options were decent, with a variety of choices catering to different tastes, though a bit on the pricier side (as expected in theme parks). The park was clean, well-maintained, and had plenty of rest areas, shaded spots, and clean restrooms. Crowds & Waiting Times: This was the only downside to my visit. While I anticipated some waiting, I was a bit overwhelmed by the length of the queuesespecially for the popular rides. Even with a weekday visit, some lines were over an hour long, which really ate into the time we had to explore everything. I highly recommend arriving early and possibly investing in the Universal Express Pass if your budget allowsit makes a big difference. Staff & Service: The staff throughout the park were friendly, helpful, and very professional. They did a great job managing the crowds and keeping the lines moving as efficiently as possible. Final Thoughts: Universal Studios Singapore is absolutely worth a visit, especially if youre a fan of movie-themed attractions. Its a great mix of thrill rides, shows, and immersive environments that appeal to all ages. Just go in preparedwear comfortable shoes, stay hydrated, and if youre not a fan of long waits, consider the Express Pass. Despite the lines, the overall experience was memorable and fun, and I would definitely come back again!

name: user_127
review: Come and play with your family, all the facilities are exciting and fun. Of course, the most exciting is the 365-degree rotating roller coaster. The mummy roller coaster is also good. The environment is beautiful and suitable for bringing the whole family to play here. Recommended

name: user_130
review: I celebrated my birthday at Universal Studios Singapore, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of my trip! From the moment I stepped in, the excitement was non-stop and the best part? I managed to enjoy all the major rides without needing an Express Pass. Heres what worked for me: Arrive Early: The park opens at 10:00 AM I reached by 9:30 AM and was among the first to enter. I went straight to the popular rides like Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy, and Jurassic Park Rapids and avoided long queues. Plan Your Route: Cover the thrill rides first before the crowds build up, then move to the family and indoor attractions post-lunch. No Express Pass Needed: With early entry and a bit of planning, I skipped all the long lines and saved money. Collect Your Birthday Gift: Dont forget to stop by the Visitor Centre near the entrance. Just show a valid ID and collect a special birthday badge and a gift voucher (mine included retail discounts and a free souvenir)! Stay Hydrated & Take Breaks: Singapore weather can be humid. Use the shaded areas and indoor shows (like WaterWorld or Shrek 4D) as fun breaks between rides. Use the Official App: It helps with live wait times, show schedules, and maps super handy for staying ahead. Whether it's your birthday or not, Universal Studios Singapore is a blast but with a bit of strategy, it becomes even more enjoyable and stress-free. Highly recommended!

name: user_132
review: family-friendly, wonderful experience.

name: user_133
review: Lot of standing in the line. If you dont buy express ticket be prepared to stand in lines for hours and then get a 2 minute ride. The rides, atmosphere and ecperience is good otherwise.

name: user_135
review: Must visit when in Singapore!! No matter how old you are, you should try it. Theres a new area called Minion Land, previously it was Madagascar (cmiiw). Recommend rides: The Mummy, Transformers, Jurassic Park Canopy Fly, Jurassic Park Rapid Adventure (you'll get wet), The Galactica.

name: user_136
review: So recomended place when your in Singapore fun rides.and much more!

name: user_137
review: Lots of roller coaster, nothing else

name: user_138
review: Very cool place to visit with your family and kids,the younger ones will surely enjoy the lively environment and the themes,the only drawback was the heat overall a good experience

name: user_140
review: Many attractive rides. arrive in the morning (10 Am) and the first thing you should do is take the (always) crowded rides. because the longer it takes, it will become more crowded

name: user_141
review: Very good place. Haven for children. Keep a lot of space in the phone for photos and videos. Must come early. Bring some food. Hardly any Veg option. Nothing less than 10 in food.

name: user_143
review: Universal Studios in Singapore is recommended for those who don't want to queue to buy tickets. The Express Pass is a bit expensive but it's worth it.

name: user_144
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a compact but exciting theme park packed with world-class attractions. If youre planning a visit, buying the Express Pass is highly recommendedwait times can easily go beyond an hour, especially for the popular rides : Revenge of the Mummy, Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, Transformers: The Ride One of the best 4D simulator rides around, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure A water-based ride that takes you through a jungle filled with dinosaurs. Its immersive and funbut be warned: you will get wet. Despicable Me: Minion Mayhem

name: user_146
review: We were there on a weekday, non Sg public holiday from 10am till 5pm. We bought our tickets from Klook. Entry was easy. No bag check or whatsoever. We enjoyed the day there. We managed to go on some 8/9 rides. Some rides needed a longer time to queue but its bearable ! Staffs there are friendly and approachable. They helped us to take photos willingly. There are many water dispenser around for refills. Toilets are clean as well ! Great day under the sun ! Thanks for the memories!

name: user_148
review: Lovely place, enjoyedUniversal Studios Singapore, located on Sentosa Island, stands out as Southeast Asias premier movie-themed amusement park, offering a vibrant mix of adrenaline-pumping rides, immersive attractions, and family-friendly entertainment. The park is thoughtfully divided into six immersive zones, each themed around blockbuster films and iconic locations, such as Hollywood, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and the newly opened Minion Land. As you enter past the iconic Universal globe, youre greeted by Hollywood Boulevards retro charm, lined with themed dining and shopping options, setting the stage for a day of cinematic adventure. Rides and Attractions: Universal Studios Singapore boasts over 20 rides and attractions, catering to every thrill level and age group. Highlights for thrill-seekers include the Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, a pair of dueling roller coasters that reach speeds up to 90 km/h and feature dramatic loops, near-miss moments, and exhilarating drops. Transformers: The Ride 3D is widely praised for its cutting-edge visuals and immersive motion-simulator experience, placing guests in the heart of a battle between Autobots and Decepticons. The Revenge of the Mummy indoor coaster delivers high-speed twists and turns in near darkness, while Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure provides a soaking, dinosaur-filled river journey. For families and younger visitors, attractions like Shrek 4-D Adventure, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase, and King Juliens Beach Party-Go-Round offer gentle fun and interactive storytelling. The new Minion Land adds even more family appeal, with rides like Despicable Me Minion Mayhem and the Buggie Boogie carousel, plus lively character meet-and-greets and themed shops. Shows and Entertainment: Beyond rides, the park excels in live entertainment. Popular shows include Water World, a stunt-filled aquatic spectacle, and Lights, Camera, Action!, which reveals the magic behind blockbuster special effects. Street performances, musical parades, and character appearances (from Minions to Shrek and even classic icons like Charlie Chaplin) add to the festive atmosphere. Visitor Experience: The park is praised for its clean, well-organized layout and the sheer variety of attractions that can easily fill a full day. Express Pass options allow guests to skip long lines, though its important to note that some passes only allow one express entry per ride. Early entry is highly recommended, especially on weekends or holidays, to maximize your experience and minimize wait times. Dining options are diverse, ranging from quick snacks to themed restaurants, and the parks size makes it manageable for families with children. Considerations: While most reviews are overwhelmingly positive, some visitors have noted that customer service can be inconsistent, and wet weather may lead to temporary ride closures, so planning ahead is advisable. The cost of admission is higher than many other attractions in Singapore, but most agree the experience justifies the price, especially for fans of movies and theme parks. Conclusion: Universal Studios Singapore delivers a world-class theme park experience with a unique Southeast Asian twist. Its blend of thrilling rides, immersive zones, engaging shows, and family-friendly attractions ensures theres something for everyone, making it a must-visit destination for locals and tourists alike

name: user_149
review: Its like dreamworld. Very fascinating. Rides are wonderful. Wait time is bit longer and tiring.

name: user_151
review: Worth 1-time visit. Loved the Return of the Mummy Ride and the Transformer ride. Night parade was a wonderful surprise! Almost missed it coz there wasn't anything mentioned at the USS website.

name: user_156
review: Beyond Magnificent. It was like we went back to our childhood. Transformers is incredible. Definitely number 1. Mummy is awesome. number 2. We spent one day but it was totally worth it. It is a place beyond dreams, especially for children.

name: user_158
review: It's very nice, but the park is not so big. It is still possible to go to all main rides within 1 day without express ticket.

name: user_159
review: Don't do it if you don't want to wait in line for 90 minutes for one of the few promotions! We were there at the beginning of May, shortly after it opened, and it was already hopelessly overcrowded. We quickly went to the back of the park so we could go rafting and ride the not-so-rewarding Jurasicpark roller coaster. Otherwise, we only had enough for a whopping two screenings, as the waiting times shot up to 2.5 hours! There is only an overpriced Fast Pass and no virtual waiting lines, as we know from Europa Park, for example. We also noticed negatively the employees who, in a very unsympathetic way, made room for the "Raptor" appearance in the Jurasic Park area. In general, the way you can use photos to show characters like Shrek and Co is also not nice. You stand in line for ages and are pushed through by the employees in a rude tone. We've been to Universal Studios in Hollywood before. In contrast, the Singapore branch is an absolute joke. The 2nd star is only given for the Steven Spielberg special effects show. All in all, unfortunately by far the worst amusement park I've ever been to.

name: user_161
review: A fun outing !!! Battlestar Galactica, Transformers Ride, The Mummy ride, Lights Camera Action are a must do. Go early and cover important rides.

name: user_163
review: Amazing place. Had lovely vibes, atmosphere , food, fun and rides. Wonderful place to spend time.

name: user_165
review: It's worth every penny

name: user_166
review: The game is fun and addictive

name: user_169
review: We came for the rides, stayed for the screams, and left with sore legs, full hearts, and way too many photos! Universal Studios Singapore, thanks for making us laugh like maniacs, sweat like tourists, and scream like we saw our electric bill!

name: user_170
review: Great fun, would love more (Nintendo / Harry Potter) as even without an Express Pass I still rode everything in my time so could add more but its limited by space

name: user_171
review: Its informative, fun, and cute

name: user_172
review: I felt like it was smaller than Japan. There weren't many customers, so I didn't have to wait to get in. The longest part of the attraction was about 80 minutes. It's humid and hotter than this time of year in Japan (end of April), so I think I focused on indoor attractions in order to cool down. There seemed to be one or two lined up outside... There was a charge for lockers to store luggage at Jurassic. I personally thought Wicked's goods were better than those in Japan, so I bought a lot of them. I also bought a Raptor soap bubble as a souvenir, but the tail is sharp so I had to do my best to take it home without breaking it.

name: user_174
review: Overrated and overcrowded Not worth the hype And no ride is worth a wait of 30 minutes except for the transformers There arent enough eateries to address all the crowd thats admitted to the park Why allow everyone beyond capacity of the park if basic needs like food cannot be addressed? The wait time is 30 minute plus for most rides even with express pass

name: user_175
review: Not my thing. We couldnt get to any rights. The shortest wait time was 15 min and in reality it was 45. Very humid day as almost every day in Singapore. There are almost no shades. All you can do is to go to the aircon shops and spend more money youve already spent to be able to go for fun rides which are unacessible because of the wait time

name: user_177
review: Way too long a wait time for rides Expect rude staffs too

name: user_178
review: Fun. Loved it. Crowded but guess that's to be expected over the weekend.

name: user_179
review: A very fun place to visit. Visit this place with your friends and siblings but not with your parents as on many rides are not recommended for people above 50

name: user_180
review: 1. The pace here is much slower than that of Osaka Universal in Japan, so it is very suitable for the whole family to come together. 2. We brought our elders here this time, and everyone unanimously praised the Jurassic River Adventure and Shreks 4D Theater. 3. Young people who like exciting games are suitable to play Battlestar Human Force and Revenge of the Egyptian Mummy. 4. It is a pity that the Water World is under renovation this time and I did not have the opportunity to enjoy the show. 5. There was thunder in the afternoon, so the outdoor recreational facilities were suspended for a while. Fortunately, it didn't rain. 6. The meals in Xiaoxiaobing Park are Wu Xin vegetarian, which can be used without sauce, vegetarian steak, and onions (both sauce and vegetarian steaks have onions).

name: user_181
review: So much fun!! It's a bit hot. I went at 10 am and the entrance globe area was so hotttt!!!! The souvenirs are a bit pricey. Loved the sparkling road. Recommend to bring an umbrella and a hat. Try all the rides! My favourites are the sherk 3d one, and despicable me one. The Egypt one was so scary!! Love princess Fiona!!!

name: user_182
review: I made a reservation and visited. I was worried that there would be a lot of tourists because it was Saturday, but there weren't that many and I was able to experience almost all the attractions without having to wait long. (I think I waited about 40 minutes at most.) I was able to see a variety of performances and I think I enjoyed it without any regrets. I definitely intend to visit again, and if I do, I would like to see other attractions and performances. Some attractions will get you very wet, so please check in advance before boarding. For me, I think Transformers (4D) and The Mummy were the most fun.

name: user_183
review: Universal studio is one of the best attractions in Singapore u need atleast 2 days to visit the whole place its very big and many attractions I visited only four in one day had lunch there and did little shopping but its one of the best experienc highly recommended. Thanks

name: user_184
review: This was magical, the rides the atmosphere there is superb. Wait time for the rides is very long which does not give you the opportunity to try them all. Overall i was happy with the number of amazing things to do there.

name: user_186
review: Beautiful day as always full of magic, it is a place where all children should go, including their parents whenever I can I go, my children and I love it

name: user_189
review: We loved it, especially transformers, the mummy. The roller coasters are too much for my appetite.. our teenager loved those rides.

name: user_195
review: Had a fantastic day at Universal Studios Singapore! Highlights included Transformers The Ride (Autobots forever!), Canopy Flyer (breathtaking views), and Puss in Boots' Giant Journey (great storytelling). Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure got us soaked! Despicable Me Minion Mayhem was hilarious. Revenge of the Mummy was too intense for us. Treasure Hunters was a chill ride. Skipped Battlestar Galactica - heard it's not for the faint-hearted! Bonus: no need for express tickets on weekdays, made the experience even more enjoyable.

name: user_196
review: There are two roller coaster styles that didn't exist in LA. It's good. And don't save your money and get the express. I can really feel the taste of capitalism.

name: user_197
review: Absolute fun. A must visit place with family. Value for the money. Cordial staff. Recommended to arrive early to make the most of it.

name: user_199
review: Guard at Rapid Adventures very rude idiot.. don't care customers.. also park need extra cash to keep our bags . Very poor

name: user_201
review: This was my second visit to universal studio and though the place is amazing, the waiting time for rides is too long even on weekdays. Also, if the weather becomes bad then the rides are shut down. Some rides were encountering technical issues and we had to leave even though we had waited in the que for almost an hour. The food courts are very expensive, better to take your own food and beverages. To be able to enjoy the whole of universal studio you will need to be on time.

name: user_203
review: It's a bit small, so you don't need to buy Express Pass (because it's very expensive and some facilities can't be used)

name: user_204
review: The place is very crowded, even though it's a weekday.

name: user_205
review: Great spot and great rides! One ride did malfunction but was tested three times before allowing us back on so safety is great here. Very good time

name: user_208
review: Good place and so easy to get there by monorail

name: user_209
review: We had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! From thrilling rides to fantastic live shows and immersive themed zones, it was a full day of excitement and fun for the whole family. The park is well-organized, with a great mix of attractions for all agesfrom adrenaline-pumping roller coasters to family-friendly entertainment. One thing to note for future visitors: be sure to come prepared for the weather. While some areas offer shade and indoor attractions, a good portion of the park is outdoors and exposed to the sunespecially during peak hours in the afternoon. We highly recommend bringing a compact umbrella or poncho for sun protection (or sudden rain), and a portable fan to help beat the heat while walking between rides. Despite the warm weather, the experience was well worth it. The staff were friendly and efficient, helping to keep the lines moving smoothly, and the overall energy in the park was infectious. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for anyone coming to Sentosabut a little planning for the weather will definitely make your visit more comfortable!

name: user_210
review: Lots of fun, so come early to avoid queuing. You have to spend a whole day here to play all the games. There are many good shows so you should watch the time frame to watch.

name: user_211
review: Need try all game and recommend buy express

name: user_212
review: My kids love to see and always fascinated by the faciltity of the uss.

name: user_213
review: Dream come true. I had a fabulous time with my kids here. I was such a kid here again. We still can't get over Elmo as a dulha and we loved grooving with the Elmo characters. Much fun! The rides had a wait time of 20 - 45 mins. All this is very clearly mentioned when you are at the ride entrance. Also recommend downloading the app which is detailed and also tells you wait time ( in real) for each ride to plan better.

name: user_216
review: We went on a Monday and even though there weren't many people, the queue at the attractions lasted from 20 minutes to an hour. Despite this, the attention to detail in the park, even in the queue areas for the rides, makes the wait go by quicker. Park really well looked after and very well done. I will gladly return and above all I recommend downloading the Universal Studios Singapore app to always have a real-time update of the waiting time on the various rides to decide which one to go to first.

name: user_217
review: Interesting park to visit by adults and younger people. Divided into thematic areas, each is associated with shops (far too many) and some entertainment (with a prevalence of roller coasters, which are strictly not recommended for the faint of heart, hypertensives, people with vertigo, etc.). The shows held in some theaters are appreciable. It is not a park comparable to some of our own but it has no demerits. Pleasant visit. Site easily reachable by metromonorail.

name: user_220
review: There are three types of Express Passes: 1. Express Pass One-time access to each ride (excludes Minion Land) 2. Express Plus Pass One-time access to each ride including Minion Land 3. VIP Experience Unlimited access, VIP line, and a guided tour (approx. 4x the cost of a regular ticket) Express Passes can cost up to SGD 1,000 more than standard tickets on peak daysbut help skip hours of waiting in queues Highly recommended to buy an Express Pass on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays due to heavy crowds and long wait times Ticket prices are also higher on weekends and public holidaysplan accordingly Accessibility support available: Manual wheelchair: SGD 20 deposit, fully refundable Electric wheelchair: SGD 50 deposit, SGD 5 usage fee (SGD 45 refunded) Many are unaware of this servicevery helpful for elderly or those with mobility issues

name: user_221
review: Overall, it is a very fun theme park. Although it is not large in scale, it has exquisite design and clear themes. From Hollywood Boulevard to The Lost World, every area is full of details and immersion. In particular, the facilities such as Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy, and Jurassic River Adventure are really recommended, as they are exciting and story-telling. If there are fewer people on weekdays, the queue time is acceptable; on holidays, you really need to come early, otherwise the wait for popular facilities will be quite long. The cleanliness and services inside the park are very good, and the performances are also exciting. It is a place suitable for adults and children to relax together. The only reason I deducted one star is because the park is relatively small and it is easier to walk around after experiencing several large facilities. In addition, the dining in the park is more expensive and has fewer choices. It would be even more attractive if one or two major new facilities could be added. Overall, it is well worth a day trip, especially movie fans and family guests, you will definitely find happiness here!

name: user_223
review: My family had an amazing time at USS. Not very crowded on a weekday. The food was quite pricey though

name: user_226
review: I had a great time with my family. The size was just right and there wasn't anything lacking in things to enjoy. A big advantage is that you can see, enjoy, and be satisfied with everything in one day during your busy travel schedule.

name: user_227
review: USS is a blastpure adrenaline from start to finish! Rides like Battlestar Galactica and Transformers are next-level fun, and the themed zones nail the Hollywood vibe. On quieter weekdays, youre zooming through queues, which is a dream. But, the food? Meh and way too pricey for what it is. Also, peak days can mean elbow-to-elbow crowds. Still, its a thrill-packed day thats hard to beat

name: user_229
review: I had a fantastic time visiting this amusement park! The entrance ticket was reasonably priced, and the overall cost was very affordable for the fun we had. The rides were absolutely amazingexciting, safe, and suitable for all ages. There was a great variety, from thrilling roller coasters to fun attractions for kids. The park was clean, well-organized, and the staff were friendly and helpful. It was a memorable experience, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun day out!

name: user_230
review: Had the best day. Went with my wife and 2 adult children and had so much fun. We were like a bunch of unsupervised kids. Went on every ride, some several times, and laughed our butts off. The wait times for the rides were really short and drinks and food were easy to find. Loved the rides, especially the Ceylon and the Transformer ride. Download the app for a map of the park and to get wait times for rides. Also, you will get wet on the Jurassic Park Rapid ride. Maybe a little, maybe a lot, so if you don't want to spend the day with wet pants I suggest waiting until your closer to leaving.

name: user_232
review: Universal Studios is definitely a one of the best attractions in Singapore as such. It is very neat and clean. It is well organized as well. If I remember correctly then it is smaller than the one that is there in Orlando but that is kind of expected. The attractions are nice. 1] There could be queues at some attractions, but they have an app which indicates the queue length at each attraction. 2] There are three huge roller coasters are one of the topmost attractions there. One larger than the other kinds. 3] There are rides like Transformers which are kind of virtual roller coaster rides and it is one of the top most attraction apart from roller coaster. 4] There are many rides like Puss in the boots which are for smaller kids 5] They also have 2-3 shows which are basically live and are arranged for only twice a day and run for 45 mins in each run. Please check the timings of the show as soon as you enter to enjoy them throughly. We had seen a show of Waterworld where they performed a lot of live stunts which was amazing to see. 6] Food options are relatively limited. If you are vegetarian they are only one or two options like Biryani inside. But it is not a big problem as such. 7] There are too many things to see so make sure that you reach there on time. 8] Please check that tickets are in order. I had booked a 3 day pass through Klook or similar site and it turnout that I had to mail them Universal first and then they send the tickets. This process wasted half an hour for me. So make sure you read the passes and conditions for entry.

name: user_233
review: Spacious place But the temperature is reasonably hot. There isn't much shelter from the sun. Most of the rides are simulators and are not suitable for children. Not suitable for walking and relaxing, suitable for serious play.

name: user_236
review: We had a lot of fun and We didn't feel the time passing out.

name: user_238
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a 100/10 experience! On quieter days, queues move super fast, letting you enjoy the thrilling rides, which are absolutely exhilarating. The theming is top-notch, and every corner is Instagram-worthy. Only downside? Food is pricey and not that great. Still, an unforgettable day out!

name: user_239
review: This is a must for your to-do list when visiting Singapore. Lots of fun experiences and rides for all ages. Worth the time

name: user_240
review: I seriously did not expect so many people on a Friday XD. Got the normal ticket, so each queue was a good 2h waiting time. I arrived before 12, and I only managed to ride 5 rides when it was 7pm. But if you went for the solo queues it would be slightly faster. The transformer was cool, but the quality is pretty bad ngl. But it's nostalgic again to feel and see it like it's the first time back like 13 years ago. Everything is the same. The mummy was alright, I almost shat myself but there was this specific female worker there was really rude. She was shouting constantly and have zero patience. I get it, I work in customer service too, but shes just so aggressive and agitated the whole time I stood there and watch her scream for the number of. Pax. She barely cared about the single queue, so for mummy normal queue would be faster. The enchanted airways is awesome!! 9/10 The Jurassic park for both was dope too so 9/10. Yea everything hasn't changed, they just add new things to it. Please buy ur tickets online in advance or else u gotta queue outside to wait for ppl to take their time to buy their tickets. Try visiting during weekdays! And not holidays.

name: user_241
review: On holiday,I recommend buying an express ticket( queue skip ticket). If you are richer, you will have more fun.

name: user_242
review: Universal Studios Singapore provides a fun and engaging experience for many visitors, with a good balance of thrilling rides, family-friendly attractions, and immersive themed zones. However, potential visitors should be aware of the potential for long wait times and the relatively high ticket prices. Consider purchasing tickets in advance and planning your visit strategically to maximize your enjoyment.

name: user_243
review: Nice rides. But it was very crowded being a weekday. Approx. 16000 guests visited that day and wait time for express too was 30/45 mins. Insane queue at food courts with 1.45hr wait just to place order. Also it was super sunny n hot, humid. There is Minions section newly opened but the express ticket doesn't work there. Its better to buy ticket online but we purchased tickets at vivocity mall which came to same price as on klook. Better deal is with express n admission together which comes cheaper than actual. The train from vivocity to sentosa too was very crowded and took us almost 45 mins in queue.

name: user_245
review: Opens late, closes early. When the sky is overcast, the amusement park closes the outdoor rides. Even though it's not raining but it's drizzling at all. There are few indoor attractions, and the queues are long. If the attractions are closed even though it is not raining, half the entrance fee should be refunded.

name: user_246
review: 80 dollars worst spent in history. Read 10 minutes of queuing and it's an hour, eternal queues everywhere, a queue skipper that costs more than the ticket, 4 clouds and all the outdoor rides close. Worst value for money in history

name: user_247
review: Waiting time was too much for each attraction hence wasted my time and energy standing in long queues. Wish management had handled the crowd properly so that people can get chance to see atleast main attractions. wasted 2 hours standing in queue for a 10-15 mins event... Hardly managed to see 3 events :(. Also, food service was slow and long queues here too. There was not much space to sit and relax while the weather was hot and humid... Not many places to get water even. Also, shopped so much but didn't even get my gst refund as biller didn't enter my passport number, which I was not aware at that time. Overall it didn't meet the expectations.

name: user_248
review: Perfect place for kids, not much for adults If you are seeking fun with no kids you better head to a different universal studio like Orlando or even Disneyland but so not worth in Singapore

name: user_250
review: Amusement park to do, the attractions are nice and the scenery very varied. The Transformers attraction is surprising

name: user_251
review: Universal Studios Singapore was an amazing experience. Although the park is not as large as other Universal parks in the world, it is very well used, with spectacular attractions, very well-themed areas and high-quality shows. The organization is excellent and waiting times are reasonable, especially if you leave early. Highlights include attractions such as Battlestar Galactica, Transformers and The Mummy, which combine adrenaline and technology. Ideal for spending a full day full of fun on Sentosa Island. Highly recommended for all ages!

name: user_252
review: If you go to Singapore you have to go to Universal Studio Singapore (USS), you can't go to Singapore if you don't come here...good...fun games...recommended to visit with friends

name: user_255
review: I tried Roller Coaster Tycoon It is more difficult to decorate well in a small land.

name: user_256
review: Had a lot of fun there. Wished we had more than one day to fully enjoy the plI wished

name: user_258
review: easy to reach, accommodate all ages of visitors

name: user_259
review: A great time! I highly recommend arriving 30 to 45 minutes early to make the most of the day. Remember to bring a small bag with water, a cap, sunscreen and light clothing, especially if it is hot. As soon as it opens, head to the right of the park to do the three best attractions without waiting: Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy (the Egyptian roller coaster, incredible!) and the Roller Coaster park, with the two space roller coasters (battlestar galactica Human & Cylon). These are the most intense and definitely worth the detour! The park is very large, well decorated and super pleasant to visit. The atmosphere is immersive, the decorations are neat, and there is fun for all ages. From midday onwards, the queues start to fill up, so it's best to get the big hits first. A great experience, well organized, fun and exotic. I highly recommend!

name: user_260
review: Extremely beautiful, the rides are so fun. Especially the Jurassic Park, Transformer and Puss in the boots. You can spend an entire day full of fun. Suggestion: Wear comfortable shoes, theres a lot of walking !

name: user_261
review: We went on monday 21st April 2025. Its smaller than some of the USA parks, but was enjoyable. Queues for rides was so long. We dont do many, so that didnt overly bother us. My son enjoyed the characters. We had lunch at mel's diner. Lots of great merchandise.

name: user_263
review: Very fun. Very hot in Egypt because it's noon. Waiting time 30-70 minutes on holidays.

name: user_265
review: It's so hot, it's Hellgate with kids without the express.

name: user_266
review: I like taking pictures and riding attractions. However, it can be hot, so an umbrella is a must. The sun is hot.

name: user_269
review: Universal Studios Singapore has been facing growing criticism around value for money, especially when: 1. Ticket Prices Are High A one-day adult ticket can cost SGD 8298 (around USD 6072), and express passes add another SGD 40100. For that price, visitors expect more fully functioning attractions and smoother operations. 2. Multiple Ride Closures or Technical Issues Key attractions like WaterWorld and Amber Rock Climb are closed. Others like Transformers and Canopy Flyer have frequent delays or breakdowns. With only about 78 major rides, even 23 closed significantly reduces the value. 3. Food Is Exorbitantly Priced Basic vegetarian meals (like rice with vegetables or noodles) can cost SGD 1520 per person. Snacks like popcorn, ice cream, or drinks are overpriced, especially with no outside food allowed. Limited budget or vegetarian options add to the difficulty. 4. Comparisons with Other Parks Parks like Universal Studios Japan or Universal Orlando offer more attractions, better-maintained rides, and often better guest serviceat a similar or slightly higher cost. Even Disneyland Hong Kong or Legoland Malaysia are seen by some as better value, especially for families.

name: user_270
review: Absolutely the worst choice we made for a weekend outing. Believe me, most of those glowing 5-star reviews seem completely fake or paidbecause after experiencing this place, giving even 2 stars feels generous. Multiple rides were either shut down or malfunctioningespecially major ones like the Transformer, Human, and Jurassic Park. We ended up walking aimlessly on hot pavements with tired and cranky kids. It was frustrating beyond words and a total waste of time, energy, and money. What was supposed to be a relaxing break turned into such a disaster that we needed a day off just to recover. A few years ago, USS had its charm, but now it feels completely neglected. Poor maintenance, untrained staff, dull eventsits just not the same anymore. Avoid USS unless you have excessive time and money youre okay throwing away. Strongly recommend skipping it altogether.

name: user_272
review: Nice attractions, BUT the queues were just enormous. Almost all attractions were in between 60 and 150 minutes waiting. There are queues for the food, for drinks, for the train... in the end i was more exhausted of the waiting and the heat/humidity rather than the pleasure of the attractions. Also, for example Gardaland in Italy better- better attractions and better organisation If you come from Europe, I would suggest not to go for it. Go to gardaland instead

name: user_275
review: This updated review is for Minion Land which opened in February 2025. Residents are lucky when our Family Day involved a trip to USS in April. Even though it was raining that day, our mood didn't dampen. My shoes were soaked however. If you are an irregular visitor like me, who visits USS only on special occasions like Family Day and HHN, and intend to check out Minion Land, just skip the rest of the park and prioritise this area. Food: Have your meal at Super Hungry Food Stand. Buy banana flavoured popcorn from Pop A Nana (10). Ice-Cream Stand for desserts Attractions: Despicable Me Minion Mayhem (indoor ride, the best one), Silly Swirly (outdoor, height spinner), Buggie Boogie (outdoor carousel) That's it haha. If you are here on a full day itinerary, feel free to explore the rest of the park.

name: user_276
review: This place is just a mood spoiler. Every ride had waiting time of minimum 1 hour from first hour of opening , with average waiting time being 2 hours per ride . Our vacation day turned into an exhauting and disappointing day . We left the studio with disappointment of not being able to cover most of the rides as every ride had huge queues. It was a very bad experience.

name: user_277
review: The wait time is 70 mins for the each best riders approx 5 rides which is only 2-10 mins duration that's the worst part that's how the time flies in USS. But the themes are extraordinary. Worst ride is magic portion in Shrek world . Best is cyclone battle ships 2 rides , egypt mummy , minions theatre , lights camera action and 30 mins show more trolls , jurassic park hydroplant and transformer . But wait for 70 mins each

name: user_279
review: We visited USS as a family including 3 year old. We came here on a friday and reached the place around 10:15am. First of all there were long queue in front of us and we werent sure which Q we are supposed to wait. There should have been proper Q ribbons extending all the way to manage the Q and provide proper labeling for each Q. This would help for newcomers as we do not want to end up in the wrong queue and waste a lot of time. Even we were a family, we were provided three separate QR codes each in a separate e ticket file. We ended up spending lot of time opening the unique qr code and gaining entry. Our child was in a stroller and they made individual persons to walk across the entry gate one by one which I have never seen in any other place. While doing that my childs stroller got stuck in between the gates and I had to forcefully pull it out. This could have been avoided easily. Little did we know this was beginning of our disappointments in the so called popular over hyped amusement park. Once we downloaded their mobile app, we got to know the dreaded wait times. Some rides had 150 minutes (2.5 hours) !!!! Really ?? There is no point in reaching early or trying rides during lunch hours. The number of visitors are so huge, it doesnt make any sense. Do you want us to spend the whole day just for one ride? You need to be really crazy to wait hours for just one ride. There must be some rides dedicated for kids. Here in minion park, adults were doing merry go round. Though wait time was shown as 30mins we waited for more than 1 hour for a ride of hardly 60 seconds. Also USS should take example from river wonders in Mandai and provide proper shades as it is really difficult to roam around in scorching heat. Except for the Revenge of the Mummy and Transformers rides, I didnt find other rides any different from the ones we see in usual parks. Also USS doesnt understand capacity. They are just allowing infinite number of visitors to this place which isnt large enough to hold all of them or entertain them. You have queues even to get food or drinks or snacks or anything. Coming to the shows, they are all sub standard. We have witnessed much better shows in universities or malls. To top it all, water world show was closed due to maintenance. My final advice to everyone looking forward to visiting USS, if you have already been to any amusement park in your country/city, this place is not worth your time and money. You can make better use of this whole day by visiting some other place. This whole place is just over rated and I would never recommend anyone to visit this place.

name: user_281
review: Unbelievably disappointing, rides with 2 - 2.5hour queues - one which snakes underground with sporadic air conditioning or fans, my 10 YO tapped out after 45m. We spent 4 hours there and managed one ride...Corporation only interested in bottom line not user experience - would not recommend.

name: user_282
review: It's being a child again, with the characters from your childhood. It is not an amusement park (except for the Galactica ones). It is more of a theme park, with small attractions from the different sagas. It's very good, there are usually not many people during the week and the places are very fun. If you download the park app it tells you the waiting times so you don't wait long.

name: user_283
review: Had an amazing time! Don't miss the cyclone or the mummy ride, both are extremely thrilling.

name: user_284
review: Worst experience !! Over hyped and long queue will be around 3 hrs minimum for one ride . This is not the way to handle crowd or worst experience in singapore .Waste of money.. Actually for worst customer service I would have complain it to court to return my money back !! Never bring children , They will be exhausted . We have been stuck in transformers for more than 3-4 hrs queue and we were unable to take other rides. Even express tickets were been on long queue. Even on weekdays. Worst experience for children. Waste of money. You will waste your valuable time and money in singapore if you enter here .if u have big crowd you must be able to manage to crowd . Other wise dont welcome all of the people just to get their money !!! Please put some sort of sign!!

name: user_285
review: Probably one of the worst theme park I've been. It is too crowded. Priced too high. It probably know that people will not come back for a second visit so it just to rip you off on your first visit. My advice is don't come. Save your money for much bigger theme parks where the crowd can be dispersed properly

name: user_286
review: Be sure to download the app to see the waiting time, except for the first 20 minutes of opening it will be from 60 to 150 minutes of waiting, what could be better for a family with a child in almost 100% humidity considering the price of 80SGD per person? It is recommended to visit in the first 20 minutes and in the last hour, otherwise it is a waste of money and time. The ratio of time on the attraction to time in line is approximately 1/100

name: user_288
review: Terrible queues. Some attractions are not included in the ticket price. Very bad experience

name: user_290
review: as an avid fan of thriller ride, i definitely enjoy my time here at USS. The ticket price is even cheaper than Legoland :( I not managed to play everything here but we finished all of the rollercoaster in USS and that's what make the trips much better. we also watched the Shrek 4D and it was very entertaining. The downside is, i still think we need to purchase the express pass if you're kinda want to finish everything inside the park in one day as the queue of people duirng the time we went is extremely crazy and overwhelming.

name: user_291
review: Excellent, very good training

name: user_293
review: I only played less than half of them in a day, so I tried to pick my favorite and most classic ones to play first. For example, the Transformers queue lasted for forty or fifty minutes. It was a VR battle scene. The realism was not bad, and the shaking was a bit interesting. It was quite consistent with the real shaking. There's also Revenge of the Mummy, which is an average-level thrill ride and a decent indoor roller coaster, but the crazy dash part is too dark and you can't see anything. The two-track roller coaster and Zhuluo River were not going well that day. Halfway through the queue, they suddenly said they had to wait for maintenance, and soon after they said there was a malfunction and they couldn't play. After playing another roller coaster, I rearranged the ride to drift. Unfortunately, the double track was closed later that day. There are many others. There are many spectacular, gorgeous and fantasy scenes outdoors, which are very easy to shoot.

name: user_294
review: Last came here about 5 years ago. Came here because I wanted to see Minion Land. And it comes the day before the red date of Good Friday. Very busy and quite a long queue. Still happy to come here even though the place is small but satisfied because you can try everything

name: user_295
review: Lost my phone at USS on 1 May 2025, around 3-3.30pmwith the help of staff at Guest Services and the Revenge of the Mummy ride, I got it back. Thanks very much to the USS team!

name: user_296
review: Take note if you want to make the most of your visit to Universal Studios Singapore: Go on a weekday, not during weekends or school/public holidays. Its way less crowded and much more enjoyable. Arrive when the park opens. We went on a weekday during a non-peak season , early in the day, wait times were about 1530 minutes, but later in the afternoon, most rides were only 5 minutes. We got to enjoy everything and even did some rides more than once! Avoid peak periods if possible. During busy times, youll end up waiting in long lines under the heat and humidity. Ticket prices for adults start from SGD 62 (depending on the website and promotions). Check the official Resorts World Sentosa website for the most accurate price. Express Pass info: Universal Express: Starts from SGD 90 per person. Lets you skip the queue once per ride. Universal Express Plus: Starts from SGD 120 per person. Lets you skip the queue as many times as you want on each ride. (Both are only valid on the day of your visit) My advice: If youre going on a weekday and outside of peak season, you probably dont need the Express Pass, the lines are short enough, and youll save money!

name: user_297
review: We were the first ones in on a weekday and unfortunately we were just underwhelmed. We were most excited for Far Far Away/Shrek and it was very rundown and had no energy at all.

name: user_300
review: Arrived at one of the world's tourist destinations

name: user_303
review: Love it.. Maybe better time on the weekdays so you can enjoy all the attraction. Start from Sci Fic Area : Transformer Ride , Jurrasic Park, Galactica Human and Cyloon ....well the coaster will roll you!!! Including Mummy The revenge..its also roller coaster! Some merchandise is good quality. The crew are helpful including the crew for locker. Enjoy the performance of many attraction..by using the Universal Studio Singapore application..get it from pplay store.

name: user_305
review: If you're happy, that's fine, the game you play should just be called absolute cinema

name: user_306
review: I really had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore.

name: user_307
review: A definite must visit place! There's so many things to see and to do that I reckon that even one day won't be enough. However, this place can easily be overcrowded and you may find yourself wasting lots of time in queues!!!

name: user_308
review: Great day out with friends and family. I do recommend paying extra for an express pass.

name: user_310
review: Jarren Tan from Minion Mart gave good customer service to me cheers to him.

name: user_311
review: It's less than I thought. It is very unclear whether I should buy Express or not. The food and drinks aren't very tasty.

name: user_313
review: visited on April 28th, not really crowded try to queue the roller coaster on the evening around 3pm or more! normal track only wait for 30m for both human and cylon coasters!!

name: user_314
review: Fast past is a waste of money "Firdaus" at despicable me ride treated us very unfairly although we purchased fast past , he let the normal que first for 3 shows and only let us enter once we made a noise!

name: user_315
review: There aren't many people. Because I went during the weekdays. Lots of photography spots The player doesn't have to wait long. There is no need to buy an express ticket.

name: user_316
review: Good . 15-18 rides . Meet and greet . Shows . Meeting with cartoon characters and much more . Download universal studios app and watch out for waiting period for each ride , time for meet & greet , also shows. No need to buy express ticket if you plan according to wait period in app

name: user_317
review: not very big, but most of the rides were amazing, still recommendable

name: user_318
