review: Universal Studios Singapore is overwhelmingly empty! You can fully enjoy it in just half a day! ! You can basically get in without lining up for rides or food. You can have a relaxing time!

name: user_319
review: Be sure to check out Harry Potter: Visions of magic. It's worth all the money

name: user_320
review: If it's your first trip to Singapore, you should go to Universal! I was looking forward to it. Tickets were about 15,000 yen per person for the Univa and Night Safari pack from the Klook site. No matter how many times I tried, I couldn't get the QR code from the voucher, so I had a hard time, so I asked the hotel front desk to do it for me. It was quite troublesome. Use the MRT to get to UNIVA, and Singapore has a well-developed transportation network that is easy to understand, convenient, and fast. And you can go there safely and securely. And everyone is kind. After arriving at Univa, I was able to easily go around the attractions in about 2 hours and ride the attractions without waiting. Being in a subtropical region, I was physically exhausted from all the hard walking, so I decided to return home after about 3 hours. It's disappointing and expensive compared to Universal in Japan, but it was a great memory of my trip.

name: user_322
review: We bought the tickets online also express ticket and Aquarium sea

name: user_325
review: Best place to explore on sentosa island...full of adventure, world class shows and rides

name: user_326
review: I came on Monday and bought a quick pass. I did six facilities in about four or five hours. It was really great! Hello Kitty here is particularly cute.

name: user_331
review: The rides are very fun. However, make it a habit to not go on public holidays or weekend as queues make take up to 2 hours. Moreover, beverages and food prices are very high so you can buy food from Harbourfront and then eat it in Sentosa. To combat the long queues you can buy the express pass which is very worth it.

name: user_332
review: Great place lots of new rides and things too see. Make sure you spend the extra money on bypassing the ride lines.

name: user_333
review: A great theme park there is a separate Harry Potter experience too for which one has to purchase separately the tickets. The best rides are Cyclone (the best not for light-hearted) Human Mummy Shrek (4D) Transformer Jurassic Park Personally, i thought the Singapore Universal studio was smaller in size to Universal at LA- California

name: user_334
review: Loads of fun! You need the whole day though...

name: user_335
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrill-seeker's paradise! From the Far Far Away kingdom to Madagascar and Jurassic Park, each themed area is meticulously designed. The rides and shows are exhilarating, especially Battlestar Galactica roller coaster and the Transformers ride. Don't miss the spectacular fireworks display! A must-visit for movie buffs and adventure lovers alike.

name: user_338
review: Absolutely recommended! You shouldn't miss it if you're visiting Singapore. Recommended rides: Transformers, revenge of the mummy, minion mayhem, cylon, and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure.

name: user_340
review: Amazing experience. I had to compare to orlando. Hands down orlando was bigger and better. Had to minus one star in comparison and waterworld was shutdown until july? So that was not cool and is one of my favorite movies. I felt alot of small attractions or stores were closed mid day? Amazing performance by the dance group and singers who were all filipino.

name: user_341
review: The best if you buy express tickets. You can get through it in 5 hours easy riding everything

name: user_342
review: Most rides are good, some needs upgradation.

name: user_344
review: Fun atmosphere There are a lot of rides. There's a grandchild's zone. Most rides have a long wait.

name: user_345
review: What a fun day! Our family loved every minute of our day at Universal Studios Singapore. We went on every ride and show and met almost every character. We highly recommend the express passes - theyre expensive but theyre worth it to improve the overall experience of the visit so you dont spend all day standing in a queue. The passes also allowed us to take advantage of better seats for the shows.

name: user_347
review: Have fun. Download their APP to view the waiting time at each ride in real time. It is really accurate. The queues are considerably smaller by the last hour of the day. It could be a good idea to try the rides again in the end. I found most of the open shows were not worth it. Could be relevant for the kids.

name: user_348
review: Big joke and no value for money whatsoever. Bought an express pass for two adults and 1 child and spent 680 SGD. At least three rides were down for maintenance, two did not take the express pass. Never again.

name: user_349
review: Small Universal Studios Park, but not very busy on a Monday. Go early for 5 mins wait on first 2 rides and then they slowly go up to 50 mins wait time. Express or Fast Pass recommended. We were able to go on rides multiple times by waiting in the regular queue when it was short and using our Pass for when the queue was bigger. Not a lot of vegan or vegetarian food.

name: user_350
review: Its an amazing park! Recommend to get the express pass if you wanna do everything within 4-5 hours and still have some time to enjoy the day!

name: user_352
review: So many things to do. Everything man made but we can see lots of things. Our kids are very happy. But tired

name: user_353
review: Travelled from England, very cool park had a good day :)

name: user_354
review: Despite visiting on a weekend, Universal Studios Singapore wasnt too crowded, which was a pleasant surprise. The park itself is relatively small and easy to walk around. The food selection is good, and everything is clean and well-maintained. The only downside is that the staff arent always helpful or well-informed theres definitely room for improvement when it comes to providing clear and accurate information.

name: user_355
review: Amazing experience at Universal studios Singapore. It was the highlight of our trip. Had lots of fun there. Special mention to- Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers and cyclone roller coaster rides. These 3 were absolutely spectacular!!

name: user_356
review: I like Minions, so I probably wouldn't have gone if it weren't for Minion Land. Compared to the expensive tickets, the attractions are old and there are not many rides. What has changed since I came 9 years ago is that Minion Land has opened... Express is great!! Waste of money The Human and Cyclone that are worth riding have to be left in a locker because you can't have any luggage. It's free for 45 minutes, but if even 1 minute passes, you'll be charged 4. I paid the money after 4 minutes... ha... The safety device was covered in soggy sweat that I almost vomited. We stayed for 6 hours taking pictures and buying goods, but we completed all the rides in 2 hours

name: user_358
review: although i went on a weekday, there was still quite alot of people tourists mostly. however the rides i rode mostly had a queue time of 10-30mins with the mummy ride as an exception of 1hr. however, it is understandable as it is one of the most popular rides. a lot of people started leaving around evening time so the queues got reasonably shorter which was good. food wise, i tried the cafe beside the transformers ride. bought the ramen. it was quite expensive 16. but its universal studios so cant really complain. the food was not bad though. comparable to japanese chain restaurants.

name: user_359
review: Great place to spend one full day to experience everything they have to offer. Great rides and experience, with Transformers and Jurassic world being must do ones. The newly opened minion world is where kids enjoy a lot.

name: user_360
review: express pack need to be take if you want make many attraction but too much attraction is not including in the express pack -transformer, ancient egypt , jurassic lost world funny -shrek 4d the presentation is too long and teach how to speak in the microphone don t put the microphone in the mouth but 15cm from mouth is better ( specially when you english accent is uncommun) -light camera action it s subtitle in chinese but not in english and the show duration 4 min not very interesting -sesame street for the child until 5 -minion part is open but the express pack is not available. -408 2 express pack and 3 adults but you can t do everything -90sg for 6 tenders 4 fries and 4 cola very expensive(chicken taste hasardous) -in the drive in restaurant, only 2 cashiers ice cream caramel oreo 9 and when you receive it's half quantity than the picture, it s a joke i spend 5 hours inside the park i have 70% of attraction

name: user_363
review: Worth a visit. It's not an overly big park but you can fill a whole day there. Decent rides.

name: user_365
review: Went first week of Jan 2025, and the place was empty, almost embarrassingly so for the Jurassic Park entertainer with the hatching dinosaur babies. Hardly any wait for the rides. A brilliant time was had and we stayed open to close. A night time show/fireworks or parade would be a great addition.

name: user_366
review: Superb. Minion land is great

name: user_368
review: It's very beautiful - everyone who has the chance should take a look at it.

name: user_370
review: That was very great places, so many interesting vehicles especially when i ride the transformers one, the food was so amazing. I ate french fries at one of thw restaurant in the middle of universal. Starbucks coffee also was so good.

name: user_371
review: The 2 stars are for the place. Its very over priced and u have to be ready to stand in queues for most of the day. Some queues are upto 1.5 to 2 hours long and then u have the Singaporean weather which melts u down. Also the weather can suddenly suspend the rides. Try to go for the single rider queue wherever available.

name: user_372
review: You should go, there are many amusement parks, the wait is quite long, but the dinosaur area is great, you should go.

name: user_375
review: A fantastic place. All of the younger staff are very accommodating to wheelchair users, going above and beyond with their kindness. The rides all have accessible lanes, there's ample seating, locker rooms are provided to store your things for free for the first 45 minutes if you need to get on a ride that requires it. Lines are unbearable for popular rides, even on a weekday, makes sense because of the popularity and the fun factor. Not too big of a park, but just enough to get your fill of family fun time. Naturally there's gift shops, moderately priced for their quality.

name: user_376
review: If you have a free itinerary in Singapore, you should definitely stop by. Confirm that there are not many people on Monday and Tuesday haha. You can get to Santosa Island by taxi from the center in 15 minutes. Approximately within 15 based on Grab Singapore Universal is not big, but it has the advantage of being able to ride various attractions faster than in other countries.

name: user_379
review: USS launched Minion Land last Feb 2025. There are 3 new rides. It's suitable for my youngest son, below 5. So much fun!

name: user_381
review: This is my third time in the USS. You should get an express line ticket because even on weekdays there are a lot of people, especially for the famous rides.

name: user_386
review: Came on Sunday, the queue wasn't as bad as I imagined, in fact it was relatively quiet in my opinion the toys were really fun and really made you dig, especially the mummy ones!! Don't forget to download the application so you know how long the queue will be, bro

name: user_388
review: We purchased the VIP package which was so good, it includes express pass after the tour and complimentary drink bottles, great for slushies and general refills at discounted price. Izak was our guide who was just brilliant - nothing was too hard, no questions too silly and up for a chat and laugh. The only downside is that the park doesnt quite cater for older kids, there were really only 3 rides for our 16YO. Nonetheless a wonderful day out. Thanks Izak!

name: user_389
review: Singapore's highlights and landmarks, lots of tourists .. Food is quite expensive here

name: user_390
review: Best attraction in singapore. We can enjoy with family. My daughter enjoy minion land. Their parade is also good.

name: user_391
review: Great place, the minion place is a bit small but had a good experience. I suggest to skip the shop and picture the morning to enjoy no waiting time ;)

name: user_393
review: They should make some roller coasters indoors like IMG and WB have done in the UAE, rather than having visitors told that outdoor closed because of the "weather", also wetsuits should be provided if not then rented/sold outside rides and attractions which could get you wet. Other than that one of the best theme parks in Asia, everything up to its reputation. Good 3d effects, Spielberg sound stage was fantastic. Beautifully built.

name: user_397
review: So fun with many amenities

name: user_398
review: All the rides are really great, and the Battlestar Galactica is terrific.

name: user_400
review: Going with school is very fun.

name: user_401
review: If you are buying the express pass you will enjoy this, for regular tickets this is designed to be a let down. There is a waiting time of 30mins (most of the rides) to more than 90mins (some rides), which means that Universal Studios is deliberately selling more tickets than they have capacity to accommodate. My guess they are overselling by 3-4 times of the capacity. Also when we visited my 5yr old daughter was very keen on meeting the "Minions". But it turns out that the Minions were not available for whatever reason. This wouldn't have been a big issues, had Universal studios not advertised everywhere about the new Minion Land and kids posing with Minions! Again a deliberate omission from Universal studios. Overall the feeling was one of being cheated / duped by Universal Studios.

name: user_402
review: It's big and pretty haha I wish it was available in Korea too

name: user_403
review: do not buy the speed pass.

name: user_404
review: Good rides, queues were relatively short on the day we went but recommend arriving before 10am and get the app to see approx queue times for each ride. Shows and activities are great, minion land especially. Food options are very expensive.

name: user_405
review: Very nice enjoying place. Rides there are very awesome plan u timings accordingly. Rides like roller-coaster has waiting time 1 to 2 hours. Don't miss the roller-coaster Rides, mummy ride , jurassic park ride and transformer ride.

name: user_407
review: We headed straight to the Sci Fi city to get ahead of the queue for the 2 rollercoasters and it was a blast! The other rides like Transformers 4D and Space Spaghetti were great as well. We had a really fun time even though we could not cover all the attractions & rides.

name: user_408
review: Awesome experience,worth every penny spent . Don't miss the roller coaster

name: user_409
review: Everytlme we went one unit is always closed. And new minion two times delayed.. morning we arrived.. we went to minion .. after long q , unit is closed Evening time is delayed again

name: user_410
review: Disappointing park! Too many technical problems... we're queuing for nothing! Management doesn't work! It's horrible.. thank you goodbye never again

name: user_412
review: Quarter of the stuff was closed! No vegetarian or vegan food options!

name: user_413
review: Raining day will be worse for those with kids. No place can have a seat. Long queue for the LRT. No lift to take to go underground taxi stand. Jia lat. The only time u can take picture without crowded at universal ball is raining day

name: user_415
review: Beautiful place near Sentosa Beach. Can be accessed by train, cable car or by walk. There is a very big crowd on weekends and holidays

name: user_416
review: All the rides are adventures yet it is so safe, neat safe and clean place overall

name: user_417
review: Too hot Definitely have to buy express pass prior entry, its the only way to avoid dissappointment

name: user_421
review: It's an incredible place and has plenty of shops already around which you need for a nice day of sightseeing.

name: user_424
review: Disappointment. A lot of attractions are just rollercoasters, with quite long waiting lines and requirement to leave your belongings in a lockers paid extra. Besides you can hang out and spend more money on food and candy. Not much themed hang out park spaces really. Youll spend most of the time just waiting in a line. Low quality to price ratio.

name: user_425
review: I would highly recommend this place to visit when you visit singapore. The only flaw is the waiting time in que is very here ( at least 30 min for normal ride and for super excited ride is approx 1hr plus) , so I would recommend buying an express ticket rather than a normal one. For me best ride would be Jurassic park rapids adventure. But for this you should not have wore shoes as it's gonna get wet also must have poncho. Also 4d show Shrek is too much fun. Over-all you will be having fun day.

name: user_426
review: Beautiful place. Heaven for kids. Lots of food options. Oasis cafe near Revenge of Mummies is best for Indian food. Veg and Jain options also available. Recommended to buy express pass on weekends and Public holidays to avoid wait time. Galactica Cylon is very scary, not Recommended for weak hearted. Highly recommended show are Transformer and Revenge of Mummies. Recommended to enter park at 0945 and straight away head to Transformer to avoid wait time. Enjoyed the most.

name: user_427
review: Transformers ride and puss in boots are the best rides

name: user_428
review: poor management of ride and arrangement, overworked staff with bad attitude. Especially poor is their locker arrangement which causes confusion by the staff. You need to get allocated a locker from their control screen, then put the things in the locker and close it, for the next person to use it. However, when putting things in the locker, other people may try to change your screen. Even worse, the staff come and cancel the screen, so the original person can't close their locker and need to queue again. Total chaos and nightmare, with bad staff attitude (kept yelling at people to put what sized bags into the locker first). Please note that a lot of the rides need to use lockers as they don't allow bags. Not interested in trying all the rides.

name: user_429
review: The place is great but needs more staff who can help. And we arrived at 11 in the morning and left at 6 in the evening, 4 of the 7 hours were spent waiting in line. For a while I thought I was going to faint. The places where they kept people waiting in line were very stuffy. We were devastated. We said we would definitely get sick here. People were on top of each other and there was not a drop of water. We waited in line for 1.5 hours in one of them. Besides, it was a weekday. I will never go again.

name: user_434
review: many high-end brands! the environment & architecture around also very goodd! they often had events during christmas, newyear, & other holidays they also had the iconic singapore ice-cream-bread, but u must early to get flavour u want bc it's get rlly viral on social media

name: user_437
review: It was lovely to be at Universal Studios. It was really busy and the waits for some of the rides got up to 90 minutes. If you are wanting to do the rides, I can really recommend getting the fast pass. As a family we are very happy to have visited and had a lot of fun.

name: user_438
review: Had a great time, but the rides could have been better.

name: user_439
review: Excellent and pleasant time at USS especially props to staff at Puss in Boots ride with a gold specs (if I recall correctly) a few others stuffs that helped as well and to the female lady at the sick bay that check-up on our well-being when one of us was not feeling well and had to rest during our time at USS.

name: user_441
review: On 14 April Halfway queuing the Puss in Boots ride, i had blurry vision and difficulty breathing and went out of the queue. A male staff wearing golden spectacles helped me by offering water and a ice pack to help me. He also arranged a wheelchair to bring me to the sickbay which was all the way at the entrance.. Surprisingly, he passed my boyfriend 2 piece of individual express pass so that we would be able to ride the Puss in Boots after i rested. About 2 hours later, i went back with my express pass to take the ride and saw him again! He even gave me and my bf another 6 tickets for us to enjoy the rides to make up for what the time we lost. I think it was rly nice of him and im really grateful that he made my trip to USS fun despite me feeling sick halfway. Im really thankful for this staff

name: user_444
review: Universal Studios Hasa amazing theme rides and fund activities

name: user_445
review: More of the same as other parks, same attractions and very very small. The stores and merchandising were a disappointment. The kings of merchaindising only selling minion material. What happened to all the huge portfolio of Universal movies??? Shark, gladiator, terminator...etc... t-shirts

name: user_447
review: Had a enjoyable time at USS! Staff Tarsh from Minion land is a very helpful person!

name: user_448
review: They need to make it possible to buy express tickets AFTER buying the entrance tickets .Get the univ studio app to check on waiting time for rides, queue for popular rides can be very very long (60-70 min on weekdays), buy the express pass if you can afford it, can get dinner at the forum opposite the studios. Buy your gifts and merc in the universal studio shop after the entrance, has all the goods from the smaller shops spread through the park

name: user_449
review: It was ok, easy to get around, lots of food and shopping options. We visited one week before Easter during school Holidays and before going I debated the express tickets over and over, in the end we didnt take them and I was super happy with my choice, i dont think the express tickets would be worth the cost. It was my first visit to a Universal studios and to be honest I left pretty uninspired to visit any others in the future

name: user_452
review: Visited during a Wednesday off peak period, and it was great, aside from the heat! Managed to catch all the rides with the longest wait being 45 minutes. But the place that was the most eye-catching was Minion Land! It was amazing, so adorable and I loved the new attractions. Rifdi from Super Hungry food stand was incredible, he was so accommodating to our needs despite it being crowded during lunch time. He always greeted every guest with a huge smile and with so much enthusiasm & never failed to always be in an upbeat mood even when it was nearing closing time when we dropped by once more before heading off. Thanks for a fun experience!

name: user_454
review: Universal Studios Singapore is definitely one of my favorite spots in the city. Being there makes me feel young again, with all those thrilling rides that get my heart racingand even though they scare me a little, its always a totally worth experience! I love how the place brings back so many memories of my younger years, making it the perfect mix of nostalgia and excitement.

name: user_456
review: Consider buying the express tickets to save on time.

name: user_457
review: So hot and sunny. The Universal symbol has a long queue and crowed to wait take pictures. You should spend all day in this place for relax and play all games.

name: user_458
review: Had an amazing time with the kids! Be sure to download the Universal Studios app for real-time wait times and show info. Huge thanks to Tarsh for all the help and guidance!

name: user_462
review: Very full ppl, we must wait 3 hours to play roller-coaster.

name: user_463
review: The roller coaster is very fast and mouth blowing.

name: user_465
review: You'll have an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! Minion Land is a must visit. Don't forget your Camera to capture all the fun moments The theming and decorations are incredible. The whole family will love it Get ready for a fun-filled day at Universal Studios Singapore. It's a dream come true for families and thrill-seekers alike

name: user_468
review: Fantastic amusement park for the whole family. If possible, it's best to visit on a weekday to avoid long queues for attractions. The cost is quite high but it is definitely worth it. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore with their family

name: user_470
review: Must visit place. Better visit in week days. Also take express tickets if you re going to visit with your children. Because some of the rides have waiting time about one hour for normal tickets. (Dont ask me about the rides...)

name: user_472
review: Better buy express tickets and carry snacks

name: user_476
review: Make sure you download the app so you can check the ride times. It really helps. There is also wheelchair service available, but you have to get there early. Make sure you bring sunscreen and a sun umbrella as it gets really warm. Lines at the end of the day tend to be shorter but never underestimate the weather! Weekdays have less people than weekends.

name: user_479
review: There is a charge of 4S to use the lockers at Jurassic Park even for a short time. I don't want to have to pay change each time, but I would like to have about an hour's worth included in the admission fee. The person in charge at the entrance will leave your luggage for you! Even though I said so, when I went in and lined up, there were a lot of people who had their own bags. Although the estimated waiting time is a guideline, it is completely unreliable. There were a lot of other things I was concerned about, and it was a day where I was more disappointed in the quality of the service than the fun.

name: user_481
review: Very disappointed. Small theme park with very few rides which you have to wait minimum of 60min to get on it which lasts less than 10 minutes. Food is absolute joke. Merchandise price is very inflated. NEVER RETURNING AGAIN.

name: user_482
review: It was great day! We had so much fun and the train ride was cheaper than expected!

name: user_484
review: Today we went to Universal Studios Singapore. In contrast to Universal Studios Los Angeles, there is no Simpson here but Transformers. The amusement park is smaller and not comparable. This recreational facility is located on Sentosa Island. Here you can also visit Harry Potter and the underwater world and also the casino. Price for 2 adults and a child 230

name: user_485
review: Excellent, but the problem is the heat

name: user_486
review: I come to Singapore often but this is my first time visiting Universal. Very fun, very impressive, very worthwhile.

name: user_489
review: Hmmm... nice place... But I don't know why I felt bore after an hour visiting this place.. Many rides and shows are there.. You will.need a whole day to explore this place. But other then 2or 3 Shows and 2 or 3 rides.. rest are for ages 3 to 9.. elders will easily get bored.

name: user_490
review: It's a wonderful place. Unfortunately, we couldn't visit the area. It normally opens at 10 in the morning. When we went there at 18:30, thanks to the employees, they warned us that people were spending 6 hours inside. Even though we couldn't enter, we had the opportunity to visit outside. By the way, it closes at 20:00. Let those who want to come know that if I come again, I will pay attention to the hours. Those who want to come, do not return without stopping by here. Thank you to the employees.

name: user_491
review: I spend two days on this Universal Studio. Both day not all of the ride open, some on the full-day maintanaince. Some on the maintainance for few hours. The worst part is that I and my kid stuck in the Canopy Flyer for more than 30 min. (Now, I'm typing while stucking in the ride) *edit: They give us the one-time express as compensation for the delay *edit 2: After that, we go to Shrek 4D adventure. And guess what happen? It delay for more than 30 min again!!! All of this happen on 14 April 2025, around 11am to 1:30pm I WILL NOT COMEBACK HERE AGAIN!

name: user_493
review: Tarsh from USS Minion shop is super friendly Malaysian! She is a socialist!

name: user_496
review: Happy place for the Kids Never get tired coming back here again

name: user_499
review: We really enjoyed our day at USS, its a clean & fun park. Whilst not huge, there were plenty of rides to keep our kids (& adults) entertained. A couple of issues we had that I thought are worth mentioning, in case it helps someone else! * No re-entry is allowed. This was disappointing for us as a HUGE storm came across & closed down every ride, for quite some time (over an hour by the time we left & not looking like easing anytime soon). When all you can do is take shelter inside a shop or restaurant (however most of these are largely outdoor seating areas), it would have been great to able to get the Sentosa Express back to HarbourFront & get dry/fed & be able to go back once the weather cleared. Instead, we just left & didnt go back. * Waterworld was closed when we were there, this happens, I get it. The Minions ride broke down as my kids were queuing for it, with no re-opening time available. Given the cost of tickets (its not a cheap day out!) & putting up with things like this, I really think a re-entry option for weather, as stated above, would be a great gesture of goodwill. * Ride operators arent really behaving in the spirit of the place. One girl working the Transformers ride made our children completely exit the queue area because they had accidentally used the express lane without an express pass... only thing is, they were the only people in both the express & the ordinary lane. Doesnt set a great tone to the day when staff cant show any kindness to a group of children who arent inconveniencing anyone else.

name: user_500
review: New zone, Minions, fun and bright.

name: user_504
review: Amazing! Kid friendly, lots of good food. Options and do not miss out below rides: Transformers 3D ride Transformers human ride and cylon ride Revenge of the mummy Jurassic park water ride Jurassic park Flypark ride

name: user_506
review: Must visit place in Singapore. Any age you will enjoy it. to enjoy fully don't forget to but the ticket for skip the line that's my suggestion

name: user_507
review: Although smaller than other Universal Parks, this park exudes charm and offers a nice mix of thrills and dark rides. The land of Shrek Far Far Away is truly extraordinary and unique for this park. The food and products are also top notch. The park is located on an island, and transportation by cable car offers a breathtaking view of the park from above.

name: user_508
review: A great place for the whole family. It made a much more impression than Disneyland, there were a lot of attractions, some of which didnt even have a queue. It's impressive how all the little details are thought out.

name: user_510
review: It's quite busy and the kids are happy to play here, but it's better if you have more money to buy the express route because for every good ride there will be a queue of 30 minutes to 1 hour. So that in 1 day everyone has visited the rides. If you use the normal route, 1 day will not be enough.

name: user_511
review: Excellent place to visit when in Singapore...some great entertainment for both adults n kids... U shudnt miss this place at all...yes do get express tickets which are a little expensive but worth it for some rides especially in the holiday season...

name: user_515
review: Good experience. Wait times can get crazy so recommend getting the app to see live wait times and do those rides when it's quieter. Didnt do the rapids as that was the only ride consistently at 40m wait.

name: user_516
review: It was good experience. Suggest to reach here around 10 am if you will reach late it will be more wait time in each attractions.

name: user_517
review: Our first visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience, especially for our three kids aged 12, 11, and 6. Right from the entrance, the parks energy pulled them ineach one found something they loved. The younger one was enchanted by the Madagascar zone and the gentle Crate Adventure boat ride, while the older two were all about the thrillzooming straight for Transformers: The Ride and the Revenge of the Mummy coaster. Far Far Away was a family favorite, with the Shrek 4-D Adventure and the impressive castle making everyone feel like part of a fairy tale. What made the day truly special was how the park managed to cater to all their ages so seamlessly. While the older kids got their adrenaline fix on rides like Battlestar Galactica and Canopy Flyer, there were plenty of fun, age-appropriate attractions for our youngest toolike King Juliens Beach Party-Go-Round and Dino-Soarin. We also appreciated the clean, family-friendly spaces, quick service, and the kindness of the staff. The kids didnt stop smiling all day, and we left with tired feet, full hearts, and a promise to come back again.

name: user_518
review: It was raining when we went to USS, but it was a blessing in disguise because there were not a lot of people yet (not normal for amusement parks) so we only waited for roughly 10-20mins per ride, we were able to ride a lot!

name: user_520
review: A Must-Visit for Movie and Thrill Enthusiasts! Universal Studios Singapore offers an unforgettable experience packed with excitement and adventure. From the adrenaline-pumping Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON dueling roller coasters to the immersive Transformers: The Ride The Ultimate 3D Battle, every attraction is top-notch. The Revenge of the Mummy indoor coaster delivers thrills with its dark twists and turns , while the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure offers a refreshing splash as you navigate through dinosaur habitats . Families will love the whimsical Shrek 4-D Adventure and the newly opened Minion Land, featuring the delightful Despicable Me Minion Mayhem ride . The parks themed zones are beautifully crafted, making every corner photo-worthy. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or looking for family fun, this park has it all. Highly recommended!

name: user_522
review: I really love Transformer 3D roller coaster and definitely recommend it for those who brought family, especially kids who like action movies, really, 30 mins was worth the wait. Revenge of the mummy was also nerve whacking and recommended if you can endure fast moving coaster, they even provide free locker for the first 70 mins. Cylon might be good but I didnt try due to motion sickness. Puss in boots one was great as well if you are into the show. Everything else felt mediocre and just good as filler to spend your time. Unfortunately the dragon ride was under maintenance. Rides aside, all the staff from entrance to the ones keeping the rides are very nice and well trained. Queue management was also good to keep people entertained while lining.

name: user_524
review: Get in early to beat the crowds. Did the Transformers ride that was excellent and the waiting time was deceptive short.

name: user_525
review: The only Universal Studios in Asia. Similar if not the same rides they have in Orlando but less. Highly recommend the express pass if you're planning on trying all the rides and dont want to wait on 1 hour queue line. One day is enough to do everything. Food is average as expected with moderate price, a little bit of everything for most people. You can request to get a stamp to return on the same day if you want to eat outside of the theme park.

name: user_526
review: The sun is quite strong. A hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen are required. If you bring a water bottle, there are water spots along the way so you can refill it. However, depending on the location, some people drink water with their mouths directly on the water, so be sure to check carefully before refilling! Please note that the waiting time displayed is completely unreliable!

name: user_527
review: We had a great time at universal studio Singapore. We almost didnt go because of a lot of reviews saying that it was too busy. We decided to go on a Thursday and we had to wait maximum of 20 minutes for any attraction. The attractions where very nice and fun! All of the staff where super friendly! Just a great day :).

name: user_528
review: My personal experience is coming here with my family. Buy tickets in advance on the Klook app. And buy a regular ticket, not an express one, because not all rides are available. My advice is that if you have entered, take the last ride first (rapid adventure) then you can move to other rides, such as transformer, cyclon rain, mummy, etc. Halal food is also available. Prayer rooms & toilets are also available.

name: user_529
review: 5/5 Stars. Had an unforgettable day at USS. Designed with different zones like Hollywood, New York, and Sci-Fi City. There are rollercoasters, live shows, and character meet-and-greets. The staff were friendly, and the park was clean and well-maintained. Highly recommend arriving early, wearing comfy shoes, and taking breaks to stay hydrated.

name: user_530
review: Very small compared to other Universal studios theme parks. Has 8-10 rides overall and insane amount of wait time like 1 hour to 2 hours. There isn't anything else to do other than walking around, eating and waiting for rides forever. For the mummy themed ride, we walked inside for some good 15 claustrophobic minutes, can't imagine the suffocation if there was a crowd. The rides are like 10 minutes max but the wait time is 1-2 hours. Most of the rides are intense and really give nauseating feeling, so pay heed to the warning. Hardly takes 4-5 hours including lunch and if you aren't forever waiting for rides. Boards are pretty confusing sometimes and no proper explanation given at places. If you have done disney or US in other locations , better skip it.

name: user_531
review: Really enjoyed the day. It is never going to compare to universal studios state side, but good enough for a third party country. Well done singapore!

name: user_533
review: Excellent day out with the family, Be prepared for wait times on rides & use the app to monitor

name: user_534
review: Awesome park and Gerald helped us a lot in the minion store! Cheers to him!

name: user_535
review: Had a great visit at universal singapore!!!! Was so excited for minion land. Gerald at the minion store was a huge help and so so nice! Had a great experience!!!

name: user_537
review: Staff were super friendly and overall pleasant experience! Latha took great care of me and went above and beyond to help me! would 100% recommend!

name: user_538
review: A PSA for my fellow bigger-boned legends: Universal Studios Singapore is packed with movie magic, but lets keep it realsome of us are gonna hit the no-go zone on most of the rides. Even the less intense ones like 4D simulators can be a squeeze. Its not personalits a safety thing, and the staff were kind, respectful, and just doing their job. That said, as a big dude I was able to enjoy a few gems: Silly Swirly, Dino-Soarin, and Acceleratorbasically anything without tight restraints or locking mechanisms. Everything else? Sadly, a no-go for me. But dont write the day offtheres still heaps to enjoy! Meet-and-greets are genuinely fun (shout-out to the Minions), and the food and shopping options are solid. And if you're a film buff? The park layout is loaded with references, details, and hidden Easter eggs that'll have you pointing things out like you're on a behind-the-scenes tour. So while I didnt hit the thrill rides, I still had an epic time. Know before you go, embrace the experience, and enjoy the magic your way.

name: user_539
review: This place was great one of the best theme parks I have ever been. Waiting times are long, especially during the day so express ticket is a must. From 10:30am to 5:30pm queuing time for decent attractions are more than an hour.

name: user_542
review: Minion land is so cute ! Cafe food is good too :) !! ()

name: user_544
review: I closed my eyes while doing the mummy ride. 10/10 would close it again.

name: user_547
review: The park is not big so you can walk around easily. There are also drinking fountains inside.

name: user_548
review: Nice Service from Tarsh at Minion World Shop

name: user_549
review: Ridzuan, Pei Yi helped at lot at minion land really grateful

name: user_552
review: Lots to see and do, for a hefty price SG98. (April 2025).

name: user_554
review: It was good, worth the money, few of the rides were closed due to the maintenance, one should check before going.

name: user_556
review: Just got back from an amazing day at Universal Studios Singapore with the fam and wow, what a blast! From the moment we walked in, the energy was just awesome. The park is super well-organized, clean, and full of fun vibes. We started off with the Transformers ride seriously one of the coolest 3D rides Ive ever been on. The kids were screaming (in a good way), and even the adults were hyped. Then we hit up Jurassic Park, got soaked on the river raft ride, and didnt even care because it was so much fun. One of the highlights? The Minion Mart and all the Despicable Me stuff my little cousin couldn't stop smiling. Oh, and dont miss the Revenge of the Mummy ride if you like a little thrill. Totally worth the wait! There are plenty of food options too from quick snacks to proper meals. We grabbed lunch at one of the themed diners and even found some halal choices, which was a plus for our family. Overall, it was such a wholesome day full of laughter, a bit of adrenaline, and tons of unforgettable memories. Whether you're with kids, teens, or just a bunch of fun-loving adults, Universal Studios Singapore is totally worth the trip!

name: user_557
review: Wonderful place with lots of entertainment and fun.Had a lovely time with family. Preferably take an express pass(other than admission ticket) to escape long queues for rides and save time.

name: user_558
review: Fun but hot small air con area Mummy Machine (10/10)

name: user_560
review: Great amusement park but a little small! No long waits at attractions!

name: user_561
review: Forget off-peak, there is no such thing like off-peak in this place. Express ticket add on is a must buy if you want to stand a chance to do all 8 noteworthy attractions in the park in a day.

name: user_567
review: Personally I do not think this is worth the money if you are visiting singapore especially if you have been to other universal studios this one falls flat on quality and size. The price is quite inflated and there are continuous costs. For instance I was told I should put my backpack in a locker so I paid 35 dollars outside the park to put my bag away and just kept a small cross body bag for my wallet. Then when you try and go on certian rides you thin need to buy a locked in the park for your smaller item and suddenly one ride is costing you 15 so you can store your bag for it. So if your alone this is an expensive day of storing your items and if your with people expect one person to sit out and wait with your bags The food as all theme parks go was of course over priced. But this is a pretty well known fact so always eat before and bring snacks. The size of the park is quite small compared to others and the majority of the rides were more or less 4d so your just sitting in a cart rattling with screens around you more than anything really. I do not recommend buying tickets at the gate as I found them through tour companies much cheaper

name: user_568
review: Been here 2 times already, this time i didnt come on holiday season so it wasnt too busy. The wait time was pretty good. My favorite attractions was the movie simulation and transformer. Its very fun and i had a great time with my gf overall. However there were so many people from india, pretty much 50% if the tourist there is from india. I dont have a problem with that, but a lot of them have really terrible body odor, so maybe it would be great to install some fragrance and air con during in the attraction line area. Its can be very unpleasant to smell during the wait

name: user_569
review: A replica of usa, can explore it with family, just one thing need to take care , always crowded with tourist here, so waiting time in each rides is from. 45 mnts to 70, mnts. There are many more things to see in sentosa where this universal studio is located.

name: user_570
review: Family fun day at universal. Not very huge we can cover the whole park in a day. Cyclon was fun!

name: user_572
review: Yes its fun there but its hella expensive Entrance ticket already 80 and you still need to pay 5-10 for all the fun rides. The free ones are all those toddles rides. The food is so expensive!! I recommend just exploring sentosa in general and not come here unless u win lottery or something

name: user_573
review: First time in Singapore and decided to go to universal studios. Food was good and drinks however some of the staff wasnt so nice. I mean dont get me wrong they are happy but one guy was so rude it was like he didnt even want to be there. All in all it was okay however they should hire their staff more if they have interests

name: user_574
review: Come here on a weekday and get here early. We were able to go on the BSG rides 3 times with minimal crowds. Pick your go to rides and go there first without clicking around photos. We did the Mummy, Transformers and BSG rides and only then did we slow down. Best part of Singapore for the kids.

name: user_575
review: Since other places to visit in Singapore can easily be covered in half a day, I recommend spending a full day here. Since Disneyland and Universal Studio are located in certain countries, if you like theme parks, I think you should definitely visit them if they are available in the country you are visiting. I definitely recommend you come on weekdays and early in the morning. I arrived at 10 o'clock in the morning and first rode the Transformers ride, and although it was one of the most popular toys here, I did not wait in line at all, but after an hour, all the toys were full and the queues started to pile up. That's why I recommend you come as early as possible in the morning and ride the most popular rides before people get crowded. Also, the fast pass is just an added feature after purchasing the normal ticket. Do not buy it from the internet by mistake, otherwise you will have to buy an entry ticket again. I think if you are coming on a weekday, you do not need to buy a fast ticket, you can ride all of them with a little wait. There is no need to buy tickets online because the capacity of these parks is 50,000 people. I have never seen the tickets run out. You can buy them at the door with cash or card option. I recommend Transformers, Ancient Egypt, Human, and Jurassic Park, but ride knowing that in Jurassic Park you get quite wet, including your shoes. Water World was closed when I went, but it was among the must-visit places. The standard entrance ticket was 83 Singapore dollars, the price of adding the express pass was more expensive than the ticket. Also, if you follow the hours, Shrek and Minions characters greet each other and take photos. It is a very enjoyable and beautiful moment. I definitely recommend it. It is done many times a day.

name: user_576
review: Very good park, the smallest of the Universal, if you go on a weekday you might want to get the common pass, there are no long lines. The express pass calculates that it is one more entry.

name: user_577
review: Plan for a full day. Recommended for those who like to enjoy rides.

name: user_578
review: Poor, nothing like Universal in Los Angeles. Some attractions were closed including Aquaman

name: user_579
review: USS orobably the only themepark in Singapore and located jn Resort World Sentosa. great theme park for family and with friends. Rides are suitable dor diverse age group. The park is quite well-sheltered from sun and rain. New addition of minion world add on to new fun.. Well maintained and park is neat and clean.

name: user_580
review: One of the best places in Singapore Purchased tickets in advance Upon arrival, I purchased FastPass tickets Download the application to view the location map, follow offers, and find out about nearby games

name: user_584
review: It's so simple to describe this place by simply writing 'Simply Awesome' !! A place full of fun, frolic, adventure, good food etc etc. One would get tired but the fun does not ends. There is so much here in Universal Studios. A must must visit place while in Singapore !

name: user_587
review: Superb experience for kids .. we all loved it .

name: user_588
review: nonstop entertaining recreation area.

name: user_590
review: Disneys better. Extremely long lines for every ride for a less than 30 second ride. Rides were too short and honestly the overall area is quite small. Best ride was the revenge of the mummy.

name: user_592
review: I had the most incredible time at Universal Studios Singapore! From the moment we walked through the gates, the excitement was palpable. The park is beautifully designed, with amazing attention to detail in every section, whether it's Hollywood, New York, or Ancient Egypt. The rides are top-notch! I especially loved *Transformers: The Ride*, which was an adrenaline rush. The *Revenge of the Mummy* rollercoaster was thrilling and definitely a highlight. The staff were friendly and professional, and the park was clean and well-maintained throughout the day. Food options were diverse and tasty, with something for everyone. Overall, it was a perfect day full of fun, excitement, and unforgettable memories. I highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore to anyone visiting the area it's an experience you wont want to miss!

name: user_593
review: Ultimate recreational place for kids as well as adults

name: user_594
review: Price & waiting time is not worth it. It's an extra 100 on top of ticket pricing for the express Q. Even then, there is a wait. Some kids rides only have 1 staff at the ride. So it takes even longer to prep the ride. The app is useful. But don't rely on the wait timing for the app. It is not already accurate. Give n take 30mins... Minion land is awesomely done

name: user_595
review: Three different technical defects on the rides within two hours. Way overpriced. The passenger handling on the rides is horrible. Waited for one hour without any progress in the Q.

name: user_596
review: It is better to visit the park during weekdays.Try to be there by 10.00 a.m.It is not necessary to get express pass on weekdays.After 4 p.m we can witness shortfall in footfalls.We can even try rides twice.The wait time for rides after 4.p.m is shorter than 5 mins.Try to visit the park on Tuesday or any midday of the week.It is advisable to get express pass on weekend or during long weekends.

name: user_600
review: Attraction getting aged need changes ! Need fresh attraction & uplifting to bring vibes back ! Over Priced !

name: user_601
review: It was awesome! I went there feeling like Universal Studios in Japan, but it was about half as crowded lol I was able to ride the super thrilling ride (Transformers) in an hour, so if you don't want to wait that long, you may want to use the Expresspass, but if you use Express, I think you can ride all the rides in no time.

name: user_602
review: Many parts were closed, minons show was silly and doesn't worth it, waiting up to 2 hrs to play, very short round after all the waiting

name: user_603
review: Super fun to go their with friends I 100% recommend when you visit Singapore, however if you go on a public holiday I recommend buying express tickets

name: user_605
review: Just before closing, all shops will no longer accept credit cards and only accept cash... It was my last day in Singapore, so I was very disappointed that I didn't have any cash on hand and couldn't buy any souvenirs.

name: user_606
review: After playing in the water at Sentosa Island beach, I went over and enjoyed it. Honestly, I don't feel like there are a lot of things to ride. The line moves quickly, so you don't need to buy a pass to get on board quickly.

name: user_607
review: An amazing experience! One day is barely enough to enjoy all the rides. To make the most of your visit, arrive early and start with the rides that are located farther inside the park, as they usually have shorter queues in the morning. For a smoother experience, track queue times using the official app and plan your rides accordingly. If possible, visit between Tuesday and Thursday to avoid weekend crowds and enjoy shorter wait times. Highly recommended for thrill-seekers and families alike!

name: user_608
review: The biggest theme park in Singapore. Various themes, minion, Jurassic Park, The Mummy, Transformer, The Trolls, etc. Need glasses and sunscreen when the weather is hot

name: user_609
review: The amusement park everyone must visit. We had a wonderful day filled with so much joy and excitement throughout. The rides were fantastic and we enjoyed every minute of our time at the park.

name: user_610
review: There are many people, the park is not big, and the consumption amount is relatively high. It is recommended to enter the park at the beginning of the admission time and buy the tickets on KKDay first to avoid spoiling the fun.

name: user_611
review: Half day is enough . Don't need to go early in the morning. Afternoon is the time when queue for rides are less.

name: user_614
review: An incredible park. Before opening, they had someone do an activity to keep everyone entertained. The rides are amazing! It is very kid and family friendly. I would recommend going on the Transformers 3d ride. Id you plan properly, you can have an amazing day with almost 0 wait time

name: user_615
review: Unfortunately, it is very small compared to America, and most of the things are closed for maintenance. Entry is 82 per person. Book online or upon entry. The best Pharaohs game

name: user_621
review: A lot of people, so fast track is the best option. Very nice new minions area w special food. Too hot during the day. But clean and nice

name: user_624
review: Long Queue Expensive Souvenirs Expensive Foods But Daughter Happy ...

name: user_625
review: It's recommended to buy an express pass, else only half the rides can be accessed.

name: user_626
review: The experience was okay. Nothing too special but also nothing too bad about it. Everything was clean, the queueign system was smooth. But when compared to USJ, it's just okay.

name: user_627
review: Had the chance to stop and cover here. In general, in terms of ride technology, what is here is 11-12 compared to that of Jatim Park 2 & 3 in the city of Batu, East Java. Only the thematic of the rides is different (because that is what is unique to each). For those who have big guts and are not afraid of sliding at high speed, it is recommended to try the Transformer, Roller Coaster and the Mummy. Shouting, screaming and crying of any kind is not prohibited. Suitable for those who have just broken up. There is also a Jurassic park. It's best to bring your own disposable raincoat. If you buy it here the price is 6 dollars. Lockers here are paid. Don't forget to bring an umbrella and hat. To get to Sentosa Island, you can take the tram (30 Sing Dollars) from Vivo station. You can also take the bus. If you can stand the heat, you can walk. There are also quite a lot of food sellers. The types of food sold are also varied with varying prices. If you want to buy souvenirs, there are lots of shops too. The price is 11-12 with prices in Indonesian tourist attractions. Don't forget to bring your own drinking water (because it's hot and very humid).

name: user_629
review: Great experience for the whole family! It was a lot of fun

name: user_631
review: Went there on weekday. 3 rides were stopped due to technical issues, waited for each for about 20 minutes before they said not working. Food and beverages are expensive, soft cone 8, beer is for 13. No water fountains in this blistering heat so you end up buying 500ml of water for 5. Wait times do come down around 4 pm. Don't recommend. Better to see the zoo and do the night safari. Don't do the aquarium.

name: user_632
review: Poor amusement park... outdated attractions. The only cool attraction is Egypt. But very short journeys. More for children than adults. After 3 hours we were bored. The park is mainly focused on selling gadgets. Poor restaurants...

name: user_633
review: The rides are lesser and the fireworks are so disappointed I have all rides within half day. And the staff are not friendly and show back faces to us. Food are much much expensive than Universal Studios Beijing.

name: user_634
review: What Really Sucks here is the High Price of the tickets and the waitin time ... Operatin Hours should be extended too Express ticket charges is more than the Price of the ticket we purchase ...

name: user_635
review: Not as big as expected, like Disneyland, with limited rides. Definitely try the Jurassic Park ride and Human vs. Cyclones ride. The shows were not good, even for children.

name: user_643
review: Brought my 5 year daughter. Did a few kiddy rides as the other rides were not suitable for her, and she was not keen. Generally, had fun but was expensive.

name: user_645
review: Excellent, high-class service, and somewhat high prices

name: user_647
review: I have a good time in Universal Studio. A lot of walking and time waiting for a ride average around 45 minutes. Bring water bottles and fan because its super hot.

name: user_648
review: The place is normal and boring if you come to watch because there is nothing to do, either shop or eat and drink at exaggerated prices, but if you want to play games intended for adults, it will be fun, but you will have to wait 60-70 minutes before each game.

name: user_649
review: Universal Studios Singapore is nice. There are rides that are like epic adventures in movies such as Puss In Boots, Sesame Street and Transformers. Ancient Egypt looks like desert and there are mummies. Its very crowded on holidays. I recommend you buying tickets in advance so you do not have to wait a long time to enter. The atmosphere is hot at 10am-2pm. Most of all, I had a nice experience and might come back one day!

name: user_651
review: Good but prefer to go in the noon for all the rides n shows to avoid long wait by time if u have normal admission ticket so afternoon 2pm onwards waiting time is just 15mins to 5mins or no wait this is 100% confirmed as per my visit most of them I did after lunch with less than 10mins wait time Carry one water bottle empty or full is ok as u will get water refil taps every where including the Ques during the waiting Washrooms or rest rooms also very neat n clean n kept dry always n have many rooms inside n no need to worry about queing Few rides are good for any age n few should think before like ancient Egypt n transformers are very good but need to be prepared for quick motions n if u by chance has taken the rides just ensure to close the eyes but dont worry they all are very very secured n dont get jaw drop Simulation for Shrek is good but be prepared for suddenly movements n neck Posting few photos n videos for ur glance as every year there will be change Ticket related express is expensive unless its affordable for u n have less time else have good breakfast n go around 1pm as last show for rides is 6pm ... u can handle all the rides in that 3-4 hours But sort out first based on few show timings Transformers got in the last around 5pm wait time is zero as there are few steps to climb n huge big lane which get reduced to 1mins

name: user_652
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an amazing experience! The park is well-themed, with incredibly detailed environments that transport you to different worlds. The rides are thrilling, and there's something for everyone, from adrenaline-pumping roller coasters to family-friendly attractions. The shows are entertaining, and the staff is friendly and efficient. The food options are diverse, though a bit pricey. Overall, it's a must-visit destination for anyone visiting Singapore!

name: user_653
review: If you want to ride a single piece of equipment, there is no separate ticket. You buy a ticket for entry. We just wanted to ride the Roller Coaster, but this was not possible. You need to go there in good time for it to be worth the price you pay.

name: user_655
review: Very good park and attractions. The attraction staff were a little unmotivated and were not very efficient with distributing people correctly. There were empty seats on attractions where there were 60 minute delays. In any case, going early and with good organization you do not need a fast pass. I want to highlight the good attitude of an older man who works in the transformers game... the only one who smiled and shared good energy with people.

name: user_657
review: Super fun! Was raining like crazy. Wish USS were more flex with the dates of entry

name: user_658
review: We visited on 30 th March 2025. The weather warnings played spoil sport most rides were not functional for half day. The rides especially cylon and human and mummy are good to look forward to. The human and mummy had 30 minutes plus wait time on Sunday. Transformers ride is a good experience and we enjoyed the shrek 4d movie.

name: user_660
review: Visited on a Thursday, maximum 20 minutes wait at attractions, smooth traffic. Very beautiful park, ticket taken the old one on Pelago at an advantageous price. In my opinion, this park is really worth it during a stay in Singapore (even for a 3/4 day stay like I did).

name: user_661
review: Universal Studios Singapore: Fun for Kids, But Expect Some Hiccups Universal Studios Singapore definitely offers a vibrant and exciting day out, particularly if you have kids in tow. The park is beautifully themed, and seeing characters like the Minions and Optimus Prime in real life brings a genuine sense of wonder to young faces. My children were absolutely thrilled by the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and the Puss in Boots' Giant Journey suspended coaster when they were actually running. Unfortunately, our visit was significantly impacted by ride closures. The tropical climate of Singapore meant that several outdoor rides were temporarily shut down due to rain, which is understandable. However, we were also disappointed to find a noticeable number of attractions undergoing maintenance, further limiting our options. This was a real shame, especially for my kids who had been eagerly anticipating certain experiences. Despite the reduced ride availability, there was still enough to keep us occupied for a good portion of the day. The shows were entertaining, and the various themed zones offered plenty of photo opportunities and character meet-and-greets. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, even with the potential for getting soaked, was a definite highlight for the whole family. Food and beverage options within the park are plentiful, albeit on the pricier side, which is to be expected in a theme park. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, doing their best to manage the crowds and provide information about ride statuses. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a good experience, especially if your primary focus is entertaining younger children. The park has a unique charm and some genuinely fun attractions. However, the high likelihood of rain-related closures and the potential for maintenance disruptions mean it's not a guaranteed seamless experience. Would I say it's a must-visit in Singapore? Probably not. While we had a good time, the ride closures dampened the overall value proposition. If you have limited time in Singapore and prioritize must-see attractions, there might be other experiences that offer a more reliable and complete experience. However, if you have a few days, are traveling with kids who are big fans of the Universal franchises, and are prepared to be flexible with your itinerary due to potential ride disruptions, then Universal Studios Singapore can be a worthwhile one-time visit. Just be sure to check the park's website for any scheduled maintenance beforehand and be prepared to embrace the possibility of rain delays.

name: user_662
review: Went six times, every time was good, but the queue was very long. I recommend that if you play many times, buy an Express ticket.

name: user_663
review: Not up to expectation. But not too bad either. And you will only think of coming back here after a very long time.

name: user_664
review: Long lines, so its better to get an express pass. Some areas were closed possibly for maintenance rotation but that just puts more pressure on the remaining attractions. There are attractions for adults only, but none specifically for kids. So, strangely enough, I wouldnt really recommend going with children. Youll end up waiting almost everywhere, which is really tough for kids. There are no charging stations, so make sure to charge your phones and bring a power bank. Otherwise, you might end up in a situation like we did: our express passes disappeared, and we couldnt order a taxi, so we had to walk back to the hotel about 5 km because we didnt have any cash on us. Out of all the attractions, we only really enjoyed a few the Shrek show, Transformers, and The Mummy.

name: user_665
review: Love the rides recommend the mummy and jurassic park ride but if u want both puss and boots best . Sadly no pics

name: user_666
review: Nice park with quite some rides and activities. Every once in a while there are also performances, music, dancing and the minions walking around. Huge gift shops but few and a Bit pricey places to eat. The minions orange sorbet - vanilla ice cream is awesome!! Try it!! Overall, recommended.

name: user_667
review: Super fun and little waiting time on weekday! Newly opened minion themed was super fun, and the meet and greet mascot was friendly, interactive and overall good vibes all day!

name: user_670
review: Amazing experience here be sure to plan your rides ahead. Use the universal studios app to check for current waiting times for the rides and plan accordingly. If you are planning to go with a kid make sure the kid is at least the height of 92 cm.

name: user_671
review: Awesome place for kids. Never imagined Whole day experience.

name: user_672
review: Quite nice for children. But the size leaves something to be desired. The attractions are quite short and unspectacular. 2-3 attractions visited were quite good. But for the money, you expect a lot more entertainment and fun! I hope to visit the studios in the USA.

name: user_673
review: Nice & Incredible Mummy

name: user_675
review: Went on a Thursday, was medium crowded. 83 for a normal ticket . Waited upto 30-40 minutes on some rides but some ride it was just 5 minutes. Sadly the waterworld is closed for maintenance, which they could've mentioned in their website. Beer is 13 inside, so plan your food & beverages budget accordingly. Was so hot climate, would suggest a cap and glass . Some rides you can keep the loose items in locker for 1 hour for free. Mummy and Cyclone rollercoaster was good. Jurassic park ride you may get slightly wet but not much. You don't have to carry extra cloth for that.

name: user_678
review: If you have an extra day in Singapore this is definitely worth checking out. It is not as big as Universal in the US or Japan but definitely still worth your time. Wait times were below 10 min on many of the rides as we went on a weekday.

name: user_679
review: This is one place which draws tourism into Singapore, Must visit especially if you have kids or if child in you still alive and active. Express pass doldrums - if money is not constrain, buy a express pass to cover more events andake most of the day. Note.. if you don't buy pass, then download studios app nd shortlist your favourites and stick to that plan

name: user_681
review: Few things if you are visiting for the first time like I did. Don't worry about buying tickets in advance. There are ticketing kiosks. Download the park map from the website for planning your schedule and priorities. Wait times can be long as most reviews would say. But be smart. Not all rides are worth the wait. The treasure hunt was the least worth it for us. Rides in SciFi, Sesame Street, Egypt, and Shrek 4D were our favourites. Watch out for character meet and greets. They just come and go for a very short duration, but could elevate your whole experience. We kept missing them most of the day until we caught Puss in the boots.

name: user_319
review: We were excited to visit Universal Studios Singapore last October, but it turned out to be a huge disappointment. The park was overcrowded, and the overall experience felt underwhelming. There was nothing particularly special about it, and it lacked the magic and excitement we expected from a major theme park. To make things worse, the park closes around 7 PM, with no night shows or special eventsjust a dull and abrupt ending to the day. The heat was also unbearable, reaching at least 40C, and there was no air conditioning in indoor areas. Instead of offering a break from the extreme temperatures, the enclosed spaces felt suffocating. Navigating through the packed crowds in these conditions made the visit exhausting rather than enjoyable. Compared to Disneylandwhich weve visited three times and loved every timeUSS doesnt even come close. The lack of proper facilities, entertainment, and overall mediocre experience make it completely overrated and not worth the visit.

name: user_683
review: Rides can be enjoyed with family of all ages.Dinosaur rides and 4d sci fi rides are must.

name: user_684
review: Great place for fun and amusement. Would recommend transformers attraction, shrek attraction. They were fun and no stress.

name: user_688
review: Universal studios living to the expectations. Great attractions and food. Drinking water available at every few meters. Must try transformers 3D battle.

name: user_689
review: It was small in size, but it was perfect for me who has a little trouble with my legs. Most of the rides were more fun than I expected, and the wait wasn't as long as I thought. It was nice that I could check the location and wait time on the app. You can also apply for free Wi-Fi on the app. There are a few rides where you have to leave your bags, but most of the lockers there are paid. If you look a little closer, there are many lockers that are free for 45 minutes, so take a good look.

name: user_690
review: Universal Studios was fantastic. Very nice park with many fun attractions, also for adults. Relatively short waiting times and nicely built. Tip: Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure is a very nice attraction, but you get soaking wet. We were soaked, even our socks were wet. So save this attraction for the end of the day.

name: user_691
review: Amazing place for everyone to visit. It's a lot less busy during non holiday periods and during the week. Rides are awesome! Plenty of shopping available, and food and assumement all around for all ages.

name: user_692
review: Amazing experience & very beautiful place to be. Many family friendly rides.

name: user_693
review: Some of the rides were fantabulous especially Transformers, meet and greet sessions were real life experiences where small kids enjoyed it along with the adults. Every corner is filled with enormous joy and overwhelming experience which can be easily covered within a days time. You need to really eat well or might carry food before entering into the different zones of Universal Studio as food cost is on a higher end. Souvenirs, toys and other essentials are also expensive. Reaching Universal studio using Sentosa express is easier than a cable car, however if you would like to experience the cable car it is up to your budget.

name: user_694
review: I loved this day at Universal Studios. We went there on Saturday and despite everything, there were very few lines and the park seemed rather empty so we enjoyed it even more! I recommend the visit!

name: user_696
review: Good fun, smaller theme park but lots going on. It's suitable for small kids, lots on offer for them. I went on a week day and there were no lines. Very clean and the food was good value and tasty.

name: user_697
review: Very nice attractions! Really thought about it very carefully. Personally, I didn't think it was much of an attraction because you were done within a few hours. Don't take a Fast Pass during the week, but do take it on the weekend. A really well-organized park and nicely put together!

name: user_703
review: What a lovely experience. This is anyone child's dream. Even for me as an adult this was exhilarating fun!

name: user_706
review: Certainly not a bad Universal park, but it's very small and on a quiet day (like when we visited) you can do almost everything in 2 or 3 hours. I guess that's not bad as it allows you to get back to your time in Singapore, but it's a quick visit.

name: user_709
review: Universal Studios Singapore truly lives up to its reputation as an exceptional theme park. From heart-pounding rides to captivating shows, it offers an unforgettable experience for all ages. Rides: The rides are simply awesome! I was particularly blown away by the Transformer ride a truly immersive and thrilling experience. The Minion and Shrek rides were also fantastic, providing a perfect blend of fun and entertainment. It's important to note that most rides require a minimum height of 102cm, so keep that in mind if you're traveling with young children. Shows: The shows are a major highlight! The outdoor dances, meet-and-greets, and other performances are incredibly engaging and well-executed. The Dinosaurs show is so realistic, it felt like we were witnessing actual prehistoric creatures! For children under 102cm, there are still plenty of opportunities to enjoy the shows from comfortable, stationary seating. Kid-Friendly Fun: My child absolutely adored the Minions and the meet-and-greet sessions. While the rides have height restrictions, the park offers a variety of shows and attractions suitable for younger children. Management and Amenities: The management of Universal Studios Singapore is truly commendable. Parking is well-organized, food options are diverse and delicious, and the park is impeccably clean. The overall organization and attention to detail are top-notch, making the entire experience seamless and enjoyable. The charges are fair for the level of entertainment provided. Overall: Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination. The combination of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and excellent management makes it an unforgettable experience for everyone. I highly recommend it to families, couples, and anyone looking for a day of pure fun and excitement.

name: user_713
review: a lot of fun and the roller coster is not a joke better came prepare

name: user_715
review: Its a good place to visit but not as good as Disney world . Lesser attractions but a good visit in Singapore .

name: user_716
review: Great place not to miss the chance to visit once in lifetime. Kids enjoyed as much as we did. Rides for teen age kids and minion show for little ones were awesome stuffs.

name: user_717
review: Check the weather before going. Thunder and lightening are common during monsoons and all outdoor rides simply stop abruptly. If one does not wish to spend a bomb on the express tickets, best is to wait till the evening - when the wait times are less for regular queues. Food is not good in the courts and also very expensive, best to make other arrangements. Visit on a weekday. It's quite easy to get to Centosa by public transport so do not bother with touristic coaches!

name: user_719
review: The areas are not well maintained and shows aging

name: user_720
review: A cool place to get a lot of good emotions, I especially liked the compartment Jurassic park!

name: user_722
review: 4 stars because it's OK, but there's no other better alternatives right... Since this is Singapore, small island with limited attractions...

name: user_723
review: I came to Universal Studios Singapore today. The time was a bit wrong and it was raining. However, I already bought the tickets and decided to play during the holiday. I wanted to experience the process of playing on a rainy day, haha The rain was getting heavier and heavier. Wearing a raincoat and holding an umbrella were both dry. As a result, we didnt get to play many games You can only play indoor games. There may be no people on rainy days, so you only need to queue for about 5 minutes. Its raining so hard that you can ride a roller coaster even in the rain. Its amazing The environment is great and its a great experience. It would be better if it didnt rain. You can take a lot of photos to remember. The food in Universal Studios is also delicious. There are fast food restaurants and kopitiam as well as several restaurants with different flavors. There are also spaghetti space chase themed ice cream and cookies Its really delicious There is also a sweeping painter with a broom painting near the spaghetti space chase theme park, which is very special The prices in entertainment venues are not expensive either. Today I played Transformers, Egyptian Pyramids and Banana Man The Egyptian pyramids are a bit exciting Universal Studios is not a big place, so I spent an entire afternoon walking around, having fun, and eating. I will invite friends to play together next time

name: user_725
review: It was fun but I wouldn't go back again, it is very small. Luckily there's not that many ppl, we got to ride some big rides a few times and that's a pro of it.

name: user_726
review: Universal Studios Singapore is not a big place. We finished our breakfast lazily in the morning and entered the park at 11 o'clock. By 2 o'clock, we had already played everything we wanted to do. We definitely have time to play it again. Bags will not be checked at the entrance of the park, so you can bring drinks and food into the park to save time eating at the restaurant. If you have time, you can look at the program schedule and find the performance you want to see. This time, I happened to encounter the parade of the mini corps after playing the mobile game. I can dance with them and take pictures. It is also very surprising and fun. The only pity is that the show at Future Water World is closed that day, and one of the roller coasters is also undergoing repairs, so it cannot be played.

name: user_727
review: Neither big nor small Even if it rains, we take a rest at the restaurant and then stand in line again. I don't think there's any need for express.

name: user_728
review: I had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore! The rides and attractions were fun, and the park had a great atmosphere. The only downside was that some rides and WaterWorld were closed during my visit, which was a bit disappointing. Still, I enjoyed the experience and will definitely come back!

name: user_729
review: The whole world at one place...!

name: user_730
