review: I visited here on March 21, 2025. The games here are very fun to play, my favorite is the Cyclon game :))) The queue is long but compared to Disneyland in Japan, it is much less. Moreover, the queuing here is indoors and has air conditioning, so it's less boring. The Minion area is very cute but the games are not very special. The games in the Transformer area are also quite impressive

name: user_733
review: A magical experience at Universal Studios Singapore! We had an unforgettable day, especially with our 4-year-old son. From the moment we entered, we were immersed in the world of beloved movies and characters. The park is incredibly well maintained, and the staff were friendly and welcoming, making our experience smooth and enjoyable. The rides were suitable for all ages, and my son had an absolute blast. He loved the Sesame Street characters, especially meeting Elmo and Big Bird, which was a dream come true for him. We also enjoyed the interactive play areas that were perfect for his age. The Jurassic Park area was another highlight, with exciting attractions that were thrilling for both adults and children. Although some of the larger rides might have been a bit too intense for younger kids, there were plenty of milder attractions like the Madagascar ride, which was a great fit for our little one. What really stood out was how family-friendly the park is. There are many child-friendly facilities, including spacious baby changing rooms and stroller rentals, which made it so convenient for us as parents. The food options were diverse, catering to all tastes and dietary preferences. The highlight of the day was the parades and shows, which kept my son entertained with vibrant costumes, music, and performances. Even if youre not a huge theme park fan, Universal Studios Singapore offers a full day of fun for the whole family.

name: user_734
review: We were there at the end of February 2025! Both children and adults liked it! Interesting rides and shows! Worth a visit once! There are various promotions on the site (if you pay with a Mastercard, you get a surprise from the Minions as a gift, discounts on games). There is a large food court where you can eat and take a break from the heat. There are lockers everywhere to store your belongings if you want to take a ride. Children under 4 years old are free. Tickets were bought at the entrance, although you can do it on the website in advance, the prices are the same. On a weekday there was a small queue at the entrance before opening, but everyone came in right away when it opened, and there was almost no wait.

name: user_736
review: It was such a great experience We enjoyed our trip to USS. We just didn't got the chance to watch waterworld show since maitenance was in progress.

name: user_739
review: Raids were super.

name: user_741
review: Wow!!! Incredible, huge and fun, for kids and adults alike. Our favourite was the transformer ride and our kid loved Minion land, but truth be told, everything was amazing. And not the just the shows and rides, the staff, the clean washrooms, drinking water taps everywhere. Only downside is waiting period, which is ofcourse expected too, so my recommendation would be to go on a weekday which is not a local holiday. Rest assured, every ride is worth the wait. Enjoy!!

name: user_744
review: Very very cool theme park from Universal. We were lucky and there was nothing going on

name: user_745
review: Very good themepark. Enjoyed the Human and Cylon. Went on it so many times. Cylon queue was short as not a lot of people were daring enough to try it. It was so fun being upside doen. I enjoed my day of here.Best themepark I have ever went to. Also the mummy ride is also very thrilling. Had so much fun here with friends. Come to USS today

name: user_746
review: Smaller than other universal studios, only 1 rollercoaster for adults. Fun and was working on a rainy day.

name: user_747
review: Do try The mummy ride. Pack light and keep water bottle. The minion land was just amazing.

name: user_749
review: It was worth visiting had wonderful time.

name: user_750
review: TRIED THE EXPRESS PASS! THE BEST!

name: user_751
review: Clean park, attentive staff, attractions and shows on time, a real joy!

name: user_752
review: It was amazing but the common drawback was lines which were very long and the food is very expensive overall a great and memorable experience

name: user_755
review: I visited Universal Studios Singapore today and had a disappointing experience. Upon arrival, several rides were experiencing technical issues. I waited 30 minutes for the Minions ride only to be told it was down. I then lined up for the Sesame Street ride for 15 minutes, and it was also under technical problems. The waiting times for some rides were incredibly long, yet the actual ride durations were less than a minute. Most of the attractions felt boring and didnt live up to the excitement I expected, especially when compared to Universal Studios in LA. While I understand the park is smaller, Ive had much more enjoyable experiences at smaller parks like Hong Kong Disneyland, where the rides are far more entertaining. Overall, I left feeling disappointed and unlikely to return.

name: user_758
review: Overpriced. Long Wait times (45 - 60 Mins) as inadequate staff on rides, one staff is handling queue, exit, entrance, operation hence turnaround time is low. Very Limited options for Vegetarian or Indian Food.

name: user_759
review: best themepark in asia, clean restroom and many facilities

name: user_760
review: Universal Studios Singapore was absolutely amazing! We had so much fun exploring the park and enjoying the attractions. The afternoon was surprisingly quiet, which meant we could go on so many rides without long waits. It made the experience even more enjoyable!

name: user_761
review: We visited Universal Studios on March 14, 2025, with our eight-year-old daughter, hoping to recreate the wonderful experience we had in 2014. Unfortunately, a disappointing incident at the Puss in Boots show at 4:25 PM ruined our day. After watching the show, my daughter, who loves Puss in Boots, was excited to take a photo with the characters. She patiently stood in line, but when it was nearly her turn, a couple skipped ahead of her. As she approached the stage, a staff member unfairly stopped her, claiming she wasnt in the queue, despite her waiting the whole time. He didnt let us explain, acted rudely, and even prevented her from rejoining the queue, saying the photo session was over. This upset my daughter deeply, and it hurt us to see her first Universal Studios experience end with such a bad memory. We feel very disappointed by this rude behavior and hope appropriate action is taken to prevent such incidents in the future. Sharing the photo herewith a shot captured in my phone while we are waiting in the queue

name: user_763
review: It's definitely fun, kids and adults will enjoy this place. They have different activities for everyone here. And you could book your tickets in advance but they also have kiosk machines outside, if you want an spontaneous activity. But be careful about the heat, stay hydrated and packed a change of clothes.

name: user_766
review: So much fun! We visited on a week day as we've been told it can get a little hectic on weekends. Wait times were next to nothing and very straightforward with getting on and off rides. Very friendly staff everywhere we went in the park. We had such a blast. All sorts of entertainment for all ages. Highly recommend!

name: user_768
review: A must visit place in singapore. If you want to complete the park rides you should go half a hour before the park opens . The rides are good and must try in are transformer rides mummy and new York city rides

name: user_769
review: transformers:the ride was fun the mummy ride also, they made a new minions land which is nice. there is also sci-fi and Madagascar rides. Very awesome

name: user_771
review: It takes about 20 minutes by taxi from Orchard. (It was about 1,800 to 2,000 yen.) There was an entrance right after going up the escalator, and it took about 30 minutes to get inside. There are many tourists even on weekdays. It was open from 10am that day, but the hours change depending on the day, so it's best to check before going.

name: user_773
review: Best and best place to visit with kids , friends and family highly recommended

name: user_774
review: Pretty small, not that many cool rides. The quality of decorations wasnt very good either. After visiting Universal Studio in Osaka this one was disappointing. I wanted to see the Far Far away the most, but one of the main rides was under construction. I came around 9.45, got in around 10. There were not many people inside. I guess because it was Wednesday morning and rainy. Even though it was raining, all the rides were working fine. And thankfully there were no lines. So I was done with everything by 2pm. What I didnt like is that several rides required you to leave your belongings in a locker but some of them werent free. So I just went to the locker room of another ride and left my stuff there for free for 45mins. They also made you take off the rain coat for the ride, so needles to say everyone was soaking wet.

name: user_775
review: Childhood dream comes true here.. its totally worth it. Revenge of mummy, Human , Cyclop and Transformers rides are worth it .

name: user_778
review: Its a very compact Universal Studios - small but well-designed, and you can easily cover everything in less than a day. However, unlike the ones in Orlando or Beijing, I cant give the Singapore Universal Studios a positive review. The sheer number of Indian visitors is astonishing, and unfortunately, their behavior is often appalling. Queue - jumping is rampant - parents send their kids ahead in line and then keep pushing forward themselves. Or worse, while youre waiting, someone behind you keeps pressing their belly against your back or your bag with every step you take. Its incredibly frustrating. Typically, they move in large family groups - five, seven, or even a dozen people together - and the smell can be overwhelming.

name: user_779
review: The best amusement park in Asia. You will definitely not remain indifferent. Both children and adults will like it. I went on all the rides. I saw all the actors' performances. I bought souvenirs and had a wonderful day. It's better to go early, as it takes a whole day to see absolutely everything. Very cool park! Unfortunately, it was impossible to film the attractions. But here are some of the memorable ones: Transformers, Jurassic Park, The Mummy's House and Minions

name: user_781
review: I'm in Universal Park right now and I'm pretty disillusioned and disappointed. First of all, I'm used to German theme parks. The roller coasters are poorly organized, the route is ridiculous and, with the exception of one, simply not worth the time. Maybe I'm just not the target group. The entire park organization is also deficient in many areas. On a rainy day, the air conditioning runs so cold that it becomes uncomfortable to go indoors in wet clothes. The milkshakes are so cold that you're more likely to chew ice crystals. In terms of price/performance: The food is simply not worth the money. Especially for Singapore conditions. This was the worst meal of my entire trip so far. So, onto the good things: The decoration is really well done. The facades in the streets are lovingly and detailed. The best ride in my opinion was Revenge of the Mummy. Good storytelling. I can completely advise against Puss in Boots. This is an absolute stop and go ride with no flow. The park has real potential that it is wasting in so many places, so it's a real shame. I'm leaving again after about 3 hours. I was really looking, I was really looking forward to the park but all in all it's more of a 3 classic park with a name

name: user_782
review: The waiting time for entertainment items is generally very long, and some are exposed to the sun, which makes people uncomfortable. If you don't buy VIP tickets, the entertainment experience is not proportional to the waiting time. All in all, it was a relatively satisfactory experience.

name: user_783
review: Nice place to explore. Takes one whole day to soak up all the fun in different rides and areas. Roller costers - Cyclone, Human; 4D adventures - Tranformers, Minions; Jurassic park ride are good and worth prioritizing. Cyclone and Human are difficult ones, while others like canopy, puss in boots are easier and fun. Wait times are displayed and visible in map using their app, which is extremely useful. We didn't use the paid express option since we went on weekday and were ok for wait times, which can go upto 30min sometimes. Lockers provided at designated places is useful, some are paid ones. Hydrate well since it's going to be lot of sun exposure!

name: user_784
review: Wonderful place and my family enjoys every activity there.

name: user_785
review: I recommend buying tickets from kkday or klook! (The price is the same as Universal Studios Japan) The area is small so you can get around quickly, but there aren't that many people and there isn't much waiting time for the attractions, so it's very satisfying! I recommend the Egypt area and roller coasters like CYLON!

name: user_787
review: An Unforgettable Experience at Universal Studios Singapore! My visit to Universal Studios Singapore was absolutely amazing! From thrilling rides to spectacular shows, every moment was filled with excitement and fun. The park is well-organized, clean, and offers a great mix of attractions for all ages. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable experience. The attention to detail in the themed zones made me feel like I had stepped into another world! The Transformers and Battlestar Galactica rides were definite highlights, and the live performances added an extra touch of magic to the day. A big thank you to the team at USS for creating such a fantastic and memorable experience. I cant wait to visit again!

name: user_788
review: Thanks to the open run on a weekday, I was able to ride 4 attractions in 1 hour (personally, I don't recommend mummy because he is too dizzy;;) It was a very happy day, meeting Minions and taking pictures with characters from the movie!!!

name: user_789
review: Visited the USS during school holiday. The crowd wasn't too bad but the waiting time for most of the rides were more than 30 minutes. If you are bringing toddlers, entering the park without express pass is not going to worth your time as you will spend 30-45 mins for literally 10 mins ride.

name: user_790
review: One of the best places I have ever visited. But you need to be very brave to enjoy all the rides.

name: user_791
review: If you like waiting and queueing up then this is the place for you. Arrived when gates open at 10 so 30 minutes to get in. Walk to first ride 30 minutes wait. Second, third and fourth rides 40 to 50 minutes each. Last ride over and hour. Yes you can pay extra to get in early and yes you can pay extra for an express pass. Or you can save your money for a trip to universal America. You will still wait for rides but as there are more rides you can pick and choose with more options. Oh and Waterworld section was closed.

name: user_792
review: Had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore, but if youre visiting on a weekend, I highly recommend getting the Express Pass to skip long queues. We went on a Friday, and while some rides had 30-minute or less waits, others exceeded 40 minutes, which made us skip a few.

name: user_794
review: New attraction is more minion , you can see many people holding the toy that make them happy . In Singapore weather, it will be nice if they open at night, it is like the F1 Singaporean version . In fact, since majority of the popular attraction is indoors, it is easy to accommodate for the night version, and with the lighting, this can be the first night amusement park in the world # do not buy tickets from Klook, please go google reviews, you will find out how horrible the experience you will get if you need help

name: user_795
review: It wasn't what I expected. But it was good enough to fill the day program. Some attractions were closed. Coffee was missing.

name: user_796
review: One of the well known travel destinations in Singapore that is located on Sentosa Island. It is popular for people of all ages. Need to buy a ticket to explore the inside here. Advance tickets are available online also as far i know. At least 3/4 hours is required to complete the full area. The place is included with a lot of adventure activities. Some activities carry the history of many places around the world and some activities are related to science fiction. All of these are made by artificial things, not from natural things. Inside here many food, coffee and ice cream shops are also presented. The prices are also similar to the outside.

name: user_797
review: General maintenance on rides lacking, they can't be bothered to fix minor faults, Examples.. smoke machines, lights, wind machines, under chair SFX, heat machines, water canons, moving SFX. I wonder what the maintenance is like for Health and Safety if they can't fix the smaller faults. dirty 3D glasses Edit: after writing this review the roller coaster kept breaking down.

name: user_804
review: Well time spent whole day

name: user_809
review: Need a a strong heart and neck considering the movement from the rides. The food is horrible

name: user_810
review: I went solo so didn't have to do a lot of lines which was great. I don't give 5 stars because I felt there were just a few rides and the Minion ride that I wanted to do I couldn't because it wasn't working (2 days after opening).

name: user_811
review: Lovely way to spend the day, waiting times not long(attend mid march) food good quality

name: user_813
review: It is an old park that has been in operation for many years, or Universal itself is not as fun as Disney. But Singapore Global is exceptionally boring. Two major projects are out of service for maintenance.

name: user_814
review: We bought a ticket in advance, made a fast truck; Well done guys - everything is so cozy and like a fairy tale

name: user_818
review: The park is filled with awesome rides so dont forget to visit Universal Studios in Singapore. I just want to say if you can afford please purchase express pass so that all the rides can be covered in time.

name: user_819
review: We visited on weekdays in March so there is not a lot of people. On average, each game queue up time is only 10min to 15min max in the morning (around 10 clock.) We have purchased the Express pass, by around 1pm we have finished all games we want to try. So I think an Express pass is not a absolute must like what happened in USJ. The scariest ride is definitely Revenge of the Mummy. Discouraged anyone who can't handle a roller coaster ride to try. It happened in darkness, there is scary element, and the falls is rapid and happened in a row. So yeah, it is exciting and scary.

name: user_821
review: Must visit with Family once in your lifetime..Kids will love..Minion Island and Underwater aquarium are must visit

name: user_822
review: For the Minion Project Not only is Minion boring and the experience is very poor, it has been renovated for so long and it is not worth playing. The sense of immersion is very poor, and the space is shaking and makes me want to vomit. I come here almost twice a year. This time I was specifically asked about Minion. I was disappointed no matter how much I expected. I was sick even if I didn't, and I couldn't continue playing the subsequent projects... I was so dizzy that I felt like vomiting.

name: user_825
review: Worth the price and experience to visit.

name: user_827
review: Always an awesome time! Rides are great for kids and adults alike. Staff are amazing at the meet and greets and really made my son feel special on his birthday. Bumblebee even said hello and sang him a happy birthday. The new minion land is quite amazing to see and they have done such a great job of reproducing the minions theme and Gru's house. Unfortunately the rides are a little childish and quite slow moving to get on and off so lines move slow. Recommend seeing the new area but rest of the park is still more fun.

name: user_828
review: Better than expected, the only drawback was the availability of vegetarian food.

name: user_833
review: The park is not big. There is no need to buy express passes. The newly opened minion is very cute. The waiting time in line is about 10-15 minutes. There is also a restaurant where you can rest. In the afternoon, there happened to be a heavy thunderstorm. Outdoor activities were temporarily closed for fear of danger. After the thunderstorm will recover, you can play some indoor games. Transformers is very exciting and fun. The queue time is a little longer. There are drinking fountains in the park to fill water. It is recommended to bring a bottle for convenience.

name: user_834
review: There is no prayer place

name: user_835
review: Universal Studio Singapore has amazing theme rides and fund activities.It is smaller than I expected but we had a great time here.It is better to visit here during weekdays around 10 am because it is getting crowded later on.The rides are safe and highly recommended for family and couple bonding.There are lots of drinkable water fountains in most entrances of every ride.They also offer 45 minutes to 90 minutes free storage depending on the rides, like Human, Cyclone, the Mummy Returns. I highly recommend the Mummy Returns and the Transformers ride.

name: user_837
review: My school bring us there for our learning journey

name: user_838
review: The line is getting less on rainy day( even on Sunday)

name: user_841
review: do it on weekdays less line and dont bring much cause u end up renting lockers small locker is 20sgd and 30 sgd for big one where u can put backpacks most of the rides are mostly needs lockers its free for small items only

name: user_842
review: We came all way here from New York to Singapore. Universal is known for its great rollercoasters and amazing entertainment. Unfortunately, Universal Singapore doesn't have enough rides or even shows to be entertained. There were a few rides out of comision which didn't help the lack of rides. That said, we did enjoy ourselves, but we wanted for more. We paid for express plus tickets at entry. Do not waste your time or money. We did not feel that it was worth it. The park was too short, and lines were short, and we found that we didn't really save time by getting in the express line.

name: user_844
review: Review for Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking for thrill, adventure, and entertainment all in one place. Located on Sentosa Island, the park offers a fantastic mix of rides, shows, and themed attractions inspired by popular movies. The Battlestar Galactica roller coasters are a must for thrill-seekers, while Transformers: The Ride provides an immersive 4D experience. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure and transformers are also crowd favorites. For families and kids, Far Far Away interactive experiences. The park is well-organized, clean, and easy to navigate, with plenty of dining options and souvenir shops. Lines for popular rides can be long, so getting an Express Pass is recommended for a smoother experience. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for all ages, packed with excitement, adventure, and unforgettable memories!

name: user_845
review: Coming to Singapore for the second time But this time I really got to travel, came here, and really came to play. It was a lot of fun. It's not very big, but it was really fun. It took me half a day to play all over the place. But if you take it slowly, without hurrying, taking photos, playing and chilling, you might end the day without even realizing it. I really like it. The day I went was a weekday and it was raining lightly, but there were some stops. Some sunshine is considered very lucky. That's not hot at all. If it rains, choose to play in the shade. Or sit and watch a show When the sun came out, I took pictures of the beautiful light. Playing on outdoor playground equipment, very fun, very chill. You can bring food in. Because I was able to bring in snacks such as croissants, juice, fruit, and candy without being inspected much. As for water, if it feels heavy, you don't have to put it in. Because everywhere you go to play There will be free tap water to drink. There are lockers where you can leave your things for free for 45 minutes (some lockers are not free. You have to choose carefully) because some rides don't allow you to bring things in with you. Even the coins

name: user_846
review: Irresistible for Transformers fans

name: user_847
review: The rides were all so fun and when I went there, there was very little waiting time. Perfect place for family and friends to bond together. Let me tell you if you haven't gone there yet it's the best place in the whole of Singapore. I would never get bored of it. Also the food there might be a little pricy but thats okay because it's also very nice and delicious especially (in my opinion) the ramen from the Starbot Cafe. If you're looking for fun in Singapore, I recommend this place. My experience here is unforgettable.

name: user_850
review: It was amazing experience. The transformers and ancient Egypt rides are incredible. It blew my mind. Well spent time and money! I was on sunday and queues were maximum 40 minutes. Most of the time less than 10 minutes. Maybe because it was raining.

name: user_853
review: Universal Studios Singapore was an absolute blast. I had a fantastic time thanks to my advance tickets, which allowed me to skip the lines and enjoy every ride without any wait. It was amazing to just walk straight onto the rides, especially since the park was quite busy. The rides were incredibly thrilling, and I especially loved the Battlestar Galactica: Human and Cylon roller coasters. The intense twists and turns, combined with the immersive theming, made for an adrenaline-pumping experience. The overall experience was fantastic, and I highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore to anyone looking for an exciting and unforgettable day out

name: user_854
review: Enjoyed universal studios Singapore. Even though we visited when minion land was closed we still enjoyed our time here. Definitely recommend purchasing lighting pass to skip the long queues. Not as big as LA universal, still decent size similar rides too. Staff were good, we went in rainy season it only drizzled but that did not bother us as its refreshing because its always hot in Singapore. Overall very satisfied thank you!

name: user_857
review: Universal Studios Singapore, the only Universal Studios in the world that does not sell annual passes

name: user_858
review: Had a great day Use vip to save a lot of time The park is not big and you dont need to walk too far When it rains, luckily there are restaurants where you can eat and take shelter from the rain. The overall feeling is great

name: user_859
review: Very good experience, came in the morning and there was no lines at all , at the middle of the day was a bit crowded but we waited 20 minutes not more.

name: user_860
review: Went on Friday lines were reasonable. 5 year old enjoyed it. We watched a lot of shows. Transformers was the best! The minion section just opened up in Feb 2025 worth checking out. A fun day!

name: user_862
review: I have seen a minion for the first time

name: user_863
review: Most of the tours are open on 2.27. Drinks are really expensive and water is too expensive. But it is small and beautiful. There are fewer people and it is more fun to play.

name: user_865
review: I visited Universal on Valentines Day, and let me tell you, this place is truly magical! The rides were thrilling and full of excitement. I highly recommend The Mummy rideit exceeded all my expectations. The Jurassic Park water ride is also a must-try! Make sure to download the Universal app before your visitit provides real-time updates on ride queues and serves as a helpful map throughout the park. A few tips: definitely bring sunblock, a hat or umbrella, and your own bottled water. There are refilling stations inside, so you dont need to buy overpriced water. Lastly, be sure to check the weather before your trip. Universal will halt outdoor operations at the slightest hint of rain for safety, so its best to be prepared.

name: user_868
review: Dont skip this fav places as your destination in SG. Clean enough but very hot laaa Better you come in the morning.

name: user_872
review: Best place for family and old kids

name: user_876
review: nice, excited for the wicked area

name: user_877
review: I heard it was more compact than USJ, but it was nice to be able to get around the park easily. I visited the new Minion Park two days after it opened, and I was able to enter the park smoothly even on a Sunday. I arrived around 12:00, but it was empty, which was great! Very different from Osaka! I think the lines for the rides were longer around 2:00 pm, but by 5:00 pm, it was about 5 minutes. If you wait at most 30 minutes, you'll probably be able to board. I was happy to be able to take many photos with Minions.

name: user_878
review: Best experience of our lives! Transformers ride is a mustttt, if possible, go more than once! The Mummy ride was amazing too! Go on weekdays for less crowd!

name: user_879
review: Extremely loud place! Very long waiting time at each attraction! I personally did not enjoy this noisy artificial park..but i was happy to see my grand son enjoying it a bit.

name: user_881
review: Beautiful theme park with alot to do, went with toddlers who enjoyed the park even in 32 degree heat. They have alot of fans in the ques and plenty of drink shops. Kids rides and shows for them to enjoy. Minions land is a must for any kid. Easier to purchase tickets at gate. Loads of terminals and no ques to purchase tickets. Same price as online

name: user_882
review: Dont buy tickets on KKDAY. Its terrible. Just buy it on the spot. Theres not much difference in price. Admission is guaranteed. I like the Mummy Tour. Its super exciting. I regret not doing it again. You can play it a few more times with the little soldiers. The new facility, Shrek 4D Theater, is also good. Its very cute. The Czech Pea one looks very fun. Its a pity that I didnt go there. There are water dispensers everywhere, you can bring a small water bottle or just drink it by mouth. Its very hot and you need to drink more water. But Universals toilet cleaning is not good. Sometimes the floor is wet and dirty.

name: user_883
review: Our VIP tour at Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience, and that was all thanks to our guide, Angela. She had such a warm and encouraging presence that made a huge difference for me. Im not usually one for thrill rides, but she helped me feel at ease so I could enjoy them alongside my husband. She was attentive, thoughtful, and always one step ahead in making sure everything went smoothly! Even keeping an eye on our things while we had fun. The level of care and service she provided was beyond what we ever expected. If youre considering the VIP tour, I highly recommend it, especially if you get Angela!

name: user_884
review: We went on a Tuesday, we were lucky that there weren't many people and we only queued for five minutes and the longest one was 20 minutes. The attractions are nice but they are small, like a 5 minute ride on the Human roller coaster.

name: user_885
review: It's very fun every time I come to play. This time there were very few people.

name: user_886
review: If you go on a weekday, you don't need fast track. I visited on February 27th. I think I got in around 9:50 after reserving tickets in advance for direct entry. After entering, go straight to the Transformer and board within 1-2 minutes. Afterwards, cyclon human Jurassic Park... . Since it's around 2pm, most people use it once more with almost no wait. Fun Transformers, Cyclones, etc. And before riding Jurassic Park, prepare a raincoat in case you get wet, but there is no need for that. Even if it's wet, it's only slightly wet, so just ride it. Maybe that's why you have to pay 4 per hour to use the locker here, but you can just bring it and use it. It's an expensive bag, so if you don't want it to get wet, you can put it in a supermarket plastic bag. For reference, it is very helpful to prepare a towel when leaving the hotel. And Jurassic Park isn't that great. Cyclon and Transformers are the most fun. I also recommend Shrek.

name: user_887
review: It was soooo fuuunnnn!!!! I reccommend you to bring your own tumblr and don't forget to buy an EXPRESS PASS, you will need this in a few rides esp HUMAN GALATICA and TRANSFORMER.

name: user_890
review: Was expecting more adrenaline. Short rides, expensive lockers which are must take if you want to go on attractions. Comparing price tickets with what you get we found it a bit overpriced and overrated

name: user_891
review: Very nice amusement park. Attractions for all audiences. The plus: we were able to take advantage of "baby swap" when the attractions were not suitable for toddlers. We even did some attractions with our one-year-old daughter.

name: user_893
review: The park seems big, with beautiful scenery. But there is a huge BUT. The queues are huge everywhere, and the rides themselves take 2 minutes. You stand in line for 40-60 minutes, 1.5-2 minutes of pleasure. Yes, and this pleasure is dubious. For adults, the attractions are very simple, but for families with children it will be torture - try standing for 40 minutes at each attraction with your child. It's complicated. We stood for 40 minutes on one attraction, and it closed right in front of us! For inexplicable reasons. The other attraction had almost the same thing, but they still opened it. Overall the impression is very bad, especially for the money. The food is tasteless, everything is not budget, the attractions are boring and not extreme (except for one). Terrible, don't recommend!

name: user_895
review: If you visit on a weekday, I don't think you need an express ticket. This is because the waiting time is not very long. Also, the number of attractions is not large, so if you go early in the morning, there will be less trouble around 2-3 PM.

name: user_896
review: always a good day with your kiddos here, especially on the weekdays.

name: user_897
review: Good Items Transformers 3d Mummies Camera action click Jurassic park

name: user_898
review: What to say, everything is perfect! But the roller coaster need to wait for 65 min even on weekdays, I would suggest to buy the express ticket or get Ready to wait for 1 hour.

name: user_901
review: This place was opened in January 2010 by Genting Group from Malaysia, it is the first Universal Studios amusement park to be opened in Southeast Asia, and the second in Asia after Universal Studios Japan. This amusement park themed on famous Hollywood films produced by Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. There are several rides that can be visited, including The Lost World, Far and Away, New York, Sci-Fi City, Hollywood Boulevard, Madagascar, Ancient Egypt. This ride is also equipped with 30 restaurants and food counters, as well as 20 souvenir kiosks. Several hotel facilities, including the Hard Rock Hotel, are available around this world-class tourist location. There are many photo spots that can be taken at this ride

name: user_905
review: The cast here are all kind and helpful. Many of the foods are cute, and the waiting times for all attractions are short. it was fun.

name: user_906
review: An amazing park for everyone to visit, from families to thrill seekers. Amazing rides and shows, great food as well. Many different cuisines to enjoy and many different areas throughout the park to explore. I definately reccomend to visit as it a very nice and clean park, definately one of the cleanest, nice looking and immersive parks, being a universal. I feel like universal studios Singapore gets looked over a bit compared to the ones in America but it is 100% worth visiting Singapore.

name: user_907
review: The park is very diverse and beautifully landscaped. The attractions of the park are for all ages. An essential and negative aspect is represented by the waiting time in queues. Regardless of the objective, wait in line for 40-60 minutes. In this case, there is not enough time to enjoy the park, not even from its opening to its closing.

name: user_908
review: blend of thrilling rides, immersive themed zones, and family-friendly fun.the park offers something for all ages. Vibrant shows, lively parades with dynamic atmosphere. While wait times can be long, the parks compact layout and Sentosa Island location make it a must-visit!

name: user_909
review: Good....queuing isn't too long on weekdays. Most like the Transformer ride.

name: user_911
review: Small but cute park! We didn't have to wait in line for any games so we went through it quickly

name: user_912
review: small compared to the other studios visited, but I must say that it is very tidy and perfectly clean..

name: user_913
review: Universal Studios was really happy and cool!! I love Minions, so I was impressed to see Minions Land Hehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehehe there's a meal discount for birthday people I didn't know You can buy tickets in advance and around 4-5 o'clock there are fun rides that only take about 10 minutes!!

name: user_915
review: If you're here by 10am, the wait isn't long for the rides. The queues build up around midday and the wait can take upto 60 minutes if the ride is popular. If you are happy to join the singles queue, you can get in quicker. A wonderful, fun way to spend the day and a must visit while in Singapore.

name: user_916
review: Date: 2025.2.28 Friday Country: Singapore Location: Universal Studios Singapore Note: You must first download the "Universal Studios Singapore" App to know the map of the park's amusement facilities, toilets... and the required waiting time for the facilities. Today we will enter the park at 10:00 and leave at 17:00. Lunch is served in the garden. Future Water World is under maintenance. We queued up for a lot of rides today: 1. Sesame Street Spaghetti Space City (very boring, had to wait in line for a long time) 2. Spinning Frisbee (similar to rotating coffee cup) 3. Transformers 3D Duel: The Ultimate Battle (long queue) Lunch at Star Chariot Cafe Minions Crazy Time Show 4. The Adventures of Puss in Shoes and Swordsman 5. Shrek 4-D Theater 6. Despicable Me Minions 7. Cute little bugs turning around (similar to a carousel) 8. Cute whirlpool 9. Film special effects set hosted by director Spielberg Meeting with stars at Universal Studios

name: user_917
review: Very fun. Some rides don't require long queues.

name: user_920
review: A Memorable Day at Universal Studios Singapore A Must-Visit for Families! As an Indonesian tourist visiting Singapore with my family, we were beyond excited for our Universal Studios Singapore adventure and let me tell you, it did not disappoint! From the moment we stepped into the park, the sheer excitement of the iconic movie sets and themed areas took our breath away. First up, we hopped into the world of Sesame Street with the Spaghetti Space Chase. My kids couldn't stop laughing as we joined Elmo and his friends on a fun and quirky space adventure. It was such a fantastic start to the day, setting the tone for all the thrilling rides ahead! Next, we zoomed into action with The Transformers Ride. WOW! The special effects and 3D action made us feel like we were right in the middle of a battle between Autobots and Decepticons. My heart was racing, and my kids were cheering every time Optimus Prime appeared on screen. A must-ride for any action movie fan! Then, we braved the darkness of Revenge of the Mummy, and let me tell you, this rollercoaster is not for the faint of heart! The combination of high-speed twists, turns, and eerie effects had us gripping the safety bars and screaming in excitement. Its a perfect mix of thrills and scares! We then took a more relaxed ride on Dino-Soarin', where my younger ones loved flying around in their very own pterodactyl while we marveled at the giant animatronic dinosaurs. It was a gentle and fun ride to catch our breath before diving into more action-packed experiences. For a moment of laughter, we jumped into the world of Shrek 4D Adventure. The movie was hilarious, and the 4D effects like water sprays and seat movements made us feel like we were part of the story. A great family-friendly experience! The Carousel was next, and we all enjoyed riding the beautifully crafted animals. It was a simple but nostalgic moment where even the adults had fun going around and around. The Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure was the highlight of the day. If you're looking for thrills and chills, this is the ride for you! The water splashes, the sudden drops, and the Jurassic creatures that pop up around every corner kept us on edge and soaked by the end of it! As fans of the adorable cat, we couldn't miss Puss in Boots' Giant Journey. It was a fun, whimsical ride, full of color, excitement, and of course, Puss in Boots' signature charm. Perfect for the whole family to enjoy together! Lastly, we ended the day in the vibrant and exciting Minion Land. My kids were ecstatic to meet their favorite Minions, and we all loved the fun, interactive rides. The bright colors, lively atmosphere, and Minion-themed attractions were simply a delight. Now, while we had an unforgettable time, there was one ride that didnt quite live up to the excitement of the others The Treasure Hunters. It was a slower-paced ride, and honestly, we found it a bit boring compared to the other more thrilling and immersive experiences. But with so many other fantastic attractions, this one small blip didnt take away from the overall fun! In the end, Universal Studios Singapore gave us a day full of thrills, laughter, and unforgettable moments. From heart-pounding rides to family-friendly fun, its an experience that will stay with us long after weve left. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking for a day of joy with your loved ones, this park is the perfect destination. We left with our hearts full of memories and a promise to return. Trust me, this is one adventure you dont want to miss!

name: user_921
review: I finally went with my husband, with the new minion ride.. it was fun but more for kids! Minion land

name: user_922
review: Been there for the 8th time, this time to check out Minions, but were a little disappointed because it was not a ride, and just 3D simlulator. Everything else are pretty much the same as last times, so no excitement

name: user_925
review: Very nice park with great rides. A little smaller than I expected and set around a lake. Really nice. There was hardly anything going on on the day I visited, so I got through very well. On a full day you definitely need the whole day. Operations are sometimes a bit poor. Very easy to reach by public transport. The Sentosa Express (Monorail) is free.

name: user_927
review: Wonderful place! A piece of Hollywood and Disneyland. We were with children and they really enjoyed it. You buy an entrance ticket and go to all the locations, taking part in the activities you like. The attractions were very cool, everyone was happy. In The Lost World you will actually be wet, both your clothes and your shoes. If a 6 raincoat is too expensive for someone, then take care of protecting your clothes in advance.))

name: user_930
review: When we read the reviews, we thought that the place was more for children, but we are glad that we were wrong. This is a delight! There are several breathtaking attractions, with a detailed immersion in the atmosphere. We did not stand in lines and were filled with joy after a couple of hours in this place.

name: user_931
review: The size was just right, so I was able to take my 10-year-old child and his parents with them and enjoy the sights and rides.

name: user_933
review: Great experience.A must try.I hired a mobile scooter and they let you go in the fast lane every time Staff were kind and considerate.

name: user_934
review: Good ride selection, very clean park, queues were all under 45 minutes during our visit and lots of places to refill water bottles

name: user_935
review: Hollywood has more rides but still fun

name: user_938
review: Transformers and ancient Egypt were pretty cool. Waterworld was boring except for the plane scene at the end.

name: user_939
review: A symbol of dreams and hope. The amusement park is not large, but it seems to have everything.

name: user_940
review: Very cool amusement park. A little small especially compared to the ones in the USA but a lot of fun. There are great rides for everyone in the family from the little ones to incredible roller coasters. We went on a Monday and the longest we had to wait for a ride was 30 minutes with most rides being 15 minutes wait or less. Great way to spend a day in Singapore.

name: user_943
review: Make an express reservation and visit. If you take the express, you can go early in the morning and visit all the facilities and places. The restaurant inside is very expensive, the taste is average, and the drinks are expensive, but the fun and satisfaction of having enjoyed it all is the best!

name: user_944
review: Came here in the low season and was not a very long wait for the rides and easy to get around as not to over crowded it took about 10-15 minutes in line per ride is not the largest universal studios out there but you can spend a few hours here enjoying yourself the Transformer ride was pretty good over all I had a good day their lots to do and see

name: user_945
review: With just the right dimensions so as not to have too much distance between one attraction and another. In one day it is perfect to complete the visit to all the attractions of the Park.

name: user_948
review: Universal Studio is nice entertainment place for kids and young people. There are 3D theatre with roller coaster rides, kids animated cartoons rides, live theatre performance, thrilling open roller coaster rides and lots of eateries. They have casino, hotels and resort inside the campus. One should need one full day tonight experience all the shows and events. Huge crowd from Asian country and Europe. So for every events and shows one must wait for at least 15 min to 45 min. Tickets available online and also at entrance. If you are visiting Singapore then this is must visit place.

name: user_949
review: It was an incredible experience from start to finish to visit Universal Studios Singapore! There is so much to see and do at this park that one day is insufficient to get a complete taste of everything it has to offer. From the thrilling rides to the jaw-dropping attractions, there is something around every corner that will keep you entertained while you are at the park. I am impressed by the variety of shops and restaurants that are available in the area. Whatever kind of souvenir you're looking for, themed merchandise you'd like to buy, or tasty meals you're looking for, there's a place that's perfect for you. If I could give you a tip, plan ahead and decide what you want to spend your money on, because the possibilities are endless. There was no way I could resist stopping at a few of the food and drink stands, each one offering a tasty beverage and treats that were sure to satisfy my sweet tooth. The atmosphere in the park is absolutely magical, from the energetic crowds to the incredible attention to detail that is evident everywhere in the park. You feel as if you're stepping into another world, and every moment is picture-perfect to share with family and friends as you enjoy the experience. Ill definitely return for more adventures! Thank you, Universal Studios Singapore, for creating such an unforgettable day of fun. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a day filled with excitement, good vibes, and endless photo opportunities!

name: user_950
review: Lots to see if you are Universal movies fan. Quite well made sights. Long queues, don't trust what you see outside the queue is inside. 20-40 min waiting. Expensive tickets that includes all sights. You can buy 100 extra ticket to avoide queues... might be usefull? No queues at the entrance (mid Feb 2025). Retaurants and cafes well available. Entry by foot/car/taxi to the door. Worth visiting!

name: user_951
review: Second time here, my favorite around the world

name: user_953
review: My advice, dont get the express pass. We didnt even have to use our express pass the entire time and we got on every ride. But if it does start to get busy then you can always buy the express passes once your in the park so its best to not buy it beforehand and just wait till lines get long then purchase if needed. The park overall was okay, we loved Shrek far far away land. And the waffle with ice cream scoop was so so good!! The only reason why the park didnt get 5 stars is because the water world show was canceled, the water tube ride had technical difficulties and closed and also the jeep ride we went on got stuck so we had to stop mid ride and be evacuated.

name: user_955
review: The minionland was really cute. The mummy was shocking but really fun! The transformers still the best Hope there will be Harry Potter section like in USJ laterrrr

name: user_958
review: minion land was very fun & it was an amazing experience. me and my friends went to the gift shop at minionland and we were served by a very friendly staff, francis :)

name: user_959
review: minion land shops service all are very kind

name: user_960
review: One of the best amusement parks with a lot of activities and fun events

name: user_961
review: We had such a great day at Universal Studios Singapore! We visited in June, and it was sunny and hot, so we highly recommend bringing a portable fan, especially for kids. We bought our tickets online through Klook, which was much cheaper and more convenient than buying on-site. Definitely recommend purchasing in advance to save time and money! To make the most of your visit, we highly recommend arriving as soon as the park opens, as there are so many rides and shows to enjoyso plan your time wisely! While there werent many halal food options, it wasnt a big issue for us. Also, keep in mind that the toilets dont have bidets, so bringing a portable bidet would be useful. Overall, we had an amazing time enjoying the rides and attractions. Definitely a must-visit for families and theme park lovers!

name: user_964
review: This is one of the go to theme parks not only in Singapore but also in Osaka, Japan, the US (California and Florida) and also China. The place makes you want to be a kid again and enjoy all your childhood memories as well as ride all you can for various fun-filled roller coasters, drive-by and adventure filled wonders the park is littered with. Food and snack items can also be found strategically so that you won't get hungry as well as water refilling stations and souvenir shops so you can take a piece of universal studios home with you

name: user_966
review: I did everything because the weather was nice All the attractions were fun

name: user_969
review: We had an absolutely amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The park is well-organised, clean, and packed with incredible rides and attractions. Minion Land was the highlight of our visitso much fun, vibrant, and full of energy! The rides were epic, and the attention to detail made us feel like we were right in the world of the Minions. The whole park offers a fantastic mix of thrills and family-friendly experiences, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Definitely a must-visit if youre in Singapore. We cant wait to go back!

name: user_970
review: We came to the university studio. The normal fee is 120, one level is 150. You can enter for 150. It serves between nine in the morning and six in the evening. Many activities are arranged for children. There are casinos and shopping points outside for adults, I suggest you stop by.

name: user_972
review: It's so much fun, I push it so hard I come back again.

name: user_973
review: I went with my little child and had a great time. Compared to Osaka, there were fewer people and it was great to have fun!

name: user_975
review: Universal Studies Amazement Park at Sentosa Island Singaore. Experience of a lifetime. Numerous Awesome and amazing rides based on different themes of Universal Studios including Jurassic Park, Transformers, and many many more... Must visit in Singapore.

name: user_979
review: Universal... Fun place with lots of snacks... Game rides etc

name: user_980
review: There is a Minions exhibition, so there are a lot of Minions everywhere. There are a lot of rides that young children can ride, so it's good to go with children.

name: user_982
review: Visited USS on sunday, but forgot to collect soft n hard copies of photos. Went back to uss on tue 25 feb 2025. Met up with USS staff, Syahiran. He is very helpful n helped me retrieve all photos frm system n I collected all hardcopies which I purchased. Great help from him. He is v patient and his smile n laughters are very influenting. Haha very cheerful staff who is full of smile and spreading positive vibes. Thank you bro! Hope you bring more smiles to ppl ard u. Keep up the good work and keep smiling! :D

name: user_983
review: jurassic park the are queue too slow, waiting time taking too long

name: user_984
review: Ive been wanting to visit Universal Studios Singapore for so long, and I finally got the chance to experience it! This place is truly amazing, with so many attractions to explore. From thrilling roller coasters to immersive themed zones, every corner of the park is filled with excitement and adventure. The atmosphere is fantastic, the rides are top-notch, and the attention to detail in every themed area makes you feel like youve stepped into a different world. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking to enjoy a fun day out, Universal Studios Singapore is definitely a must-visit!

name: user_986
review: didn't go inside Taken from the front I have to tell you that this place looks a bit old. It doesn't look very lively. Quite a few people come to visit. Should be improved better than this.

name: user_990
review: The recommendation is to try the roller coaster ride, it's really fun. and the Egyptian rides are recommended to try

name: user_991
review: On February 24, 2025, at 12:45 PM, we experienced poor customer service from a staff member at the Mummy ride. Unfortunately, the staff member, Shafini, was extremely rude. I would like to request that the management review the CCTV footage at the gate where the incident occurred, if available. Please look into it. We paid for the tickets and we expect kind service. Thank you

name: user_994
review: A Thrilling Adventure at Universal Studios Singapore! Our recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience! We had an amazing time exploring the park and enjoying the rides. One of the highlights was the newly opened **Minion Land**it was incredibly fun, immersive, and perfect for all ages! From the adorable Minion-themed attractions to the vibrant atmosphere, it truly added a fresh and exciting experience to our visit. Although some outdoor rides were closed due to weather conditions for safety reasons, we still had a fantastic time enjoying the indoor attractions. The wait times were longer than usual, but the rides and experiences were absolutely worth it. The energy of the park, the friendly staff, and the well-designed themed areas made the day extra special. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore continues to be a must-visit destination. Rain or shine, there's always something exciting to do! Can't wait to visit again!

name: user_996
review: I just rented the sgd4 cabinet, but I queued up and was told that there was a system problem and the service was interrupted. I also bought a waterproof jacket sgd6, and the experience was extremely bad

name: user_999
review: Good connections, food prices are quite expensive, monorail trains are 4 SGD, crowded with visitors.

name: user_1000
review: A cool, fun and fun place to play even if your legs are really sore...

name: user_1001
review: Very Pleasant experience. Be sure to purchase the express pass as the que can get quite long.

name: user_1002
review: Worth having an experience in the universal studio singapore, kids have definitely fun, recommended place to everyone

name: user_1004
review: Go when it's not the holiday season... it's really nice to take photos... if you don't want to play, you can just go to the front for snacks and photos" beautiful

name: user_1005
review: I really love this Theme Park! Ive been there twice every year and always enjoyed it a lot! Although I would recommend only going with an Expresstickets as the Lines for every attraction are very long. The Food is at a medium price! Love it there

name: user_1008
review: good for family and kids

name: user_1009
review: You can take one lap of the Express Ansa Island and ride the popular rides about two times. It is definitely smaller than Osaka! Still, there are far fewer people! I'm going to play with Jam.

name: user_1010
review: Overpriced, as is typical in Singapore, but still worth a visit at least once.

name: user_1011
review: Cool experience. Ok with short queues. They could have had a little more activity with characters from the movies in the streets.

name: user_1012
review: Been to USS a few times when it first open and decided to bring my kids this year, Lets say the experience is quite underwhelming. I did not go for a lot of the rides, so I will only comment on the ones I went on. Battlestar Glactica: Human vs. Cylon: it is a must ride however USS needs to do some maintenance work to ensure that the ride remains hygienic after every ride. As the handle smells of a lot of sweat. Suggest to put a BIG sign to not bring phones or bags, otherwise the poor person at the front have to keep repeating himself or herself before scanning everyone with the handheld metal detector. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: the ride itself is interesting and fun for my kid but the handles need maintenance work as well, it was sticky and slimy Shrek 4-D adventure: the show was good but i feel like more can be done to ensure that there is order. Lots of foreigns squeezing and pushing their way through to their desire seats even though we were queuing to enter the row already. Maybe ensure that there are lines on the floor for people to queue so that they go to the row that they are lining up for. We went for some other shows, which are generally good but overall as a local, I dont think i will not bring my kids or even think about going to USS again. As the rides need maintenance, the toilets are not exactly designed with young children with strollers. The crowd there are mostly non-local and little more rowdy.

name: user_1013
review: Having Fun here. Many people in the Universal Studio, but the waiting time for playing the facilities is shorter than expected (15-60mins/ game). Recommended to come. Also, prepare 2-3 more days to visit other places in Sentosa Area. It spends more time than imagination in Sentosa.

name: user_1016
review: Tickets are cheaper to buy from travel agencies than to buy them officially. Half a day is enough to play. The wait time is long in the morning, but the wait time is much shorter in the evening. You should definitely ride The Mummy!

name: user_1018
review: Smaller than some of the Universals but very good attractions and well laid out.

name: user_1023
review: Fun, the Minion zone should have more shade.

name: user_1027
review: Visited the highly anticipated Minion Land - therere a total of 3 new rides and a Minion-theme restaurant for highlights. My favourite would be the 4D ride although the enjoyment was a bit short. An entertaining hangout for families & friends!

name: user_1028
review: The park is super crowded, coming here mainly involves queuing. If I come back again I will buy priority tickets to get in quickly

name: user_1029
review: Its better to come for the whole day to have time to visit everything. And definitely before the opening, as there are long queues during the day.

name: user_1032
review: One of the best places to play! Less queues compared to USJ, weekdays are quieter :) There's a prayer room too, tap water that can be delivered straight away, now there's more games, it's clean, just OK!

name: user_1033
review: Do take express pass on your visit. Without that you wont be able to experience the real fun. With normal ticket you will exhaust yourself standing in long ques for hour.

name: user_1035
review: Very nice place for enthusiasm and sports activities. Neat and clean with discipline

name: user_1037
review: Bring umbrella, cap or hoodie as it gets really hot. Food is overpriced. Make sure to bring own tumbler as water fountains are available at the park

name: user_1040
review: Very nice experience and family time

name: user_1041
review: i went here during the golden week and its packed but it was fun you should just bring the essentials such as a fan since its superr hottt

name: user_1042
review: The experience was horrendous. Wait times for every single ride was at least 45 mins. This was during off peak season on a weekday. Express pass js such a scam. Charging 120 per person to only get 1 express ride per ride? Which is on top of the already expensive entry ticket. And for this price you would expect the staff to be more than decent. But no, staffs at the rides were showing attitude and yelling at customers as if they own the place. Seriously? Im paying this much to come into a mediocre place thats been not very well maintained and still get treated with rudeness, its just ridiculous.

name: user_1043
review: They are kind to autistic disabled people When I got motion sickness from hearing and visual reactions, they took me to the place where the bed was I felt so safe and my parents were thankful (Postscript) They gave me a ticket that allowed me to ride all the rides without a line hehe

name: user_1044
review: Buy a fast pass.

name: user_1045
review: All theme parks have an air that someone else is in control of your wallet, but this one feels particularly Iike you're being fleeced. It's overpriced for the number and length of the rides and impossible to enjoy without the express pass. The rides themselves are mostly entertaining, but extremely short. The park was also quite well managed with enthusiastic staff to help at every turn. Speaking of the express pass. We purchased ours in advance expecting to be able to take all rides using it. Unfortunately, the freshly opened Minions section of the park required yet another upgraded express pass on arrival. Looking at the attractions in that section, we decided we'd spent enough at this park. In addition to that, transport to the island is completely inadequate for the number of visitors. Given the cost of any of the attractions, I don't expect to be shoved into a two-car monorail and covered in the sweat of others before I even arrive. This needs a serious upgrade. Take a quick look at the Disney parks in Hong Kong or Tokyo for inspiration. The rides to those parks are comfortable and inspire you to have fun with its decor. This one just feels like it's squeezing your wallet open by packing you into the train. On a final note, the food was some of the best we've had at a theme park. Typically parks like these serve scraps at best, but it was actual restaurant food here. Well done on that!

name: user_1046
review: Honestly... if you go there expecting to go to USJ, you will be very, very disappointed. The park is about half the size of Usj. You can ride and explore all the rides in 5 hours. (The waiting time for the rides is not that long.) I highly recommend it if you are taking children, but why with adults? I feel like that a little bit.

name: user_1050
review: It wasn't a burden because it was small, but the smaller the place, the lower my expectations. It's very easy to visit and you don't have to buy an express ticket if you open the run. But compared to Japan, it was fortunate that there were at least dogs that adults could ride.

name: user_1052
review: Minion Land themed. Mainly outdoor from theme to theme parks. Rides were fun and well decorated. Merchandise store everywhere. Restrooms are mins apart.

name: user_1054
review: An amazing amazing place whether you are an adult or a child! It is a happy place for all!

name: user_1056
review: Minion land was super cute but I feel like Universal Studios Tokyo had a lot more attractions plus their Harry Potter section was actually attached I couldnt find the Harry Potter section easily here sadly. But regardless, we had a great time and had so much fun on some of the rides! But tickets in advance as we had to line up though there are machines if youre paying by card. Enjoy!

name: user_1057
review: Its super fun. There wont be too many people here this time. The park isnt too big, so its easy to walk around!

name: user_1058
review: An unforgettable birthday celebration at USS! We had an amazing time celebrating my wife's birthday at Universal Studios Singapore. The thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and vibrant atmosphere made the day extra special. A pleasant surprise was receiving a birthday voucher from the USS officesuch a thoughtful touch! Some of the best rides we absolutely loved were Battlestar Galactica (both Cylon & Human), Transformers: The Ride, Revenge of the Mummy, and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Each ride was a thrilling experience, and the excitement never stopped! A word of advicegetting the Express Pass (around SGD 120 more) is totally worth it. It saves you from the long queues, ensuring you get the most out of your visit. Without it, the wait times can be quite long, especially on weekends and holidays. Overall, it was a fantastic and memorable experience! **Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun-filled day in Singapore!

name: user_1059
review: Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is a must-visit for thrill-seekers and families alike! With exciting rides, immersive themed zones, and entertaining shows, its a fun-filled experience. Be sure to try the Battlestar Galactica coaster!

name: user_1060
review: Universal Studios is an absolutely massive theme park, bursting with movie magic and fun for everyone. Oned day just wont cut it if you want to experience all the attractions and activities it has to offer. Prepare your wallet to spent on movie merchandise, snacks, drinks and fan stuff.

name: user_1062
review: How can you come to Singapore and not come to USS? ... The entrance fee is not expensive. If compared to what they invested, the details are good, plus there are various maintenance costs, please give it to them. Who has an adult with you? They have wheelchairs for rent. at the tourist service point Walk through the door. It's on the left. If you can't find it, ask the staff. All the staff are lovely. Food and drinks are not strict. You can take a small amount and they won't check it. But don't go to the point of holding it openly. A little is enough. Please support him too. Inside, there are points for refilling drinking water scattered throughout. But please. Don't take it to eat in their restaurant. I didn't buy it. Like sitting and harassing him. Customers who go to support them will have seats... The amusement park has seats spread out. We can go sit there, they don't mind Since 14 Feb. 2025, the minion zone has been opened. Very cute PS.Transformer I still recommend that you play it, it's very fun.

name: user_1063
review: Not very very many rides for adults, but still a fun time. Food options leave a bit to be desired, especially for the prices.

name: user_1064
review: My first time going to the Universal Studios Singapore, and it was to check out the Minion Land. Very thrilling simulator ride for the Despicable Me Minion Mayhem. Very colourful Minion Village, and I enjoyed my Minion Land Raspberry Ice Cream. At Buddie Boogie, you can dance, play, and take photos with the lovable Minion characters. It's a fantastic spot for kids and adults alike to let loose, have fun, and create unforgettable memories. Visit the Minion Mart to shop for your favourite Plush toys, apparel, collectibles and etc. Good to book your ticket one day in advance on Resorts World website. Go early to avoid the crowd. Nearest MRT - Harbourfront, and take the Sentosa Express to Resorts World Station. Have fun.

name: user_1068
review: First 2 rides were a waste of time! 1st ride queued for half an hour, then there was a technical issue. They simply gave u a choice to continue waiting INDEFINITELY or leave the queue. There was no service recovery at all. They should give visitors, at least the 1st 20 or so in the queue a food or express voucher. 2nd ride, the same thing happened AGAIN. This time, my group were supposed to be the next batch but there were technical difficulties too. While we were thankful that we weren't left hanging in the air like the batch before us, it was definitely very unpleasant. Again, there was no initiative for service recovery at all! I had to request for express tickets while explaining my situation of having about 2 hrs wasted in between these 2 rides. It's difficult to get the staff attention too. They avoided eye contact, walked away from me. They ALL were deemed bz 'helping' with the situation. Even though 1 or 2 was just looking 'bz'. An art which was frustrating to witness. There was another ride that was slightly delayed with technical issues again, but thankful, it was simply just a short 10min delay. Surprisingly, it wasn't crowded on a CNY Sunday afternoon. Not much tourists. I guessed for local visitors, not many will visit again if they have the same experience like me. Don't think I will visit for the next 5 years.

name: user_1069
review: New minions attraction

name: user_1070
review: My 4th time going to Universal Studio (they recently opened minions!) You can buy the ticket from Ctrip, which is slightly cheaper (74.5) Sunday was more crowded than Saturday (if you are tourist, just recommend you to visit during week day). We reached at 12pm and it took around 10mins to enter. It was our strategy to get there during lunch hour to avoid waiting line. Recommend to ride: Transformer Mummy took soooo long (about an hour ) but highly recommend it! Canopy Jurassic park Roller coaster maybe in the end, as you can feel nausous. Shurek 4D Adventure

name: user_1071
review: A great place to spend time with family and some great and thrilling rides to enjoy. Especially the roller coasters and The Mummy! Highly recommend to visit.

name: user_1072
review: Good place to spend an entire day.. We saw many reviews that Express pass is needed, unfortunately we bought them (it's applicable only once for each ride) and found them to be not so bang for the buck !!! (Get it if you are on tight timeline and want to finish the USS in less than half a day with getting on rides only once. We could do Transformers ride 4 times, Revenge of the Mummy 2 times and many other rides throughout the day. (And we went there on a Saturday!!!) By early morning at 10 am and after 4 pm anyways waiting times are less than 20 minutes for most rides. (There are hardly many key rides there) IMO Express pass is not needed (not worth it), if you feel the need, you can still buy it inside the USS after entering the park. Book the tickets in advance from Klook or other platforms to get the good discounted rates.

name: user_1073
review: We have young children and they enjoyed it. I'm not sure that the rides (except the biggest two) are big enough for teenagers. Prices inside the park are expensive but you do expect that. They say you can't take food in but no one checks your bags.

name: user_1074
review: It was the Saturday after the Chinese New Year, just before Minion Park opened. I was able to ride each attraction within about 20 minutes. The Hamunaptra attraction takes about 60 minutes at most. If you use the official waiting time app, you can travel more efficiently.

name: user_1075
review: The first thing I would say is that you shouldn't bring expensive bags! I either put it in a locker when I get on a ride, or I put it on a shelf right before I get on a ride, and it's safe because it's safe, but everyone puts their Chanel bags on the shelf and rides... Well, I guess it's because it's safe that it's okay! ! I bought my ticket at Agoda the day before, and although there are buses available, I chose the monorail. I went to have breakfast at the mall near the monorail station! Meals in the park are park prices, but they are memorable so if you like them, go for it! It's hot, so if you don't want to buy drinks inside, I think it's better to bring some with you! It's a long time, from 10:00 to 20:00, but since many people stop by on the day they're heading back to the airport and leave early, it surprisingly starts to become empty in the evening. I was so excited that I decided to stay forever! Halfway through, the wait for the roller coaster series suddenly became 5 minutes, and I got carried away by riding the red Human (regular coaster), the black Cylon (twirl), and then I got drunk after twirling around Jurassic Park ( ;;) I rode most of the way, so I got home at 7pm. It's basically a small space, so I recommend checking the app to see if there are any open spaces. It was empty in the evening, so I skipped the 30 minute wait. There is no signboard that lets you see all the waiting times in the park, so you just have to look at the app. Most of the shoes I wear are foot bras, so if you don't want to have to take off your removable shoes every time you ride an attraction, I think sneakers are the way to go. Jurassic Park It's hot, so if it's empty, you should go first and get wet before walking around the park! You can bring your luggage with you, but there are lockers available for a fee. (Coaster-type trains do not force you to bring your luggage, so the coaster-type lockers are basically free. Japanese is OK. Please take your time and read carefully.) Some people brought raincoats or bought raincoats, but with a maximum of 9 people on board, there is a high possibility that 2 of them will get soaked! It's a gamble whether you use a kappa or not! ! I returned to the hotel with wet shoes, so I wish I had gotten on the train earlier. Jurassic leg bra guy Single is early! I got the best view of the scenery! Mommy It's early for singles, but I got lost on the way to the boarding area and was so scared that I almost cried.I hit it off with another child who also got lost and went to the boarding area together...When it's empty, I try not to get lost until I get to the boarding area (maybe it's just me). Personally, it's my favorite vehicle. Human Cylon It's not that scary, and the scenery isn't all that great. It's fun, but it's just a normal coaster. Shrek Zone coaster type I thought it was a trick for children, but it was surprisingly tall and scary! Visuals Donkey Shrek I'm not good at English, so I felt like I couldn't keep up with it... Shrek 4D is quite shaky, so please be careful with your children. (There are also seats that do not shake.) Sesame Street Super safe rides Water World If you don't want to get wet, please go to the back! (Surprisingly, if you look closely, there are empty seats.) I think it's more like the opening act before the show starts, so I think it's fun to go early, but I think some kids got scared because people were falling. Personally, if you don't mind, you should definitely see it! The one on fire there is a possibility of getting wet in the front row on the far right Impressed by the image in the back I've used the Single Rider several times, and every time I've been talked to, I've gotten a pack from a Korean girl I became friends with after getting lost at Mummy, a woman told me "this is my first coaster ride in my life," a Chinese lady told me how beautiful the sky was, and I thought it was the most peaceful uni in the world. The vehicles and souvenirs are completely different from Los Angeles! It was so much fun! ! Minion will also be open from next week, and although the rides may be a bit old-fashioned, I definitely recommend it when you come to Singapore.

name: user_1076
review: I came at weekday during low season but somehow still some crowd inside. Need approx 30-60 minutes to wait for each attractions, but all were worth to wait. The attractions were extraordinary fabulous.

name: user_1078
review: We love our visit here. We availed the VIP package for 2 pax. Adam the tour guide is very helpful he makes sure that all his tourist will experience the best visit in Universal Studios.

name: user_1079
review: Very fun and enjoy the whole day in USS

name: user_1080
review: Good place, express has better experience

name: user_1081
review: I came on the day the Minions Museum opened:) There wasn't much happening, but there was still so much to see at the Minions Museum! Bob and Stuart. It was great that these characters took pictures so often and held many events! Minions Restaurant doesnt seem to be worth the price so Ill pass on it!! After purchasing souvenirs, you can get a tax refund at the service center (at the entrance)!

name: user_1083
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling and immersive theme park experience that caters to all ages. The park boasts an impressive array of rides, shows, and attractions inspired by popular Hollywood movies and television shows. One of the highlights is the immersive experience offered by the themed zones. From the adrenaline-pumping thrills of Transformers: The Ride to the charming world of Madagascar, each zone transports visitors into their favorite fictional universes. The attention to detail is remarkable, with meticulously crafted sets, vibrant costumes, and engaging characters that bring the worlds to life. While the park is known for its thrilling rides, there's also a good balance of attractions for those who prefer a more relaxed experience. The WaterWorld show is a spectacular display of stunts and pyrotechnics, while the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase offers a gentler ride for younger visitors. The park also offers a variety of dining options, from casual eateries to themed restaurants, ensuring that everyone can find something to satisfy their taste buds. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for a day of fun and excitement. With its wide range of attractions, engaging shows, and immersive themed zones, it's a truly unforgettable experience for the whole family.

name: user_1084
review: Nicely done. Still far too long queues for moderately good attractions. In addition, there are not that many attractions/the park is very small for the entrance fee. If you come from Europe or the USA, you should have a nice day at the theme parks there (which offer more and better attractions for the same price)!

name: user_1085
review: Average waiting time is 50 minutes!

name: user_1086
