review: Worth every penny! With its amazing range of exhibits, numerous meet & greets, shows, and amazing rides, it will bring back your memories of childhood- from Transformers to Disney. Cylon and Human in Battlestar Galactica- the two high speed roller costers are the stars of the park. Its rides pack in the 4D experience. Do not miss the rides, even though each one has a wait time, that is very high in the morning hours. (Download the Universal studios official application and get real time location for moving about the park) Look for the meet and greet timings in the app, as each one has a specific timing, and get to meet optimus prime, bumblebee, shrek, puss-in boots, kungfu panda and many more. The food stalls tend to your cravings. The last time for your to gain access to any ride is 7PM, after which it starts to close. Overall this theme park should be one in your bucket list. P.S.: I missed the new minion exhibit, as it hadn't opened till then.

name: user_1088
review: Had the VIP tour today and it was the best Express on every ride, no waiting anywhere Our guide Adam was the best Made the day so enjoyable Highly recommend it Worth the money

name: user_1089
review: The first time I went to Singapore was to come here. I was pleasantly surprised. It was much better than I expected. I am a tourist from Malaysia. Lots of rides and friendly staff. There is no need to worry about not being able to communicate because of poor English. Most signs will be in two languages. The security measures are also very good.

name: user_1090
review: It is truly wonderful all those fun rides was a Marvelous idea! I am impressed! It is a place for people to enjoy their time there! I highly encourage you to go there! 5 STARS!The waiting time was definitely worth it.

name: user_1091
review: We have had a really great time here. Highly recommend

name: user_1092
review: Relatively expensive entrance fee considering the number and quality of attractions (I compare with Orlando and Hollywood). In addition, there are a lot of people so it is almost impossible to get to all the attractions where you want. However, the design is beautiful, including the castle from Shrek - beautiful. The shows are also very successful. You can bring in food and drink, backpacks are not checked!

name: user_1095
review: The sky is beautiful, the view is beautiful, but the weather is very hot, very hot. It is recommended to bring a portable fan or umbrella. And the food is quite expensive, at 13-25 (but the portion is big and worth the price). As for canned soft drinks, it's 4 / if anyone drives. The parking fee is 13.10/day. If you're already staying at Sentosa Resort or want to play in the casino or waterpark, take the cable car as well and not go anywhere. It's worth it because it's so wide that you don't know how to walk.

name: user_876
review: It was really fun! Get to ride on a roller coaster and other fun activities as well.

name: user_1096
review: You must book tickets in advance for fast pass. We went there when Minion land has not opened yet, but still take you all day to enjoy here with your kids

name: user_1099
review: It felt like a dream come true for me, as Ive always wanted to visit since childhood. They have some amazing rides! If you're planning to go, dont commit to anything else that day, because you'll need the entire day to fully enjoy everything.

name: user_1101
review: Good but buy universal express

name: user_1102
review: Honestly USS would be fun if it wasn't so tiny. I mean USS could take over the Sentosa golf course. Anyway, its a lovely place with a new addition, Minion land. I do really hope they expand and have more rides.

name: user_1104
review: Its old, shabby, half of it is closed for renovations, although in fact everything needs to be closed and rebuilt... P.s. The most wasted money in Singapore...

name: user_1111
review: Funny for children. Nice atmosphere, good rides. Nice shops and not so spacious. Can't be compared with America. Still worth a visit.

name: user_1112
review: Queues lasting 40-90 minutes for attractions that are no longer relevant, such as 3D cartoons or roundabouts. I don't recommend it.

name: user_1113
review: The place is clean, the building is futuristic, from the parking lot to here, take the escalator first. Wonderful place. Lots of flowering plants... Love it

name: user_1114
review: Great place if you want to stand in line for an hour and ride an attraction for 1.5 minutes. The queues were too long, I didnt experience any pleasure. For the most popular attractions, queues last for an hour and a half.

name: user_1115
review: Finally my husband was able to get here. After completing his duties and being rewarded for his hard work, he really enjoyed it...

name: user_1116
review: one of the most visited places and value for money.... must try the water world show, transformer, human & cyclone, revenge of mummy, Jurassic world are best ride and show

name: user_1118
review: The park is not big compared to Orlando. By the evening of the working day there were fewer people and there was no need to stand in lines, so we visited some attractions twice. The coolest Transformers, Egypt, the show Water World (at certain hours) and Cyclone. This is all for adults.

name: user_1119
review: We had an open run on Friday, starting with Transformers, Mummy, Human, and Roller Coaster... the kids had a great time riding it. My 7-year-old rode Transformers 3 times. It's a bit small so it's good for short play.

name: user_1121
review: All waiting lines are reduce when Waterworld show starts.

name: user_1122
review: Loved the park. Nice rides and very clean. Did not enjoyed the food that much. Prices of the food were high but not more expensive as in Disneyland. Make sure to order a fastpass, it won't be worth visiting without one.

name: user_1123
review: I found it exaggerated, it was nice but it should have been much better, I won't even talk about the crowd, what was that, my personal opinion is definitely a waste of time, our land of legend is bigger and more beautiful.

name: user_1124
review: Spacious place and not far from the MRT When I came here it was under construction and it was raining so I didn't want to take photos but overall this is a beautiful place

name: user_1126
review: I feel like I went back to my childhood.

name: user_1129
review: Awesome place. Weather is little unpredictable, it might rain anytime carry ir raincoats and umbrella.

name: user_1130
review: The Best of Rest...!!!

name: user_1131
review: Good for first timers. 3hrs wait for regular ticket holders and 1.5 for express. Pick an off day to cover everything. Else you will be bored soon

name: user_1132
review: Worth every penny. World-class attractions and rides. The staff are friendly. It's a must if you're visiting Singapore.

name: user_1133
review: Universal Studios Singapore (abbreviation: USS) is a theme park located within the Resorts World Sentosa integrated resort at Sentosa in Singapore. Universal Studios Singapore is Southeast Asias first and only Universal Studios theme park. Be transported by adrenaline-pumping rides, interactive shows and a wide variety of exciting attractions based on the blockbuster movies and television series you know and love so well. an unforgettable adventure at Universal Studios Singapore, Southeast Asia's premier Hollywood movie theme park. Brace yourself for heart-pounding rides, captivating shows, and immersive experiences based on your favourite blockbuster films and television series. From thrilling encounters with iconic characters to exploring themed zones that transport you to different worlds, this amusement park in Singapore promises a day filled with laughter, excitement, and cherished memories.

name: user_1134
review: The last time I went to USS was in 2019, and for some reason, I remembered it being much bigger. Turns out, its actually pretty compact. This time, I went on a public holiday, whichbig mistakethe crowd was insane. Lines were already crazy long the moment I arrived at 11 AM. I thought I could handle the wait, so I lined up for Accelerator (the spinning yellow ride). After 30 minutes of barely moving in line, I gave up and got the Express Pass for SGD 140which, by the way, you can buy on the spot. It definitely helped, cutting down wait times significantly. Most rides took around 10 minutes max with Express Pass, while the regular queue was easily 3045 minutes at best, and for some rides, even up to 2 hours. Puss in Boots with an Express Pass? Still took an hour, so yeah, be prepared. That being said, USS is still a fun experience. My top recommendations? Revenge of the Mummy (a great indoor coaster with cool effects), Transformers (always a solid choice), Human vs. Cyclon (for thrill-seekers), and Lights, Camera, Action! (surprisingly entertaining). If you like Jurassic Park, definitely check out Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure (prepare to get soaked) and Canopy Flyer (a fun suspended coaster with a great view of the park). With the Express Pass, I managed to finish all the must-ride attractions by 3 PM, which made it feel worth it. If youre visiting on a peak day, just be prepared for long queues or consider getting an Express Passthough it doesnt always mean instant access. If you prefer a more relaxed experience, going on a weekday might be the way to go.

name: user_1135
review: Today i went to the Goldilocks.There was amazing services ive been through.Eventhough got long queue but the services they provide was extremely good and satisfied.

name: user_1137
review: At Universal Studios Singapore, it is unlikely that you can go through almost all the attractions in the park without buying a quick pass. It is also strongly recommended to download the Universal Studios Singapore app. In addition to the electronic map, you can also view the waiting time of each attraction and arrange the order of play. There are not many places for shade in the park, so it is recommended to wear a hat and sunscreen. And bring a kettle, so you can have drinking water equipment to fill it up while queuing. If you have a bag, you can bring some snacks and drinks into the park, because food and drinks in the park are very expensive... And sometimes the amusement equipment will malfunction, and sometimes we have to wait until the fault is rectified before it can be opened...

name: user_1138
review: We were there for the first time 10 years ago. Unfortunately, the crowds have apparently tripled since then, so you actually have to wait around 40 minutes for each attraction. Of course, you can also buy express tickets for a lot of money and smile past the long queues. Still an exciting place for film fans and those who want to become one. You can spend more money on food and drinks here, see photo of milkshake.

name: user_1139
review: This is our 3rd time visiting USS. Our family had a wonderful vacation here. Love to ride the mummy, transformers, shrek, etc. Event their live performance was amazing. Definitely will come back again soon.

name: user_1143
review: Too bad the Minion is still in building process

name: user_1148
review: Second time here. Always love the rides

name: user_1151
review: Crowds were big because of CNY but pre-paid entry tickets and express pass were worth it. The express pass gets you a priority entry line as well. Great fun.

name: user_1152
review: Super fun! Some of the rides had a wait time but was 100% worth it. The rides and attractions were next level and something life changing.

name: user_1154
review: is 1 of the best place in Singapore , but little bit crowded.food n drink so expensive.

name: user_1155
review: Universal Studios Singapore A Fun Adventure for All! Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for theme park lovers! From thrilling rides to fantastic shows, theres something for everyone. The park is divided into different themed zones, like Hollywood, Sci-Fi City, and Ancient Egypt, each offering unique experiences. Thrilling Rides The Transformers ride and Jurassic Park are absolute highlights, full of action and excitement. Live Shows Enjoy entertaining performances, like the Waterworld stunt show, which is packed with action. Great Food Plenty of dining options to refuel after all the fun. The park is well-maintained, and the staff is friendly. Its a perfect destination for families, friends, and anyone looking for a day full of adventure!

name: user_1158
review: Well, for me it's kinda boring, but overall the place is great! The facility is good and me as muslim, I can easily find halal food there, very recommended! Only cost 88 SGD for 1 people (Universal Express Unlimited)

name: user_1159
review: You still have to queue up during the Chinese New Year, so its recommended to buy Express Pass

name: user_1160
review: Goin on weekdays in dec. Not very crowded. Download the uss app for easier to decide which ride with less q. Tried all the rides except the roller coaster transformer ride is recommended. Also the mummy. Transformer i ride 2 times

name: user_1163
review: We had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore. The park had several attractions that catered well for adults; plenty more for children. We arrived early and tried the popular attractions first when the queues were short and used our Universal Express passes later during the day for repeat rides (note - you can only use the pass once per ride). Plenty of places to eat, each with their own theme and cuisine. There were enough options for vegetarians.

name: user_1165
review: It is recommended to take the MRT (mass rapid transit) to Vivocity Supermarket (also known as HarbourFront station). You have to take MRT to Stations EW16/NE3 (Outtram Park), drop and then take NE3-NE1 (HarbourFront). Climb to L3 of Vivo city is there the Sentosa Ticketing counter for get to the penisula. Ticket can be booked before you go. But in there, enjoying the childhoods iconic characters world: Puss-in-boot, the Donkey, Shrek,... i was lucky getting a 4D Shrek movie show where i was led to the long time ago past There was lots of souvenir in the Fairy Godmothers - Portion shop. The music in the Shrek 4D show was fantastic!

name: user_1166
review: Buy express tickets, guaranteed fast. But you can only ride once. After that, queue again as usual. The spot is good, lots of photos can be taken. Close to Indonesia. OK then.

name: user_1167
review: Our family had an amazing day at Universal Studios Singapore! Visiting with my wife and our two young kids was such a joy. The park is incredibly family-friendly, with plenty of attractions suited for little ones. We also appreciated how clean and well-organized the park was, making it easy to navigate with strollers. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when we needed assistance with ride accessibility for our youngest. Dont miss the live showsthe *WaterWorld* stunt performance kept everyone entertained. Tip: Arrive early to maximize your time, and use the family restrooms near zones like Madagascar for convenience. A perfect spot for creating memories with kidswell definitely be back!"

name: user_1168
review: Loveeeeed it , transformer ride and Hollywood set productions. Ancient Eg was a bit too scary for me and fun for my friends not forgetting the shrek show in far far way. Second time doing this and l already know theres a third around the corner

name: user_1169
review: Food was fine.Portions were huge, and apparently costly compared to local food outside USS. Rides were fun, we went during cloudy day, which was good to avoid crowds. There were still long queues, but managed to cover most of the areas. Went out of the USS around 6ish. Disney is much bigger in comparison.

name: user_1170
review: It remained bad after Tokyo Disneyland. Some events constantly malfunction. Due to malfunctions, we were only able to enter 2 events in the first 3 hours. The queues are very long and the waiting times are very long. Our favorites in order 1) Waterworld - It was a very entertaining show, like a live movie. A must see. It will be more fun if you wear a raincoat and sit in the front rows. If you don't want to get wet, choose the back. It takes around 30 minutes. 2) Transformers - It was a nice experience to feel the action in the movie. 3) Light Camera Action - 4) Roller coasters are available at many events. The latter are below par. 5) Shrek - 3D cinema more suitable for children 6) Sesame Street - more suitable for children 7) Mummy - we can say that the tunnel of horror is a fast roller coaster. 8) Puss in boots - Kid-friendly roller coaster. 9) Dinosaur adventure - A boat trip where you're likely to get wet. Your shoes may get wet, take precautions if you are going to ride. The organization and employee behavior were not good, we did not like it. It's annoying when events keep crashing. Events that are overcrowded in the early morning hours become empty in the evening. Don't waste your time waiting for events that have a waiting time of more than 30 minutes. Or save your money and buy a priority pass. You will complete all activities in 3-4 hours.

name: user_1171
review: I had so much fun here. What a nice ride. Please buy universal express if u dont wanna wait for a long time

name: user_1172
review: It is recommended to enter early, otherwise the queue will be longer. The maintenance of the equipment is for the safety of tourists. Perhaps it cannot be criticized for being too casual, but turning it on and off is very troublesome. Sometimes it waits for "half a day" (meaning a long time), and then it is turned off! (miserable)

name: user_1175
review: If you know a lot of theme parks, you won't be particularly overwhelmed. It is more of a smaller park that is arranged around a lake without becoming confusing. The attractions and rides are nice but not great either. The entrance fee is also a bit too expensive for the size. But still, if you have time to queue, this is a pretty nice amusement park to have fun at.

name: user_1176
review: The setup is fantastic. The rides are great. Staff are very friendly. It's a bit on the expensive side for food and beverages, but you can expect that. Take your own bottle of water to be able to refill there.

name: user_1178
review: Super nice andrenalin for the entire family

name: user_1179
review: Too crowded with many tourists waiting to enter Universal Studios.

name: user_1182
review: Exhibits are getting old, we came just before the minion section release so might be different after Feb. Pretty expensive and 20-40 minutes wait for all the kids rides but not enough rides available for little kids to want to upgrade to the express tickets. Definitely worth upgrading if it was just me! Meet and greets with characters was well organised and easy to figure out. Would recommend downloading the app to plan your schedule before going if you want to see the shows etc. It was fun despite everything being the same as I last went 8 years ago haha.

name: user_1183
review: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! If I could give this place zero stars, I would. What an absolute disaster of a theme park! We wasted an entire day here, only to go on ONE ride. Yes, you read that rightone single ride in the whole damn day! First, the crowd control is nonexistent. We waited in line for 2.5 hours just for them to suddenly announce a technical fault. No apology, no compensationjust pure wasted time. Every ride had ridiculous wait times, making it impossible to actually enjoy anything. Whats the point of spending so much money on tickets if you cant even experience the rides? Then comes the food situationan absolute joke! Another 2-hour wait just to order food. How is that even acceptable? Overpriced, bland, and not worth a single penny. We came in a group of four, and guess what? Each of us only got on one ride the entire day. Thats how horribly managed this place is. Universal Studios is nothing but a money-draining scam with no proper management, no accountability, and absolutely no regard for visitors' time. If you value your money, time, and sanityAVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS! This is not an amusement park; its a never-ending queue with a side of disappointment.

name: user_1186
review: We had a truly unforgettable experience. It's a must go place especially if you are travelling with your family. Some points to note - 1. A whole day may fall short to cover everything thus prioritize well what you want to cover. 2. There may be queues with waiting time ranging from 30-90 mins, thus check realtime waiting time on the universal studio App 3. Must not miss the Transformer ride and Jurassic park Ride. Suitable even for parents with age near 60. 4. Avoid visiting on weekends/public holidays if possible 5. Buy tickets through Klook App in advance to avoid queues.

name: user_1187
review: This is the second time we are visiting and totally love the place. They keep renovating the place which is really a good thing. I felt the food here is too pricey,if it could be brought down a bit it would be really good. Other than that its lovely and a must visit spot for foreigners.

name: user_1188
review: Was here a few weeks ago and did the VIP experience - 10/10 reccomend if it's in your budget. 25 off food and drink, express to the front of the lines and retail discounts! Big bonus on our tour guide Adam being so great - was a great experience.

name: user_1189
review: Its nice adventures park . You can spend a whole day with lots of fun rides .. This pretty small compared to Los Angeles theme park . Place was pretty clean , nice staff .

name: user_1193
review: Universal Studios SG has more to offer when renovation is done. As of today, there were still many improvements under construct.

name: user_1194
review: Very bad...too much qeueu....even when we go to buy food....in the restaurant..... Has no public charging for phone... Very dissapointing....

name: user_1195
review: Its a bit slow to visit a place like this where young people gather when you are over 50 years old. There are many people, but the game facilities are full of surprises. The ticket is well worth it.

name: user_1196
review: Express tickets are worth it if you want to skip the queues. The park is tidy and well-maintained, with a great selection of rides. I visit every so often and always enjoy the experience. However, taking the monorail in or out of the park can be a very long wait.

name: user_1198
review: First of all, it's much smaller than Osaka. It can be completed in a few hours. All the staff are not smiling and some are in a bad mood.

name: user_1200
review: I'm really happy to be able to come here even though I didn't buy a ticket, just take a photo here. Finally, I can be like other people.

name: user_1201
review: I went on a day when it wasn't raining, and maybe it was because the weather was bad the day before, but there were a lot of people even on Monday. As soon as I entered, I rode the popular Transformers and Revenge of the Mummy. I really recommend it. I think I had to wait for over an hour for Jurassic Park, which I rode last. Even the Water World performance. It's really worth seeing It was disappointing that there were a lot of people, but it was still a satisfying visit.

name: user_1207
review: The park is small, but beautiful, the problem is that if you don't pay for the express pass you have to wait in lines for at least more than an hour, with luck you can go on about 6 attractions in the day... There are also lockers where you must leave your things to enter some attractions and they charge you to use them... Obviously everything you want to eat or drink inside the park is very expensive. Another problem is that they close the attractions when there is a lot of demand and they also close the rider-only option. Lastly, the two most attractive roller coasters were closed for the first 4 hours of our visit. In short, I would not return to this park, the ticket is cheap, but the express pass is worth twice the basic ticket.

name: user_1211
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an excellent theme park for visitors of all ages, especially families with kids. It offers a wide variety of attractions and entertainment to enjoy. However, the park can get quite crowded, leading to long wait times for rides and shows. To make the most of your visit, its a good idea to arrive early or consider purchasing express tickets to skip the lines. There are also several dining options available, although the food can be on the pricey side. Overall, its definitely a place worth experiencing.

name: user_1212
review: The facilities are great. There are many attractions to enjoy. The queue is depending on the time and the weather. I bought the ice cream near the Cyclon and transformer attraction. The cashier is nice and so helpful patiently. The restaurang inside, they provide a good food with reasonable price.

name: user_1214
review: The park is good. Transformers is the best out of all the attractions. The staff maintaining the express pass queue could be deceptive. On couple of rides, they told me it will take 50 mins while it took just 5. They just deceive the crowd somehow.

name: user_1215
review: Download USS App for more convenient queuing time

name: user_1216
review: Not as big as I thought. The waiting time for the attraction was too long. You have to wait endlessly without knowing where the line ends. It would be nice to install a CCTV display for the waiting situation, or edit and show the attraction movie while waiting. There were places that didn't have change and didn't accept cash, but only card payments or other payments. Transformers was the best, and although the rest were short, they were just okay It's worth a visit at least once!

name: user_1221
review: A great place for adults and children to visit, at least one day should be arranged.

name: user_1222
review: Buy the tickets in advance. Download the app so that you know the wait times for the rides. Run to the one which has the least wait time first. Post lunch the rides usually become free. We were able to go on Battlestar Galactica 5 times and Transformers 2 times. Lots of joints and restaurants inside but it is a little expensive so you can bring your own snacks. Water refill stations are there so no need to buy water bottles

name: user_1225
review: It's called the Lunar New Year, but why is Singapore so excited? Maybe it's because there are a lot of Chinese people in Malaysia, Singapore, and people of Chinese descent, so it seems like everyone is in a holiday festival mood... Perhaps because of that, there were breaks in the restaurant and there were many changes to the schedule. From the monorail waiting line to Sentosa Island... How long.. ah.. it was really hard. Visiting Universal Studios after several years.. Before that, I went to Japan, and this time to Singapore... It's okay to go to Singapore without an express ticket. I saw the post, there were so many people... The attraction with the shortest waiting time is 30 minutes. I thought there would be no answer if I waited like this. Express purchase available for one ride per attraction. 140 Singapore dollars per person.. 150,000 Korean Won.. Time is bought with money.... This was my first experience purchasing an express ticket. Since the waiting time for popular attractions is 80 to 100 minutes, I couldn't find an answer. There were places where I had to wait 30 minutes for the express line, and anyway, I rode everything I could. Legal cutting in line...Express... I came this far to get on one, but I was so mad at waiting for an hour or two... In the end, I think I did well anyway... Because it's less difficult for my family... Above all, a child who likes to ride amusement rides Proving once again that laughter is worth the money. It was a bit disappointing that the Minions area was closed for maintenance, and Singapore Universal was definitely smaller... There wasn't as much to see as I thought... Anyway, I think I did everything without regrets. I don't think I need to come back again.... Above all, Singapore is so expensive that it is easy to It seems like a difficult tourist attraction to come by.

name: user_1226
review: Good day to spend! Atleast should have people of 4 to enjoy ! Mostly they have 2/4 people ride ! Best part is go early ! Finish early and repeat the games which you like......mostly after 5 all games wait time is just 20-30 mins ! Final one hour ! All games wait time is just 5-10 mins..... Best games as per my experience is...... 1. Cylon (free Locker) 2. Egypt (free Locker) 3. Transformers.( Bags allowed) 4. Human(free Locker) 5. Dino water ride (lockers on paid basis, can carry back if you have rain cover which is sold outside for 6 6. Waterpark (water stunt, use rain cover as well) Bring your own temp rain cover from 7 Eleven or some local shop as it cost only .5 to 2. Express ticket is good ! But during public holidays we can complete the attraction on time if you enter the premises by 9:45am (entry) Avoid going back by monorail ! As it is so crowded.

name: user_1227
review: Had lots of fun...beautiful memories

name: user_1228
review: Good place for your family outing.

name: user_1229
review: Colorful and superb place. Many games to enjoy

name: user_1231
review: Very long waiting times for everything and ultra commercial. The place is designed to suck as much money out of peoples pocket while providing very little real experiences. Better spend your money elsewhere.

name: user_1234
review: It's beautiful inside, but there are huge queues. A ticket for fast passage through queues costs a fortune, but without it its easy to stand in line for 1.5 hours for just one attraction.

name: user_1236
review: A fresh shock. The Transformers three-dimensional and 4D experience was thrilling and cool. My scared daughter cried, but it will be a good memory!

name: user_1237
review: very busy. The roller coaster is a must try

name: user_1240
review: Epic ...!!! Words fall really short to describe the amazing time I had with my family over here ....It was a sureal moment I must say especially for a person like me who loves cartoon and animations .

name: user_1242
review: The amazing rides and the globe with the words Universal Studio are icons for taking photos. There are many other paid rides that can help you spend time in Singapore You can often find food, drinks and souvenirs here.

name: user_1243
review: Three (3!) attractions had technical problems. 2 stopped for 15 minutes, delaying an already long (90mins) queue; while the third was trolls musical and it was cancelled abruptly 10 minutes in. The show just stopped with rude safety guards asking us to leave the auditorium. It was so sudden and surreal that most people did not follow instructions at first, thinking it was a joke. No explanation was given afterwards. The park seems to need proper maintenance but, profit above all, they will never close it and give it the attention it deserves. Closing on a positive note, prise to the actors of water world who put on a terrific show!

name: user_1246
review: A great experience with varied rides, ideal for alternating between thrills and calmer attractions. A little disappointed by the merch which does not offer many things for older children, there are not enough clothes sold or diversity in the products. Additionally, there could be more food stalls (like ice cream vendors, waffles, etc.) and places to sit (especially in case of rain). Apart from all that, I had a great day in this park which is really magnificent. The Waterworld show is really worth it, the mummy attraction is really great, however I strongly recommend that you take the express pass otherwise you will wait 1h-1h30 for each attraction.

name: user_1249
review: I did not like the worst Universal I visited. There is no variety in the stores and their prices are expensive. The games are limited. The best game was Battlestar CYLON. The Jurassic. We smoked in line for half an hour. Then they said we got it drunk and the offer is for a nice partner. Not once, I mean, what made it easier for us. The weather was beautiful. I took a Starbucks and sat down Anyone who comes to Singapore does not get excited about Abu Dhabi and Japan is much more beautiful

name: user_1253
review: Although smaller than the Orlando parks, Universal Studios Singapore does its job well. The Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cyclone roller coaster is a highlight. Definitely breathtaking!!!

name: user_1255
review: I waited for over an hour to get on the rollercoaster. It was my turn and the rollercoaster broke down. I had to go back. I paid 6 for the locker for nothing. I decided to buy an express ticket. I went to Jurassic Park first. I quickly passed without waiting. We sat down and fastened our seat belts and guess what happened. They let us off again because of technical problem and after waiting for a while the problem was fixed. I wanted to get on The Mummy but the staff at the door refused me because they said there was a technical problem again. It is not nice to have so many technical problems in such an expensive place.

name: user_1256
review: It's really fun, but if you don't use express have to wait a lot There are plenty of snacks and restaurants here and there. Some rides are really scary and fun

name: user_1260
review: Horrible and torturous experience. High wait time on all rides. Expect upto 120mins delay on all major rides. Even on weekdays. Some rides will go under maintenance right before your turn comes. That means additional delay or go and get in another que for other ride for 120mins. They need to restrict the no. of people at one time in the park to make it enjoyable for all.

name: user_1261
review: Perhaps because I was lucky, I was able to ride all the rides within an hour even though it was an attraction. The weather wasn't bad and the rides were really fun.

name: user_1262
review: We had so much fun. It's better to arrive early for enjoying all the rides and show. Mention special to comedians from Waterworld. It was amazing.

name: user_1263
review: A lovely place for kids and adults alike. My kids will strangle me if I don't give it a 5 star. There are a few things to keep in mind though; it is good to enter early so you can go for many rides before the crowd gets in, take it slow and enjoy the place. We went on cylon ride, human ride, puss in boots, Egyptian, transformers, Shrek 4 d adventure. Had some Slush, fries, icecream, burgers, pizza, etc. Most importantly, we kept hydrating ourselves. It's good to take the Express pass but you can get only one ride per head. For multiple times, you need to stand in the general queue. There are Lockers available for some rides. You have to pay only if you keep it for a long time. So it's better to read instructions before using the lockers. We took 6 hours to complete the above rides, eat, drink and roam around. With the express pass. We did not go for the slow rides. Photos cost a Bomb. SGD65/- for some. Pretty but expensive. They made you pose for a photo. Buying the print is up to you. Minion land is opening 14 February 2025. We just missed it by a month.

name: user_1265
review: Magical land for adults who are kids inside. Would recommend Jurassic and the transformers ride One of my favorite memories of Singapore, it's so well maintained. Queues are really long, even on weekdays (visited in Oct), so the priority pass is recommended, another way is to use single line for solo travellers.

name: user_1266
review: It was VERY FUN! The revenge of the mummy was very scary, my heart beat so fast at that time! If you ever plan to come there, please bring raincoat! There is also a ride where its def gonna make you and your shoes wet but yet soo funnn!! I wish to see more rides here in USS. Def will come back to see the new minion land! Pleaseeeeeeee BUY TICKET ONLINE! (Klook) and use the promo code for up to 10% discount! Or else you will waste hours in queue just to buy the tickets.

name: user_1267
review: In the past, I only took photos at the entrance. This is my first time to come to Universal Studios. It is very suitable for older children. The water world show is very exciting and Shrek 4D is very realistic. I have to spend at least two hours here to pick out gifts for the children. Finally, the master card is in Universal Studios The cinema has a 10% discount, very discount

name: user_1268
review: Cable car fee to/from 850 For this picture

name: user_1272
review: roller coaster bazaar

name: user_1275
review: Cool amusement park. There is a Hollywood zone, Transformer's, Shrek, The Mummy, Jurassic Dinosaurs. The minion area was closed.

name: user_1277
review: Colorful, Fun, Exciting Place. Loved to visit there. Recommended Place for Singapore Tourists

name: user_1278
review: 1 Star in general. Way too crowded even when it rained half a day. The only good thing at Universal Studios Singapore is Waterworld. I'm not a fan of fast rollercoasters in general. Kiddie rides took 20-40 minutes. Other wait times were 60 minutes for regular tickets. When it was 10 minutes till closure, a lot of rides became 5 minutes wait. It's not worth the price.

name: user_1280
review: A Must-Visit Icon of Singapore Taking a picture in front of the Universal Studios Singapore globe is an unmissable experience! This spot is a must-see symbol for anyone visiting Sentosa Island. The atmosphere here is vibrant, buzzing with excited tourists capturing their perfect moments. Even if youre not entering the theme park, the front area already gives off an exciting vibe. Its ideal for family photos, couple shots, or even solo travellers. The view is impressive, rain or shine. Tips: Arrive early to avoid crowds and get the best photo opportunities. Bring an umbrella or raincoat if visiting during the rainy season!

name: user_1283
review: Best place I've ever been to..it has got a lot of rides.Differnt zones and minion land is gonna open in February 14 2025.. must visit during week days to avoid queue.

name: user_1284
review: Although it is the smallest Universal Studios in the world, it is still quite big. There are also very exciting performances in the afternoon. Some of the rides are very exciting. There are fast-pass tickets. It is recommended to buy them.

name: user_1285
review: Visited on 24.01.2024 Friday. Without express pass it wouldnt have possible to see all the rides. I entered 10:20 by taking photos and videos i finished everything by 4:45 pm and came out. It was raining yet none of the rides was paused. Although there was few technical issues but they resolved under 20-30 minutes and resumed.

name: user_1288
review: Dreamland on earth. Buy express pass...worth it as u can see more and enjoy rides else u will waste time in que

name: user_1289
review: There are several spots that I want to visit but apparently they have been discontinued. Maybe you can check updates on the official website

name: user_1290
review: Wow kind of palce, loved to see around and the experience was awesome. The rides were amazing especially the transformers ride was simply superb and something to cherish

name: user_1291
review: Best place to visit with young children..we had good expecience. All are super rides

name: user_1292
review: Some great rides. I wear glasses and two rides required you to remove glasses so I had to sit those out. Lots of food options at, as you would expect, higher than normal prices. Spent 10 till 5 there no problem at all. Que times varied between 5 minutes to 1 hour. Waterworld show was fun, Transformer's 3D was my favorite ride, the Shrek 4D experience is definitely worth doing.

name: user_1294
review: Amazing, Universal Studio is one of the best tourist places i have ever visited

name: user_1297
review: Great rides. Unlimited fun.

name: user_1298
review: A must in Singapore. Great for adults too. There is no need to buy tickets in advance. There are many kiosks at the entrance. You can buy it with a credit card without waiting. It is smaller than in California, but the best shows such as Waterworld are also available here. It's always crowded. I recommend getting a fast pass. You'll wait much less time at activities. Especially children get bored while waiting. Fast pass provides an advantage. Rollercosters are a lot of fun. The adrenaline level of the black one is very high. We went in the afternoon. The fast pass was sufficient for all activities from 2 o'clock until closing. If you want to travel comfortably, relax and do the activities we love over and over again, go in the morning. Otherwise, 6 hours is enough for everything. I draw particular attention to the Waterworld show. It happens twice. Be sure to check out the watches and don't miss it.

name: user_1303
review: Universal Studios was more fun than I expected.

name: user_1305
review: Amazing please with family friends and kids

name: user_1310
review: Reasonable price good for kids At the food center and the souvenirs store got air-conditioning Easy to take the train from Vivo city to Sentosa

name: user_1312
review: I have been to Universal Studios twice. First with my mom and then with my husband and children. It is a place for the young and the young at heart. If you want to not only enjoy the rides but watch the shows also be sure to start early so you can enjoy both. For children they have Sesame Street live show and Shrek in 3D. Adults will love the live Water World show. Its my favorite. Be prepared to get wet though. The Mummy ride and the Transformers are not one for the fainthearted so beware. Jurassic Park ride is best for those who do not want their guts spilled out. We cannot wait to visit Universal Studios again. I would not mind a third or fourth visit.

name: user_1313
review: If you are good at guessing, you can ride a lot without the express. Transformers, Mummy, Human, Jurassic Boat, Water World, Shrek, etc. I rode a lot by looking at the waiting times for each ride on the app and moving accordingly. There are souvenirs in front of the exit, so you can look and buy them on your way out, but they are expensive.

name: user_1315
review: We had a lot of fun in this beautiful amusement park. We are fans of Universal Studios and never miss an opportunity to visit it regardless of the country in which it is located.

name: user_1319
review: FUNNN!! I went on new years day and it wasnt crowded !!!!!! buy tickets in advance so thag its cheaper :)))

name: user_1320
review: Most visited theme park, with a great experience. Cyclone, transformers, and the mummy are the best

name: user_1321
review: Had a delightful experience at Universal Studios Singapore. Had been raining the whole day yet we somehow managed to cover 90% of the outdoor activities and 100% of indoor activities. Main drawback is of food and drinks. It's very expensive and options are very limited for outsiders. I think it would be good if they look into it.

name: user_1325
review: My father brought me there 4 years ago. It was fun and I get to spend my time with my father it was fun, But I do reccomend to buy an express pass if you want to play every ride cause the line are superrrr long.

name: user_1326
review: Beautiful and huge theme park to spend a day in Sentosa Island. Various indoor and outdoor roller coaster rides to try out for the adrenaline rush. If you are planning to go on weekends or during public holidays, it is better to purchase the fast lane tickets because queues can get really long. Food and drinks are on the expensive side. Don't miss out Transformers and Revenge of the Mummies ride. They are amazinggg!

name: user_1328
review: The park is more for small children than for adults. 1.5 more or less normal attractions. Queues without fast track for half an hour

name: user_1330
review: Sadly the Minions section opens up in February. We went there early January. Enjoyed a good time with my family there! Make sure to budget properly as there have a lot of gift/souvenir shops that will tempt you...There's also plenty of food available & all are so yummy!

name: user_1335
review: Universal Studios Singapore currently has six major theme parks, namely Hollywood, New York, Science Fiction City, Ancient Kingdom of Egypt, The Lost World and Shrek's Far Far Away Kingdom. As for the Xiaobing area, it will open on February 14, 2025. Facility experience: Since it is the smallest Universal Studios in the world, walking around the theme areas will not be too tiring. You can download the Universal Studios App to know the queue waiting time of each facility, the time to meet the theme characters and protagonists, or the performance time. We visited on a weekday, and even without a quick pass, we could play almost every facility at the end of the day. You can bring your own light raincoat. You can wear it at some facilities or performances, especially when playing Jurassic River Adventure, it is very easy to get wet! Performance experience: The water world show and the Hollywood movie special effects studio are highly recommended and worth seeing! Dining experience: Compared with Osaka Universal Studios, there are not so many unique or stylish meals. Your backpack is not checked when you enter the park. If you want to bring some simple food and drinks, you can

name: user_1336
review: The park is good and offers some attractions. We felt the Express Pass was necessary. This shortens the waiting time from sometimes 60 minutes to 2-3 minutes. However, the pass is only valid for one ride per attraction, which was perfect for us. The Waterworld Show is very action-packed and worth it.

name: user_1337
review: My kids enjoyed it. Waiting time per ride was ok.

name: user_1338
review: Good rides although I feel that it's more male targeted. Transformers ride and Mummy ride was a long wait, but otherwise it was pretty fast waiting in my opinion compared to other theme parks e.g disneyland or other universals. LOTS of rollercoasters in this park, if youre looking for a more easy one then I recommend the Shrek 4D adventure.

name: user_1341
review: The rides were diverse and fun. The lines were not that long when we went. The staff are friendly and helpful. However, I feel as though there could be more activities or shows to do. The food portions are generous. The Indian food was delicious. Overall this theme park is a good place to spend time with your family or friends.

name: user_1342
review: Its great place. Weekday no waiting time. NEXT to transformers ride , there will be people from universal trying to persuade you and trick you into taking photo with transformer , without telling you about the cost, and then proceed to the counter to learn that the photo in frame costs 65 SGD . So that wasnt nice . Everything else good !

name: user_1343
review: I came on a weekday and the meet and greet schedule was not accurate. Really want to meet shrek but only get to see fiona. The line on weekday is normal and still manageable. Great theme park will come back someday

name: user_1344
review: I found the studios a little disappointing. Unfortunately the new world of the minions was not yet opened. What was there was quite good but not as expansive as the LA Universal Studios. Food was ridiculously expensive. It was 50AUD for a family pizza in one good area. Main show Waterworld was very good. My wife and I did the whole park in just a few hours.

name: user_1346
review: The standard ticket, costing S83, was practically useless on an average Friday afternoon, as the waiting time for most attractions exceeded 1 hour. In reality, only the S193 express ticket holds real value, as it allows access through the express queue. However, even with the express ticket, a 10-15 minute wait had already formed for several attractions by around 4 PM on Friday afternoon. For those arriving at regular hours and unwilling to stand in line for hours just for a few minutes of entertainment, it is advisable to purchase the express ticket. That said, for a family of four, this represents a significant financial burden, and in my opinion, the park is not worth that much.

name: user_1348
review: The quality is good, but its too crowded and hot, and it took a long time to queue.

name: user_1349
review: "Amazing Experience at Universal Studios Singapore!" I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore with my wife and son, and we had an absolutely wonderful time! The park is full of thrilling rides, fantastic shows, and incredible themed areas. From the exciting roller coasters to the fun-filled attractions, there was something for everyone to enjoy.

name: user_1350
review: One of the best place for thrill and fantasy lovers, cylone, transformer are simply. Wow Do not visit in holidays, tickets and express pass will so pricy.

name: user_1351
review: Sooooo gooood . I want to be a transformer

name: user_1352
review: It's better not to go on the weekend, extremely crowded and therefore long waiting times. But in itself very cool and you should do it if you are nearby.

name: user_1354
review: If there were a zero star, Ill give this that. Im writing this from the park 4 hours after entry and experiencing just ONE ride in this park in spite of having an express pass. Extraordinary queues on each ride - express or not. If youd like to make it your kids suffer by having them only look at the rides but not ride them, please bring them here. Expected better of Singapore. Management please dont respond to this post asking for details or how you can address this. The point is it is a highly oversubscribed park with little management or care for visitors.

name: user_1356
review: If youre accustomed to theme parks in the USA, particularly the ones in Orlando, this park may feel quite small in comparison. As an adult, I wouldnt necessarily say its worth the visit unless youre here with children. For kids, however, its a different story. The park is very child-friendly, and all the rides, including the roller coasters, are designed specifically with younger visitors in mind. You wont find anything too extreme or thrilling, but the attractions are still engaging and fun for the little ones. What I did enjoy was the ambiance and how beautifully the park is built. The architecture and layout are thoughtfully designed, creating a charming and immersive atmosphere. The surrounding scenery adds to the overall experience, making it pleasant for a stroll even if you dont go on the rides. The pathways, landscaping, and themed areas really make the park feel magical, especially when taking your time to explore. In short, its definitely worth a visit if youre traveling with kids wholl appreciate the rides and attractions. As an adult, while the rides may not be the highlight, the overall setting and walkability of the park can still make it an enjoyable outing.

name: user_1358
review: Of course when you come to the Lion City, you must come to Universal Studios! Because the weather on that day was not as expected, we didn't have much fun, but we had no way to arrange the itinerary in advance. Except for the two more exciting roller coasters, we didn't play (actually because we didn't dare to play) and we were almost there at that time. It was raining heavily, so I couldnt do anything else. Maybe it was because the movie theater in the Lion City was relatively small, so I left after dinner in the afternoon. But if the weather was better, it would be a lot of fun

name: user_1360
review: Buy express tickets really helps you cover all the rides with no or min wait.. the rides are much much more advanced when compared to Lego land.they do have a height limit, if not wrong 100 cm for kids to enjoy most of the rides probably will miss Egypt and roller roaster rides only. The rides are awesome, like rides of Egypt, the jurassic world, transformer, and roller coaster ride. Not to forget 4D movie..I bet you will have wonderful experience with it.. we as adult loved it too :D Good facility of restrooms and food courts (with limited veg options.) Plan your trip in December or January as these two months are comparatively less hotter Don't forget to carry portable fans, hats, tag for kids, some snacks for munching! All in all a wonderful experience if you enjoy good rides. They do have stroller available for kids just after you enter.

name: user_1361
review: I really like this place, it is very spacious, there are many very interesting and challenging games, the atmosphere is full of themes, providing an interesting additional experience for taking family photos. Just going around 1 round to follow almost all the games takes about 6 hours. It is very satisfying to be able to play all day here There is one game that is most memorable for me which may be common in other locations that use 3D technology or even up to 5D, but at USS this game feels very different because we not only feel the 3D screen that fills our entire view so that we feel like we are really in the film, but we also move to several screens on the train track so that we will also feel the effects of moving, speeding, falling, and others in the vehicle

name: user_1363
review: Express pass is worth every penny...

name: user_1366
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers a thrilling experience with diverse rides, immersive themed zones, and world-class entertainment. Highlights include the Transformers ride, Jurassic Park Rapids, and Hollywood attractions. Its well-organized, family-friendly, and perfect for all ages. Crowds can be heavy, so plan ahead for shorter wait times.

name: user_1367
review: The rides are the same as before, but the ticket price..Express..VIP.. Ordering too many additional fees.. It's not big, but.. the line for the ride is long.. I spent a long time at Universal... I recommend going in the afternoon. There are no people so you don't have to wait in line.

name: user_1368
review: Had so much fun get the express tickets so u can ride more than once

name: user_1370
review: We bought tickets at klook for cheaper. So line up now. The queue moved quickly. Enjoyed the roller coasters. It just rained in the afternoon so we bought a poncho

name: user_1371
review: No facilities, for visitors to rest; air-conditioned available only in restaurants. No seating arrangements. Limited fans. Old and very young should avoid this place.

name: user_1372
review: Great fun for.kids and family. Maybe consider the fast pass for younger kids than 6...you can only use it once on each kid rides

name: user_1375
review: Fyi, I go under the tour guide so all the tickets have been prepared. Please bring your mini fan or your hat since it's very hot here . For a picture it is worth it. Android please bring your portable bidet or mineral water ikyk right.

name: user_1377
review: So, it is amazing, they sure did invest a lot of money in building it however, there isn't much to do and there is too much space. This means it can hold a ridiculous amount of people but there aren't enough activities for all those people to do hence the lines are literally a few kilometers long. Be ready to stay in line for at least 45min to enjoy one simple activity that may last 1 minute or even 30 seconds. And yes, staying all this time standing with nothing to do other than wait for your turn in line. It's physically and mentally exhausting. On the bright side, I had a meal at the Transformers restaurant and I told them I am allergic to seafood, they made sure to clean all utensils just to prepare my meal to prevent cross-contamination. That was 10 stars. And at the Goldilocks restaurant, a staff was very kind for taking my picture at the throne they have displayed there 3 (I made sure to go at a time when the restaurant wasn't busy though)

name: user_1380
review: One of the best experiences to live in your lifetime. Such an amazing theme park it is. So meticulously planned, well maintained and absolute fun place to be with your family. We all went crazy at the Universal studios, there was something there for all age groups and types of people. The tickets are expensive but absolutely worth it if you spent the whole day and got on to all the rides. My suggestion is buy yourself an express pass if you love rides and do not want to miss any one. I finished all the rides and did some, multiple times. It's an absolutely amazing place, a different world altogether. Do not miss the Transformers, Jurassic world boat ride, the two big rollercoasters, Human and Cylon, and many more. Go find it for yourself! An absolutely immersive experience.

name: user_1381
review: There are lots of rides, the queue isn't too long if it's not the holiday season, there are lots of food courts, but the prices are quite expensive, the merchandise is complete, suitable for a family holiday

name: user_1383
review: Very well organized, well managed entire experience. The weather can be very unpredictable on the sentosa island, carry umbrella, sunscreen, glasses, caps, water & raincoat (for some rides). The Jurassic boat ride was the best of all. The wait time for each ride is up to 40 minutes minimum.

name: user_1384
review: Good place to visit. Wonderful ride experiences. Amazing ideologies in brining the cinematic experience into the real world. Must try Mummy ride, transformers ride, Galactica, Human, Jurassic park ride.

name: user_1385
review: Its having very less attractions compared to other universal studios we have been to. Looking forward to the minions land addition soon.

name: user_1386
review: It will take you a whole day. The place is large and the variety of games is great, but one searches for tickets on sites that are cheaper than the box office. I advise the express ticket because the wait for the games takes a long time. Some of them may have an hour wait.

name: user_1388
review: Beautiful theme park, best way to spend a day in Sentosa. There are several themed rides, must try the Transformers ride and the roller coasters if you don't have severe motion sickness. There are several references to popular movies around the place so be sure to see them all. Lot of shops as well for shopping goodies.

name: user_1389
review: Wonderful entertainment place but expensive, entry fee abount 80 S if u donot want go inside and use rides than can go in 5 S. Thats good option visit outside and also enjoy sentosa beach

name: user_1392
review: I have visited all of the universal cities around the world. This was my last one. It's always a fun place to be. It is smaller park in comparison butbIt's still worth the trip. Note that this universal Studios does not seem to get as busy like the other universal longest I had to wait was 20 to 40 minutes. I'm sure that's also depending on day, but even the crowd calendars throughout the year confirms my experience. The minion land will be opening shortly, February 2025. Look forward to seeing that when I go back. The best brides are the Transformers, The Mummy, human and cyclone. Jurassic Park is good too Just be prepared to get wet. Getting soaked is a likelihood.

name: user_1393
review: Family friendly amusement park

name: user_1394
review: Don't go here and compare it to Universal Orlando, it's a fraction of the size but I knew this before coming. Still had a great time and it definitely gave that small buzz of being at another Universal Park but in Singapore (and at a cheaper cost). Great gift shops, the theming is still nice, covered areas in case it rains. Minions land was due to open in a couple of weeks which from the looks of it seems to be a decent sized expansion! We had our tickets in advance through Klook and you just go with the barcode on your phone straight to the entrance turnstiles. On the way out I went into customer relations and asked for a 'proper' ticket to take away with me which they can do and is a nice souvenir in itself.

name: user_1397
review: WowIf you come to Singapore and have children, you must go thereIt's small but meaningful. It's fun for both adults and children.

name: user_1398
review: My trip to Universal Studios Singapore was the best experience of my life! I absolutely loved every moment of it. From the moment I stepped into the park, I was blown away by the incredible atmosphere, colorful decorations, and the magical feeling of being in a movie world. I also enjoyed exploring the themed zones, each one more exciting than the last. The Ancient Egypt area was stunning, and the Hollywood zone made me feel like a star. The food was delicious, and I loved the cute souvenirs I brought home as memories. The staff were super friendly, and everything was well-organized. Though it was a bit crowded, it didnt take away from the fun. This was truly the best trip ever, and I cant wait to visit again. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for anyone looking for fun, adventure, and unforgettable memories!

name: user_1400
review: The roller coaster is very exciting, and there are very few queues for each item. The unique Egyptian experience is very unexpected and worth it. It just rained that afternoon and the water world has been postponed. It is a pity that we did not wait. The park is not big and it is worth going.

name: user_1402
review: Cylon keep on closing everytime we went for queue. Human was great, mummy ride the best. Donkey was meh. Overall, its good. Mutton briyani at oasis was sooooo good! 16sgd

name: user_1403
review: its a very big park with lots of adventurous rides to hop on.. its a full day activity.. must do rides / shows are 1) transformers 2) cylon roller coaster 3) revenge of the mummy 4) water show there will be a long waiting time for all the rides, so its advisable to get the express pass which will allow you to skip the queue.. vegetarian options are very limited inside the park..

name: user_1404
review: Disneyland Singapore was a bit disappointing as many major rides were shut during my visit. However, the shows were still enjoyable and offered some magic. Id recommend checking in advance to ensure the rides youre excited about are operational to make the most of your visit.

name: user_1406
review: Very crowded even on a weekday. Please buy express tickets if you can. One of best roller coaster rides in the region.

name: user_1407
review: I would highly recommend express pass if your visit is on a public holiday as the waiting can be hopelessly long! Also for the restaurants, you should expect waiting not only for ordering food but also seating! The rides are great and maintenance is excellent too!

name: user_1408
review: Many visitors take photos at the globe universal studio...which is iconic...rooms for worship...are in shopping buildings and hotels

name: user_1409
review: A beautiful and fun place with shows and games If you like to play, express tickets are best Be prepared with umbrellas and rain jackets, as the rain comes suddenly It has halal restaurants, a prayer hall, and restrooms everywhere It is best to download the application to see the map and the waiting time

name: user_1411
review: I came to USS aiming for the popular Transformers. I entered early in the morning and was able to get on the train after waiting for 5 minutes. It's a vehicle similar to Spider-Man in Japan. When I returned to the Transformers area on the way, the wait time became 90 minutes, and as I looked around for a while, the wait became 10 minutes, so I was able to get on the train for the second time. It seems to be a good idea to take your time and try the challenge. The Minion area will also open from February, so it may get a little crowded, but I don't think there will be long lines like in Japan.

name: user_1412
review: From The Pricing you need to spend for the entrance fee is not equal with the service and facilities. Food stall services averagely rude, each show outlets just average. Compare with Disney Hongkong services very far, like sky and earth. If i have given to spend to be here again, NO WAY ! I understand raining but some still the schedule on their website or apps never been able to close to certainity , not sure how they manage the service culture there but I guess almost nothing.

name: user_1413
review: Not really much going on at this park! No wonder why its quiet compared to pre-Covid times.

name: user_1416
review: It was fun to stay and I want to come again

name: user_1418
review: Truth be told, Universal Studios is so much better than Tokyo Disneland (sorry Walt...) But, like all theme parks, the lines for the attractions are always long. Unless you fork extra for the express tickets. Food has tons of variety, visuals are off the charts, and lots of souvenir shops for everyone. Don't waste the day in the popular attractions in the morning, the lines starts thinning late in the afternoon. Especially the roller coaster. I'd come back again and again if I could.

name: user_1419
review: LOVED IT !!! NEEDS VISITING NOW !!! Buy the faster ticket for rides or else you will get stuck in lines for a long time . Go to Madame Tussards

name: user_1424
review: One of the best theme park experiences weve had, good mix of kids and adult friendly rides. Food was great which is rare for theme park food typically. Recommend going to USS early Jan after the tourist rush has all gone back home.

name: user_1427
review: The park is exceptional!! Very small but very fun!! It is definitely worth going!!

name: user_1428
review: 1/8 Compact and short waiting time No stress. I was able to get around easily compared to USJ. All prices are high in Malaysian prices. It's a national trait, so it's easier if you don't feel like you're skimping on your trip. . I saw a lot of comments in favor of Transformers, I highly recommend Hamunaptra. Transformers reminded me of Spider-Man if you have experienced Osaka University. Nostalgic Shrek 3D The shaking is much stronger than Japan lol I enjoyed the sense of unity with people I didn't know about Jurassic Park and whitewater slides. There was also an experience attraction that reminded me of Backdraft. As a USJ annual pass holder, my wish has come true. Singapore Uni. very I think it's an ant. It doesn't have the impressive quality of Nintendo Mario World or Harry Potter, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. There are some places that cost money, such as the mysterious locker for free, paid attractions, and the human clothes dryer [next to Jurassic Park]. If you can handle it in Singapore, there is no problem. Grav is definitely recommended for transportation. You can travel for half the price of a taxi.

name: user_1429
review: We spontaneously visited this extraordinary park. Clean and very nicely laid out. Super well maintained. Extremely nice staff. The rides have something for every age and every taste. It was surprisingly empty. We hardly had to queue. You can already guess what awaits visitors next week when the Minion World opens. Lots of toilets. And drinking water dispensers in many places, which is very helpful in warm temperatures. There are stunt shows and other shows, all of which are nice to watch. There is a very large selection in the souvenir shops. Food and drinks are provided.

name: user_1431
review: An unexpectedly beautiful experience. The entrance fee of S68 is a standard price for theme parks. If you want to eat in the park, it will be expensive. E.g. a piece of pizza with cola and dessert for 20 Singapore dollars. We went to the park on a beautiful weekday and had 5 hours of fun.

name: user_1432
review: As you enter make a plan as there are many on street show and in audi shows. Rides are good as many cater for small children also. The popular ones may have waiting line of almost an hour so keep a whole day for this place.

name: user_1433
review: Universal is good for first time visitors . Other universal studios in US and Japan are much better. Wait time is too much for few rides and express ticket is costly, even costlier than buying ticket for 2 days. There is no option for 2 day combo ticket. Best to line up at 9.30 a.m while having pre booked tickets so that beat rides can be completed within first 30 min to 1 hour.

name: user_1434
review: Very good amusement park. I highly recommend the Universal Express Pass - although we didn't have to queue for it, we didn't manage to do everything with children because it was too much.

name: user_1435
review: Love the Hello Kitty souvenirs here!!!

name: user_1437
review: You have to ride the mummy

name: user_1438
review: Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is a world-class theme park located on Sentosa Island. Singapore Here you will find the most exciting rides. Spectacular show and attractions inspired by famous movies and series such as Transformers, Jurassic Park, Shrek, Madagascar and more. The park is divided into 7 zones: Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi. City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away and Madagascar, each zone has its own unique features and attractions. Whether you are a child or an adult. Movie fan or not? You can definitely enjoy the fun and excitement at Universal Studios Singapore. Singapore #SlothTrip #thailand #travel #onedaytrip #family trip #good atmosphere #ThailandTravelThailand #Traveling in Thailand #Traveling in Thailand #Travelling along the way #Cafe review #Beautiful cafes that people will tell you about #Cafe life #Cafe don't miss #Beautiful photography cafe #Trip gives away free accommodation #Trip gives away discounts #100 ways to travel #Get discounts without relying on luck #IndyTrip

name: user_1439
review: Try to go on weekdays and the crowd is comparatively less. I have managed to go on all rides without express pass. The best was transformers ride.

name: user_1440
review: The space is cool and there are many places to check in. I chose to walk from vivo through this area

name: user_1441
review: Beautiful park with 7 areas including, Jurassic Park, Shrek (unique because no other Universal has it), Ancient Egypt, Hollywood etc.. More than 28 attractions and we don't know why mystery that day, a Saturday there was NO ONE there! Maximum queue of 10 minutes but when we see the infrastructure installed we understand that it can be queues of 2 hours. Lots of water fountains to cool off. Themed restaurants and lockers to store your belongings, free of charge for a certain period. Minion Land opens on February 14, 2025.

name: user_1444
review: I had the best day!!!! After experiencing Disney Japan last year I was apprehensive to visit another theme park. This was completely different! There wasnt huge lines and it was easy to navigate around. We got the express pass ( highly recommend ) and then lined up again for the rides we loved! We stayed for about 4.5 hours. My only negative is the locker system which was lengthy and annoying, surely theres a better way?

name: user_1446
review: Its a free of cost location to entertain yourself and another park area entering must have payment to enjoy and

name: user_1448
review: I went there on the weekend for Universal Studio Singapore Christmas festival 2024 and there is the newly launched Wicked set with Wizard of Oz. Stay tune in feb 2025 for Minionland

name: user_1450
review: Its a big theme park with many attraction, food court, shops. I go there in last day of the year n i got firework attraction.

name: user_1452
review: Highly commercialised. Mainly all rides, good for kids. Food is not so good but very expensive. Staff very helpful. Shrek in 4D was the best highlight of the day

name: user_1457
review: Family loved the day out, great entertainment but expensive food and drinks inside venue.

name: user_1459
review: Cool. Only queues for attractions

name: user_1462
review: Nice people good food Fun!

name: user_1465
review: We visited Universal Studios on New Year's Day. We were advised to book tickets in advance and to also book express line pass tickets. We did book our tickets in advance but didn't add the express. We waited until we arrived to see how busy the park was. Luckily the park was not as busy as normal. We were able to enter the park without any wait. The longest queue time we waited in was for 40mins. The rest of the rides were 25mins or less. If the park is busy maybe consider the express tickets but these are costly. Wait to see if the park is busy as you could end up wasting money. The rides were great and each section was designed and built very well. Our son had an amazing time here. Expect to spend around 5-6 hours to view everything.

name: user_1467
review: Of all the places we went in Singapore during our 4 day visit to the city , Thes place was the best . It was a Weekday ( Dec 24 ) We did not opt for Express Pass , the waiting for normal ticket like 30 to 45 min for almost all the rides but post lunch the waiting time dropped to like 10 to 20 min and by 3 pm there was practically no wiating for even the best rides . If you want the best experiance please do take Express Pass otherwise if its week day i think plan to go late then you will be able to cover allmost all the good rides . Do not Miss 1) Cyclone 2) Mummy Returns

name: user_1472
review: it was ok. a very average universal studios in comparison to the others in the world

name: user_1473
review: Highly recommended for the family! The park is world class. All the rides are so well done, the best (scariest) being the Return of the Mummy and Battlestar Galactica (Cylon ride). Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure is great too but youll get wet. Plenty for everyone to enjoy. While you can buy tickets at the venue, Id recommend buying online in advance. Get there when they open as it can get a little busier in the afternoon.

name: user_1474
review: A few very good roller coasters (Mummys Revenge, Battlestar Galactica) and a few good ones for people who arent into the big rides. However you *must* factor in the cost of an Express Pass (we bought ours after entering) when coming here, otherwise you will be standing in lines for an hour or so for each ride (and this was on a not particular busy day). Some simple rides would have gone much faster if theyd had more than one employee running the entire thing. Its a reasonably small park and not that many rides, its a good day but not great from a value perspective.

name: user_1476
review: This is a fun place!! Busy crowds but my 18 year old son and I enjoyed the bonus of utilizing the single rider lanes on quite a few of the rides, meaning we skipped past an hour's wait (or longer) and got to the front- it did mean we weren't always together on rides but we didn't mind! Would recommend this if you are 1-2or only 3 adults or less in your group- meant he got to ride some of the big rollercoaster rides multiple times in the afternoon! Bring an umbrella and a parka if you are traveling in the wet season.

name: user_1477
review: This park looks so tired. It is the smallest out of all the Universals but it also has some unique and familiar rides. I love the Ancient Egypt and Sci-fi sections, the Spaghetti Chase and puss in boots are all awesome. Canopy flyer is way to short and the cue can be up to a 120 minute wait and I miss the Madagascar ride. It would be nice to have a How to train your dragon ride- something like Disneys Soarin. All it has is a Merch shop and a statue of Toothless. There isnt a Harry Potter world or Jaws ride, no Fast and Furious. Basically it needs more rides to ease the wait times. Food is very limited, I usually bring my own as I am Gluten Intolerant. I recently visited the park and went to Mels Diner and I told the server that I would like a burger but cant eat wheat or gluten, I even explained it in Malay and my burger came with a slice of meat with cheese stuck to the paper, sauce everywhere and very little lettuce ( a lettuce wrap would have fixed it), the whole thing was a disaster and messy. New York section- needs a Bagel shop with gluten free bagels on offer......It just needs a major shake up all over.

name: user_1480
review: Book online from headout app. U wll get discounts. Best time to visit early morning as it takes more than 7 hours to finish all. Visit all the 6 theme parks and 2 roller coasters. In the roller coaster nothing can be carried along, not even a money wallet leave everything in the lockers nearby. Good and plenty food options in side the park. Try visiting in weekdays for less rush. Somethime the waiting time in 1 roller coaster will be near to 2 hours. Baby strollers are available in rent.

name: user_1482
review: Nice Park - express ticket highly recommended !!! Great rides !!!

name: user_1486
review: Way too overpriced. The waiting lines are so long, even with an express ticket. Sometimes you have to wait 80 minutes for a 2 min ride

name: user_1487
review: visit was amazing. rides were faster than stated waiting time. yong kang was really helpful and nice, he was very kind while taking the order and was also quick to serve. very pleased with the service.

name: user_1488
review: Not very interesting. Many of the attractions are also half-baked.

name: user_1490
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating destination that offers an unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. Located on Sentosa Island, this world-class theme park features seven themed zones, each packed with exciting rides, shows, and attractions inspired by popular movies and TV series. From adrenaline-pumping roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica to immersive experiences like Transformers: The Ride, the park seamlessly blends cutting-edge technology with thrilling entertainment. The parks attention to detail creates a truly immersive environment, making guests feel like theyve stepped into the worlds of Jurassic Park, The Mummy, and Shrek. The live performances and character meet-and-greets add to the charm, ensuring fun for families and groups. Dining options and souvenir shops scattered throughout the park enhance the experience, providing opportunities to relax and take home memories. Whether you're seeking high-speed thrills or family-friendly attractions, Universal Studios Singapore delivers excitement at every turn. It's a must-visit attraction that showcases Singapore's ability to provide world-class entertainment.

name: user_1491
review: It was fun. Since it was New Year's Day, it was crowded. I wish I had bought a Fastpass from the beginning. You can only go around counterclockwise, so if you're going in the morning, you should think about it. It is said that Minionland will open in February 2025, so if you are looking for that, you should go after March!

name: user_1496
review: A World-Class Experience at Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is an exceptional destination that offers a truly unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. From the moment you step inside, youre transported into a world of entertainment, with immersive rides, captivating shows, and detailed themed zones inspired by iconic movies and characters. One of the best ways to make the most of your visit is by investing in the Express Pass. This invaluable upgrade allows you to skip the long queues and enjoy VIP access to rides and attractions, saving you hours of waiting time. The pass is especially useful on weekends and during peak seasons when the park is bustling with crowds. It ensures you spend more time enjoying the attractions and less time in line, making your experience smoother and more enjoyable. Some highlights include the adrenaline-pumping Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, the breathtaking Transformers 3D ride, and the magical Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Each attraction is designed with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring a world-class experience. The park is also equipped with excellent dining options and souvenir shops, so you can refuel and take home memories of your adventure.
