For anyone visiting Singapore, Universal Studios is an absolute must-visit, and the Express Pass is highly recommended to make your day truly seamless and unforgettable.

name: user_1499
review: Good experience for families with kids or anyone who likes theme parks and rides. One needs to dedicate a whole day and be prepared to walk a lot and wait in queues for all rides. The app was very user friendly and easy to navigate with accurate wait times for each ride. I think it's better to buy tickets on the day when you arrive just in case the weather is not good. Big tip: wear an outfit with zip up pocket so that you can keep your phone on you while queueing and zip it up for the ride. All loose belongings and bags have to be left in a locker outside the ride or with someone not riding. I wanted to buy a rain cover for the raft ride but didn't have anything on me to use the vending machine. Also wear shoes that don't fall off. I really enjoyed the Shrek pancake.

name: user_1500
review: Amazing place to spend with the family which engages all age groups.. It is really joyful & fun being there where we can take Awesome pics too

name: user_1501
review: Been here three times... Three times satisfied... Manthabs and Bravo... the place is clean, safe and comfortable .

name: user_1502
review: Worst theme park I have been to out of 5. 2 hour queues for rides. Spent 160SPD for 2 normal tickets to ride two rides. Looked at express which was another 160SPD. They are letting far too many people in for the number of rides. Basically a classic Singaporean money making endeavour. 4SPD for a mandatory locker for the rides then charges you again on return due to the queues being so long. AVOID THIS PLACE!

name: user_1503
review: Huge difference depending on whether express is present or not. This is my second visit, but express is a must.

name: user_1504
review: Cool day ! Express pass is required if you wanna enjoy all attractions once without waiting too long.

name: user_1507
review: it was an absolutely amazing experience, especially for kids! This theme park has something for everyone, from thrilling rides to immersive shows, making it a must-visit destination. Some of the standout attractions for me were: -Transformers: The Ride 3D -Shrek 4D Adventure -Lights, Camera, Action

name: user_1509
review: Visited May last year Very Fun Experience

name: user_1511
review: Great experience on New Years Eve. We were worried about going on a holiday but this was a perfect day. They opened the gates 15 minutes early and we hit all of the rides with no more than a 10 minute wait fur any ride. The trolls show was also entertaining and a great way to cool off from the heat. The slice of pizza from the NY pizza place was also good.

name: user_1512
review: Hot and crowded as expected. Definitely an experience. Really mediocre at best as an amusement park, and expensive (typically Singapore). Foot traffic was a nightmare since there are people from all over the world, and drive on different sides of the road. Throw in some aimless wandering, confused people, the elderly and very young and... I borderline get anxiety just think about it. Not much seating in general. So good luck finding a spot to rest your feet. Amenities in general don't seem adequate for the crowd size.

name: user_1514
review: Very nice surprisingly not very busy. The best ride is transformers the ride 3D

name: user_1515
review: This place contains many things that kids and you the growing up need to be super happy! We're going here in the high season, but sadly they're not yet ready with Minions land... So we're only can take a peak from the outside of that cool place... You must to take that Louis pizza, they have that Chicken resto that not really yum since the chicken was too salty, but the staffs so nice and helpful... Try that bagel with roasted duck, nyamnm... don't forget to shopping alot till you drop for their merchandise coz you'll never find anywhere like there... All worth your every money. You also can play some of that festival games, you can play once for S5 or S10 for 3 times. The prize if you can win it total worth it! The show in Far far Away will makes you wanna be there again and again... But the show in Trolls was too boring, only when the time when we can play with those Gnormous balls kinda fun but jist a very short times and not everyone can get a chance to play with it, please give some more times... We're wishin for more even with free fun games gifts in that season... They're also have that Harry Potter show downstairs, Casino and some outside food that we're not allowed to bring it inside the Universal Studios... The best choice to go back to your hotel only by big taxi, no need to wait, only more price you must to pay... Since the reguler taxi also in a long lines.

name: user_1516
review: visited with my friends on Friday. the queue during noon was crazy long. i waited almost 3hrs for dino ride which always give me dehydration because its so hot. waiting for the rides in ac area was fine. we bought the tix online with voucher 5 on food & 5 on merch, worth it. used the fnb voucher on the bread. bread & ice cream was super good. got % off for credit card user so we were able to save some money. food was nice. thank you for the free water filter. i really love all the extreme rides but my favourite probably the mummy ride (?) and transformers. i queued 3 times for mummy because it was so fun. sitting on front, middle & last row definitely gave different experience. really enjoy it. entered transformers around closing time, no need to queue. really loveeeee the experience. what i can say is i really enjoyed my experience here. the rides were fun that the queue is bearable. i took more rides after 3pm than the time before since the queue time became shorter than noon love it. the USS application really helpful on showing the waiting time so i can focus on shorter queue time for better experience. will come again in future, really fun!!

name: user_1517
review: Long queue, express pass is a must. Most of the ride too thrills for me. I didn't noticed any warning in mummy ride express lane, nearly fainted after finish

name: user_1519
review: Iconic tourist attractions in Singapore besides the Merlion. Always busy, especially during the holiday season.

name: user_1520
review: Horrible wait times and crowd management, not worth the money... There are way better things in Singapore than Universal studio. It is just overhyped , just could do 4-5 rides in whole day

name: user_1521
review: Wait time for rides could vary from 30 mins to 90 mins. Recommended to buy the express pass. This would give you express entry to each ride once

name: user_1522
review: Well maintained and good amount of rides. The main disappointment was the year end fireworks which was pretty underwhelming

name: user_1526
review: Its was a amazing experience with goose bump adventures.

name: user_1527
review: Under renovation for the minion land. Worth to visit on feb

name: user_1528
review: Can get very busy, and ride wait times can be up to an hour or more, you can buy a fast pass that will cost an extra 100 per person, well worth it if you love to go on all the rides.

name: user_1529
review: Spending a day at Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is just right for a fun-filled experience. We bought our tickets in advance from Klook for Christmas Eve, and the process was smooth and hassle-free. While the more exciting rides do have longer queues, they are still manageable. If it rains, be sure to have a poncho ready to keep the fun going!

name: user_1531
review: Was a overall good experience. Wait times are very long. Recommend you to prioritise your rides and take them in the first 2-3 hours once the park opens. Food options are good but pricey. Id also recommend the buying the universal express pass if youre keen on trying out all the rides or else expect a 20-45min wait time on average for most rides.

name: user_1533
review: This is a great park. I was expecting it to be smaller, but it's big. Long wait times though, best rides were 150 minutes, so Express Pass or be prepared to wait! Haven't done Waterworld for a while and it's still fun! Wicked pop up was great!

name: user_1535
review: Not really big as compared to Japan. If you have been to Universal Studios in Orlando, you cant compare the experience to USS as it is really very far off.

name: user_1537
review: On a trip to Singapore, I started from VivoCity Mall, with the intention of exploring the surrounding area. However, after a while of walking, I got lost several times, trying to find the right path. Armed with clues and a little luck, I finally found a fairly hidden path, leading to Sentosa Island. Even though the journey felt longer and a little confusing, I finally arrived at Sentosa Island, enchanted by the views and atmosphere that was different from the hustle and bustle of the city. An experience that teaches patience and courage to keep going, even in the midst of confusion. On a trip to Singapore, I started from VivoCity Mall, with the intention of exploring the surrounding area. However, after a while of walking, I got lost several times, trying to find the right path. Armed with clues and a little luck, I finally found a fairly hidden path, leading to Sentosa Island. Even though the journey felt longer and a little confusing, I finally arrived at Sentosa Island, enchanted by the views and atmosphere that was different from the hustle and bustle of the city. In Sentosa, I saw the iconic Universal Ball, standing majestically in its enchanting beauty. The atmosphere around the ball was very lively, with enthusiastic visitors capturing the moment in front of this famous landmark. The bustle blends harmoniously with the beauty of the Universal Sphere sparkling in the sunlight, creating a sight that captivates the eye. I felt like I was in a world full of energy and excitement, but there was still calm beneath the splendor. An experience that teaches patience and courage to keep going, even in the midst of confusion.

name: user_1539
review: The worst experience of my life. The place is so crowded with visitors that you can't even walk here. Ticket 85 dollars and express pass 140 dollars. Queue 3 hours for 1 attraction and with express pass it is only 1 hour! Queues for food and drink minimum 30 minutes and maximum 3 hours. I don't recommend anyone to go here. It's a money factory for the park owners and people come last here. There is nowhere to sit. People are sitting on the street and on the steps. People are stupid sheep.

name: user_1541
review: There are too many people. Each item requires queuing for more than 60 minutes. It is recommended to provide benches for those waiting in line to rest.

name: user_1542
review: Such a wonderful day here at Universal Studios. There a many many rides. Be warned, do not compare Universal Studios to Dinseyland - they are both amazing in their own ways. Universal studios have some great rides! Prices are very fair!

name: user_1543
review: If you don't necessarily have to ride with your partner, you can prefer the single lane, so you can sometimes only queue for 5 minutes instead of 2 hours and have the same fun :)

name: user_1544
review: Massive crowds if you are visiting over the weekend or public holidays. Kids definitely enjoyed themselves over here, even though it is quite difficult to get on all the rides.

name: user_1545
review: Universal Studios Singapore: Where dreams go to die in a queue. If you enjoy standing in line for hours only to be disappointed by sub-par rides, this is your paradise! Every ride feels like a lottery winif you manage to survive the epic 90-minute wait times. Honestly, I spent more time staring at the back of strangers heads than at the attractions. The staff? Lets just say their smiles clocked out long before they did. A simple question was met with a look like Id just insulted their ancestors. And the prices? Oh, they charge you as if youre getting a VIP tour of heaven. A bottle of water costs more than my dignity after a whole day here. Save your time, money, and sanity. Just watch a YouTube walkthrough insteadits faster, cheaper, and the workers wont roll their eyes at you.

name: user_1548
review: An Unforgettable Adventure at Universal Studios Singapore! I recently had the thrill of visiting Universal Studios Singapore, and it was an absolute blast! This world-class theme park is a must-visit for anyone looking for an adrenaline-packed adventure. The park is impeccably designed, with meticulously themed zones that transport you into the world of movies and TV shows. The rides and attractions are cutting-edge, with something for every age and bravery level. Highlights include the heart-pumping Battlestar Galactica roller coaster, the immersive Jurassic Park River Adventure, and the spectacular evening show, Lake Hollywood Spectacular. The park's staff are friendly, efficient, and ensure a seamless experience. The food options are varied and delicious, with plenty of dining spots throughout the park. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is an unforgettable experience that will leave you screaming for more! Rating: 5/5 stars! A must-visit attraction in Singapore for thrill-seekers and families alike!

name: user_1550
review: Completely overpriced, not enough to see for the high entrance fee. Some systems were not in operation. Too long waiting time. A show was simply canceled. There are better attractions in Singapore.

name: user_1553
review: Good place to spend time with family. Many food options available. Preferable to buy tickets online. Can use the sentosa world site or Pelago app.

name: user_1554
review: It's really exciting, on average there are no queues for the rides, there are queues but only 10-20 minutes! The rollercoaster is also very exciting

name: user_1555
review: Must visit! Plan to spend the entire day if you intend to take rides. We didn't go on any rides, so we were finished by 3 PM. You can combine your visit with the Harry Potter show once you're done. Kids will absolutely love the experience. The food here is a bit expensive, but there's not much choice. It's a good idea to carry some water and snacks with you.

name: user_1556
review: They will make everything has to be paid. Plastic cover 6, air dryer 5, locker 4 for 1 hour. Not to mention the pricey express tickets.

name: user_1559
review: It is relatively small. Liked the Egypt themed area but not many rides and food queues are huge Can be completed in half a day Lake fireworks were underwhelming

name: user_1561
review: Bad experience at Universal Studios on 27 Dec. Staff remarked that attraction was at nearly 3 times over capacity but this was not made known at the point of booking. Such information would allow guests to make more informed choices. Did not enjoy the rides due to long wait times. Staff tried to upsell express queue tickets but this was not useful in view of long queue of 60 to 90 min wait times. No attempt to service recover by Universal Studios

name: user_1562
review: One of the best experience in my life. I recommend to buy express Pass during season time, otherwise it us not required.

name: user_1564
review: First time go universal feel like amazing experience

name: user_1565
review: The place is overcrowded and we waited in some queues more than one hour. And if you go with kids less than 92 cm short, half of the events are not allowed. We exhausted after some time waiting in the queues.

name: user_1566
review: An unforgettable experience, combining high-energy rides, great shows, and the magic of Hollywood all in one place!

name: user_1569
review: We had a really good time! Only negative was that they charged 140 for express pass and then there were still 30 min -45 min lineup with the Express pass because so many non express pass holders where taken first. The prices vs quality of food was as expected at an amusement park. Expensive and not the best. Also that restaurants are automatically adding 10% tips... well thats not how tips is supposed to be. Its just a nasty way to mark up all prices by 10%. If you think popcorn is expensive at the movie theatre. Then do not even think about buying it here. 10 bucks for a tiny thing that is filled to 75% because the top is supposed to be able to be folded and closed... well thats a rip off too. When it comes to the rides and over all experience otherwise it was really good and what you expect from a Universal Studios park. Thanks!

name: user_1570
review: Great place for vacation and go with ur families! The queue is a little bit long but u can see the timing expectation from the app and other stuff from the app! Can improve for the queue line and area for more shady parts to sit and relax a bit.

name: user_1572
review: After being in line for two hours with ease they apologize for the delay and cancellation of the ride without compensation. Wasted my time and hurt my legs. Terrible experience here, couldnt ride any other rides because of that.

name: user_1573
review: You can come here just for sightseeing or if have time buy the ticket for the amusement park which is better if you have the whole day

name: user_1576
review: Too much waiting but was a good experience.

name: user_1577
review: My family and I had an amazing experience. We really enjoyed the shows. Unforgettable!

name: user_1578
review: What had happened to the ticketing and express pass system? Price increased double (express pass is now 140 onsite per pax) compared to previously where one has the option to decide on day itself if opt for it. And again, the monopolizing impact of USS in each city. We did the VIP experience today for birthday gal and few friends, they were all thrilled and enjoyed to fullest under the best care of VIP team guide Shah, who was so patient and entertaining to kids! In the end the kids stayed till almost to closing and wanted to go on for more. Thank you Shah for a most memorable bday at USS! Crowds were at high this week, but so glad the VIP lanyard gave the kids priority in almost every ride and food queue. Wanted to hold the party in Enchanted Castle function room, but it was pretty outdated in decor. We are at good ease to choose this in the end for a quality celebration. Only bummed is for more new and bigger restaurants in USS to serve full capacity visitors. About time to start revamp and enhancements to match with post covid times. Pre covid was great with many rides to go for, esp for kids. For past 2 years, quite a number of rides and street performances are affected but USS still manages to keep all spirits hyped by constantly having new events and activities with measures in place. Bummer for the restos and cafes and kiosks as many are shut. Would have to give thumbs up to Megatron who never failed to amuse audience for each and every session. Its as if he was real talking to audience with lots of spontaniety and humor. Always happy to see the mascots on streets even though no contact.

name: user_1579
review: Did a lovely round trip tickets where expensive but thats to be expected at such a lovely place wait times where tremendous and would recommend coming early

name: user_1584
review: Just money making business .they buy tkts from us and make us stand in queue .then get extra money as Express n send all of them while this queue increases continously .we bought tkts in advance

name: user_1586
review: Long queue for even food,No place to sit and eat

name: user_1587
review: Very bad experience compared to other country theme park legoland, China &Japan. I really doubt all the 5star good reviews. The workers are so rude, keep screaming, their Q system so lousy. 11am checked in 8:30pm checked Out cannot finish all games due to super slow Q. All mood spoiled. 1/ Record is 2.5hours for transformer , in the apps told 90min. 2/ Dino sorin waited 1hour, apps show 10min waiting time. 3/ Canopy flyer Q 45min unable to play due to technical issue. 4/ Jurrasic park rapids adventure technical issue , waiting time will be delayed Others theme park workers are so friendly, Q system is good , fast even long Q, show time no need hear rude screaming from the workers which spoiled our mood. Not worth the money

name: user_1588
review: Singapore is incomplete without visiting Universal studios. Absolute VFM. Download their app that will be quite helpful to plan wait time for your rides.

name: user_1591
review: Can enjoy a full day here with various activities. HUMAN roller coaster is the best

name: user_1594
review: Don't go to Universal Studios Singapore on holidays if you don't want to be miserable. Each ride has to wait more than 1 hour. The waiting time displayed on the information board is not accurate. The toilets are not clean because there are no cleaning staff on duty to guard against the influx of visitors. If the waiting time is so long and the queue is so long, it would be better for USS to improve by providing attractions in the queue or thinking about how to provide entertainment for waiting visitors. Very bad and unpleasant experience.

name: user_1595
review: 82 SGT is the ticket price per adult. All rides inside are free of cost. You can go as many times as you want. Whenever you go I'll recommend a full day at Universal Studios to cover all items and rides inside. 20 SGT extra for Indian lunch meal.

name: user_1600
review: There are not enough facilities for the number of people. Either they will limit the number of people or they will add facilities, very crowded, very long, and it feels like a huge loss for the whole family.

name: user_1601
review: Long queue (approximately 45 mins or more) for each ride. Seeing people giving up queuing for the ride. Experience technical issue with the transformer ride. Food is expensive and limited. Not worth with the price. Too small of a park to cater to such a large crowd. Not sure if the management have any limitation on the number of people visiting the park each day with space, rides and safety taking into consideration.Or if there is any measure on the waiting time for each ride.

name: user_1604
review: It was generally good and excellent. However, there were people that preferred to Jump-Q. Personally, I hope there is proper channel or on-ground personnel for visitors to lodge complaint on the above-mentioned so that everyone can enjoy to the fullest and with all fairness.

name: user_1606
review: Its a really amazing and fun country hahahaha I like it.

name: user_1607
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers a smooth experience with inexpensive traffic to the park and very easy entry, often with little to no wait times. The Fast Pass is highly recommended, as it typically saves around an hour per ride queue. However, a frustrating policy prevents re-entry to the park after leaving, which can be tough on families whove spent significant amounts on tickets and might need a break at their hotel. While the rides are fun, the park lacks variety compared to other Universal destinations. Interesting fact: this is the only Universal park not owned by Universal Studios, making it unique in its operation. If youre visiting Singapore specifically for Universal, you may want to consider other Universal locations instead.

name: user_1608
review: This is a great place, I would recommend it for both adults and kids just ensure the height of your kids is above 120cm, that will make them eligible for most of the rides. I came here on a Sunday and the maximum wait time was only 30 mins, so dont be afraid of the wait times. However, the food is a bit too overpriced. Overall its a great experience!

name: user_1610
review: Must visit the WaterWorld theme park. The stunts, special effects and story is amazing. Farquhar castle is also a must go virtual reality effects and 3D experience.

name: user_1611
review: A great place...the ticket Price was at first looking big...but after visiting the seven zones...it was like full paisa wasool tour... better to compare the ticket price in various apps and book online

name: user_1612
review: Solid experience. Great for something to do in Singapore. Definitely buy express pass! You do not want to wait 1.5 hrs per ride. Important side note: Careful of the limo taxi sharks waiting to charge you a set fee that is 5 times the normal rates to take you to a local spot due to long waiting times at the taxi rank. This should be investigated by Singaporean local government. They are praying on desperate tourists.

name: user_1614
review: Great time with family. Great staff and fun rides. Food is expensive as expected. Long wait times

name: user_1616
review: Avoid visiting this amusement park during rainy season, as the park is mainly built for fair or sunny weather. Come wet weather, be prepared to get wet, as there are no sheltered walkways to shield you from the elements. Even some parts of the meandering queues to indoor rides like the Accelerator, are outside the shelter. And if thunder roars, be prepared to kiss your outdoor rides goodbye, as these would be suspended for your safety. Also, avoid visiting the park during peak period, eg the school holidays and festive seasons. It is so overcrowded that it would take you almost a full day (or about 8 hours) just to enjoy 4 (or if you are lucky, 5) rides, with each ride lasting for less than 5 mins on average. Because most of the time would be spent on queuing and waiting for these rides. The same applies to dining at USS and taking the Sentosa Express. Yet, there are not enough seats or benches to rest tired feet. You would either be standing most of the time, or sitting on the sidewalks. Moreoever, there's little crowd control. It's crazy! To be honest, this park does not have the capacity to handle huge crowds. Yet, it tends to bite off more than it can chew. Even if you are paying festive package price, considering all the above, it is not as worth it as it is touted to be. Still, it is an experience worth learning from.

name: user_1620
review: Worst experience ever. Long queues 60 mins for fews minutes ride. and most rides not even working. Overcrowded, overpriced and its just money making now, no customer satisfaction considered. Will definitely never visit.

name: user_1621
review: Probably the only theme park that I dont have the desire to visit again. Singapores weather is just not good for a theme park. Its super hot and inconvenient when lining up outside. Ride selection is also very limited compared to USJ. Staff are ok but can be more cheerful (they look so sad for a theme park staff but I understand it could be because also of exhaustion due to heat). Shrek 4D is highly recommeded. P.S. be careful of rude Chinese visitors who cut of the line without excuse nor apology

name: user_1622
review: Compared to the universal studios I have been to in the States and Japan, this one is the worst so far.

name: user_1623
review: After waiting for 2 hours, they said the machine was broken. They said sorry and that was it. They suggested that I go play something else first. Then I went to play something else. After waiting for 1 hour, they said it was a malfunction. I came all day and only played two projects. Thank you very much. Super bad review

name: user_1624
review: This place is highly overrated.... Wait time for each rides is 60 minutes and it is better to buy express tickets or else we will end up waiting 60 minutes for 5 minutes ride

name: user_1628
review: The CP value is not high. Less accessible items for young children

name: user_1630
review: Generally enjoy the rides and facilities. Suggest more care to monitor long queue situation where there are inconsiderate visitors who get one person to queue for family members/friends (the case we encountered was 14 members, no handicapped, he claimed and insisted that he has someone who was on the queue behind the 20 visitors...) ... eventually the additional members just cut queue in front of 20 visitors. The "one" who was supposed to queue... joined the group who cut queue in front. This is very unfair to other visitors especially the queue is more than 60min.

name: user_1631
review: Come here if you want to ruin your mood and holiday. We came in at 10:30am, joined the queue and finally took our 1st ride at 11:30am, and then spent the rest of time in rain. The park has a strict no re-entry policy which means you cannot run to your car to escape the rain and the staffs here are very unhelpful, we got shoo away by staff at Puss in Boot for taking shelter under the umbrella at the entrance. I would like to suggest to Universal Studio Singapore management to implement better crowd management and perhaps give out poncho to poor visitors during heavy rain given the price of tickets.

name: user_1632
review: Disappointing Experience at Universal Studios We visited Universal Studios recently and left feeling disappointed. While we were excited for a fun family day, the experience fell short for several reasons: 1. Overpriced: The ticket prices are extremely high, and once inside, additional expenses like food, drinks, and souvenirs add up quickly. It's hard to justify the cost for what you get in return. 2. Not Family-Friendly: Many rides have height or age restrictions, making them inaccessible for small kids. For a family with younger children, there wasnt much to do apart from walking around or waiting for shows. 3. Excessive Waiting Times: The waiting times for each ride were unreasonably longsome lines stretched to over an hour or two. Spending most of the day standing in line wasnt the enjoyable experience we had hoped for. 4. Underwhelming Shows: The shows were lackluster and didnt make up for the long waits and limited ride options. They seemed more like fillers rather than highlights of the park. Overall, the park feels overpriced and poorly managed when it comes to accommodating families. We wouldnt recommend it unless youre willing to spend a lot of money and time for very little in return. In short: UNIVERSAL CHEATING.

name: user_1635
review: Back to childhood, a great place not only for children!

name: user_1637
review: Overrated.. except 4 good rides

name: user_1639
review: Theres not much to review. USS is definitely a place to relive your inner child in you. Crowded as usual even on weekdays so better prepare for long queues, bring a lot of water and patience.

name: user_1640
review: Transformers is a must!!!! Pay for Express you can bypass long lines for most rides 1 time.

name: user_1641
review: I just go and have a look, but surprisingly everything was fun.

name: user_1642
review: Very nice theme park all around. Rollercoasters were fun and very very clean.

name: user_1643
review: Whole day fun packed tour. One of its best.

name: user_1644
review: Great, good. Suitable for bringing children too. You can also just take photos around the location at no charge. You can just take photos for a while, but if you want to try the ride, you need to take a long time to be satisfied. It's a bit confusing to find food that is halal.

name: user_1647
review: This is really good place to explore, but guys as per price you might not cover more than 3 rides. In weekdays the waiting time is more than 1hr . To explore all the attraction u need to come 3 times. Food is very limited. All locker are paid system, some buffer time is there but due to waiting time it will surpass.

name: user_1650
review: Had a great time at universal studios. Travel on a weekday if you can. We traveled on a Thursday, and still it was rush. They also have express tickets if you want quick access. The roller coasters are amazing. I enjoyed the Mummy ride and the Transformer ride. Its a very big place and will probably take half a day to explore. Plan for the sea museum and universal if you are planning a day.

name: user_1651
review: Highly recommend the express pass!! The food overall was pretty bad and VERY expensive - we had lunch and dinner there, and do *not* recommend the lobster laksa or the v expensive hot dogs.

name: user_1652
review: it was an amazing experience. we booked it on a 90% heavy rainfall day and it didnt rain at all! due to barely any rain, all of the rides queues were 5 minutes max.I highly recommend watching the waterworks show. it was amazing. food wise, i recommend eating at mels diner and watching the mels diner show while doing so. however, the mummy ride had barely any people inside, as im a tween, i went with my friend and the way to get into the ride is literally like a scary ride itself! so well done on giving me nightmares. there were no people at all in the ride and about 3 on peak hours. it really gave me a fright due to all the doors open and the lights were off! i really ran like lightning most of the time. i high y recommend this themepark.

name: user_1653
review: Best place on Singapore You will love to go multiple times Minions section is opening in February 2025 All the rides are awesome do try the Transformers, Galactica both rides, Mummy ride, Jurassic park and all shows Do install the app so that you can plan The rush is less after lunch for most of the rides Staff is super helpful Must visit if you are in Singapore Kids love it Lot of food options Indian food at Oasis restaurant Click photos in Meet and greet times

name: user_1654
review: Celebrated my beloved daughter's 1st birthday and my first year motherhood. Momi had a fun time!

name: user_1656
review: A really fun day out! Get there for opening (10am) and all queues will be around 5 mins long, with many walk-ons. Good variety of cuisines for food, but understandably pricey as is all theme park food. It is a very small park compared to other Universal parks, and theme parks in general. We had done all of the rides by 2pm. You do not need a fast pass!

name: user_1657
review: There is not as much content as expected, and it feels like there is something missing compared to Universal Studios Osaka.

name: user_1659
review: It's such a great park, all the details are great and the staff are friendly. Better than I expected. We went early on a weekday and it wasn't too bad, longest line was 20 mins. Seemed even quieter when we left mid afternoon.

name: user_1661
review: Depending on the vehicle You'll have to wait about 20 to 40 minutes. In the evening, there were fewer people and I was able to ride with almost no waiting time! ! It's not as spacious as USJ. It was easy to get around and my 2nd and 3rd grade middle school children were very satisfied _ The Minion attraction was under construction, so I'm looking forward to the next time

name: user_1666
review: Had a wonderful experience visiting at Universal studios. Nicely build and very well managed activities which can be enjoyed by visitors irrespective of ages.

name: user_1667
review: I visited USS recently and noticed that the crowd was significantly smaller compared to previous visits, which made it much easier to get on the rides. This was definitely a positive as we didnt have to spend too much time waiting. The Transformers and Mummy ride remains my absolute favorite its always a thrilling experience! Overall, its a great place to spend some time and enjoy the variety of themed areas, which add to the fun and atmosphere.

name: user_1671
review: Everything was fine but it is very difficult for older people to get around since it is huge. The authorities should consider buggy service or some sort of transportation service to go from point A to B

name: user_1672
review: The park is small but has a few good rides. Very little ques for even the big roller coasters. Will be better once Minions world opens to add the attraction

name: user_1674
review: Honestly I loved this place. I went during peak covid and because no one was there we got to go on rides 7 times. There was Niko lines and it was great: its definitely a core memory

name: user_1676
review: The place is such a beauty but kindly plan accordingly in terms of prioritising the rides. Theres a huge crowd irrespective of which day. So prioritise the rides yall wanna do and finish those up as its gonna test your patience in the queues. If budget is high get the express way ticket to skip the queue.

name: user_1677
review: Quite similar like Disneyland..good range of rides and captivating shows... beautiful lights in the evening...every ride can be taken exception being Battle star Galactica - Human & cyclotron..for Vegetarian, there is Oasis spice cafe... download the universal studios app beforehand, be updated with rides waiting time..get yourself a good internet, coz wifi will get disrupted multiple times..

name: user_1678
review: It's so much fun everyone, I'm hunting for a sale so buy 3 tickets and get 1 free

name: user_1679
review: Universal Studios Singapore? This place isn't just an amusement park, it's a place where dreams come true... and wallets get thinner! From the moment I entered, I was greeted by the iconic spinning globe, making me think, 'Is this a rotating globe using a machine, or is it being blown by the Singaporean wind?' Riding Transformers: The Ride, I immediately felt like I was filming a Hollywood film. Screaming while avoiding evil robots, even though he was just sitting on a chair. Then try Battlestar Galactica, only then will you know what it's like to be thrown around by fate like laundry in a laundry machine. Favorite part? Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. I pretended to be calm, until the dinosaur appeared and the water splashed in my face. Immediately soaked, but happy at heart. Oh, and don't forget to take photos with the Minions, OK! Maybe they can't talk, but their authority is greater than my boss at the office. Conclusion: Universal Studios Singapore is a place where fun and tired meet. Sore feet? Yes Thin wallet? Yes But a satisfied smile? Certain. Prepare your stamina, camera and mentality to queue, because this is an experience you won't forget... until your next paycheck comes!

name: user_1683
review: Exceptional Service by Iskandar in the Dark Room at Universal Studios Singapore I had the absolute pleasure of being assisted by Iskandar during my visit to Universal Studios Singapore, and his service was nothing short of amazing. From the moment I walked into the Dark Room to retrieve my photos, Iskandar went above and beyond to ensure I had a wonderful experience. One of the photos I had taken earlier in the day didnt turn out as nice as I had hoped, and without hesitation, Iskandar kindly offered to help me retake it. He was incredibly patient and meticulous, putting in extra effort to ensure the new photo was perfect. His dedication to ensuring I wouldnt leave with a less-than-stellar memento was genuinely heartwarming. Its rare to encounter someone so committed to delivering top-notch service, and Iskandars attention to detail and willingness to go the extra mile truly made my day. Thanks to him, I left Universal Studios with a photo Im proud to keep as a memory of this special visit. Iskandar is an outstanding team member who embodies excellent customer service, and I hope his efforts are recognized. Thank you, Iskandar, for making my experience so memorable!

name: user_1686
review: Was very good! Love the rides and the shows, however the shows look dangerous

name: user_1687
review: Be sure to take the express train. Unlike Osaka, it is a little smaller and there aren't many people, but the reason you should take it is because it gives you the front row seats. The seats where you can have the most fun are given to the express train. Since you are going, you should have fun. And since the weather here can be unpredictable, it is a good idea to take it quickly once in a while and have lunch.

name: user_1689
review: Quite busy, seats full. It's hot outside, so there are lots of shoppers and taking shelter at Starbucks.

name: user_1692
review: Its so much better to go during weekdays since there were barely any lines for the rides and attractions. The longest we had to wait was for the Transformers one but it was only for about 20mins. As for the rest, we just go straight in and into the ride. We were able to get into almost all the rides in just one day

name: user_1694
review: "Universal Studios Singapore is an amazing theme park with exciting rides, immersive attractions, and well-designed themed zones. Highlights include the Transformers ride and Battlestar Galactica roller coasters. The park is clean, well-organized, and perfect for families and thrill-seekers alike. Friendly staff and plenty of dining options make the experience even better. Highly recommended for a fun-filled day in Singapore!"

name: user_1695
review: I went in December snd it was not that crowded. Was able to cover 80% of the rides. Beautiful amusement park. Got Christmas food set as complimentary.

name: user_1698
review: Visit on Wednesday, 12/04/2024 It covers a very small area, each area is very close to each other, there are not many facilities in each area, and the landscaping is much inferior to Osaka Universal Studios... We entered the park at 10 o'clock, bought Klook Christmas ticket (including main course and drinks, but there are only a few very limited meals to choose from, so it is not recommended if you have special dietary needs), basically there was no facility that required a queue of more than half an hour all day, and the souvenir shop felt like it sold things mixed together. We walked around all the places and watched every show at around 5 o'clock. The Mummy is awesome, I think both adults and children will like it; I personally really like the atmosphere and spaghetti situation of Far Far Land; Shrek's show and Stroll's show are also very attentive If you only plan to stay in Sentosa for one day, you can leave Universal Studios early and go somewhere else!

name: user_1699
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a mid-sized theme park. There are things to see and do for all ages. The cylon roller coaster was particularly fun. It is a little expensive, but if you are only visiting once it is worth getting the express pass.

name: user_1700
review: Singapore 3 days stay is required to explore numerous tourist place, out of which, universal studios takes one day fully to enjoy.A must visit place in Singapore

name: user_1701
review: All day might be not enough time for you guy but less crowded if compare I visited before the pandemic

name: user_1702
review: Universal studios is a must visit place when you are in singapore ,it's beautiful inside and you will get to see different movie characters in outfits like minions ,transformers .you also have some shows inside which you can enjoy and the Shrek village is amazing .I loved it

name: user_1705
review: It must be fun on a day when it doesn't rain. It's sad, but it was raining, so I'm lamenting the unlucky season that I wasn't able to enjoy to the fullest. But it was fun!

name: user_1706
review: Great park, had a really fun time. The Cylon was the best ride, expect turbulence. This time we did not buy fastpass and it was fine, compared to other Universal studios, the queues where not too big, but we did go on a Thursday, your mileage may vary.

name: user_1707
review: Visited on 7th December 2024 Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute paradise for thrill-seekers and movie lovers alike! My wife and I spent a full day here, and it was hands down one of the most exhilarating experiences of our trip. We made it a mission to try all the rides, and each one was a unique adventure. The Battlestar Galactica roller coasters, both Human and Cylon, were pure adrenaline rushesfast, intense, and unforgettable. The Transformers 3D Ride was another standout, immersing us in a thrilling battle with incredible visuals and effects that made us feel like we were part of the action. For fans of Jurassic Park, the Water Rapids Adventure was a perfect mix of excitement and splashes. We also couldnt resist the charm of the Revenge of the Mummy, a dark, high-speed indoor coaster with a spooky yet fun vibe. Even the gentler rides, like Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, had us smiling ear to ear with their attention to detail and charm. The park itself is wonderfully designed, with each themed zonefrom Ancient Egypt to Hollywoodtransporting you to another world. The food options were diverse and delicious, and we appreciated the shaded areas and water fountains to stay cool in the tropical heat. The staff were friendly and efficient, ensuring that queues moved smoothly and adding to the overall positive vibe. While the tickets are a bit on the expensive side, the value you get from the rides, shows, and immersive experiences makes it totally worth it. Universal Studios Singapore is not just a theme parkits an unforgettable journey filled with fun, thrills, and a touch of magic. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Singapore!

name: user_1708
review: Went on Wednesday. The queue time per ride is 5-15mins, very nice. Overall very good experience for my kids. Only missing 1 section of the park which is The Minions opening in 2025. Good weather too.

name: user_1711
review: We happened to have a no-queue weekend even though it's close to holiday season. Overall we manage to try most of the ride in only under 4 hours, and it's magical like always. Food price are expensive as expected. If you visit on your birthday month, you can claim free stickers and snack coupon on the front office to the left right after entering the gate.

name: user_1715
review: Very great, clear amusement park. After half past four there were only a few visitors left so there was no waiting time at all for the roller coasters. We thought it was gigantic.

name: user_1716
review: Best to visit on Weekdays. I highly suggest to buy the Express pass. Overall fun and entertaining. It'll be more fun to visit on non-holiday seasons

name: user_1717
review: USS - Universal Studios Singapore great place to heal your inner child. Best time to visit is weekdays as the usual queue is short. During weekends expect long queues. But overall it was a great time to visit once you are in Singapore.

name: user_1718
review: More than 2 hours queuing just to play 1 game that last less than 10 min.

name: user_1719
review: If you go on a weekday, there seems to be almost no wait even if you don't buy express. We regretted buying it...all the lines were less than 10 minutes...it doesn't get crowded like in Osaka and there's no need to do an open run! (I'm not sure about weekends...) If you're going to buy the express, come and look carefully before buying it haha.

name: user_1720
review: The first time I entered there was a lot to try, but I didn't have enough time

name: user_1721
review: Its a fun place to have fun. Was there at lake hollywood fireworks that I thought would be fantastic but to me its just normal fireworks

name: user_1724
review: One of the dream theme parks that Asian people should visit at least once. Because it is full of imagination and fun, we will have the opportunity to meet many cartoon characters that we like. and join in activities with those cartoon characters Here it is divided into zones. Hollywood zone : sesame street, movie show, the monsters etc. Scifi zone : transformer The mummy zone : The mummy movie Jurassic zone : jurassic Far far away : shrek and the gangs! I see that there will be minions in the future as well. When I go again I will come with a new review

name: user_1727
review: Universal Studio Singapore is located in Sentosa. To get here I took the MRT and then continued by train. Entry here is priced at around 1 million/person. There are lots of rides here, starting from challenging adrenaline such as the Mummy, Cyclon & Human (Roller Coaster), Transformer, Jurrasic Park etc. Many Interesting Photo Spots.

name: user_1728
review: Fun enjoyable and good rides bring ur own water

name: user_1729
review: An all round super fun experience that makes the expensive tickets worth the price. Some rides had very long queues though, so best to show up early.

name: user_1730
review: Universal Studios Singapore (USS), located on Sentosa Island, is one of the most popular attractions in Singapore, offering a mix of thrilling rides, engaging shows, and immersive experiences. Designed to appeal to visitors of all ages, this world-class theme park promises a day of fun, excitement, and unforgettable memories. The Themed Zones USS is divided into seven unique themed zones, each offering a distinct experience: 1. Hollywood The entry point to the park, Hollywood sets the tone with its vibrant streets, retro architecture, and energetic atmosphere. Highlights include: Walk of Fame: Modeled after Hollywood Boulevard, perfect for photos. Street Performances: Live shows and character meet-and-greets with Marilyn Monroe, Woody Woodpecker, and more. 2. New York Step into the bustling streets of New York City. Key attractions include: Lights, Camera, Action!: A special-effects show hosted by Steven Spielberg, showcasing Hollywoods behind-the-scenes magic. 3. Sci-Fi City A futuristic zone with thrilling rides and cutting-edge design. Dont miss: Battlestar Galactica: The worlds tallest dueling roller coasters (Cylon and Human), perfect for adrenaline junkies. Transformers: The Ride 3D: An immersive, high-speed adventure thats a favorite among visitors. 4. Ancient Egypt Explore the mysteries of Ancient Egypt amidst towering statues and sandy ruins. Must-try: Revenge of the Mummy: A high-speed indoor roller coaster that combines thrills with storytelling. 5. The Lost World Inspired by Jurassic Park, this zone offers dinosaur-themed attractions and adventures: Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: A water ride through a dinosaur habitat, complete with a thrilling drop. Canopy Flyer: A family-friendly aerial ride with scenic views of the park. 6. Far Far Away Enter the whimsical world of Shrek and his fairy-tale friends: Shrek 4-D Adventure: A fun cinematic experience that combines 3D visuals with physical effects. Enchanted Airways: A junior roller coaster ideal for kids and families. 7. Madagascar Perfect for younger visitors, this zone is based on the hit animated movie series: Madagascar: A Crate Adventure: A boat ride through scenes from the movies. King Juliens Beach Party-Go-Round: A colorful carousel for kids. Shows and Entertainment USS offers a variety of live shows and performances throughout the day. From character meet-and-greets to stunt shows, theres always something happening. Notable shows include: WaterWorld: A spectacular live-action show featuring pyrotechnics, jet skis, and daring stunts. Hollywood Dreams Parade: Held on select days, this parade showcases all your favorite characters. Dining Options The park boasts a wide range of dining options, catering to all tastes and preferences. Highlights include: Mels Drive-In (Hollywood): A classic American diner serving burgers, fries, and milkshakes. Oasis Spice Caf (Ancient Egypt): Offers Middle Eastern and Indian-inspired dishes. Starbot Caf (Sci-Fi City): Asian fusion cuisine in a futuristic setting. Vegetarian and halal options are also available, ensuring everyone is catered to. Shopping No visit to USS is complete without some souvenir shopping. Each zone features themed stores offering everything from t-shirts and mugs to exclusive memorabilia. Popular spots include: Universal Studios Store (Hollywood): A one-stop shop for park-themed merchandise. Transformers Supply Vault (Sci-Fi City): Exclusive Transformers-themed souvenirs. Facilities and Accessibility USS offers excellent facilities, ensuring a smooth experience for all visitors: Final Thoughts Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit attraction that delivers on entertainment, thrills, and memories. Its blend of world-class rides, immersive zones, and family-friendly experiences ensures theres something for everyone. Whether youre a thrill-seeker, a movie buff, or simply looking for a fun day out, USS promises an unforgettable adventure in the heart of Singapore

name: user_1731
review: Has some amazing, thrilling rides, shows, live performances, out-of-the-world experiences. Should be on your must-visit-before-you-die list. Simply awesome

name: user_1732
review: It was very fun, but when I went on holiday, there were a lot of people and I had to wait to play the attractions. There is a luggage locker service. Very convenient and safe

name: user_1733
review: Universal studios is an amazing theme park in Sentosa island. It has many themes such as hollywood which primarily features New York City in the United States, Ancient Egypt, Disney primarily featuring shrek, and the lost world which features jurassic park. I would recommend people who are fit and are capable of standing in long queues and having the fitness to do long walks visit this place. The reason is that the wait time can go up to 90 minutes per ride hence it becomes difficult to continuously stand in a queue. People who are older in age or have physical movement issues should refrain from taking rides. The place has many rides with many of them having high speed roller coasters. Many of the movies in 4D are also good with real simulation, which can become scary as well. The theme park has in house shopping where you can buy souvenirs accordingly. Please keep your tickets safe as it is very important to roam freely inside the park. Many food stalls are present and along with that many restaurants are present to have a good meal. Lastly please follow the guidelines whenever the officials give to you or it can lead to mishaps as well. Overall a very good place to have a great family time, and it is the best place to bring your children as they will love almost anything here.

name: user_1736
review: It is the smallest park I have visited, but the cheapest. We hardly queued at any game, most of the visitors are from Asia, Australia. It is not worth buying the universal express, you can travel through the park perfectly in 6-7 hours. The park is inside an island Sentosa

name: user_1737
review: Went to Universal Studios Sin December 2016 but really got the moment there Even though you have to queue for hours for each ride, it's really fun Hopefully I can come here with my children later...aamiiiiinnn

name: user_1739
review: Excellent place with lots and lots of reality games. Especially the roller costers and mummy ride are awesome. Apart from this, the streets and the location of this studio has been themed up with various movies of Universal Studio. Really true value for money and need to try atleast once with kids. Kids will thoroughly enjoy this place like anything..

name: user_1740
review: Great place, a must-see in Singapore. We spent the whole day there, and still didn't manage to see some attractions. On the plus side, we managed to not have a lot of people so there weren't any long queues. We liked the Jurassic Park queue the most, we managed to go down it twice, we came out all wet. I bought tickets on the website, it was about PLN 500 for two tickets for one day. In the park you can watch Water World live, it's another must-see in this park. You can find a large gastronomic offer, there is a Starbucks where we went to cool off and have a drink, because it was terribly hot. I recommend visiting the Universal Studio store, you can find great souvenirs there, I bought a magnet there for 10 Singapore. The prices are high but it's like in all such places. In general, I highly recommend visiting this place, but you need at least 2 days to visit everything calmly. A minion zone is being built in the park, but from what I saw, the opening is planned for 2025

name: user_1741
review: Great place to visit in Singapore. the whole island is next level. Many rides and spine chilling experience that one should experience in life time.

name: user_1742
review: Only one fair-skinned Malay male greeter at the entrance (and later, as we exited) is friendly and courteous. The rest of the staff seem like they dont want to be there, treating us, the paying visitors, as if were disturbing their Sunday. Dont visit Singapore for its attractions. The STB should also consider shutting down its department that oversees USS.

name: user_1743
review: We got to the park on our own by bus for 5 SGD literally from the hotel. I recommend it to those who love rides and a festive atmosphere. Everyone can find something for themselves. But for very young children, in my opinion, there is not much entertainment. Where you definitely shouldn't waste time is Treasure Hunters. Long waiting time, but only a toddler will appreciate it. Otherwise, everything is great: themed shops, cafes and, of course, the entertainment itself.

name: user_1746
review: I was disappointed because it was smaller than I thought. I went at the morning entrance time, and I was able to see and ride everything in the morning. I absolutely do not recommend riding the jeep in the Egypt area. The wait was 30 minutes, but the ride was less than 5 minutes, and it was cheap and childish. And the hamburger place near the entrance was the worst in my life. It was expensive and cold. If I hadn't been comforted by Waterworld, Shrek, and Transformers, I would have sued.

name: user_1748
review: Nice place to spend the whole day. Opens by 10AM. You need to finish the popular rides early as it would mean lesser wait time. There are fives theme zones. Remember to catch the Waterworld show; it is really good.

name: user_1750
review: Super Park I loved the Transformers

Too bad close so soon.. the toilet is so pristine and clean Staff berry friendly and informative U should prepare raincoat for the water rides Here sold for 6 sgd per piece I will go again to USS

name: user_1756
review: Visited Universal Studios Singapore on a weekend and its a thrilling theme park that offers an exciting mix of rides, shows, and attractions based on popular movies and characters. Located on Sentosa Island, it features seven themed zones, including Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, and Sci-Fi City, each with immersive experiences for all ages. Popular attractions like the Transformers ride and Jurassic Park Rapids make it a standout, while family-friendly shows and live entertainment add to the fun. With its vibrant atmosphere and high-energy thrills, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for both movie buffs and adventure seekers.

name: user_1757

review: One of the best events in Singapore, I highly recommend visiting it All the games are nice and take you between 4 and 6 hours There is a small chapel for men and women after the first train (the big train) on the right after the safety deposit boxes, shown in the map I added. I recommend wearing a hat or using an umbrella because of the sun and heat There is a fast pass feature for events and no waiting in queues, and it is added to the admission ticket, but I recommend purchasing the regular ticket (one time admission ticket) only because it was not crowded at my time. Its price is 83 Singapore dollars. Then, if you enter and see there is crowding, you can add the express pass feature and the addition price is 100 Singapore dollars from the guest service office inside the city and do not go to the office outside.

name: user_1786
review: Has visited universal studios on Nov 27th 2024 Wednesday. Below are the good rides as per priority. 1 Transformers 2 Revenge of mummy 3 Jurassic park Rhapsody 4 Galactica 5 lights camera action For kids: Puss and the boots Canopy flier Enchanted airways Shrek Show: Water world Minions world is still under construction . name: user_1788
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating destination that promises fun and adventure for visitors of all ages. From thrilling rides to immersive attractions, its a must-visit spot for anyone traveling to Sentosa Island. The park is well-organized, and the themed zoneslike Ancient Egypt, Jurassic World, and Hollywood Boulevardtransport you into different worlds with their detailed designs and exciting attractions. Some of the standout rides include Battlestar Galactica, a high-adrenaline roller coaster, and Transformers: The Ride, which offers an incredible 4D experience. Families will enjoy the interactive shows and gentler rides, ensuring theres something for everyone. However, during my visit, I was disappointed to find that the Minion Land attraction was temporarily closed for maintenance. While this was unfortunate, the rest of the park had so much to offer that it didnt take away from the overall experience. Id recommend checking the official website for updates before planning your visit. The park staff were friendly and efficient, and the food and beverage options were diverse, catering to all tastes. Pro tip: purchasing an express pass is worth it to skip the long queues during peak hours. Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling escape that guarantees unforgettable memories, even with minor closures. I cant wait to return!

name: user_1789
review: Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is a world-class theme park located on Sentosa Island, offering a perfect blend of thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and live entertainment. As Southeast Asias first Universal Studios theme park, it has become a top destination for families, thrill-seekers, and movie enthusiasts alike. Spanning seven themed zones, the park is meticulously designed to transport visitors into the magical worlds of their favorite films and characters. The experience begins with Hollywood, where visitors are greeted with a lively atmosphere, street performances, and souvenir shops. The Walk of Fame here is perfect for photo opportunities. Adjacent to it is New York, featuring iconic landmarks like the Statue of Liberty and attractions such as Lights, Camera, Action! a thrilling behind-the-scenes experience showcasing special effects. Sci-Fi City is a highlight for adrenaline junkies, housing the famous Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon roller coasters. These dueling coasters deliver a heart-pounding experience, while Transformers: The Ride offers an exhilarating 4D simulation that immerses riders in a high-tech battle. For families, Far Far Away and Madagascar zones are a delight. Kids love the Shrek 4D Adventure and the adorable Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride. The whimsical architecture and meet-and-greet sessions with characters like Shrek, Fiona, and the Madagascar crew make these areas especially charming. The Ancient Egypt zone takes visitors back in time with its majestic architecture and the Revenge of the Mummy indoor coaster, which combines speed, darkness, and special effects for a thrilling adventure. Meanwhile, The Lost World appeals to dinosaur enthusiasts with attractions like Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, a water ride that guarantees fun and a bit of splashing. Universal Studios Singapore also excels in entertainment. The WaterWorld stunt show is a standout, featuring live-action sequences, pyrotechnics, and daring stunts that keep audiences on the edge of their seats. Street performances and parades add to the vibrant atmosphere throughout the day. Dining and shopping options are abundant, with themed restaurants offering a variety of cuisines and souvenir shops selling exclusive merchandise. Whether its grabbing a quick bite at Mels Drive-In or indulging in a full meal at the Discovery Food Court, theres something for everyone. While USS offers an unforgettable experience, it is advisable to plan your visit strategically. The park can get crowded, especially on weekends and holidays, leading to long queues for popular rides. Opting for an Express Pass can significantly reduce waiting times. The weather in Singapore can be hot and humid, so staying hydrated and wearing comfortable clothing is essential. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit attraction that promises a day filled with fun, excitement, and memorable experiences. With its well-crafted themes, thrilling rides, and engaging entertainment, it appeals to visitors of all ages. Whether youre a fan of adrenaline-pumping roller coasters, immersive movie-based attractions, or simply looking for family-friendly fun, USS has something magical to offer.

name: user_1818
review: Loved it! Didnt have to wait more than 10 minutes for any ride, and went on most of them multiple times. Weekday is recommended.

name: user_1826
review: Had loads of fun. The best way is to get there early and complete all the fun rides because once the crowd comes in, you'll need to wait for 30-40 mins even on weekdays.

review: Waste of time and money, not worthy to visit universal studios.. it is outdated.. better we can visit any amusement park with lower price

name: user_1828
review: Whatever you do once inside, make sure to NOT miss trying the Ancient Egypt ride. Not to spoil the fun - if you know, you know. LOL

name: user_1829
review: The themes, the rides, the characters ... it has something for everyone

name: user_1833
review: I went at opening time on a Saturday, but there weren't many people waiting. As soon as it opened, I went on the popular attraction first and was able to ride it without waiting. After about an hour and a half, I rode most of the attractions, had lunch, and went out to watch the first part of Water World. However, as lunch time approached, the crowds increased significantly and there was a wait of about 50 minutes for popular attractions.

name: user_1835
review: I completed all the rides in 3 hours. Transformers, mummy and Battlestar galactica rides are really great. I will recommend the lunch time also because most of people go for lunch so you will get lesser queues. Also recommend to carry raincoat for jurassic park ride

name: user_1836
review: Must visit place when in Singapore. Must go to there Transformer ride.

name: user_1841
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for thrill-seekers and families alike! Located within Resorts World Sentosa, the park features seven themed zones, including Madagascar, Far Far Away, and Ancient Egypt. Visitors can enjoy a range of attractions, from roller coasters and water rides to live shows and character meet-and-greets. The park also offers various dining options, from fine dining to casual eats. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is an excellent choice for a fun-filled day out in Singapore!

name: user_1842
review: Universal Studios Singapore is more than just a theme park. its a place where magic, adventure, and movie moments come to life. Whether youre traveling with kids or looking for an adrenaline rush, its a must-visit attraction that truly has something for everyone!

name: user_1843
review: Finally ticked off my childhood bucket list and it was one of the best experiences ever! The rides were thrilling, and the nostalgia hit hard! Even my mom and sister had the time of their lives! A day full of smiles and unforgettable memories!

review: Explore and enjoy your time

name: user_1848
review: Ticket prices are high, games and services are not diverse

name: user_1851
review: Worst theme park I have visited. We purchased the Universal Express, which is absolutely necessary by the way, as wait times are extremely long and difficult in the heat and humidity. Everything is overpriced, which we all naturally expect but here it is exorbitant. The park is in need of an update, rides are quite lame and uninspired - the only exception being the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure. Give it a miss.

name: user_1852
review: Liked it a lot,the only thing that was kind of sad for us was revenge of Mummy was closed due to maintenance work.we went there on weekday so it was comparatively less crowded so the waiting time was pretty less for us.We enjoyed alot

name: user_1856
review: Before going to universal studios install the app, It is very useful to track rides and u can check shows timings and u can track rides without waiting.

name: user_1857
review: had an amazing day at Universal Studios and were there from open to close. We did initially get some incorrect Information from two workers who had us line up in the general admission line before opening despite having the premium express passes. We did realise these ourselves and correct it after a while though. The park wasnt that busy to start with and we were beginning to think the express passes werent worth it but by the end of the day when our kids were hopping off one ride and getting back on within a minute or two it was definitely worth it. The transformers ride was a favourite of ours and my children loved the Water World show. I didnt eat there besides and ice-cream for the kids but food wasnt too expensive.

name: user_1858
review: Had an awesome time there with my wife. If you are planning to go all the rides it is better to purchase the express tickets unless you will have to wait 20 minutes for each ride till you get in.

name: user_1859
review: Took my son here and we had a great day. We arrived at 10am and left at 6pm. We got to go on every ride and some two or more. We went during a weekday it was busy but we managed to do everything. Bring a hat or umbrella as it does get hot walking around and there is not alot of shade walking between rides. For smokers there is one designated smoking area near Mels diner. Food and drink is expensive. If you can, pack bottled water and bring some snacks.

name: user_1860
review: A little bit pricey..

name: user_1862
review: I enjoyed so much in this area.

name: user_1863
review: One of the most sought tourist destination in Singapore. Please keep in mind that you get very limited time to do all the rides so better use time effiiently.

name: user_1864
review: Waiting time to long. Closing arena too quick.

name: user_1867
review: Open at 10am. Ticket buying online can queue directly, no need to change ticket. Show the bar code. You can download the app Universal studio Singapore for queuing the line and the show time table. If you have raincoat for the Jurassic park rapid adventure, you don't need to hire safe box for you bag. Otherwise it cost 4 for one hour.

name: user_1868
review: A check-in place that thousands of people want to go to, nothing more to say but too beautiful

name: user_1869
review: The themed facilities are very serious and fun, so you dont have to wait in line for too long.

name: user_1871
review: Most thrilling and funfilled park , Must visit in Singapore

name: user_1873
review: A good place to spend a whole day. The games are nice.

name: user_1875
review: Fantastic day out! Park was half empty on a Sunday, got on all the rides straight away far far away is amazing, felt like you were in the shrek 2 movie lockers to rent could be cheaper though...

name: user_1877
review: I arrived around 10:30 on Monday, and the line didn't last longer than 30 minutes, no matter how long it was. I was thinking of buying Express, but it would have been a waste to buy it. I think I had to wait 30 minutes before lunch for Transformers, but since it was afternoon, I got on right away without waiting. The amusement park wasn't that big, so it was easy to get around!

name: user_1878
review: We had an extremely disappointing and horrifying experience at USS Halloween Horror Nights. Unfortunately, I booked our tickets through a sponsored link on Headout, unaware of the complexities involved. The ticketing process was confusing; in the past, there used to be one entrance ticket for the whole day entry, but now there are separate day and night passes. Misled by Headout's website, we unknowingly purchased day passes instead of night passes, spending 366 with express passes included for 2 persons only. When we arrived at the entrance, we hoped the staff would be understanding and allow us to switch to night passes with a willingness to pay the difference. However, we were denied entry with no flexibility shown. It felt unnecessarily harsh, especially since we had already paid for entry and the company had profited from it. The refusal to accommodate or show empathy was deeply disappointing. We were told to buy new tickets if we wanted to enterwe were reluctant to spend a total of 600-800 for just a few hours at a small and overcrowded theme park. In the end, we left and spent the money at VivoCity on some nice shoes instead. This experience taught us a hard lesson, spending 366 to return home upon arrival was really an upsetting experience and we doubt we will be returning to USS anytime soon.

name: user_1880
review: OMG can't just describe in words ...what an amazing experience..Must visit place in Singapore. The place is so big you can't see the whole place in one day. Buy Vip tickets if you don't have much time cause there is big queue in some rides so that takes your 2-3 hours waiting time.Don't miss the parade .

name: user_1882
review: A must visit place in Singapore...it's a once in lifetime experience...Great rides..heaven for adventures people

name: user_1883
review: Rides from my favorite to least: Cylon-the 2 tunnel drop very nice, most intense ride Human-nice 2 drops Mummy-nice drops, there were heat effects too Enchanted-very quick ride, OK coaster Canopy-OK quick ride with nice view Rapids-bring your poncho to avoid wet, nice dark ride Transformers-much better than Skyworld's Apes ride Steven spielberg-20 minutes intervals, there is heat and water Puss in boots-boring slow dark ride Space chase-boring slow dark ride Water world-boring live show with water and stunt man Shrek 4D-really long boring movie with good 3D effects Others matters: Fireworks at Friday 8pm-really small and short duration of 5 minutes Lockers-The free time dynamically adjusts based on the current wait time for the rides near Battle Star and Mummy. For other rides, they let you put stuff on shelve before riding. Bottle-I think 300ml is enough, there are many places to refill all over the park Queue-Came at Friday 9.30am. Almost no queue in the morning. Experience 9 rides in first the 2.5 hours. Queued for Cylon 40 minutes because it only opened in the afternoon that day.

name: user_1885
review: Fun day for both the adults and kids in our group, age 6 to 70. Weekday didnt feel busy or crowded but still many rides with 30 to 45 minutes wait. While getting the express pass doubles the cost of entry, it is so worth it. With the express pass never waited more than a few minutes for any ride. Disappointed that there are several rides without an express line. Heavy storm came for an hour around 2pm, after 4pm most rides had only short wait without the pass. Plenty of food options spread around the park, also restrooms also close by wherever you are. Allow a whole day to explore, have fun and have second rides on your favourites. Plenty of automated machines to purchase tickets on the day.

name: user_1890
review: What a life time ever green experience My 10 th Country is this

name: user_1891
review: Unfortunately, three attractions were closed due to technical problems. A bit too much for this price of admission.

name: user_1892
review: Visited november 13 (off peak season) and found the queues to be manageable! We mainly queued for 0-20min and only queued for more than 30min twice. (Skipped the queue for the Jurassic ride which had a 1h wait time) Would recommend visiting in Nov/Oct if you can, barring the bad weather which closes down most outdoor rides (in this case, we planned to visit the indoor rides instead). The rides here are definitely really tame and not what I would go for if I were looking for any actual thrill rollercoaster wise - though their indoor rides like the Mummy are good. Be prepared if you want to sit on the jurassic ride as you will almost certainly get wet - socks, shoes, etc. Nearly all the staff were visibly dry and unwelcoming to the point we noticed and discussed it. Very aloof, easily annoyed etc. Staff on waterworld on the other hand were really interactive and brilliant choices for their roles. I was unsure about watching a live show but it was incredibly gripping and engaging. Definitely recommend to plan your visit around the show timings if you're going.

name: user_1896
review: Universal studio is known for its rides and shows. I was a bit disappointed, maybe I had high expectations from this park too. Since I had the chance to visit Universal Studios in Los Angeles. It's too small rather the section of LA studio is bigger than this. We were short of time after spending almost the whole day but we were done with 3-4 hrs here too because my kid and her friend repeated revenge on mummy a couple of times. Jurassic park is there for namesake, hardly see any show except the water world show. Charter encounter or meet the characters were very limited. Since this is small, you don't need to have an option for a fast/express pass.

name: user_1899
review: U can take water and light snack in hand baggage

name: user_1900
review: A beautiful place to visit along with children, pack with foods, eating stuffing and great enjoyment. If you can afford to go by express pass, take it so that you can travel the whole place in a day with all the activities, else you can also plan to start early as enter first and leave last. In this way you can enjoy majority of the rides. By the end of the day it becomes less crowded and you can walk down the rides directly. If you have a kid you can take a stroller for SGD 15/20 and can also keep your bag in that. Do download the app and get handy with with shows and maps. However, Disneyworld is disney world you can not compare universal with that.

name: user_1903
review: Dont miss this place if you are visiting Singapore. Worth every penny. All the attractions are good need to wait for every ride. Some of the rides were closed due to maintenance.

name: user_1906
review: Took long time for rides

name: user_1907
review: I visited Universal Studios Singapore on a Tuesday, and while the wait times for attractions ranged from 5 to 20 minutes, Im really glad I purchased the express pass tickets. With the scorching heat in SG, I wouldnt have wanted to stand in line for even 5 minutes. The express pass made the experience much more enjoyable, allowing me to skip the lines and make the most of my time at the park. There was intermittent thunder throughout the afternoon, and the outdoor rides were temporarily closed. However, they reopened as soon as the weather improved, so it didnt disrupt the experience for long

name: user_1909
review: A must visit park if you ever visit Singapore The rides were great They have something for all ages Dont miss out the waterworld show and the speilberg show

name: user_1911
review: The ambiance is good, but the attractions are average

name: user_1912
review: Its great. But with almost 80% the price of Disneyland, I expected 80% of fun. But its not even 60%. Its great and fun but lower your expectations.

name: user_1913
review: Its more better if you travel early so you will enough time to explore

name: user_1914
review: Among the roller coasters, the Cyclone is especially fun (highly recommended!)

name: user_1916
review: It was one hell of an experience visiting the Universal Studios. We went on a weekday and experienced less rush and i was able to cover the entire studio. Pro tip: You can visit early in the morning giving you the flexibility to click infinite photographs next to the universal globe. Be ready to walk inside so better to wear some good comfy shoes. You can use klook to book your tickets in advance just like we did and saved alot of time.

name: user_1918
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a world class theme park located on Sentosa Island Singapore, offering a thrilling mix of rides, attractions, and shows based on popular movies and TV shows.
