Its the first Universal Studios theme park in Southeast Asia and having seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Jurassic Park, each immersing visitors into the magic of cinema. When I visited about a year ago, I had an incredible time exploring the park. The highlight for me was definitely the extreme rides like the Battlestar Galactica rollercoaster and the Transformers 3D experience. The live shows, such as the Water world stunt show, were also fantastic, providing some great moments of excitement and humour. I really appreciated the immersive theming in each zone, and the parks attention to detail in food and merchandise added an extra layer of enjoyment. However, one downside I noticed was that the park can get quite crowded, especially during the weekend and the prices there for food and drinks is quite expensive, like a single water bottle there cost 4 Singaporean Dollar but the food was nice though like the churros i got. Wait times for some of the popular rides were longer than expected, and the park felt a bit cramped in certain areas. While the attractions are great, a few could use some updates or new features to keep things even more cool :). Despite these drawbacks, if you enjoy theme parks and can visit during weekday, I would definitely recommend Universal Studios Singapore. It offers a fun day out for families and friends, but be prepared for the weekend crowds if youre planning to go during at that time.

name: user_1920
review: If anyone has time and scope, should visit this place; definitely with kids.

name: user_1921
review: Very nice. Rides are good, available for all who can do fast rides, simple rides. Many shows, if you can't ride, make sure you go to shows. I think they are always full but maybe better idea to go on a monday Or Tuesday. Make sure to carry water bottle. Food is expensive, carry some fruit etc and eat before leaving. If you are vegetarian, further more problem, you will get options but very few and that too very expensive. Long que in even taking picture with the cartoon character. There are two group that performs with drums and sticks etc, it was awesome. Had a very nice experience. Make sure to reach at the time as soon as they open on that day to make the most of your day.

name: user_1922
review: It's so much fun. There are only thrilling rides that you have to try! Especially Revenge of the Mummy is awesome.

name: user_1923
review: I have visited Singapore 2 times, and both times I visited universal studios, I confess that the second time was not so fantasy. But it doesn't stop. If you are going for tourism in Singapore and Sentosa Island, of course you have to visit it, especially if you have small children with you.

name: user_1924
review: Timing was not good on our part b/c of weather (rain and lightning). Couple nearby lightning strikes put a real damper (literally and figuratively) as all the outside rides shutdown for safety. The indoor rides are dated, and overall look of the place needs upgrading. Staff and operators were friendly and helpful, but the place needs a face lift. Disney needn't worry...

name: user_1928
review: I had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The park is well-maintained, with a great variety of rides and attractions for all ages. The themed zones, like Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, and Far Far Away, are immersive and full of detail. My favorite rides were the Transformers and Revenge of the Mummythrilling and high-energy! The staff were friendly, and the park had plenty of dining options that catered to different tastes. The shows, especially the Waterworld stunt performance, were spectacular and kept us entertained. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun and exciting experience for families, friends, and thrill-seekers alike. Highly recommended!

name: user_1929
review: we went on a weekday, not long wait times but there was rain/storm do the water show was delayed or cancelled. overall a good place to visit , half day is good if you dont go on rides that much

name: user_1930
review: Unfortunately not the greatest experience. This is the only theme park in the world where it seems the staff go out of their way to be rude and arrogant. All customer service goes out the window upon entry. Also don't buy the express passes as it was the biggest rip off, only allowing to use once per ride without stating this in the terms and conditions of the express pass. They hide this term and condition because u wouldn't buy it if they made it clear in the terms and conditions. We were there on a busy wet day most of the rides close if raining so steer clear of rainy days there's not much to do. This is my first ever bad review of any business because I prefer to try to highlight the positives out there. However the experience was too bad to ignore and hopefully I can't help others with their expectations of Universal Studios Singapore.

name: user_1932
review: Visited park 13/11. Due to thunderstorms almost all attractions were closed, other attractions (Mummy) closed due to technical issues leaving the park with just 3 available operating attractions only. Universal built a park in a tropical climate subject to frequent thunderstorms with attractions that cant operate in such circumstances! No announcements, no updates on whether attractions would reopen. Notifications received through app. The Park is also looking tired, worn and rather faded needs investment and freshening up in many areas. A Large attraction area (20% of park) closed until 2025 for new Minions Land but no discounted admission fee to reflect this, same price, less experience. Food quality in restaurants poor and overpriced. Check weather before attending and avoid the restaurants.

name: user_1933
review: Great rides, Make sure you choose Gallactica carefully

name: user_1935
review: Can be visited again and again. It is super fun.

name: user_1938
review: Wow an experience of a lifetime

name: user_1940
review: Some staff rush you with the picture taking sessions (Minions) even though we paid to experience that in Universal studios and waited just like everyone else in the long queue under the heat. Some others are not even good at taking the photos (Transformers). If you won't let someone else in our group take our photos, be at least a better photographer. The rides were good because there were little to none waiting times, but they closed early today because of a bit of rain, so be wary of that because then it won't be worth it otherwise. The shows are okay. Best thing about the park is probably the use of 3D because they were really good quality and the buildings for picture taking.

name: user_1943
review: It's so much fun! As rumored, Transformers are so amazing that you should definitely ride them even if you stand in line! ! I went for a weekday, but it was quite crowded

name: user_1944
review: Great place to hangout for entire day, should be medical service or ambulance ready there for any unforeseen instances

name: user_1945
review: It's v fun but expensive . Some rides are bit scary

name: user_1946
review: Recommending Future Water World, a very effective performance

name: user_1949
review: I visited Singapore specifically to visit Universal Studios. I spent a whole day there and tried everything there. Do not miss the Waterworld offer, it is very beautiful. My advice is do not buy the express unless you enter and see the situation and make sure that it is crowded. Personally, I was satisfied with the ticket to enter without the express.

name: user_1951
review: Love love good for children even the big ones

name: user_1952
review: Love the visit. Its my first time here and everything is a breeze. Highly recommend the Universal Express ticket. Will make your visit much more pleasant when you minimize the time to wait in line

name: user_1953
review: Excellent must visit place in Singapore. Pros: Transformers ride is a must do. Rollercoaster rides are also very good. Jurassic Park water ride is a very good. Dampeners: Wait times for other activities can get long. Express pass is expensive. Photo service is not worth 50 SGD charge, unless you make the most of it.

name: user_1954
review: Too bad that some attraction was under renovation and the jurassic rapid adventure was under maintenance. But overall it was very fun for me and my family

name: user_1955
review: Amazing structure, had lots of fun. Mind to keep your stuff in the locker before entering, cause most os roller coaster will demand that you keep your stuff in lockers inside the park for limited time, or pay the fee

name: user_1956
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking for a day packed with thrill, fun, and adventure! The park is well-maintained, with a variety of attractions suitable for all ages. Highlights of my visit: Transformers: The Ride and The Mummy were absolute adrenaline-pumping experiences! Highly recommended for thrill-seekers. The 4D, 7D, and 9D shows were super immersive and added a unique dimension to the visit. The themed zones like Hollywood, New York, and Jurassic Park are beautifully designed, and theres no shortage of Instagram-worthy spots. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, ensuring a seamless experience throughout. The food options are a bit pricey, but the variety is decent. My only tip would be to plan your day early to cover most attractions and make the most of your visit. I cant wait to visit again!

name: user_1957
review: Transformer ride was fantastic. Cyclone and Mummy ride was also quite good. Not many options for young children aged 6 or below. Some rides were closed and some got cancelled after entering the hall. Overall good experience

name: user_1958
review: I had a magical experience in Universal Studios Singapore. The food was overpriced, spent 58 on the food that is seen in this review. I bought an express pass, however a lot of the rides did not have Universal Express lanes so I ended up queuing even though I spent RM313 on the express pass which is double of the admission ticket. Disappointing. The Madagascar & Egypt attractions were closed, very disappointing. Battlestar Galactica was a walk in a park, not even slightly exciting. Disappointing. The toilets did not have any bidet, only tissue paper. First world country? Weird, even a third world country has a bidet. Overall, I would say my experience was still magical regardless of the shortcomings by Universal Studios Singapore.

name: user_1959
review: Great way to spend a day getting entertained by rides themed by your favourite movies of all-time. The first time I went to universal was over 25 years ago in LA. Happy to say that it has not lost its charm.

name: user_1964
review: Compact and amazing. One ride treasure hunter eas pathetic. It was for toddlers.

name: user_1965
review: Always crowded, but dont miss this place. All the rides are excellent. You need 2 days to cover all attractions. Wait time is 60min in all major rides. I enjoyed Egypt & transformers a lot ..

name: user_1966
review: I love this place and my feel good place in Singapore, however half the park was closed due to renovations and the Mummy ride closed due to maintenance, yet we are still paying the same ticket price but with less rides and more people waiting on those rides that are actually open. Really disappointed in this but still love the park. The Transformer ride will always be my favourite.

name: user_1972
review: You must visit this place when in Singapore. However, it is impossible to get around the whole thing without an additionally paid express pass. We were there out of season and didn't have time to see everything. In the season without an express pass, you will see maybe 2/3 of the main attractions, and you will spend well over half of your time in queues (90 minutes for one attraction). Personally, we wasted about 2 hours standing in queues, which we had to leave due to the failure of two queues.

name: user_1974
review: Super fun but u need at more then a day inside

name: user_1975
review: FYI Singapore Tourist Pass cannot be used for monorail. Instead, you can pay using contactless payment methods such as Mastercard or Visa which are accepted for rides on the monorail.

name: user_1976
review: If you're looking for thrill rides, there are some here, BUT THEY CLOSE THE Battle Star Galactica JUST BECAUSE OF DRIZZLE, not even a moderate rain so if you're there early better ride the Battle Star Galactica in the morning, I've been in other amusement parks where it's opened and operating the roller coaster during a monsoon rain. The queue on the transformer takes about an hour or more when we queued in the afternoon, but it's worth the wait.

name: user_1977
review: Every rides is so much fun! Too bad the revenge of the mummy ride is closed due to a maintenance

name: user_1979
review: This time I specially participated in the Halloween event at Universal Studios Singapore. I got to play in all four themed haunted houses (you can purchase them for quick clearance). Each of the four has its own characteristics, which is very exciting and fun I would especially like to mention my favorite Sweet Home haunted house! For fans who have followed all three seasons, the experience is great. I feel that the scenes, characters, and story sequence are very particular when making the haunted house. I really want to stop and take a closer look at the scenes and details. Because I only participated in the Halloween event, I didnt go to Universal Studios during the day. I would like to make a pilgrimage again next time!

name: user_1981
review: The streets here are quite crowded, even though it's a weekday not a holiday, it's still always crowded. The weather is good, it's not too hot, so you can relax for a while.

name: user_1982
review: Best shows Don't miss waterworld show and revenge of mummy ride if you visit this place

name: user_1984
review: Our visit to Universal Studios Singapore was nothing short of magical! From the moment we stepped in, we were swept into a world of thrilling rides, charming characters, and unforgettable moments. Each section of the park felt like its own little universe, packed with iconic attractions and delightful surprises at every turn.

name: user_1985
review: 2nd visited. Still same, lot of fun.

name: user_1986
review: A delightful experience, a tremendous day out with my daughter on a Sunday. The cost of tickets for entry and rides was SGD 83 , if I am recollectng right. There is an express line for the games with price tag of 3times the normal price tag, which I found exorbitant. But the sectors like hollywood, Jurassic world , waterworld and four others - they all give your money's worth. You must ride the rollercoasters particularly the roller coaster named cyclone but I would strongly recommend those with neck and head injury or if you have some kind of trouble in your heart , not to indulge . Other than these there are many options in the pyramid that is the Egypt segment or the Sci-Fi segment I would recommend everyone to watch them. There are various segments with heater is I personally 8 and patriot Jurassic world overall there are 7-8 restaurants. There are other food stalls and drink stalls as well. There are numerous stalls where mementos are available with the sticker of the logo of universal studios those things are dam costly I mean food be interested in buying a minion 6 to 7 inches soft toy with a price tag of around 30 US dollars!!! Not me. But the design of the whole amusement park is amazing and with just a single ticket you can virtually spend the whole day with your family. I think it's a must see if you go to Singapore.

name: user_1987
review: The power of the weekend visit express ticket was incredible. If you look closely, time is running shorter than you think.

name: user_1988
review: There were also attractions that were different from USJ and I enjoyed them.

name: user_1990
review: Universal Studios is an unforgettable experience! The park is filled with thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and incredibly detailed themes that transport you to different worlds. From the adrenaline rush of the roller coasters to the family-friendly shows and interactive experiences, theres something for everyone. The staff is friendly and the park is well-organized, making it easy to navigate and enjoy all the highlights. The attention to detail in each themed area is amazing, and I felt like a kid again exploring every corner. I cant recommend Universal Studios enough for a day of fun, adventure, and fantastic memories!

name: user_1992
review: My happy place! Best to try is the transformer ride! So nice and everything is quality!

name: user_1994
review: No queue last weekend . Best ride is the mummy's. Ok leave your things in the locker which is free for the first 45 minutes .effects are awesome. It's a rollercoaster ride.

name: user_1995
review: Best place to visit, you must try thr roller coaster, jurassic ride and transformer ride.

name: user_1996
review: A must visit spot! Universal Studios Singapore features seven themed zones: Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascar. Each zone is inspired by popular movies and TV shows. Rides you should take here:- Transformers: The Ride 3D Battlestar Galactica: Human vs Cylon Revenge of the Mummy Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure Puss in Boots Giant Journey Special shows you shouldnt miss: Lights, camera & action Water world (live action stunt) Lake Hollywood spectacular(fireworks) Elmos TV time Hollywood dream parade Shrek 4-D Adventure Operating hours : 10am to 7pm

name: user_1998
review: A beautiful place worth a visit Entrance fee is approximately 26 Omani Riyals per person But there is a lot of crowding on some rides, humidity, and heat

name: user_1999
review: Short vacation with my family... A bit disappointing because they still do the renovation to build a new area (Minions)

name: user_2000
review: Lots of attractions. I recommend it to everyone.

name: user_2002
review: Rollercoaster, Transformers, Jurassic Park, and Egyptian Rides, these are the Rides you shouldn't miss.

name: user_2003
review: We lined up before opening There was a huge line even though there were many groups. There's nothing to block the sunlight It was bright and hot. It was not possible to re-enter the park. It felt like it was much smaller than Japan. Lots of souvenir goods too Hello Kitty, Gude Dama, etc. There are so many Japanese characters Much closer to Japan? I thought so. On this day, the wait was about 30 minutes, which was relatively good. Apparently the day before was some kind of holiday. Apparently it was an 80 minute wait.

name: user_2005
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking to experience world-class entertainment and thrills in the heart of Sentosa! This theme park may be compact compared to other Universal Studios parks, but its packed with top-tier attractions, exciting rides, and themed zones that bring beloved movies and characters to life. From the heart-pounding excitement of the Battlestar Galactica roller coasters to the immersive world of Transformers and the magical kingdom of Far Far Away, theres something for everyone, whether youre a thrill-seeker, a movie buff, or visiting with family. The special effects and attention to detail in each attraction are impressive, truly transporting you into the worlds of your favorite films. The character meet-and-greets are a big hit, especially for families with young kids, and the parades add a vibrant, joyful touch to the experience. The food options within the park cater to a variety of tastes, though they are a bit priceyas expected in a theme park. However, there are plenty of fun themed snacks worth trying. The staff here are friendly and efficient, keeping the lines moving and ensuring everyone has a great time. Plan ahead and consider getting an Express Pass, especially during peak hours, as some rides have long wait times. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore delivers an unforgettable day filled with excitement, laughter, and wonder. Its a fantastic escape into the world of movies and magic and well worth the visit for anyone in Singapore. Highly recommended for families, couples, and anyone with a love for adventure!

name: user_2006
review: Halloween at Universal Studios is especially fun

name: user_2007
review: Had lots of fun. Fast pass and early entrance tickets are essential if you want to avoid the endless long queue

name: user_2008
review: A must visit place for adults as well as k7ds over 8 I feel. You get to experience best rides , watch amazing live shows and attend various meet and greet events with different characters. Do carry a good hat or cap , a water bottle . Try to reach early . Go for express pass if you want to do rides multiple times. Even if you don't go for express pass you should be able to do all rides and everything at least once for sure. Make sure to visit during weekday to avoid rush. Keep yourself hydrated and me sure you cover enough rides before going for a heavy meal. Enjoy.....

name: user_2009
review: I had an amazing time at Universal Studios Singapore! The parks themed zones, thrilling rides, and live shows make it a truly magical experience. Unfortunately, some rides were closed due to rain, but the staff handled it well and kept us informed. Despite the weather, there was still so much to enjoy. Id definitely recommend visiting, rain or shineUniversal Studios Singapore is a must for anyone looking for a day filled with fun and excitement!

name: user_2011
review: Nice theme park and PLEASE GET EXPRESS PASS IF YOU VISIT WITH FAMILY AND ON WEEKEND OR HOLIDAY. THE QUEUES ARE INSANE. The theme park food is so expensive but expected lah. I will explain some rides rating below. PLEASE BRING UMBRELLA SG WEATHER UNPREDICTABLE. and bring ur own water becoz got water station,Water 4 sgd leh. Many giftshops around so many souvenirs available. Please don't bring young kids onto rollercoaster rides like transformers or mummy they keep crying summore its a literal drop rollercoaster. I recommend kt grill and goldilocks for food. Some ride need to pay for locker, pls use locker or else mafan need to put belongings somewhere when on a ride. 1. Revenge of the mummy. The queues are long. My entire family was flabbergasted and almost vomited. Vigorous spinning, dropping and speeding up. Do not recommend for young kids and weak people, older kids maybe can lah based on if they are ok with it 2. Transformers 4d movie. It was also rollercoaster with spinning and speeding up, its kinda nice but queue is long 3. Seasame street spaghetti space chase. Great for seniors and younger children but no thrill at all it's so slow 4. Raptor rapids. My favourite ride so far. Guy at entrance was funny. The ride itself was exciting and there was a drop at the end. Others clothes were all soaked but only my converse was drenched. I thought the trex would spray water at us 5. Trolls hug time jubilee. Relaxing and fun for young families with bubbles and confetti. 6. Waterworld show. It was quite funny and exciting but not rlly for young kids becoz got gunfire, fireworks, fire and explosions. Don't sit at blue seats because you WILL get wet. The show itself 20 minutes long.

name: user_2016
review: A beautiful and wonderful place, suitable for families, children and young people as well I recommend visiting it early

name: user_2017
review: To expensive for the services offered.

name: user_2018
review: Totally worth the price.

name: user_2019
review: The first time I visited universal studios Singapore In 2015 I was pretty overwhelmed by all the chaos and all the fun . All the rides were amazing and I enjoyed the park till closing time . Cut to 2024 , third time visiting it and having visited some more of Disneylands and universal studios and amusement parks I felt that the park can definitely do with an update to all the rides.It was Halloween day and the park was too crowded. Thanks to the express pass. I got on all the thrill rides but they all felt bit dull compared to some of the roller coasters I tried recently. All in all good but definitely not the best universal studios.( there is Harry Potter section coming up in November 2024)

name: user_2020
review: This Univer is small so I was able to go around it quickly! Since it was a weekday, we were able to enter all the attractions quickly and there was almost no waiting time. I'm glad the kids enjoyed it too

name: user_2021
review: Food stalls staffs are not friendly. Even though we've got birthday stamp on...

name: user_2024
review: My visit to USS today 1/11/2024 required me & my family to wait a very very long que which unacceptable..it almost 2 hour for Battlestar Galactica..even others ride also average waiting time is 40 minutes..the park is closed at 5pm???

name: user_2025
review: Came here for the Halloween horror nights, they were fun but I was really blown away by how nice the park was and all the theming of the rides and areas. Really does give Disneyland a run for their money.

name: user_2026
review: I was truly impressed by Siti Nuriffa's outstanding service. When my boss unexpectedly asked me to upgrade all our companys standard passes to express passes, I quickly reached out to the sales team through the website. Siti responded promptly and managed to sort everything out within just an hour. RWS is fortunate to have such a capable and dedicated sales representative. Thank you, Siti Nuriffa! Youre amazing!

name: user_2027
review: When you have been to Universal Studios in Los Angeles and Osaka, you will find that it is really small! The minions are under maintenance, there are very few to play with.

name: user_2029
review: The amusement parks are nice and a nice, realistic experience. The ancient Egypt game was crazy and the death train game was fast and finished in about a minute with one turn. The 3D experience of the castle from the movie Shrek Al-Akhdar was crazy. Of course, release, release, and some of the games describe a long period of time that makes you melt from the heat and get tired of standing, but the place is really fun..

name: user_2031
review: Attended the special Halloween show of universal studios. So much fun. We brought out kids and there were the regular rides eg. Transformers, mummy plus the Halloween shows. Weather was cool relaxing. Very memorable time! Glad I came on Halloween.

name: user_2033
review: I was pleasantly surprised. Small crowds and great rides, get the express pass and little or no waiting in lines.

name: user_2034
review: Universal Studios Singapore was an absolute blast! The rides were thrilling, especially the Transformers, and the themed zones were immersive and fun for all ages. My family and I had an incredible time with endless fun and excitement. Its a must-visit for an unforgettable day in Singapore!

name: user_2035
review: Mummy ride was scary and must be done in the list

name: user_2037
review: A great example for how a great idea can be ruined. Basically you pay for standing in different queues for hours, and in between sometimes you get to enjoy the offered shows. There are no screens to inform that how long you have to stand in a line. For some shows you wait more than an hour, standing, there are no restrooms, not a family friendly concept. Very bad ratio for not so little money... Only recommend if you like to wait and pay for it.

name: user_2038
review: So my family and I had a great time at USS, and it was our first trip in almost 13 years actually! We enjoyed the flagship attractions like the twin Battlestar Galactica roller coasters (especially the hanging Cylon one with its insane multiple loops), the Mummy dark ride coaster (that goes backwards and also gives sudden jerky stops), the Transformers 3D ride, and the fun 4D experience with Shrek & co. at the Far Far Away castle. Even if the Madagascar area that we went to back in 2011 was no longer there, as it was being replaced by Minions Land that will open in 2025. We also had our meal at USS due to lunch hour being at the halfway mark of our visit (we entered the park at 1005 hrs when it just opened) and what better place than the main F&B outlet that looks just like the one in the Jurassic Park movies? The meals were a bit on the pricey side but the large replica T-Rex in the center of the building was good eye candy though! However, two things did spoil the experience slightly: firstly, the queues were insane, ranging from 30 to 50 minutes so we should get the express pass in future and secondly, it was really hot and humid on the day we were at USS, but luckily we brought our own bottles and there were lots of convenient water fountains all over the park too.

name: user_2039
review: Finally got the chance to take pic here hehe... Next time i'll come again with mom and my love

name: user_2041
review: Went today, quite disappointed with how small the park is. We paid for a express pass each but you can only use it once at each ride and some rides you can't use the express pass. Really only 3 scary rides for adults. Start at the back of the park first. No one was there, by 12pm the park was packed.

name: user_2042
review: headed down to halloween horror nights 12 this year! had more fun than expected and honestly it was really easy to navigate around the amusement park :) went on a friday night and the crowd was busy but still okay! absolutely recommend buying tickets in advance

name: user_2046
review: It is smaller than those in Orlando, but the price is also much more affordable, making it worth it. In one day you can visit all the attractions, and if possible it is advisable to go on a weekday so that there are fewer people and the lines are not very long. Food prices are high, but you can bring snacks because they don't search you at the entrance

name: user_2047
review: This is the worst service of universal studios I have ever seen. The express ticket doesn't make any difference in most rides. The staff is very rude. The worst experience in years for the money.

name: user_2049
review: Not so bad but Not so good. You could finish playing all the facilities within 3 hours. Cant really compare with Japan Universal Studios. No need to buy fast pass!!! (You wont need it!!! Trust me)

name: user_2051
review: Highly recommended buying express pass in advance

name: user_2052
review: I love going to amusement parks, this was my second visit to Universal overall and first to Singapore. So needless to say, I loved it.

name: user_2054
review: Great place for kids and adults fair dinkum fun and plenty of toilets around the only thing I personally didnt like was the water in the cartons but waters water.

name: user_2055
review: Went on the mummy ride, the human ride, the enchanted airways ride, the puss in boots ride, spaghetti space thingy ride, the turning in circle cups ride. Overall a pleasant experience - especially the drop during the human ride, that was so thrilling that i screamed even though i just recovered from a sore throat!

name: user_2056
review: Much smaller than Disneyland or other such theme park, and rides are very small and not scary at all. Good thing is the wait time is very less. The dinosaur boat ride is a must do

name: user_2057
review: A good place for a holiday, the rides are cool and not boring. Can't wait to visit here again

name: user_2059
review: We had a fun time at Universal, but this is clearly the weakest park in their line up. The park felt very crowded and congested in certain areas. Once the Minion area opens, I guess guestflows will be better. It rubbed me the wrong way that they heavily advertise their Express pass service. Every 100 or so meters there was an employee waiving around with a banner about this. The River Adventure ride was closed for maintenance, which wasn't advertised during booking, on the app or on the website. A huge let down, because the amount of big rides is already quite limited. We arrived at 10 sharp and managed to complete the big 7 rides by 11. When we walked back towards the entrance the queues really started to built up there. So; arrive early. Start at Transformers, then work your way towards the Shrek area. At certain times the music/entertainment was blasting out very loudly. In combination with the high amount of guests, sometimea very narrow paths that were obstructes by themeing, this created a rather unpleasant and chaotic environment. 60 Eur admission seemed fair to us. We will not be going back anytime soon. If they added a few more areas, we would consider it.

name: user_2062
review: Unfortunately, compared to Universal, Orlando is a bit inadequate in terms of toys and space, but having such a place still makes the city fun.

name: user_2068
review: The visit was great, we had a lot of fun. The possibility that you can queue up in a single-ride line if you are traveling alone saves a lot of waiting time Unfortunately, part of the park was still under construction but the rest of the park was great and very clean! We'll be back ;-)

name: user_2072
review: This year Halloween Night is enjoyable. Very entertaining. A lot of scary NPC, always heard someone screaming across the walking street Just the waiting time are too long, average waiting time is 45-60mins even on weekday. Advisable to buy express ticket if money is not an issue

name: user_2073
review: Kids have to be older to have fun playing, around 12-13 and up.

name: user_2074
review: Expensive. Little thing to play Supper long queue

name: user_2077
review: Great food and drinks, but there are only a handful of rides compared to other universal studios around the world. Still it was fun and cheaper than other universal studios so it's worth checking out if you're a die-hard universal fan and happen to be in Singapore, but there are more interesting things to do there like China town, Little India, Gardens by the Bay, and of course the marina with the famous Marina Bay Sands hotel

name: user_2079
review: This is one of a good places in Sentosa Singapore. I recommend you buy the ticket before the day you come here. And I'm here early at the opening time to take time more.

name: user_2082
review: Superb Experience...Need atleast a day to explore the entire location.

name: user_2083
review: Good place to visit and can enjoy your childhood together with your kids overall very good experience but couldnt finish all the game coz limited time sure will visit again! The most amazing part for me at transformer 3D thempark

name: user_2085
review: Amazing place in SG...bought ticket in Agoda less expensive .We have rides and it was amazing.. however we were not able to explore much as they closed early on Sunday till 5 pm pnly

name: user_2086
review: Good place for childrens

name: user_2087
review: It was a one of a kind experience. The Rollercoasters and the movie themed rides were really fun and worth wait. I have to say try to avoid weekends to get less waiting time.

name: user_2088
review: It is an old and neglected park. Without a doubt the worst I have visited. That's why it's the cheapest, but I still didn't think it was worth it. If you don't like roller coasters this park doesn't have much to offer. The waterworld show that is its main attraction on the day we visited only had two shows that we did not coincide with. Its streets and in general feel old, neglected and lack of maintenance. I don't recommend it at all

name: user_2090
review: I don't know if it was because it rained a bit in the morning or if it was a great success because it was Sunday, but there were really few people so I don't think you need to buy the pass : Before riding a roller coaster-type ride, you have to leave your luggage in a locker (you can't even bring your cell phone with you to get on the ride). Some lockers charge an additional 4. It's Halloween right now, so if you make eye contact during the parade, you'll be given candy.

name: user_2093
review: Park is great. Fantasticly themed and great selection of rides and food. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and happy to help. Would recommend taking the train here from anywhere. Its about 2 and very quick. Beat all the traffic.

name: user_2094
review: Must visit! I have been to many theme parks but none of them were as good as USS. They have rides which amuses every age group and the rides are unique and super fun.

name: user_2096
review: A few attractions were close for either improvement or repair when we visited. The street performance was a bit lacking in terms of length and showmanship sadly.

name: user_2097
review: What a great attraction and amusement park for fun

name: user_2098
review: The older you get, the more afraid you are of going on the rides, it's good to come here on Halloween because at night the track doesn't have to queue, and it turns out you can just take photos in front of the globe without going into the uss, but it costs quite a bit for the photos if you charge 100k Rupiah.

name: user_2101
review: Thrilling rides, spectacular shows! Must-visit for thrill-seekers. Arrive early, no need to use Express Pass. Unforgettable fun!" Don't miss: - Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon roller coaster - Transformer 3D ride in Sci-fi city - Waterworld live show

name: user_2102
review: Overall, 2/10, worst theme park ever. First of all, I must start with the obvious problem, long waiting time (I know, this is normal for most famous theme parks but hear me out), after waiting for so long I finally get to try one of the game inside the theme park, and guess what? It was VERY boring, I tried one of the 'egypt car ride' game and tons of people was lining up to try it out (even though the car was very slow, and it feels like a filler to make the theme park looks bigger). And oh my god, it was the worst and the most boring 7 minutes of my life. Just so you know, I waited for 22 minutes to try out the game, and it gave me the worst experience ever. I tried out a couple of games again later, but it's almost the same. The only good one was the roller coaster.

name: user_2106
review: Transformers n revenge of the mummy n jurassic park n Shrek rides were good but the worst ride was treasure hunters which was waste of time , spaghetti space chase is for kids but not entertaining though n v missed minion ride n King Kong 3d rides which were in Los Angeles USA but not in Singapore n even the studio tour where they show psycho character which was missing here in Singapore but the waiting time was lot less compared to Los Angeles

name: user_2107
review: Spent a whole day here: would require two day trips to cover entire theme parks and the rides

name: user_2110
review: There are several attractions and rides that you can try, but as a suggestion, if you come in the morning, you should visit the rides at the back because you won't have to wait too long.

name: user_2111
review: The area is too small.

name: user_2114
review: Very fun. I like it a lot. Opened up new experiences.

name: user_2115
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a favorite destination for both adults and children alike. The variety of rides cater to all ages, providing thrills and excitement for everyone. The park is also filled with souvenir shops and food stalls at every turn, making it the perfect place to shop and dine. Weekends at Universal Studios Singapore can get quite crowded, so it is advisable to arrive early to beat the queues. Waiting times for popular rides such as Battlestar Galactica and Transformers can be as long as an hour, especially if you have a standard ticket. Despite the crowds, the shows at Universal Studios Singapore are always spectacular and worth watching. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun-filled day for the whole family. From heart-pounding rides to entertaining shows, there is something for everyone to enjoy. So grab your friends and family and head to Universal Studios Singapore for a day of fun and adventure.

name: user_2118
review: Amazing place to visit... wonderful presentations of everything, including the rides...

name: user_2120
review: First in Asia.

name: user_2121
review: After visiting Universal in Florida, Los Angeles, I would say the one in Singapore is just too small and features almost nothing. The wayfinding and directions are flawed. The staff at some of the rides are rude and non-cooperative. The food outlets are limited for vegetarians and everything is just overpriced to a very high extent. 6 for a plastic to wrap your self in the wet ride? 4 for a can of basic soft drink? There are no directions on how to reach via cable car. Not a very good experience when compared to the price paid.

name: user_2122
review: Waiting times are longer at every ride. Hot and humid. They close by sharp 5pm. They start chasing you out and don't let use their washrooms. I suggest they start early by 8am so that people can enjoy with milder weather. Worth the money for the shows present. Mummy ride and Transformers ride are the best. Canopy flyer and River adventure at Jurassic world were good too.

name: user_2123
review: Its a great deal to include a piece of food with the Halloween package. This time, start from the upper left corner and go clockwise, it wont be too crowded; I only had to wait for about half an hour for Jurassic; Water World is worth seeing, remember not to be blocked.

name: user_2124
review: We recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and it was an exhilarating experience from start to finish! Nestled within the Resorts World Sentosa, this theme park offers an impressive array of attractions, shows, and dining options that cater to visitors of all ages. As soon as I entered the park, I was struck by the vibrant atmosphere and the detailed theming of each zone. From the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City to the enchanting streets of Far Far Away, every area is beautifully designed and immersive. The iconic Hollywood Boulevard sets the stage perfectly with its charming shops and street performances. One of the highlights of my visit was the rides. The **Transformers: The Ride** was a standout, combining cutting-edge technology with thrilling action that left me breathless. The **Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure** was another favorite, offering both excitement and a chance to cool off from the Singapore heat. For those seeking a more family-friendly experience, the **Shrek 4-D Adventure** was delightful, filled with humor and engaging visuals. The live shows were equally impressive. The **WaterWorld** stunt show was a thrilling spectacle with jaw-dropping stunts and pyrotechnics that captivated the audience. Its a must-see for anyone visiting the park! Dining options are plentiful, with various cuisines available. I enjoyed a delicious meal at Mel's Drive-In, which offered classic American fare in a retro setting. While the food was tasty, prices were a bit on the higher side, which is typical for theme parks. One thing to keep in mind is that the park can get quite crowded, especially on weekends and holidays. I recommend arriving early and considering an Express Pass to make the most of your day without long wait times. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination filled with fun, adventure, and unforgettable experiences. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or just looking to enjoy a day of entertainment, its a great choice. I left with wonderful memories and cant wait to return! Highly recommended for families and friends alike.

name: user_2127
review: Went there with 5 teenage kids. We went to Disney sea in Tokyo the week before and Universal Studios in Singapore was another level better. Great rides and actually wasnt too busy. Maybe this helped on how we enjoyed. We decided not to get express pass. Best decision ever. Longest wait was probably 15min but most times we got straight on rides or rides had to go empty as not enough people. Kids loved it, so many good rides

name: user_2130
review: Fun, lots of toys

name: user_2133
review: Good. But it is small compared to USA. Take priority pass if on weekends to cover more rides.

name: user_2134
review: On our eldest sons birthday, we went to Universal Studios to celebrate his birthday The park is not big but the amusement facilities are very fun. From entering the park at 10 o'clock to 5 p.m., you can find all the facilities you want to play.

name: user_2136
review: Wonderful experience. If you want to visit it will take time

name: user_2138
review: It was a hot but enjoyable amusement park. Especially Shrek-chan.

name: user_2139
review: Fun and adventure! But just make sure don't go on holiday!

name: user_2140
review: We went on a Friday (no bank Holiday or school holidays). It was still so full that the queues we're 30-60min on every ride (and including the food stalls...). And the rides are super short. Fast track pass is pretty expensive imo but if you want a good experience without having to stand in line everywhere you're almost pressured to buy it. That might have even been the reason the queues were so long, cause people with a fast track pass kept being let through. It's very pay to win. However the park is pretty but very small. Not a lot of rides (but therefore an awful lot of people, even on a weekday). For us this was the most overpriced and most easy to skip experience when visiting singapore and probably the amusement park we enjoyed the least so far. The "universal" globe is outside the park, so if you just want to take a picture of that and skip actually buying a ticket and going in you're not missing out on too much imo.

name: user_2143
review: It is recommended to purchase priority coupons

name: user_2145
review: Very Very fun place. I want to go back here if i could

name: user_2147
review: It was worth the day trip, and you could go to enjoy the sentosa island afterwards. Watch out for the pricing since it is really expensive everywhere. P.s. buy the express pass included to save your time and having most of the experience

name: user_2149
review: I love all the rides at universal studios I really liked, the return of the mummy, the cyborg and human roller coasters, and the one with the dragon. Also do check out the water city thing.

name: user_2150
review: A fun time for kids and adults. Food and drinks are ridiculously overpriced. The chubby guy with glasses at guest services is incredibly rude and doesn't want to help anyone.

name: user_2151
review: We visited twice in 1 day. Enjoyed the park and all of its rides during the day and the Halloween night. Both are amazing to do. My suggestion would be in the daytime do the rollercoasters on open followed by transformers. Most rides have a single person line and so we made use of this! In the evening we did the 2nd Halloween maze, then 3rd, then 4th and back to 1. This seemed to help us avoid the queues as much!

name: user_2152
review: Nice place to visit It was raining heavily on that day, however, they still operated most rides and shows as usual

name: user_2153
review: Children need to be taller than 1m

name: user_2155
review: A compact theme park that you're quite able to go around in one day. The waiting times were reasonable during my visit.. ranging from 20 to 40 mins. Some of the ques were deceptively short from the outside because there is quite an extended queuing line inside the building. Transformers, the Mummy, Jurassic park, Shrek 4D cinema were worth the wait. The rides whilst thrilling were too short especially considering the que times. Food as expected was overpriced. Tip 1 : get your souvenirs at the main shop near the entrance as they have the full range so you can enjoy them throughout your visit. Tip 2 : be aware that the park may close early on some days. Tip 3 : your day will suck as outdoor rides will not operate if it rains heavily. Tip 4 : Ask the operator if the ride shakes you about to check suitability for those who may not like it. Overall (if weather gods are kind).. enjoyable day out.

name: user_2157
review: Good place to visit once... But highly rated... Should be in a long queue and wait for atleast an hour driing the peak seasons...

name: user_2159
review: Great place for people of all age, but rides and attractions should be more. Theyre quite limited.

name: user_2162
review: Universal Studios is a must-see if you are visiting Singapore. If you enjoy movie-themed rides, roller coasters, cartoon mascots, and all things silly and wonderful, this is the place for you! You cannot see everything in one day, so try to arrive as early as possible. However, here are a few tips: 1. Get an Express Pass or you will spend the majority of the day lining up for rides. Typical tickets require you to wait for 30-60 minutes or more, which is extremely frustrating! 2. I recommend bringing a personal fan and water with you. The humidity can make you tired quickly. Water is not cheap either! 3. Eat before you leave... So you have energy, and you will not have to spend as much money on food while you are there. Unless, of course, you are also there for the food.

name: user_2164
review: Highly disappointed. In 7 hour of operation with over 15 options with average waiting time of around 20-50 minutes; we land up doing only 4-5 attractions. At S83, it is a rip off. To ride 10 attractions, you need to buy an express pass at an additional S90. My suggestion is to either restrict the number of visitors per day or increase the park timing from 10-5pm to 9-7pm or introduce a 2 day pass at discounted pricing. Let every penny spent can be enjoyed.

name: user_2165
review: We loved playing around however the park closed at 5pm which is a bummer because we did not got the chance to play all the rides.

name: user_2166
review: Friendly for all ages. Wheelchair friendly. The street pop up shows add so much joy - could have passed the day without any rides at all. Though the water splash ride got our shoes soaked to the core (not the fav part) But very friendly staff and joyous performers.

name: user_2168
review: Super cool to experience many rides and shows but not up to the mark with US Overcrowded and force to take exp pass with is double the entry pass Long wait for all rides and make you feel tired by noon

name: user_2169
review: It has some good rides but it is very expensive.

name: user_2170
review: Wow. You can't write in words. had a blast in here. Universal Studios had one of the best time. We did/enjoyed Rides like Lights, Camera, Action, transformers, accelerator, spaghetti world, Canopy flyer & Jurassic park rides, Shark 4D, Treasure Hunters. They have locker facility near every rides. One can use them for 60 minutes free. We could not do Revenge of Mummy because of my Kid height issue (Minimum height needed for Kid for any roller coaster is 122 cm). However must do is Lights, Camera, Action, transformers, Canopy flyer, Shark 4D with Kids. Waiting time for each rides is approx 30-40 minutes. It opens on 10 AM and closes on 5 PM evening. Had a blast

name: user_2174
review: Horribly hot weather in Singapore and the park does not have much shade or misting fans to help with that. 2 rides had technical issues and people were stuck queuing for an extra 15 minutes. Horrible experience coz of the weather and wait time. The weather made every visitor sweaty and queuing with the body odour of everyone made the wait even more like a nightmare. Like most theme parks in the world, everything in the park is overpriced. So that isn't new. Wouldn't visit the USS again unless it snows in Singapore or they can aircondition at least 70% of the park

name: user_2175
review: Having visited Universal Studios Singapore several times before, I recently returned after a long hiatus, eager to see how it had evolved. Unfortunately, my recent experience wasn't ideal. Despite purchasing tickets weeks in advance, the park was extremely crowded. While I expected lines for the rides, the wait times were excessive. We queued for the Cyclone roller coaster for over two and a half hours, only to be met with an announcement of an indefinite delay. This, coupled with the intense heat, led us to abandon the queue, a decision shared by many others. We did manage to experience two other rides, but each came with a wait time of at least an hour. The congestion was pervasive, impacting even the express lines. It felt as though the park had overreached its capacity, diminishing the overall experience. Perhaps implementing a queuing limit or a reservation system for popular rides would alleviate this issue. Compared to other Universal Studios parks, such as those in Japan or Orlando, Singapore's offering feels smaller and less engaging. While it may be a suitable option for those with budget constraints or limited travel opportunities, especially within Southeast Asia, I would recommend exploring other Universal Studios parks for a more fulfilling experience. It's worth noting that I visited during peak season (Indonesia's holiday, causing influx of visits in Singapore) which undoubtedly contributed to the extensive wait times. A friend who visited recently during the off-season reported significantly shorter queues. While longer waits are expected during peak periods, the park should consider implementing measures to improve the queuing system and overall guest experience during these busy times.

name: user_2176
review: Amazing experience, 4D effects are great. Must visit, but pls plan the entire day and book your tickets in advance. Visit on weekdays to avoid huge crowds and long queues for rides.

name: user_2180
review: A special place. It's worth spending the whole day there. Great fun. You pay one ticket for entry and all attractions are included in the price. There are queues for some of them. The whole day may not be enough.

name: user_2181
review: Really enjoyed our visit here. The rain was such a bummer but overall, we had fun!

name: user_2183
review: Excellent Experience. Good to visit at Universal studio. Recommend to take express ride pass to avoid any waiting for long que... Good Luck and Kind Regards Parminder singh

name: user_2184
review: If u r visiting , do buy express pass. U ll be able to do all rides otherwise forget it. Wait time is too long

name: user_798
review: 4/10. If the ghosts were more asian influenced instead of western, it wouldve been a million times scarier and more worth our money - otherwise all okay.

name: user_2185
review: Excellent,safe, convenient, use its own app to know wait time, 1. Egypt ride 2 cyclone 3 Transformer 4 Jurassic boat ride 5 Human ride These are 5 must do activities, dont buy express tickets on weekdays . Wait for lunch time after that rides will be less crowded. Or better to be in queue at 9:30 am buy tickets in advance with klook app in economical rates

name: user_2186
review: It was so pretty that I couldn't stop looking at it. The rides were fun too.

name: user_2187
review: We separated into the universal group and the aquarium group. I chose the aquarium so I didn't go inside, but I heard that there was less waiting time than in Japan and I was able to ride many attractions.

name: user_2188
review: If you have extra buy the express ticket if not just go solo ride instead of the normal as it be faster waiting time.... Theres always que so choose which you want to ride the most... Higly recommended revenge of the mummy,transformer,battlestar galatica,light camera action(not rides ya,bt stil fun experience),for this ride do it last as you might get wet-jurrasic park rapids.... Lastly not a ride but show,seriously super fun and really worth your time to spend sitting and enjoy the show- water world performance,if you love to get wet sit in the middle front definately will 100% wet....Just remember to plan it all out so you get the best enjoyable experience.... Also if you want limited edition souvenir,shop at UNIVRS, of coz expensive la,limited ma.... Alright enjoy y'all

name: user_2189
review: Went with my family today 4/10/24. Waiting time was 60-70min per ride. Was very busy and also a lot of people pushing. It was totally over crowded. Truth be said.. we did have fun.. managing only to go on 3 rides. However I am giving a 1 star.. reason being ..for 1 young very rude security worker.. verbally pushing me and my kids to exit the site without my wife. Even though I had mentioned it to him .. (my kids and I , had just exited the toilet and was waiting for my wife to exit the toilets). He was totally rude and ruined the whole day. We paid over 400 and at the end we got chased and pushed out by the security .. because they had some halloween event after 5pm.

name: user_2190
review: Thank you so much, Alexis at Universal Studios Singapore! I go to Universal Studios Sinagapore every time I visit Singapore and this time made my 3rd with my parents. We all had fun until my mom got on Revenge of the Mummy. It was my mistake that my mom let to ride on because she barely can ride any rides since she has vestibular neuritis I just didn't think of this fact until we got on the ride. Revenge of the Mummy isn't really scary but for my mom it was; it drops down and turns with high speed and as a result, her condition got bad; vestibular neuritis has attacked her again. This does come around her once or twice a year so I felt very sorry for my mom that I didn't take care of her enough. We had to ask for a help to one of a staff and he called a manager and she helped us all the way to get my mom takes enough rest. Thank you so much, Alexis and to all staff who cared and helped us! The place where my mom took a rest was near the entrance so we had to walk all the way back. Since my mom was having difficulties walking by herself even we give our hands to her so, Alexis prepared a wheelchair, she tried to help my mom being cool by blocking strong sunlight and hot humid weather while we were walking down the road. We could feel that Alexis really did concern my mom sincerely and she tried her best to help us out. So, once again thank you so much Alexis because of your heart-warming help my mom was able to got better quickly and we came back home safe. On our next visit, I'll make sure my mom will not get on any rides again. :) Thank you so much.

name: user_2192
review: Take a photo in front of the globe when you get home and then enter first. Open run is the answer. If you don't have an express ticket, you have to go at 9 o'clock, otherwise you really need an express ticket. Admission tickets are around 80,000 won express tickets are around 90,000 won... It's really expensive. No matter how hot it is, people explode. It's nice that there are facilities so you can wait in the shade even if the waiting line is long, but the standard waiting time is over 50 minutes. If you don't have an express ticket, raise your hand quickly and use it when a single ride seat becomes empty. I didn't know what it was, but found out later. There is a locker at the entrance for about 12 for 4 hours. Payment is made by card, but Amex cards rarely work in Singapore. Go inside and there is a storage box near Egypt(?), but there are a lot of people, so let's leave it at the entrance. There aren't many places to buy souvenirs or drinks. It's crowded near the entrance, and the further you go inside, the more rides there are. It is not sold everywhere like Everland. If you see a place selling something, I recommend buying it right away. When entering a restaurant, the group will take a seat and one person will go to order food.

name: user_2193
review: Good experience, pls expect waiting on weekends, try to reach by 10 AM, TRY THE RIDE CYCLONE WITH EXTREME CAUTION, It'll be very hot so carry a bottle of water. The food inside will be very expensive

name: user_2195
review: Absolutely amazing, the rides are insane and the overall ambience of the place is brilliant. It does take your entire day, so I'd recommend to enter when the park opens. Download the universal studios app to locate all the rides and see the wait times. There are also different live shows throughout the day in each zone, the app will help to plan your day accordingly. Recommended rides - Battlestar Galactica Cyclon & Human, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic park rapids, Transformers 3D ride, Puss in boots giant journey.

name: user_2200
review: You can't really complete the full rides in a day especially during halloween time when the hours are restricted to 5pm. Either go for an express pass or skip it altogether. Some rides had mechanical failure and such waste of time. They don't give any extension for that.

name: user_2201
review: One of the landmark places to visit while in Singapore. Most important If you can plan on weekday it's better. However, incase you have weekend available do plan but start early. Go inside on the opening time. The rides are enough to keep you engaged whole day. On weekend 40 mins wait is standard time. Food and juices are available inside. Roller coasters have most wait times. Prayer room is also available. There can be combos offered but I think only separate dedicated trip is recommended. To reach monorail from Vivo center is most convenient way which cost 4/5 Singapore dollar. Transformers was acclaimed to be worth watching in 4d etc but after few days I found 6d experience at genting Highland which was far better. However in rides, universal studios is far superior to genting Highland. Overall it's a wonderful experience and also costly but it's only once a while and worth it.

name: user_2202
review: It was overcast but this just meant that it was not as busy as normal. Had a great day and got to ride the transform ride, the human one and the colon (dam you auto correct!) Both are great!

name: user_2203
review: You just can't have one day to complete everything. A must go and for people who can manage atleast two days is a must!! This is one of the best made attractions I've been to! What an experience!

name: user_2205
review: For those who want to come from Malaysia with their own car, these are tips for you. Apply vep and autopass. Can do two weeks before you enter. Cost 10 sgd. After getting a confirmation email. Can be picked up at two locations provided. We spent the night around danga bay the day before we entered singapore and the uss. Topap auto pass is ready. Myica filling is ready. Individually or in groups. Topap autopass using the Nets application. 50sgd is enough. When it arrives at uss. He parked in the B1 East area. Find one close to the escalator to get to uss. It's easier. For those with small children. Bring a stroller. The parking rate at uss is max at 13.10 sgd only. Boiled water standby. Umbrellas and fans. Payment close in uss easily using paywave/debit card. Activate is ready from Malaysia. So much.

name: user_2206
review: Lovely Vintage looking place. Too crowded. Waiting is an hour or later. It's just too tiring and hot to have an enjoyable time.

name: user_2207
review: Yes, its beautiful during the day, and theres a light show at night! But its not easy to find the best viewing spot!

name: user_2208
review: Nice place for rides and Amusement Universal Studios Singapore is a premier theme park located on Sentosa Island, offering a variety of attractions and entertainment options. Heres a brief review: Highlights: 1. Themed Zones: The park features seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Sci-Fi City, each with unique rides, shows, and attractions that cater to different interests. 2. Thrilling Rides: Iconic attractions such as the Transformers Ride, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, and Revenge of the Mummy provide thrilling experiences for adrenaline seekers. 3. Family-Friendly Options: There are plenty of rides and attractions suitable for younger children, such as the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure and the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase. 4. Live Shows: The park hosts entertaining live performances, including stunt shows and character meet-and-greets, adding to the immersive experience. 5. Dining and Shopping: A range of dining options, from quick snacks to sit-down meals, along with shops offering exclusive merchandise, enhances the overall experience. Considerations: Crowds: The park can get crowded, especially on weekends and holidays, so its advisable to arrive early or consider purchasing express passes to skip long lines. Ticket Prices: Entry tickets can be relatively pricey, so planning ahead for discounts or package deals is recommended. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for thrill-seekers and families alike, providing a fun and immersive experience that brings beloved movies and characters to life.

name: user_2209
review: Great rides. Shame on accelerator the attendant looked so over it. Nothing was filled.... She was so meh. Definitely go early!

name: user_2214
review: Great place to visit if coming to Singapore, cheap and cheerful. Drinks and food on the inside pretty expensive! Staff did not check my seatbelt on the main rollercoaster which I feared for my life. He should be sacked but other than that great.

name: user_2218
review: If you go with kids I would suggest buying the express pass ... Must watch1. Transformers 2. Revenge of Mummy (indoor roller coaster) little scary 3. Lights camera action 3. Jurassic park 4. Shrek 4D . Food in the food court is not great if possible plan and pack some lunch.. plenty of water to be taken

name: user_2219
review: Kids love it. Recommended for ages 10 and older. Anything below that is fine. There seems to be a difference in infants.

name: user_2220
review: Overhyped place. waste of time. ticket cost is Expensive.

name: user_2222
review: Had a great time! Make sure to download this the app to look at the wait time and decide which ride to take Mummy, transformers, human ride is a must! Buy tickets online There is not much to do for toddlers

name: user_2223
review: Its so fun that I cant stop

name: user_2224
review: The rides were okay. However, the long wait times were highly abundant. Making the experience tiring and honestly stressful. Visited only 2 Rides, the Battlestar Galatica (Human), which the wait was extremely long (3 hours), and the ancient Egyptian ride located in the pyramid, which was decently quick but don't be fooled as you think you might've reached the end of the line, No. There's an even bigger line stairs.

name: user_2226
review: I'd love this place ,Mummy is very Exciting , Transformer is good for everyone

name: user_2228
review: Great park! Very clean and friendly staff. Visited on a weekday. Pre-purchased tickets including Express pass. Crowds were not heavy but the Express pass was still worth it. Entry to the park for the Express pass is all the way to the left of the entrance. It rained a bit while we were there but it wasnt a problem. Some outdoor rides were temporarily closed due to rain but opened again quickly. Food was good at Mels Diner and reasonably priced. Dont miss the Water World show. All in all a great day at the park.

name: user_2229
review: You could spend days here and still need more time to do everything. Excellent free train that goes round the island , excellent food and atmosphere although can be expensive if you don't watch the wallet

name: user_2230
review: Nice ambience and family friendly place to visit. however way too crowded and costly, not many rides, one time visit only

name: user_2231
review: Had visited Universal studios today 07.10.24 at Singapore and was stuck nearly for an hour in Transformers due to technical issue which was informed after an hour only about technical issue and couldn't say how long it will get ready, so we had return without going in for the ride, further all rides were closed at 4.45pm and we were sent out at 5 pm, is this fair from universal studio? They could have compensated by giving extra time so we could have completed all the rides, it was over crowded today and so the waiting time for each rides were approximately 40 mins minimum, everywhere they had a display for express tickets which when obtained outside its 120 Sgd against 83 Sgd for normal ticket per person but after getting regular ticket if bought inside its 100 SGd extra per person for a group of 5 its 500 Sgd extra Is it fair? I felt a very bitter experience. A small suggestion to universal studio may need to cap the limit of entry on particular day

name: user_2232
review: The place is legendary The best places for me Transformer The mummy The red and gray train I didn't ride, frankly Express Pass is very important unless you want to waste your whole day waiting

name: user_2233
review: universal studio at singapore was so fun! the rides were thrilling and there were many options. i like the variety of food choices, the watermelon crush was my favourite, very refreshing!

name: user_2234
review: Buy vip, if not the line will be forever, ive waited 7 hours for 2 rides so please book vip

name: user_2235
review: Always good for family fun, make sure your troopers enjoy fast rides more as it focuses more on adrenaline coasters

name: user_2238
review: Go on a weekday to avoid long waiting queues, buy express pass to save on waiting time. Rides were great but this will be outdated with time. Overall good place.

name: user_2240
review: Naah! Not well organized. Very few staffs to manage the rides which increases the queue time unnecessarily. One can hardly ride 5-6 rides as the park closes at 5 and unbelievable wait time at each ride. Definitely not worth the price. My personal bad experience in comparison to other Asian theme parks.

name: user_2241
review: Very bad experience in uss , the theme park already closing early at 5pm to serve the Halloween horror night customers. Staff starts to chase the day customers out at 4.30pm . The queuing time for every rides are 80-90 mins long . The wait is very torturing . However , the Waterworld show is very recommended to catch , the actors acted well . Lastly, the management of the exiting of the day customers is very very bad. 500 pax forced to exit through a small narrow path as shown in the picture.

name: user_2242
review: It was ok. It was clean and well ventilated. We were lucky to have a good weather. It was small compared to other Universal Studios. Wait time for transformers 80mins. The mummy 15mins. Lights camera 40 mins. Shrek 4d 20mins. We were able to do all rides we wanted even without express pass. A lot of water fountain even available while in line. Food and drinks were really expensive but acceptable. Sandwich 16usd. Slushy 8sgd. Rootbeer in can 4sgd. Just wear comfy shoes because youll be on your feet for hours. Staff very polite and kind. Some of the visitors really smell and not following rules but not the parks fault. Ok to go once and able to finish in a day. We did the shrek 4d twice. Its my favorite attraction.

name: user_2244
review: The rides are great, but I wouldn't bother coming if you can't afford to buy the epress pass, as the wait times can be out of control. If you're waiting for up to an hour for each ride and the park closes at 5pm, you don't have a lot of time to relax! We bought express tickets at the park after waiting an hour for the first ride. In that time the prices went up so just accept the inevitable and buy them straight up! Great day out for the children, but like all theme parks - you need to be patient!

name: user_2245
review: It was my first time here and I really liked it

name: user_2249
review: Many rides just don't have enough time. At 5 pm it closes.

name: user_2254
review: Not as big as orlando but still worth a visit if in singapore

name: user_2255
review: This is my second visit. I felt really safe because the device held my body tightly. It was fun. Jurassic... If you don't want to get wet, wear a raincoat. I didn't wear a raincoat, but I thought it would be like the Amazon at Everland in Korea. But Amazon has waterproof fabric, right? It's not here. Just who gets wet? The difference is whether it is sufficiently wet or not.. But because the weather is so bright, it dries quickly. Universal Studios is smaller than I thought. Personally, I prefer the fantasy land of Everland.

name: user_2257
review: Visiting on weekdays and off-peak seasons basically means you don't need an express pass at all, especially if you travel alone, so save that money for something else in Sentosa. If you are visiting with kids i.e. extra time spent here and there, this would take one whole day, otherwise your trip should only take half day to complete. IP lineup is weak and facilities are pretty worn down. I visited on a rainy day which is common in SG, there were several rides temporarily closed due to the rain and one of them even stopped when there was riders on it. YMMV but if you are visiting Asia for Universial Studios, USJ in Osaka is a much better choice. Stuff are friendly and all of them can speak English fluently.

name: user_2259
review: So many activities , really loved the transformers 3D ride experience

name: user_2260
review: If you are going there, do not go with toddlers, because you almost all the rides, toddlers are not allowed. also, take the express ticket else you would waste time in queue

name: user_2261
review: Updated (2024) - reduced from 3 star to 2 star Visited in Oct on weekday of 1st week. Very very crowded and closed early beacause if the Halloween evening. Such long lines. We managed 5 rides only on a full day. I have been in many universal and Disney around the world. I Will not recommend to a friend to come here. Original (2019) Very busy and long lines although We were there mid week, on a school day, in an of peak time in February, not near Chinese new year Some rides were working under capacity so lines remain long Lines started to reduce at about 4pm. Most of what we did was between 4 and 7pm when the park closed All in all, high tkt price with low option to do "all" rides in one day

name: user_2263
review: Extremely beautiful place must visit for family, but need patience and time on hand for shows and event

name: user_2264
review: Universal Studios offers an exciting experience with a variety of rides, beautiful themed areas, and much more to explore. There are different ticket options: the normal ticket and the Express ticket. With the Express ticket, you dont have to wait in long queues for the rides, while the normal ticket usually means a 30-40 minute wait per ride. Although the Express ticket is a bit pricier, I highly recommend it for a smoother experience. Make sure to try all the ridestheyre fun and thrilling! The park operates from 10 AM to 5 PM, so plan your time accordingly. There are also themed events like Halloween and Minions that add extra entertainment throughout your visit

name: user_2266
review: Gr8 rides for adults aur kids few rides over all good.experience

name: user_2268
review: Felt like a kid again. Everyone needs to come here once in their life. If you plan on coming alone dont buy the express ticket, as most rides give single rider entry. Minion land is still under construction. Dont come if there is an announcement of rain and thunderstorms, they close 80% of the rides. Try to come in the morning as early as it opens because you just cant see everything in one day.

name: user_2269
review: Although I had to wait in line for almost two hours for Transformers 3D Showdown, it was well worth it. It was so exciting, fun and shocking that I wanted to queue for a second time

name: user_2271
review: Line up to loong

name: user_2272
review: This is a very famous place where people often travel and sightsee. And when you visit this place, you can immediately notice that there are a lot of people because it is famous. I have been here and among the things I think about, I highly recommend riding the roller coaster. It is really thrilling to ride that ride. If you go nearby, there are a lot of people, so it's a very important and nerve-wracking moment to get a girlfriend. If there's a pretty girl, make sure to date her, please. And the downside is that because there aren't too many people, the waiting time for the ride is so long that you can't even talk, so I think it's very important and recommended to visit in the morning right before business hours.

name: user_2273
review: Fantastic place, both for children and adults. Guaranteed fun.

name: user_2275
review: The transportation is convenient and there are not many crowds. Although the park is not big, there is no need to queue up. You can finish it in about half a day.

name: user_2277
review: Biggest attraction was closed

name: user_2278
review: Amazing place ! Visit on weekdays for lesser wait times !

name: user_2287
review: We visited on weekday and we could cover most of the rides and shows without express pass. However, the biggest roller Coaster was closed for maintenance, which was a major disappointment

name: user_2289
review: This place is good for children to place and tourist for picture taking.

name: user_2291
review: Super fan!! What a unique experience!!

name: user_2292
review: Visited after about 9 years nothing much changed. Still worth to spend a day. Iam bit scared of roller coaster rides hence opted rest are enjoyable. I have been to universal studios HOLLYWOOD at Los Angeles that is the BEST and very big and needs minimum 2-3 days to enjoy.

name: user_2293
review: Great smaller theme park. Good variety of rides and attractions for our kids which are aged 5 and 8.

name: user_2294
review: Getting lame no new rides and the roller coaster was on maintenance

name: user_2296
review: Had a fabulous day exploring Universal Studios and although the main ride wasn't operating there were still plenty to see and do. Loved Transformers and The Mummy rides. Really enjoyed Steven Spielberg show and Waterworld.

name: user_2297
review: A must visit place for fun, adventure and thrill

name: user_2300
review: Excellent and especially the mummy is crazy every adventure is super

name: user_2301
review: Expected queueing for more less 1 hour for less than a minute rides

name: user_2303
review: A beautiful park and lacks a bit of attraction. If you compare the park with Disneyland Paris, you will finish the park in less than a day without any problem. Thanks to King Julian and Alex

name: user_2304
review: No matter what is your age, you will become a child here & enjoy. Not to be missed when in Sentosa

name: user_2305
review: Jangan pergi weekend ya.. rugi beratur Extra 100 dollar if you want express tickets. Fun n the best theme park ever

name: user_2307
review: A pretty good themepark. It is a bit dated, and could use som new and big attractions. But the rides they have are well done and amuzing. It is a half day park, as it is pretty small.

name: user_2308
review: Many attractions were closed, there were only around ten available. The waiting time indicated on each attraction is not the real time it is in fact much longer.

name: user_2309
review: One of the best places to visit in Singapore.... tourists attractions...games and adventures... people in group will enjoy a lot.

name: user_2312
review: This is a very interesting place to go, I like the Egyptian indoor roller coaster game the most

name: user_2313
review: Very nice amusement park. Get ready to spend a day there if you want to try all the attractions. Try to avoid weekends, otherwise you will spend more time waiting in the queue than at the attraction.

name: user_2314
review: Amazing experience here. Worth spending the whole day here. Kids will really have a blast. Actually the place is suitable for people of all ages.
