Just have to come prepared for a day of walking and putting up with the swealtering heat. The rides are well maintained. On most occasions there are waiting times unless your take a VIP pass. I think the clue is to go for finish to end. The more popular rides like the transformers and mummy and roller coasters are at the start. I noticed that post lunch, ie around 2 pm those rides didnt have that much of a wait time. Hope that helps.

name: user_2315
review: Go on weekdays, must try Jurassic world, Transformer, The mummy.

name: user_2317
review: Great day out for the family , excellent rides affordable food choices . Go early and get on the rides easily.

name: user_2319
review: Having been to Florida a few times I was excited to visit Universal Singapore however that initial excitement quickly disappeared when I saw the queue for the first ride Cyclon (battlestar galactic rollercoaster) which was 90 minutes. First off they are militant about not having your phone or any bag on you and check prior to entering the queue meaning you can't even try and plan your day whilst waiting. And also basically no ride set up and amusement when waiting in line makes for a rather long and boring wait. Even the 1st class citizens who pay more than the price of the park ticket again to get the 'priority pass' had to wait about 30 minutes for the ride. Absolutely detest this scummy system parks seem to use but it seems to be standard and not normally too much of an issue if regular queue times are reasonable and rides have single rides options (of which I only seen this option for the transformer 4d coaster at Singapore universal) Eventually we managed to get on the coaster and it was pretty mid, the hulk or velocicoaster from Florida this is not. Anyway this set the scene for the rest of the day. Huge lines for pretty much all rides / shows and pretty average when you actually got to experience it. Also this was a Monday so I don't know if that makes a difference but I wouldn't want to see this park on a busy weekend. The water world show was ok. Probably the best thing there... And actually managed to see it without a massive wait which was a bonus. Overall I would avoid this park, it would make for an ok day out if they let about half of the people in on a daily basis but that would not line their coffers I guess....

name: user_2320
review: I suggest you to buy the "express universal" for S30. It worthed every penny!

name: user_2321
review: Visited in September 2024 when the standard adult ticket price was SGD 83. This pass allows you to enter the theme park for the day and enjoy all the rides . Although I visited on an ordinary Monday, there was a huge crowd. They had many rides, shows and meetups grouped in to few zones (Hollywood, New york, Far away, etc.) with about a couple more to be added soon. I felt that it was impossible to complete all the rides within a single day. There were long queues to enter every attraction with an average for about 60 minites. They also had a bit high priced queue bypassig option called "express" that you could buy inside the park from few locations. Recommend to have the Universal app installed before you go. The app allows you to navigate the theme park easlily and see the real time waiting time of each attraction.

name: user_2324
review: It is not as worthwhile as its hype. They need to work a lot on their management and staff. The staff is quite rude. Bought a universal pass, but not all rides have a queue for universal pass entry, so we have to wait in the regular pass queue. Friday but still roller coaster were closed. And aahhh the heat . They only let some people to take pictures with characters. We can't touch the transformer and can only take photos with family, no single ones. Again, the staff was rude and immature. I think the people of Sentosa are quite rude compared to other areas of singapore. Never gonna visit again Will go for disney land and florida studio. Expensive but not worth it.

name: user_2325
review: Nice park, but long waiting times and few attractions

name: user_2327
review: Mummy is great! Human and cyclone closed for repair

name: user_2334
review: Amazing place and vibe .. rides are not for everyone. Transformers ride is very good 3D experience. Plenty of drinking water available you just have to find them.

name: user_2335
review: It is said that you can go around in 3 hours, but is it too much to go around everything? It's a hot country. (It didn't make much sense, but I used Express Pass) Lockers in the Jurassic Park area cost money, so you can save money by using the free lockers in the adjacent area. Please don't compare it to USJ. Both have their advantages and disadvantages. Let's find the good.

name: user_2336
review: Buy a fast track if a tourist. Very handy

name: user_2338
review: Here is our experience to have a very fun trip and experience all the games here: * You should carefully research the tickets and buy them in advance. Our team buys 2 types of tickets (entrance ticket universal express ticket. With the express ticket type, we can go directly to each game once without having to wait and wait in line. * Download the universal app to check if the waiting time for the game is long so you don't need to use the express ticket to be able to play again next time. * Bring a raincoat from Vietnam because some games have water that will get your clothes wet and buying a raincoat over there is very expensive * Bring a thermos to collect drinking water and pack as light as possible because some games have to send items for a fee. * Enjoy and play hard with your teammates because I don't always have time to go, so I think investing in express tickets is very beneficial, so everyone should consider.

name: user_2339
review: My daughter was looking forward to the second day in Singapore the most. Universal Studios Singapore I went to How many years has it been since I visited Uni? Singapore is a compact city Univa is also about 15 minutes by taxi from the hotel. The first time I went to Transformers The Ride 3D I stood in line for about 2 hours. Expensive but other than about 3 attractions A pass that allows you to ride all rides once with priority. Buy the Express Pass! I don't know when I'll be able to go next. Transformers lined up for 2 hours I went with the pass and was able to ride in about 15 minutes I thought it was interesting to try the human body dryer after getting soaked. It's dry, but the warm air makes it hot.

name: user_2341
review: We had a great experience, a great visit if you like any of the worlds they recreate. I recommend transformers and the mummy roller coaster is great! As a point to improve, we would like to mention that certain main attractions such as the Battlestar Galactica roller coaster or the world of the minions were not open and we were not informed.

name: user_2342
review: I tried one roller coaster revenge of the mummy. It was exciting attraction. It seems too scary for people who dont like coasters. The park is not so huge than I had thought. It was a good experience and we cherish the memory we could visit here. Many goods about Sanrio characters. The park is really accessible by using trains and a monorail.

name: user_2343
review: We never went inside because we dont have enough resources but I got the chance to take a lot of memorable pictures because being outside is just for free.

name: user_2344
review: It was nice that there weren't many visitors. The waiting time was usually 5 minutes and the streets were quiet. I bought an express ticket, but I dont think I need to buy one!!

name: user_2345
review: Universal Studio always makes me happy! It's not a big size compare with other amusement parks but attractions are really exciting. Rather, it's not a big size, it was easy to walk around here..!

name: user_2346
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a popular theme park with a variety of visually captivating areas and attractions. Here are some of the best photo spots within the park that you shouldn't miss: Best Photo Spots at Universal Studios Singapore: Main Street: The entrance area with its colorful facades and iconic Universal Studios globe provides a classic and vibrant backdrop for photos. Hollywood Zone: Featuring the iconic Hollywood Walk of Fame and the Universal Studios Archway, this area offers a quintessential Hollywood vibe. New York Zone: Capture the detailed cityscape and architecture reminiscent of New York, including famous landmarks and storefronts. Sci-Fi City: The futuristic design and striking architecture of attractions like the Transformers Ride and Battlestar Galactica make for dynamic and high-energy shots. Ancient Egypt: The theming of this area, with its elaborate Egyptian architecture and the imposing facade of the Revenge of the Mummy ride, is perfect for dramatic photos. Far Far Away: The whimsical castle and colorful, fairytale-inspired scenery from the Shrek movies create a magical setting for photos. The Lost World: Featuring dinosaur-themed attractions and lush, jungle-like settings, this area is great for adventurous and nature-themed shots. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: The entrance and surrounding area of this ride offer exciting and adventurous photo opportunities, especially if you enjoy capturing dynamic action shots. Madagascar Zone: The vibrant and playful design, inspired by the Madagascar movies, provides fun and colorful photo opportunities. Dining and Shopping Areas: Unique themed dining spots and shops throughout the park, like Mel's Drive-In or the Dino-Store, offer fun, themed backdrops for casual photos. These spots at Universal Studios Singapore provide a variety of thematic and visually striking backdrops, perfect for capturing memorable moments during your visit.

name: user_2347
review: Was a wonderful experience with the games and fun unlimited with a loved one...

name: user_2350
review: Premium prices without the premium experience. If you are a foreigner much better to go to a theme park in any other country. Far better rides. Express ticket is more useful. For some reason express ticket was not valid on 2 rides... Unsurprisingly both with a long que

name: user_2351
review: The roller coasters all that park were amazing some of them youll be waiting for 40 minutes some of the no wait, the atmosphere was magnificent

name: user_2356
review: I went to Universal Studios Singapore for the first time. Get off at HarBourFront MRT station (NE1/CC29), then transfer to Sentosa Express at Vivo City and get off at WaterFront station. You will arrive at Universal Studios Singapore in about 5 minutes on foot. It was my first time in a country and my first place, but I arrived easily. The monorail has two cars, so it tends to get crowded. Tickets are available from vending machines and on weekdays, you can buy tickets right away with your credit card without having to wait in line. I've been to Universal Studios in Japan, and compared to that, the 1-day pass price seemed a little cheaper, although it depends on the exchange rate. It was a shame that the first part of the attraction was closed or suspended due to renovations. Although there were some characters I didn't know, I enjoyed it, and since the grounds are compact, I was able to visit all the attractions in one day. It would have been 5 stars if there were no area closures etc.

name: user_2358
review: Even though I've been there once and tried again, I was happy this time with my wife, so I got a new atmosphere there, hopefully I can go there again when Minionland opens.

name: user_2359
review: Best place for weekend. Please buy express tickets. Quite expensive but we can skip long queues.

name: user_2360
review: The park opens at 10am but they allow entry even around 9:00am. It's good to be there before 10am and go straight to the rides so that you can avoid the long queues. There's no need for an Express Pass if you do this. I got my ticket from Klook in advance

name: user_2362
review: The most attractive tourist spot in Singapore. I visited in 2017. At that time it had various shows (roller coaster with 3D rides) in contemporary movie like The Transformer, The mummy e.t.c. Also this facility had two most exciting roller coaster rides named CYCLON & HUMAN. The earlier you can enter the better, because it becomes very crowded. Advance ticket booking is recommended.

name: user_924
review: transformers and mummy get drunk

name: user_2368
review: For those traveling by public transportation, get off at Revo City mall. The way to Universal is on the 3rd floor. Round-trip tickets are 4 per person. There aren't many people on the day you go. Join the queue for just a moment. But the stuff inside is very expensive. I recommend carrying a water bottle where you can always refill it. The lockers can leave your things for free for 90 minutes (depending on the type of ride). The pizza is delicious, soft and the cheese stretches well, but it's very expensive. 1 piece is 10.

name: user_2370
review: I came on my office tour. I missed my kids. A must visit for kids here..

name: user_2372
review: Great place, Guaranteed adventurous and fun filled experience one will have. Buy express tickets to avoid long queues and wait time

name: user_2373
review: The wait time for each ride was about 2 hours. The ride is about 3 to 5mins. Make sure you go early. Weekday or weekend doesn't make a difference, it's pretty crowded. Take plenty of water or expect to pay the high prices.

name: user_2374
review: Ticket purchased website( trip.com but you can check any site to compare and buy best price for you. Since we been saka USJ, here is very small to enjoy. name: user_2375
review: Not a bad Universal Studios. It does have some good rides, but not a place to spend the entire day. The gift shops were over priced and so were the food outlets, but you get that at any theme park. Not a place we would return to, but the kids did enjoy seeing the minions.

name: user_2376
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers a truly immersive experience with its attention to detail across all themed areas. The cleanliness of the park deserves special mention, as it significantly enhances the experience for visitors of all ages. The variety of rides caters well to both kids and adults, ensuring that every family member has something to enjoy. However, the waiting times for attractions are generally acceptable, though peak times can see longer waits, which is typical for a popular theme park. One area for improvement would be the addition of more resting areas, particularly for the elderly and young children. Incorporating more shaded or indoor rest spots could make the park even more accommodating for all age groups, reinforcing its status as a family-friendly destination.

name: user_2377
review: Wow nice place than Disney land. Parents who has boy kids, must choose this studio than Disney land. Must try for kids above 90cm, Transformers average 1hr waiting time Shrek show 15min wt Canopy flyer 1hr wt Enchanted Airways 15min wt Dino event

name: user_2378
review: Universal Studios Singapore is one of the top attractions on Sentosa Island, offering a fun-filled day of thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and a dose of Hollywood magic. I visited Universal Studios in September, and while the experience was enjoyable overall, there were a few downsides that made the day less smooth than expected. The first thing to note is that it was *extremely hot* when we visited. Singapores tropical climate is hot and humid year-round, and being out in the sun all day can take a toll. I would highly recommend bringing a hat, plenty of sunscreen, and staying hydrated, as there is limited shade in some areas of the park. Despite the heat, the excitement of the park and the energy of the visitors kept the mood upbeat. One of the biggest drawbacks of our visit was the *long queues*. Universal Studios Singapore is a very popular destination, especially on weekends and holidays, which means waiting times for rides can easily exceed 45 minutes to an hour. The popular attractions like *Transformers: The Ride* and *Revenge of the Mummy* had some of the longest lines, and waiting under the sun only added to the discomfort. If youre not a fan of waiting or dont want to spend the majority of your day standing in line, I highly recommend upgrading to a *VIP pass or Express membership*. These passes allow you to skip the regular queues, saving you a lot of time and ensuring you can experience more rides without the frustration of long waits. Its definitely a splurge, but I found it to be worth it if you want to maximize your time and avoid the heat. As for the rides themselves, Universal Studios offers a variety of experiences, but if youre a thrill-seeker, you may find some of them underwhelming compared to other parks like *Ferrari World* in Abu Dhabi. For example, while the *Battlestar Galactica* roller coasters are exciting, they don't compare to the intense thrills of Ferrari Worlds *Formula Rossa*the fastest roller coaster in the world. Universal Studios rides are more family-friendly and are designed to cater to all age groups, which means the thrill level is a bit toned down compared to parks focused on extreme rides. That said, there are still a few standout attractions that are well worth trying. *Transformers: The Ride* is an amazing 3D experience that fully immerses you in the world of the Autobots and Decepticons. The visual effects and motion simulation are incredibly well done, and it was one of the highlights of my visit. *Revenge of the Mummy* is another great ride, blending dark indoor roller coaster elements with special effects and surprises. These rides offer unique experiences that you won't find in many other parks, making them worth the wait, even if the queues are long. In addition to the rides, Universal Studios Singapore offers plenty of entertainment with live shows and character meet-and-greets. However, the shows also tend to attract large crowds, so it's best to plan your day carefully to catch them without missing out on too many rides. **Conclusion:** Universal Studios Singapore is a fun park with a good mix of rides, shows, and Hollywood-themed attractions, but there are a few things to keep in mind before visiting. The heat can be intense, so come prepared, and the long queues can be frustrating. If you want to make the most of your day, I highly recommend opting for a VIP pass or Express membership to skip the lines. While the rides here are more family-friendly and not as intense as those in Ferrari World, they still offer a unique and enjoyable experience. Just be ready for a full day of fun, excitement, and a little bit of waiting.

name: user_2379
review: We brought the ticket online. However, the On spot ticket was cheaper than the online one. Don't forget to download the Universal Studio app that made us able to beat the crowd, and we were able to attend entire events without missing any of them.

For a more detailed review with photos, check out my blog by searching for "Daniaexperiences Singapore".

name: user_2421
review: Universal Studios is a magical experience, offering a perfect blend of excitement, adventure, and immersive entertainment. It is filled with filmy entertainment, rides that give you adrenaline rush, truly fun activities for kids. Perfect for a day having fun with family and friends, this theme park has something special for everyone. The park is divided into various themed zones, each transporting you into a different cinematic universe. From the glitzy streets of Hollywood to the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, the attention to detail is impeccable. Walking through these zones feels like stepping into the movies themselves. The vibrant colors, iconic landmarks, and thematic music all contribute to an immersive atmosphere that captivates visitors from the moment they step in. It offers a wide variety of rides that cater to different age groups and thrill levels. The twists, turns, and inversions deliver an adrenaline rush that is hard to match. The Transformers: The Ride is an absolute highlight. This 3D dark ride combines cutting-edge technology with immersive storytelling to create an exhilarating experience that leaves you on the edge of your seat. For families with younger children, the Madagascar: A Crate Adventure boat ride and Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase offer fun and excitement without being too intense. These rides are beautifully designed with vibrant characters and engaging storylines, making them enjoyable for both kids and adults. The live shows at Universal Studios Singapore are not to be missed. The WaterWorld show, in particular, is a spectacular performance filled with high-octane stunts, pyrotechnics, and special effects. The cast is incredibly talented, and the show is packed with action from start to finish. Its a thrilling experience that keeps you on the edge of your seat. In addition to the shows, the character meet-and-greets are a big hit, especially with the younger visitors. Meeting iconic characters like Shrek, the Minions, and the cast of Madagascar adds an extra layer of magic to the day. The food options within the park are diverse, catering to various tastes and dietary preferences. Whether youre in the mood for a quick snack or a sit-down meal, theres something for everyone. The themed restaurants, not only serve delicious food but also add to the overall immersive experience. Prices are what youd expect in a theme park, but the quality and variety make it worth it. The staff at Universal Studios Singapore are friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to ensure that visitors have a smooth and enjoyable experience. Even on busy days, they manage the crowds efficiently, and the queues for rides move at a reasonable pace. Tips: Get there early to utilise full day and enjoy all attractions. The Express Pass can be a good investment on busier days, helping you skip the lines and enjoy more attractions. Dont forget to bring sunscreen, as much of the park is outdoors. Also, bring a pair of fresh clothes if youre planning on enjoying all water rides or buy ponchos from nearby stores in the park to protect yourself from getting wet. Most likely you will which is another kind of fun. A fresh pair of clothes will come in handy in these situations or if it rains.

name: user_2423
review: According to reviews, the wait time for attractions was about 30 minutes, but when I went there on Friday, the wait for Transformers was 110 minutes. The wait for the roller coaster was 70 minutes. The trick is to get in first thing in the morning and ride the popular attractions first, just like at USJ in Japan. A Minion attraction was under construction, so it might get even more crowded in the future.

name: user_2426
review: I think every few years when I visit USS, it feels like a bit like doing it all over again as if I did it for the first time. Loved it. The transformer 3D ride and Mummy roller coasters are probably my highlight in every trip. Looking forward to Minion Land open up soon.

name: user_2427
review: Known for some amazing rides like roller coasters, movie theme rides, kids pleasure cinema, souvenir shops and snack shops, this place is a museum of entertainment. We purposely went on a weekday as weekends are very crowded. I was surprised to see the kind of rush here. The entry time for normal ticket was 10AM but I myself entered around 9.45AM as the gates were open. It was mind boggling to see that they have just provided tickets without any sense of whats happening inside. Sadly, the wait time for every ride for a Normal Ticket was 120 mins, even the people who had taken VIP tickets which has line free access to swings were waiting 35-45 mins for their turn. It was a low-key experience to see such kind of management at a place like this. Overall my experience was pretty bad just because of the Ticket price & kind of wait time they had given for every ride that just lasted fraction of seconds. They should really improve the management to understand headcount vs wait time/ride.

name: user_2430
review: The games are quite good, but the wait is very long. The decorative landscape is very beautiful and impressive. Opening time is only 6 hours so there's no time to play many games or watch shows.

name: user_2431
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a major amusement park located on Sentosa Island. This theme park is modeled after Hollywood's famous Universal Studios and features various exciting rides and attractions inspired by films and television shows. Following are the major attractions of Universal Studios Singapore. 1. Hollywood: This section will remind you of the famous Hollywood Boulevard, which is lined with theaters, shops, and restaurants. 2. New York: This themed section of New York City lets you enjoy the city's top sites and cultural experiences. 3. Science Fiction City: This place is inspired by science fiction and futuristic environment, with rides based on movies like Transformers. The 3D rides here will give you a lot of thrill. 4. Egypt: This section takes you to the world of ancient Egypt, where you get to experience the thrill of mummies and mysterious pyramids. The rides here give you the thrill of being a part of The Mummy movie. 5. Lost World: Here you can enter the world of Jurassic Park, where you can enjoy exciting rides among dinosaurs. The waiting time is often long here. 6. Far Far Away: This area is based on the characters and their worlds from animated films, such as Shrek and Madagascar. 7. Madagascar: This themed area is inspired by the Madagascar film series and features family-friendly rides and attractions. The swings here are very entertaining and thrilling. But there is a long waiting time in these, so you should come to the studio with enough time. Universal Studios Singapore is a wonderful place to spend a day, where people of all ages can enjoy various rides, shows, and entertainment. You should come here early in the morning to enjoy the entire studio so you can enjoy all the attractions.

name: user_2432
review: Always enjoyed the rides and also the whole atmosphere in USS! Did not realise some changes until I am here. 1. From 1 June 2024, No re-entry after you exit. Usually when we visit USS, it is also a staycation in RWS, and so we will usually exit during lunch time, maybe go back to the room to rest and escape from the afternoon sun and come back again after 3pm. No re-entry means lunch was inside USS. As it is the school holidays, the place is quite crowded and due to the rain, everyone was indoors. As a gauge, a burger and fries set is 17 and a corn dog is 7, and a scope of ice cream is 7. 2. Universal express pass is limited. If you do not wish to wait in queue for rides (as a gauge, Rapid dash was 50 mins queue, transformer ride was 60 mins and Puss-in-boots ride was 40 mins wait), the express pass is an option. It cost about 90 for a person, but from the beginning of the year, they no longer offer unlimited express pass. The express pass can only be used once at every attraction. For example if you are not intending to use the pass for the enchanted airways ride, it cannot be used for a 2nd express ride for transformer ride. With minion land still under construction, Dino soarin also not available, there were less rides available, we were hoping that we can do a few more rounds with other rides. The forum area at RWS is under renovation and many food options closed due to new development in RWS, perhaps it will be better to come again when all the development is done.

name: user_2433
review: Very crowded on a weekend. The rides like transformers have a long que with waiting time of 4 hrs for a 4 min show.4 hrs of standing is tiring for kids, teens, adults, young and old alike. Either reduce the wait time or provide seating

name: user_2435
review: The park is a bit small for the price you pay, but it is beautifully done and there is something to look at on every corner, and the frequent shows also offer a wide variety

name: user_2442

name: user_2457
review: We got early access with breakfast ticket so there is no queue. But there are only three attractions open. The shops are all closed. So it goods for those who wanna take photos with stars.

name: user_2458
review: Universal Studios Singapore, located on Sentosa Island, is a premier destination for thrill-seekers and families alike. The park boasts 24 rides and attractions, each themed around popular movies and TV shows, providing an immersive experience. Highlights include the adrenaline-pumping Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, a dueling roller coaster that offers breathtaking drops and near-misses. For fans of the Transformers franchise, the Transformers: The Ride 3D is a must-visit, offering a thrilling, high-tech adventure. Younger visitors will enjoy Madagascar: A Crate Adventure and Shrek 4-D Adventure, which bring beloved animated characters to life. The park also features themed dining and shopping options, ensuring a complete entertainment experience. The attention to detail in the parks design is impressive, with each zone meticulously crafted to reflect its respective theme. The staff are friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall experience.

name: user_2460
review: Enjoy every minute with your family in this place it is truly magical

name: user_2462
review: I have been to USJ several times before. This is my first time to visit USS. The first impression is good. I will go again if I have the opportunity. The campus is much smaller than USJ, but there are some differences in facilities. Buy the admission tickets in advance at klook on the same day, it is much cheaper and more convenient, and there is no need to wait for admission Unfortunately, it happened to rain heavily, and the outdoor amusement rides were stopped for a while. As a result, it took nearly 3 hours for me to wait in line for the indoor rides. It was a long wait, but it was really fun and exciting. I stayed for about 7 hours this time. I didnt play a lot of games, but I also took a lot of photos and had a pleasant day

name: user_2463
review: Amazing place, lots of games and photo spots, suitable for holidays with family or friends. It's best not to come here alone so it's more exciting and fun

name: user_2471
review: For a fun day full of fun and beautiful memories, don't miss a visit to Universal Studio Fun for kids and adults. There are clean restroom facilities and a small place for prayer. Restaurants, cafes, and various machines that sell cotton candy and soft drinks.

name: user_2477
review: Nice and tidy, with lots of amenities, lockers and food services. Rudes are short and queues are long. I've found universal studios bigger and more comprehensive.

name: user_2478
review: Family enjoyed, lots of rides but it was so packed that we had to buy the fast passes otherwise we would still be waiting in lines Waterworld was a really good show, interactive with audience and kids ( I loved the reference to breakdance of Paris JO from the lady warrior ) Unfortunately, a big part of the park was closed due to building of Minion World that will open in 2025 only.

name: user_2481
review: A theme park that should be on your must visit list.. Big enough to host all the thrilling rides and small enough for you to enjoy the day and chill at the in-house resturants

name: user_2482
review: I have been to Universal Singapore many times, and in my personal opinion: the games are still the same, nothing different, there are no more exciting performances, the waiting time to play is very long from 45-90 minutes, the campus is small unlike other places, services and goods are quite expensive. So only go once.

name: user_2483
review: Please download universal studios app to know waiting time for rides and enjoy fully

name: user_2484
review: Just missed 1 minute, we were not allowed to get into the mummy attraction. The staffs think the ticket is cheap? I think Dufan's Ancol is better than USS in term of price vs attraction and also staff's attitude

name: user_2486
review: The amusement park is awesome. Well maintained. Transformers and Mummy shows are must watch.

name: user_2487
review: - I went to the garden on 8/23/2024 - The entire section (Water World) is closed for maintenance or renovation - In a new section, the world of Meno's, which will be opened soon - The garden is relatively small - Very crowded with school students and tourists - Express entry is very crowded, the wait is less than an hour, and regular entry is an hour and a half

name: user_2488
review: Universal Studios on Sentosa Island, Singapore. Apparently a Minion area will open in 2025. You can enjoy attractions such as Transformers, Hamunaptra, Waterworld, and Jurassic Park. For attractions such as roller coasters where you cannot take your luggage with you, you must put your luggage in a locker, but there is one point that is difficult to understand even if you choose Japanese guidance. When registering your date of birth in your locker, you must enter it in the order of date, month, and last two digits of year. It's written as DD/MM/YY, so make sure you don't get confused. Once you select your favorite color, the number of an available locker will appear, so all you have to do is put your belongings in and close the door. There is no charge. When you want to retrieve your luggage, all you have to do is enter your date of birth and your favorite color again.

name: user_2492
review: Nice place but the toilet smelled stinky

name: user_2493
review: If you like movie themed rides, roller coasters, cartoon mascots and all things silly yet wonderful, this is a must-visit place for you! We truly had fun here! A few tips though: 1. make sure to get an Express Pass or youll end up spending most of the day lining up to go on the rides. 2. bring a personal fan and water with you... the humidity can tire you out pretty quickly. And water is not cheap either! 3. Eat before you go... so you have energy, and so you wont need to spend so much on food when you are there. Unless of course if you are there for the food too. 4. The ice cream at the entrance/exit is a must-try! Loved my raspberry cookie dough scoop on a waffle cup!

name: user_2496
review: Very nice park. Compared to the US in Orlando and LA it is smaller. We bought our tickets in advance. We recommend downloading the Universal Studio app. Very helpful. What we didn't like was that we came all the way from Germany with anticipation. We queued at Revenge of the Mummy, after 40 minutes in line the attraction was blocked/closed. It was later reopened. At Jurassic Park Rapids Adventures we got stuck for 30 minutes until someone helped us. Couldn't experience just a part of the attraction. As compensation, I received an express ticket for an attraction. Unfortunately, the waiting times at the entrance are not correct. Many activities were closed for a short time. That's what you should do Transformers WaterWorld Revenge of the mummy Battlestar Galactica Cylon

name: user_2498
review: A child-friendly place and suitable for traveling with family. highly recommended

name: user_2499
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination that offers an incredible experience for all ages. The park's diverse range of attractions, from thrilling roller coasters to immersive themed zones, ensures there's something for everyone. The attention to detail in the park's design, especially in areas like the Wizarding World and Jurassic Park, is truly impressive. The staff is friendly and the overall atmosphere is vibrant, making it a fun and memorable experience. Whether you're a movie lover or just seeking an exciting day out, Universal Studios Singapore won't disappoint!

name: user_2500
review: Its a small place. Its better to go to the casino outside after shopping. In fact, you dont have to spend any money to enter. The ball is outside, so you can just take photos and check in.

name: user_2502
review: To many visitors. You must pay express

name: user_2503
review: Still a favorite for children to play here all day.

name: user_2507
review: Totally had fun. Something exciting for all members of the family

name: user_2508
review: August 2024, not worth the money. Half the park was closed for upgrades, which I understood. But the rides you could access were closed, all but 2. So it cost us 300 for 3 fast passes which was pointless plus the entry fee. I think considering the circumstances around the park today, they shouldn't be charging full price for entry let alone the fast past. And they should be advising people prior to entry. Was not impressed. Only good thing was the water world show.

name: user_2512
review: The waiting time is also fun.

name: user_2513
review: If you have to line up, you can get on the train much faster if you use the single-ride (single-person) line.

name: user_2514
review: The amusement park is great as always. We never tire of coming here again. This year there is a minus that about a quarter of the park is closed for reconstruction, but this did not affect the price of tickets at all. Well, in general, the whole ResortsWorld is in a state of restructuring and the whole place has become less pleasant.

name: user_2515
review: The atmosphere was joyful and joyful, it was a wonderful day spent there, and the show at Water World was very nice.

name: user_2517
review: There are so many people Entry at 10 o'clock, not 9 o'clock Be sure to ride first after entering. There are a lot of ways to ride on YouTube. You can't do that. Don't waste an hour standing in the wrong line at Sesame Street like I did.

name: user_2518
review: Very nice park with not too long waiting times. Queues are nicely decorated.

name: user_2519
review: Always choose for express tickets to avoid long long queues at rides.

name: user_2521
review: It's fun and great! But I was helpless because it was raining. The rides were all stopped, and there weren't many places to take shelter from the rain other than the entrance. In Singapore, where it rains often, prepare in advance for rainy weather!

name: user_2522
review: An amusement park smaller than I imagined and in addition the Minions part was closed... No activities for young children (3/4 years old) apart from perhaps an exploration in Egypt with a 45 minute wait. The shows (Shrek for example) are super noisy and make young children uncomfortable. On the other hand, the adults (14 years and over) had a great time.

name: user_2524
review: Enjoyable and good experience but the weather is way to hot and long queuing is a big minus. Maybe it a small park, or maybe it a holiday, slit crowded.

name: user_2525
review: important advice if you book the express tickets, of all the games you can play there, there are 2 games you cant use the express tickets for one in Jurassic Park world and one in Egypt world. So I strongly suggest once you enter you go to these 2 finish them the please the rest of the games and you would save time by doing so ;) dont forget to download the app for Universal Studios to know the timing of the shows.

name: user_2526
review: The Universal Studios is a really good place to visit for those who are visiting Sentosa Island in Singapore. But, it would be helpful if you buy vip tickets instead of standard tickets. The rides inside the park are free, but for standard ticket holders, the waiting line for each ride is from 40 minutes to 100 minutes on the weekends and public holidays, while the vip ticket holders can get into a ride without standing in the line. Souvenirs and other goods are costlier inside the studios than outside. Overall, it was a good experience. The film set of "The Return of the Mummy" is really magnanimous. Other than the waiting time, everything else was pretty much worth enjoying. If anyone is planning on visiting here, do come on a weekday and come as early as possible, so that you may be able to experience as many rides as possible.

name: user_2527
review: Great Place, the only downside is the price of foods and the queues at certain rides. But otherwise a fantastic experience.

name: user_2528
review: Not worth going unless you purchase the express pass, which is nearly 3x more expensive. Probably the worst managed theme park I have visited. Queues are ridiculous (like 2 hours per ride) and the ride staff are militant removing all items. Not worth it.

name: user_2529
review: The rides will be long regardless of the day as they run less cars and have less staff on weekdays. Waiting 90 mins for Cylon and finding them only one train is ridiculous.

name: user_2530
review: Try to go early as possible to enter and stand in line twke express if u dont have money issues

name: user_2532
review: I think you have to be at an age where you know and like Universal-related movies. It seems pointless to pay extra money to buy Express. There are a lot of people and the waiting time is long, so you can't ride many things.

name: user_2533
review: Pricey and very long queuing without any queuing time estimation. We stacked for 2 hours in Transformers area and went out via emergency exit cause couldn't reach the attraction. Very bad experience.

name: user_2535
review: My fourth time at Universal Studios and it's still one of the best experiences Singapore has to offer. Took my 15 year old and 11 year old. Some key points: To make the the most of your day, you gotta get Universal Express. Trust me, some queues get up to a 90-minute wait. It's steep but worth it. The Universal Express Pass works only once per ride. So best to plan your day before heading to Sentosa (where Universal Studios is). If you're there as soon as gates open at 10am, you could get the first two rides without any queues to worry about, so you save your Universal Express Pass to return to those rides and jump the queue when the wait times are over 40 minutes. I recommend getting in at 10am and going straight to Battlestar Galactica Human and Battlestar Galactica Cylon using regular queue. These rides are really good and you're gonna wanna do these again. By the time you're done with the first two rides, the queues would be getting longer so you can now use your Express Pass for the rest of the day (and be sure to return to those first two rides and enjoy the quick Universal Express access). The best rides for me are Battlestar Galactica: Cylon, Battlestar Galactica: Human, Transformers The Ride and the Mummy Ride. Jurassic Park is good too, but best to do that at the end of your day because you will get wet even with the silly little plastic coat thing they sell there. The Waterworld show is also quite good. There are heaps on eating options at Universal Studios. I didn't like the corn dogs but the hot dogs near Jurassic Park were fantastic. I highly recommend it. The Thai Basil hotdog is divine and the staff member there - Yusri, was great. Staff wise: it's a bit of a mixed bag. Some rude attendants are polite and fun. Others are robotic and often not in the best of moods. Getting there is quite easy. Beware of a bit of surge pricing when taking a taxi from Sentosa to return to your hotel. Enjoy.

name: user_2536
review: Amazing, but queues too long for actractions that last few minutes. Something like 80 minutes waiting for 2 minutes actractions. No consideration for food intolerance such as gluten intolerance. We did not find not even a place gluten free friendly.

name: user_2542
review: Having been at universal in Orlando and many other theme parks I found this one quite mid. It was super packed, so each line was a minimum of 50 minutes without the fast pass. If you buy tickets online you get a voucher for shopping and food, 5Sgd voucher for each. Use the food one before 7:30 pm or it becomes invalid. The single rider lanes appear to be closed but you need to ask to go through. Some of them are actually closed tho, not sure why. The best ride is the cylon, the only rollercoaster that can set some emotion. The Battlestar galactica red one was totally not worth it. Better to ride cylon twice. Super disappointed on galactica it was slow you could have a conversation whilst on it. Also the single ride was closed for it... The water show was cool tho, probably one of the best things at the park and different to the other parks. The items at the stores are surprisingly cheap compared to Disney and universal Orlando. I bought a character mug for 5 euro. Using my voucher. You can bring in food if you want, and water bottles as there are many stations to fill up your water. For the long waits in the line there are rollercoasters where you have to put your belongings in a locker before lining up, so plan ahead and think of some games to play or bring some head up or something. Shrek 4D was also cool. The donkey comedy club show was too short in my opinion, it lasted roughly 10 minutes with only two people being interacted upon.

name: user_2544
review: Ann was present! The famous location in Singapore to visit. The beauty of this place is overwhelming me. I spent my little time here simply strolling around the outside #15082024

name: user_2545
review: Eat before you go our pack food, it isn't great. express is a def! Rides are awesome! Transformer ride is a must!

name: user_2546
review: I made a reservation for the early check-in and breakfast included plan (pictured) on the official website. Transformers, Mummy, and Jurassic World, which are not available at USJ, were very interesting. However, on the day we went, two of the roller coasters were closed for some reason, so the kids were disappointed. Also, there are quite a lot of people crowded in the small premises, and there is a waiting time similar to USJ, and there is no such thing as vacancy'' or getting around right away''. I was able to check in early, so I was able to ride the Transformers and Mummy many times, but if I had entered normally, I would have had to be prepared to wait in that intense heat. I was wearing a raincoat for Jurassic World, but I got soaked from head to foot lol

name: user_2547
review: Buy an express pass, to skip 100mins/game. Express pass waiting time 5 mins

name: user_2548
review: Singapore Cable Car Sky Pass

name: user_2549
review: Good place to spend a day. Mummy ride and roller coaster is nice. Transformers is ok. Not as good as the hype created. The wait time for few rides gets reduced during the evening. Can use this trick instead of spending hours in the morning.

name: user_2550
review: The Theme park has to get organized for the crowd they Invitee. EXPRESS LANE is an expensive part however we have to keep waiting for long time for every ride. Normal pass more than an hour waiting for every ride Hardly 5-6 rides people can consider to take after waiting Long day.

name: user_2551
review: I visited on a Saturday, and the wait was very long because I failed to guess. Come in with a regular ticket and get a fast pass while waiting? I also saw families buying it. Jurassic Park? I went there after waiting for 40 minutes, but due to the huge crowd and sudden heavy rain, all outdoor rides were stopped, so it seemed like I only waited for 2 hours... haha Then, it rained heavily for a while, so I took advantage of the time when many people left to ride one more popular ride (I think I waited for about 30 minutes?) and looked at the goods before leaving. I left a little after 4 o'clock, and there were people entering at that time.

name: user_2552
review: Queues per ride are crazy long. I recommend going on rides only on two conditions: you are one of the first people who entered the park (short queue lines) or you purchased an express pass.

name: user_2553
review: Very nicely laid out amusement park. The shows were excellent. There are also plenty of rides, although there are often very long queues. So if you want to use the roller coasters, you should get the ExpressPass. This is of course even more expensive, which then significantly reduces the price-performance ratio. For visitors who just want to look around and enjoy a few shows, very good. Too expensive for roller coaster enthusiasts. Nothing compared to EuropaPark in Rust/Germany

name: user_2554
review: The park is not big, so you can play all the activities in one day, and there are quite a lot of people there on weekdays. A great place to unwind with children.

name: user_2555
review: A whole day fun activity, with ample options for food (paid) and water (both free and paid). There are several rides having very long queue, so to avoid time waste, it is better (much much better) to take rapid tickets!

name: user_2557
review: Its definitely cool that Singapore has its very own Universal Studios but was disappointed in our last visit. It seems that there is no limit in number or timing for Express tickets so be prepared for ridiculously long lines in the heat even if you buy this expensive extra. If you dont, Im afraid you and your family are going to need to get used to queuing for hours because thats what your day will be. Honestly, with much else to do in Singapore, Id recommend giving this a miss (maybe even skip Sentosa entirely).

name: user_2558
review: Its just a perfect day to play, there are so many roller coasters, Ill be sick from playing them

name: user_2559
review: Since it was during the summer vacation period in early August, there was a wait of 60-90 minutes for popular attractions, but since it started to become empty in the evening, I was able to ride smoothly there. It's smaller than Japan, but that's why it was so easy to get around I felt that there was something good about each country. In the evening, I was happy to meet my favorite Velociraptor, Blue, in Lost World at the right time

name: user_2560
review: Highly recommend visiting USS. Though, I would go one more step and recommend buying an express pass beforehand in order to use the express lanes once per ride. Can save a lot of time waiting. I used Klook to buy my entry ticket and express pass (need both). My favourite ride would have to be 3D transformers in Sci-Fi City. You can easily spend all day here, so come early.

name: user_2561
review: Universal Studios resorts offer one of the best themed rides and experiences imho. And like its bigger sibling Orlando, the Singapore resort did not disappoint. The level of detail is great, and a wow factor to be found for most age groups. Express pass noticeably enhances experience, and the live show worth making time for.

name: user_2562
review: Even on a weekday, queues were ridiculously long, with average waiting time of more than an hour. The number of visitors that could be allowed to enter the place should be better managed. The whole place seemed old and dirty. The rides were boring, except the Transformers ride which was more fun & thrilling.

name: user_2565
review: It's a beautiful place particularly for children who are cartoon- worm.

name: user_2566
review: A bit lacklustre after experiencing Universal in LA. Perhaps more deserving of a 4 star review, but it wasn't anything special. Rides were OK, food was ok, layout was ok. Probably wouldn't recommend to a theme park buff.

name: user_2567
review: You can reach USS by using sentosa express (SDG 4 for rountrip ) access from Vivo city mall. Buy tickets by online sometime cheaper than on the spot. The USS itself offer so many attractions, but some attractions are not toddler-friendly. It is always fastest route to enioy the attractions if you choose single rider .. It is good to visit after midday because less people in the line to enter the attractions.. but the long line will wait for you when you take the sentosa express back to vivo city mall.

name: user_2568
review: It was one of the best days of my life. I had so much fun. Transformers, mummy, water show and Shrek should definitely be experienced!

name: user_2569
review: Very costly Long long waiting times Rides are great if u get it

name: user_2570
review: Been here 3 times. Best amusement park for me. I love the transformers ride and roller coaster. Had to buy the express pass to skip queue so that I can play over and over many times. Or else will have to wait 3-4 hours long for one ride.

name: user_2572
review: Excellent, you can spend 2 days here. Allow one day for Universal Studios. Buy tickets in advance arrive at 10am, do the big rides first, then the shows.

name: user_2573
review: Worse amusement park. Few rides, expensive, long waiting time and no staffs to assist.

name: user_2574
review: If you imagine the size and attractions of Japan or your home country, you will be disappointed. The scale is quite small. However, most of the time you wait in line is indoors in an air-conditioned room, so you can manage to wait for more than two hours. Please note that the park closes early. Near the park's closing, there was almost no waiting time for the attractions, and it was unlimited rides. (From about 1 hour before closing)

name: user_2579
review: Make sure to buy express pass in order to avoid waiting . It is really amazing

name: user_2580
review: Personally a little disappointed, too expensive for the size it is, and the roller coaster attraction was closed for maintenance. We queued endlessly for every attraction, and to purchase the queue skipper they asked for triple the cost. The shows were inaccessible because the rooms filled up immediately. In short, either you spend almost 180 each or you will be able to enjoy very little. Very far from American studios.

name: user_2581
review: The best day for our kids. They enjoyed every ride. Safety boxes for our belongings were really helpful.

name: user_2583
review: I'm very impressed. The staff's service attitude is very good. There is no extra charge when you want to bag the goods. My favorite is Shreks 4D movie. You have to wear 3D glasses and the chair can move. Its so fun! The turkey legs are delicious, but the hot dog sandwich is not recommended. The gelato from Sesame Street is also good, but the cookies are too sweet. I bought a lot of peripherals to give to my family and friends. There are many styles to choose from, which is very good! Finally, it is highly recommended to buy universal express, which can help you save a lot of queuing time. (I was queuing for the express line and finished playing a facility very quickly. When I came out, I saw that the line for the general line was very long and winding. Moreover, it was a summer afternoon, and the direct sun was very hot and baking. It was very easy to suffer from heatstroke. . Its really not worth it to save a few hundred Hong Kong dollars)

name: user_2584
review: Awesome rides.. Must try Transformers, Shrek, Mummy, Galatica rides.. Ok one tip for everyone - After entering just go straight to Far Far Away - Puss n Boots then complete shrek n enchanted. Then go for jurrasic world, Mummy and then move to transformers.. By this you can save waiting time and no need for express pass. Couple of activities also there like water world n others.

name: user_2585
review: Must go in Singapore - i like Mummy ride and Transformer - i will be back! Love

name: user_2586
review: . , . Here you can see a great piece of art. Here you get to see beautiful works of art as well as thorough information about that art, both visually and in written form.

name: user_2587
review: We bought our tickets through Klook and was able to enter USS right away! There are also at least 5 ticketing machines if you prefer to get your tickets there. I suggest getting the Universal Express if you opt going for the rides. If no, the wait time is around 60-100mins per ride Bring an umbrella just in case it rains!

name: user_2589
review: Bring The Vibe of Happinest...till the last minute on the spot...

name: user_2590
review: So I share my experience. Also thanks to Baron for his advice. This will be long, sorry. Maybe it will be useful to someone. Today (Monday) we went to Universal Park. We bought tickets in advance for the trip. We got to HarbourFront station, where we took the escalator 2 times up the shopping center. We went out to where the snowman was standing. Then take a stroll along the promenade towards Sentosa and signs for universal. The walk is probably 20 minutes. We were at the entrance at 9.10, there was already a queue of 12 people (4-5 groups) standing (or rather sitting). There are several queues in the line, you can join any one. Periodically, they open a new one and everyone runs there. You can stand so that the next one is closed and there is no longer a queue; closer to 9:40 it will open and you will be even closer. We actually became the first. They do everything for the people. They check everyone's tickets and ask them to prepare them in advance so that there is no confusion at the entrance. They opened around 9:50. We immediately started on Transformers and were the first there. Generally the first. A fun attraction, but not as they say in the reviews, that this is the best thing you will see. Well maybe for me.. Then straight to the Mummy, we stood in line for 5 minutes. Already a fun attraction. Maybe if we still understand what they are saying (maybe they are scaring us with something?), we just stared. Then straight to Jurassic Park, in line for about 5 minutes. Of course, its better to wear a raincoat, but it depends on your luck. I was wearing it, but still at least squeeze out my panties. As a result, we went through the main attractions before 10.30, maybe earlier, and without any queues at all. The slides didn't interest us and then they were closed for some reason. Afterwards we went to see Shrek in 4D, there wasnt much of a queue since the hall was large. The main thing is to take at least some place. I liked this, although I didnt expect anything. I thought it was cooler than the top ones. A cool cartoon with 3Deffects. Having rested a bit, we went to the Stunt Show. The biggest disadvantage here is that there is also a queue, but everyone will be seated. There is a lot of space. The hall is divided into 3 row zones. Zone 1 will definitely get wet (not even because of the show, but just before the show the warm-up gets everyone wet), the second one might get wet, zone 3 stay dry. Funny show, the plane is spectacular. Since the minimum plan had been fulfilled, we then simply walked and came in one by one. In the middle of the day there were a lot of people. The waiting time is written next to each attraction; for transformers it was written 120 minutes. But here's an example. On the hill near Shrek's castle, the waiting time was 60 minutes, we got through in 25 (I timed it), Sesame says 50 minutes, but we got through in 12. It depends on your luck. Since you won't realize it in advance, the line inside the building may meander. Total: everything is absolutely real, theres no need for express (you need it if you sleep until 12 and go during rush hour. But here the choice is yours. Dont sleep or pay). Drinking fountains are everywhere, you can get water. The park is not big, from edge to edge it takes 10-15 minutes. Definitely worth a visit.

name: user_2591
review: Universal studio is good but the waiting time is too long . It's very frustrating and test for your patience .it's not worth for the money. Even on weekday tye waiting time for each ride is more than 2 hrs .

name: user_2592
review: To long waiting, attractions out of service, show is cancelled... not worth the money. Small park, not enough attractions and too much people.

name: user_2593
review: It was nice and very fun place to go

name: user_2596
review: Fun, worth it

name: user_2598
review: Buy express if you wish to enjoy all the rides. Also choose to ride Galactica rides towards the end like after 4 pm. So you don't end up wasting your time and energy in queues. Also download Universal studio Singapore app to get the map of the studio

name: user_2599
review: Very disappointed with this park. Nothing to do with Universal Studios in Florida Lots of people and not many attractions.

name: user_2600
review: Attention !!! Buy Express pass or go single - This place is Not recommended for family with kids below 4 years !!! My strong advise is to buy Express pass to avoid really really really long queues which may go from 60 mins upto 120 minutes in a intense humid day. Most rides are prioritised for Express pass holder which is really frustrating to wait and see them passing quickly and standard ticket holders being neglected and delayed almost in some rides. Pls be mindful that most of the big attractions are not for children below 4 years (height wise) so I dont recommend really to go with kids of that age as apart from gift shops, there is nothing really for them. For adults better buy a Express pass (allowed once per ride) or go alone in "Single" queue (incase allowed) as most of the time single queue is closed. One day is enough if u reach at 10am and come out at closing time. Overall the place is obviously great to be at. Rides to go for... 1. Jurassic Park Boat Ride 2. Revenge of Mummy Ride 3. Transformer Ride 4. Waterworld Hollywood Live show 5. Light Camera & Action Show

name: user_2601
review: You should reserve a taxi for your return trip. When I tried to take a taxi back to the hotel around 6:30pm on August 12th, I had to wait at the taxi stand for an hour. If you pay 65, you can skip the line and take a taxi, but you can get back to Marina Bay Sands for about 10-15, so which one do you choose? I went in August, so it rained in a squall, and the attraction that I had to wait for an hour was closed for an hour, which was miserable.

name: user_2604
review: Fun for children . Buying Express tickets is suggested

name: user_2606
review: There were so many people and the wait was so long. I queued up for the Transformers ride. It took 50 minutes outside. After entering one room after another, 90 minutes passed. The 3D facilities that match the plot of the movie are very good.

name: user_2608
review: Queuing for hours without an express pass. Few rides.

name: user_2612
review: Never try to come on Friday Saturday and Sunday. Everyone qued 3 hours for 1 ride. Manage to play 3 rides out 20 rides, despite going at 11am (opening 10am) to 7pm (closing time). 8 hours in there. Play 3 rides (each rides 3 to 5 mins play). Que 7 hours 45 mins. Ridiculous. Express pass is exorbitant at 140 SGD / pax, to be paid on top of the standard ticket (83 sgd) Highly don't recommend. Not sure about weekdays. Design and environment is ok

name: user_2615
review: Endless queues, half of the facilities closed early or had malfunctions. We did maybe 4 attractions in a whole day. Our most expensive and most disappointing experience of the entire trip.

name: user_2617
review: And as Fantozzi would say: a crazy Ka!!! If you come to Singapore you will save money and precious time.. a small park with few attractions and endless queues to do the few attractions.. in practice they force you to buy the fast track ticket.. a bit the same story as all these parks now.. Without considering that the most important part, that of the minions, is still under construction.. NOT RECOMMENDED!!! The island on which it stands, called SENTOSA, is beautiful

name: user_2619
review: There's a catch in my 5* grade. I bought rise and dine early acces which allowed my and my two kids to enter the park at 8am, 2 hours before the regular crowd, with a free breakfast in Mel's Diner. Otherwise, it would be a ruined day with regular tickets because the queues are huge during the day. Although only 3 attractions were included in the early acces, here's why is this premium buy for a small extra fee. 1. You get to enter the park among the first, we litterary entered first (we came at 7.45 in the queue and we entered the park at 7.55). We were running to be alone on the streets and had a chance to take some really nice photos without any people around (which is impossible later). 2. We didn't want to go to the special effects show, but we run for the Transformers ride, which is absolutely great. We came there first and we had 4 consecutive rides without any waiting in the queues (for the last we waited 5 minutes). During the day the queue for this ride is 2 hours. We also checked Sesame Street ride and it's for the small kids, you can skip that. 3. It's very important to get to the free breakfast around 9.00 because you have to wait around 20-25 minutes to get your order (it's very good breakfast). I am saying this because you have to be ready by 9.45 when they let early access visitors to go to the rest of the park. That means you will be among the first for all the other rides, including rollercoasters, Jurassic Park rides or the Mummy (we skipped it in the morning since the queues are really small after 2pm and we did 4 consecutive rides in the aftrenoon). From that point at 9.45 you will have at least 90 minutes to try everything you want without big queues. After 11 or 11.30 am, the queues are staring to be unbearable. 4. Since you checked all the rides you wanted, some even few times, you can now slow down and enjoy the park, visit the stores, get yourself a cup of coffee or see one of the shows. In the afternoon you can go for the Mummy ride (it is brilliant) and maybe wait for another one or two other rides if you want. Without this early access I would probably go mad waiting in the lines for hours for a couple of minutes ride. Some of the rides are even shorter and really not worth it.

name: user_2621
review: Always great time at USS but the waiting time, despite going on weekday, was almost unbearable under the hot scorching heat. After visiting many times, nothing beats the transformer! By far, our most favorite ride among all! Downloading the USS app helped a lot to prioritize the rides and checking the wait time for each ride and the show time.

name: user_2622
review: There are many tourists. I wonder if it is because of the peak summer season. I bought a VIP tour this time and visited almost all the facilities without queuing. The tour leader Toki is very good. He explains carefully and the itinerary is flexible. It is worth visiting

name: user_2624
review: Families from all over the workd enjoys Their Fun Activities : Resort World Sentosa . Universal World on Film Making ,Hurricane : Fire &Water Creation bring to Life.

name: user_2625
review: Fun, but you have to queue

name: user_2626
review: Poor service, no guidance from staff, many dead ends in the park, poor attitude of staff

name: user_2627
review: Not worth your time or money. Was forced to buy Universal Express pass given some of the ride queues had almost 2 hours waiting. With Universal Express, the queues were still half an hour for some rides. Kids disappointed and frustrated waiting. Universal pass only allows entries to rides just once and for 140, it was ridiculous. The 4D shows were not special in anyway. Will never return.

name: user_2633
review: One of the best places to visit in Singapore. You can book tickets online from klook, headout or GetMyGuide. Best Ride - Transformers, Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure Best Attraction - Shrek 4D We reached at 10 AM on a Tuesday, and directly went to Transformers, waiting time was 30 mins (It took 30 mins). Then we moved to the last (Enchanted Airways) as all other rides had waiting time of 40 minutes till we finished transformers. From there we started in reverse order. Waiting time we faced was 5-15 minutes for each rides after that. Note - After 5 PM, waiting time for all rides reduces to 5 mins, so you can actually ride all later as well. I don't see any reason to get express pass unless you have to leave early. Vegetarian food only available at Oasis Spice Caf. Carry your own water bottle. Suggestion - Target shows and character meetups, you can get to rides later. No point in waiting for a ride if wait time is 15 minutes. Overall, totally worth the price. For us it was 5.1K INR 80.65 SGD

name: user_2634
review: Universal Studios Singapore, located on Sentosa Island, is a popular theme park known for its movie-themed attractions and rides. The park features 24 rides and attractions, including thrilling roller coasters and immersive experiences with themes like Ancient Egypt, Sci-Fi City, and The Lost WorldAd1. Many visitors praise the park for being a great family destination. There are attractions suitable for all ages, from young children to adults2.

name: user_2636
review: Parks smaller than others around the world. No new features except Minionmayhem which is arriving (although already released everywhere else). An exclusive, the adventures of Puss in Boots for children aged 6 to 10 max.

name: user_2637
review: We have been to the Universal parks in L.A., Osaka and this last one. What a disappointment, it takes third place in the ranking. Poorly organized, few places to eat, lockers (mandatory for some attractions) are paid, free after the time and are only in the main attractions. For example: Cyclon, waiting time 120 min, locker time 100 min; and then, the suit to the card. If you are reading this, don't waste your time or money on this park, and go to the one in Japan.

name: user_2639
review: Very good amusement park, faithful to the other Universal parks, with several thrilling attractions! Favor the fast pass if you don't want to wait 90 minutes in line for each attraction and above all buy them online in advance to get them cheaper Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located on Sentosa Island in Singapore. Opened in March 2010, it is the first Universal Studios theme park in Southeast Asia and one of the most popular in the region. The park is divided into several themed areas, each inspired by famous films, TV shows and film genres. Here are some of the main areas and attractions: 1. **Hollywood**: This area recreates the glamorous atmosphere of Hollywood, with a replica of the famous Walk of Fame. There are shops, restaurants, and live shows. 2. **New York**: Inspired by New York City, this area offers attractions like the Lights, Camera, Action! show. produced by Steven Spielberg, which shows behind the scenes special effects in films. 3. **Sci-Fi City**: This futuristic area features attractions like Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON, an inverted roller coaster inspired by the Battlestar Galactica television series. 4. **Ancient Egypt**: Recreating ancient Egypt, this area is home to one of the park's most popular attractions, "Revenge of the Mummy", an indoor roller coaster with impressive special effects. 5. **The Lost World**: Inspired by the films Jurassic Park and Waterworld, this area offers water attractions and action shows. 6. **Far Far Away**: Based on the Shrek universe, this area offers attractions for families, such as the 4D show "Shrek 4-D Adventure". 7. **Madagascar**: Inspired by the animated film of the same name, this area is ideal for young children with gentle attractions like "Madagascar: A Crate Adventure." The park is also known for its shows, parades, and special events throughout the year. Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for thrill-seekers, movie fans, and families looking for a day of fun.

name: user_2645
review: Amazing park. The rides are so fun and the atmosphere great. However, it's really only worth it if you get the express pass, which is very expensive. It's super crowded, even on a week day. If you don't get to skip the lines, the experience will be horrible.

name: user_2647
review: Preparation is key for making the best of this place. Rides wait time on Monday waa 90 min for 90 sec ride. So do your research well, know what you want, plan. Go early or at 2 PM.

name: user_2652
review: Everything closed when it started to rain, in a country that rains a lot?

name: user_2654
review: The best time in singapore. Everything was just perfect. Fantastic rides, Long queues, well organised, if you got money to spare express pass helps to shorten the line of wait. Main rides are usually 60 to 90 minutes of wait time. Overall a pleasant experience with family and friends.

name: user_2656
review: Over-all Great experience. Entry waiting time is 15-30 mins. Post entry, you will find a long queue with 60-120 mins waiting time for all the great rides like revenge of mummies, the roller coaster . I recommend buying an express pass as it will help you to skip the long waiting hours for all the good rides and shows. Download the universal studios app and check out the maps for attractions and shows.

name: user_2658
review: Indeed a good experience except the long long long queue

name: user_2659
review: Well kept but extremely crowded place. Not many high octane rides.

name: user_2661
review: The worst theme park ever : at least 1h of queue for any attraction, everything is ridiculously pricy, attractions feel like a 2015 thing I would not recommend

name: user_2663
review: Great park, great attractions. The food is not great.

name: user_2664
review: get an express ticket. long waiting time. rides quality is super

name: user_2665
review: I have to admit that the price is quite deterring but it is definitely worth to go visit at least once. The rides are fun the variety is great for a any size families and the experience quite unique. However it is quite large and I strongly recommend using an attraction as a meet up point because losing yourself and others is not hard. Some rides I would recommend (in no specific order) would be the cylon, human, mummy(jumpscares) and jurrasic world water ride (i can't remember the name(oops)). Some final advice would be to go on a weekday as random as possible to minimise wait time and yeah have fun. :)

name: user_2666
review: Personally, I think queuing up to play games is a fair and normal thing! But, after entering the park! Found a quick pass! It turns out that by spending double the money, the waiting time can be reduced by 4 times! I felt very uncomfortable on the spot! If I hadnt already arrived at the scene, I would be queuing up! I won't come in again! I don't like this business model very much There are a large number of children in the world who simply love cartoon characters from around the world! Entering the park, you still have to accept reality If you dont have enough money, just wait in line slowly!

name: user_2669
review: On August 9, 2024, my family and I visited the USS. However, because it coincided with Singapore's independence day, it was very busy. Before coming here, don't forget to buy tickets online first, to get here from Vivo Mall there is definitely an ez link. Because now I use a BCA card from Indonesia, it can't be used for the LRT to Sentosa, it can only be used for the MRT and buses. If you walk from Vivo Mall, it's approximately 1 KM. Or you can use the bus from Vivo. Now USS has a place to pray, and there is a restaurant that is halal certified. Oh yes, there is a toilet with a bidet/sprayer also near the roller coaster. Many places provide free drinks.

name: user_2671
review: Full of fun. Going with your children and family is very fun. Recommended to go at least once if you have a chance. It's a good place, convenient to travel.

name: user_2673
review: My purpose for visiting Singapore is to go to Universal Studios, and compared to its size with Universal Studios Los Angeles, it is considered small. The Harry Potter castle is not located in the Singapore branch, but we enjoyed the games available, whether 3D or 4D games or outdoor games, and I took express entry tickets and it saved me a lot of time because waiting in some Games take an hour, while express entry takes less than five minutes in most of them.

name: user_2674
review: Way,way, way to many people. Lines were to long, had to wait up to 2 hrs for a ride. They need to look at numbering the amount of people in the park at one time. Very disappointed

name: user_2677
review: Have to wait 120 Mins for the top 3 rides, which means just 3 rides in 6 hours and sore feet.

name: user_2679
review: Frankly, it is very bad, crowded and tiring for the children

name: user_2681
review: Big waste of money. Huge lines on a normal monday. They sell you normal tickets (that should be called Super Economy Class Tickets) but if you wanna go on the rides, you really should consider spending extra USD 110 for the Express (and still expect some queing, like 20-30 min). Or... If you wanna enjoy the day, they can sell you the VIP experience, which will cost you a fortune (around USD 310 per person) but will allow you to actually have fun. Honestly, worst park planning I've ever seen. Don't waste your money and time...

name: user_2683
review: Very crowded. It is rather recommended to buy an express pass.

name: user_2685
review: The temperature is high during the day, so we recommend that you take precautions against the heat. I entered the park at opening time, but it took a while to ride the popular rides without an express pass. I wasn't able to ride all the attractions, but I think it was enough to kill the half-day I had free time (to satisfy the kids) due to transfers.

name: user_2686
review: Dont do it! The organisation is absurd. You pay for queuing, the first time even before entering the park when it comes to exchange you reservation voucher bought online on the official website for the proper ticket finally allowing entry. Then you may decide to cut 1 hour waiting times by half by buying express tickets but this will cost you 2x the price (140 SGD per pax at 10:15 on Monday morning - no discount for kids, of course) you already paid for entering the park (86 SGD). In summary, just dont do it and leave to people which culture goes with another relation to time spent in queuing. As Europeans, it seems we have a lot to learn from the patience / tolerance others have to time (lost).

name: user_2687
review: On 11 Aug 24 at about 1830h, my friend and I were entering the "Human" roller coaster ride (Battlestar Galactica) after depositing our bags in the lockers. The young man on duty checking us with a security device (did not see his name on his name tag), shouted at my friend saying "hey! where are you going?!) when he mistakenly walked to the wrong lane to enter the ride. This young man was very rude to have shouted in a condescending tone to a visitor of the attraction. Moreover, my friend did not misbehave and he merely walked on a wrong lane thinking it was the right path to enter the ride. This young man on duty at the HUMAN ride on 11 Aug 24 at around 1830H needs to be polite and humble since he is in the service line. His tone was like an instructor in a SAF Camp and we were like recruits in the olden days. Gosh. Can the management find out who was this young man and signal him appropriately? He will invite more negative comments to US.

name: user_2688
review: Rides are very good ,muumy and transporter is best apart from roller-coaster

name: user_2690
review: Great park! The attractions are very successful and all work well (a few interruptions sometimes but quickly resolved). It is relatively small so you can get around quite quickly when there are not too many people (I recommend the universal express pass to avoid endless queues, it is really worth the price! On the other hand, buy it at the in advance it is more expensive on site) and we have the possibility of meeting a lot of characters (seen in one afternoon: Fiona, Blue, the Minions, Agns, etc.). The prices in the shops are not excessive, another good point. The catering could be better but at the same time its the same in all amusement parks. We had a great day, go there with your eyes closed!

name: user_2691
