review: The park is not big, but there are surprisingly many people! ! I originally thought that there was no need for fast passes here...but I miscalculated! ! If you want to have fun, you still need to buy a quick pass

name: user_2693
review: Had so much fun while visiting this place. Fun rides but long waiting time (even on weekdays), as expected from a theme park. But, you must come here if you plan to go to Singapore.

name: user_2694
review: Every ride was in a long queue, Each ride we spent 1/2 hr minimum.

name: user_2695
review: It was really disappointed. The place was overcrowded never see in any park, what a rubbish Waiting time for some activity will take up to 2 hours. The experience was waste of time and money.We got soaked due to continues rainy weather and left back to hotel.

name: user_2696
review: If you are visiting first time and have 1 day better buy early entry ticket which allows to enter 8am or buy express ticket. Normal ticket for 1 day is waste as management allows everyone and its like human zoo inside. No shed outisde to save you in rainy or sunny time even after paying such amount. Looks like it is more to earn money than keeping people enjoyment also in mind. You can buy express ticket inside also in case did not purchase online. Only transformers and light camera action are good rest are common rides and available in all over world amusement park. Overall not recommended due to so much rush and no shade area as management looks like after money only.

name: user_2697
review: If you want to come here to enter the theme park, you have to spend a day at least near here. Lots of places to take pictures. If you want to take a picture on the uss globe, it's free. Because it's close to the outside. If you enter the theme, just pay.

name: user_2700
review: I bought a ticket that includes breakfast and allows entry from 8am. There were only three attractions, but it was great to be able to ride them right away. Unfortunately, the outside attractions were canceled due to thunder. There weren't many places to take shelter from the rain, so I got soaked. It's a compact facility, so I think one day is enough. I was first in line and waited for 50 minutes. The attraction itself feels a little lacking, but it's perfect for families with children. If you're looking for Japanese-style service, it's no good, but if you think this is normal, Japanese service is overkill. The best thing about it is that it has attractions that are not found in Japan!

name: user_2701
review: If you want to experience all the rides, it's best to purchase the Universal Express Pass. It allows you to skip lines and enter attractions with little to no waiting time. In my experience, we didn't buy the Universal Express Pass. We managed to visit most of the top attractions, but unfortunately, a thunderstorm hit in the afternoon. Despite the rain, its still a great place to have fun. The attractions are well-made and safe. Id definitely return if I have the budget. Just be prepared to spend, as this theme park is quite expensive.

name: user_2702
review: We reached Sentosa island from Cable cars. It was a great ride and highly recommended than taking the bus. During weekend the waiting time was so long inside Universal Studios but worth every bit! Its always better to book express tickets in advance to avoid long hours in queues. Our favorites were the transformers ride and the Ancient Egypt.

name: user_2704
review: Its good but the traffic is too much. We had to wait more than 2 hours for some activities

name: user_2705
review: It is recommended to go 30 minutes before opening time to get in line to enter the park. As for tickets, you can buy them there. But you should hurry and buy it because it's sold out. If you go when the amusement park opens, the queue for the rides won't be long. Wait no more than 20 minutes. But in the afternoon, you'll have to wait about 1 hour or more.

name: user_2708
review: Fun for all ages!! Bring a hat, your sunscreen, and a water bottle! Be prepared for crowds and queues!

name: user_2710
review: Something for everyone really,variety of rides for different ages,nicely spaced out themed areas,plenty of performances,lots of merchandise nicely priced,the shrek 4d and Steven Spielberg visual effects were great and the queues seemed to go faster than the times allowed.

name: user_2715
review: Amazing shows and rides and a little tip ride waiting times get down at 3-5

name: user_2716
review: A little crowded during our visit. But it was fun. Great place for family recreation!

name: user_2717
review: I recentry come here every year if possible this place very please me for my holidayI find myself drawn back to this destination annually. The atmosphere and amenities consistently exceed my expectations. It's the ideal location for my holiday, offering a perfect blend of relaxation and recreation. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable and enjoyable getaway. I look forward to returning again next year.

name: user_2722
review: Amazing experience, Im a solo traveler so the single lines helped a lot went early played all the games I wanted to play and went to most shows , would recommend to use the universal studios app to know the wait time for rides and times for shows

name: user_2724
review: All rides are safe to ride. I truly enjoyed my time in Singapore and hope to return again in the future.

name: user_2725
review: Ive been to universal studios multiple times before and I have to say the quality has gone down over the years. From 11am to about 6pm almost every ride had a wait time of 95 minutes or more. My friends and I spent the morning in the line for the water ride in Jurassic and the ride was paused for an extended period of time after an hour and half of waiting. But after 6ish then the lines became incredibly short ( e.g mummy ride was 10mins and Human was only 20 even though it said 40 on the outside ). I highly recommend staying until the park closes to get to ride everything

name: user_2726
review: I heard it was empty, but I went on a Friday and it was very crowded. An express pass is required, but it's expensive! ! ! !

name: user_2727
review: Great rides. Fun for kids. Carry hand fans as it gets pretty hot.

name: user_2732
review: Loved it. An express pass is a must and saved us a lot of time! Thrilling rides and great food options.

name: user_2734
review: Too crowded and we didnt manage to buy express pass , waiting time during weekdays is 60-150 minutes! Just dont go during summer time. And if you go - buy much earlier express pass.However they have removed unlimited express pass.

name: user_2736
review: If you have been on any other universal this is total waste of time . Less rides and same as other universal nothing new but cheaper . Food inside is very expensive though

name: user_2738
review: family travel

name: user_2741
review: It's an okay place. It lacks a lot of development and improvement. Part of it is closed and under maintenance. I do not recommend going there during vacation times... it is very crowded and the queues for the games are very long

name: user_2744
review: The capacity of the place cannot accommodate the crowded crowd We took the entry ticket two hours before in the morning for a difference of 36, and we were shocked that not all areas were open, only two areas and not all the games!!

name: user_2751
review: I am giving it a 1 star due to overall experience. Yes, the rides are good BUT - The queues are insane (even on a weekday). The sign may say 40 minutes but the popular rides take over 1 hour in the queue. Even the mediocre rides take 40 minutes for 2 minutes of entertainment (please nobody queue for the Sesame Street ride, the sign said 20 minutes, 40 minutes later we finally get in and the ride is terrible), even our 4 year old said "that was boring"). - You cannot leave the reenter the park. When there is a 45 minute queue for food we wanted to leave and eat outside. That is not allowed - The restrooms are not well maintained / cleaned. In a market where labor costs are relatively low, there is no excuse for not having clean bathrooms.

name: user_2752
review: Amazing place to visit. Could spend 2 days here and manage to do everything. Events and character meets all during the day. Watch out for sudden rainfall. Take an umbrella with you to keep dry. Food prices weren't too bad and the shops were a good price. Would recommend to anyone that likes action and rides but also people that prefer easy going fun too. Wheelchair access okay for most rides. I did have to lift my wife in some rides but we did manged to skip ques as some were up to 70 minutes long. Fun visit and would go again.

name: user_2753
review: This is a thug town. They sell unlimited tickets, which means you have to wait 2 hours for each ride. Zero customer focused. Avoid it is not worth your time

name: user_2754
review: This is still one of the top visitors attraction in Singapore. Ever-changing, some of the themes have been renovated, like this month is about minions, it is after 6 months since my last visit, the exhibits are constantly changing and it make it fun. There are early entry tickets for sales , and you can enter the theme park from 8 am instead of the usual 10am so that you can enjoy the breakfast and tour some of the venue before the crowds stream in.

name: user_2755
review: It was a wonderful experience but needs to have more attractions , for all ages :)

name: user_2757
review: It's a terrible experience. I chose to go on a weekday because i thought it would be crowded on weekends. But how wrong i was. If you're okay with 100 minute wait for any ride, then go for it - but that's not okay for me. Crowd control is lacking, and those persons who have been deployed for crowd control are overworked so they're rude. Even rude coffeeshop aunties are better than the crowd control staff. It's not worth 83 for this nonsense. I went to nagashima in japan and the coasters there trounce USS coasters by a huge margin. My 83 was a donation to Sentosa. It was just a scam.

name: user_2758
review: Visited on a Monday. Queues for almost all attractions were really long with wait times of 1-1.5 hrs. Not worth the high prices!

name: user_2760
review: 22-06-2024 Madagascar zone Currently improving As for other players Can still play normally Waiting in line for the rides takes no more than 30 minutes to play. The weather is very hot, so bring a small fan.

name: user_2761
review: It is highly recommended to go to "JURASSIC PARK"

name: user_2765
review: It's much smaller than I thought. Except for a few roller coasters, there's nothing to ride... I'm very disappointed in the size and attractions compared to Osaka Universal.

name: user_2766
review: This place is ridiculously over populated (way too packed) you are waiting for 2 hours for 1 ride then the "express ticket lane" just comes along and takes your place over and ove4 again. I wouldn't come here again. 8 hours 4 rides. Not really happy. I dont recommend this place at all.

name: user_2767
review: Paid triple the price to have an express pass just to get told no express pass at half of the rides

name: user_2772
review: One of my worse experiences with parks all over the world. You need to wait for more than 1 hour for each ride. I paid mire than 50 dollars for each member of my family to end up riding 4 or 5 rides all day long. They must find solution for that. They need to limit the number of admission to the park

name: user_2773
review: Beautiful & fun filled atmosphere for adults as well as for kids

name: user_2775
review: Very good if you have universal express pass

name: user_2778
review: It's too hot and the waiting time is too long so I can't use it properly. I never want to go again Lotte World in Korea is 100 times better.

name: user_2779
review: If you are a family with kids on a vacation in Singapore then this place is a must to visit. Its a good place to spend a day. Your level of excitement depends on the country you are coming from. Like if are from US or UAE then this version of Universal Studio will be very much similar to six flags or motion gate. Rides like Galactica and Human to be taken in the evening to avoid long queues. Express pass can be a lame option here because even that has an average 20-30 mins waiting. Pick a weekday and if you start by say 12 noon then you can finish the park by sunset. Its tiny!

name: user_2783
review: Be aware of the Express pass conditions, they change the conditions and price without notice and proper communication. Paid S140 per person; Which was supposed to be unlimited based on RWS own hotel ORA table, but found that if bought directly at Universal, it would only be valid for a single ride. If I wanted to go in my kids favourite ride twice I would need to go to the regular queue... this is hardly a good value for the extra S560 I paid on top of the regular tickets... Otherwise is a nice theme park, with a few very good rides. But, will I return.... No!

name: user_2785
review: Very poor crowd mananegement especially at the food establishments, digital experiences, movies, auditorium etc. Not good for the brand image and has a negative effect on the customer experience.

name: user_2788
review: If you are going during the holiday season, I definitely recommend taking the express. Unlimited express is good, but if you buy each express once, open run, and ride once on Cylon or Human, you will be waiting for more than an hour. Then, I think it would be okay if you bring the required Rapid Adventure raincoat, wait for the normal ride, have lunch, watch the water show, and buy a one-time express ticket each in the afternoon. Be sure to install the USS app and use it while checking the waiting time for each ride Lastly, there is a Yonggari train in the Far Far away area that looks like it's for children, and it's quite fun, so it would be nice to ride it.

name: user_2789
review: Very disappointed with the Universal Studios experience (family of 4 including 2 adults and 2 teenagers): we will never return to this park. The queues are endless and it is difficult to access more than 6 attractions during the day. In addition to the price of the entry ticket, you must add the price of lockers/lockers on certain attractions (calculated according to the duration of the locker and therefore the length of the queue), at a minimum of S4 per hour, it quickly becomes racketeering. For access to the Jurassic Parc rapids attraction: paying lockers required and sale of ponchos, abandoned in a pile at the exit. Even access to the Dry Pods at the exit of the Jurassic Parc rapids costs S5. We were criticized for only using our S5 vouchers at the end of the day, free for the purchase of an entry ticket and deductible from consumption made in the park... but only at certain stores. Few thrills even on rollercoasters. Shows of average quality, despite the performance of the stuntmen.

name: user_2792
review: Fast pass is the most unfair mechanism. Everyone pays to enter the park and have fun. Why can you jump in line by spending a little more money? People who pass quickly will spend an extra 10 to 20 minutes waiting (paying to jump in line). ), the weather is hot and the waiting time is long, and the children nearby say that they envy people who can clear customs quickly, the discomfort in my heart keeps increasing. Besides, there is not much difference between Japan and Singapore, and the same is true for Water World. The plot and facilities are similar. I wont go to Universal again. Its not a very pleasant experience! Its better to go to Chimelong Ocean Kingdom!

name: user_2793
review: Small park. Too many technical problems. Too much waiting time. Difficult to move around

name: user_2795
review: Beautiful, but what is not desirable is that the waiting time for each game exceeds 60 minutes

name: user_2800
review: On August 1st of 2024 my family and I went to universal studio Singapore, we got the express pass but no priority was felt. We waited for more than 30 minutes per ride on average, with one ride (Jurassic Park) that exceeded an hour of wait. The roller coasters were 40 mins more on average, it was truly a horrible experience. In the shrek theater, one woman yelled at all of us for trying to enter when she opened the door with no clear instructions with what we should do. One person who was in charge of the bumblebee ride (turning cups) was incredibly rude to an Indian woman as he wrongly miscalculated the number of tickets that was given to him. The overall experience was terrible and avoid this amusement park at all costs. If it wasnt for the google system, Id give this place a -100 stars for being overcrowded, bad service attitude, and horrible ride experiences. This park is not worth visiting and should reflect on their operation and service. They should also consider making the fast pass actually fast as opposed to us throwing worthless money into a pass that made us wait for 60 mins with the worst service possible.

name: user_2801
review: When you go to Singapore, you always have to go for a walk around the world.

name: user_2802
review: Took almost 3 hr just for 1 time transformer ride. Only manage to try 3 other rides

name: user_2803
review: I'm deducting 1 star (which is very small compared to what I experienced) from the management of this place. On 07/28/24, my friends and I were in line to enter the Transformers ride. Sat 3 hours and ended up not playing. You don't even say The ride breaks or there's a problem. You leave nearly 100 customers waiting in line inside this area, all of whom have no idea what's going on outside. Finally, when walking to the player Only your staff stood handing out tickets to return to the ride by 31/07/24 (but I came today to play today) and upon exiting the ride. There are many customers wanting answers about what happened. But you only replied "I don't know and can't give you an answer." We who are waiting to ride this attraction. No one has played at all. And I wasted 3 hours. I planned to stay here all day to play your famous attractions. But my friends and I feel sorry and regret coming to this place. I would like to suggest that you have a better way to communicate issues to customers about damaged or unplayable players. I believe everyone is here to have fun and spend money. (which is quite a bit) to have a good experience at your place So please take my advice as a customer and improve your management in the future :)

name: user_2804
review: The place is fun for game lovers There are some dangerous games, but they are fun for those who love adventure Water play is fun and cools the weather a little There are many kiosks selling fruits and ice cream The day we went was very sunny. We were once tired of the heat. I suggested they add fans and mist to cool down the atmosphere. To enjoy the games without standing in line for a long time, you must purchase Express

name: user_2805
review: Pay a fortune, some rides seem short staffed. They can make the lines move faster. Just get efficient staff to support the rides!

name: user_2809
review: Compared with Japan Universal, it is a bit small, but with fewer people, you can get what you want, especially Transformers.

name: user_2810
review: It was amazing however I really recommend buying the fast pass because the waits can be long sometimes really amazing and fun park though

name: user_2812
review: It's a tough situation, but I just trusted YouTube's recommendation to buy a pass and went there, and ended up waiting for 3 hours for Transformers.

name: user_2813
review: Hot and stuffy - think twice about queuing under the hot sun :)

name: user_2814
review: Great place but it sure does heat up

name: user_2815
review: You have to accept very long waiting times. Our experience was to visit the cable cars after 5 p.m. It's worth it but the children had a lot of fun

name: user_2818
review: Small but cute! Its a good place for everyone!

name: user_2819
review: I like the rides, I am enjoying everything

name: user_2822
review: The food inside is really too expensive, and its really hot. There are few places to hide from the sun, and every ride has to wait for more than an hour.

name: user_2824
review: The world's smallest Universal Studios can be visited in 15 minutes. When I went there at the beginning of the month, Shrek had to replace its minions, so that area was under maintenance. Maybe I didnt queue too long to enter the park early. It is said that the park refers to big data to measure the days admission time and the price of fast pass. I The express pass on the day I went was SGD 120. ps. There is a restaurant outside Jurassic that sells delicious curry chicken cutlet rice for SGD 14/portion.

name: user_2825
review: If you want to waste your time and money, go to this park! It's a big mess. It's okay that you have to wait a long time at attractions, but the employees are very unfriendly and shouty. We waited a long time at one of the attractions and when it was finally our turn, we were told that the attraction was broken. We have experienced crowds in Universal Studios LA and Universal Studios Orlando. But somehow those parks are more structured than this park. Never again this park!! It's a waste of time. It's a shame that the employees are so ill-mannered. It did ruin our day! If you still choose to go to this park, a tip: buy your express tickets in advance. That saves a lot of money.

name: user_2826
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a super scam! Even if I bought a quick pass to get in, I still had to queue for more than 40 minutes. The point is, 3 or 4 of the fun ones said they were not open for maintenance!

name: user_2827
review: Full day worth it...if you have kids too much tough to cover whole park...in a day

name: user_2829
review: It was fun, but it was really hot at noon that day. The show is nice

name: user_2832
review: No star deserved. Absolutely godless. Waiting in line for 2.5 hours with the "normal" ticket (which is already expensive at 83SD) for about 4 minutes of Transformer... the resolution with the 3D glasses was bad, two effects were briefly a little more exciting... - with the express ticket (this one costs 100SD. In addition, I was told by the other tourist that it was a 20 minute wait. It's a shame that your own time isn't worth anything if you don't pay heavily for it. There are certainly ways to use AI to optimize the waiting time, issue time slots, restrict access, optimize tourist flows, etc. Or at least be fair enough to indicate the expected waiting time at the entrance. But as it was, it was absolutely disappointing. What's more, it's even planned that way, because the snake squeezes through solid metal railings with three drinking water basins in between... Of course there are no toilet facilities. So completely intentional and organized. The next two attractions were closed. The staff couldn't say how long. At other attractions there were waiting times between 30-60 minutes. We had headaches and back pain from waiting and standing. And then left after a total of 3.5 hours. It was very sobering. By the way, a burger costs 30SD (in the SkyBar at MarinaBaySands it's 20...)

name: user_2833
review: Overpriced and too many lines

name: user_2834
review: Many of the rides are like roller coasters. If you like fun and excitement, it is recommended to buy a quick pass to avoid queuing for a long time. Regular tickets will take about an hour and a half.

name: user_2836
review: Strongly not recommended, endless long queue, broken devices every few hours, no guidance or help on exit. DONT GO!!!

name: user_2838
review: Amazing experience with the VIP tour got to go on so many rides with no lines definitely worth the higher price tag. If you are near the area or visiting this is definitely worth while visiting

name: user_2840
review: Its such a nice experience apart from the long waiting times in the more popular rides. Be ready to spend your whole day in there, to make the most out of the entrance fee. If youre pressed for time and want to experience at least half of all the rides before closing time, I highly recommend spending extra for the Express Pass, this way, you only spend 30mins max of waiting time per ride, not two hours.

name: user_2841
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic destination for all ages, offering thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and immersive attractions based on popular movies and TV shows. The park is well-maintained, with friendly staff and diverse dining options. A must-visit for a fun-filled day in Singapore!

name: user_2842
review: While this is quite a small Universal Studios, it is well worth a visit. Some of the rides here are fantastic, including Revenge of the Mummy, Battlestar Galactica, especially the human side and Transformers. However if you want to do these rights you need to get the Express pass. I noticed that there were so many people with express pass on Battlestar, that the standard queue was moving very slowly. If you are in Singapore and like roller coasters, this is a must do day out.

name: user_2844
review: We visited Universal studios on Sunday afternoon. The place opens at 10:30am. We took a train ride from Harbour front station to Rivers World Station and purchased tickets. It's a short rail ride from there to reach Universal studios. The place was very crowded. They had many interesting adventure rides based on many themes such as Mummy, Transformers, Shrek, Jurassic park etc. If you have kids older than 7 yrs, they will absolutely love the place. Food options are also available. No matter your age, you must try Both roller coasters, mummy and transformers ride as they are worth every penny. On weekends rides have long wait times up to 70 mins, so please download the SG app and check wait time before getting in line.

name: user_2848
review: the only and best themepark in singapore! the rides have many range... from extreme (human and cyclone or smtg) to children rides. i still love mummy ride tho. Buy ur tic in advance and avoid school holidays!!!!!!!

name: user_2851
review: Not a great experience for us. We waited over 2hrs to get on 1 ride only to be told it had broken down and that we should leave the queue and find another ride to go on. We walked around the park looking at more rides but the wait times were all 1.5-2.5hrs long. There are too many people jammed in one space, that you feel as though you are constantly bumping into people. We left without going on a single ride, with strict instruction that a refund was not possible. Overall very disappointing.

name: user_2730
review: I thought it was so compact that I might not need it for the whole day. You can check the waiting time on the official app, but it doesn't match the current situation. On Mummy's Ride, it says that you have to put your personal belongings in a coin locker (if you wait 15 minutes, 45 minutes are free), but since the waiting time was much longer than the displayed wait time, we ended up having to pay. What do you do when your wallet is in the coin locker? ? ? It was very crowded and I had to call a staff member to open the paid lockers, which surprised me at how inefficient it was. The guidebook said it was cashless only, but there were some places that didn't accept Amex, so I ended up paying in cash. At restaurants, there are too many people occupying tables and taking breaks without eating, resulting in unnecessary waiting time. It was the worst dining experience because the cast members were unmotivated and didn't pay attention or consideration. If you don't have an express pass, you'll have to wait in line for the attractions, but I don't think it's necessary to buy a pass. For families with children, it can be quite tiring not to have easy rides where you can ride without waiting.

name: user_2852
review: Loved it!! Wait times were pretty good. Longest queue was for Jurassic park water ride and was around 45 mins, but all the rest were much less. Just work around wait times as the park gets super quiet around 6pm, so we queued 5 mins for a lot of the rides later in the day, stay till later! Met shrek, Fiona, puss in boots and kitty long paws. And we met Optimus prime! The show they had on in the waterland was amazing too. Really good theming. Great experience, deffo recommend!

name: user_2854
review: Purchased the Breakfast option with USS Breakfast, gives you access to 3 rides early. Transformers ride was class one or two others, but post afternoon it gets horrifyingly busy, you will likely be waiting hours in queues with poor or no AC. It is also very small, could not imagine taking kids as it would cost a fortune for nothing special. The lockers for each ride is also tedious, why not follow many other theme parks and have a bag drop facility on the other side. Seems 99% of reviews dont even have coherent sentences just Wow, go its great place

name: user_2856
review: We did it with the VIP pass... a different way of going to an attraction parc... No queues, you just drop in and off you go. A personal guide is with you during the tour and day... when the tour is over or before you can enjoy the express queue... so you dont wait for attraction... a great way to visit an attraction parc... even if a bit expensive, but it was a wonderful day for the kids and the family...

name: user_2857
review: It seems like the place will never be empty, many people come just to take photos at the Universal Studio sign, like me for example haha

name: user_2861
review: Universal Studios is a must visit place in Singapore for a great experience. It is a theme based park with full of attractions and activities that you will love and enjoy. It is better to enter the park at the opening time so you can experience almost all the rides there. Its better to take the tickets in advance and can avoid the long queue especially in the weekends. The fast track tickets are available, it will help to skip the long queue in rides. But we have to pay double the cost for normal, I think it worths. Otherwise it will take two or three days to complete experiencing all rides and activities. Never miss the roller coaster rides. In rainy weather they will stop most of the rides including roller coaster. Mobile phones are strictly not allowed in roller coaster. And they close at 6.00pm, its a very short time period for this mega adventure park. I strongly suggest to the management of Universal Studios to extend the time for closing to at least up to 07.30 pm. Anyway the time spend in this place is amazing, kids are really enjoying it. Dont miss it when you come to visit Singapore.

name: user_2862
review: Honestly Universal was such good fun! People say that the place is small but you definitely have enough to do for a full day. And theyre extending the park (minion works) so itll be even better by the end of 2024! The rides are rly good and for the price its honestly a steal compared to the parks in the US! The express pass is not needed if youre going on a week day and up and there at park opening. If you show up around noon, expect over 1 hour waits for the most popular rides! Also, buy your tickets on Klook in your own currency itll be cheaper :)

name: user_2864
review: There are a lot of people, so the queue time is really long, it takes about half an hour, but the facilities are worth experiencing and highly recommended.

name: user_2865
review: The scores are very high for a park that is so infunctional: - the technical problems continue, considerably lengthening the already interminable waiting time (the time to complete 5 attractions in the day) - certain attractions like Acceleration are very poorly optimized. The operators take their time to evacuate the attraction but especially to install it. The wagons are not even filled and instructions are recalled at the start of each turn even though we have heard them 150 times before. Longer transition times than attraction times... - very time-consuming mandatory locker system (waiting at terminals, touch screen bug). Why not use the same system as the other parks? - the density of people is much too high. They have to determine maximum quotas, the park is small. In short, an amateur category compared to Disneyland Paris, Europapark or even Universal Los Angeles

name: user_2867
review: A must visit adventures place for all visitors. There are lots of adventures rides inside and good cartoon theme as well. Entire day is also not enough. Its recommended to start day as early as 9 in the morning so that all the rides can be covered

name: user_2868
review: I have done multiple universal studios and this one is the worst. First ride (Cylon), 20min displayed on the app / 5min displayed on the ride itself... at the end, it was 2h30 Such a joke .... Then we waited for Jurassic Park ride (the one on the water). Estimated time at 50min... the ride was under maintenance for 2hours .... With no compensation or commercial gesture. Usually when this scenario happens, the staff is providing an exceptional fast pass just for this ride to compensate your waiting.... The park looks old and not really maintained. Looks like they dont know how to manage the park. There are plenty of useless staff and the service is really cheap.... Its a shame !

name: user_2870
review: This is the fantastic place to visit. Must experience the thrilling rides. More techno shows are expected from this organisation. But good experience. Keep it up.

name: user_2871
review: Very poor experience. We are only visiting Singapore for one day only. Unfortunately all lines to all rides are at least an hour and 10 minutes long. So far we have only seen the line to one ride which was delayed even further for an unknown reason. Unfortunately a day at universal studios will only allow for my children to go on 3 rides if they are lucky, and standing in lines for at least 3 hours. Over priced for this experience.

name: user_2872
review: Lines are long, they are greedy and upgrade visitors to vip that can afford it to cut the lines which slows down the general line even more. In the park for 4 hours today and will only have time for 2 rides, after paying 400 for the family to get in. Over priced and not worth it.

name: user_2874
review: Nice park, that's for sure. Entrance on the large side, also very busy, you will have to wait in line for an hour or much longer. You get the feeling that you are mainly part of a commercial plan to milk yourself as much as possible, once but not again.

name: user_2875
review: Very good place to visit. All adults and children enjoy together. If you want to get an amazing experience you should go to visit this place.

name: user_2877
review: Loved both the Battlestar Galactica rides. The wait time was really high, though. I was in line for 60 mins for the Battlestar Galactica Cylon ride.

name: user_2878
review: Saturday morning visit Waited for about 5 minutes and entered around 9:50. I recommend riding Transformers first! Since the run is open, even on a Saturday, I can enjoy almost everything right away without the express ;)

name: user_2879
review: I wish I could give a minuse star. Very few rides with more than 2 hours queue. The timings the rides display are always wrong. It was very crowded and had no point in buying tickets in advance. You have to wait in the very long queue when you enter. Food options are very, very expensive. Please don't waste your time and money. Los Angeles's universal studio is far more well organised than here.

name: user_2880
review: Went on Thursday, 25 July with my family. When we reached, there were a lot of people outside! Lots of tour groups too. And there was a bit of queue to enter the park too. Was very disappointed that the first ride we went to, had a malfunction. And we had spent 40mins waiting to go for the ride. Only to have it stop just as it had started. There were instructions to stay in our seats and that the ride would resume soon. We waited for another 20mins. We had thought the ride would resume. But we were brought to the end of the ride. After spending more than an hour in the the attraction. The staff there gave the affected guests a free fast pass for one ride. But still, time had been wasted. But most of the day, we just spent waiting to get on rides as the timing would be 30 to 60mins for each ride. I guess because the park was blocked and they were making another attraction. But it was also super crowded! And not only that, but it was also hard to get around. And while queing up, some guests kept pushing and going into our space. Overall not a good experience today. But the rides were great as usual. Maybe next time, there could be a limit as to how much guests should be allowed into the park. As it really was too crowded. Thank you

name: user_2882
review: Good amusement park for Singapore but quite small and quick to visit.

name: user_2883
review: Worst place to go its too over crowded there must be a limit of number of people. Every ride has minimum 2 hours queue waiting for normal and 30 minutes queue for express. I visited on Thursday July 25 2024. Such long queues in sunny day cannot give a good experience

name: user_2885
review: Best to buy tickets in advance amd be there at the earliest time possible. If you have extra, get that superpass to avoid queueing in lines, it saves you a lot of time and effort to roam around

name: user_2887
review: Always be my favorite place to visit in Singapore Been visit USS 4-5times so far. And always had great time Current situation, they still build The Minions Land. Hopefully the construction will be finish end of this year.. Eventhough, the USS is the smallest Universal Studio, i guess, but still its worthed to visit

name: user_2891
review: I didnt expect that buying tickets at Tsuna is more expensive than buying tickets on site. Its summer vacation and many people are going there. Its really hot and sunny, so be sure to wear sunscreen.

name: user_2892
review: My sincere appreciation for the exceptional professionalism exhibited by your staffs Lynne, Rosemary, and Karthik during our visit to Universal Studio Singapore on 23.7.2024. Their attentiveness and courteous service. I'm tour Manager from Guideline Travels and my guests are Jain vegetarian. I have catered food for them, as they can't consume vegetables such as potatoes, garlic, and onion. I didn't know there's no re-entry for Universal Studio Singapore. I spoke to Mr. Lynne to allow my guests for a re-entry once they have consumed their food, and they will enter back to Universal Studio Singapore. Lynne was of great help to allow my guests to be re-entry. I would also like to greatly appreciate the assistance of Ms. Rosemary and Mr. Karthik in ensuring that the guests are given a re-entry stamp. Their willingness to accommodate as my guests are Jain vegetarian undoubtedly enhance the experience for all attendees. Now, knowing there is no re-entry, my next visit, I will inform my Travels not to cater food for our guests. Thank you once again for the excellent service and attention to detail.

name: user_2894
review: I was there on a rainy day, bought express pass so that no need to wait a long line.

name: user_2896
review: Beautiful and fun games. It takes 4 to 5 hours to finish the games. It is best to buy an Express card. The amount is very high, but it is enough for you to have to wait..

name: user_2899
review: It's okay, but it's a bit small. The facilities may malfunction.

name: user_2900
review: Amazing theme park in Southeast Asia. Love the design, atmosphere, and many attractions to enjoy. Like almost everything else in Singapore, the operations are very efficient and HighTech. The waiting at the opening gate was usually crowded, especially during the Holidays or weekend on peak season, but rest assured that the lines are moving very quickly and to save more time, I suggest you buy the ticket online (I used Klook). The line to any attractions is quite long though, so if you want to save some times, you can buy the Universal Express Pass. The attractions, went through almost every one of them and enjoy it so much. The staffs are also very courteous, saw a few people trying to cut the line but the staffs handled it very professionally so kudos to them. Love everything here and would be a great place to enjoy your day with your partner or love ones. With many attractions are currently on the way, I hope to visit there again one day.

name: user_2902
review: Look it was fun day but you need to do work to make it enjoyable and buy a fast pass!

name: user_2903
review: Very good, experience of a lifetime. If you can, buy UNIVERSAL EXPRESS pass along with the ticket, then you donot have to wait in long lines and can use almost all the best rides in one day. Worth every rupee

name: user_2904
review: First their staff behaviour was damn worst Simply they treat u like goats .. Next they keep wait time 60-200 min almost 3h.20 min y ? without planning taking too much admission just earn money right?! until 7 pm suddenly they reduced the wait time.. no where u find a chair to sit even u sit some place their staff scold u get away as if they are landlords .. exactly 8 pm they close & they keep open all the sales counters alone y ? To make money ? next food Water bottle(200 ml )-4 Singapore dollar Baby food - 14 Singapore dollars which is worst Food minimum 16 Singapore dollars which is so expensive..! I prefer dont waste ur time money & dignity In between they stop entry ride dont know y? Shows at specific time only so u need to go there

name: user_2906
review: I entered the island by monorail from Vivocity Station. There are two monorails, and it's busy. I arrived at the station at 9:40, but there was already a long line. Apparently, people in China are on summer vacation, so the staff said that it was crowded like this every day. Anyway, it was hot and humid, and being outside was exhausting, and waiting times for popular attractions were up to 80-90 minutes. I bought the Express Pass after thinking it was empty, but it worked great and I'm glad I bought it. The park itself is small and easy to get around. Unfortunately, Minion Park is still under construction.

name: user_2908
review: The worst amusement park experience. When buying things, people who pass the gates quickly jump in line. You have to wait in line for almost an hour for each ride. You also have to spend 4 star coins to rent locker space. The food is terrible. Its chemically flavored juice

name: user_2910
review: Our experience at Universal Studio Singapore was very nice. We all enjoyed it as a family and took advantage of all the time to experience the games and shows. The most beautiful games were in ancient Egypt. I do not know the name of the game, but we rode in a cart and it moved quickly.. and the story of the game was searching for the book. Also, Shrek Castle and the 4D show inside it was beautiful and entertaining for everyone We purchased Express Entry tickets for the games, which were very useful, saving us a lot of time and queuing, and allowing us to experience all the games

name: user_2911
review: Although it is small, you can play from the time it opens to the time it closes. Even on a Monday during the summer vacation, it took 30 minutes to queue up to get in. Without buying a quick pass, it took about half an hour to play every facility. In Jurassic Park It took nearly 100 minutes to wait in line for the express boat. The overall tour route was smooth and the performances were remarkable. The future water world blasting show and martial arts action were lifelike. The most fun ones were Transformers/Shrek. The food and drinks in the 4D movie are quite expensive, and it is not possible to enter the park again now, so it is recommended that you bring enough water and snacks to support yourself. Overall, it is a very good experience. It would be better if there were fewer people.

name: user_2914
review: Not as big as other Universal Studios. Still ok.

name: user_2915
review: The rush was too much, for every ride the wait was in hours even with express pass it was 15 20 minutes.

name: user_2916
review: smaller than Los Angeles I was able to look around in no time!

name: user_2917
review: What an amazing experience! It's a must visit. A fantasy world which is teeming with life. Age no bar.. All age groups would enjoy.

name: user_2918
review: Very crowded queues waiting in the heat to play Up to two hours The entry price is high, with no services to mention

name: user_2920
review: Incredibly fun..almost flawless..InshaAllah will definitely come back there again..for those from Indonesia, just bring your own raincoat for white water rafting..

name: user_2921
review: I had one of the best experience at this place. The rides were stunning and mesmerizing. Especially the Transformers one. This is one of the best places to visit here in Singapore. I wish to visit here another day.

name: user_2929
review: The children's favorite paradise is very fun, but it is a bit hotter in summer

name: user_2931
review: Good park. Nice rides but ........... Minion land is still under construction. So sad ....

name: user_2932
review: Love the place, 90% sheltered so when it rained, I remained dry. Food quite expensive but then it is worth it. Remember to bring raincoat for water ride and definitely recommend you to try out Human and Cylon. May seem scary, but after going once, I guarantee youll go again.

name: user_2936
review: Universal Studios is located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. It offers an exciting blend of entertainment, thrills, and cinematic magic. It provides unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages, combining iconic rides, live shows, and beloved characters from blockbuster movies. Universal Studios Singapore is separated into seven themed zones like Hollywood-inspired streets lined with iconic landmarks, the futuristic cityscapes of Sci-Fi City. Park's flagship attractions include: Transformers The Ride - 3D adventure where guests with Optimus Prime and the Autobots battle against the Decepticons. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure - River raft ride through dinosaur-infested waters with thrilling drops and surprises. Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon - A dueling roller coaster offering high-speed twists, turns, and loops. Live Shows and Entertainment - Musical performances featuring characters and spectacular stunt shows that recreate scenes from blockbuster films. Meet-and-Greet Opportunities - Chance to meet their favorite movie characters up close like photo with Minions from "Despicable Me," meeting characters from "Madagascar," or dinosaurs from "Jurassic Park". The park has a wide array of dining options, ranging from quick bites to themed restaurants providing international cuisine or snacks inspired by popular movie themes. Universal Studios Singapore features themed merchandise shops to purchase souvenirs, apparel, and collectibles. The park provides accessible pathways, wheelchair rentals, and accessible attractions. Informational maps and signage make navigation easy. Friendly staff members are to assist with any inquiries or special requests. Universal Studios Singapore offers a electrifying escape into the worlds of cinema, adventure, and fantasy. The park delivers an action-packed day of fun and excitement. It's a must-visit destination.

name: user_2937
review: I really like it. So glad I came here.

name: user_2938
review: If you are visiting Singapore, you must visit Universal Studios its amazing place for kids, and adults don't miss it

name: user_2939
review: it's a really nice visit to play. Maybe it's kinda expensive but really worth the price. i really recommend to visit with friends because it's so much fun. Better to visit since morning so you don't need to wait so long

name: user_2940
review: Universal Studios Singapore is Southeast Asias first and only Universal Studios theme park. Adrenaline-pumping rides, interactive shows, and a wide variety of exciting attractions are based on blockbuster movies and television series that you know and love. We only tried the Transformer ride, and it took almost an hour to get on. If you have patience then go, but if you don't have patience like me then just take pictures everywhere lol We went there on Thursday, and it was still really crowded. Tickets are recommended to be purchased in advance.1

name: user_2941
review: The theme park is from good to very bad renovated so the full circle is blocked. Only theme park that doesn't allow reentry if u forget anything in car or wish to rest at hotel it is not allowed. Selling tickets at extremely high price also no more annual pass and express pass is at 120 same goes for child there isn't any wet weather planning. Food choice is bad expensive and unhealthy why universal why u banned rentry and hide it in terms and conditions List goes on fast pass not applicable for all ride is jus boring.

name: user_2942
review: Amazing n Thrilling attraction, One must visit life time experience, lovely souvenirs for kiddos n youngsters like me, I enjoyed , even full day is not enough to see all attractions @Unviersals

name: user_2943
review: Purchased tickets online and subsequently encountered a 20-minute delay in the queue, followed by an additional 20-minute wait for the conversion of the online tickets into physical tickets. Long queues on normal and express tickets

name: user_2944
review: Although it is not as big as Universal Studios Japan, it still has everything you need. It takes a whole day to visit. Food in the park is a bit expensive. It is my second visit. The Madagascar park has been updated to the Little Soldiers Park (under construction). expect......

name: user_2945
review: Transformers is a 360-degree dynamic 3D cinema roller coaster. The visual effects include the car being thrown away by the cable and falling from a high altitude. Very nice. There is another facility, which is different from the previous chain-climbing roller coaster. It uses an electric motor to climb quickly, and is equipped with various water and fire sound and light effects.

name: user_2946
review: The rides were fun but lines r big

name: user_2947
review: Very amazing place absolutely stunning would recommend everyone one to go and visit

name: user_2949
review: Went to both Beijing's universal and Singapore's this trip. Singapore better cause A LOT less people (don't need express, but can if U want to) and has more exciting rides. The cylon, human and the ancient Egypt rides were great. We went on the cylon ride like 5 times.

name: user_2950
review: Minion closed

name: user_2951
review: It was my first time going to Universal Studios. I've never been to Japan, so I can't compare, but the wait time was reasonable.

name: user_2952
review: **Universal Studios Singapore: A Thrilling Experience with a Few Hiccups** As an avid theme park enthusiast, I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore. While the overall experience was exhilarating, there were a couple of issues that prevented me from giving it a perfect 5-star rating. **What I Loved:** 1. **Rides and Attractions:** The rides are top-notch, especially Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy. The attention to detail in each themed area is commendable. 2. **Immersive Worlds:** Walking through Hollywood, Ancient Egypt, and Far Far Away felt like stepping into beloved movies. The ambiance is captivating. 3. **Shows and Performances:** The WaterWorld show and the street performances added an extra layer of entertainment. Kudos to the talented performers! **Areas for Improvement:** 1. **Queue Times:** You hit the nail on the head here. The queue times displayed often didn't match the actual wait. Waiting for 20 minutes turned into a 2-hour ordeal. 2. **Seating:** Agreed! Some queue lines lacked seating areas. Standing for hours can be exhausting, especially in the tropical heat. **Tips for Fellow Visitors:** - **Early Bird Advantage:** Arrive early to beat the crowds and enjoy shorter wait times. - **Hydrate and Rest:** Bring water and take short breaks. Your feet will thank you! - **Patience Is Key:** Remember, everyone's there for the same reasonto have a blast! Despite the glitches, Universal Studios Singapore remains a must-visit for thrill-seekers and movie buffs alike. Just be prepared for a few twists and turns beyond the rides!

name: user_2955
review: There are a lot of people even on weekdays during the peak season. You can see when it is not crowded on the timetable app among the two apps. After 5 o'clock, a lot of people leave, so you can almost always wait a little while to get a ride. Even if you go early, if you wait for an hour, you get a king. If you go early, how about riding something that can accommodate a large number of people first, such as a performance, and riding the rides later?

name: user_2956
review: Weve visited this universal studios many times over the past decade. Unfortunately its taken turn for the worse until the upgrades are done. The entire Madagascar sections have gone while they replace with Minions. So basically there are fewer attractions now. Vary little offering of photos like before. I think it would be fair to say wait until upgrades are completed or universal studios should discount the tickets

name: user_2962
review: Fun entertainment place with many games

name: user_2963
review: I love the rollercoasters there. It is a thrilling experience. However, wait times can go up to 150 mins. Even the express queue was quite long. OVERAL: it was great place!!!!

name: user_2964
review: It was convenient to purchase tickets in advance. The rides are also very fun.

name: user_2965
review: Came here for a night company event. Had a blast with all the adrenaline rides. Good variety of halal food. A prayer place is available.

name: user_2967
review: Must visit if you are in Singapore. It has something for everyone. The rides are well curated, each providing an experience to feel and enjoy. The dark rides like The Transformers are also worth the wait. The live performance at the Minions corner is also a thoroughly enjoyable and immersive one. The food joints offer plenty to choose from and the souvenir stores have a great collection.

name: user_2968
review: Great place featuring Universal Studios.100 percent recommended for tourists.

name: user_2970
review: A nicely themed and clean theme park. Fun attractions, shows and entertainment. Queue times range anywhere from as low as 10 minutes all the way up to 100 minutes with usual waiting times around 20-50 minutes. The park is not as big as the American parks but the attractions are fun, well designed and of high quality. The staff members are kind and helpful. Many dining options throughout the park ranging from typical western restaurants to a wide selection of local food. One day is enough to experience all the larger attractions in the park. Buying tickets in advance isnt necessary, I found the ticket prices at the ticket booth to be slightly cheaper than what is offered online.

name: user_2971
review: Perfect place to enjoy the day if you like Rollercoaster, not much to do for young kids. Please note that if you purchased an entrance ticket in advance and it has a QR code, it's only an voucher, that needs to be exchanged at Guest Services before proceeding to the entrance. This makes advance ticket purchases a little useless and time-consuming.

name: user_2972
review: The best place to enjoy and chill out with friends and conduct group tours. The most recommended ride is the Transformers Ride. Do visit early morning to enjoy all the rides and attractions.

name: user_2973
review: 8 hours there and didn't even notice. The saying is true; "Time flies when you're having fun."

name: user_2975
review: It's only the fifth Universal studio theme park in the world and 2nd in Asia.

name: user_2981
review: Express pass was handy to get on rides quickly. Needs more fans and demisters installed around park and aircon to be blasted due to warm weather.

name: user_2983
review: I bought the entry ticket first after transferred to other pass waited for very long,why they were not finish same time? Very disappointed ,second photo is ticket transfer to entry pass station

name: user_2984
review: Visit in 2022, quite crowded. You might need to plan which activities that you want first.

name: user_2990
review: Always had a good time @universal

name: user_2991
review: Universal Studios Singapore, located at Resorts World Sentosa, is one of the premier theme parks in Southeast Asia. The park offers a variety of rides and attractions suitable for all ages, from thrilling roller coasters to entertaining interactive shows. The park is divided into seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, Far Far Away, and Madagascar. Each zone features decorations and attractions that match its specific theme Universal Studios Singapore also features various live shows, such as "WaterWorld," a thrilling stunt show, and "Shrek 4-D Adventure," an interactive film that takes viewers into the world of Shrek. The park is well-equipped with amenities such as restaurants, souvenir shops, and comfortable rest areas. Visitors can enjoy a wide range of food, from local dishes to international cuisine, and take home exclusive souvenirs. To make the most of your visit, it's recommended to arrive early, use express passes to avoid long lines, and wear comfortable clothing. Don't forget to bring a camera to capture the exciting moments at the park. Universal Studios Singapore is a perfect destination for spending time with family and friends, offering an entertainment-filled experience and unforgettable memories.

name: user_2992
review: Long line to enter the games, the wait may reach an hour The fast pass ticket is not for all games and its price is high

name: user_2993
review: Whats the deal with people running the Puss n Boots ride? They have to constantly stop the ride because the attendants havent queued enough people, the attendants just chitchat with one another while the ride is stopped waiting for riders, they take 75% from the express pass line sometimes 100% from the express pass line while letting cars stop and go unfilled. Its ludicrous. The ticket portal does not work for foreign credit cards and theres no way to buy with Apple/Google Pay. This was a problem 1yr ago and its still there. You have to shop 3rd party vendors for advanced ticket purchase but still have to wait in a long queue at customer service to get your park ticket. Thats bonkers. The app didnt work for half the day. Kept giving bad gateway errors despite being on Resort World Sentosas WiFi. Its an otherwise great park but their ride management needs work along with their customer service and systems.

name: user_2995
review: An amusement park for adults only. yes! USS! I had previously heard that the site is much smaller than USJ and that 4-5 hours would be enough, so I thought that would not be the case, but it turned out to be true. I entered in the afternoon and was satisfied by around 16:00. I forgot the names, but there are two fairly interesting roller coasters. The climbing speed is faster than regular roller coasters in Japan. That also amplifies the thrill. Such attractions are good, but simulation-based ones have a language barrier that reduces the fun. No, anything else. That's your responsibility. It's my fault that I didn't study properly. I'm glad I was able to go to the USS, which I don't often have the chance to visit, as a memory that will last a lifetime.

name: user_2998
review: Very fun, be sure to buy quick pass, save time and play more

name: user_2999
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem for anyone looking to have a fun-filled day! From the moment you step inside, youre transported to a world of excitement and adventure. The park is impeccably clean and well-maintained, making the experience even more enjoyable. The variety of rides and attractions is truly impressive. Whether youre a thrill-seeker looking for an adrenaline rush on the Battlestar Galactica roller coasters or prefer a more relaxed experience like the enchanting Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, theres something for everyone. The themed zones are incredibly immersive, and the attention to detail is top-notch. The live shows are another highlight, offering a great mix of entertainment and interactive fun. The WaterWorld show is a must-see, with its spectacular stunts and special effects. The character meet-and-greets are also a big hit, especially for families with young children. The staff at Universal Studios Singapore are friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. The food options are diverse and cater to various tastes, ensuring that no one goes hungry. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fantastic day out filled with fun, laughter, and unforgettable memories. Its a must-visit for both tourists and locals alike!

name: user_3000
review: Express required!!!!! I went with the Gow City Pass, but the ticket picking place was different and I had a hard time getting a ticket error, but the staff helped me all the way through so I was able to get in. You can complete a full circle in 4 to 5 hours. It was all fun

name: user_3002
review: Everything inside is pricey.

name: user_3003
review: It's really exciting, you have to go there, kids friendly, lots of queues, advise wearing sandals or comfortable shoes because you will be standing in line or walking a long way

name: user_3004
review: If youre into theme parks, you may like it. But rides are not that great except cyclone. And theyre quite short. Also, better to take express ticket since wait time goes up to 2 hours for some of them.

name: user_3005
review: Although it is relatively small, it is definitely enough for a day of fun. The most recommended are the two stunt shows a day, Transformers (not a roller coaster/suitable for all sizes), Jurassic Park (a small surfing spaceship), and the Spielberg special effects demonstration is also very interesting. Also note that Tomb Raider is a high-speed roller coaster, so dont be fooled!

name: user_3008
review: Excellent fun for kids of all ages, the rides suit a wide range of thrill levels, we had a great day

name: user_1634
review: Awesome day out at the Universal studios. We had the regular entry passes and many a time was considering the express pass as queues were ranging from 20 to 60 minutes . But we were 2 adults and 4 kids and for an extra 780 we opted to queue . We managed all the rides comfortably to be fair so no regrets . Perhaps who comes weekdays will find it even easier.

name: user_3009
review: Sure we had fun. Compared to other Locations for example Tokyo or Disney World its kinda small and limited in terms of everything. The flair was not really there and we missed some more attractions. Transformers the Ride was fun.

name: user_3010
review: Universal studios Singapore is a very enormous place! It contains various rides and many zones! It contains many fictional charecter rides.

name: user_3011
review: Easy to take the public train to get to Universal studios. I would highly recommend booking the express pass and go do the Super Nintendo world (Mario) first because its the most popular spot and people tend to NOT leave the area. It gets very packed. We were there for 4 hours in that area and the crowd did not seem to slow down.

name: user_3013
review: The rides are fun Only the queue during the holiday season can be 1 hour

name: user_3015
review: Absolutely amazing. Firstly, the express pass is definitely worth it. You can only use it once per ride, and cost can vary depending on how busy it is. The day we came, it was S110, but can go as low as S80. Lines for rides that would normally be 80 minutes, you can get on in 20 minutes with an express pass. I do believe you can buy an express pass online when you buy your ticket, however I bought once inside. The transformers ride is definitely worth it, low wait times for me and a really exciting ride. The Cylon roller coaster was also really good, as was the mummy indoor roller coaster, however these have much longer wait times. Food is VERY expensive there, but tastes pretty good. I arrived there by bus, which is only S1, but you can also get there through cable car and monorail. I recommend getting a locker and splitting cost among friends, as you can't bring possessions on most roller coasters. I also recommend spending at least 6 or 7 hours there, there's that much to do. Also exciting was the soundstage showing how movie scenes can be made, hosted by Steven Spielberg. Overall an exciting place and a definite visit whenever you're in Singapore

name: user_3017
review: It a entertainment for family or individual, many ride and show performance need a full day to visit.

name: user_3020
review: The place has many beautiful check-in points and spacious space. A place worth visiting when coming to Malaysia

name: user_3024
review: A bit of a rip off, however we had fun as we where there early and be able to get in a few rides in before wait times went up. From 11.30ish, don't bother queuing as you easily wait 30 minutes even for boring rides. Shows got canceled due to potential rain when there were blue skies. Highly disappointed, we had to wait over 30min for the water world to start due to weather. Although it was a good day, prices, wait times and show cancelations were a bit of a downer.

name: user_3029
review: A place filled with rides and fun USS is the place to be out in the sun I enjoyed my time with family and friends I dont want this experience to end

name: user_3030
review: A great way to spend the day filled with excitement and fun. We took the Cable Cars from Harbour front Tower 2 then catch Bus A or B directly to USS. There are a lot of rides with long wait times. The express is worth the time you save being able to visit all of the attractions (generally no wait if you have the pass). Another tip would be to use the single rider line to skip the queues. Would definitely recommend Universal Studios Singapore.

name: user_3031
review: Too bad. Too crowded! Waited 60 minutes and couldn't play any games. It feels very expensive. There are many ticket classes such as VIP, express, no need to queue, etc. In general, the way to pay is quite good

name: user_3035
review: Visited through grab and dropped off in front of casino; satisfied as we could get in there before opening. For ticketing from the webpage, you can buy 1hr early entrance. Waiting time was less during opening time period and after 5pm. Even though we had to wait 60-70min during day time, after than 5pm, there was only 5-15min. I thought whether to buy express ticket, on the day we visited, even it was LNY peak period, riding attractions was enough to enjoy without the express ticket. ** revisited in July, and it was crowded and queue were still long until the late evening. So we used single rider to avoid longer waiting time for our 2nd round of ride. My sons loved there so much. Not that big we could look around within a day, which is good thing for us. For attractions, Transformer 4D, mummy, shrek 4D were great. Strongly recommend Water world show- they are perform twice a day at 1:30pm and 4:30pm. Human, cylon, and the water ride in Jurassic park were good for me but seems some people dislike these ones due to the height or getting wet. The Water ride is definitely wet. Youd better preparing raincoat seriously. treasure hunter, troll show, puss in boots were just okay for us. There was lots of photo spot and characters so check the time first. Dragon and kungfu panda is at 7:30pm. For lunch, we had hotdog in jurassic park. Almost 20 per person.

name: user_3037
review: USS is quite small but it's worth being there. However, Minion-land is still under construction.

name: user_3038
review: Universal Studios in California is still quite awesome But it is still worth giving four stars. It has done what it should do in a limited space.

name: user_3039
review: The park is very big and there are many interesting things to play.

name: user_3041
review: It's quite compact compared to Osaka. You get pretty soaked in Jurassic World, but it was a lot of fun. It costs 5SGD to use a full body hair dryer after you leave. The plate of curry in the food court nearby was probably flavored with cinnamon or star anise, but it was quite strong and not to my liking. Also, the person organizing the queue only spoke in Chinese, so I couldn't understand anything. Overall it was fun, so it's worth going at least once.

name: user_3042
review: the place is wonderful, we visited on the weekday even though was crowded ,so express pass is highly recommended to enjoy your time specially in the hot weather.

name: user_3044
review: Admission to the park on Tuesday 07/09 (stay 0830-1530) is always crowded Suggestions: 1. Buy early entry to the park and take photos and have breakfast. 2. Buy express passes (I dont know if its related to the summer vacation. Its only one-time and there is no unlimited express passes). 3. Go to the queue at 10.00 for those who cannot use express passes. 2 items 4. The most terrifying mecha roller coaster. There is no need to queue until around 1500, but the seats are very smelly of sweat. For your reference Ps When I left the kindergarten, I saw a lot of Chinese childrens camp groups. Everyone had big and small bags of souvenirs and toys. Its not like I left the kindergarten empty-handed. Haha.

name: user_3045
review: Great place for all ages, fun

name: user_3047
review: I had so much fun playing. It's the best Cylons are so super strong that they vomit if they do something wrong. Please be careful!

name: user_3050
review: Favorite place to have fun

name: user_3051
review: The only adventure park I felt safe with all the rides. It was so fun and I enjoyed a lot

name: user_3052
review: It was just an awesome experience. If you are someone who seeks adventure and is up for adrenaline rush anytime this is a must visit place. So many rides and theme based adventure. Great place for all age groups.

name: user_3053
review: A unique experience for children

name: user_3057
review: Beautiful place. Lot of items. You need atleast a full day to cover the attractions. Some attractions are too crowd and you have to stand in queue. A paradise for photographers.

name: user_3059
review: The worst amusement park in the world. They always talk about technical problems. The machine is broken. I wasted two hours waiting in line to vent the air.,, Don't come here to be a fool or an idiot,

name: user_3061
review: After queuing for almost 2hrs for the rapid Adventure, we were told that the project would need to be temporarily suspended due to technical issues. You can continue to wait at where you are, but they will not tell you the estimated waiting time. You can also choose to leave. During the peak period, each project had to wait for a long time. When something like this happened, all the previous waits were in vain, and it rained heavily. There is no compensation, not to mention the rude attitude of the staff towards tourists. Definitely wont come again, USS Singapore.

name: user_3062
review: Some rides were not working the reason was maintenance given by staff... Long ques and not proper management. In the transformer ride we were stuck in a ride due to a mechanical issue for 10 min. Do not visit sea world waste of time and money. All plastic... Rest all have fun... Time pass

name: user_3063
review: One of the mainstay theme parks, the rides are great, the shows are also on time. Food and drinks are available everywhere and in various kinds. Lockers are also available, some even free for a certain period of time. Getting to and leaving the location is also very easy to access, and there are several vehicle options available to suit your budget.

name: user_3064
review: I visited Universal Studios on a Monday and found that the ride waiting time was over 90 minutes. Even people with priority passes had to wait over 30 minutes per ride. Additionally, there was inadequate seating at the food court. Considering the high administration fees of approximately 80 for an adult, it doesn't seem like a good value for money.

name: user_3066
review: It's okay, but the queue time is much longer than the play time

name: user_3070
review: Very nice buying express is recommended

name: user_3074
review: The family and I had a fantastic time at universal. Unfortunately the wait times for the rides were a little long which takes away from the enjoyment, however, it's still a great day out.

name: user_3075
review: I went as a weekday rider and didn't buy an express pass. I was able to collect all the rides I wanted to play. The queue didn't take long. I recommend downloading the Universal SG app to view the queue (or you can look at the ride page). And if you don't buy the express, choose to ride the rides that there will be a lot of people playing first, like Mummy and Transformer, so you don't have to wait in long queues. Dressing is casual. Sneakers/sandals as per convenience (Personally, I prefer sandals, Jurassic style, cool if wet). Food prices are quite high. There is free water available. You can carry a water bottle inside. Personally, I really like Universal's professionalism. The player has a PM and a clear warning label. Recommend and good service

name: user_3076
review: Recommended to buy an express ticket if you want to do all the rides and it's a full day itinerary. Universal Studio SG app shows the waiting time for rides and show times. It's super convenient to check the app for details. There are lockers for a small fee near the entrance for some rides if the mobile phones and bags are not allowed in the ride.

name: user_3077
review: The best place to spend an entire day in Singapore Water world show is a must watch

name: user_3078
review: USS provided an exciting getaway for our family of four adults, despite the weekend crowds and wait times of 30 to 45 minutes per ride with a regular pass. The Transformer and Mummy rides were definite highlights, offering thrilling experiences worth waiting for. Unfortunately, heavy rain cut our visit short, preventing us from enjoying more rides. Nevertheless, the park's themed zones and immersive attractions made for a memorable day filled with cinematic adventures. Ideal for families seeking fun and excitement.

name: user_3081
review: Kid is having fun in this place. Especially kids above 120 cm

name: user_3084
review: Needs more seating in cool areas,

name: user_3085
review: I went on a weekday (2019/11/21) and it was quiet. So I don't buy express. I used it as a regular ticket. Entry at 10 o'clock, almost all rides until departure at 6 o'clock, including the Water World performance at 5 o'clock I used it and had a really enjoyable day. In particular, I was most impressed by the excellent 4D version of Transformers, and my 7-year-old daughter loved it so much that she gave Puss in Boots a thumbs up.

name: user_3086
review: always mesmerizing!! now coming here with family, my daughter just love it! Thankyou Ken for the street artwork you did, amazing!!

name: user_3088
review: The queues were horrible even in the morning of a weekday, so I recommend buying the express pass. The park itself has not that many rides and I would say not suitable for older children. The drinks and food were expensive as expected. Overall, would not choose to go there again unless you are a diehard fan of Universal studios or has kids who really want to go there.

name: user_3089
review: It's small. Compared to Osaka, it is best not to expect much from theme museums. If you only experience one thing, you should definitely see the Water World show.

name: user_3090
review: This is transformers attraction. Using very low ticket, it will cost your time to queue.

name: user_3091
review: Must visit.... good place with all facilities. Enjoyed a lot

name: user_3098
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute blast! From the moment you step through the gates, you're transported into a world of fun and excitement. The park is impeccably clean and well-maintained, with friendly staff always ready to assist. The rides are fantastic and cater to all ages. The attention to detail in each themed area is impressive, making every corner of the park an adventure in itself. The live shows and character meet-and-greets add an extra layer of magic. There are also plenty of dining options offering a variety of cuisines, which was great for refueling in between rides. Highly recommend getting an express pass if you want to make the most of your visit. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers an unforgettable experience. Can't wait to visit again!

name: user_3101
review: It's my 2nd time here and now with my daughter

name: user_3103
review: Enjoyable .. If dont want to wait a long time in the queue, Express Pass is recommended.

name: user_3104
review: Had fun at Universal Studios. The average wait time for most of the rides was 60 minutes so if you are wanting to go on lots of rides, would recommend the express pass. Most of the food options were also really busy at lunchtime, so prepare to be patient.

name: user_3105
review: It is small and hot compared to usj If u driving, go with the signboard that wrote Resort world...

name: user_3106
review: priority pass,

name: user_3107
review: Need to add new games

name: user_3108
review: Amazing experience (must do if youre visiting here with friends/family)! There are so many exhilarating rides to go on and even if you dont like high speed intense rollercoasters (if you do go to 1. Cylon/Human, 2. Mummy), there are many chill relaxing rides and everywhere is a great place to take photos and create memories. There are also live performances / meet&greets with some fictional characters. There are many places to eat and rest (snacks or lunch/dinner) throughout the amusement park. This will be needed as it can get pretty hot However, the only downside is that most of the time when youre visiting (weekends/public holidays), you will HAVE to wait in a long line (20-60 minutes) for a single ride with the normal tickets. As a regular visitor here, I recommend purchasing the Universal Express Pass (S193) for optimal enjoyment and minimal wait time (you can go 8-10 times on a ride while people still wait in a line). I also recommend going on a less busy day like the weekdays and making full use of the entry time at 11:00am and exit at 6:00pm,

name: user_3109
review: Perfect place to feel young and blissful ever!

name: user_3110
review: Great attractions, but not many

name: user_1386
review: Small and dont have major section like Harry Potter Fast teack is is expensive and only one time per game Water is only available in paper bottle No people are available to help if you have any questions Never ccompare it with US

name: user_3112
review: I see some people complaining about the rides so here's my two cents: Download the app and show up before 11. First thing in the morning: start with Human, there should be almost no wait time. Right after that, you should get on the Mummy, there would be maybe 20 min wait time if you show up before 11:30. Then move to the far side further rides such as the Jurassic Park River or Shrek 4D. Meanwhile, definitely spend time on some small rides in that corner. Around 2, people will start heading for lunch, which means that Cyclone and Transformers will have like 10min wait time.
