After lunch, move to the front section, those rides are generally the emptier ones. Later at like 4:50, people will start lining up for Waterworld which means you can do any ride pretty much without waiting. Everyone gets into the Waterworld theater without issues and you don't have to spend 20 min waiting in line. People usually don't wanna sit in the splash zone, which means you can get good seats even if u show up late. Towards the end of the day, I'd do Canope flyer and Puss in Boots because you get views of the whole island and Singapore. We managed to do everything and it was a time we'll spent. Some rides seem a bit outdated and could use more creativity/sophistication. This being said, if you are willing to pay the money, getting the express pass is worth it.

name: user_3113
review: Went on a Thursday, still long q every ride but by 4pm waiting time decrease. Should invest on the express pass next visit. Bought yhe tickets online (traveloka) with food vouchers. Easy access just scan hp. Bring water bottle as refill place is abundance. There's smoking area & a surau (next to Battlestar Galactica rollercoaster) . Halal eatery near Mummy attraction.

name: user_3119
review: It is a very beautiful amusement park with a variety of games. I advise booking an express entry ticket due to the large number of visitors and the long wait for each game.

name: user_3121
review: Fun times - family times . Shows and rides all come together to bring an exhilarating time to all - young and old . The parade by the characters at the end of the evening was just super !

name: user_3122
review: Spending 6 hours at Universal Studios in Singapore was an interesting experience. If you purchase the Express Pass for over 7 million VND, you wont need to wait in lines everywhere. However, if you opt for regular tickets, be prepared to queue for each ride, which can take anywhere from 20 to 50 minutes, sometimes even with 100 people ahead of you! The term rides here doesnt necessarily mean actual games; it often refers to attractions where you sit and enjoy the experience. Universal Studios offers various themed areas, including NYC, Transformers, Ancient Egypt, Jurassic Park, and Far Far Away (soon to have a Minion land). However, there arent too many games. If you visit, prioritize the Jurassic Park ride (remember to bring a raincoat from homeit costs 10,000 VNDbecause the 6 SGD per person fee here will leave you as wet as a soaked mouse! ). Next, try the Transformer ride (it felt so real that it made my heart skip a beat). Theres also an impressive show that recreates an action scene from JAWS, directed by Steven Spielberg. Its fantastic, although experiencing 2-3 scenes instead of just 1 would be even more satisfying! For younger visitors, the other attractions are more relaxed. Universal Studios has several roller coasters, but unfortunately, my digestion and heart arent up to the task, so I couldnt review them. Overall, the 1.4 million VND per person price tag for an experience comparable to what youd find in the United States didnt leave me completely satisfied. Id rate it a 7 out of 10. Heres hoping for a Disneyland visit someday to add to my reviews!

name: user_3124
review: Entry tickets are expensive and queues are long. Buying express tickets is not much different from the normal queue because there are also a lot of people buying express tickets. Fun games but set aside time all day just to play here. Food in the area is expensive.

name: user_3125
review: Pretty poor experience and like most things in singapore way overpriced! We went on 2nd day of supposed minions themed experience but the minion land was not even open! It takes up nearly half of the park and is still under construction. What a rip off!! Too hot, no areas to cool down, very few and overpriced food options, insanely long waits for underwhelming rides. There are only roughly 10 total rides in operation now. We basically left after less than 4 hours. Would have more enjoyment to watch my money burn in fire pit on beach! Dont waste your time! If you are expecting a disney like experience prepare to be let down!

name: user_3126
review: Fun place, did almost all the rides. Glad the galaxy roller coaster was up and running. Pricey foods and drinks though

name: user_3128
review: A very small universal studios Fun things for small kids: Seasome street ride and shows Ride in far far away kingdom Fun things for bigger kids/adult : The human roller coaster is actually boring , while the cyclonroller coaster is really exciting The mummy ride is quite fun as well. The lighting special effect in movie is amazing , showing you how a movie studio can make audience believe thigns are happening in the movie . Then other games are just alright, if you are not big fan of the characters then indeed you can go there 9-5pm (with fast pass and play all of each 1-2 times )

name: user_3129
review: Insanely long queues / wait times for rides. An express pass wouldnt have even helped as the rides kept getting closed for weather warnings. The food options in the park are low quality and overpriced.

name: user_3131
review: Wait in line for 2 hrs

name: user_3133
review: For those who come to Singapore I must say you must enter Universal Studios. Spend a full day here and you will definitely like it.

name: user_3134
review: Awesome with express ticket. Everything went so smoothly

name: user_3137
review: Even though I visited on a Saturday, there weren't many people. It closes early, but I lined up for a clone around 5 o'clock and didn't have to wait even 10 minutes.

name: user_3138
review: Express pass or no, you will wait for 60 mins on big rides (normal pass to wait for 120 min) Lower your expectations on weekdays.. Be ready that staff will close big rides for unknown reasons (it was sun and hot day when i went today 1st of July) They even delay the biggest shows for potential risks due to EXPECTED bad weather!! .. they must see things coming that we couldn't see in the clear sky above us :) Anyhow go with no expectations at all please. *I paid express for 120 and wish i didn't, i failed to notice the fast pass concept with sooo many people having express pass ! They have a lot to improve and they need to show "sold out" sign to control the huge crowd buying tickets per day.

name: user_3139
review: This is the must visit place with friends and family if you are in singapore. I highly recommend to go for express ticket, this is double the cost but it's worth it. You can save more than 30 mins per ride with the express. Don't Start with roller coaster. Keep it for last and before the lunch. Whole new world for kids.

name: user_3142
review: it is amazing ,but have to wait the line for long time...

name: user_3145
review: Crowded beyond belief, people just randomly bump into you, no spacial boundaries. Every attractions wait time is 70 minutes or more! Express tickets sold out. This is a must skip for all travellers.

name: user_3146
review: Ive been to every Universal park except one, and this is a pretty good one. Its definitely cheaper, which is reasonable considering its small size. But size doesnt matter as this park is a whole-lot of fun. It contains copies of attractions from other universal parks with a slight difference, and it has its own unique rides. My favorite was Battlestar Galactica coaster (cylon obviously) as it had an amazing launch in the middle of the lift hill to get that adrenaline pumping. The Jurassic park ride was a fun little change from the original (from boat ride to spinning raft ride). I dont think express passes matter too much, as the longest line was 40 mins on a Saturday. I would recommend checking out this nice little universal park if youre in Singapore.

name: user_3147
review: If anyone wants a lifetime experience, you have to visit Universal Studios Singapore.

name: user_3148
review: Very cool place, all the activities here are good and I really feel like staying here for a long time

name: user_3149
review: We liked it a lot, we had a great time!

name: user_3150
review: Amazing place. There are games and activities designed in the theme of each and every movie. It is super huge so you need to take a whole day if you want to see it all.. you get good food here, there are many cafes and shops to buy souvenirs for your loved ones..

name: user_3151
review: I was there on a weekday, and it was crowded! The admission line was pretty fast though, the staff were very helpful and attentive. The park was not that big, a single day admission is enough to try out everything. The food was expensive as expected but we were so hungry that we did not mind. We had lunch at the diner near the entrance, and it was pretty good. Navigating the park can be really challenging with a toddler especially how hot it was. Make sure to use a sunblock, bring portable fan and an insulated tumbler!

name: user_3156
review: Universal Studios in Singapore was undoubtedly the highlight of my trip. The park's thrilling roller coasters and attractions provided an exhilarating experience that I'll never forget. Although I couldn't experience every ride or show, the ones I did were spectacular. The overall atmosphere and excitement of the park was great. Dont miss out on the ride Revenge of the Mummy.

name: user_3158
review: My kids have a lot of fun,.if you like extreme rides theres a lot in here..all in all a day of fun,.

name: user_3159
review: Its one of the must-visit attractions, if you are coming to Singapore. The theme park contains a variety of thrilling indoor and outdoor rides, 2 types of roller coasters, a 4d show, a fairytale inspired castle, various meets and greets, etc. A must visit is the 'Transformers' 3D indoor ride and the " WaterWorld " show. In terms of dining and shopping, the theme park has a lot of options, which are pocket-friendly and well-maintained. The only downside is the amount of wait time some of the rides and attractions have, going up to or above an hour during peak, so recommended to visit the park during weekdays, or to purchase the Universal Express pass to reduce the wait time.

name: user_3160
review: Too many people, if you want to have a good time, you should buy a free pass to save the time and the sanity. The transformer show is good so as the Jurassic world boat. The water world show we lineup, but when they say okay to come in, the Indian and Chinese just cut the line. You can't reason with these two kind of people. Anyway the water world show just like the movie, the finale which plane coming in is pretty impressive. They have a truck transporting the raptor pretty cool. The souvenir of universal studio is pretty expensive compared to the skyworld, so I just buy a Kung Fu Panda shirt.

name: user_3163
review: Come on June 25, 2024 (Tuesday) with just a regular ticket, you can play all the rides, even ride Cylon 3x and Mummy 2x. If it doesn't drizzle, you can play all the rides 2x - 3x Arrived at USS at 09.00, took some photos first. At 09.30 am already queuing in front of the gate in the front row even though the gate has not been opened At 10.00 am go straight in and ride Transformer (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Cylon (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Mummy (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Jurassic Park (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Puss in Boots (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Enchanted Airways (queue 5 minutes) Continue to watch Sherk (queue 5 minutes) Lunch break Continue to watch WaterWorld (queue 15 minutes) Continue to ride Canopy Flyer (queue 20 minutes) Continue to ride Human (queue 30 minutes) Continue to ride Cylon 2 (queue 5 minutes) Continue to ride Mummy 2 (queue 30 minutes) Continue watching Light, Action, Camera (queue 25 minutes) Continue riding the 3rd Cylon (queue 10 minutes) When playing the 3rd Cylon, it started to drizzle, if there was no drizzle, we could have continued riding the cylons as much as we wanted because the queue was short

name: user_3165
review: Great experience. It's not a massive park but kids loved it ... Strongly recommend getting early bird entry and express passes ... We did what we could without waiting times for the first hour then used our express passes in the afternoon ...

name: user_3166
review: We were very impressed from start to finish. Make sure you have a full day, you may have to wait in line for some attractions, this is normal.

name: user_3169
review: I am a local SG. My expectation was high for SG USS after visiting Japan USS. SG USS lost out in terms of the lack of energy level and customer service attitude of the theme park staff. One of the USS staff ignored me when I asked him some questions, yet when a Caucasian guy asked him, the same staff smiled politely and entertained him. This is unfair treatment and racism in SG from our local staff.

name: user_3170
review: Recommend Shrek 4D!

name: user_3171
review: Cannot really give them a negetive rating ,so the single star. Reached at around 10 am ,took 80 min for the transformers ride,no place to sit while we wait,no option of rest rooms too. Next got on line for the roller coaster,the most sought after ride,after waiting for 2 hours and reaching just about the line where we enter the ride there was a technical issue and the ride was delayed,very unprofessional behaviour by the staff,no information was been shared ,they spoke very rudely and they sure do have a sense of superiority in them and for sure they are not service oriented,any which ways went around the whole park waiting for hours for very average rides,paying a bomb of food and water(almost 4times). Got back to the roller coaster,waited another 90min and still could not ride due to the same technical issue.same pathetic behaviour by the staff. Not bothered about their clients. Worst day of my life. Guys don't come here . These studio staff guys are only licking the soles of people who buy the super expensive express passes. Not bothered about the comment people who have also paid quite a lot for the regular ticket. Overhyped and over priced and pathetic services Avoid And if you must go always but that expensive express pass, never the regular tickets.

name: user_3172
review: We were there at the beginning of June and luckily there wasn't much going on. We had bought the tickets including early access and express pass online in advance and therefore had little to no waiting. The food there is quite expensive and the quality could be better. It's a fairly small park compared to LA or Orlando but definitely worth a visit. It is a very detailed park and the unique area from the Shrek films including the castle from Far Far Away and the Sesame Street attractions are worth a visit. The Star Trek roller coasters and the Mummy are great and also suitable for fatter people. Great fun for young and old

name: user_3176
review: It was a long wait for some rides, but it was fun

name: user_3182
review: Been visiting USS for the past 8-9years core memories. However some of the area has been shut down for reconstruction heard theres a minion theme coming up soon

name: user_3184
review: Lots of people, but fun! The staff inside are all friendly and you can buy tickets online in advance so you dont have to wait too long.

name: user_3186
review: Its a must visit place to visit if anyone coming to singapore. I like the overall atmosphere rides, entertainment show. All rides are superb and i must recommend to take dinasaur ride, its too awesome and thrilling

name: user_3187
review: Touristors are adviced to take universal express pass so they can explore everything peacefully

name: user_3190
review: Best. Weekdays are also busy with people. I just played Transformers and Far Far Away. Will have to repeat again later.

name: user_3191
review: Science Fiction City "Battlestar" and "Transformers 3D Tour" Ancient Egypt The Lost World Far Far Away New York Hollywood Future Water World 13 points must-see You must wear a raincoat and rain boot covers in Jurassic River Park, otherwise your shoes will be damaged

name: user_3193
review: It was so exciting to be there you can spend your whole day. In every half n hour there are shows which are really good.

name: user_3194
review: It was a fun, thrilling, and breathtaking experience. I really enjoyed all of the rides

name: user_3195
review: Among all Universal Studios this one is by far the smallest, with it's rides being very short as well. Usually you'll wait in line for 30 to 45 minutes only to ride for 30 seconds (Jurassic Park etc., 75 seconds at Treasure Hunters) Food is expensive and we had the worst, tasteless and most expensive hotdog in our lives (S19, there's only one Hot Dog counter). Corndog was delicious on the other hand (S7). I advise against drinking Coca-Cola from tap counters - only bottled. If you're adrenaline junkie you'll only fancy 2 rides - Cylon and Mummy. The rest of the rides are very easy going and slow. Battlestar Galactica rides: Cylon is way more intense ride than Human. Lockers for putting away your stuff are free for limited amount of time (anywhere from 45 - 120 minutes, depending on the waiting lines), after that it's payable (mostly S8 for additional hour, or maximum S20 in total). The lockers in Jurassic Park are payable, but you can keep your belongings with you (next to "Jungle Rapids"). Dry Zone is payable S5 for 3 minutes. We arrived at 10am, just when they opened. I recommend you do the same and go straight to the Land Far Far Away or Jurassic Park. Most people start at the beginning, so the first rides (Transformers) immediately get packed whilst farther away rides are stills empty. It gets packed between 11.30am and 3pm. After 3pm there's hardly any line longer than 20 minutes. Also, their line-time counting is horrible - we'd seen "waiting time 40 minutes", decided to give it a try and still attend the ride, and it would be completely empty - we got the first-row ride, that's how empty. For example, our favourite, Cylon, was consistently 45 minutes waiting time prior 3pm, but after 3pm we ran around 5 times, because waiting was maximum of 5 minutes. Mummy also.

name: user_3197
review: Weve bought the express pass which is almost 100 AUD extra per person however we felt its a disappointment as we found out at the door that its allowed to be used only once per ride, cant be used twice for any ride, such a scam. I think use the early entry pass, you ll be in around 45-60mins earlier than everyone and take the rides you like best first. The transformers ride was really an amazing experience however our friends got stuck for 20mins inside.

name: user_3199
review: Trust me, this experience will be one of the best you'll ever have! It's an absolute must-do. Make sure to get a good night's rest so you can be fresh and ready for the adventure. Investing in fast-track tickets is worth every penny. Be sure to pack as much as possible into your day - it's worth it! You'll feel like a kid again, full of wonder and excitement. To avoid the crowds, try to visit on a weekday instead of during school holidays.

name: user_3200
review: It's a beautiful place to visit, and there are sweet and fun games for children. I recommend it

name: user_3202
review: What a great place to spend a day with family. We booked the tickets only online, but once we arrived and saw how crowded the park is, we took the express pass without hesitation and IT WAS WORTH IT, we only spend 5 minutes maximum on each ride and the normal que was taking up to 90 minutes.

name: user_3203
review: Remember to book express pass in advance.

name: user_3204
review: Nice rides, with some very good time coasters. The Transformers ride is exceptional.

name: user_3205
review: Universal studios at Singapore is one of the must see places - well organised lot of of great rides and shows to enjoy and celebrate. The transformers, mummy, raft ride at the Jurassic world and the re-enacting movie stunt scenes are all excellent. Overall its worth to spend a whole day. One of the things noticed is a kind of discrimination in one of the rides by their attendants. We were waiting in the queue for long time and surprisingly found the attendant called his country men who were far away in the queue and surpassed us - never expected such an attitude.

name: user_3206
review: Probably my 4th time here. The rides never disappoint. However, weekend waiting time is extremely long for most rides, especially the Humans and Cylon rollercoaster. Suggest to come on weekdays/ non-holiday season for shorter queues.

name: user_3207
review: As per singapore seasonaly whether issues. We try to finish rides as much as faster. Due to thunderstorm or lightning some rides was announced close probably. So we purchase express pass SGD 100 per person. This is not included park ticket . so nearly we spend SGD200 each . But it was worth. The day was weekday but its middle of June holiday in singapore so park was very cloudy. All the famous ride takes more than 30min for que. But with expresspass. All the rides we can start less than 5min. And as we expected bud weather at 4pm outdoor rides are all closed. We were lucky with express pass at this point. But around 6pm whether was getting hetter then rides open again. So I recommend to finish outdoor ride first if you see weather forcus says badly.

name: user_3208
review: It was fun, but a quarter of the rides was closed-down, and we had to wait almost an hour for the transformer but it was worth it. You might think it is a short queue based on the queue outside but there was an even longer queue inside and the board showing how long it would take you to get into it outside was just a total lie . Ignore it as it will take you a lot longer if you went at around 12-3.30 oclock. It was fun but I am kind of disappointed. We had trouble finding a place to eat because the restaurants are mostly closed though the ones that are open had wonderful food. If you want to straight away go into the park,buy tickets online as it is a lot faster.

name: user_3209
review: If the weather wasn't so hot, I would have kept going, but it was so hot that I couldn't enjoy it properly. Attractions Transformers and Cyclone are recommended. Naruto Gallery runs until June 30th. It's a shame it's a bit small.

name: user_3210
review: An excellent place to be happy, better with the family or friends in a whole day

name: user_3211
review: A very nice parc. Transformers was the best ride. It was very clean. The prices for food and souvenirs are very high. The waterworld stunt show is also very good. The best stunt show i have ever seen in a parc.

name: user_3214
review: A day well spent in thrill and leisure..rides will raise your goosebumps..entertainment for every age group considered..though post entering there remains no limitations of age..lol..

name: user_3215
review: If you are into rides, go ahead and take the express pass. Lines can be really long specially on weekends.

name: user_3216
review: It is recommended to consider purchasing an express pass on weekends due to the significant crowds encountered during our visit. This resulted in an inability to experience any rides due to the extensive wait times. Additionally, the management of the wait lines appeared inadequate. It was observed that the standard pass did not provide any discernible priority, which is concerning and requires immediate attention. While the park itself is remarkable and worthy of visitation, it is regrettable that additional expenditure on an express pass is seemingly necessary to access the rides. It is imperative that the management devise a strategy to effectively manage the crowds and reduce wait times, thereby ensuring a seamless experience for all visitors.

name: user_3219
review: University Studios Singapore

name: user_3220
review: A really cool amusement park, with atypical attractions. There is no queue from 6 p.m. until closing. Just for certain attractions you have to put all your belongings in a locker which is free for a certain duration (45 to 80min) but quickly exceeded to owe some "infuriating" money.

name: user_3221
review: A great place to go with your children. Bought the express ticket so no need for long queue because some of the attractions need more than 30 minutes queuing. You can but the ticket online so u dont need to queue anymore. Dont forget to bring extra clothes if you have planning to play jurassic park attraction , you will get wet.

name: user_3225
review: Eventhough its a school holiday in sg, the queue is not that long to wait. Really had fun with friends. The show was incredibly awesome !

name: user_3226
review: We walked here from Vivo City, and the journey here looks rather sad. The surroundings were badly maintained. The place was packed, with at least 60 mins waiting time for each ride. The food was quite expensive, a meal was at least 15. Great for teenagers and kids, probably not adults since we can't take exciting rides as well as we were younger.

name: user_3234
review: Ive been here 11 years ago and I can tell that the crowd doubled including during weekdays. Nothing change with the rides specially the transformers still the same. Queueing or waiting time is ride dependable Shrek - 30 minutes Transformers - 1hr and so The Mummy - 30 minutes Roller coaster Human - 15 minutes Cyclone - 10 minutes Etc

name: user_3238
review: Its a great amusement park with lots of rides and attractions! But you need really good pair of shoes as you have to spend whole day! For Indians theres a Indian restaurant also near Egypt section...

name: user_3239
review: Went few times, nothing changes...

name: user_3240
review: very busy, express tickets so no queuing, fun exciting adventure...

name: user_3242
review: Service staff didn't help in crowd control during meet and greet with Minions. The staff who helped in photo taking for visitors with our handphone also did not help to ensure photos are clear. Just hurried everyone off. The people dresses up as Characters are also not friendly towards the kids. Need more training. Very little entertainment for kids below 6yo. Timing of Trolls show on Friday was changed from 12noon to 2pm at short notice. The park was hot, with limited dining options or resting place for young kids. There is also no re entry allowed. We left at 12.30pm 2 hrs after entry, very disappointed and waste of time. Not recommended for families with children less than 6 years old.

name: user_3243
review: The park is certainly nice and well-kept, but absolutely too small and with few attractions. On my last visit (June 2024) the new Minions section was under construction, which will probably offer a couple more alternatives. The CYCLONE rollercoaster is excellent, while its neighbor HUMAN is disappointing. Accustomed to Universal Studios Orlando, any comparison is impossible for size, alternatives and food offerings. On the other hand, the entry price (around 60) is adequate for a park that runs around and gives the possibility of doing all the attractions in less than 4 hours. Excellent option to spend half a day, no more.

name: user_3244
review: It's impossible to cover the whole area within 1 day . We started our journey around 10 AM and left there at 7 PM but we could only covered upto 50-60% of the whole area . The ticket was 83 SGD and you can ride anything or go anywhere with this no extra charges needed. You can also ride multiple times in a single ride. It's really fascinating and enjoyable place to enjoy weekend holidays. You can also go for a date with your partner to enjoy the rides and you can also come with your family. Maximum rides are based on roller coaster . So, enjoy.

name: user_3250
review: We visited Universal Studios Singapore on a working day, hoping it would be less crowded. However, since it was June, a holiday season, the park was quite busy. The wait times for rides were long, ranging from 30 to 90 minutes. The food is overpriced, but the meal sizes are decent. One major disappointment was that an entire section of Minions was closed, and there was no information about this when we purchased our tickets. Overall, it was an okay experience, but the crowds and lack of upfront information about ride closures were frustrating

name: user_3254
review: Second time visit and loved it just as much. Great atmosphere, fantastic rides and plenty of food and drinks options. I suggest that you plan your day to ensure you get to the Meet and Greets on time. Also, the express passes saved a lot of time, although they are expensive.

name: user_3257
review: If you come to Singapore, definitely stop by. It is a very fun place, there is a different activity in every area. Especially galactica, transformers, Revenge of the Mummy and Lights, Camera, Action were very good. I recommend you try it. However, you have to wait in line for at least half an hour for toys. Food is a little expensive inside.

name: user_3258
review: Book tickets in advance, currently there is alot of construction going on if you have been to Universal I dont think its worth it now wait for the new areas to open. We always have a good time at Universal alot of Halal food options available shrek waffels are delicious.. there are many shows and meet and greet if you are planning with kids please make sure to start in the morning so you can cover everything. And if express pass is in budget I highly recommend if you have small kids with you. There are alot of nice shops around most of Universal studio is covered but I recommend you to bring umbrellas water bottles and fans as SG is very hot.

name: user_3259
review: I love riding the roller coaster ! Food is OK, prices are high

name: user_3260
review: Totally loved it, was able to catch up on 4-5 rides. My husband and I took turns to ride as we had a baby of 2.5 years. Most rides get free after 4 pm and the weather also gets pleasant. During 11 to 2 the sun was hot as hell. Had bought the tickets directly at the kiosks outside the entrance.

name: user_3263
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a popular theme park located on Sentosa Island, Singapore. It's known for its thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and themed zones based on blockbuster movies and TV shows. Even though i can't go inside that day Certainly! Universal Studios Singapore offers a diverse range of attractions and experiences that cater to visitors of all ages and interests: 1. Themed Zones: Each zone within the park is meticulously designed to transport visitors into the worlds of famous movies and characters. For example: - Hollywood: Features the iconic Walk of Fame and Hollywood-themed attractions. - New York: Recreates the bustling streets of New York City, complete with its own set of attractions. - Ancient Egypt: Takes visitors back to the time of pharaohs and pyramids with thrilling rides like Revenge of the Mummy.. - Madagascar: Where visitors can meet characters from the Madagascar movies and enjoy family-friendly rides. - The Lost World: Inspired by Jurassic Park and Jurassic World, with thrilling dinosaur-themed attractions. 2. Rides and Attractions: Universal Studios Singapore boasts a variety of rides catering to different thrill levels, from high-speed roller coasters to gentle rides suitable for families and children. Some highlights include: - Transformers: The Ride 3D: A state-of-the-art 3D thrill ride that puts you in the middle of the Transformers action. - Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon dueling roller coasters that offer intense thrills. - Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: A water-based ride through dinosaur habitats with a thrilling finale. - Puss in Boots' Giant Journey: A family-friendly roller coaster based on the beloved character. - Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase: A gentle ride suitable for young children featuring Sesame Street characters. 3. Live Entertainment: Throughout the day, Universal Studios Singapore hosts various live shows, parades, and character meet-and-greets. These include musical performances, stunt shows, and interactive experiences that bring favorite movies and characters to life. 4. Dining and Shopping: The park offers a wide range of dining options, from quick bites to themed restaurants serving international cuisine. Visitors can also shop for souvenirs, movie memorabilia, and exclusive merchandise related to Universal Studios' popular franchises. 5. Visitor Experience: Universal Studios Singapore is known for its attention to detail and immersive environments, making visitors feel like they've stepped into the worlds of their favorite movies. The park is well-maintained, with friendly staff providing a welcoming atmosphere for guests from around the world. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore combines thrilling rides, immersive theming, live entertainment, and dining/shopping options to create a memorable experience for visitors of all ages. It's a top attraction in Singapore and a must-visit destination for entertainment enthusiasts.

name: user_3264
review: Was really fun and interesting but somewhat disappointing comparing to other universal studios Ive been i would still recommend if you have kids.

name: user_3265
review: Beautiful tourist attraction with lots of Disney characters themes, Revenge of the mummy is best ,also Jurassic park and The Transformers are mind-blowing.... People of all age group can enjoy here especially children...but it requires one entire day to cover all the rides and lot of patience wait time can be more in some attractions... Cyclone and Revenge of the mummy is highly recommended by me.

name: user_3273
review: The good: Very clean and well laid out. Rides were very fun, but some are aging. Waterworld show was the highlight of the day. The bad: Food prices are a bit high for what you get, but the quality was decent. The ugly: The wait time for rides was incredibly long. We would not return based on this criteria. The park/staff are very slow on turn around times for rides (60-110mins for each).

name: user_3275
review: great place to play with your family, but the food price here is quite expensive, also the weather is very hot, but still fun

name: user_3277
review: What an awesome experience this turned out to be. Definitely buy the VIP experience if you're able to as it's worth its weight in gold here. Without it the wait times are anywhere between 20 minutes to 2 hours per ride. With it you're able to skip right ahead of the queue. Our guide for the day (Giselle) was absolutely fabulous. She was very attentive and never missed an opportunity to capture the perfect moment. A thoroughly memorable experience and would highly recommend for everyone visiting Singapore to give the place a go.

name: user_3278
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a very small and somewhat good amusement park on the Sentosa Island of Singapore. The accessibility may take a long time by public transportation because you need to take a metro on the MRT then the Sentosa Express back to the MRT Station. It is very busy, but the main downside is the atrocious food. At the Jurassic Food Court, the prawns are imitation crab shaped like prawns. The roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica and Puss in Boots Journey are very nice, well-themed rides.

name: user_3281
review: Amazing.... All the rides are superb. Since I was a solo traveler, I did not have to wait for a long because at some rides there are special queues for solo travelers.

name: user_3282
review: I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore on June 19, 2024, and it was an absolutely incredible experience! From heart-pounding rides to delightful food options, USS truly knows how to deliver a memorable day. Here are some highlights: 1. Roller Coaster Cylon: This ride is an absolute must-try! Its the most thrilling roller coaster Ive ever been on. The twists, turns, and sheer speed will leave you breathless and wanting more. A definite highlight of the park! 2. Transformers 3D Ride: Prepare to be blown away! This ride is more than just a simulatorits an immersive experience. Wearing 3D glasses, youre thrust into the world of Transformers as your ride car moves and reacts to the action. It genuinely feels like youre part of the movie. Hands down, the best ride Ive ever been on! 3. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure: If you love water rides, this is for you! Get ready to be soaked as you navigate through thrilling rapids. Pro tip: bring a poncho and an extra T-shirt and socks, because you will get wet. Its an absolute blast! 4. Halal Food Options: For my fellow Muslim visitors, you can enjoy delicious halal fried chicken at Goldilocks. Its not just convenient but also incredibly tasty! 5. Exceptional Staff: A massive shoutout to Hanafi and Boon from the USS team. Their friendliness and impeccable customer service made our visit even more enjoyable. Special thanks to Hanafi for going above and beyond by iron steaming my new KungFu Panda T-shirt. You guys are amazing! While my day at USS was fantastic, there are a few areas where the park could elevate the experience even further. Some rides and attractions could use a bit of upgrading and touch-ups to maintain their top-notch quality. Additionally, the Naruto Gallery currently showcasing at USS has a lot of untapped potential. Right now, it mostly features posters and background stories of beloved characters like Naruto, Sasuke, Jiraiya, and Orochimaru. Given the massive fanbase for Naruto both inside and outside of Singapore, introducing more interactive and engaging elements could make this gallery a major attraction. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a phenomenal theme park with an array of thrilling rides, great food options, and standout staff. Its a perfect destination for a fun-filled day. I highly recommend visiting and cant wait to see how USS continues to innovate and improve!

name: user_3283
review: Firstly, the express pass is a total ripoff. It costa more than the tickets themselves and many rides or attractions don't even have express. Secondly, it's small, and still under construction in parts. There are very few rides and attractions compared to many other theme parks around the world and they seem outdated. I was really looking forward to this for the family, but it ended up as a disappointment. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1, is that the shops and food was decent as well as transport to and from the park.

name: user_3284
review: I enjoyed here! It's an amazing experience I had never seen

name: user_3286
review: It was an OK theme park 3/5. Was raining when we went, so less people around, and we were able to ride the popular attractions like transformers and roller coaster without waiting in line.

name: user_3287
review: A must visit when in Singapore! So much to do and see :) The Luge was super fun and the Ski lift type ride back was awesome.

name: user_3288
review: A global destination for tourists. Must do activity while in Singapore. Try to book tickets prior with Express Pass facility to skip the queues. Worth spending some extra money for the pass since it will save a lot of time. Easier for small kids too. The whole Sentosa island is a tourist heaven. So many things to see and do. Universal Studios stand out as the top attraction for people of all ages. Keep in mind the height restrictions on some rides for small kids. Not to miss the Transformer rides.

name: user_3289
review: If you do not have kids, do NOT come here. You will be very bored. Games are very limited and only about 4 games that give you some taste of thrill. Also, they told us if we buy the tickets for more money, we get 20 for food inside (from any restaurant) we get 5 from any store inside. It turns out that the food can be bought front the worst three restaurants and to get the 5 from stores we first have to pay at least 35. In other words, it is a big SCAM to get into your pocket.

name: user_3292
review: My very first experience at Universal Studios was truly amazing. It felt like entering a whole new world from the moment I stepped inside. Joyful rides were everywhere, and it was definitely worth buying the express pass to skip the queues for the rides. However, be prepared if you plan to ride the roller coasterstheyre thrilling but intense. I got motion sickness after one of the roller coasters, which affected my ability to enjoy the rest of the day. It took quite a while for me to feel better, and when I tried another ride, the motion sickness returned. If youre prone to motion sickness, I recommend saving the roller coasters for the end of the day. Enjoy the other attractions first to make the most of your visit. Despite my experience, everything else was absolutely worth it!

name: user_926
review: never a let down when visiting here! been here every year since the opening, overall a great time spent!

name: user_3293
review: Not that big (I thought it would be)...ride time is only 1 or 2 minutes but the queue wait time is minimum 1 hour for good rides and 30 minutes for others... Some rides like Rollercoaster, Shrek 4D adventure, Transformer ride, Spaghetti ride (for kids) are good... Express pass is just a way to get more money from people...but if you are a ride person then do take express pass...

name: user_3294
review: Dated rides with Minion rides still not available with no line of sight to when it will open. Food is expensive but more importantly average at best. The "Lights Camera Action" was meant to showcase how special effects are made, but it was easily 20 years ago so it looks more like a museum than a showcase of their special effect technology.

name: user_3296
review: Very nice adventure and nice rides

name: user_3297
review: Excellent Theme Park in Singapore that features thrilling rides, attractions and shows based on popular tv shows and films. Really enjoyed this place. A must visit when in Singapore

name: user_3300
review: Overall good experience despite 3rd time visiting! Last visit was almost 10years ago, proving their excellent maintenance! Probably because of long weekends, the queue for some of the rides were pretty long. Still, most of the rides were very enjoyable and exhilarating (even though I have slight fear of heights but I really enjoyed the thrill of roller coaster)

name: user_3305
review: Experience that the rides make you go through is unimaginable. Express pass is a must have if you plan to cover the entire USS in a day.

name: user_3309
review: Food in food court was very good that why the price also very expensive, no problem since the food was good. Many of fave arena are roller coster and the queue was exhausting. Took wait around 1 hour for each arena.

name: user_3310
review: Although its a quite famous place, but the service and equipment need to get improved. Can not imagine that the park just let people stand under super strong sunshine for an hour never come unless it improves the service.

name: user_3311
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrill-seeker's dream come true! I spent an adrenaline-packed day exploring the theme park, and it was an absolute blast. The roller coaster rides were the highlight of my day - the Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy rides had me screaming with excitement! The immersive experiences, sharp turns, and steep drops made for an unforgettable adventure. But it wasn't all about the rides - the WaterWorld show was a spectacular display of stunts, pyrotechnics, and action-packed fun. I was on the edge of my seat as the performers pulled off daring feats and explosive stunts. After all that excitement, I needed some retail therapy, and the Transformer shop delivered! I geeked out over the impressive collection of Autobot and Decepticon merchandise, and scored some awesome souvenirs to take home. The park's theming, attention to detail, and friendly staff all added to the magic of the day. Whether you're a fan of movies, TV shows, or just plain old-fashioned fun, Universal Studios Singapore has something for everyone. Highly recommend to buy express ride tickets. In short, USS is a must-visit destination for any thrill-seeker or pop culture enthusiast. Get ready for a day of non-stop action, adventure, and unforgettable memories!

name: user_3312
review: Best experience of Hollywood theme... Suitable for any type of audience. Looking forward to visiting again with more universes in progress

name: user_3315
review: Great place. Awesome rides. They have too many fast rides, great for adventures. The timing is from 10am - 6pm. To visit Universal, you should have one full day. Then only you can able to enjoy fully. There is no end to fun in this place. Also, i suggest plan it in weekends only.

name: user_3318
review: Visited on Satuday 15 June 2024. 12:30 show was cancelled after everyone were sitted. Transformer ride suddenly stopped due to technical issue. Went to the spaghetti ride, facing technical issue as well. About 1/4 of the theme pArk already blocked for renovation. Food queue at was around an hour. Think twice before going there with young child. Most rides are more than an hour.

name: user_3320
review: USS is a great theme park with lot of rides and shows. We went from India during the weekday and enjoyed a lot with my family. You may or may not complete seeing the whole place in one day but in 2 days you can complete taking all rides, watching the shows and other activities. Do not miss the Transformer ride and the Jurassic park boat ride. We completed all rides in one day except the Cyclone.

name: user_3322
review: They should manage the queue more efficiently. It's not right for letting children to queue for an hour for a ride

name: user_3329
review: Very nice rides mostly roller coasters but also many other rides and rides for babies too

name: user_3330
review: Universal Studios Singapore offered rides, entertainment, amazing shows and great food options. We spend the whole day there and loved it. Would highly recommend.

name: user_3331
review: There is a fee to drive in and there is no parking space.

name: user_3332
review: Super over-crowded. Per ride Q time avg 40min to 150min. 100 for express Q with only 1 ride each. What a rip-off. Even restaurants Q times 1 hour avg. Only taken 2 rides during 6 hours in the park. Won't visit again in future.

name: user_3335
review: Many ride to play there really good to spend a day there you will need a whole day to experience it

name: user_3338
review: This place is worth every penny! Bought tickets online through klook for 78 per person! Luckily during my visit it wasnt crowded and we enjoyed every minute of our time We enjoyed the rides but quite disappointed for the canopy flyer cause there was some technical issues and took hours to fix it otherwise it was fun and thrilling! Would definitely visit again after the opening of minion rides HEHEH

name: user_3339
review: Universal Studio Singapore is a wonderful place to visit along with your kids and family. Fun place to be. You will require a minimum of two days to completely visit all the places/rides/activities. However, if you are carrying Premium/Express pass, then you can cover maximum numbers of rides in a single day and that is more convenient also. I also suggest that, one should plan out the things, much in advance by downloading the Universal Studio Singapore app. One should refer to the map and plan the visit to various rides accordingly. It will save much more time. Enjoy your trip...!!!

name: user_3340
review: Most of the rides inside are free. If u have done universal studios in USA or some other place u can skip !! Lots of restaurants .. stuff for kids to purchase ...!!

name: user_3342
review: Rides are superb. Want to save money with benefits then visit when Hollow nights are going on. u wil enjoy horror as well as rides in free like transformer, mummy, etc..

name: user_3344
review: An amusement park worth experiencing, especially for my daughter, who loves thrilling games. After 1 day of experience, I found the following tips and suggestions: 1. When you first enter the gate, you should go straight into the Egyptian area and play straight in. When you're done, go back to the gate and play back in so there won't be much of a queue. 2. Comment: I noticed that the game instructors had to introduce the game with a microphone over and over again throughout the day. In the last game, I saw that the player couldn't speak and his voice was hoarse. If these introductions were recorded, they could observe and help the players when needed. Wishing everyone a happy experience

name: user_3345
review: Nice place for family activities. Kids and adults like it. Most of the thrill activities are the one has less queues. Kids like to go again and again in the main 2 thrill rides... If any rides waiting time is more like 50 mins, you may skip firbtime being and come again after you done other rides, the waiting time will change based on the crowd. Snacks and drinks sold there are very extand not so taste nice.

name: user_3349
review: There are a bit few amusement facilities. You have to queue up when you first enter the park in the morning. The crowds begin to decrease in the evening, so there is relatively little time to queue up for the amusement facilities.

name: user_3351
review: It was amazing we had so much fun

name: user_3354
review: I met a clerk named Francis at the Xiaoxiaobing store. He was very nice and introduced the products very kindly. I liked it.

name: user_3358
review: Not enough time so just took a quick look around the outside, a bit of a pity.

name: user_3359
review: Best place even on rainy season

name: user_3362
review: Wonderful places.. you have fun and adventure over here.. food was good.. all of them park is awesome and amazing..

name: user_3363
review: The best place in Singapore you want to be in Best rides n display Mummy n jurasic park are the best Minimum waiting is in Mummy ride Jurasic park is too busy as it goes too slow Many parts still under construction Download the universal studio app that will help you in knowing waiting time and what you have to do next Photos here are expensive Locker available but chargeable after 40-50 minutes You cannot yake baggage for few rides ao it is better to carry minimum baggage Take a full length raincoat for Jurassic park water ride Initially there was waiting but after 3 there was basic waiting only Would advise to avoid express pass unless you want to save time

name: user_3364
review: Wish they had more shows that people can catch. A lot of time is spent on queues. They should have a token system so that the time spent in queues can be better utilized

name: user_3365
review: It was good keep all the shows in mind and u can ride all the rides easily without express pass

name: user_3367
review: I actually lost my phone today and I would like to give a serious 5/5 and a shout-out to that staff who was at the ticketing, also known as lost and found counter who helped me get back my phone in about 10-20minutes after reporting it. I think her name was Elina/elirina somewhere close but I'm literally so thankful that I met her. She was so proficient and gave me a paper to fill up, and together with her BESTY staff, they called and got my phone in 7minutes like TYSM to her I don't think I would have gotten my phone back if not for her. I think she deserves a higher pay/promotion/bonus. Tysm to that staff really. (Mines that pink phone ) LITERALLY 5 STARS TO THAT STAFF. LOVE HER SO MUCH SHE WAS SO KIND AND FRIENDLY. However, I gave 4 stars as the mascots(minions,gru,transformers)and the staff which helped to take picture for the transformers were mean. Firstly, the mascots kept scaring me and my friends.Two minions even drove my friend into a corner and kept scaring her. Then while the staff was taking the megatron picture after the megatron scared us, he was showing an unhappy and angry look and kept asking us to hurry up. OK BUT RLLY THANKS SO MUCH TO THAT STAFF WHO HELPED ME 5/5 SLAY.THANK YOU.

name: user_3368
review: USS is a small theme park, it took us 4 hours for 5 rides and watched two shows, as we have a same day flight back. Make good use of the single rider if you are short of time. The experience was fun though, and the staff were very nice.

name: user_3369
review: As a visitor to Universal Studios Singapore, I was blown away by the sheer excitement and variety of attractions. The inner child was just bursting to try out each and every attraction. But sadly, I could not because of the long queues and some breakdowns. Thus, I would recommend a little strategizing before you reach there though. Understand that the theme park is divided into 3 segments: The rides, the shows and the meet-and-greets. Depending on your priorities, choose the attractions. To help you out with the schedules and wait times, download the app and keep checking it for real time updates. I personally loved the Sci-Fi City, and Ancient Egypt Adventures. Transformers: The Ride, The Revenge of the Mummy coaster and the Battlestar Galactica coasters were the highlights and also the ones with the longest wait times. I would suggest to get here early or take the express pass. If you have kids with you, they will enjoy the Accelerator ride, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase and Enchanted Airways. The Lights, Camera, Action! show and Shrek 4-D Adventure was a magical experience, while WaterWorld wowed with all the stunts. Meeting Shrek, Donkey, and the Minions made my day! Keep an eye on the schedule for the character interactions. I was livid with myself for missing out on Naruto: The Gallery Experience which I hear is a treat for anime fans. Do check it out if you plan better than me. Regarding the passes, I did not take the express pass as it was too costly, and I believe if you plan better, you can cover most attractions if not all with better planning. Also, I believe go to the park to enjoy and not to cover all the attractions. Soak in all the pleasures the park has to offer and let your inner child free. And don't forget to take loads of photos throughout the park and Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit. Whether youre a thrill-seeker or a family with kids, theres something for everyone.

name: user_3370
review: Best in the universe theme park don't carry water with u Bec inside there are 50 water taps only carry food because it costly

name: user_3371
review: Very large and crowded with tourists. You need to pay attention to the time on the queue board when you want to participate in the games. Everyone must deposit their personal belongings in the locker before entering the queue. There are food courts, fast food and soft drinks.

name: user_3372
review: Although it is the smallest Universal Studios, you have the opportunity to play all the rides.

name: user_3373
review: Carry their online map, easy to navigate...great place to spend a while day if ur into adventure and thrilling rides...kids aged below 5 have very few rides ...

name: user_3374
review: Although the park is not big, there are many recreational facilities and photo-taking spots! !

name: user_3375
review: It's too small and nothing special compared to its reputation... Take a million photos at the entrance, buy a ticket and enter. 10 minutes after entering, the excited man left...sad... You can ride the rides if you wait about 30 to 50 minutes, so it's not bad... hmm... Still, I took a picture with Shrek and Fiona... I guess my expectations were too high...

name: user_3376
review: Super Ganda , Great if fan ka ng mga rides . May for beginners to extreme

name: user_3377
review: Universal Studios is a small but beautiful place. If you have access to most of the facilities, you can definitely stay there all day. I think the only drawback is the privacy issue in the men's restroom (the urinal has no partition)

name: user_3378
review: Very nice place to visit with friends and family, only thing is each ride wait time is upto 40 to 60 minutes. Buy Express Pass tickets to skip the queue and don't miss the TRANSFORMERS, MUMMY & JURRASIC PARK rides, those were amazing. Food was also the best. I recommend the food court in the jurrasic park.

name: user_3380
review: I found this place overhyped compared to the rates they are charging . 4D Shrek, Mummy, Transformers are some of the few must enjoy rides / attractions here... Sentosa has much better vibes then this place especially the beach area !!

name: user_3381
review: Terrible experience with my family. For the amount we paid for tickets, Id at least expect all the rides to be functioning but at least 2 were down. Every ride was manned by only 1 person. These lone rangers were clearly overwhelmed and stopped scanning express passes so pretty much everyone was cutting the line. Queue times were at a ridiculous 60-80 mins on average. There were actual employees walking around with expresses passes for sale here signs to entice people to pay a ridiculous 100 more for the ability to stand in a line. USS is a tourist trap and for suckers who cant entertain their children any other way.

name: user_3384
review: A must-visit paradise with children

name: user_3385
review: Best place for entertainment,for more fun & for exploring each ride should buy express way ticket

name: user_3386
review: We book our tickets from Klook and Im glad we did because its hassle-free. We went here on a weekend and there were a lot of people (locals and tourists as well). We had a wonderful time exploring and experiencing the rides. Even adults like us will definitely enjoy this place. Some rides you will wait in the line for about 30mins but thats okay the rides are really cool and enjoyable. Make sure to wear comfy clothes and shoes that is good for walking coz you'll be doing a lot of that for sure. I recommend going to Universal Studios whenever you're in Singapore.

name: user_3387
review: Remember to download the App Convenient and practical, you can see the map and waiting time

name: user_3389
review: It was a great experience in USS we went at Sunday. Waiting time for each ride is about 10 min. The mummy ride is the most excited. It is not a big USS compare to USJ in osaka. But it feels like more casual and relax. Worth to spend one day here. I am a full time foodies and explorer. For more review. you may subscribe to my youtube and IG 266k followers Yt: stephenleung IG: stephenleung1226

review: In fact, you can finish it in half a day, every theme is great Favorite Shrek 4D experience

name: user_3391
review: The price of entering is 100 SG... I would suggest to lower since some guests, they just want to get in to look around or accompany their partners or friend to enjoy together in that only

review: It's my first time to go to the world I think it's pretty good

review: Pretty fun theme park catered to a range of ages. Not so efficient in managing entry and queues.

name: user_3396
review: I definitely recommend it to families with children. There is so much to see and it is great for making precious memories with family. Recommended for November, December, January, February

name: user_3397
review: It was hot and humid. But a must visit when in Singapore. Easier to go via cab rather than MRT. Food inside are quite expensive. Bring water!!!

name: user_3403
review: Great experience with family especially with young and teenagers.

name: user_3404
review: 1. Even though it was Saturday, I waited in line for most attractions for less than 30 minutes. I think it was about 15 minutes on average. I was thinking about buying Express, but I guess I was really glad I didn't. 2. Personally fun order: Cylon (2nd ride) - Transformers - Mummy (2nd ride) - Shrek - Light Camera Action - Jurassic Park - Human - Puss in Boots - Others 3. It would be better to bring snacks, drinks, and water with you and eat while playing. Later, I bought ramen, fried food, drinks, and fruit. @ 4. Check the real-time waiting time on the app and move around to avoid waiting too long.

name: user_3406
review: I really recommend to buy the tickets online before going to the Universal Studios. Regarding the experience, it was bad mostly because it is really crowded and queues waiting time varies from 20 to 120 minutes, depending on how many people want to see that specific attraction. Also, the AC system is not available that much when you wait to enter at most of the attractions. Overall, it is really crowded so they get much money and they can invest in better AC system. I am not a big fan of this kind of and this is a bias, but the overall client experience may be improved for sure. If you want to save time and not wait 1 hour per attraction at the queue, you should buy the express line unlimited experience.

name: user_3407
review: Best adventure and amusement park, so many rides, cyclon in black track was very awsm ride, mummy ride also good, jurasic park water ride also very awsm.

name: user_3408
review: Universal studios Singapore with fam ;)

name: user_3413
review: The game complex is very famous in Singapore, including 7 other amusement parks, each with a movie theme. The area also has a Malaysian food street, with many delicious restaurants.

name: user_3414
review: Some great rides, but be prepared to queue up.. especially in the hot weather, make sure you take a lot of water #rollercoaster #themepark #hydration Look out for better deals online, and avoid purchasing at the door..

name: user_3415
review: Went there twice weekend once and weekday once, both time it was packed. All highlight rides waiting time is 1 hr to 1 and half hr, wasted more time there. Went to discovery food court and walked around the court with our food tray for 10mins cos most people book the table by putting their bags before even buying their food. Thankfully one of the staff name YARA went around and ask few tables if they are done eating as theyre many people waiting for table. Grateful for her kind help. Otherwise the games and management is good, heart pumping and enjoyable rides..

name: user_3417
review: It is the June holidays and we went on a weekday. The place was super crowded and it started from the Sentosa Express trip. Therefore, I decide to go for an express pass paying 100 each for Universal Express queue. It is the same price for children also. According to the queue time for Battlestar Galactica, it will be a 2hrs wait, after waiting in line with an express pass of 30 minutes, it was closed due to wet weather. We went on other rides. I think age has caught up with me and I found Mummy ride to be scary also, especially when I went backwards. Food at the Discovery Food Centre was expensive, with an average of 16/main. Nonetheless, it was pretty expected and fortunately, there was a discount for Passion Card members. For WaterWorld, the staff really take pails and pails of water and one will be drenched if you are seated in the splash zone. Do sit in the area if you are alright getting wet. Fortunately, there are drying pods outside the area.

name: user_3418
review: Just wow. So good. Need a full day to see

name: user_3420
review: Ensure to check weather conditions. annoying to see rides are suspended just for minor lightening. Transformer was on hold due to technical gllitch. Express pass must to cover all rides.

name: user_3422
review: Awesome place to spend an entire day in Universal Studio

name: user_3423
review: One of my dream place since I was a little boy. Unexplainable experience I have ever had. Amazing. Went through the every rides, foods items and lost in this dream paradise for while.

name: user_3424
review: The 100% worth to visit in Singapore is univarsal studio. It is located near Sentosa Island. Univarsal studio is a movie makers company from United States. The aim behind making this studio is - you must hve seen so many univarsal movies , but it is a time to ride on movies... The ultimate show inside,named - light, sound, camera... Represents & shows, how the Hollywood film shooting they do and creat a movie... As well, ride 3d - activity like - Transformers is a live symbol of advance technology used by movie makers... Apart from these, there are tooooo manyyyyy moooorrreee.. Ask me for details

name: user_3425
review: Memorable experience. Lovely place. Lack of Indian vegetarian food. Rest all good.

name: user_3426
review: Went there during Taylor Swift Concert and not that much people. Experience almost all ride. 1. The mummy (best one! Not that long queue) 2. Shrek 4D (okay lah! Please eat their waffle!) 3. Jurassic park (bring your own rain coat to save your money) 4. Transformer (best! Worth the wait) Some ride i dont remember hahahahha. Do come and experience it!

name: user_3432
review: Entertaining and Mobility friendly in most parts. As per these places you pay a premium for food, drink and souvenirs.

name: user_3436
review: A wonderful experience with the family! Just enough shows and attractions to keep you entertained. I highly recommend the Transformers cyclon and human roller coaster rides and the Trolls show. The Sesame Street ride was also nice esp for little kids. I also like the Lights, camera, action! show. Just be mindful where you position yourself unless you brought along an extra shirt. The Mummy ride was fun as well, just not my favorite. Overall, a must try experience when you visit SG!

name: user_3439
review: The place is good but there is too much waiting time, due to which you cannot explore the entire property

name: user_3441
review: Its super fun, but I suggest you dont come too late. Singapore is prone to thunderstorms in the afternoon. The disadvantage is that its a bit small and you can finish it in half a day

name: user_3443
review: We arrived at the USS at 8 am, the photo spot on the SGP globe was still quiet at that time. It's better to arrive early and take photos first, so you don't have to join a long queue to go to USS.

name: user_3445
review: Have great memories and experiences here..probably my only suggestion is to upgrade the prayer room to have a proper ventilation system, like regular fans to give more breeze inside the room

name: user_3446
review: A ton of fun, but very hot very crowded.

name: user_3448
review: Was an interesting time. Once at Santosa we were surprised at how very little Signage there was to show what direction Universal Studios was. Once we actually found it, the place was bustling with lots of people. We had VIp ticketing so we jump the queue . Rides are ok. Some were not operating and most were very tired . Food pretty good and not too expensive . The Cable over to Santosa was pretty good however it is not Air-conditioned so take a fan . We spent every haf hour going into food courts as the Air-conditioned areas were always the best place to work out were to go next . You will need about 6 hours if you want to see most of the area.

name: user_3449
review: Easy and swift access using the tickets bought from klook. i bought it after reaching the USS gate. Very quickly voucher was generated. Better to go early and do download US Singapore App to check the wait times on the rides. if you reach early then Do Transformer Ancient Egypt Jurassic main rides first. These 3 are the best ones. i went on weekday ( I reached there late (at 11))and by around 4 PM the wait time for Transformers was 5 mins (From earlier 120 mins). Be quick on your feet and plan as per the wait times. USS is not big. Food is slightly expensive. Jurassic World main ride - You will get soaked/drenched completely so plan accordingly. i had to walk back to my hotel with shoes filled with water(Very Very unpleasant). You can plan to stay and do the rides till 7:30 to 8PM, subjected the rides are available.

name: user_3450
review: I would recommend going only with a priority pass which is quite expensive - 100 bucks per person otherwise you have to wait about 40 min per one attraction entry.

name: user_3451
review: Very crowded during middle hours come early and book in advance every place has a long line except the weird tornado one which was the best one there

name: user_3452
review: It is recommended to buy a quick pass. The Mummy and Transformers rides are very attentive. I also recommend the comedy of Donkey in Shrek Park and the waterworld show. I walked around from 2 o'clock to 7 o'clock to enjoy the facilities. It was not as small as expected.

name: user_3456
review: Unfortunately I have to agree with the rather negative reviews. I expected more for the price of admission. There were at least 3 attractions unavailable due to renovations etc. In addition, you would have had to pay 100 SPD per person for the ExpressLine, which is an absolute disgrace. As a family of three, we also paid another 121SPD entry fee for the aquarium and for the photo that you were allowed to take at the entrance (free), you would of course have paid 65SPD at the end of the tour, packaged as a souvenir. The aquarium was ok, I've seen bigger ones. The jellyfish were the most impressive thing for me. We would also have liked to visit Delphine Island, but we would have had to pay the entrance fee there too. All in all, in my opinion it wasn't worth the price we paid. I am very disappointed. The photos that can be seen in the reviews show pretty much the entire size of the park.

name: user_3458
review: Some projects have to wait in line for a long time

name: user_3459
review: There are attractions that USJ does not have, such as Transformers and Hamunaptra, and I was excited to see the moving Transformers.

name: user_3460
review: Wow.. it was fantastic though expensive, compared to others spends as a tourist in singapore, this is worth it. Hanging roller coaster is super for adventure enthusiasts. Transformers show us must watch. Such a great immersive experience , I have seen many immersive experience in lot of places but this is the BEST

name: user_3463
review: What a place it is omg awesome , if your planning here, try to get an express pass and don't miss the shows on timing

name: user_3464
review: Nice and beautiful places. Its better to get express pass during crowded times.

name: user_3465

I believe he should receive an extend appreciation for his sincere services as it would make more people be excited to come here and enjoy their visits :)

name: user_3467
review: A nice place to have fun! It makes you feel like a child again. There are many rides and shows. It's located at Sentosa island south of Singapore. Highly recommended!

name: user_3468
review: Their equipment, management, safety, staff all are the best I had ever met.

name: user_3469
review: Fun! Good place to come to at most annually. It is pricey for what it has to offer though.

name: user_3470
review: Singapore Global is so fun!

name: user_3474
review: The experience was extraordinary. Ensure to download the universal app which helps you to keep a track of all the shows and meet & greet. My personal favourite was, Transformer ride and the ride at ancient Egypt section. And yes, Elmo goes Bollywood was absolutely adorable, check out the video

name: user_3476
review: It has got boring now. They have not changed much in last 7 years. Also they have scrapped unlimited express ticket and making single ride express ticket so costly.

name: user_3477
review: Theme park at sentosa island to burn out a day time

name: user_3479
review: the place is very nice, lots of exciting games that can win prizes, I went there with my family

name: user_3482
review: A great place for family fun! Rides recommended for thrills: The mummy ride is the best for me as the decor is sooooo goood that as if you were really inside the tomb of the ancient Egypt god. Second is the human ride which brings you great excitement. The third is cylon ride with five upside down flips but less scary than the human one. Food is fair priced and many mascots for photo taking. Single rider saves many queuing time.

name: user_3484
review: Awesome place and insane thrills. Try to buy the express ticket so that line would br very less.

name: user_3485
review: It's simply amazing. There are multiple zones and each zone has multiple rides. The ones which should not be missed are roller coaster rides Battlestar Galactica and Human, bunch of rides in Jurassic park like Canopy Flyer, JP rapids adventure, And revenge of the mummy. Also not to forget Transformers. It has a single pass entry to the entire park and enjoy unlimited rides. If you want VIP entry to each ride and not to wait in the long queue then you buy an Express pass by paying an additional SGD100 per person. Generally the park has a max crowd between 12pm to 5pm. Post 5pm, you will have very less rush and the waiting at each ride would be 10-15mins. There are multiple performances as well in the Evening to relax. Also there are good shops for kids like Hershey's, Lego, Candylicious etc. Overall 5 star from my side for excellent crowd management, neat and clean and very well maintained amusement park

name: user_3486
review: So happy to be back here! We visited on March so it was a bit hot but it rained a little. We went on a Friday so we were expecting for a lot of tourists but fortunately, it wasnt too crowded. We only spent about 30mins waiting for Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON and it was worth the wait! We spent even less time waiting for The Transformers ride. Unfortunately, we missed the show in the Waterworld and they closed the Revenge of the Mummy ride due to technical issues. Also, if I remember correctly, there used to be Shreks swamp but we didnt see it on this visit. The park was undergoing renovations and they were adding Minion Land. We are excited to be back to check out the new additions and hopefully, to be able to go to all the rides.

name: user_3487
review: We had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore I have 4 and 2 years old we were really happy most of the rides have height restrictions of 92cm and above so we all enjoyed and got on the rides more than 3 times as it wasnt busy on a Tuesday. My kids felt sad as we left the country but definitely we will be back.

name: user_3489
review: One of very good attractions of Singapore. While this place is not as big as US one but provides ample ride options to engage for 5-6 hours. I would recommend getting express pass to bypass huge crowds else huge wishing times dampens the mood. Loved transformers ride, Galicia and mummy rides. Vintage car ride is a joke and avoid it and canopy is not worth waiting time. Shrek 4d was awesome. Food inside is average and costly. Carry water bottles and there are ample places to refill. Those who have seen RFC in Hyderabad may feel some repetition for few of the things. Overall a place in Singapore which is good to spend the time but not great or unique.

name: user_3493
review: Amazing, must visit with family and friends. How much time would you need - upto to you, IMHO one should be able to do all rides on 5 hours tops if started with early access pass. I really like the mummy and Jurassic world rises.

name: user_3495
review: Awesome experience. The people who like adventures and rollercoaster it's very good place.

name: user_3496
review: We travelled to Singapore with two kids, I must say the rides were thrilling and kids really had good fun, it was great experience specially the transformer ride, however I found the staff of few rides to be extremely rude and impolite towards people. There were few who were old and could not understand the directions and staff was literally shouting at them.. this really left a very bad taste in mouth. Hospitality really needs to be worked on ..... After people coming to this place come all the way to Singapore to visit universal studio.

name: user_3497
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers an immersive and thrilling experience with its diverse themed zones and exciting rides, making it a hit for families and thrill-seekers alike. Visitors appreciate the park's cleanliness, helpful staff, and variety of attractions, despite occasional long wait times.

name: user_3501
review: The rides are minimalist and there is almost no need to queue. It is not recommended to spend additional money to buy a quick pass, because it is almost useless!

name: user_3504
review: A beautiful park, but waiting in line is a bit long.

name: user_3506
review: Amazing place but too much waiting time for each of the rides ie more than 30 minutes

name: user_3508
review: I have been to this place 7-8 times and can feel everytime it's a degraded rather than upgraded version of USS. No new attractions came up and some of the existing attractions are closed now forever. Many a time some of the rides are not working, I can really feel the change in USS and it's not for a good reason

name: user_3509
review: Admission ticket is not cheap.A bit small compare to other USS..waiting for minionland to open.Some rides are exciting and really worth queuing Eg Revenge of The Mummy.a bit rundown need some revamp..

name: user_3512
review: Good place but less rides compared to to US Universal studios

name: user_3513
review: It would recommend to buy a VIP ticket for entry for rides if your visiting as group or family. Sometime rides you have to wait for more than 45mins . Rides and shows are amazing and must not miss it. Well organized and staffs are supportive . It's a good experience on visiting universal studio.

name: user_3520
review: There is no end to fun in this place. Other the normal famous rides there are lot of small rides which are very very good and there is no much queue for those too. Egypt ride is a must go. So is transformers.

name: user_3522
review: Visiting Universal Studios Singapore was a thrilling journey into the heart of movie magic. Exploring various worlds like Egypt, DreamWorks Shrek Puss in boots and adrenaline-pumping rides like Battlestar Galactica, every moment was packed with excitement. The attention to detail in the park's design and the friendliness of the staff added to the experience. However, be ready for queues, especially during peak times if you don't have an express pass. Despite that, it's an unforgettable adventure that's definitely worth experiencing.

name: user_3525
review: This is an amazing place . Doesn't matter if you are an adult or a child there are enough rides for everyone. I believe the best ones are Transformers, mummy, water world show, Jurassic park and of course the roller coasters. The 4D shows are also decent. Had a really good time

name: user_3530
review: We visit USS in Friday and it was raining in the morning, the crowd is not heavy. We played almost all ride and have enough time to watch several shows.

name: user_3532
review: Must visit and rides all are too good.

name: user_3533
review: Awesome place to enjoy multiple rides, live performances and many more

name: user_3535
review: I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an overall great time, but my experience was somewhat mixed. The rides were fantastic, with my favorites being the Transformers ride, Battlestar Galactica, and The Mummy. These rides were thrilling and well worth the visit. However, I encountered a significant issue with the line management. There were often no staff present to guide the lines or monitor the crowd, which led to many people cutting in line. A specific group (and race) was particularly disrespectful, blatantly cutting lines and even applauding themselves for doing so. They were in large groups, which made the situation even more frustrating and disrupted the overall experience. Additionally, in such a closed environment, the lack of proper ventilation became quite apparent, making it uncomfortable with the poor smell lingering around.
