Sadly, the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure was closed during my visit, which was disappointing as I was looking forward to it. Despite these issues, I would still recommend visiting Universal Studios Singapore. The rides and attractions are top-notch, but I would advise against going on weekends to avoid the large crowds. Also, be vigilant for line cutters to ensure a more enjoyable experience.

name: user_3538
review: The atmosphere at USJ is also good. However, this place gave me a feeling that I don't have in Japan, and it gave me good memories. You can't go around it in one day.

name: user_3539
review: Good park, but smaller than what you may anticipate. Rides are really awesome and really good quality. Express pass makes lot of sense.

name: user_3544
review: Good experience but not as good as other universals like LA. Rides and attractions are lesser in Singapore as compared to other universals. Queue was terrible and at some places wait was as high as 80 mins. Their VIP price is too high. some rides were really good.

name: user_3546
review: A fun place for the whole family. Tickets ate expensive, but worth it. Needs a whole day. Visiting on a weekday was helpful since there were hardy any queues at the rides

name: user_3547
review: We booked our tickets online from Sentosa portal, when we reached guest service desk at universal studio, they did not accept the tickets saying that it does not have bar code. We had to wait, we had to wait and coordinate with the platform provider for the barcode. Very weak IT infrastructure in place, they were unable to retrieve our booking.

name: user_3548
review: Every ride is fun. It's really fun. There weren't many people on the day we went, so the queue wasn't long. Some machines can be entered right away. Some machines require a 5-10 minute wait. There are shows from employees at various points throughout the day. But the day I went was Sunday. Meet the Indian tour There are a lot of people but I can still play. The food here is very expensive. Various souvenirs are also reasonably priced. But when it comes, I have to buy some. You'll regret it if you like it, haha. Tickets bought in advance from the app are a little cheaper. Personally, I don't buy express.

name: user_3551
review: The place is good, only on weekends it gets very crowded...

name: user_3553
review: liked it but the crowd is a lot. waiting time is almost 50 mins which means you are spending max of your time standing for a ride rather than riding. very disappointed. families have a long wait time in standard ticket queue. better take express ticket if you hate queue. single rider option in some rides is super helpful but then thats for the single folks - i loved the smile on their faces when the went for rides without any wait times. place has more cafe's and less rides. dont miss transformers, shrek, puss in boats, cylon, human, mummy, rapids, lights camera action. ps. avoid treasure hunt - it is a slow moving car and there is nothing in it.

name: user_3555
review: An amazing experience. Got the normal ticket( no express pass), glad i did it as i could not have done all the rides in one full day due to the head spinning in few of the rides. Best ones were the transformers ride, mummy returns ride, waterworld show and the light camera action show. All in all a must visit for all ages.

name: user_3556
review: Best place to explore in Singapore for Kids and Youngsters. Weekend use Express pass for least waiting

name: user_3557
review: This tourist park, which is a must visit when traveling in Singapore, contains various types of games, both adrenaline-fueled and relaxing and fun Tickets can be purchased on site or via third party websites or online applications. If you buy from a third party, you can simply scan the Barcode at the entrance without needing to print it to enter Access to this tourist park is very easy and simple because it is connected to the LRT Resorts World Sentosa Express Station, you just have to walk approximately 150 meters without worrying about being hit by rain or hot sun. If necessary, you can bring a folding umbrella or portable raincoat The facilities inside are very complete, toilets are available, there are many kinds of fast food restaurants selling snacks, drinks and even heavy meals. Small luggage lockers are available on some rides The instructions for each game ride are written very clearly for each rule, because some games require requirements such as height, not being sick, not being under medical care, etc. Some games can also involve getting wet, flashing lights (strobes), using fire, etc. So read first before boarding the game There are lots of tips and tricks for visiting Universal Studios Singapore on social media. My advice is to visit when it's not in the holiday season and don't come too late or early in the morning. Use sunscreen if necessary, bring your own portable raincoat if you want to save money

name: user_3558
review: When You Want Your Kids To Explore Exciting Rides Get Photos With There Favourite Character Universal Studios Is The Right Choice. Transformer Ride, Roller Coaster, Dino Soarin Lot Of Other Rides To Spend Your Day. DO NOT FORGET To Buy Express Entry Pass On Holidays.

name: user_3559
review: The Globe in Singapore is really special Used all the facilities in half a day Food prices in the park are relatively high There are also food trucks and vendors outside, so you can choose from!

name: user_3561
review: Just the right size and with the right number of attractions and rides. There's also something for most ages, with young kids able to go on most rides in the park. Lots of familiar franchises for the rides so it's exciting for all. The Jurassic Park section is the best in terms of ride quality and design. Lots of food and drink options. Perhaps the only short-coming is that certain basic amenities are chargeable, such as lockers to store your valuables when going on rides, and things like ponchos for water rides. These should be given for free considering the ticket price.

name: user_3564
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a vibrant and thrilling theme park that offers a fun-filled day for visitors of all ages. Located on Sentosa Island, this park is packed with exciting attractions, live shows, and a variety of themed zones that transport you to different worlds. One of the highlights for thrill-seekers is the collection of adrenaline-pumping rides, such as the Battlestar Galactica dueling roller coasters and the Revenge of the Mummy indoor coaster. These rides provide heart-pounding excitement and are a must-try for adventure enthusiasts. For families with younger children, the park offers a range of gentler rides and attractions in zones like Far Far Away and Madagascar. Here, kids can meet beloved characters like Shrek and the Madagascar crew, and enjoy interactive shows and themed rides that cater to their sense of wonder and excitement. Universal Studios Singapore also excels in its entertainment offerings. Spectacular live shows like the WaterWorld stunt show and the Hollywood Dreams Parade provide captivating performances that entertain guests of all ages. Additionally, the park frequently updates its seasonal events, ensuring there's always something new and exciting to experience. The park's immersive environments, from the ancient ruins of The Lost World to the glitz and glamour of Hollywood, are meticulously designed, creating a truly immersive experience. Dining options are plentiful and diverse, ranging from quick snacks to full meals, catering to various tastes and preferences. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination that promises a fun and memorable day for everyone, making it a perfect spot for families, friends, and solo travelers alike. Whether you're a thrill-seeker, a movie buff, or just looking for a delightful day out, this theme park has something special to offer.

name: user_3565
review: One of the Universal Studios in Southeast Asia, when I came here with friends, of course it was very busy, but I didn't have time to play on the rides, just taking photos, there are lots of shops here too, there is also a Lego shop here

name: user_3568
review: One of the best places to visit in Singapore. Attractions, roller coasters, characters, themed cafs, what more could you want? Would highly recommend going with family. Buy the express pass as well. It helps a lot with the waiting times.

name: user_3574
review: Worth visiting ! Recommend the mummy ride and the water show ! It was amazing !

name: user_3575
review: Excellent attraction and everyone should experience this attraction. Children will especially enjoy it a lot as well as adults. So many rides are there with full fun. The only request is, people having any health issues, should not use any rides.

name: user_3576
review: Full of Fun throughout the day. You will be exhausted enjoying everything.

name: user_3577
review: Great theme park, having the AC in the shops was a true saver with the constant hot days. Easy to get to via the MRT or Grabb plus catch the light rail from Vivo city. Don't buy your ticket on the day cos they will have already sold out! We made that mistake and had to go back the next day. There is a few places to eat in universal ..certainly expensive though. Tbh universal did lack atmosphere compared to Numerous other theme parks l have been to which was disappointing. Not the best for young families are there are limited rides for young children.

name: user_3578
review: Luckily for us we got relatively less crowd and managed to cover each and every corner of the park. Great rides, great food and a wonderful experience!!

name: user_3579
review: A small but mighty place. I enjoyed all the rides. Tip here. If you're a single Rider you get to go through the fastpass line without having to pay.

name: user_3580
review: An absolutely amazing experience. Top notch rides. Really loved the Transformers Ride. Many options in food. All kinds of rides available. Lots of cool stuff to shop from.

name: user_3581
review: Its just amazing place to go with family, friends and kids. Must to go place when you are in singapore. Buy tickets in advance frim getyourguide app

name: user_3584
review: Great experience specially for kids. Has rides, live shows and many attractions. Prefer to go on weekdays and if you dont prefer rides then the whole place can be covered in under 4 hours easily. Main wait is due to rides that have long queues. Or if going with express pass that allows to skip the queue, can help cover whole thing in about 4 hours. Though the express pass is expensive (has to be bought separately and in fact costs more than the ticket). Enjoy till 4 pm and then head to the beaches nearby.

name: user_3585
review: Having read so many different comments, not sure whether we could finish the rides or not without the express pass which is very pricey. Truth is, we finished in very good time. There are barely any wait at all for all the rides from about 5pm and one can easily enter the rides in under 5 mins. Don't forget to also look for the shows as they are fabulous too! Lots of photo opportunities with different characters. A LOT of roller coasters in this place which make up 80% of the rides.... if you dislike them like I do, you might find the ride choices a bit uggh.....but all in all, an enjoyable day for me and my partner.

name: user_3586
review: Compared to price and time slot one can see only half of the Universal studios.

name: user_3587
review: We went there and bought the general admission ticket for 8085 per person. Then, when we went inside, it was overcrowded. When we went for a ride, it was a 100-minute waityes, over 1 hour just for 1 ride out of 16 attractions. So, to overcome this, the park offers you an express ticket for 100 per person. The ticket counter will sell you a ticket, but most of the attractions are not suitable for kids under 122 cm. So it was a waste of money for us. Altogether, we spent 600 plus 100 for the cable car. By spending 100 on express tickets you will feel like VIP (Very Important Person) as normal crowd is waiting for hours an hours while you can come in and out very quickly. I should have left my feeling at home in Australia that everyone is equal as the park doesn't treat you like that. My question is when they can accommodate large express ticket crowd why not others or make 1 price ticket and only let limited crowd in and out like in Night Safari where you have to pre book. Or else increase the staff or attractions facility. Surely if the business is making money then investing in impoverment won't be a issue. It lacks simple management solutions even though it Universal Studios. The park is overcrowded with Indians tourist mainly. Please mind I am an Indian Australian too. Not against any race, but the park staff was not able to control the crowd. My family and I were pushed 3-4 times while waiting for the attractions. I was elbowed twice. My wife and kid was pushed back by a man so he could break the queue and come to the front of the queue. Also, by the way, most of the time, no one was following the queue. The park will keep selling tickets to make more money; it's like quantity but not quality. I would not recommend it to families with young children or infants and toddlers as it's a waste of time and money. It will probably be okay with children over 6 -7 years plus, not for 3-4 years or below. If you have never being to Universal Studios then go for it. After the experience from Universal Studios we decided to cancel all other plan to water world and rest of the sentosa as I rather have relax holiday in the hotel pool relax and enjoy with kids rather then get pushed around, elbowed or rush around. Probably I would choose Thailand as it got everything to offer to everyone and the management on venue's is way better.

name: user_3588
review: Long time repeat visitor. Recent return visit post Covid was poor. No shelter, expensive lockers, poor queue lines and several rides were being rebuilt (despite same entrance price). The express pass was more expensive than the ticket, why cant they align to Disneys genie pass and pre-booking system that works great and cost half as much.

name: user_3591
review: This time is mainly going to the aquarium, so it does not go inside the main park. The day I went (May 12), the weather was beautiful and not too crowded. Because I didn't go inside, I can't comment on the service and games. When I went here, I took the bus from Vivo and didn't notice that there was a train from Vivo straight to Sentosa station, which was a bit of a failure.

name: user_3595
review: I bought an early ticket and it was worth it. I arrived at 9 am on Monday, and can try all rides The most favorite rides were Revenge of the Mummy and Canopy Flyer It was so fun and so many performances like Madagascar, Troll, Shrek etc

name: user_3596
review: I would say that if you dont buy fast track then youll be waiting for a long time. I would recommend families and children to go there than adults alone. The different places to eat is just so busy and so many cool rides were closed. I was already through the good ones less than 2 hours for 180 I just somehow wished there was more and somehow appreciated the fact that there was at least air conditioning

name: user_3599
review: It was a very fun experience. We both our ticket outside USSG we did not buy the express lane. Although there are heaps pf people on a weekeday...we didnt have to wait much. I enjoyed the transformer ride too bad we cant take photo. There are heaps of other ridea too bad i was too tired becuase of the heat and the screaming and walking.

name: user_3600
review: I've been here before, but this time I didn't go in on a rainy day. The staff at the front desk were friendly and even informed me that it's cheaper to buy online.

name: user_3601
review: I go to Universal Studio during Chinese new year. There are crowed people. However, Rides and show delivered the great experience. Dont forget to have Gelato edition both ice cream and cookie which is the best part for me on that day.

name: user_3603
review: Im not much of a roller coaster person but Universal Studios was still an awesome day out. Facilities were great, heaps of restrooms available all in great condition. Staff were lovely and helpful. Merchandising felt pretty reasonably priced. Food is a bit pricey compared to what you can get in SG so would recommend bringing in some snacks.

name: user_3604
review: Fantastic fun as always. Sad that the Jurrasic water ride was not open and will be great to see the minion land when finished.

name: user_3605
review: Beautiful entertainment, breathtaking rides. There is something for everyone, for young and old. To do without hesitation.

name: user_2167
review: 1. Loved visiting Universal Studios 2. Most of the rides are thrilling and wonderful Transformers (Most amazing experience) Roller coaster (As usual but only 8 minutes) The Mummy (Good one) Shrek 4D ( kids enjoyed the most) Lots other rides and had good time with the group. 3. The water show was amazing and should never miss their Live stunts and blasts.. 4. Limited food options and tastes average. 5. Recommended to visit on Weekdays.

name: user_3609
review: Enjoyed with family and friends

name: user_3612
review: USS is already famous so let me just cut my review short with critical tips. 1. Use the express system, either at your most desirable ride or straight at the Revenge of Mummy. 2. Jurassic's water-ride is fun, you will definitely get splashed at, but not soaked. 3. The weather's super hot, wear light and stay hydrated. (Bring your water bottles or pay the theme-park rate.) Others, have fun and explore!

name: user_3616
review: Despite the occasional downpour, I was able to enjoy most of the attractions with almost no waiting time.

name: user_3618
review: Went there on 20.05.2024. Disappointed that maracasar was shut down. The jurrasic water ride was down for servicing. Yet all this information was not made available to us online before we bought the tickets. The costs of tickets remain the same even . Thus the queue to the remaining rides was longer than usual.

name: user_3620
review: Excellent place to visit ,even during sweltering heat of Singapore

name: user_3621
review: A place for movie fans and non movie fans to enjoy. It could be your holiday retreat or a vacation perhaps. There are so much things to do here that you won't get bored ever. I was on a tour last time, so I didn't get to explore that much, but next time I'm going to spend most of my time there much more. Update: I returned there after 5 years and this time I got to enter the park. We paid about 70 since it was low season but the place was still packed. The price we paid was reasonable since this is by far the smallest universal studios I have ever been to. A great time with the family.

name: user_3622
review: The experience is great the food is bit heavy on the pocket but the quality of rides and shows are great

name: user_3623
review: Kids can enjoy some rides and mostly adult can only enjoy and can ride, but the waiting time for rides ll make u think do u really need to go ahhhhhh but I have to tell these rides are worth the visit some shows were there which can be seen according to the timing but ya can be enjoyed by all, and the less stars for the works and upgradation going inside some areas in the USS.

name: user_3626
review: Good one. Disappointed to see lost world ride was closed. Enjoyed Shred 4d, transformers 4d, mommy's revenge, water world show etc. Once in a lifetime you have to visit this place with your kids and bring out the child in you.

name: user_3629
review: Feels like in INDIA and smell Curry Sweat everywhere.... They do not know how to que the line If you have more of money, it is better to go to OSAKA (JAPAN)

name: user_3631
review: Good options for rides and 3d shows. Smaller as compared to Disney in Hongkong. Transformers 7d show was best.

name: user_3632
review: WE BOTH LOVED OUR DAY HERE!!! We spent the day at universal on a Friday and it was so so good! Got there at opening time and spent around 10-15 queuing to get in. Once we were in the rides hardly had any queue throughout the whole day apart from one which took around 30-40 minutes! Other than that it was very smooth and quick to get on each ride? CYLON, HUMAN and (The ancient one, dont remember the name) were by far the best rides which had queues up to 5 minutes so definitely worth the short wait! The park its self was so nostalgic to walk around and so cool to see all the different sections including: THE LOST WORLD, transformers, Far Far Away and the rest!! We are travellers but just wanted a bit of fun for a day and honestly it was so worth it!!

name: user_3633
review: One of the Spore icons that we must visit when we go there But yesterday when I visited there were still several points under repair

name: user_3639
review: Very beautiful amusement park located on an island with several beaches, hotels, beach clubs etc... just a shame that there are not enough thrill attractions for my taste.

name: user_3640
review: Great to visit if it's your first time going to Universal Studios, but people who have gone to larger USs such as Universal Studios Los Angeles will find it underwhelming, and a lot of rides were under maintenance, including one of the roller coaster, which broke down just moments before we were to get on, and the iconic revenge of the mummy.

name: user_3644
review: This is my second time to Universal Singapore. We got the early entry tickets which is highly recommended. By 10:15 we had done Transformers, Sesame Street and both Battlestar Galactica rides - I thought the Cylon version was one of the best rides Ive ever done - amazing. My only gripe is that as I type this it is 12pm and I have gone on every single ride apart from 2 kid friendly ones - so 12 rides in 3 hours - on a Sunday! Wouldnt recommend the express pass as it is not worth it if you arrive early. We are going home as basically done everything, granted there are a couple of shows which we could watch but not for over an hour. They are building a new Minions area so perhaps there is less than there would normally be, but for 50 I feel like there should be at least a whole days worth of activities, not a half day. Would recommend for first timers though.

name: user_3648
review: Any uni in the world is the best

name: user_3652
review: For Thai people who will come, I recommend you to buy VIP tickets, otherwise you will queue for a very long time to enter the attractions!! Please buy tickets in advance. You won't have to line up to get a ticket.

name: user_3653
review: Universal Studios is a fantastic theme park with thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and immersive attractions. It's perfect for families and movie lovers. Be prepared for long lines, but the experience is worth it.

name: user_3654
review: So fun! Use locker to put your bag for 100 minutes and take it after you play. Put it again every time you wanna play, so you will not pay more. Bring a transparant raincoat if you wanna play in water area.

name: user_3657
review: Good place to play in. The lines are long but well organized. Should try Transformers: The Ride, Revenge Of The Mummy, and the shrek ride. Felt a fun time in here with family. Get your life to the fullest.

name: user_3658
review: So in comparison to Universal studios in USA or Japan, this is a small park. The rides & experiences are also relatively tame in comparison. However you can achieve it easily within a day without complete exhaustion, which was perfect for us! When we visited, it was during the slow season (mid late April) & there were hardly any wait lines! We paid for express tix and we really didn't need them! We hopped off the human vs cyborg roller-coaster and got right back on, four times! It was a really fun family day out & would defo recommend a visit!

name: user_3661
review: Lot of walking around.wear a good shoe.rides are good. Veg food options are less.carry ur own food for kids.u need 5 to 6 hours in the place.carry an empty bottle to fill drinking water or in shop its 4 sgd

name: user_3662
review: I really enjoyed our whole day walkathon here at USS. I'm just sad that the weather is kinda unpredictable in SG so we always have to pause in between fun stuffs. I still appreciate the whole USS, I haven't got to try all the rides because just the Revenge of the Mummy already traumatized me and made my tummy go upside down (I don't do rides that is why!). I'm glad we took a lot of photos though, I'd still want to know more and wander around USS again someday! Btw, as someone who did and studied theatre and film, the Lights, Camera, Action is my fave experience here, goosebumps!

name: user_3663
review: Of course, Kids loves Universal Studios. For elderly parents, some walking is required and they are many shows to watch and relax. For Veg, you have veg briyani option near Mummy zone.

name: user_3665
review: The lines were very short, the longest was only 30 mins. Very pleasant surprise from Universal Hollywood back home where lines can get two hours. We did go on a Thursday so perhaps on the weekend it might be more busy. The food was amazing here!

name: user_3671
review: A Comprehensive Review of Universal Studios Singapore Prepare yourself for an extensive exploration into the wondrous world of Universal Studios Singapore, a realm where fantasy and reality converge to create an unparalleled experience of joy, excitement, and unbridled entertainment. Strap in, dear reader, for this journey promises to be as exhilarating as a ride on the most thrilling roller coaster. First and foremost, let us delve into the sheer magnitude of attractions that Universal Studios Singapore has to offer. From the moment you step foot into this fantastical realm, you are greeted by a cornucopia of wonders that cater to every age, interest, and inclination. Whether you find yourself wandering through the enchanting streets of Hollywood, traversing the jungles of Jurassic Park, or exploring the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, there is no shortage of adventures to embark upon and memories to be made. But it is not just the quantity of attractions that sets Universal Studios Singapore apartit is the impeccable quality and attention to detail that truly elevate the experience to new heights. Each themed zone is meticulously crafted to transport visitors to far-flung realms and immerse them in the magic of their favorite films and franchises. From the lifelike animatronics of Transformers: The Ride to the pulse-pounding thrills of Revenge of the Mummy, every attraction is a testament to the artistry and ingenuity of its creators. And let us not forget the spectacular shows and entertainment offerings that grace the stages of Universal Studios Singapore. Whether you find yourself swept away by the dazzling spectacle of the Hollywood Dreams Parade, mesmerized by the death-defying stunts of WaterWorld, or laughing until your sides ache at the antics of the Sesame Street characters, there is no shortage of entertainment to captivate and delight audiences of all ages. But perhaps the true pice de rsistance of Universal Studios Singapore lies in its unparalleled commitment to guest satisfaction and comfort. From the immaculate cleanliness of the park grounds to the courteous and attentive service of the staff, every aspect of the visitor experience is carefully curated to ensure maximum enjoyment and relaxation. Whether you find yourself indulging in a delectable meal at one of the park's many dining establishments, cooling off with a refreshing beverage at a themed kiosk, or simply taking a moment to rest and recharge in one of the shaded seating areas, you can rest assured that you are in the capable hands of professionals who take pride in their work. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore stands as a shining beacon of excellence in the realm of theme park entertainment. With its vast array of attractions, impeccable attention to detail, and unwavering commitment to guest satisfaction, it is no wonder that visitors from around the globe flock to its gates in search of adventure and excitement. So come one, come all, and embark on a journey of discovery and delight that will leave you breathless with wonder and longing for more. Universal Studios Singapore awaits, ready to whisk you away on the adventure of a lifetime.

name: user_3672
review: Fun and clean. Alot of shows to watch for free. Would go again

name: user_3673
review: I follow my other friend to go at 12:15 but i arrived 5 minutes late.... sudennly i arrrived at penacony is this real? Welcome to my world renew your definition world so high let it show and hear my declaration

name: user_3675
review: Very good just visit it just now on 12.15am but there's no people at counter so I don't know how to get in.

name: user_3679
review: The park is nice and the atmosphere is pleasant. The reason why I am giving a score 3 is because the park is very much in disregard to food allergies. There are many many places to eat but not one did have anything gluten free to offer. I ate only potato wedges all day when I was threre.

name: user_3682
review: Lovely amusement park that has a little something for children and adults. The shows and performances takes you down the memory lane and the roller coasters will definitley kick your adrenaline in. You will require an entire day for finishing the park.

name: user_3685
review: Universal studio as usual movie stuffs with fun rides.there is usually a long queues for rides especially for transformer 4d ride

name: user_3690
review: Please try for early entry so that everything will be covered. The waiting times are higher for some of the events .So plan accordingly. Mummy , Transformer, Water world are the more attractive shows .

name: user_3693
review: Third time here and everything was

name: user_3694
review: Great 4D shows and roller coaster rides but preferred to visit post 12 pm as queue will slightly lesser compared to morning rush. Could have been more activities added

name: user_3698
review: The rides were great, decoration very nice, a lot of options to buy souvenirs. I enjoyed the day a lot. Water show the best

name: user_3700
review: It's a very fun place! When I went last week, one of the rides (Jurassic Rapids) was closed for renovation, so that's a bummer.

name: user_3702
review: Rides are ok. Lack of good F&B options

name: user_3703
review: If you are visiting singapore, this is a must place to visit. Similar to Disney world. Thrilled rides and lot of adventure exists. We Adults & Kids definetly love this, sometimes we think, we need to go the ride again & again. Best attractions which we shouldn't miss is Roller coster, Jurassic park rapid adventure, Canopy flyer, Avengers, Transformers, Revenge of Mummy etc., My badluck during visit is Revenge of Mummy is closed for maintenance. Every attractions is excellent. Better to start early in the day, make sure that we reach there by 9:30 am. Better to take MRT & bus to reach here. If we want to avoid waiting in queue, need to buy VIP pass, which costs more. For many attractions, the photography / video is not allowed. For some rides like jurassic park rapid adventure, bags are not allowed to take as there are high chances of getting wet. Few of them carry / purchase the rain covers to protect them from water. People who come early, first visit the attractions like Transformers, Avengers, Mummy etc., so there will be huge queue in front. If we want to avoid queue, better to come from last, so that we can avoid queues. Visit these attactions post the lunch, so that it will be empty. Food: - Food is costly here, we can carry some snacks / food to save money. Photo package: - People try to come and ask you to take photo package with unlimited photograph. If we take the package, sometimes the server will not work and finally we will end up of getting multiple tags. Consolidating photos from multiple tags will be tedious. Meet & Greet We can meet lot of characters like minions and few others and take photos. There are people who help to take photos with this characters using our phone. They take lot of photos too, so no worries. Though the ticket is costly, but it is worth to spend to enjoy. Make sure spending entire day till 5-6 pm, so that we dont miss any attractions.

name: user_3704
review: Fun, fun, fun! Enjoyed the theme park a lot. Played the rides until closing time. Must try roller coasters! Mummy ride is nice too.

name: user_3706
review: Must do for all ages! A quick tip - please get the express pass especially if you are visiting on weekends

name: user_3707
review: Our visit to Universal Studios was a blast! We had a great time enjoying the child-friendly rides and exploring all the attractions. The prayer room near the rides was incredibly convenient, and we appreciated the thoughtful inclusion. The food options were fantastic, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. Universal Studios is definitely a must-visit destination for families looking for fun and excitement!

name: user_3708
review: Bit disappointed with few rides under maintenance but over all great experience Especially Transformers Ride And roller coaster

name: user_3710
review: Extremely good especially with kids...take express entry on weekends...weekdays normal tickets are fine

name: user_3711
review: A fun filled adventure place

name: user_3712
review: You must bring family or friends, guys

name: user_3713
review: Slight deception to see half of the park under construction: jurassic always having technical issues, Mommy out of order, and waterworld not open. Good tip is to buy the early entrance ticket to avoid the commoners. Food is below par. How come no beef in an American Burger Drive In? But it creates good memories for young teenagers anyways.

name: user_3714
review: It is truly the smallest Universal Studios in the world! I entered the park at 11:30 and did not buy a fast pass. Except for the roller coaster, I did not play any other facilities. You can finish it before closing at 19:00. However, it is highly recommended to go to the Water World to watch the show. Every time you see the show, you will be very, very shocked and no one can beat it!

name: user_3716
review: Amazing day out, the rides were spectacular (especially the Battlestar Galactica themed ride) and the themed food options were awesome too. The shrek waffle was particularly delicious! Can easily spend the whole day in the park, either on the rides or watching the shows. Would recommend bringing an umbrella for the sun (and rain ). It is particularly busy on weekends though so maybe buy a fast pass if you dont like waiting.

name: user_3717
review: Universal Studio was definitely a great experience but in my opinion, it wasn't worth the entry fee price and it was a bit overrated. Minions area still under construction, a couple of rides were undergoing maintenance. Be sure to take a drink bottle as they offer cold water fountains.

name: user_3718
review: Embark on a whirlwind adventure at Universal Studios in Singapore, where every corner is bursting with cinematic magic. From strolling down the bustling streets of Hollywood to exploring the whimsical worlds of Sci-Fi City and Ancient Egypt, every step feels like a journey into a beloved movie. Though we eagerly explored every nook and cranny, we opted out of the thrilling rides this time, finding solace in the vibrant atmosphere and lively entertainment. Despite skipping the queues, the experience was still brimming with excitement and discovery, leaving us with cherished memories to treasure.

name: user_3719
review: A great place to have fun with your kids. Even if you don't buy the express bus, the line isn't that long on weekdays, and depending on the time, the characters take pictures with you. In particular, Shrek and Fiona are very realistic and friendly, and the prices for Goods and various foods are killer.

name: user_3723
review: Had a great time with family. Loved all the rides. Waiting time maybe longer but worth it to spend full day there.

name: user_3724
review: Long queue times even on weekdays. Some attractions will be closed, Especially when it rains, it pours in Singapore lots of renovations and expansion ongoing hopefully itll be better in the next 3 years. I queued for Transformer ride only to be informed the ride is malfunctioning. Great staff though

name: user_3725
review: We had soooo much fun at the park and the rides are so cool .. hosts are super kind and friendly .. I remember Mr Francis from Minions store was super helpful and friendly

name: user_3728
review: It's a bit small but it's very fun

name: user_3729
review: Don't buy express pass on weekdays.. enter the park at 10am .. do the most popular rides early on.

name: user_3731
review: I love Universal Studios and this place is amazing. A must if you are in Singapore.

name: user_3732
review: Universal Studios Singapore Only came here for a while because I had to continue my journey

name: user_3733
review: During the time I went, I encountered a lot of Indian tours.

name: user_3734
review: Life is short. Go have fun. We have to do what we want to do, enjoy life to the fullest. No regrets coming to Universal Studios Singapore. It was fun and magical, for all the kids, young and old. Thanks for the memories.

name: user_3735
review: Loved it, was only able to spend a day there, but it was enough to want us to come back and explore it even more.

name: user_3736
review: Food always amazing! Especially their unfried chicken! Must try! Staff are very accommodating too! Thank you guys! Well done!

name: user_3738
review: It's quite nice, in one day you can tour it and ride practically all the rides and even meet some characters (with good organization). I paid for photos, but I don't recommend it since the nice thing about it is that you have the photos inside some games, but the Battlestar Galactica didn't have the camera activated when I went up to it (according to what they said, it doesn't have the cameras until after 10:30). Otherwise, most of the people who work are very friendly.

name: user_3740
review: I felt it was not worth the money paid, a few rides are good, the roller coaster red one is not scary I did not try the black one.

name: user_3741
review: gone for 7 years .Sad that they remove the Madascar and Shrek's House :( .So efficient that you can get your tix at the kiosk.I mean, All the tickets for their tourist attraction.

name: user_3742
review: What a great day we took 5 hours to discover this park "universal studios" as it closes at 7pm and the last gondoler leaves the island at 830pm cost for an adult is 130 Aud for universal entry and gondoler accross to santosa Island and on the island, monorails are free on santosa inland, we used buses in Singapore and taped on and off with visa card, great bus app available, and great service till midnight, "Note that after midnight taxi is 50% more" so look at limousine transport after these hours as it the same cost as a taxi, enjoy and good luck.

name: user_3743
review: Place is nice but price is little high and without express pass it is useless And don't go with small kids cause than you can't take rides overthere

name: user_3744
review: Good experience If u dont wanna wait the players so long time express the best choice

name: user_3745
review: Family & friends, Must visit in Singapore

name: user_3748
review: The park might not be that spacious, but it's always crowded even on weekdays. There are long queues for popular rides like Battlestar Galactica, Transformers, and Mummy. I recommend booking tickets in advance through Travel agency like Klook to get a discount. No need to wait in line for purchasing a ticket, just show the barcode from mobile phone and scan it at the park entrance. Minion Land is currently under construction and is scheduled to be opened in 2024...

name: user_3749
review: The universal studio is a 1 of a kind experience specially if you are going with young ones. Amazing atmosphere all around. Everything is very realistic. Whether it's a ride or the character which comes for a meet-up. Yes it's always crowded as it's very famous. But one can plan the day accordingly and research well before going. Wait time can be annoying but you have to live with it and enjoy the day. I would recommend going on weekdays and keeping famous rides like transformer and mummy for the second half as most of the people go and do those rides first. You should check the weather forecast before planning your trip. As too much rain can spoil your day.

name: user_3750
review: This place sell corns at 6 that are awful and they cannot even supply salt with it.

name: user_3752
review: Worth experiencing, but a bit small, waiting time for each game is too long and many games require maintenance. Not planning to visit again next time.

name: user_3753
review: Wonderful place to spend time with family. Our favorite was the transformers and then the Mummy rides. Food is okish, it could have been better.

name: user_3755
review: Good experience... And I appreciate that they have roof in many of the areas... Plus the food is way way way more edible than the other theme parks I visited abroad

name: user_3757
review: Went on a Thursday and managed to get the early entry ticket so the crowd was not too crazy yet. I managed to enjoy the rides on sesame street and Transformers. Afterwards i went to Battlestar Galactica. i was already waiting my turn at the gate but everyone was suddenly asked to return to the queue. As all of us were waiting, there wasnt any information or explanation given. We waited for a good 10-15 mins before an announcement was made that there were technical difficulties and the rides are delayed. Waited for 10 mins and no updates were given how long. Slowly everyone started leaving. A man asked the staff what is happening and the staff only said we have technical difficulties and unfortunately we dont exactly know what is causing it. You can stay but we dont know how long it will take or you can leave. I waited for about 15 mins and they still said they did not know what the issue was. There wont be much they would do for service recovery either. So i feel like the early entry ticket was wasted or useless as i didnt get to ride at all afterwards. The ride was only working about 30 mins after i left which is about the same time that more crowds were forming. When i wanted to ride, the wait time was more than 2 hours. Not only did i not get to ride it, when i waited for the transformer photo taking, it also delayed for 10-15 mins. Now i understand as it might be difficult to wear the costume but it was kinda frustrating as the queue was under the hot sun. We were not allowed to wait under the shelter either as it is considered to be entering the staffs zone. USS used to be fun and enjoyable, now just seems to be full of delays and issues without any service recovery. If you were to complain, they wont do anything much either and probably wont do anything when i write this review too. So just take note of this if you plan on going USS.

name: user_3758
review: Nice, construction zones, I highlight Sherck's 3D show, transformer simulator, Jurassic Park. Regarding the entrance fee in relation to the activities, you can visit it in one day.

name: user_3761
review: Alot of ride in renovation and maintenance, only 70% of rides and restaurant are in business. Paid full price for it, what a deal breaker. All visitors become packed to available restaurant / ride that are open. Was raining heavily half day, not enough accommodation for shelter, and most of the ride become offline due to rain. Tough luck, but bad management, shouldnt charge full price for 70% operational theme park. To us, this is the worst univ. std weve ever been to. Never going back. Better spend your money elsewhere.

name: user_3763
review: A very different place to enjoy various types of activities. One is not enough to enjoy all rides. Rollercoaster Power Rangers Water level games are very memorable.

name: user_3764
review: If you don't buy a fast pass, you need to queue for at least 1 hour for each facility. The park is not big, and at least 2 facilities are not open that day. Water is provided in the park and can be used while queuing, but many tourists drink it directly and even cover the water outlet with their mouths, which is very unhygienic. There are only 2 shows in Future Water World every day. The blue area is a completely wet area. If you dont want to get wet, try to sit as high as possible in the back, but it will be far away from the stage and there will be less interaction with the performers. It seems that I have seen this water show before. There is quite a lot to comment on, you can go in and experience it for yourself!

name: user_3767
review: Quite amazing amysement park. Transformers ride was the best. Maybe Battlestar Galactica was good too but I had to skip it because others were too scared to go.

name: user_3772
review: Magical and very fun. An excellent amusement park.

name: user_3774
review: If this is your first experience with theme parks, it's great, but for us (we've been to Orlando in the US, Disneyland in Paris, etc.) it wasn't crazy. The whole thing took us about 5/6 hours (compared to other parks it is rather small) and we didn't like any of the attractions enough to go a second time. Very nice WaterWorld show, a nice time, but we wouldn't go again. We were there on May 5, the queues were not long, about 25 minutes to the attraction, the price was SGD 84.

name: user_3776
review: I have taken several fun photos at this location

name: user_3779
review: It's a great place to have fun. I recommend the Waterworld presentation that they have at the noon, along with the Transformers ride

name: user_3781
review: Recommended. More for children aged 6 and over.

name: user_3784
review: Really a great entertainment.. All the rides is marvellous and especially the transformers and mummy ride is awesome experience. Street dancers are making a huge vibes

name: user_3791
review: Many interesting games

name: user_3792
review: Lovely theme park, lots of ride but it is crowded every day and any day. Express pass additional 100 is recommended. Otherwise mostly crowd recedes after 5pm or so.

name: user_3793
review: Very fun but the SCP Labratory was the best

name: user_3795
review: Really fun experience. This place is more for adults than for kids with thrilling rides. Cylone, mummy rides, Transformers are must and should never miss. If you have kids I recommend taking express pass even if you're seeing out more money as there will be waiting period minimum of 40 mins in each ride in normal pass. For the show's there Shrek show is 4D and really good, and there are many other shows for kids like trolls , sesame Street show and also there will be small shows on the road itself going on every now and then . Food is pretty expensive there and not that good too. Keep less luggage as possible as you need to keep your belongings in locker for few rides and go. Don't miss the water world show are 1.30 and 4.30 pm .

name: user_3796
review: Had a blast at Universal Studios Singapore despite the scorching weather. The park is filled with thrilling rides and attractions, keeping us entertained throughout the day. The staff were fantastic and always ready to assist. While the hot weather was a bit challenging, especially when waiting in long queues, the overall experience was still fantastic. A definite must-visit destination for families and adventure enthusiasts

name: user_3799
review: Useless ! Without stopping at the attractions, you can walk around the park in 10/15 minutes. It's tiny. 150 min queue for looping attractions, rides closed, single rider lines also closed. Food expensive and really not good. There's nothing magical about the decorations of the park itself either. When you know parks like Disney, Asterix or Europapark this one really sucks in comparison. Very overrated compared to the reviews and advertising around it. Very disappointed. Some nice attractions though like Shrek 4 D, Transformers or the water show.

name: user_3801
review: Amazing park with lots of nice roller coasters and other fun rides. Park is quite small and very clean. I did enjoy my day there. Note that food is expensive.

name: user_3802
review: Had to wait 2.5h for a roller coaster. Other rides with at least 70 minutes wait. I'm sure the park is great but the queues are brutal and ruined the experience

name: user_3803
review: We went in mid april. It was really hot but we enjoyed all the rides. There was a temporary naruto gallery setup which was pretty cool. Must visit transformers and mummy rides

name: user_3804
review: This is my 2nd time to come to Universal Studio Singapore. I had a fun memory in this theme park like going back to my childhood. Universal Studios Singapore is a top-notch theme park that offers a wide range of attractions for visitors of all ages. One of the most popular rides at the park is the Transformers: The Ride 3D, which combines cutting-edge technology with thrilling motion simulation to immerse guests in the world of the Autobots and Decepticons. This ride is a favorite among many visitors for its high-octane action and immersive storytelling. For those seeking a more extreme experience, the Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon roller coaster is a must-try. This dueling roller coaster features two different tracks, each offering a unique and exhilarating ride experience. The Human track provides a more traditional roller coaster experience with loops and twists, while the Cylon track offers a more intense and thrilling ride with inversions and high-speed drops. Both tracks offer a heart-pounding adventure that is sure to satisfy adrenaline junkies. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic theme park that caters to a wide range of tastes and preferences. Whether you're a fan of thrilling rides or immersive storytelling, there is something for everyone to enjoy at this world-class attraction. The park is well-maintained and clean, providing a pleasant environment for guests to enjoy. The staff are friendly and helpful, ensuring a positive experience for all visitors. The food options within the park are diverse and delicious, offering something for everyone. The Park offers a variety of souvenir shops where visitors can purchase mementos to remember their experience at the theme park. Some of the popular souvenir shops include: Studio Souvenirs, Minion Mart, Jurassic Outfitters, The Dark Room, Silver Screen Collectibles. The park can get crowded during peak times, so it's recommended to plan your visit accordingly. Overall, Universal Studios is a must-visit destination for anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out!!.

name: user_3807
review: As I am a theme park lover and have been to various parks in America and Europe, I have to say that I was disappointed... The park is quite small and there are far too many visitors for that! The attractions are sometimes great and sometimes ok. We didn't do all of them at all, even though the park is small, but at some point we just didn't feel like queuing for 40-60 minutes anymore. The queues are long and sometimes things were not accessible. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with the overall package considering the price-performance ratio, but there are also some cool attractions. The Minion area is scheduled to open this year, perhaps. Is it better then?

name: user_3808
review: Incredible! We went on a monday thinking it would be calmer but the wait time on average was over 30 minutes. My brother and I were okay with riding in different times so we used the single person line which took about 10 minutes max. You should purchase tickets beforehand and I would advise being at the gate early in the morning and getting to the most popular rides before the crowds are there is the best trick.

name: user_3809
review: Great place to walk around and enjoy with you family.

name: user_3812
review: Truly Magical! But keep in mind the humid weather as it is non-Air conditioned. Also here even Vegetarian menu has Egg, so if you are a vegetarian, better carry your own food.

name: user_3819
review: Full of thrilling games and shows for children

name: user_3820
review: Had a great time with the kids. Purchased early entry and got to ride a few while it was quiet. Easy to get on rides. Very little wait.

name: user_3821
review: Fantastic fun although huuuuge lines limiting overall experience.

name: user_3823
review: Be v careful when you plan a visit to this place esp if u have infants, children or senior citizens 1. The long que at transformers ride was around 90minutes and u don't realise it at all until mid way. There is no staff around to guide u for emergency. Its Absolutely unorganized 2. There is no or less seating across the area or even for attractions with long distance making it worst and painful 3. Most of the staff are rude with you esp if you belong to different community or are a tourist and not a localite. They shout at u for no reason. 4. The parade is only done on Sundays and most characters are not available on weekdays. We met the puss cat who was equally rude with us in behavior. Why even act like a character if u cnt handle your role humbly? 5. After the entire days hectic walk when we left, the train que was again huge, trains run v v slow with bad cooling and suffocates you as it's so packed. Taxi stop is v far so making it difficult. As usual no place to sit so u have to kill yourself. 6. It was so tiring that my 5yrs old slept and we had to carry her in our arms waiting in this exit que to get the express train. The escalators to climb up to board the train were not functional so we had to take huge staircase with her and our bags with other child. There was no priority given to us despite having a child in arms. All in all, worst experience for huge amount with no facilities to make you comfortable as a guest. They only need your money to make business but give a damn to you or your comfort.

name: user_3825
review: Highest ride: battlestar. Got the early entry ticket. Early entry rides: transformers

name: user_3826
review: Beautiful amusement park. The attraction dedicated to the Transformers is beautiful.

name: user_3828
review: We were really looking forward to visiting USS and unfortunately it was hugely disappointing and we ended up leaving early. Feels like weve wasted a precious day from our trip to Singapore on being hot tired sweaty frustrated and hugely out of pocket. Even though we went early and on a Monday there were such long lines, far longer than the stated time, the ride operators were so slow at each round of the ride they fill it up with like 70% of the people with fast track tickets so felt really unfair. The fast track ticket was nearly as expensive as the main ticket and you have to buy it at the same time as the main ticket. We had a one year old baby and it was very frustrating to just have to carry him in a 40 minute plus queue, we ended up leaving most queues. Even the free shows, you have to get to them in advance otherwise you just miss them and have to wait another two hours for the next show. The meet and greet was so boring, unlike other theme parks where you can interact with the characters, here they just stand behind a rope and people queue up in the heat to take a quick photo and leave. The food again was also majorly disappointing, the cheapest thing you could get was water for 4 and soda for 5 everything else is double restaurant price too and not many great options, mainly just junk food and only 3 are halal. On a positive note the decor in the park was really nice but unfortunately just nothing interactive that you can enjoy without having to queue up for. At the very least they should make all queuing areas air conditioned and properly shaded, not just some far away fans and plastic canopy. There arent even benches to just sit outside to have a rest people just sit in the pavement or have to sit in a restaurant and pay for food. Just overall really not worth the price, came home so deflated unfortunately and wanting a refund as we did not enjoy it. I wouldnt recommend or return - particularly to people with young families.

name: user_3829
review: We were here on a weekday. We bought our tickets online and we were an hour early. I really enjoyed the attraction. In the morning we did not wait in lines at all. We caught a lot of the attractions several times. In the afternoon the lines were already 20 minutes long but it's good to take a break if you still ride roller coasters . I really enjoyed the day and haven't had such a good time in a long time. The shops and restaurants are very overpriced in the park. I had a burger at Mel's. You get a really low quality burger for a high price. So be careful.

name: user_3830
review: Bought tickets from Klook, the transaction was easy. I recommend coming during weekdays, it has fewer visitors. Bring an umbrella and water bottle.

name: user_3832
review: Get there early to beat the crowds. The live shows are great. Recommend the water world show.

name: user_3833
review: A must visit place during holiday in Singapore Here we can enjoy full day activity with all family

name: user_3835
review: Have a fun day with friend here

name: user_3836
review: Fantastic. Having said that, for this first visit, we did all the attractions because it was not too crowded then we ended up doing multiple times cylon and humans :-)

name: user_3838
review: Lets fun and be kids again. This time some place has maintenance next time visit again l.

name: user_3842
review: Visit SG and not go to Universal Studio is against the law ... LOL Make sure to buy EXPRESS pass if you are going on weekends. Check out my reels and shorts @asadvirani

name: user_3845
review: Pack n crowded at the entrance. With ppl taking photos around the areas near entrance. Inside water world shows is great

name: user_3846
review: Skip the rides at the start and to the far end and then back track to avoid the crowd

name: user_3848
review: Spent a fun Saturday with family in Universal Studios. Went for almost all the rides except the Mummy ride was it was under maintenance. Had some food in their Shrek cafe. They had this waffle with green filling and ice cream topping. Was really delicious and satisfying after all the rides.

name: user_3851
review: We didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes for a ride! We had a fantastic time

name: user_3852
review: It is a great must visit place, excellent rides for all age groups, Indian food also available in one restaurant.

name: user_3855
review: Lots of closed rides and exhibits, but yet you pay full price. 50SG for a pizza... Even the parade was cancelled due to potential rain, which is no one's fault but a partial refund wouldn't hurt.

name: user_3857
review: lines are long even on a weekday. rides were good and grateful for the fans. the app was the best thing as we could see the waiting times.

name: user_3859
review: I have been to America and Singapore and they are all with the same level of organisation, entertainment and fun. This city is one of the first things on your list when you visit Singapore. You can go there by taxi, cable car or metro.

name: user_3862
review: A must see/do attraction in Singapore. A fun filled day for our family and the place is extremely clean. And the staff are so happy and helpful.

name: user_3863
review: From morning to night, you can also get 15% off coupons on your birthday, so you can have fun until you dont want to go home

name: user_3864
review: Universal Studios Singapore has very nice rides for small kids. There is a ride I personally like which is a 3D transformers experience. It give you a very nice experience of what it feels like to be in that moment, the seat moves around like youre flying across the room. The tickets are about 90 Singaporean Dollars per person with very overpriced food which I personally think is kind of highway robbery. Overall experience I give is an incredible 4 stars.

name: user_3866
review: Even though the weather was raining, USS was still crowded, the queue was quite long, we were lucky to buy express ticket....

name: user_3868
review: As long as there are dark clouds in the sky, all outdoor facilities in the park will be suspended, and they will be said to be unsafe due to lightning

name: user_3869
review: For sure it's a place to spend many hour having rides on the adventure parks. Prefer to visit it during weakdays because it isn't so crowded. If you visit it during weekends may you prefer the universal express ticket otherwise you are going to wait for more that an hour on each ride. For sure to visit the transformers, the galaxy roller , the 3D move of Shrek (far far away castle) The food is expensive (as expected). So, you avoid to have a full lunch, and prefer to have a byte. When you finish and move out of the studios you should enjoy a nice meal on restaurant.

name: user_3870
review: Universal studios Singapore is alright, though I felt like it is very small as compared with Universal studios LA. Nice place to spend a day with family.

name: user_3873
review: Super fun. Got tickets online and was granted early entry which was very helpful for wait times

name: user_3874
review: Exquisite place. You can spend a whole day ans even the next day just by going around the park. There is something to do for everyone and person of every age. I loved the far far away. Watched twice. I am scared of heights so no roller coaster for me. I liked the transformers ride. We took monorail which I believe is the only way to get there. The chocolate shops are just great. You can not come out of these shops without spending lots on different types of chocolate. The food is expensive. Best to buy tickets directly from here. The gifts shops have good variety. Ended up buying quite a few t shirts.

name: user_3875
review: I have a mixed opinion. Of course kids will enjoy Jurassik Park or Far far away areas. But the park is very small with not a lot of rides for small children (5 and under). A lot of queues, or you have to purchase the fast past ticket. But in that case, the price is twice !!! And I did not accept that the Park advertises on Minions and Naruto whereas there is no ride at all for these characters. I put 3 stars and not less only for the Waterworld show which is really amazing

name: user_3877
review: Universal Studios Singapore (USS) is a premier theme park located on Sentosa Island, offering visitors a thrilling and immersive entertainment experience. The park is divided into several themed zones, each with its own attractions, shows, and dining options inspired by popular movies and TV shows. One of the standout features of USS is its attention to detail in recreating iconic scenes and environments from beloved films. Whether its the magical world of Harry Potter in the Far Far Away zone or the thrilling rides based on blockbuster movies like Transformers and Jurassic Park, theres something for everyone to enjoy. The live shows and performances, such as the WaterWorld stunt show and the Sesame Street character parade, add to the parks lively atmosphere and entertainment value. While USS offers a world-class entertainment experience, some visitors may find that the park can get crowded, especially during peak seasons, which may result in longer wait times for popular rides and attractions. Additionally, ticket prices and costs for food and merchandise inside the park can add up quickly, making it a relatively expensive outing. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for movie buffs and thrill-seekers alike, offering a mix of exciting rides, immersive themed environments, and live entertainment that promises a fun-filled day for the whole family.

name: user_3878
review: Amazing experience. Must watch Transformer, water show. Loved the place..

name: user_3879
review: Great and Happy Place to Play at any Ages Fun!!!!!!

name: user_3884
review: It's my first time going out of the country and my first going on a theme park in a different country. It's definitely worth the price I paid! It's hot in there but it wasn't a hindrance to enjoy the place. It's just so beautiful and fun. This place is a core memory for me. While the rides are extreme, I did enjoy it despite having motion sickness (I just had drink medicine hour before going there tho.) Overall, it has given me an awesome experience.

name: user_3886
review: Good value for the price of the ticket. Its a full day out and well shaded from the sun. Plenty of family friendly rides.

name: user_3887
review: Im very disappointed Bcz last time go and explore ,everything is running recently go and visit 3 or more places cant explore some is under construction & some maintenance,the ticket is valid one day only 76 Some place cant see and enjoy then why cant less the price or otherwise can remaining before booking tickets some of them coming for 1 month vacation only cant try one more time allso

name: user_3888
review: Entry experience is HORRENDOUS. None of the ticket scanners recognise tickets purchased in advance. 100's of people walking around in heat not knowing how to get in. Staff overwhelmed

name: user_3889
review: Happiness overloaded for family life.

name: user_3890
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating playground where fantasy comes to life, offering an unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. From the moment you step through the iconic arches, you're transported into a world of magic, thrills, and adventure. The park's meticulously themed zones, from the enchanting streets of Hollywood to the futuristic landscapes of Sci-Fi City, immerse you in the worlds of your favorite movies and characters. Whether you're dodging dinosaurs in Jurassic Park or battling villains in Transformers: The Ride, every corner offers a new and exciting adventure. The attention to detail is impeccable, with jaw-dropping attractions, dazzling shows, and interactive experiences that will leave you awestruck. From heart-pounding roller coasters to family-friendly rides, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

name: user_3891
review: It was overcrowded and we had to wait long for every attraction/ride. Sometimes up to 90 minutes.

name: user_3892
review: It's really big so I can see why they come. I was tired of waiting in line for a long time, but when it was my turn to use it, I saw the real beauty of the place. I play all day and it's a shame it closes, but I'm sad about the time I'm allowed to spend.

name: user_3893
review: One of the tourist attractions in the Sentosa Resort area that you must visit if you go to Singapore, there are lots of rides, photo spots, food courts and various entertainment facilities inside. Over all, it's great

name: user_3894
review: Most famous destination in Singapore and Southeast Asia. Free entrance to check in at University Global. Need to buy ticket to entrance the park with many special games. Lego store Singapore is 1 good place to checking in also here.

name: user_3895
review: The roller coaster was fun. The decoration is cute and all, good vibes. However, the weather was hot, some indoor queuing had poor ventilation, and it was hard to breathe. The sweat smell, ew, please shower people

name: user_3896
review: Must try rides and entertainment. We went on a Sunday and didnt face much crowd or long queues. Definitely worth the ticket price!

name: user_3897
review: Very small park with limited attractions. (Note: Ive been to Universal Orlando which is an entirely different experience.) Shopping for Universal gear was plentiful here, and oddly enough there didnt seem to be any crowds considering it was a Friday. For the westerners visiting, the rides are a little clunkier than in the states.

name: user_3898
review: Universal Studios is really a place which you shouldnt miss when youre in Singapore. literally I thought this was for kids before going there, This place is really amazing and gives you thrilling experience. Rides which you will definitely enjoy are as below, Transformer Rides Cynon rollercoaster ride and Human rollercoaster ride Mummy revenge Water show (twice a day) And many more If you are a solo traveller then for every ride you need to wait max for 1-2 mins (youre a VIP without express pass) If in group you need to wait 30 mins to 1 hour for each.

name: user_3899
review: Very lively....Colorful, eye-catching, beautiful. Thai tourists like to come and check in.

name: user_3901
review: Few times closed rides, and after waiting more than 1 hour in line...and that few times and weather is sunny... disapointed

name: user_3903
review: Overall, I had a positive impression of the visit. Pros: Available cafes After 16:00 there are fewer queues You can walk everywhere with a stroller Cons: A rather expensive ticket for such a park Many attractions are under reconstruction Long lines during the day Didn't give me a park map Its not clear what time and where the show is, so we missed a lot Crowds of Indians will not let you take a photo

name: user_3904
review: Lots of game for adults and child

name: user_3906
review: Universal Studios in Singapore is undeniably a must-visit theme park and one of my personal favorites. Every year, without fail, I make it a point to visit, and each time, I'm captivated by the thrilling attractions and immersive experiences. The anticipation for the upcoming Minionland only adds to the excitement, ensuring that every visit to Universal Studios is as thrilling and enjoyable as the last.

name: user_3909
review: Buy express ticket

name: user_3910
review: One must visit this place in lifetime. Wow feel

name: user_3912
review: Perfect for a fun day with the kids. Some great rides and really easy to get to from our hotel.

name: user_3914
review: Nothing can beat this amusement park. 100/100 All activities are worth while. Specially Transformer and Jurassic World

name: user_3919
review: Special day out for the family. Sesame street cookie monster ride was gentle, Transformers was a little more scary and the Jurassic park Teradactyl ride was fun. Is fairly busy - go early.

name: user_3920
review: It's fun. My personal opinion, if you haven't been to Universal yet, I recommend somewhere. There aren't many people, it's worth it, and it's not too big.

name: user_3923
review: The experience at Universal Studios Singapore was somewhat disappointing. Key attractions like the Mummy ride were closed, and the express pass was not accepted for the Jurassic Park canopy ride. Additionally, many of the cooling mist fans previously available in queue areas were not operational, reducing comfort during waits. An incident involving dropped glasses led to the temporary closure of the Sesame Street ride, further limiting available entertainment options. For a superior theme park experience in Asia, I would recommend considering Universal Studios Osaka, which offers more consistent quality and service, or even the Beijing location, which surpasses Singapore in several aspects.

name: user_3925
review: They chose a family who bought tickets after us because they were the first to apply. It's not nice. It doesn't make sense for those who bought internet tickets for Girus to be let in first.

name: user_3926
review: USS is fine. Ive been to one other park, USJ (Universal Studios Japan), and I think USJ was better. We went on a number of rides which were fun but really short. I recommend the Jurassic Park Rapids one - just expect to get soaked. The food was disappointing. We got the fried chicken in Far Far Away - original and laksa. The laksa was not spicy at all and too sweet. The fries were not crunchy. If you have a day to spare and it doesnt cost too much, then USS might be a good place for you.

name: user_3929
review: You need an entire day to cover most things here.

name: user_3932
review: The park has a great selection of rides but is a bit on the small side. Revenge of the Mummy was closed when we were there which is disappointing as it's my favourite universal ride. Shout-out to Sebastian who was fantastic and made out day!

name: user_3933
review: It's just wow. A dream for adults and kids. So many details and the organization is perfect. Go on weekdays if you don't want to wait on the queue or vip pass

name: user_3935
review: Fun for the whole family! The park is not too big, so one day is completely sufficient.

name: user_3939
review: Most amazing place in Singapore must visit with family and friends

name: user_3941
review: Great experience at USS. Trolls were awesome. Worth watching with kids.

name: user_3942
review: Great rides, kids love it. Clean, neat, great decoration, lots of spots to take pictures. Universal express fast pass was worth buying, so you dont have to queue. Food quite expensive, drinks too. But you can refill the drink water at the refill station.

name: user_3943
review: Good place for kids to enjoy the thrill of various ride. Adults can also enjoy these rides as per their choice. The operating hours are less to cover each ride. Jurassic park ride is best here, the shows on the streets is also good. Don't miss the water world show and shrek movie. If you enjoy rollercoaster rides then you will also enjoy transformers rollercoaster, puss in the boots rollercoaster and shrek rollercoaster. Suggestions: browse the park guide to plan your visit to enjoy every ride.

name: user_3945
review: No regrets purchasing the Express Pass. Saved a lot of time from most of the rides..

name: user_3946
review: A unique experience in all as the place is very aesthetic for photos but for rides ,better buy express pass if u want to complete all the rides. If you want to try 2 3 rides and enjoy the setting more ,You can do it with normal pass too.

name: user_3947
review: Each game the queue takes more than 45 minutes. So it forces visitors to buy the express one even though the price difference is large. So if you can play a maximum of 50% of the game, you are already very grateful. Even though the entrance ticket is already expensive... Not value for money and not worth it

name: user_3951
review: Don't forget to download Universal Studios app to get to know about location of rides, waiting time and show time And take priority entry to enter into it 1 hr before everyone else..

name: user_3953
review: Went on March 19, 2024, arrived at 10:30 a.m., took a quick photo of the front and walked in immediately. How to take a bus to the USS from Vivocity. In front of the bus stop, walk to the right and there will be a RWS8 bus stop. Pay cash for 1 per person. It takes about 20 minutes (good savings, get to sit and watch the view on the side of the road). Park at the Casino, walk straight, turn left and go up the escalator to the USS. Price comparison card from Klook Trip and Agoda Klook had a 10% discount so I got it for 1,980 baht, for the child it was 1,480 baht, bought it close to the day of the trip. Check the waiting time for the ride in the Universal SG app. The waiting time is not long, so don't buy Express. There are very few people inside, so you can play Transformer without having to wait in long queues. Then go to Jurassic Ride inside first, there are few people as well. Bags must be deposited in a locker for 4. Bring a raincoat. In conclusion, I didn't wear it and it didn't get as wet as I thought. (But other people were very wet) Played a lot of things. There were hardly any queues. Walking was comfortable. The weather was very hot. Download the app and look at meet&greet times. It helps a lot. Come take photos with the mascots and meet a lot of dinosaurs. Which rides stop being renovated when the park opens? Download the app to check in advance. Last time I played Mummy and almost fainted. I didn't play anything further. This time, I'm taking a break. 555 Enter the Goldilocks restaurant next to Puss in Boots. They don't accept cash. Visa and Mastercard only. You can use youtrip and tap to pay. The food is very expensive, but you can refill soft drinks and unlimited drinks. Sit and fill up the whirlpool until it's worth it. because of the hot weather The cotton candy kiosk next to the mummy requires cards only, no cash accepted. We planned to stay until closing but the children and elderly couldn't handle it. We returned at 4:30 p.m.

name: user_3956
review: This place is worth the money. I enjoyed the rides and appreciate the single lane they have for Revenge of The Mummy. There is a lot of cute stuff to buy in the souvenir store so make sure you set a budget. The rides I enjoyed the most are Canopy Flyer, Puss in Boots' Giant Journey, and Revenge of The Mummy. Better ride Revenge of The Mummy as a test ride if you are thinking of riding the more difficult roller coaster rides.

name: user_3957
review: The a magical world all together...full of fun and frolic ... Great experience all together

name: user_3958
review: Rides are free. The, Mummy is an indoor attraction, but it's dangerous when you lick it!

name: user_3961
review: Great place to spend a day quality time with family, unfortunately for vegetarian foods is tasted awful for something at 16 IMO.

name: user_3962
review: Once in a lifetime experience, a must go destination if you are in Singapore. On weekends/public holiday there are too many people and big-big queues for any ride so my recommendation is going for express ticket else you wouldn't be able to have all the rides or see all the shows in 1 day. If you have normal ticket then it can take even 1 hour to be in queue and just cover 1 ride like transformer. Few rides might have shorter queue but again 30 min is minimum you have to wait for any ride. All the rides are worth going for and will provide you different experience. We could cover 3 rides and 2-3 shows overall in whole day and express ticket could have helped in covering all the rides. Though many rides are for adventurous people as they are either roller coaster or some other high speed rides and not everyone would love to do them so in that case normal tickets will be good enough. Transformer ride is a must go ride and will provide you a thrilling experience, it is a 3D ride and a unique experience, worth waiting for 1 hour in the queue for it. Stunt show was good and should be covered. Jurassic ride (Rapids Adventure I guess) is good but then at the end your clothes get wet so better to carry an additional pair or use rain coats (which is provided, might be at additional cost though). There are good food options inside though a bit costly but then you don't have any choice. You will get normal drinking water inside from taps. It was too hot so do carry sunglasses and caps. Overall a nice experience and recommended.

name: user_3965
review: It is a much smaller park than Universal in Florida and California, but it has good attractions and if you arrive 10 minutes before the gate opens, access is quite quick and the lines are not too long. Then mid-morning it starts to fill up a little.

name: user_3966
review: Universal Studios is an iconic destination that captivates visitors with its immersive entertainment experiences and timeless attractions. From thrilling rides and spectacular shows to behind-the-scenes studio tours, Universal Studios offers something for everyone to enjoy.
