The park's commitment to guest satisfaction and safety ensures a world-class experience for visitors from around the globe. Although the waiting time for the rides is long , its really worthy to give a try.

name: user_3967
review: It's very fun, all the rides are very close and it's easy to play. I will definitely visit again next time. Gift shops, by comparison, are the best and the best in Japan.

name: user_3968
review: Unfortunately minions section still under construction, but yeah u still have lot things to do in here

name: user_3969
review: It was raining that day but the kids still had so much fun!

name: user_3971
review: It was so much fun! Loved it! Feels so satisfied that I could cover almost every rides

name: user_3973
review: It's always fun to be on the USS ride

name: user_3974
review: Universal Studio Singapore is one of the mandatory destinations in Singapore. It's good just to take photos in front of the Globe or take part in the rides. There are not as many USS rides as USJ. But it's still interesting because it's not the same. My favorite is of course Transformers & The Mummy. Queue from early in the morning so it's not crowded when taking photos at Globe.

name: user_3975
review: A visit to universal studios is an absolute must if you are in singapore.It has great selection of entertainment and rides attractions it was an awesome experience everything is so well looked after. Book tickets is advance to avoid long queue.

name: user_3978
review: Love it, nice for holiday with family.

name: user_3979
review: Warning...the ride lines are just too long, be careful not to get stuck in a line you can't get out of (transformers ride in particular), spent most ofthe day in lines, very disappointing overall. Not worth the cost of entry, especially for a family.....nothing like I expected

name: user_3980
review: Our first universal studios visit, and what an amazing experience. Its charm is its compact-ness (at least we liked it since we had a 3.5 year old kid). It has variety of rides for all age groups and we had to go in turns as our daughter couldn't go in some rides. We didn't take the fast pass as we could go in single person lane which was very fast (as we took turns). Food is decent but don't expect much from a theme-park, however sugar loaded desserts like all theme park are really tasty and will keep your adrenaline high. We could cover this park easily in 6-8 hours

name: user_3982
review: Rides are outdated, park is waay too small. Very few adult rides. Beijing jurassic world ride is better than the jurrasic park ride in USS (by a lot). The park is waay to old, need regular upgrades to the rides and themes.

name: user_3985
review: It's a place where you can have a good time. Since it's not available in every country, go here while you can. It's a little expensive but worth it.

name: user_3986
review: Fantastic place. Definitely take the Express Unlimited pass. Must buy!

name: user_3987
review: It's great. It's fun to deal with a little bit, especially the mummy maze.

name: user_3989
review: Nice to play but really small HUMAN, Transformers mummy movie special effects must play The rest is up to you Shrek 4d is also good For shows, I recommend Water World, which is really beautiful and shocking, Cats in Shoes and Swordsman, and Street Dance and Drums in New York. Meet recommends Puss in Shoes, Minions, Transformers, and Sesame Street! It can be said that the fun is over quickly. It is recommended to go on weekdays! There is no need to buy a fast pass express Those who are fast can finish it in half a day (for fun only)

name: user_3991
review: Select weekday for your visit, reach as early as possible if you are staying in sentosa siloso beach resort recommend & free route to USS - take siloso beach shuttle & reach beach station from there take mono rail and het down at resorts island(USS) I dont recommend express pass if its a weekday visit, waiting time for single riders will be less than 5mins in majority of the rides utilise that and save time. Travel light, I recommend not to carry DSLR camera carry water bottle and a poncho If you are travelling with a kid it is advised to bring a stroller Vegetarian food only available in oasis near the mummy returns ride. Umbrella or a poncho will be helpful if it rains ( most of the USS area has shelter)

name: user_3992
review: Buy tickets online to enter hassle free. We had an amazing day even though it rained for 5hrs. On this day, there was also no need for the express pass. We (2 adults , 2kids) entered each and every attraction at least once, both big rollercoasters and the water world show twice, all within 8hrs.

name: user_3999
review: (Experience, visited long time ago) It's about the same since my last visit more than a decade before. Although the standard about the same, which means good job for maintaining it. But I certainly hope USS can be more innovative and improve the facilities instead. Really hope to see new park or perhaps new games in the same park. (Tips) Recommended to enter as early as possible so that you can enjoy all the rides as some rides queue time might vary, 5min to average 30min, or sometimes to 120min per ride. Express addon is more than double than normal ticket, but if you want to fully enjoy all rides, consider it. Locker is free to use (with certain quota limit like first 40min is free) and available everywhere. Bring tumbler or water bottle as you can refill it at almost all restrooms area where there's drinking water machine. Food is slightly more expensive, given it's tourist spot, but quality is there. Fair. Download apps, check the special showtime and plan your tour so that you can catch the best show. Bring light raincoat if you want to play water games and avoid purchase expensive raincoat on the spot. Staffs most of them are friendly and helpful. Just remember to smile and ask them nicely. They been repeatedly doing the same thing over and over might get bored sometimes.

name: user_4000
review: We loved the place! I would recommend buying universal express tickets if you hate 60 minutes waiting time for each ride

name: user_4001
review: Enjoy the rides from morning. Before going around, it's best to go for a week with your family and children every day to go for a little jog so you can enjoy all the rides more.

name: user_4002
review: This is a has to be a put it on your list kinda thing. We had just been at Hong Kong Disney 2 days prior, so it lacked atmosphere and magic by comparison, but was still pretty cool. There is a good range of coaster which we loved, some lesser easier rides. Food prices were ok, not rediculous. We did meet and greets with Bumble Bee and Megatron which was a lot of fun. We went over to Sentosa on the Monorail out of Vivo City Shopping Centre. That was cheap and so easy. It ain't no Disney, but it's still very cool and a must do.

name: user_4003
review: Must to see... without any recommendations. The place is well maintained and planned miraculously well. The rides are awesome as well as the food and beverages. Do not miss it when you visit Singapore. TAKE THE EXPRESS PASS... will save a lot of time

name: user_4005
review: We have wasted more than a hour at Jurassic Park - water boat. Service disturbing happens many times. Under exhausted weather, the announcement for many titles are repeating. The service should be worth enough for the money you taken.

name: user_4006
review: Most of the rides are roller coaster types. Enjoyed.

name: user_4007
review: Good place..lots to walk.good footwear & umbrella is a must unless u r thickskin literally. Every ride has a more than 1 hour wait.& 2 rides wer cancelled by the time our turn came due to technical fault in the ride.Dats dangerous cant take a chance. Basically go look around take pics Eat/ drink if u can.For rides..wait whole day 1 after the otherQ. One visit is fine.Dont bring parents if old & difficulty walking.Small kids can b managed in a pram/ trolley.

name: user_4008
review: Ill be the first to admit that Im a huge theme park fan, so when planning to visit Singapore, Universal Studios was an absolute must visit. The theme park is on Sentosa Island, which is about 30 minutes from Marina Bay, and is very easy to get to. I was using a GoCity Singapore pass to get entry, so you simply redeem the pass on the GoCity website and you get a ticket emailed directly to you - you simply then proceed to the turnstiles with no wait. The park itself felt both familiar and different which I loved. You knew you were in a Universal park as it had lots of flagship rides, restaurants and attractions, but there were also lots of unique additions that you wouldnt find anywhere else too. We started our day on the parks 2 biggest roller coasters - Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs CYLON. HUMAN is the side where you sit down and it doesnt loop, whilst CYLON is a suspended roller coaster with 3 loops. Both were surprisingly thrilling and fun, and were a real highlight of our visit. Some of the parks other fantastic attractions include the jawsome Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, which was an absolute soaker of a river rapids, Revenge of the Mummy, a thrilling launched roller coaster with some epic theming, and the incredible Transformers: The Ride, a thrilling 3:D dark ride. Theres loads for all the family to do at the park, my particular highlights were the hilarious Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chace, which was a rather bonkers ride and the land of Far Far Away was brilliant. Im not the biggest Shrek fan but still found the whole area very amusing. Theyre also getting ready to open a Minions Land which will add even more. We also caught Waterworld, their amazing stunt show, which always impresses me even though Ive seen it in Universal Hollywood - its not to be missed. We went mid-week out of school holidays and it was still busy, but did quieten down for the last 2 hours. The queues for the biggest rides more than halved in the last hour. We did buy Express Passes which we did online in advance, and I found them very reasonably priced for the amount of queues we skipped. We spent from around 10am until 5pm at the park, and covered most things multiple times with our Express Pass. I throughly enjoyed my day at Universal Studios Singapore, its a great theme park with lots to do, some great entertainment and a really vibrant atmosphere. If youre planning a visit to Singapore I would highly recommend a visit!

name: user_4009
review: Bad toilet services

name: user_4010
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers an exhilarating blend of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and immersive experiences. From the adrenaline-pumping roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica to family-friendly attractions like Madagascar: A Crate Adventure, there's something for everyone. The attention to detail in the themed zones, such as Hollywood, New York, and Ancient Egypt, is impressive. However, crowds can be overwhelming, especially during peak times. Overall, it's a must-visit destination for theme park enthusiasts looking for a fun-filled day of adventure. Purchasing VIP tickets at Universal Studios Singapore is definitely worth considering if you want to skip the queues and enjoy a more exclusive experience. With VIP access, you'll receive priority boarding on rides, reserved seating at shows, and personalized guided tours of the park. It's an excellent option for those who want to make the most out of their visit without spending too much time waiting in lines.

name: user_488
review: I've been to USJ in Japan and USS is far different from Japanese one. USS's attractions were thrilling and fantastic. You can enjoy there only in 5 hours or so.

name: user_4013
review: Poor you at this attraction, only 1 staff to process checking, scan, checking again, then operate, after that checking again. Why don't you add more staf. Its not worth to wait almost 1 hous only for game like this. Special line also make customer confuse.

name: user_4014
review: Overhyped place. Wait times are too big and attractions are not much exciting. If you are going on group then get express pass for some people before visit. It is a waste of money to buy express pass for all. Express pass purchase from park will be at higher cost and price will increase as day progresses. There is an early entry pass,use it to experice rides without wait. At evening and certain time wait times will come down. Use the universal Singapore app to know it live. Use of this app is highly recommended. If you don't like Malay type food then do not plan to eat in discover food court. Use the one near revenge of mummy or Mel's diner. Your shoe and dress will get wet in rapids. Remove shoes. It can rain so carry umbrella or poncho

name: user_4015
review: A MUST VISIT WHEN YOU GO TO SINGAPORE. Universal studios has a wide range of rides including roller coasters & other shows that are fun to watch. There are rides and shows for every age group, right from the 5 year old to 85 years old. For kids under the age of 5, it may not be a great place to visit if rides is the purpose of visit. Most of the rides require a minimum height which mostly comes after the age of 5. Universal studios itself is a great place to check out if you have small kids and/or you are not so keen for rides. Do carry your caps and a water bottle (If you do not want to buy water after every ride LOL) to protect yourself from all the heat and to keep the body hydrated.

name: user_4016
review: Without the Express pass the wait times get quite long and express pass holders are given full prioritization. Also in comparison to other amusement parcs the price is quite high and the rides are not super special. It is nice, but I probably would probably invest my time somewhere else next time.

name: user_4017
review: Came here on weekdays, happy that I did't take much time for queue. Still my fav amusement park in SEA

name: user_4018
review: An awesome place for a family experience. A must go if you are an Anim fan..the latest addition to the park.

name: user_4019
review: I came here because the tickets were bought faster online. I can compare it because I was once in a similar park in Bilund, Denmark. Despite the middle of the week and early hours, there were a lot of people and few attractions. Big queues for the roller skates, the water roller skater, the one with mummies and the biggest one, it takes almost an hour to stand there the fun is probably only really for children aged 3-15 I was a bit disappointed because the photos seem to show big attractions but that's not really the case.

name: user_4021
review: Universal Studios Singapore in Sentosa is a world-class theme park that brings the excitement of Hollywood to life. Packed with thrilling rides, interactive shows, and themed zones featuring iconic movies and television series, it's a place where families and friends can create unforgettable memories. From battling dinosaurs in Jurassic Park to soaring through the skies on the Transformers ride, there's something for everyone. To maximize your experience and avoid long queues, especially during peak seasons, an Express Pass is highly recommended. It allows you to skip the regular lines for most attractions, ensuring you have more time to explore the park and soak in the beautiful atmosphere.

name: user_4022
review: must visit place with family and friends when in singapore

name: user_4023
review: SO FUN!! I tried some of the roller coasters and it was scary but super fun! I recommend this place if ur going on a vacation with ur family!

name: user_4025
review: Great ride and attractions but unless u have express pass which is expensive the queue time is 40 to 1hour for a 5 mins ride or less. It's like 90% walking and waiting and 10% ride. What you really pay here is waiting not the ride. There are less attractions also for kids under 90cm which is kinda disappointing since we came here hoping kids will enjoy

name: user_4026
review: If you have nowhere else to go, it's worth going at least once. However, since it is small and crowded, it would be better to go early or late if possible.

name: user_4028
review: Very fun, the service staff are very good and friendly. Worth the money spent, good and clean players, really like it.

name: user_4031
review: The whole theme park is fire, one of the best places to visit in Singapore. The transformers was extremely nice, and made me feel immersed in that augmented world.

name: user_4032
review: We had a wonderful experience in this park because there were not many people. However, this park remains quite small for a Universal (if there are not many people, the morning is enough for you to do everything several times). In terms of food, I strongly advise you to take your picnic because there is not much and the prices are high.

name: user_4033
review: Buy express ticket if you dont want to wait or have very little time.. dubly expensive..

name: user_4034
review: We were looking forward to seeing Minions coming in 2024, but they said it would open in May, so please take note. When we took the cable car, we didn't know that we had hiked up the mountain and got on it, but was it Vichy City? You can get on and off there too, so keep that in mind. I went on the weekend and there weren't many people, so I don't think I had to wait even 5 minutes for the ride.

name: user_4036
review: Most remarkable were transformers for sure. We had to wait for 75 minutes but it was totally worth it.

name: user_4038
review: Revisit after 7 years I entered at 9 o'clock (purchase early admission ticket express), came out at 4 o'clock, and enjoyed most of the rides and parade!!

name: user_4039
review: Small but good place , if you are going for the first time. If you can spend, definitely buy an express pass, which is 100 SGD more. (Normal ticket is 83 SGD) Or you can plan your trip after 2 pm. In the evening, the rush is less and you spend very little time , waiting for rides

name: user_4040
review: Had a lots of fun

name: user_4043
review: Extremely crowded and since most of it is open the heat is a spoiler! Rides were good but wait time is over 30mins for most rides!! Advisable to buy an Express ticket!

name: user_4044
review: Its a nice place, too but there are some attractions that were closed off. What a bad timing. What i liked the most are the rides. Careful though some are not fitted for others who has a weak heart

name: user_4045
review: Mixed experience - was initially disappointed at not being able to buy unlimited express pass but it became unnecessary around 2.30 pm. Has only 2/3 rides that are "thrilling", my kids kept going back to Cylon. Tip (if you're a tourist and visiting the park on a weekday) - try going late (i.e., after noon) rather than early; I suspect many people (for instance, the ones with infants) leave the park by then so it becomes much less crowded.

name: user_4046
review: Cylon is the best ride for thrill seekers, and human a close second. otherwise lots of fun less intense rides which are more experiential like transformers, mummy etc.

name: user_4047
review: This place is amazing,One day full time enjoyments.Games, shows,3d Shows,4d Shows ,water games. Photo's clicking places vintage cars and restaurants all are superb ...

name: user_4049
review: This is a very fun place! I really enjoyed the rides and attractions. Water fountains are available within the facility. The shows are also fun and so entertaining! We got to enjoy almost all of the rides even though we do not have an express pass. I lost my phone in the shrek 4d but I was able to retrieve it thanks to the all the very accommodating staffs. Kudos to the team!

name: user_4050
review: You can play a lot of things without buying a quick pass. Especially at three or four in the afternoon when there is no one around, you can play it several times. Since there are not many rides, you can actually finish it in almost half a day.

name: user_4051
review: Wonderful experience. Must visit place. Only the thing is we won't get much vegan foods here.

name: user_4052
review: Marvelous place for fun and enjoy the rides.

name: user_4055
review: 2 rides were closed. Only two rides are really thrilling and all other are waste rides among a total of 14 odd rides at 6 stations. Over all I felt it's just the hype created to attract tourists. Warner Bros at Abu Dhabi is way far better in all aspects. Half of the universal studios is filled with shops to purchase things and toys. Even wonderla at Bangalore is much better in terms of inclusions among thrilling rides. Burnt over a hundred dollars per person with poor satisfaction.

name: user_4057
review: Early entry 1 hour. Express ticket It was a wonderful time spent in Universal Studio Singapore. We went on Saturday. We purchased tickets from the official website because it was mentioned that you can do an early entry of 1 hour for which a couple of rides would be available. We had two rides available early including Transformer. We didn't even use our Express pass. No queue at 9 am. Then we went straight at Jurassic Park and Mummy rides without Express ticket. Don't miss Transformer Don't miss the stunt show - reach early Express Ticket is not required if you go on weekdays or non-festival weekend After 5 pm, there is no queue. Food expensive, we had ice-cream which was great. We took some food inside as well. Ride safety - A Thriller rides - Cyclon and Mummy and Transformer. Imagica and Magic mountain have more thrilling rides

name: user_4058
review: More than 1 hour wait time at almost every ride. Not worth the effort of standing in queue for so long. Management should only allow the right number of visitors that they can manage. Absolutely pathetic experience. I would not recommend this place even if tickets are offered for free.

name: user_4059
review: It has a great selection of attractions, entertainment, and rides for families to explore. There are a total of 24 attractions, of which 18 are original or specially adapted for the park. The park consists of seven themed zones which surround a lagoon. The best time to visit would definitely have to be on the off-peak days, which are usually the weekdays. The crowds are lesser on these days, the chances of shorter queues for the rides are definitely higher. 1-Day Admission Ticket (Super Peak): S 92.00. [ADD-ON] Express Pass - Single Pass: S 87.50. The wait times are around 90 minutes and the park is open for about 7-8 hours. They sells one-day pass tickets and express tickets. A regular ticket would cost you 76 when you buy on the day itself. However, it is highly recommended that you book your tickets online, mainly because it's cheaper and you won't have to queue! Generally, most visitors spend a full day at the park, which can range from 8 to 12 hours. However, if you want to experience everything the park has to offer or plan to visit during peak season, you may want to consider allocating two days for your visit. Sentosa is open on all days including public holidays between 9 A.M -10 P.M. One is allowed to enter 30 minutes before closing time. - Visitors are not permitted to stay on the island unless they are staying in Cove or any hotels located on the island.

name: user_4061
review: Went on a weekday, didn't wait long in line, got to play almost everything. Taking a Grab from the hotel is not expensive.

name: user_4062
review: I have been coming here for many times and the last visit was the most disappointing. Very unwelcoming experience at the ticket gantry. No smiles and no greetings. Didn't give us clear instructions as we have kids with us. She clearly did not communicate to us properly. She told us that we will.go inside one by one but then we were pushing the kart so the child could go in but stopped us and asked the mother to wait. All instructions should be clearly stated before scanning our tickets. The moment we came in, there is this lady who stopped us the scan the tickets the second time round. Why waste our time scanning 2x? It's very annoying because she chose our group to scan the tickets the 2nd time round when in fact, she does not do it to other groups. Is this a new system where you guys do random checking? For what? It threw off the experience. It's very unwelcoming. Very unwelcoming experience.

name: user_4063
review: Smaller version of California universal studios

name: user_4064
review: Amazing experience ..!! Would recommend to all visiting this when in Singapore especially the rides are fun Suggest taking express pass to cover maximum rides and have more fun

name: user_4067
review: Love the experience... :) minion land is on the way.. im excited

name: user_4068
review: It opens at 10 o'clock. The triple clock says 11 o'clock, but don't be fooled and go on time. Because there are few people, there is no need for fast track. You can go in early and enjoy it, then come out and see Sentosa Island and then return.

name: user_4074
review: BOOKING: We visited it on a Friday after booking tickets 1 week in advance through the app KLOOK. To enter, we simply scanned the QR code in the ticket. There was no checking of our bags. ENVIRONMENT: The roads are spacious and full of greenery. The shops and rides look new and clean, and the decor is adorable. Most rides have canopies/coverage with plentiful fans when lining up. RIDES: One land was closed for renovation when I went, so there were 12 rides and 8 shows in the park. My personal favourites are: - Mummy Ride: A roller coaster with a great balance between storyline, atmosphere and simply a good rollercoaster. - Shrek 4D Adventure: A 4D movie whose storyline happens after the SHREK 1 movie. The aircon and chairs are very comfortable and great for relaxing after walking around in the heat. - MELS: A 3-person performance of the greatest pop hits in history. A small scale show on the streets but very fun and energetic. FOOD: There are 8 restaurants and some food carts scattered around the park. Most sell fast food, noodles and some local dishes. Snacks and drinks cost around 8-10 SDG, AND dishes cost around 15-20 SDG. MY OPINION: A fun park with great theming. Its kept clean and safe, and I especially appreciate the enthusiastic attitudes of the staff working there. However, it is a relatively small park (we went on 90% of the rides in one day on a Friday). I think adding more large-scale dance performances would make it more fun.

name: user_4076
review: Super easy to get to via MRT and you can just use your credit card and tap to go to Sentosa Express. If you can, come as soon as they're open whether it's a weekday. We visited on a Thursday and entered the park at 10.30am and the wait was already 30-50 minutes on the roller coasters (transformer, mummy and human). Water refill station was everywhere, so make sure to stay hydrated! Food options was plenty so you can choose whatever your want. We didn't get to take photos with so many characters as we were waiting in line for the rides.

name: user_4077
review: I remember it being difficult because there were so many people and it was so hot;; Although it is small, it seems like a worthwhile place. If you go diligently, you can try many different rides. The rides are definitely very fun, and the shows are of very high quality. If you work hard, you won't waste money I don't know if the kids are older, but it seems a bit difficult for younger kids. I think it's good that they put the express service in first

name: user_4078
review: Had a great time here with a journey back tou childhood. Come early if you want to avoid the long waiting lines at some places. Wear good walking shoes. Food and water is quite expensive inside the USS. We also rented a stroller for our daughter, that came handy. Overall a great experience. Be ready to spend about 6-7 hours inside

name: user_4079
review: I went on a weekday so there was very little queue for most of the games. Prepare a plastic raincoat at home in advance so you don't get your clothes wet. If you buy a raincoat at the counter, the price is 6 sgd :))) or a dry one, the price is 5 sgd.

name: user_4082
review: We visited Singapore during Christmas/New year. A lil expensive during this time of the year but worth it! Universal Studios at Singapore...we purchased tickets online to avoid queue. They have a few sections lesser as compared to US, but a great way to spend a fun day in Singapore! Specially for a Hollywood geek like us! Few new adventures are upcoming like minions land etc. Food options are quite good.

name: user_4084
review: Must visit for all ages. Lot of rides, shows and meetups.

name: user_4088
review: We visited universal studios Singapore on a weekday so we didn't take the express pass as it was less crowded. We reached at 9:30 am and after entering started with the cyclone n human ride wait time for that was 10 mins later did other rides. Must try Rides: Cyclone n Human Mummy Transformer

name: user_4090
review: Fun place....go with friends and family. A bit over hyped as I liked Universal at Florida better.If possible do buy express tickets as wait time was too long.Buy tickets online as you get very good deals.and are cheaper

name: user_4091
review: Outside food not allowed unless it's kept inside the bag and they won't see it. Drinks are allowed. Bring fan. There are rides that do not allow bags inside but there are lockers you can use.

name: user_4092
review: Half of the rides were roller coasters. Not suitable for kids below 12. Most parents were just waiting outside. It was hot, occupied seating area and no air conditioning in some places. The water cooler wasnt even cold. What I like the most was the efficiency of each ride. Great scenery and surrounding. Will I go for the 2nd time. I dont think so. They should add variety of rides and entertainment.

name: user_4093
review: Having been visited other such places, I strongly suggest not to rush it up on various events. It's completely mad house during initial entry hours but gets easier later on the day. Places where we took 45-50mins in waiting during the morning time were easily done during second half of the day. Although in comparison to other places here there is less to exploit, hence comfortable. Kids will certainly enjoy it. Transformers is the best.

name: user_4097
review: Although it is small, it has everything it needs

name: user_4098
review: An amazing place to spend the day at in Singapore! Plenty of rides and you can easily do it in a day so no need to book multiple park days. Food options are good I would recommend the shrek waffle and burgers at Mel's drive In, in the New York bit. Rides vary from ones for little kids to big rollercoasters. I decided to try the battlestar galactica human coaster and it was really good as well as revenge of the mummy both I would highly recommend. If you have the extra cash to spend buy an express pass it is a lifesaver when it comes to skipping the queues especially for Battlestar galactica.

name: user_4099
review: It's a very good place. Must visit. Only recommendation is to not buy photos from here as they are very expensive.

name: user_4100
review: The park is small, and there are almost no queues for the game facilities on weekdays. You can play it all in one day. Sesame Street campus is so cute.

name: user_4103
review: Eygptian character is really turn off as you stood 10 cm from one kids face. Many attractions are having technical issue. If the ticket is cheap is okay, the fare is expensive

name: user_4104
review: Thrilling rides, fun shows & characters brought to life! Great for all ages. Expect crowds with long queues, especially weekends. Prices can be high for food & drinks. Overall, a fantastic & unforgettable experience!

name: user_4105
review: Francis, a staff at the minion store, are very friendly and professional. Waterworld show is spectacular and amazing. We enjoyed a lot! Wonderful place to spend a day with kids.

name: user_4108
review: A visit to Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute must if you're in Singapore! Be sure to set aside a full day for this adventure, especially if you're planning to visit on a weekend. My friend and I went on a Saturday and, yes, some rides did have queues longer than 30 minutes, but trust me, it's all worth it! The rides are incredibly exciting and packed with fun. To make the most of your visit, I highly recommend downloading the Universal Studios app. It helps you keep track of waiting times for each ride and the show timings, ensuring you can plan your day efficiently. Two experiences that stood out for us were the Transformers ride and the Water World show absolutely thrilling! Overall, Universal Studios Singapore offers an amazing day out for all ages. Highly recommended for an unforgettable adventure in Singapore!

name: user_4112
review: The most fun my kids and I have had recently! The rides are amazing and we went back over and over for our favourite rides. I recommend getting the Express or Express Unlimited pass to skip the queues and maximise your time there. If you don't have young kids and want to enjoy the best rides, go anti-clockwise for the best ones. The Mummy was our favourite ride followed closely by Transformers and the Roller Coasters. Go early and get there at opening time to minimise wait time.

name: user_4114
review: Some good rides like Battlestar Galactica Human/Cylon, the Mummy, Transformers. A section of the park was closed so it seemed a bit small.

name: user_4115
review: Second visit. I bought my ticket in advance on KKday. Seven years ago, I was able to ride most of the attractions in about 4 hours, but it was twice as crowded. If you don't have a Fast Bus, you'll only get your turn once every three times, so if you really want to ride, it might be better to buy one. For thrilling attractions, you must leave your luggage in a locker. Free within 90 minutes. I boarded a ride that had a 40-minute wait sign, but since I didn't have a FastPass, I waited for over 90 minutes, and my wallet was in the locker. There was an incident where I was unable to vacate the room even though I had to pay. (I borrowed the card from a friend who didn't go on the attraction) The locker fee I paid at that time was 10. . . I was really happy with the minions in the character greetings.

name: user_4116
review: Waterworld show was excellent. There is a lot of concrete in the park, makes it extra hot

name: user_4117
review: Don't go, kids, to Universal parks. At the end of the line you'll grow old

name: user_4119
review: The rides were great, my wife and I had an awesome time

name: user_4120
review: The staff at the rides were particularly helpful, as my husband had injured his foot and was using crutches. Its a shame the park is currently being redeveloped (Madagascar section closed) plus some other activities were closed eg climbing wall in Jurassic Park section.

name: user_809
review: 1/4th of the park is closed, and only 1 ride is available in the Egypt section. We also encountered 3 times of technical difficulties during our queue, made us waste a lot of time waiting in line with uncertainty of when the ride will open again. The park was not very crowded but due to these 2 issues, we had to wait 60-70 mins just for a 1 minute ride.

name: user_4122
review: The park is not big If you are in a hurry, you can enter the park between 10:00 and 4:00 pm to enjoy most of the facilities, but the store products are highly repetitive. Recommend Shrek 4D Cinema

name: user_4123
review: Always enjoy this place! Sea aquarium is the best! We are falling in love underwater world here The main tank is huge and plenty of large displays with a wide variety of fish, the many kind of sharks tank with stingrays and the fantastic displays of eels.

name: user_4124
review: Great amusement park with digital attractions. The thing is. .you have to wait for the long line but you can purchase their easy access ticket for a smooth queue experience.

name: user_4130
review: If you are visiting USS, make sure you buy Universal Express Pass as there is huge disparity between general ticket holders and express pass holders. The waiting time for most of the rides today was 60-90 minutes for general ticket holders. I could complete only 7 rides between 10:30 to 7pm. The Human and Cylon Battlestar rides are no good in comparison with Dubai adventure park rides.

name: user_4132
review: Our first time visiting Universal Studios Singapore, located at the center of Sentosa Island, one of the must-visit destinations for travelers in Singapore. Making our way to the park was really easy, thanks to the convenient Sentosa Express. Upon arrival, we discovered that while Universal Studios Singapore may be quite small, it is filled with a variety of amazing attractions, thrilling rides, and astonishing shows. We booked the Fast Pass Tickets, which helped us maximize our time by skipping queues so we could enjoy most of the attractions throughout the day. Of all the attractions, The Battlestar Galactica: CYLON is our favorite, an adrenaline-pumping roller coaster that transported us to another dimension with its speed and thrills. The park's size proved to be both good and bad at the same time. On one hand, it allowed us to enjoy every attraction in a single day; however, on the other hand, it paled in comparison to larger Universal Studios complexes we had previously visited. Nevertheless, our time at Universal Studios Singapore was nothing short of fantastic. From start to finish, we relished every moment and departed with cherished memories of our adventure on Sentosa Island.

name: user_4133
review: Went on a Tuesday and there were very short lines for the attractions. Park was a bit smaller than I had anticipated but was still fun.

name: user_4134
review: Great place to have fun, with nice attractions and family-friendly

name: user_4136
review: The best experience in Singapore. Extremely good and thrilling rides like Cyclone, Human,etc. In one of the rides they turn you upside down 5 times and your fear will go away. Also the rides are very safe and kids (7 years ) are allowed in almost every ride where they consider the height. The transformers ride and Jurassic world is amazing. Tickets should be booked in advance. In the rides the maximum waiting time on a weekend was 25-30 minutes even though they say 40 minutes. Many shops were there for buying candies, Starbucks, Souvenir store which were very overpriced just because Universal Studio was written in them. The souvenir shop will lead you to the road of poverty. The staff was friendly. You will need to spend at least 7-8 hours to explore it fully. Some restaurants are also there inside including an Indian restaurant. The palace in the beginning is good for taking pictures. Also the mummy ride was very good. All rides were open except the Water World Show. Overall a good experience for all ages.

name: user_4137
review: Do come planning by having advance booking of tickets and try to reach before 10:00am to cover all the rides and complete the Universal Studio in a day .time is 10:00am to 07:00pm. May fluctuate depending upon weather.please confirm one day prior.

name: user_4140
review: What an awesome experience, everything is so well looked after. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Not a single rude person anywhere. So much better than any Disneyland. Everything was fairly reasonably priced and the waits werent long at all, even with it being Easter weekend.

name: user_4142
review: If you love adventure rides and you have seen universal studio movies, you will definitely enjoy this attraction. We paid tickets online and all rides were free and part of the main ticket. However, the purchase of food and the merchandise stores within the studio would cost extra. Our top attractions were - Battlestar galactic (rollercoaster) Transformers ride Mummy ride (little scary) Shrek 4D (my parents loved this) Jurassic Park Waterworld show ( do not miss this - sit in first row for full experience - you might get wet ) ! Definitely worth visiting!

name: user_4143
review: It's smaller than Japan's Univer. It was easier and more fun to play while avoiding crowded places.

name: user_4145
review: This people's who run universal studio is big thief they looting hard earn money in long que at every ride

name: user_4149
review: Amazing place to send with friends and family!!

name: user_4151
review: 202403 Universal Studios, which is mainly based on American IP, has quite fun facilities! But I'm not too interested in IP. I only visited two facilities and indoor dining before leaving. Overall, it's still worth visiting!

name: user_4152
review: Small but beautiful paradise, very fun

name: user_4153
review: We were there on a Thursday. It was extremely busy and without the express tickets we would have had to queue for at least an hour for each ride. The express tickets cost 120SGD per person, without which it would have been unthinkable for us. The park is not particularly big and the rides are mediocre. All in all, the park is just too small for what it costs. We also noticed that after around 2 p.m. the waiting times at the rides go down significantly. Maybe come a little later and save yourself the express tickets!!!

name: user_4155
review: Went one one ride which had a sign up saying 20 minute wait. Ended up taking 1 hour 20 , and nothing is worth queuing this long. Unfortunately you don't realise that there are different chambers of the que, so keep hoping you are near the front only to find out you're not. It ruined the day. If you are going here and want to do rides, you should really pay for the express pass - or don't go.

name: user_4156
review: Amazing place... Everything in one place.. We enjoyed it a lot ... Love it

name: user_4157
review: Visited on weekday. Waiting time to the top rides was up to 100 min. If you have possibility - buy express pass, even better to get unlimited. We took 2-3 rides on each top ride as cylon, human, mummy, transformers and one time on every other ride. If you can not buy express pass - try to get ro the ride during Waterworld show (1 p.m, 4.30 p.m). If express pass is not available online, recommend to go on 09:00, take photo of Universal globe, grab a coffee and buy express pass on the counter at the left.

name: user_4159
review: It's very nice. We have a lot of fun. Many tourist took pictures and videos. I recommend to all tourist.

name: user_4162
review: Very nice place. To come here you can have a snack, you can take the MRT, you can also take the cable car

name: user_4164
review: I bought express pass and it was the right decision!

name: user_4165
review: Great way to spend a day in Singapore! We had a lot of fun, that different rides and shows were really thrilling. Definitely go to the Water World show and do the Cylon and Transformers rides. We went on a Wednesday so not too many people (longest we waited was maybe 50min). Heard from others that its pretty small compared to other Universal Worlds but we still had a great time!

name: user_4167
review: A must-go to the Transformed Gold and Steel Realm

name: user_4168
review: Awesome place to visit just like any USS but here in Singapore its a different atmosphere that is a great experience for everyone. I enjoyed everything even though Im not much a roller coaster rider as when in youth. I did do the Mummy experience and it was a bit rough for me but nice experience and the transformer wax good but I got dizzy. The food is plentiful and many different choices. Great pictures to take throughout the park. If going to the casino you need your passport. Definitely check it out.

name: user_4171
review: Compared to USJ, it's incredibly less crowded. I was able to experience the attraction comfortably and enjoyed it! Maximum waiting time was 30 minutes.

name: user_4173
review: Good place to visit with family. Lots to do!

name: user_4174
review: A mist visit when in Singapore! We got express passes, but apparently, if you just come early enough, it is not needed. Make sure to experience Transformers the Ride and The Mummy. And around the afternoon, take note of the schedule for Waterworld. Everything else, you can experience without the need of Express Pass.

name: user_4175
review: So much fun to have a lot variations of rides, shows and choices of restaurants and snacks. Souvenir outlets are also very exciting. This is the second time to USS. Will back again someday if I visit Singapore again.

name: user_4176
review: Amazing experience. It brings out the hidden kid inside you. Stefan Spielberg light show, transformers ride etc are a must to do activities.

name: user_4177
review: Don't dare to play the roller coaster. Hehehe

name: user_4178
review: Extd really first time here. Will come back again if I go to SG next year Hopefully Minion will be there soon

name: user_4180
review: Amazing theme park experience..must for all ages

name: user_4181
review: The reissued Universal Studios Singapore is located in the Langtaosha Resort. Although it has been open for a few years, the maintenance level of the park is very online, and the experience of tourist facilities is equally impressive. The catering facilities are convenient, not too much better than Shanghai Disneyland, and there are no unpleasant memories of the food being too unpalatable. The only bug is the ticket price. Due to the exchange rate of Singapore currency against RMB, the price of the ticket speed pass is actually not cheap, but it is still worth it.

name: user_4183
review: With 18 attractions created or redesigned for Singapore, Universal Studios SingaporeTM promises an experience that you will not forget. Laughter and screams are heard around every corner, and lasting memories are made every day. Themed dining and shops are available. UNIVERSAL STUDIOS, UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE, Universal Globe logo, and all Universal elements and related indicia TM & Universal Studios. All Rights Reserved.

name: user_4184
review: 5 star for accelerating, thrilling and visual experience. We opted for Express tickets and entry to each ride was breeze. Mummy ride was scintillating, Transformer was superb, Roller coaster having two type of rides and both are adrenaline gushing. Trust me, it won't leave you boring. Going with normal tickets can be painfully slow on getting to this rides due to waiting time of as high as 45-60 mins and you may not be able to cover all the rides in a subtle day.

name: user_4185
review: Visited on Monday, it was busy but a great visit. Bought tickets online prior to going which was easy. Also highly recommend buying an express pass to help bypass the long queues at popular attractions. Bring your water bottle as you can fill it inside the park. You will need about 5-6 hours to cover the entire park.

name: user_4186
review: Warning for parents, whether it's a weekend or a weekday, this place will be packed no matter what time you go. The line at transformers literally took 1hr 30mins on a Monday at 11am (got to ride at 12.30pm). Queues are ridiculously long and some rides are definitely not worth it. Best advice is to save up and spend on the express pass, if possible. Otherwise, don't bother. You may be able to squeeze in 2 rides every 2-3hours....plus its hot and humid to add to the experience...

name: user_4188
review: 100% worth every amount of time and money spent! Would recommend hydrating a lot throughout the day, especially if you're visiting during the summers and maybe carry a few extra tees. Must do the transformers ride, the Spielberg show, the waterworld show, the Jurassic park ride amongst everything

name: user_4189
review: It was awesome with the VR roller coasters and shows that happened all day. I Would recommend everyone to not miss the ancient Egypt roller coaster and transformers ride .The ticket price is worth it but the good prices were 2 to 4 times the price outside so if you can try carrying some light food. It is place where it is very hot and during the summer so don't forget to hydrate and have funn.

name: user_4190
review: Loved the rides especially Transformers, plus Waterworld Stunt Show was very good.

name: user_4191
review: It's smaller than Japan and easier to get around. Since it was a weekday, I thought I wouldn't need the express bus, but it was fine at first, but by the afternoon it was getting pretty crowded, so I had to buy an extra bus inside the park.

name: user_4192
review: Wonderful service at the fairy godmother store! Rizuan and Aizy were very helpfulful in finding the hat that I want! Cheers!

name: user_4193
review: We bought unlimited pass as it was a weekend and wanted to not miss out on anything. Its a great place to be ! We were all adults and enjoyed all rides and theatrics, can only imagine the joy this place would bring to a kid ! We slowly worked our way up to Galactica and Ceylon by getting on to all other available rides first. The Egyptian ride felt underrated as there were not many in the queue though it was a great one. Transformers was brilliant! Loved shrek 4d too. I was in awe when I saw the water on the other side in Lights, cinema and action ! It felt surreal ! There was a performance by group of artists in a theatre with the most lively and bright decor I have ever been to ! A great message delivered through the show! We covered treasure hunt for the sake of it ! Nothing much there but still good to tick it off. Things to take note of: 1. if you are in heavy clothing like jeans that do not dry faster, advisable to purchase a raincoat to prevent your clothes from getting soaking wet in the coracle ride in Jurassic park 2. Carry a water bottle to re-fill water at the dispensers 3. It can get quite hot, please bring your sun protection - cap/hats, sunglasses, sun screen, umbrella, enough water, and one towel to wipe off your sweat every few hour(s)

name: user_4194
review: Much shorter lines than in the US. Kind of a small park but a bunch of fun rollercoasters.

name: user_4195
review: Go on a weekday, buy tickets in advance from Klook and get in right away, no need to wait. There are few people in the morning. Anyone who wants to collect toys, I recommend coming early in the morning. Because there are a lot of people in the afternoon. I recommend going to Transformers with Mummy first. The food inside is expensive. Eat until you're full from outside. There are water dispensers throughout the park. It is recommended to bring your own water bottle to save money on water costs because it is very hot.

name: user_4196
review: I have never seen a theme park this empty. I was there on a Wednesday but there were so few people there that I oftentimes could walk right to the coaster and get in without waiting. However, the park is very small when compared to the other Universal Studios and therefore the ticket price feels a bit expensive. There are 3 rollercoaster that are fast paced, namely the two battlestar galactica and the return of the mummy coaster. Besides that there are multiple shows and smaller things like rafting. Also lots of character meets which I would highly recommend doing because there were usually just a crowd. At the character meets there is staff that will take a picture with your smartphone for you.

name: user_4198
review: A fun day out, but no comparison to the Universal Studios in Orlando or LA!

name: user_4199
review: Universal Studios Singapore exceeded all my expectations! From thrilling rides to captivating shows, every moment was filled with excitement. The attention to detail in the park's design truly transported me to different worlds. The friendly staff ensured a seamless experience, adding to the overall enjoyment. A must-visit destination for anyone seeking unforgettable entertainment

name: user_4202
review: Tickets were purchased at the electronic ticket office. There was no queue to enter. The queue for the rides is 30-40 minutes. Universal itself was not impressive, there are not many attractions. More than one day. Many areas were closed. The scenery itself, and some of the attractions, dont look very good.

name: user_4203
review: It's was a day full of experiences. Staff was courteous & warm. We were lucky to pick a relatively light day, so didn't faced long wait time. I would say visit to this park is a must

name: user_4204
review: This place is a world of its own and it is a place for all kinds of people!. adrenaline junkies will find some crazy rides here like battle star gallatica, revenge of the mummy, transformers etc . And there are lots of peaceful rides for other people. This place is a treat for kids in all aspects filled with many anime shows, real cartoon characters and kid friendly rides. Very impressed by how this place was constructed with such perfection. Loved the experience. Please note the wait time for each ride was around 30-40 min on a weekday. There is also an option for an express pass which will help you to bypass the queue, but you have to pay little extra.

name: user_4205
review: If you have more time during the holiday, it is recommended to buy a three-day ticket, and if you have less time, buy a priority ticket.

name: user_4211
review: If you can recommend going to Japan, the consumption inside Universal is too high and not huge, but the consumption in the Southeast Asian food area outside Universal is much more normal.

name: user_4213
review: The playground is located on Sentosa Island Singapore, Universal Studio Singapore. The place is really spacious, games, rides, performing arts, places to eat, places to relax, it's all here. You must try it if you are on holiday in Singapore. To get here you have to take the MRT to Harbourfront station (you can check the route to Harbourfront on the map or on the Singapore MRT website), then continue using the RWS 8 Bus which costs 1SGD per person. Then get off at the last stop, namely the stop to USS. For entry tickets to the USS, you can order from traveloka, tiketcom, klook or on the spot at the location (OTS is usually more expensive hehehe) for tickets there are also other choices, regular tickets or pass tickets without queuing (different services have different prices, right ) The USS opening hours depend on the official USS website, you can check first before going to the location, because the hours often change. Don't forget to bring a mini portable fan, an empty drinking bottle because there are lots of free drinking water spots there, and if it's hot, wear a hat/umbrella haha.

name: user_4214
review: It was mix experience,good and bad both.less happening for under 4 years old kids.expected more.not much to see and do under 4 years old kids.Even for the adults roller costers only for fun.

name: user_4215
review: The first time I came here with my husband, we came on a weekday and bought a Chinese New Year ticket package for 98 per person. Not bad because you can enter early, get a gift, food included, and shopping discount voucher. There are quite a lot of rides/attractions to choose from, even if you don't dare to go on an extreme ride like me, you can watch the attractions and ride the normal rides. Overall, it's really fun to come here all day, but the prices for the snacks are quite pricey, guys.

name: user_4216
review: Have been here twice and feel so lucky because both visit don't have any queue, even I can ride some attraction twice.. the Minion and Nintendo land still not open yet, maybe next time I will visit USS again after it's open.. I'm really having a great time here!

name: user_4219
review: Great place to visit if you are in singapore ....better to avoid weekends to come here highly crowded and waiting for long time in ques..

name: user_4221
review: If you're looking for a full day of adventure, this place is a must-visit! They offer two types of tickets: regular and express. The express ticket is great if you want to save time and enjoy all the rides and activities without waiting long. However, the regular ticket is more budget-friendly, though you might have to wait up to 80 minutes for some attractions. They have dining options available for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The Human and Cyclone rides provide thrilling experiences, while Transformers is a popular attraction loved by many. Don't miss the water showsthey're a must-see! Overall, this place offers an exciting and enjoyable experience for adventure lovers of all ages.

name: user_4222
review: Smaller than Japan Universal There is a lot to enjoy and everything there is to see. I bought an express ticket and got on it right away without waiting for 10 minutes. The Universal in Japan was so crowded and spacious that I got lost, but in Singapore, there were no people and it was leisurely, so I felt like I got on all the rides. Mummy, Cylon, Human, round water rides, you need to store your luggage (disadvantage)

name: user_4224
review: A few notes when having fun here - This ticket price is too expensive (only the main 5 games are worth experiencing). The main thing here is to take pictures. Vinwonder Phu Quoc Park half price number of games scale is much more worth it - One thing that is quite frustrating for all tourists is renting a locker for 4 SGD just to play 1 game, then paying at least 2 SGD more to buy a raincoat and finally if you don't get soaked, then another 4 SGD to dry your body. A bit of a waste of money for tourists

name: user_4225
review: The rides are very interesting, the space is spacious and there's lots of food inside, don't worry, the queue isn't too long in the afternoon. We tried the Transformers rides, Mummy and Elmo only queued for 20 minutes.

name: user_4227
review: Great rides. Great day trip for families. Pricey food within the studios though. Long lines for rides but worth the money.

name: user_4228
review: The shows and the like are very inferior compared to Universal in Japan, but it's great that you can ride all the rides with a maximum wait of 15 minutes even on the weekend! Even an hour after the show started, it was still empty. Although advance tickets are recommended, there is absolutely no need to buy FastPasses.

name: user_4230
review: Really great place for both adults and kids. We were lucky and it was not so crowded when we arrived,so we didn't have to spend a lot of time waiting in lines.

name: user_4231
review: Universal Studios is one of the must visit place in Singapore - Sentosa Island which has exiting attractions both for kids and adults and the attractions are truly based on Hollywood TV series.

name: user_4232
review: One of the best place to bring the kids when in singapore, just make sure to check their height before hand so to know if they can do the numerous rides.

name: user_4236
review: Wow wow and wow are the right words for this place. Very satisfied with the game rides complete with your favorite cartoon characters you can take photos with. It's already wow from the outside, let alone entering the inside arena. What an interesting experience. Thank You.

name: user_4239
review: The park is quite underwhelming really. There are very long queues for almost every ride or attraction even on a mid week day out of holiday season. Most rides etc have minimum 1 hour queues. Of course if you want to pay double the price you can walk on to anything. Personally I won't go here again

name: user_4240
review: A must visit in Singapore.. buy express passes .. transformers ride has a long queue.. visit during the wee hours to avoid rush .. carry your own waterbottle as well as keep in handy a map given to you on the entrance so that you minimise chances of skipping attractions .. keep in mind the show timings of water world .. avoid sitting on the front rows in order to not get wet due to the water show .. fireworks at night are a recommended sight

name: user_4241
review: A whole section of the park was closed while we were there with no warning... would have been nice to know upon entering, or even beforehand.

name: user_4242
review: Great place to spend the school holidays! We bought tics on the USS official website and it was cheaper than other 3rd party websites. The promo allowed for 1 hour early entry into the park but the only ride which was opened was the transformers and other kiddy rides located before the Human and Cyclone rides. Awaiting the opening of the new minion rides before our next visit!

name: user_4243
review: There are many attractions. I wasn't able to ride Transformers Battlestar, but I was satisfied with Transformers The Ride. The downside is that the price is too expensive. A small key ring costs 10 Singapore dollars each, so if you need a lot of souvenirs, we recommend bringing at least 100 Singapore dollars. The most expensive thing I saw was a snow globe with the Universal Studios logo costing 68 Singaipol. Shrek has a small Ferris wheel inside the store. (For children) It's quite disappointing that it ends at 6 o'clock, so I really recommend coming early and having an open run. For reference, there are a lot of shows in between. Going to Jurassic Park on that boat feels like a combination of a Whoop Ride and the Amazon Express. If you think 'I'll only get a little wet', you'll be wrong. You'll need a raincoat, and Daiso sells something that costs 1,000 won for 5 Singapore dollars, so the price difference is at least 5 times more. So, if you are going to ride, I recommend buying a raincoat in Korea.

name: user_4245
review: Omg, it was mind blowing experience. Very interesting rides. Must to visit in life time experience.

name: user_4248
review: Universal Studios Singapore falls short in comparison to USJ, Disney parks Tokyo, or Hong Kong when it comes to creating a lively atmosphere. The staff appeared discontent and lacked smiles, diminishing the overall experience. Moreover, extensive renovation work limited the available attractions, making the already small park feel even smaller. Nevertheless, it's crucial for the park to undergo upgrades, including improvements to staff demeanor, to enhance its appeal and attract more visitors.

name: user_4249
review: Brilliant park, good value for money, little to no wait times for even the bigger rollercoasters! Very happy :)

name: user_4252
review: Very fun day at USS! The queues are short, the rides were kept clean and the staffs were very nice & friendly especially the elder staffs. Cant wait for the minion land to open this year

name: user_4254
review: Good for kids and even for Adults, the rides are safe, exciting. Lot to walk.

name: user_4255
review: All is good here especially the show and the store

name: user_4256
review: One of must visit place in Singapore. We went on weekday Monday which was crowded. Better to go at 9 am with free early pass where you can cover rides and shows. Carry the empty bottle as there are places for free drinking water. Best ride was mummy ride, transformer and cyclon. Only irritating part was waiting time which went Upto 100 mins and there is no place to sit anywhere. You can take the busy rides during the afternoon when many people will go for lunch. One of the best show was water world and be ready to get drenched . We felt soft toys are less costlier when l compared to outside place. Do wear good shoes and there is no place to change the dress . There is dry zone place where we need to pay. We can meet and greet the cartoon / animation characters in where there is specific timings. We can take photo with them . Do install uss app where we can see the waiting time and route . There is free wifi and my suggestion was they could have given hard copy of map.

name: user_4257
review: Very fun. Well set out and wait times for rides were nothing compared to other theme parks around the world

name: user_4258
review: Universal Studios Singapore..a place with various kinds of toys..fun..beautiful..interesting..very excited..

name: user_4259
review: Interesting place with games, movies and chronograph action. A lot of bites and everywhere you can seek for a drink.

name: user_4261
review: Playgrounds are suitable for children and adults

name: user_4264
review: Had a lot of fun! Queues were not too long today (Wed , Singapore March school). Longest wait time I have endured previously was 1 hr for Transformer ride. Today it was about 40 minutes . I managed to do Cylon twice (wait time 25mins for first round at 3pm and 8 mins for round 2 at 6.30pm). Family and friends also got to repeat a number of rides, including 6 rounds on Enchanted Airways in Far, Far Away Land.

name: user_4265
review: Awesome Day @Universal Studios Singapore.. will surely come back soon.. Thumbs Up to Universal Studios Team for the great experience.. - Jakarta, Indonesia

name: user_4266
review: Had one of the most joyous day of my life. Worth every penny for the thrilling ride in the park.

name: user_4269
review: 9 March 24 : It is a place that anyone who has time left over from their trip to Singapore must come here. Even though there aren't as many rides as other places, But it's still fun as always. Saturday, Sunday There are quite a lot of queues to play the attractions. You can check in the app. And you can buy an express pass if you're too lazy to wait.

name: user_4271
review: Visiting among these days is a good choice,as visitors dont need to wait for a long time experiencing almost all rides!

name: user_4272
review: Better come during the weekday for this extremely special tourist attraction. Wait times on peak can range between 45-75 minutes. The transformers ride is a highlight. Be prepared to wait long queues at the end of the day for the monorail back to Vivo if not staying in Sentosa Resort

name: user_4273
review: Premium pass is must. Its too crowded. And Dubai rides are better, to be honest.

name: user_4277
review: I left some fun memories Transformers 4D theater is realistic and worth waiting for Re-entry is allowed once. The Blue Dragon Train is less thrilling than waiting. It is a very safe structure The Jurassic World water boat may get your shoes and clothes wet, but it is very thrilling. the streets are clean

name: user_4278
review: Every facilities is nice but Very bad experience in USS with impatient ,being to arrogant and very rude and not even a basic respect to tourism. The workers there like treat people like there pets just call us here and there. Please focus more on staff training. It ruin my whole day !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: user_4280
review: Firstly, MUST BUY EXPRESS PASS!!! The theme park is very fun and a lot of activities to do, such as the meet & greet, the shows, the rides, and the beautiful environment. When I first came here I didn't buy the express pass, this caused me to wait in line for roughly 1 hours in line for the Galactic Cyclone ride. It was unbearable for waiting so long, and I also went to queue in the mummy ride for nearly 45 minutes just for a minute ride. Anyway, I got the express pass about 1pm and I have a great experience afterwards, like shorten queue and faster access. This is a very family friendly place where it's okay to let families member wait in the family room in each ride in case the family members aren't fit for the ride.

name: user_4282
review: Same as the one in Las Angeles minus the Lot tram ride(obviously), and minus a couple other shows/rides (No simpsons, no Jerasic park boat ride, No Jimmie Fallon ride, and couple other shows)... But still a good time. Recommend tickets before hand to skip the ticket lines... But I do not recommend the fast pass... our longest wait for a ride was 30 minutes .. and we still easily rode all the rides and were done 2 hours before park closed. Recommend bringing a cheap rain Pancho because you definitely will get wet on the Jurassic park water raft ride... other than that... comfortable tennis shoes obviously... Food is a bit spendy... we had a meal in the Jurassic park restaurant and it was 17.00, plus drink... For ehhh food.... But to be expected in an amusement park... just a heads up.... Bring

name: user_4283
review: Don't visit this place on the weekend, and it's better to buy the express tickets Trust me

name: user_4284
review: A bit disappointed by the Universal Studio in Singapore, after doing both in the US. The organization is a bit messy, having to lock your backpack in a locker beforehand, with the penalty of an extra 4 if you're late doesn't help you enjoy the hour wait for the ride for the galaxy. We finished the day with 2 ride malfunctions, after a 45 minutes wait, so not ideal to finish a long day. Expensive 19 hot dog for a quick lunch break. Just a big plus for the Waterworld show, the same as in the US, but still very nice for special effects and choreography.

name: user_4285
review: I loved it. Enjoyed my time alone and it was perfect. Super nice shows and attractions

name: user_4286
review: Beautiful theme park with lots of roller coasters. Don't forget to catch the waterworld special performance while you're there!

name: user_4288
review: Visited universal studio Singapor and had an amazing time for a three Ling rides to fantastic shows

name: user_4289
review: Bought the express pass so we don't wait on the line. Super hot that day!

name: user_4291
review: Very nice theme park, I went here alone and took Single Lane. Really enjoyed. The staff also very nice service. Fall in love USS !

name: user_4292
review: I always buy tickets in advance. After waiting for 2 hours, it was said that the machine was malfunctioning. I just said sorry and it was over. I suggested that I go do other things first. The passage has only one entrance but no direct exit. It is very inconvenient to go back to the original path. I will not come here again if I give a bad review.

name: user_4293
review: Now waiting in cuw more than one hour and not even informing about the reason of such long waiting time, bad service for such expensive ticket!

name: user_4294
review: Good but not soo great .... But too much expensive....

name: user_2794
review: It was an amazing fun filled experience for the whole family!

name: user_4299
review: I went there in the afternoon but need a full day to cover everything. lots of fun activities

name: user_4301
review: After visit in 2019 I visited again in 2024. I went in at opening time at 10 a.m. and left around 3 p.m. I think I rode most of the rides. When it's hot, I think it would be a good idea to refer to the indoor show schedule and move accordingly.

name: user_4303
review: The revenge of the Mummy was administered by a rather vengeful lady who decided that the punishment for crossing over to the single riders lane was to exit and re-enter the ride. So when asked how to do that, she was annoyed too. Understand she must have had her share of horrible riders who dont follow protocol but when I reappear and had the whole ride to myself, she just looked bored. Not a v good start for single riders who just want to use up the ticket for a couple of hours since I just recovered.

name: user_4305
review: We went on a weekday and the weather was sunny all throughout. No rain showers and the waiting time was fairly reasonable. We queued for less than an hour for the Transformers and the Mummy ride. The restaurants also had lots of seats available. I expected more people to be visiting USS since it was The Eras Tour week but I guess people visited elsewhere instead.

name: user_4306
review: There's a group of people acting like a mafia in the studio. They tried to occupy my tables in front of an american dining which I was sitting even there are plenty of tables available. This is very scary and dangerous and should be illegal. Not safe at all. Already reported it to the guest information center. But for the studio itself, most thing is perfect. Less queue. Good staff. Food are expensive but understandable. Many attractions and things to do. Lovely place

name: user_4308
review: Fun activity to do in Singapore !! No doubt, it s a incomplet park if you compare with other universal studios around the world! Would recommend it if you have extra days in the city ! The best attraction for adults who arent scared is CYCLON !

name: user_4315
review: Must visit when in Singapore. Make sure you come here early morning if you want to enjoy all rides and capture beautiful pictures

name: user_4316
review: I REALLY LOVE USS bought unlimited express ticket for friday and it was best decision. i could rides 12 attractions! Always be my favorite theme park i ever visited

name: user_4320
review: Highly recommending buying the universal express pass so you won't have to wait for 30-40 mins in line for one ride! Overall it was a very nice trip, but the food and drinks sold there are a bit expensive. Recommended bringing sime light snacks and mineral water in advance. There are refillable water dispensers across the park

name: user_4321
review: Great experience, fun place to visit must go for transformer ride, revenge of the mummy, jurassic Park rapid adventure and battles target galactica.

name: user_4322
review: Had such a great time at universal studios. Its an appropriate size and can be done within half the day. Easy to access, signs and very helpful staff everywhere. Lockers to put in big bags (charged) and then smaller lockers at each ride for phones (free of charge). About 4 outdoor rides which do close when there is heavy rain. Must do rides are revenge of the Mummy & cyclons!

name: user_4324
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem! The park's vibrant atmosphere, thrilling rides, and captivating shows make it a must-visit destination. From the jaw-dropping Transformers ride to the magical world of Shrek, every corner offers an immersive experience. The attention to detail is impeccable, and the friendly staff adds to the overall positive vibe. Whether you're a movie buff or just seeking a fun-filled day, Universal Studios Singapore delivers pure joy and excitement for visitors of all ages.

name: user_4325
review: It was a fun time The rides were as thrilling as USJ.

name: user_4327
review: 1. If you go on weekdays, you still have to wait in a small queue. Popular facilities must be visited within 30-60 minutes If you are worried about waiting in line for too long, remember to buy a quick pass Otherwise, the queue will be much less crowded after 5 o'clock. 2. Singapore often has strong sunshine in the morning and heavy rain in the afternoon. Remember to bring an umbrella or a light raincoat (they sell one at Jurassic Park for SGD 6) 3. It is recommended to buy souvenirs last, otherwise they will be heavy to carry around. 4. There is a row of food trucks and a Malay food court outside the park. If you dont like the food in the park, you can stamp your name and eat outside before coming back to play.

name: user_4329
review: Very good place. Have a lot of fun.

name: user_4331
review: A great experience for kids, teens and even adults.

name: user_4332
review: Minion is still not ready. And btw, when you are waiting in line for Puss in Boots, do not place your arms on the queue rail, its rusty and will leave nasty dirty marks on your sleeve.

name: user_4333
review: It's fun, exciting, but very hot so wear sunscreen and must wear a hat. A normal day is worth it

name: user_4334
review: USS is a must to visit place when you are in Singapore. Its a theme park operated by Universal studio. It is located at Santosa island. Its operated from 10 AM to 7 PM in weekdays and upto 8 PM at weekend (Sunday). Ticket can be purchased from different online sites or at USS. Bying from online can save time from long queue on the spot. To avoid queue at entry and rides additional Universal Express pass can be purchased. Usually there is long queue in the morning at opening. But with time rush is less than usual. The park is divided in diffrent zone according to diffrent movie theme. This place is very attractive, rides are fantastic but some are restricted for child. Lots of fun and shows are there. One can download Universal Studio Singapore app on mobile and can have live update of the shows while in the park. It will take around 4 to 6 hours depending on how many rides you are enjoing, crowd and your schedule. Foods and drink are quite expensive there. Don't forget to bring cap, sunglass, umbrella. Happy travelling.

name: user_4336
review: Tickets purchased for early entry which I highly recommend as we had short wait times for the rides all day. Ended up doing the park in about 7 hours.

name: user_4338
review: not worth going here. not worth it if you want to spend 5 hours here, you have to remember that 4 hours and 30 minutes are spent waiting, 30 minutes for the ride. places like this should be boycotted to the fullest extent.

name: user_4339
review: If you dont want to wait in queue then buy the express ticket

name: user_4343
review: Not great, not terrible. I think it's a little overpriced for a relatively small park with just a few attractions. Also, very disappointing that they charge (quite a bit!) for their lockers.

name: user_4344
review: I'm a big fan of Minion, and this was my first time visiting Universal Studios. I was so excited! I spent a long time in the Minion Mart and couldnt choose the stuff. Besides, there were so many rides to choose from inside Universal.We were able to check the queue times online, which was really helpful because we could plan which rides to go on first. I didn't go on any roller coasters, but from what I saw, everyone seemed to be having a lot of fun on them. The ride I did go on was Transformers, and it was amazing! We had to wear 3D glasses, and it felt so real. I felt like I was actually in the movie!

name: user_4347
review: A great park overall, some of the lines in the late afternoon can be around 45 minutes. We attended on a weekday and started first thing from opening.

name: user_4348
review: I think it's good that Universal always provides enjoyable experiences

name: user_4349
review: It's a place where kids will find a lot of happiness. Many kinds of activities can be explored. Transformers 4D, Flying Dinosaur are some to mention.

name: user_4350
review: The Transformer attractions are lit. The queue for the water raft adventure was annoyingly long during my visit, and one can get really wet, so gotta take the get wet warnings seriously. The Egyptian theme is amazing, incredible giant statues. Galactica roller coaster was quick but exhilarating enough. It looked safe and well maintained. Enough places to dine. Not a lot of unique drinks. Coconut juices werent very great imo. Locker system can be paid with credit card! https://fb.watch/qBzqqLJ12i/?mibextidv7YzmG

name: user_4355
review: Make sure to go here early so you can avoid the crowd for photo op at the Universal Studios globe. The USS gate doesn't open till 10 am, so that also gives you time to explore Resorts World Sentosa's other amazing attractions!

name: user_4356
review: I hope management realize the happiness and well-being of the staffs, they seem so rude and not happy.. not sure they are over-worked or under-paid.. looks like they are working for a torture camp, not for a theme park lol So many sinister looking and frowned faces and rude when directing the visitors

name: user_4357
review: The SMALLEST of Universal's parks. Do check in advance which attraction is CLOSED to avoid disappointment. The F&B was OVERPRICED. Wear poncho or bring extra clothing if you intend to try the water rides. Only Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN vs. CYLON not to be missed!

name: user_4358
review: It's small, but you can enjoy it for a whole day. We recommend having an Express Pass as it will allow you to travel more efficiently.

name: user_4359
review: A good place to travel with your significant other or children
