name: user_4360
review: Universal Singapore is a smaller version of Universal Orlando. Tickets are cheaper than Orlando's, which is justified by the smaller number of attractions. I found the park more geared toward children, but adults can also have fun. The outdoor areas are a very interesting experience and reflect the country's history well. When I was there in February 2024, there was a construction site for a new attraction. I faced a few lines, and in one of them there was a technical stoppage with no forecast for the ride to return. I found this frustrating, because they were encouraging people to give up. I was at the front, and if I gave up, I would have to wait in line when the rides started working again. The right thing to do would be to clear the line and close the ride. The best thing to do is to download the Universal app, where you can favorite the rides you want to go on, and in the app you can track the queue time. The problem is that you can't follow the route in sequence, and you go back and forth to places when the queue is shorter. The best time to avoid waiting in line is at the end of the day. Then the queues are much shorter. Just pay attention to the shows, which have limited times. As for food, there are some options that aren't so cheap, but I didn't think they were exorbitantly priced. I went there and came back using a ride-hailing app to save time, but on the way back the drivers don't accept rides, and it's more expensive than the outward journey. The island and the area near the park are also very beautiful attractions. If you have time on your trip and are traveling with young people and children, it's a good experience. We stayed there until the park closed.

name: user_4361
review: Its still remain the same since my first came on 2016, not much changes in these years. The queue is long and waited more than an hour, some attractions dont really crowd with people like talks and the performance, quite boring. If dont wanted to waste time to queue up, I would recommend you to get an express pass.

name: user_4362
review: The mobile games are average and not exciting enough! But the service was good and the atmosphere was nice. You can play it all without a fast pass

name: user_4364
review: Pretty good experience. Everything was quite orderly despite the horde of tourists. Rides were definitely fun. Leaving out one star due to the construction sites when we visited I think the tickets are a bit overpriced.

name: user_4365
review: We visited the Universal studios for the second time after a gap of 12 years. It was ever a fun filled and wonderful experience. This is one place that has activities for all age groups! The Hollywood walk, the NYC pavement have the perfect picture backdrops. Far far away theme park's 4D experience was truly amazing! We were a little scared to try the Puss in the boots ride, but it was a short one and not to be missed! The lost world park is my favorite. We can have multiples of canopy ride, rapids as well as bird ride. It is never enough! In the Egypt theme, treasure hunt is perfect for an easy ride through the history. The mummy roller coaster was scary as hell! It became pitch dark and ultra fast. It's not for the faint-hearted, mind you. Sci-fi city is good as always. Transformers as well as the roller coasters are one true must have. Every theme park has a separate food court, ice cream parlors, rest rooms. Water world has lot of amazing rides and in my opinion needs one whole separate day to enjoy! Do not forget to take universal express passes to skip those lines. Else, you will end up missing many awesome rides due to timeout. Overall USS is a unique experience and should not be missed when you visit Singapore!

name: user_4366
review: Amazing place, certainly takes more than 5 hours, even with the express entry passes, so cant plan anything else for this day. There arent many options for vegetarians inside, but theres some good food outside in the food trucks area. So totally sorted.

name: user_4368
review: Beautiful and organized amusement park.. It is medium in size and has a variety of toys. Suitable for different ages.

name: user_4373
review: I went 3 times and got to tried few of the rides. Every rides needs to queue quite long but still happy as i got to spending my time together with my family. 2 times went there some rides i unable to rides because of the weather. Raining Heavily. My suggestion before buy a ticket please see the forecast for that day.

name: user_4375
review: The ice cream served in the park is good, but the strawberry milkshake is ordinary (lower middle). If you have more time, you can also consider wearing an armband at the door and dining outside the park. However, dining in Sentosa is generally high-priced and crowded. Therefore, you can evaluate whether you should eat a full breakfast before entering the park (it doesnt open until 10 oclock anyway), eat lunch later to avoid the crowds, or simply eat ice cream. The Shrek movie was fun and worthwhile, and some of the more thrilling (scary) attractions had very few lines at 4pm.

name: user_4376
review: Family enjoy place...many adventures to test/enjoy...Food is good... We take whole day here...

name: user_4381
review: what an experience. also a highlight with children. The virtual ride at Transformers is great. Donki in the theater is also very cool.

name: user_4383
review: It's really small Many areas are fenced off. Minions and Shrek's Wall So there are fewer things to play It's about 4-5 hours on weekdays.

name: user_4386
review: This is the first time riding the roller coaster. It was superb, and my sister's kids like it very much.

name: user_4388
review: Went with my partner and was very satisfied with the service.

name: user_4390
review: Perhaps the best theme/amusement park I've been to. The rides, the shows, the overall look and feel of the place are magnificent. The whole park is spread over a massive area and is easily accessible via public transport of Singapore. Their landmark roller coasters cyclon and battlestar galactica are truly thrilling and overwhelming to say the least. Other areas like Jurassic Park, transformers, Egyptian Palace etc. too have some wonderful rides and shows. Basic facilities such as washrooms and drinking water are available throughout the park for your convenience, while there are several eateries and food courts within the park to satisfy your hunger Pangs. You need a full day to enjoy this place to the fullest. So be prepared to allocate a full day out of your itinerary to Universal Studios when visiting Singapore.

name: user_4391
review: It was okay, not too wow as only a few rides for adult thats exciting, the other half was mainly for kids. Now however, Starbucks experience was very bad!! We ordered ice americano but had to wait 30mins because they prioritised online app order.

name: user_4392
review: Entrance ticket using the monorail is 4 SGD on the 2024 Chinese New Year holiday. The place is quite dirty because there are lots of foreign tourists :(( the queues are also long even though it's nice to have the monorail :( Maybe you can try it next time, if this is your first experience, it's 8/10 Take the ferry from Batam, pp. 700 and visa free. Cuss on holiday!!

name: user_4394
review: Broken Jurassic water rapids ride

name: user_4396
review: It's really fun, the place is really nice and spacious, it makes your legs tired but it's really fun there

name: user_4399
review: Universal Studios Singapore exceeded all my expectations ! The park is packed with thrilling rides, stunning shows, and immersive experiences that truly bring your favorite movies to life. The attention to detail is impeccable, and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Whether you're a thrill-seeker or just looking for a fun day out with the family or spouse, Universal Studios Singapore has something for everyone.

name: user_4400
review: Its recommended to buy an advance ticket trough any app. Recommended klook app. There are offer ticket with special discount and refreshment include as well. Be patient with the waiting time for popular roller coaster ride. Make sure you are keeping yourself hydrated. I suggest planning for which station/section of entertainment you wanna play. Since, a que timing will be drag your daytime and you will waste the chances to finish many entertainment section well. If going with children, always keeping up and stay with your children. Let them enjoy a 3D shrek, puss in boot. Jurassic park, waterworld, transformers and also sesame street. Overall, it is worth it every penny of your money if you are planning well and try everything the section they provided. The ticket entry SGD 80 per adult.

name: user_4402
review: Fun but I'm spoiled by the massive parks in USA

name: user_4404
review: Since I used the express ticket, the line was only 15 minutes at most, so I was able to enjoy the attraction. Water World was especially fun.

name: user_4406
review: What can i say, it's a paradise for children and adults alike. Only recommendation is to buy express pass single entry (not multiple) to all rides, only then you can enjoy everything.

name: user_4407
review: A great place for families and children to enjoy. A good time as long as you avoid the time.

name: user_4408
review: Park hours are too short. There is not enough time to cover all the major attractions with hours of waiting, except paying 50 extra for express entries.

name: user_4409
review: Great theme park really worth visiting if you are a tourist in singapore or even a permanent resident, roller coaster is great especially the human one, dinosaur glider was fun too. Personally my favourite was the jurassic world raft ride, food there is great, many tasty snacks, overall great tourist attraction

name: user_4411
review: Great and compact amusement park in SEA. When buys souvenir, pay with Mastercard to get 10% off. Very helpful staffs like Francis, recommended us to get tax refund when purchased above 100 SGD. New zone, Minion Land is coming end of 2024.

name: user_4413
review: I went there on Chinese New Year's Day. Experienced some great decoration and thrilling rides. Don't forget to buy Express ticket otherwise you will have to wait in long queue for almost every ride.

name: user_4414
review: I do not recommend the visit! A small amusement park with few attractions. It looks nice but is at best a cheap version of a theme park. On some coasters you have to pay for a locker to lock the bags. At the end you will be asked to fill out a survey. This takes 10 minutes and you get a cheap keychain of a cartoon character not resident in the theme park. There is no comparison to that phantasialand in Cologne or Disneyland in Paris.

name: user_4417
review: One of the nicest and well maintained place in Singapore. Rides and attractions are very popular here. Definitely must try place.

name: user_4418
review: Too many people compared to the area

name: user_4419
review: The rides are awesome, few are scary too.. I went there just before covid outbreak and pandemic lockdown so there wasnt much crowd but as I know and have heard that the queue takes more than 20-30 mins per ride.

name: user_4420
review: "Mummy Ride," "Enchanted Airways," and "Transformers: The Ride" at Universal Studios Singapore are super fun! Even if you're a bit scared, you can still have a good time. "Mummy Ride" has simulated volcanoes and explosive effects, "Enchanted Airways" has spins with cute characters, and "Transformers: The Ride" is a big epic battle in 3D. Buy fast track tickets to skip the lines and enjoy these rides to the fullest!

name: user_4422
review: This park is absolutely amazing. What a great day my family and I had. It is very different from Japan and the United States. But it's worth the visit. We are glad we got to see this park. My only issue would be. Where do you go to get picked up from a taxi or zig? They lack the information and employees to help guide you in the right direction that you need to go to in order to exit. It is quite confusing. I do suggest trying to go first thing in the morning. There is no waiting to get in and no waiting for any of the rides. The afternoon and evening are the busiest times to go. If you want to do the rides with no waiting and you want to get in the park with no lines, go in the morning.

name: user_4423
review: There were too many people because it was the Lunar New Year holiday, but my child loved it. It was a good memory

name: user_4425
review: Superb to take kids along .. it's a amusement park .. Rides for kids, adults and both. Walking is too much there so need to carry sports shoes compulsory and food along.

name: user_4426
review: This is the best ever experience in my life. Also very first time I had visited. Each and every segment is just incredible. We had used expressway and took only just few mins to wait and kindly chose this ticket. The way of behaviour from staffs are also very kind hearted and simple. Strongly recommending to each one of you to visit this place and make it memorable one. This is just once in a lifetime experience.

name: user_4427
review: Worth of lifetime experience . The price is worth it . Although some rides is out of date i think , like the Shrek , i think it need regeneration. In addition, They provide a Surau like mini mosque , as a muslim it really helps us to pray

name: user_4428
review: As someone who has visited many theme parks around the world and most of the Universal sites worldwide Universal Singapore operates like no other theme park and not in a good way. The biggest issue here is how the rides operate with regards to lockers. In order to ride some of the rides they do not allow you to have anything in your pockets at all. This is very different to every other theme park I've been to where they understandably don't allow bags or backpacks so you have to use the lockers but items in your pockets are allowed everywhere else but here. The first problem is they do not make this clear when you are queuing so when you get to the front of the queue and are scanned by a metal detector wand it detects your phone / wallet etc. and you are told by the miserable staff member that you need to put this in a locker despite having already queued and dropped your bag off at the locker before joining the ride queue. They do allow you to return to the front of the queue but this could be avoided by having someone inform the visitors while they queue. So once you have placed everything you carry into a locker you then queue for the ride. Sounds ok, right? Wrong. The lockers are only free for a set amount of time (45 mins) which if you are a theme park regular you will know is nowhere near enough time to queue for a ride so you then get charged a rate of 2 for every 10 mins past the free 45 mins. A complete scam. For context Universal Florida give you a few hours free. If you aren't already annoyed at your experience so far once you get off the ride to collect you items you then discover that you do not have your bank cards to pay for the locker as they are locked away so you now have to find an employee who can unlock your items for you and then you have to pay them in cash which not everyone will have so you then need to go find some cash. It's infuriating and such a colossal waste of valuable time in the park. After 1 ride I'm so angry at the entire situation and genuinely don't want to be there anymore. Ride staff are miserable and extremely unhelpful throughout the day. For contrast the staff in the retail stores are very friendly and helpful. Maybe this is better training, maybe it's working environment (air con) staff in restaurants were a mixed bag. Some were friendly, some were just rude. Food in the park was actually pretty good and unlike other theme parks wasn't ridiculously expensive. We bought tickets that included a Chinese New Year promo meal which meant each area of the park offered a different option for this so it's worth shopping around to find the best looking meal. We opted for duck wraps from the Shrek themed area and they were very large and delicious. Had we known portion size we would have used one voucher here and bought something else from another area. Not all the food was good though. In Mel's Diner from back to the future I ordered a sundae that was a half filled cup of semi melted ice cream and not the swirled ice cream with strawberry sauce as pictured (see pics). When we complained about this to staff in both English and Chinese (my wife is Malaysian Chinese) they just laughed and walked away. Wait times for rides were posted incorrectly. E.g. 15 mins for The Mummy when we queued for over an hour. Other issues encountered include Staff allowing groups of tourists to join the single rider queues when it was very clear they were all together and just attempting to queue jump, 3D glasses for transformers ran out so had to wait for staff to replace. no one stopping use of phones, queue management was awful. Filling up rows 1 person at a time instead of 4. The park is very small compared to other theme parks so there is no excuse for the multitude of errors we saw when visiting. In fact this should be the best operated Universal Location due to the size but it's by far the worst we've been to. Would I return here? Absolutely not. I would recommend it though for a single visit as long as you know what to expect. hopefully reviews like this will enable others to have a better trip

name: user_4429
review: Still not a bad choice for teenagers.

name: user_4432
review: Buy an early access ticket, it will save time. Some rides require you to lock stuff in the locker, the first 45 minutes are free of charge. Water World shows are at 1: 30 and 4: 30.

name: user_4433
review: It is a must have experience. Do book your tickets in advance and buy those ticket online where they allow you to enter 1 hr before the rides start so that you can click the pictures easily without much crowd. After 10am ride starts & then the wait time of each ride can reach upto 60mins to 120mins. Try to finish the adventurous rides first if you don't want to buy express tickets which are like double the normal ticket cost. Enjoy the meal there. Vegetarian options are less but you can find it in Egyptian food court.

name: user_4435
review: U must try the transformer games and mummy games,

name: user_4437
review: First time being there, alot of different themes throughout the studio which was fun to see. More of a family theme park, not so much for thrill seekers. Food was average.

name: user_4438
review: Universal Studios Singapore: A Fun Experience, But Consider Universal Studios Japan for a Fuller Adventure Universal Studios Singapore offers a fun and enjoyable experience, but for those seeking a more extensive adventure, Universal Studios Japan might be the better choice. While Universal Studios Singapore is relatively smaller and offers fewer rides compared to its counterpart in Japan, it still provides a range of entertaining attractions and experiences. To make the most of your time at Universal Studios Singapore, consider purchasing express passes to minimize wait times for popular rides. This allows you to enjoy more attractions without spending too much time in queues. After a day of thrilling adventures, you can head back to Sentosa Island, where Universal Studios Singapore is located. Sentosa boasts a variety of dining options, allowing you to refuel and relax after a day of excitement.

name: user_4440
review: During events.... the wait time is insane... bring small fan, powerbank, water etc.

name: user_4441
review: The staff of attractions, too much unkind and rude.. even they didnt answer simple question. may they need to hire educated ppl.

name: user_4444
review: A very sorry excuse for a theme park. An absolute waste of money. Everything very fake looking, unlike Universal in LA and simply not enough to see or do.

name: user_4447
review: The minions part was under construction, so it is not the best time to visit, but in other words, it is not that crowd and you dont really need a fast pass For shopping, the magic of universal sudio is always powerful, but you may need to be aware that even they have an information board saying that they accept this and that kind of e-payment, you will be told that they dont accept this but only accept that at the cashier, so make sure that you ask if they accept your desire epayment before filling up your shopping bag

name: user_4449
review: This was ok. Honestly enjoyed this much less than the theme parks in South Korea and Dubai. Maybe we went on a very crowded national holiday. Hence was much less fun vs other days

name: user_4450
review: Expect long queues on weekends as there are many people rides were fantastic and fun.

name: user_4452
review: Once in a lifetime experience & an absolute delight to be at this place. Right from tram rides, meet & greets to marvellous architecture this place has got it all. Really liked the mummy ride & the Jurassic Park ride. Be early to this place at 10 am as the crowd picks up from 11 am onwards

name: user_4453
review: Extreme fun! Yes, get the Universal Express pass if the reason you come here is to ride as many rides as possible, otherwise you'll end up waiting in queue for up to 30-60 minutes. With the pass the wait time is usually 0-10 minutes. Regarding the one pass or unlimited passes, it depends: most of the attractions are fun only 1 time since they have a story/show/etc, get the unlimited passes only if you plan on going on the rollercoaster multiple times or you have a kid which may enjoy seeing the same activity multiple times. During the last few hours of the day the rides free up and there's no waiting time at all for almost all rides, with or without the priority pass. There are around 15 rides, not all suitable for all ages: for 1-2 year olds only 1-2 rides are ok, for kids under 120cm about 4-5 rides are unavailable (main 2 rollercoasters, the mummy ride which can get scary, and some others... But there's a kid friendly rollercoaster too with unexpectedly high speed) Most of the rides are unique, each one with a different objective: some are speed coasters, others ride and show, 4D events, water splash, discovery, etc) There are also a lot of meet & greet events throughout the day, where you can take photos with various characters (transformers, egyptian characters, cartoons characters, etc)

name: user_4454
review: I am tourist. For two adults when I bought the tickets at the Kiosk outside the entrance my forex card got charged twice (2 ticket payments of S176 each) with a receipt for only obe payment of S176. When I checked with the customer care inside the studio they say only one payment is received. I checked with my bank and they say they did not get any response yet for the details of the second payment charged to the card with a receipt nor a refund. They asked me to wait for 30 days to know the final status and am still waiting for the 30 day period to elapse which is around end of this month. My recommendation is not to use those Kiosks.

name: user_4458
review: Best worth money but buy express tickets to avoid wait time

name: user_4459
review: I didn't wait for an express ticket to ride it right away. I couldn't see the Waterworld because the time wasn't right. It was a little hard waiting because of the shower after 4 o'clock. Pizza at a pizza place is really good!

name: user_4460
review: From bottom of my heart ,I would like to thank Lynne USS team. On 16th Feb, I'm unable to get my tickets from Agoda. Lynne help me to get the tickets n they way handle customer was a excellent. Keep up the good work n we enjoyed our USS trip. Thank you for the birthday token given to my son.

name: user_4463
review: wonderful experience that will last for a lifetime!!! memorable moments with my mom!

name: user_4464
review: Even the smallest Universal Studios in the world is worth visiting If you enter the park early, you can basically enjoy all the rides. However, the queues on national holidays are really scary. Even if I have to take the MRT back to VivoCity on my way back, I have to wait in a very long queue!!! What I enjoyed most this time was taking photos with various characters. Especially Madagascar is super energetic!! Big heart to the staff

name: user_4467
review: Hello to every who's gonna read my review. i will share a very brief details on my experience i had during the public holiday. Of course compare to where I came from, the rides at USS were exceptional, amazing and wonderful. I especially love the ride "Revenge of Mummy" and the huge rollercoaster "Battlestar Galactica: Human". It was extremely enjoyable that my siblings and I could not stop moving trying to queue up on our next rides. Something to be aware of: 1. For muslims, the food outlets inside the theme park mostly consist with the selling of beers and non-halal food/drinks but there's one halal stall at the Far Far Away Land area called the "Goldilocks (something)" so.. for foreigners, you might as well have breakfast at home and bring some snacks along with you. 2. Be aware that the queue is a no joke thing, it can be extremely long especially "Revenge of Mummy", "Battlestar Galactica: Cylon", "Puss In Boots' Giant Journey" and all of the Jurrasic Park rides. To be frank, the queue might take up to 1-2 hours especially during peak time 11-2pm. So it's a matter of you willing to wait or not. 3. Be aware of people (especially foreigners who's Indians). Sadly, from my experience, they tried to cheat on us and cut our queue to access the ride faster and be ahead of us Not only that, they pushed one of my family members during the queue multiple times to the point we have to speak up. Totally not a pleasant experience. 4. You can access the link of USS by scanning the bar code posted right before going into USS as this will provide you with a map of the theme park, the rides available on that day and its estimated waiting time. 5. Lastly, my other main reason as to why I had to rate USS 3-4/5 was because of some rude behaviours of the workers. Yes it's understandable that you have been working a whole day taking care of the rides under the hot sun and dealing with customers/visitors but that does not justify the rudeness and incompetency that you had show towards these people who not only bought tickets to have a good time playing rides in the theme park but also are the ones who enabled you to have the paycheck you're receiving. For the Sesame Street Ride lady waiting in front of the door, I am here to write to you on how rude you were and that your statement, tone and how you shouted at customers are totally NOT professional and a disgusting behaviour. If you cannot cope with working there to the point you had to push and shout at customers just because the rides were closed then you should have just resign. In other words lady in blue shirt with glasses working at Sesame Street ride at 7.55pm on 10th February 2024, you could have provide us visitors with better approach instead of what you've done, not only that it had also caused us to have a tainted image of this "good and friendly neighbourhood of Singapore", it had also stained our excitement by the end of the day at USS. Suggestions: 1. Better maintanence on the rides as by the end of the day some rides closed down due to maintanence and it take quite long compared to during lunch time (about 5mins). 2. More Halal food stalls for the muslim, easy access to Prayer rooms and please clean the toilet, it's quite stinky, dirty and the rubbish was too full that it falls out to the floor. 3. Improvements of customer service (eg. don't be rude and be friendly) 4. To reduce waiting time, every available seats per ride should be completely filled. I think that's all, thank you for reading and hope you get some knowledge and enjoyed it!

name: user_4468
review: Overall experience was great although it was a peak season CNY. The only sad thing was the birthday badge was not available at that time.

name: user_4471
review: Suggest buying express access in advance

name: user_4472
review: I went during the Lunar New Year holiday on February 11th and there were too many people. I had to wait for almost an hour for the rides I could ride, but the weather helped and it was cloudy most of the time, so I made it through. If the sun was hot, it would have been difficult to endure. Although the overall scale is smaller than Universal Studios Japan, the rides were much more fun and scary than those in Japan. Personally, I think Japan competes with screens that feature flashy characters and rides that aren't scary. In Singapore, the fear was much greater as I didn't know what would come out of the darkness. I finally got a seat after waiting for the restaurant. It was next to the waffle shop past Jurassic Park, and the chicken was bigger than the original one, so I couldn't eat it all. The food was salty. They only gave me a cup because the drinks had unlimited refills. I wasn't able to see the water show because the timing wasn't right, but as I was passing by the entrance to the water show, I saw a show (?) where a baby dinosaur hatches from an egg, and it was quite realistic and fun. I couldn't ride much even after walking over 20,000 steps due to a failure in the game of wits, but next time I go, I'm going to try riding some equipment I haven't been able to ride.

name: user_4473
review: Brought my family here, had a great time and enjoyable session. However queue times can be extremely long if you're going during weekends/phols.. Please take note.

name: user_4474
review: Instead of long queue, other thing is good

name: user_4478
review: Many people from India. Please rent out some outlet for pure veg food vendor. Rest everything is fine.

name: user_4479
review: First time to Universal Studios. It was great to go there early in the morning and play the rides.

name: user_4483
review: Visit once in a lifetime...

name: user_4484
review: No refunds for bad weather. Thunderstorms came around 4pm, and all the outdoor rides stop. Many technical issues so they stop the rides. They stop single rider lanes when it gets too busy... just doesnt make sense. The decorations were average. The whole water world section was closed off for construction.

name: user_4487
review: A great place for adults and children, and great shopping! Recreational facilities that are too young are not suitable!

name: user_4488
review: There is no need to wait to enter, but to play games you need to wait 20-60 minutes to play a game.

name: user_4489
review: Firstly, get there early! Like, before it opens early! We got the ticket that allows early access and it was so worth it! Plan out the rides you desperately want to do and tick them off first... the difference is waiting 15min in line to 60-80min waits. Each ride has a sign out front telling you the wait time. By midday the wait times for most adult rides are 60 mins. Was annoyed to see rides taking off with half full carriages just because ride operators didnt want to force or allocate singles to go with groups of 3 etc. just blows out the wait times for everyone. Pack your own food and drink! Our ticket included a 20 meal voucher each - it didnt go far and the food was average. Toilets were very clean, park was clean, gardens well maintained. All in all was a good day but we left after the water show that started at 1.30 as we didnt want to wait an hour to go on a ride.

name: user_4490
review: An amazing place full of attractions themed around different movies, you can do it in a day

name: user_4494
review: Express entry is a must..

name: user_4500
review: Don't arrive without buying *in advance* a full day express pass. they sell you 1 for 100 during the day which is an insulting price. some of the rides are 1 minute but over 40 minutes in wait... wouldn't recommend it without a full day express.

name: user_4501
review: My visit to Universal Studios in Singapore was a delightful experience! While the park may be smaller in size compared to other Universal Studios locations, it certainly didn't disappoint in terms of fun and excitement. Although there aren't as many rides as in larger parks, each attraction offered a unique and enjoyable experience. The theming throughout the park was impressive, transporting us into the worlds of our favorite movies and TV shows. Despite its size, the park still managed to deliver a day filled with laughter, thrills, and unforgettable memories. The friendly staff and vibrant atmosphere added to the overall enjoyment of our visit. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore may be compact, but it's definitely big on fun!

name: user_4502
review: Lots of places to visit. Visitors must determine which game they want to play or which location they want to visit first. Because the queue is quite long, it takes a long time to get your turn. Cool queuing area, with free drinking water dispensers.

name: user_4503
review: There are too many facilities that children cannot play in. It is not recommended to bring children under elementary school. Some facilities that can be played inside may frighten children. Can I ride a small roller coaster that is 92 centimeters long? And no explanation of what a roller coaster is? (Is this a mainland term? Not all Chinese-speaking countries know the term), and there is no reference video? Universal Studios certification standards are so weird The child was so frightened that his entire trip abroad was disrupted. He woke up crying every day from nightmares and was so scared that he lost his mind... I was frightened twice when I returned to Taiwan...I was scared to death. I can only say dont go there again, and you cant play anything. Its a waste of money.

name: user_4504
review: We literally spent the entire day on this fun place. I like this better than Disneyland. Lots of fun ridea appropriate for age. Universal Studios Singapore has great organization, safety and really shows they care about the customer's welfare. Line could be long but have notice before getting in line. Food and beverage stalls are ubiquitous. Restaurants are great. Attractions are fun and good for families. Very friendly staff.

name: user_4505
review: I arrived an hour early and everything went smoothly.

name: user_4507
review: just amazing experiences with world class rides & shows

name: user_4508
review: Roller coaster was the best experience but locker time has different time thresholds

name: user_4517
review: Awesome! Super fun to experience, we only have Disneyland Paris nearby

name: user_4523
review: Had a thrilling time here. Plenty of rides and shows for the whole family.

name: user_4524
review: It is very fun and suitable for bringing children. If the children dare to play, they can ride on the roller coaster.

name: user_4525
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an unparalleled theme park experience. From the moment you step foot inside, you're transported to a world of excitement and adventure. With seven themed zones, including Hollywood, New York, and Ancient Egypt, there's something for everyone. Thrill-seekers will love the adrenaline-pumping rides like Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon and Transformers: The Ride. Families can enjoy the whimsical attractions in Far Far Away and Madagascar zones. Don't forget to catch the spectacular live shows and parades that bring beloved characters to life. The attention to detail is impeccable, with stunning set designs and immersive storytelling around every corner. The park's cleanliness and organization ensure a seamless and enjoyable experience for all visitors. Food options abound, ranging from quick bites to themed restaurants serving delicious cuisines from around the world. And of course, no visit is complete without snapping a photo with your favorite movie characters or shopping for souvenirs to commemorate your unforgettable day. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking fun, thrills, and magic in one spectacular place. With its world-class attractions and immersive experiences, it's a theme park unlike any other.

name: user_4527
review: Good but very full, the express lane system is not automated, which causes delays in service, and therefore delays for those who do not have express lane. The entrance is incredible, the candy stores and the Lego store are fantastic!

name: user_4528
review: One of the playgrounds in Singapore. Universal Studio provides several game areas, and the game ride map is all integrated with the application, apart from that there are predictions of waiting times and rides that are delayed due to rain. The play area is quite large and comfortable, but when it rains it gets a bit muddy. For eating, there are several food courts spread across each area. Apart from that, there is also a souvenir shop. The price of the food is quite expensive because it is in the play area, around 15-20 dollars. Waiting times vary from 15 minutes - 2 hours, so you have to be wise in choosing the vehicle you want to ride. To avoid queuing too long, you can use a VIP pass. The safety of the rides here is guaranteed, apart from that, you also pay attention to the weather, so it's best to choose outdoor rides first when it's early and bright. In each area there is a meet and greet with various cartoon character dolls. The schedule can all be seen in the application

name: user_4530
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an incredible theme park located on Sentosa Island in Singapore. It's divided into several themed zones, each offering its own unique attractions and experiences. Here's a description of each zone: Hollywood: As you enter the park, you'll feel like you're walking down the streets of Hollywood with iconic landmarks and entertainment. It's the perfect place for photo opportunities and live performances. New York: Step into the bustling streets of New York City, complete with its famous landmarks like the Statue of Liberty and the New York Public Library. You'll also find themed shops and restaurants in this area. Sci-Fi City: Immerse yourself in the world of futuristic technology and outer space adventures. Here you'll find thrilling rides like Transformers: The Ride and Battlestar Galactica. Ancient Egypt: Transport yourself back in time to ancient Egypt, where you can explore mysterious tombs and encounter fearsome mummies. The Revenge of the Mummy ride is a highlight of this zone. The Lost World: Enter a world of dinosaurs and adventure in The Lost World zone. Experience heart-pounding rides like Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure and Canopy Flyer. Far Far Away: Step into the enchanting world of fairy tales and meet beloved characters from Shrek, Madagascar, and more. Don't miss attractions like Shrek 4-D Adventure and Puss in Boots' Giant Journey. Madagascar: Join Alex, Marty, Gloria, and Melman on a wild adventure through the jungles of Madagascar. This zone features fun-filled attractions suitable for the whole family. Hollywood Dreams Parade: Be sure to catch the colorful Hollywood Dreams Parade, featuring larger-than-life floats and your favorite characters from Universal Studios movies. With its diverse range of themed zones and exciting attractions, Universal Studios Singapore offers a day of non-stop fun and entertainment for visitors of all ages.

name: user_4531
review: Visited during weekday still lots of people here. Place rather small comparing to Japans. Queueing time on average 90 to 100 minutes per facility, which made us decide to purchase the Universal Express, costlier than the admission tickets. Well time is money, if we hadnt purchased UE we might have ended up spending like 6 hours in the queue for around 10 to 15 minutes play at the end of the day. But this happens around the world not only here.

name: user_4535
review: Great place. I recommend the Transformers attraction. A must-see place on the map when visiting Singapore

name: user_4537
review: Go to the queue before the door opens. After entering, go directly to the facilities at the back so you dont have to wait in line for a long time.

name: user_4539
review: Had some fun time, but very crowded during weekends and lot of waiting time. But still a great place kids and family

name: user_4541
review: Buy tickets from outside websites Line up with QR code to enter USS very quickly. Recommended to come on weekdays. And carry a folding umbrella because it's raining. Wear shoes that can get wet. and modesty, such as strappy shoes Many rides allow us to leave the locker next to us for free, such as mummy, roller coaster. As for the Jurassic ride, there are rubber boat seats. Deposit not required But if you're really afraid of getting wet, leave it here. But the deposit fee is quite high. If you want to play everything, I recommend the Express card (Beng ticket), bought separately from the USS entrance ticket. Or will you line up with a single player? Become a reserve when there is only 1 seat left. If you are a Motion Signature ride, don't enter. While waiting in line, there will be a flashing light. and smelled vomit (So the Ministry of Public Health put on a patch of patchouli) 4D player

name: user_4542
review: Superb place. We can enjoy the whole day with family or friends. Variety of games and shows. Many food stalls with fine space to sit and eat tasty foods.

name: user_4545
review: My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me with mixed feelings. Having previously visited the Orlando location, I couldn't help but compare the two. While Universal Studios Singapore offers some enjoyable rides, many felt mediocre compared to Orlando's offerings. For first-time visitors, it's worth a try, especially if you're excited about a new experience. Wait times are generally short (10-15 mins), but consider an express pass on weekends. Overall, it's a decent outing, but not quite on par with Orlando.

name: user_4548
review: I went here all the time when it's holiday, the rides are a never ending fun

name: user_4549
review: Small and compact, you can play for 6-7 hours There are water dispensers in the toilets and queues!

name: user_4550
review: If you have been to other Universal places such as LA or Osaka, I don't think it is a must-go course. Minions and Nintendo World haven't opened yet, so there are fewer rides, but there are a lot of people.

name: user_4553
review: Very fun, but you may have to queue a bit

name: user_4554
review: Placr for all Experience ride Meet n great characters Must rides like transformers one Place for all age group

name: user_4555
review: It's hot and there are too many people. I think Everland in Korea is better.

name: user_4556
review: Kids love it as well as adults. place is clean and staff friendly too. We go there every time we're back with the kids and never fail to enjoy the place.

name: user_4558
review: Universal Studios Singapore! ! When I went there during the summer vacation, the queue to get in was super long! ! But once you get into the park, its fine (because the crowds dispersed), and you must queue up for a fast pass before playing the rides! After getting the fast pass, you will have to wait for about 1 to 2 hours depending on the situation. You can go play other things, take photos, or visit souvenir shops first. The roller coaster was super super fun. I thought I would have to queue for a long time but it only took 30 minutes. We rode the one where our feet were in the air (the other one had a floor to step on, but we didnt get to ride that). It was really fun and you must queue up for it! ! The most exciting roller coaster I've ever ridden!

name: user_4560
review: Universal studios India The service standard in singapore is terrible

name: user_4562
review: Smaller than the US park in Florida, but still lots of fun.

name: user_4563
review: Had a ball here with my girls. Rapid river ride was highlight!

name: user_4564
review: It's superb....plz reached early in the morning if u want to enjoy full of fun

name: user_4566
review: There is a machine at the door where you can buy tickets (you can purchase express passes). Each express pass can only be used once. If you want to sit again after that, you have to change to the general aisle (I'm not sure about the bracelet). The more interesting ones are Transformers, The Adventures of Puss in Shoes, Egypt Double Track, Shrek 4D... On weekdays, you dont have to wait to get through the levels quickly. It's open until 20:00 in the evening, and you can basically play all the key things if you go in in the afternoon.

name: user_4568
review: It was definitely a very interesting experience. We booked the earliest entry at 7:30. After watching the show, the zoo was already dark. It was exciting and thrilling to explore with the children. It was definitely a memory of a lifetime! Worth recommending

name: user_4570
review: Absolutely underground. If you are used to German amusement parks, then it is best to stay away from this amusement park. An overpriced entrance fee combined with bad shows and long waiting times will make you sick. And I mean it seriously, in this heat you'll get sick waiting (of course there's nothing the park can do about that). It's a shame about the one star I had to give.

name: user_4573
review: It's a whole new level of experience coming here. I'm referring to the rides of course but not the level of service. The crew as much as possible are juggling a lot. So their level of services are not that great as expected for an international brand of theme park. Nonetheless it wasn't horrible (far from it in fact) but maybe as guests we are expecting a friendlier service.

name: user_4574
review: Superb and a must visit place in Singapore. Lots of activities to do. Some activities are a real thriller... All the staff there is friendly and helpful. One can really spend entire day long here.

name: user_4575
review: A city divided into worlds. The ticket price is 60, and it is better to add the fast track for approximately 80, to avoid crowding. The games are suitable for adults and children. Some games require putting the bag in a locker for a small fee. The restaurants are many and varied, some of which are halal. Approximately 4 hours are enough to spend time in them.

name: user_4576
review: Good, fast automated ticket counter, very well themed, the decorations are out of this world, was scared couldn't ride everything but the park was pretty empty after around 3-4 PM, the ride estimation was pretty accurate, best ride was Reveng Of The Mummy ,Cylon VS Human coaster from Battlestar Galactica and Transformer The Ride, the Puss In Boots Giant adventure wasn't really worth the queue, the Shrek 4D torture was amazing, it's very immersive

name: user_4577
review: This was one epic experience. Transformers, Mummy, and Jurassic were my top 3 experiences in order. Human and cyclon rides were so much thrilled

name: user_4579
review: Pretty easy vibe on a Sat evening. Surprisingly not very crowded there. The food trucks and performances are good.

name: user_4581
review: Good for kids playing around .

name: user_4582
review: Particularly in Singapore there is no issue of service, but in this place there is not even education, very bad experience. All the game boys very rude!!!

name: user_4583
review: This was one epic experience. I've been to Singapore 5 times and never tried USS. I wish I could've tried this experience much much earlier during my previous visits. Transformers, Mummy, and Jurassic were my top 3 experiences in order. We got an one hour early access pass. So we could avoid the queues for each experience. There were technical issues with some experiences which made us wait to come back later to experience those. (Including the best one, transformers)

name: user_4585
review: We came here with great anticipation and were looking forward to an exciting and eventful day. What we got was a total of hours of waiting in confusing rooms at the individual attractions and ultimately a cancellation on our part because we simply couldn't stand anymore. You're not a young 30-year-old who can stand the endless waiting and standing. At Transformers, at Battlestar Galaktika and in the Temple of the Mummy we queued for well over 3 hours and ultimately saw nothing!!! With such a hefty entrance fee, this was the most expensive wait and the biggest disappointment we have ever experienced. What I found particularly bad was that there was no indication of waiting times in the morning hours. Only when we left the studios in the afternoon, deeply disappointed and pissed off, did we see waiting times (45-80 minutes). I also have to mention that you can and probably should buy express entry (extra entry with shortened waiting times) for 100 SGD per person if you want to experience anything at all in this park and dont want to spend almost the entire time of your stay waiting. Two people 246 SGD for Cable Car and Universal Studios entrance 200 SGD Express 446 SGD Too Much!!!

name: user_4587
review: A great day. Not the biggest universal which is not a Bad thing. Overall entertaining And Clean. Not too many attractions So you have time to visit most of them. Lines were not that Bad on sunday.

name: user_4588
review: Worth every penny paid. All unique rides and experiences. Take your kids if they are at least 5 years old. Always check yours kid's height before deciding whether its worth for you to take them there. Height restrictions are given for each ride on Universal website and app.

name: user_4589
review: It is a very fun tourist attraction. Suitable for all genders and all ages. Traveling is convenient. Both by bus, train, and cable car. There are many types of rides, shows, meet and greets. and lots of things to shop for You can come to the place all day.

name: user_4590
review: I will request whoever comes across my review. Please patiently go through it as it shall help you. If you are visiting this place , make sure you have an entire day only for Universal Studios, and you start very early. From wherever you are staying, you need a taxi/bus till the mount fabre cable ride, or you can go via cab/ mrt to the sentosa resort world station or via bus.. The cable ride costs 35 sgd per person, but other mentioned options are cheap. After you reach the first ticket counter to all the activities you shall realise there are a lot of options. Look at the photo with a list for reference. My suggestion is to not cut any tickets from there if you are visiting Universal as after reaching the universal, you have to stand in line to collect your tickets again. So better cut it after reaching the main gate. Also, it is highly recommended that you book it before, as online tickets are much cheaper, but at the gate, it is 88 sgd per person for the non vip line. To reach the main gate and counter of Universal studio, you take a train from imbaya Station. Now after getting your ticket you should enter the place without any food and water. You have to buy it from inside only after crossing the scanner. After that, as you go for a ride, expect to wait in queue for nothing less than 15 to up to 160 mins. For life-saving hacks for universal, please contact personally. I will give you a complete idea as to how you can cover almost all the rides in universal.

name: user_4593
review: The rides are thrilling overall. When it rains, some attractions stop, but you have to ride some while it rains. Can't use raincoat while riding When entering the island, if you go to the ground level, you have to pay a gate toll of 6, but if you go to the underground casino, you don't have to pay it. So, the local taxi driver said that if you call a taxi from the ground, it won't go.

name: user_4594
review: Entry Tickets are very expensive. Else live shows, mini actions & rides are excellent.

name: user_4596
review: Fun time is SG is less without visiting this theme park. My all-time fave is Transformer, Jurassic and The Mummy! I could not convince my friends to try The Accelerator, and I could not just ride by myself. Next time will surely try it. Need entire day to enjoy this place to the max.

name: user_4597
review: Winter amusement park, the first choice in Asia

name: user_4598
review: The first time you go to USS, my advice is that you should download the USS application so you can find out how long the queue is at each ride. I explored from behind and started at 11am. The rides at the back are still empty and still busy at the front. There are plenty of toilets and tap water so bring your own tumbler. The games are all fun but the best in my opinion are Jurassic Park, Ancient Mummy and Battle Galactica

name: user_4602
review: There's not enough attractions here to warrant VIP or express pass. We were here last year and There's only 1 ride repaired . Universal is constructing something new to the left of the entrance. Maybe next year is better.

name: user_4603
review: Great theme park! 2nd time visite with my kid

name: user_4607
review: go there on weekdays because it gets busy on the weekends! p.s get there early or before the open time

name: user_4608
review: I did the super exciting roller coaster six times

name: user_4609
review: It was soooo much fun! It has 8-9 main attractions but each of it was worth the wait. I think the well known attraction is Galactica which has 30-40 mins line, but definitely worth it. They also provide water tap everywhere so, you wont get dehydrated. Be sure to enter Universal Studio at 10 so the line is so much shorter and you can play all the attractions.

name: user_4611
review: This is my second time to come here for the Universal in Singapore! I really love to enjoy this place. I chose to come the weekday and got the normal ticket and not add for the express ticket so why I had to wait some players almost two hours. Moreover, I knew if I came during Jan that I obtained the a brith day treat because my brith days month. Its worth it to spend my time to get more the positive energy here. My target that I will go every Universal around the world and hopefully I will achieve my target in future

name: user_4612
review: Travelled from Australia! Loved universal studios, all the rides are very child friendly. Excellent crowd control and food court available. Spent the whole day and had a memorable time!!

name: user_4614
review: If possible, you should choose a cloudy day. Worth seeing apart from the waiting times.

name: user_4618
review: Small park but still represents the universe quite well Little wait at attractions

name: user_4619
review: Have been to universal studios in LA . It does have more rides and attractions as compared to Singapore However Been always a pleasure being at universal studios Loved it

name: user_4620
review: This universal studios is kinda small but still fun!ready yourself for 1-3minute rainfall from time to time lol

name: user_4623
review: A fun and enjoyable place to play

name: user_4624
review: Jurrasic park & Transformer are my fav rides here, the minions zone will open zoon in this 2024 , quite sad that we cant experience it in this time. At last, the gift shop is great and cute but a bit expensive, also the food court.

name: user_4627
review: Universal is always a great place to visit. Top top: download the universal studio app and plan your trip and rides etc in advance to make the most of the trip. We went on a Monday morning but the lines for the rides were still 1-2 hours long! If you can get the express pass it really makes a difference

name: user_4628
review: Wait time depends on the ride. Download their app to see the updated wait time and many more!

name: user_4629
review: Excellent place in some rides need to wait nearly 40min. Then express pass also available but costly.

name: user_4631
review: I think it's the smallest Universal Studios among other Universal Studios around the world but still it's such a magical place full of attractions and entertainment.

name: user_4632
review: good place.. and many kind for game n fun

name: user_4633
review: Tip: When you enter and leave, put a stamp on your arm and you can come back in. Arrive at 9:30 on weekdays and wait in line for 30 minutes. Entry begins at 9:50 Transformers - Mummy - Jurassic - Cat and Golden Goose Climbing the tree and riding the lugger (I don't know the name) Takes 1 hour (get on right away without waiting) After eating I got into a cyclone or something scarier and came out at 1 o'clock.

name: user_4634
review: One of the best place to visit when u are in Singapore. We went on Sunday that was weekend & the crowd was horrible. For each ride there was 2-3 hours waiting. 2-3 rides we had skipped due to time issues. I would recommend to visit there on weekdays n also refer to weather conditions, if it is going to rain then avoid to visit because few rides are closed due to rain. Now when u go there just go first to Transformer, the best one , don't skip, Second the Mummy & then go for cyclone for trilling experience. One thing I would I like to mention is that though u buy express pass n visit on weekends then u have to wait for at least an hour for each ride. Must visit place & beautiful experience.

name: user_4636
review: Chilla thrills and loads of fun... Exciting coaster rides, wonderful shows.. Fantastic

name: user_4637
review: If you want a "worth it" experience, visit the park on weekdays and be there very early.

name: user_4639
review: I get Fast Lane and it was worth it

name: user_4640
review: Singapore's Universal Studios is a captivating blend of thrilling rides, immersive attractions, and cinematic magic. The park offers a delightful experience for visitors of all ages, combining the charm of Hollywood, the glamour of New York, the mystique of Ancient Egypt, and the excitement of Sci-Fi City. The attention to detail in the park's design is impressive, with each zone transporting visitors to different cinematic worlds. From the adrenaline-pumping roller coasters in the Sci-Fi City to the enchanting atmosphere of the Far Far Away Kingdom, there's a diverse range of attractions to cater to various tastes. One of the highlights is the cutting-edge technology used in rides such as Transformers: The Ride 3D and the incredible animatronics in the Revenge of the Mummy roller coaster. The live shows, like WaterWorld and the engaging street performances, add an extra layer of entertainment to the experience. Navigating the park is made easy with clear signages and helpful staff. The variety of dining options, from themed restaurants to casual eateries, ensures there's something to satisfy every palate. While the park can get crowded, especially during peak times, the efficiency of ride operations minimizes wait times. Universal Studios Singapore is not merely a theme park; it's a cinematic adventure that captivates visitors with its creativity and entertainment. Whether you're a movie buff, thrill-seeker, or just looking for a fun day out, Universal Studios Singapore delivers a memorable and magical experience for everyone.

name: user_4641
review: When visiting during an open run or just before closing, you can board the ride within 5 minutes.

name: user_4642
review: Mixed Experience at Universal Studios Singapore I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore, and while the overall experience was enjoyable, there were a few drawbacks that need attention. I would recommend everyone to get the tickets via their website as it offers 1 hour early access. The park offers a thrilling array of rides and attractions, creating a captivating atmosphere for visitors. However, my excitement took an unexpected turn when we got stuck on one of the rides (the Transformers). The staff kept us updated and we were given an express pass as compensation. This hiccup slightly dampened the experience, highlighting a need for better maintenance and operational efficiency. Another ride went again into maintenance after we reached the front of the queue after waiting half n hour, another disappointment (The chase of the mummy) On the culinary front, the variety of food options was commendable, but I couldn't ignore the steep prices. The expensive food choices were a drawback, making it less budget-friendly for visitors. It would be beneficial for the park management to reconsider pricing strategies to enhance the overall value for guests. Additionally, while most staff members were helpful, I encountered instances where a bit more politeness could have made a difference. Improving staff interactions would undoubtedly contribute to a more positive and memorable visitor experience. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore offers a fantastic time with its attractions, but addressing issues like ride maintenance, food pricing, and staff politeness would elevate the overall guest satisfaction.

name: user_4643
review: Roller coaster ride has thrilling experience

name: user_4644
review: I liked everything very much. I recommend visiting.

name: user_4645
review: Kids love it and adults are satisfied too. Riding Transformers was so thrilling and satisfying, but riding Mummy was so exciting. It's the best.

name: user_4647
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a dazzling theme park, and my visit was full of admiration for the amazing rides, exciting shows and unique atmosphere. First of all, Universal Studios rides are extremely diverse. Various thrilling roller coasters and themed areas based on classic movies, each area exudes a different charm. In particular, Universal Studios Singapore's charming architecture and high-quality rides provide visitors with an ultimate ride experience. Secondly, the theaters performances are amazing. From dazzling musicals to stunt performances, each show is full of visual and auditory shocks. I particularly enjoyed the interactive performances where I met various interesting characters. This sense of participation made the whole tour more lively and interesting. Finally, the environment and atmosphere of Universal Studios are just as captivating. Each area carefully presents scenes from classic movies, as if you have entered the fantasy world of the movie. In addition, the park has a wealth of themed restaurants and shops, providing visitors with a complete entertainment experience. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a dreamy place full of magic and fun. This place not only satisfies tourists' desire for adventure, but also brings a deep understanding of the art of film. This tour was truly an adventure full of laughter and wonder.

name: user_4649
review: It was a great place to celebrate your new year, mine was my birthday this year. I love theme park, and having to experience all the attraction in one day it was just perfect celebration. You may want to come here during a week after new year, less people but full of fun. Best ride goes to Galactica the human and cyclon entrances. You can buy entrance ticket on the spot, but if you want to buy the free pass ticket, i suggest you to buy it in advance from the official website, or apps like traveloka

name: user_4651
review: Amazing place. Really enjoy it, the rides. Defo recommended spending the extra money on express passes. Had a brilliant day.

name: user_4653
review: It's smaller than other universals, so you can get around quickly and there's no need for the express.

name: user_4654
review: Just amazing. Must visit ! And if you can, get the express tickets, especially if you go on a weekend.

name: user_4655
review: Just a visit , one day i will spend my whole day in universal studios singapore

name: user_4658
review: Its a really small Universal Studios with very convenient transportation. But you have to queue up for each one, and the popular ones take at least 2 hours. The Egyptian area is very beautiful and shocking

name: user_4661
review: Spent a good time in the theme park but the wait time for 1 ride is so long even in a weekday if you want to play alot i recommend to buy a express pass you will save alot of time. What i love about this theme park is there is a very interesting theme on every attaction which well made and make the ride more interesting. The park is a little bit on the small size.

name: user_4662
review: One of unforgettable moment in USS. highly recommended to have a Universal express unlimited to avoid long queues in holiday season. all the rides is very enjoyable.

name: user_4664
review: Family entertainment

name: user_4665
review: Invite the family..

name: user_4666
review: World class, magnificient, adventurous, wonderful awesome experience. True fun and enjoyment.

name: user_4667
review: This has been my favorite location so far. Big enough to have a day full of fun. Restaurants are good and the rides were nice

name: user_4670
review: The cost is very high for such attractions. The queue is over an hour even on weekdays. There are queues even in cafes. I do not recommend visiting.

name: user_4673
review: The small and exquisite Universal Studios allows me to use every facility

name: user_4674
review: I pay in advanced the ticket not to do queues. It was a very good decision! Universal studios Singapore was an awesome plan to do with my partner in our 30s.

name: user_4678
review: Buy universal express pass no matter when you are going as it'll save u a lot of time! If u are a foreigner then buy tickets and express passes together with your passport details and claim GST refund while getting out of SG. You'll get GST refund if amount is greater than 100 SGD and if you have entered passport number while invoicing.

name: user_4679
review: All Staf is good especially the one that sell the pop corn...Sis Sandar...very polite and respect others...

name: user_4681
review: all the fun you can have, it's worth

name: user_4684
review: Much better than Disney land. Water world rocks.

name: user_4685
review: I visited Universal Orlando and Los Angeles its much bigger than this one.. but has some of its rides like Transformers and The Mummy.. which is good .... Its great place to visited, tried the food there its nice and has Halal choices which is great .. we bought the express pass to skip the queue but some of the rides dont let you in and have to take queue with the normal queue.. which they didnt tell you this from the beginning.. it has prayer room which really great

name: user_4687
review: The rainy season has passed but there has been no rain. Although the park is not big, it is still full of content. It is very convenient to book tickets online and swipe the order barcode to enter the park directly. You can check the app to see where there are few people and go to play first. It is less time-consuming. After 6 o'clock, there are almost no people in the popular facilities. You can play when you walk in. The performances are also very exciting.

name: user_4688
review: The park is good enough to spend the whole day seeing all the attractions and enjoying the fun rides. Wait Times at adventurous rides is more than an hour even during weekdays and the staff managing at rides is one of the worst experience. People with Express pass have a huge advantage as the get VVIP treatment at the queues. Whereas the Regular entry is served as "delay pass". Also, there is lack of proper ventilation(Fans/ACs in the waiting Queues that one could faint of suffocation because of high humidity & crowd. Park Management seriously needs to take actions to improve this or keep only EXPRESS ENTRY for everyone! Because the ones who aren't paying for express are paying there by frustration and inconvenience!

name: user_4689
review: Very fun experience. You will need the whole day for sure. Its good thats its not just for kids but adults as well!

name: user_4690
review: Great attractions for its size and worth every penny. But if you have some extra dollars to spend, definitely get the express pass. Tried almost every rides with no queue, we even got on the Battlestar Galactica 6 times and still had time for other rides (normal queue is 50-130 minutes) Visited on Monday low season

name: user_4692
review: We went on a weekday on 1/24, thinking there would be less people, but it turned out there were still a lot of people. When we lined up for the rafting facilities, we had been queuing for almost an hour and finally it was our turn. It turned out that there was something wrong with the equipment and it was over. There was no compensation plan at all. , the child was so disappointed that he burst into tears on the spot. It was really bad. My friend also encountered the same problem when he went to queue for Transformers, and there was no compensation. The company can issue priority passes to those of us who have worked hard to queue for a long time! Just for this facility, wouldnt such a simple treatment be enough? There are no staff to manage the queuing area. There are a lot of people jumping in line. Are the people who line up obediently all idiots? What a bunch of substandard adults. I will never go there again, nor will I recommend it to my friends. It was an expensive and unpalatable lunch!

name: user_4693
review: Went on Monday and managed to ride all attractions. But I don't like the donkey show as it is not appropriate for the kids / muslim community to let a couple kiss in public during the show. Even if it's just a smooch.

name: user_4694
review: There are many people in the garden and things are expensive. If you dont want to queue up, buy first.

name: user_4695
review: It's not big. I came in a little late, around 11 o'clock, and played until 7 o'clock and left. The water show is great! The scary rides are Mummy and Cyclone Human. Transformers are fun

name: user_4696
review: Second time visiting Universal studios. Thrilling rides, amazing experience. Started with the Transformer ride, then the mummy ride and then went for Jurassic world. Was surprised, as we went for transformers we were told there was some technical snag and ride was cancelled indefinitely for the day. Just as we were about to leave they started allowing people back again. Mummy ride should not be missed. Around 1.15 pm just as we were strolling the park the water world show was about to start. Luckily we were just near. I enjoyed the show. It's amazing to see their clean choreographed act. In between this decided to do the spaghetti sesame street ride. The queue was big but the ride was not worth it. Because its for small kids :P next we saw the Light camera action show by Steven Spielberg. It shows how a movie scene is made. It shows a cyclone hitting a city. Look out for the character greet and meet. They have specific timings. We saw Gru from indespicable me, Maurice from Madagascar, Sesame street characters. There was one dance show around the corner but we missed it twice [sigh] At last the two rides which will make u feel ur money worth The Galactica Cyclone and the Human. Did both one after another. Its gets your adrenaline rush instantaneously. There are lockers all around the rides which are free for use upto 20-45 min. There are plenty of restaurant options u can try. Worth visiting if u r in Singapore.

name: user_4697
review: i love the ride! especially the mummy one. recommend to buy express oneadmission. so no need to queue

name: user_4702
review: Themed Hollywood movie park with land rides and few water rides. Huge queue in the morning sessions in front of major attractions.

name: user_4703
review: I have alot of fun in Universal Studios Singapore. the rides and roller coaster are fun. come during Halloween month, there are special events at night. easy transport to the park from city.

name: user_4704
review: Great day out with the family would be good to get the fast pass if possible lines were about an hour long in a week day

name: user_4706
review: Nothing exceptional, park is old , food is hugely overpriced and unworthy mostly . Transformers ride was good and May be the roller coaster but thats it . Funnily enough there were queues in the express side as well.

name: user_4707
review: Fun day at Universal studios! I really recommend getting the Universal express unlimited which is a fast pass for all the rides. We had a smooth experience because of it. Favorite rides were Galatica, Puss and boots, and Revenge of the Mummy! Can't wait to go again for the minions and Nintendo extension!

name: user_4709
review: This is the famous amusement park in Sentosa Island. Many rides with various categories here. It is almost impossible to try all of the rides without fast-track ticket. For example, to be able to ride the roller coaster with reguler ticket will cost almost 2 hours queuing. So I think it is better to spend more money than to waste time.

name: user_4710
review: I only visited the globe outside as I was actually visiting the water park and aquarium. Many people went in and came out looking happy and had enjoyed themselves. If I had more time in Singapore I would definitely of gone but it is something I can do next time.

name: user_4713
review: Awesome place, must visit, I have taken express card which had helped me to excuse the que... it's bit expensive but it gives the pleasure to be in 1st and also it will help to attend other activities. Inside u will get food hub.. lots of activity and rides also. since we have taken Hard rock hotel it was easy to walk in to universal whenever u want to see but till 9.30 to 10pm last light off.

name: user_4715
review: Small version of Universal studios with some unique rides and lands. It was a very fun park to visit. If you can get the early park access you can get a lot done before the park even opens. I really liked the Waterworld show and the lights camera action shows. The battle star galactica ride is awesome. The human side is a more mellow side and the cylon side is more intense. I bought the express pass and wished I hadn't because I only used it once. So maybe buy in the park I stead of in advance. If you have some time, you should hit this park just outside the city.

name: user_4716
review: having a good time. must try transformers ride

name: user_4717
review: Because I went to Universal Studios on a weekday during the winter vacation, there were a lot of tourists, and there were also some children teaching outside the school. There were seven areas in the park, namely Egypt, New York, Science Fiction City, Madagascar, Hollywood, and Far Far Away Kingdom. Because it is the smallest Universal Studios in the world, there are relatively few facilities compared to other Universal Studios. However, Shrek and other facilities are quite enjoyable. My favorite is Transformers. For most facilities, you have to queue for a long time (some are twenty minutes, and Transformers takes two hours), but the long queue is worth it. Be careful of people who jump in the queue. They will jump in when you are not paying attention. Their quality is really low. Others have to wait for so long and they still jump in the queue. I hope no one will be jumped in the queue again.

name: user_4718
review: Experience of a lifetime. Buying universal express ticket will save a lot of time and youll be able to enjoy all rides.

name: user_4719
review: A place where I didn't know time passed

name: user_4720
review: Enjoyed it a lot.. Just make sure you don't go there on a day with even slight chances of rain as outdoor rides might be closed

name: user_4722
review: Visited Universal Studios on Friday. Wasnt too busy. We had a wonderful time and defo going back every time we in Singapore

name: user_4724
review: Absolutely an amazing experience. Great food choices and great rides and shops.

name: user_4725
review: It is very small compared to Disney or Universal in Japan. If I have an express ticket, I can ride in 5 hours. On weekdays from Monday to Wednesday, 5 hours is enough to purchase tickets. Tuesday recommendation.

name: user_4726
review: Amusement Park as very popular & expensive & hot & so crowded..

name: user_4727
review: Playground for roller coaster lovers. But if you don't want a roller coaster, there are still lots of rides you can enjoy. For 4D, it's really great. The water world show is also interesting to watch. Lots of lockers to store bags if you want to go on wet rides or roller coasters. If you don't want to get wet, bring a disposable raincoat. If you want to buy inside, you can, but the price is 6 . For food, lots of choices. The price is pretty good in rupiah. But delicious. Don't forget to bring a tumbler because there are lots of places to fill drinking water.

name: user_4730
review: 10/10 Very fun. Recommend Transformers. But if you like scary things, I recommend Mummy, almost Khit. It's best to buy an Express ticket or a solo ticket. If you're going with friends, it's recommended to just go with 2 people, so you'll be able to enter faster than many people.

name: user_4732
review: A fun place to spend the day. Well designed, with 6 themed zones. Its smaller than the studios at other locations, but its worth a visit. The food options arent all that great.

name: user_4735
review: It's small, but cute and nice. I recommend going when it opens in the morning. The waiting time gets longer as the afternoon goes on. I highly recommend Water World. I highly recommend Express Pass.

name: user_4741
review: Unforgettable Experience at Universal Studios Singapore! My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore left me thoroughly impressed and exhilarated. The sheer magnitude of entertainment, thrilling rides, and immersive attractions make it an absolute must-visit destination in Singapore. For those seeking the ultimate experience, I highly recommend investing in the Express Ticket. This proved to be a game-changer, allowing me to bypass long queues and make the most of my time enjoying the rides and shows. The convenience and time savings with the Express Ticket ensured a stress-free and memorable adventure. Beyond the attractions, Universal Studios Singapore boasts a diverse range of food options. From delightful snacks to hearty meals, there's something to satisfy every palate. The variety and quality of culinary offerings add an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience. The attention to detail in each themed zone is truly commendable, transporting visitors to different worlds with every step. The well-executed shows and interactive experiences make it a joy for visitors of all ages. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute gem, offering an unparalleled blend of excitement, entertainment, and gastronomic delights. If you're planning a trip to Singapore, make sure to include Universal Studios in your itinerary, and consider upgrading to the Express Ticket for a truly exceptional and hassle-free adventure!

name: user_4743
review: We did the VIP package as a family of 4. Although it worked out to be 1500AU, It was awesome! I dont think we would have been able to see everything in one day with our 6&8 year olds if we didnt do it. We were able to do some rides twice as you also get a fast pass included to use once the tour is over. You receive vouchers which covered our lunch and some merchandise. We would definitely do it again.

name: user_4745
review: The name says it self. Its all different universe. The best experience so far. Worth to visit atleast once in a lifetime. Mummy park and transformers part is beyond imagination.

name: user_4746
review: We enjoyed universal studios. Was great being in off season as it resulted in us going on all rides we wanted and some twice.
