Gift shops we felt were lacking in interesting choices for but our young son was very happy with the stuffed toys! Adult things lacking. Ie options of shirts etc as memorabilia. Not as much as universal in America and mostly rides based but we did enjoy.

name: user_4747
review: Went there in Dec. Open time 10am to 9pm. Waiting too long for favourite rides. We went for transformer, battlestar galactica and spagetthi chase at night so no waiting time. We didnt ride canopy flyer because long waiting time and revenge of the mummy as it was high speed and not suitable for my son. Madagascar section was closed and will be replaced with minion. Bought tickets thru klook with food combo and retail voucher. Very expensive locker rental at SGD30 for big locker.

name: user_4750
review: Great ! You should arrive for the opening with fewer people. Planning a picnic saves time and money!

name: user_4752
review: Jan 2024 Pre purchased tickets and got there at the opening. Managed to do both Battlestar roller coasters, mummy and 2 Jurassic park rides in hour and a half. Then took our time to attend shows and other experiences. Did transformers on way out, time at entrance said 60 minute wait. We were in and out in 20. Great day out.

name: user_4754
review: Fun Park In the Fun Park, thrills abound, Roller coasters galore, screams resound. For those who shy away from rides most wild, Jurassic Park and Sci Fi City, food that beguiled. Gigantic sundaes and sculptures grand, Egyptian wonders in a magical land. Pose with a Transformer, a photo to keep, Talking to you, memories run deep. Souvenir shops, a treasure trove of delight, Cute, practical, fancy, choices so bright. AJ suggests to the Park Parades by characters to greet fans

name: user_4755
review: Boring, same attractions as 10 years ago. Long waits for rides. No atmosphere. Waste of money.

name: user_4757
review: I couldn't ride much, but it was fun to ride in the rain.

name: user_4760
review: A super awesome place in Sentosa. Plenty of rides and shows. I highly recommend the place. Aware of the height restrictions if you are traveling with your child. And free entry for kids below 4 years old.

name: user_4761
review: Minion park in construction progress will come back again

name: user_4763
review: A great place that combines food, entertainment, shopping and accommodation. Let the whole family enjoy it

name: user_4764
review: Amazing but make sure to wear comfortable shoe

name: user_4766
review: Awesome And all my Guests from India Enjoyed a lot ..

name: user_4768
review: Awesome fun filled day, get you Tourist Transport card that allows multiple usage per day to use the Metro Rails, Bus Fare is 2 to Santosa, enjoy your day with all the rides and food

name: user_4769
review: USS is what it is abbreviated to. The first impression was quite cool, as soon as we entered, all vehicles were directed to the bus parking which turned out to be in the basement. Go up the escalator, then you will meet the UNIVERSAL Globe Ball (everyone's favorite photo spot). Because we use a tour vendor, all USS ticket accommodation is facilitated, just check in at the gate. This is on a weekday, it's quite busy but comfortable enough for photos. The prices of food, snacks and other snacks here are quite expensive, in Singapore Dollars, prepare enough funds, master cards, QR payments, cash are also still accepted. There are lockers available to store luggage or other things if you want to enter the vehicle, provided that without any luggage, cellphones, coins, raincoats, shoe covers, even mountain shoes must be removed. If you don't want to queue, you can use an Express Card, there are several options for just 1 ride, or several rides but you can only play 1 time, or unlimited (the latter apparently can cost up to 200 Singapore Dollars). Don't forget for those who drink a lot, there are drinking water refill spots for tumblers or direct drinks. So all toilets, clean and comfortable. There are quite a lot of tables in the restaurant/cafe, there's still a chance of getting a table quickly, unless it's peak season, school holidays or something else. The price of food at the restaurant I went to was in the range of 20 - 40 Singapore Dollars, not including drinks. When I came in January, it rained all day starting at 1 pm, you had to prepare a rain coat, shoe cover and bag cover. It's comfortable going around the rides, and it turns out that what used to be a waiting list of 60-100 minutes in heavy rain conditions has become around 5 minutes!!! You should install the USS application in Playstore, so you can monitor updates on waiting times for each ride. Happy holiday.

name: user_4770
review: I enjoyed every bit of my trip to universal studio Singapore although it was my third time at Universal it was equally exciting and fun like the first time

name: user_4771
review: Best Entertainment Place for Family & Kids.

name: user_4772
review: very good place 4 children

name: user_4773
review: Embarking on a full-day adventure at Universal Studios Singapore proved to be an exhilarating experience, offering a perfect blend of shows, rides, and cinematic wonder. Securing the one-hour early entry ticket (9 AM) was a game-changer, allowing me to explore at least five attractions before the crowds descendeda practical and cost-effective choice compared to the pricier express ticket. While most of the rides boasted minimal wait times, a brief snarl at Battlestar Galactica added an unexpected twist. A croc slipper mishap caused a 30-minute delay, turning a 10-minute wait into 40 minutes. However, this hiccup aside, the majority of attractions featured wait times ranging from 5 to 40 minutes, depending on the time of day. The WaterWorld show, a captivating spectacle, became a highlight of the day with two performances, and catching the 1:30 PM show proved to be a rewarding choice. The Jurassic Park area offered a culinary respite, though prices were steepa common theme in amusement parks. Despite the cost, the food was delectable, living up to the "amusement park pricing" standard. In retrospect, my early entry strategy, coupled with the occasional waits and memorable shows, made the day at Universal Studios Singapore an unforgettable experiencea journey through cinematic magic and thrills.

name: user_4777
review: Kid-Friendly Magic at Universal Studios Singapore Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic playground for kids. The colorful and immersive environment, filled with beloved movie characters, kept my little ones wide-eyed with wonder. The variety of rides and attractions were well-suited for different age groups, providing endless excitement. From meeting favorite characters to thrilling rides, the park offers a delightful mix of entertainment. While some queues were inevitable, the overall experience was seamless, and the staff's friendliness added to the positive atmosphere. Family-friendly dining options made it easy to refuel between adventures. Universal Studios Singapore is undeniably a great place for kids, offering a magical day out that balances thrills with enchanting moments. A solid four-star experience for family fun!

name: user_4779
review: I went there with an elementary school boy. I made a reservation through Klook and went there. Because it was a weekday, Thursday, the express service was not disconnected. If you are using it on the weekend, it would be better to use the express service. Puss in Boots is surprisingly fun. It was even better because it was a place where movies and entertainment came together.

name: user_4785
review: Singapore was rainy season, so outdoor attractions were suspended whenever it rained. The notice of the suspension occurred three times, so I was only able to ride one attraction during my visit. I understand universal studios' safety guidelines, but I'll never visit again because staffs just said sorry and didn't compensate. They didn't value the customer's time to wait meaninglessly. Also, I don't think it's reasonable to pay the same fee as other customers who visited when the weather was nice because we used less than half of the service compared to them. Does it make sense to stay for six hours and ride a single attraction?

name: user_4786
review: Great family time in Universal Studios. Transformers 4D ride is the best!

name: user_4790
review: Not too busy, the Cylon ride was the best

name: user_4791
review: Incredible place to hangover for a whole day fun.. Ensure to spend additional 10 dollars for Universal pass which will straightaway take you to any ride without any 40mins queue.. You will definitely be thrilled enough for whatever u pay... Plenty of foodie options

name: user_4792
review: The show was fantastic and you cant come to universal studios and not see the display they put on. Highly recommended and the staff and actors are so friendly and put on an incredible show for everyone. Great entertainment before the show starts as well.

name: user_4793
review: Singapore host the first and only Universal Studios in Southeast Asia that has been the one of the five around the world. Want to stay forever young? Let explore the 6 theme parks of Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, and Far Far Away

name: user_4794
review: Very beautifully planned and the rides are great too. Make sure to try the Mummy and Transformer rides.

name: user_4795
review: Visited USS a few weeks ago. It was good, not too crowded so the queue for each attraction was quite fast.

name: user_4797
review: One of the best attractions in Singapore. Had an amazing time in Universal Studios. Its mesmerising and you need a complete day to explore it. Never miss the Transformers ride and Waterworld stunt show.

name: user_4798
review: Although it is small, you can enjoy it enough. Waiting times for attractions vary depending on popularity. On the day I went, the wait was about an hour at most. It was fun! !

name: user_4800
review: A must-visit course for travel to Singapore! I had fun with Mujeheon Express. But it's smaller than I thought and there aren't many people, so just taking the express is enough! I think I rode the Space Galactica Cyclone 4 times. Front seat required

name: user_4801
review: Good times. It was smaller than Hollywood and Osaka, but it was cheap and suitable for a short day of fun. Universal is always fun. If you want thrills, go for the Cyclone.

name: user_4802
review: The almost 5 stars here are definitely not justified. We were there on a Monday in mid-January and the waiting times were still forever. The queues are led confusingly around 1000 corners so that you can't see how long they are. This isn't a fun park, it's a waiting park. At least 2 attractions had breaks due to maintenance work. If you want to come for just under 60, take a few photos of the scenery and spend several hours in queues, you should go.

name: user_4803
review: First time ever visiting a Universal Studios, rides were amazing, the setup and the themes were really cool. Highly recommend to book tickets in advance and if possible, get an Express Pass as it's very crowded on most weekdays also. But overall a really wonderful place, enjoyed a lot with supportive staffs to guide us across the place

name: user_4806
review: We went there today. I bought the Mastercard special promo for 4 adults around S83 as it gave a free gift from the universal studio gift shop. It was just the smallest fridge magnet. Not worth it. Included in the ticket was an hour early entry before the place opened at 10am. It was quite up until 11am then got busy. Wait time was around 5 to 30 mins. We had done all the rides with 2 to 3 hours including some shows.Place looks a little run down some rides and shops didnt open til after 10am so paying for an hour early entry wasnt worth the trouble. It was rainy and ponchos were S6 which I thought was expensive. Even though the tickets states strictly no outside food , I saw a lot of people eating food/drinks they had bought from home. And yes food is very expensive inside universal. There are some lockers which are free for 45 mins and then you get charged afterwards. These are located near the revenge of the mummy ride some staff were friendly but most were grumpy and not helpful. I mean it was good not great. Like I was done in 3 hours and then we just looked around. Live performances and photos with characters was good but if you want to buy a photo ,it ranged from S30 upwards. We bought our photo with a transformer, with a frame for S50 . We took the bus to Vivo city then monorail return ticket around S4 each to Sentosa island. On the way back we came to vivo city and took a Grab ride home which is the cheaper way to travel. If you want to use grab download the app no credit card needed just pay the driver cash. Weve used it in 3 different countries, Thailand Malaysia Singapore.

name: user_4814
review: Waste of money!!! Very not worth it!!! Rides consistently suspend and says techincal difficulties. We wasted our money and time here

name: user_4818
review: We had a great time at Universal Studios Singapore. It wasn't too packed or overcrowded. We enjoyed our time.

name: user_4820
review: Tickets are expensive but the park is small If you go during non-peak season (early January), you can complete the whole thing in about 2 and a half hours. Many facilities require you to store things, although the first 45 minutes are free (but why not give them lockers) There arent many shops

name: user_4821
review: There is no need to purchase express tickets on weekdays. Except for famous Scu-fi attractions, the waiting time is less than 30 minutes. As with all amusement parks, it is recommended to eat outside if possible.

name: user_4824
review: Good theme park with nicely themed rides. The rollercoasters are not that good, except Mummy the ride. All dark rides are well done and fun. Compared to other universal studios, this one is the weakest.

name: user_4825
review: I always wanted to visit a Universal studio and glad I did. Singapore studio is a fantastic place for young and old. As a lover of the Transformers franchise of movie I was hesitant to take the 3 D experience Ride, Eavan at the age of 63 I totally enjoyed the experience. From the replication of streets of Hollywood to the amazing and somewhat scary roller coster rides to the family friendly theatres and shows for kids this was a must for our trip to Singapore. Ticket prices are all inclusive and well worth 96 sg dollars for Adults. I would recommend setting aside a full day to be able to see and experience as much possible .

name: user_4826
review: Without priority pass it is a pain not a joy

name: user_4828
review: A lot fun for the children and parents too.

name: user_4830
review: We enjoyed all the theme parks and rides though the long queue takes a lot of our time. What I like the most is the THE MUMMY ride. I'm amazed by the effects, it's soo artistic. And the roller coaster rides. Im more shocked at the fact that there are kids who can ride it and seem unfazed after. I think i cussed and shouted a lot during my ride. I will never forget that ride. There's a lot of free rides so if you're gonna visit its better to check them all. Try the spaghetti rides for a warm up then the transformer(fyi, you can take your glasses off if you're too afraid of the effects, just dont drop them). We enjoyed our visit and the weather that day was great.

name: user_4832
review: Universal was great. We got the VIP Package where a guide takes you to all the rides and gets you on first- No waiting at all. They take you through back doors right to the front, its awesome. Our guide, her name was Gladys and she was just amazing. We did all the rides in Universal and sometimes more than once. Highly recommend getting the VIP experience.

name: user_4835
review: Had a blast during our last visit. Even its raining we are lucky that all the ride is open. Crowded on a rainy Thursday. Friendly staffs especially the one at Transformer photo booth. Long Q was manage well.

name: user_4836
review: Expensive, expensive, expensive. Early access tickets available starting at 9:00 (sold on official website) Prices are the same. Even if you go early, only Sesame Street and Transformers are available for attractions. If you go early and there are no problems, it is good to rent a place and take pictures when there are no people around.

name: user_4840
review: Friday was pretty crowded Unable to get unlimited pass on that day. Weather matters, so do check the weather forecast before going!

name: user_4841
review: Everyone will be impressed with this name and want to come visit again, right?

name: user_4845
review: I had a good ride without waiting in line.

name: user_4848
review: Coming in December is very fun because there are lots of Christmas themed knick-knacks everywhere. Didn't have time to enter the USS because I had children and limited time. But I've been to the USS before, there were lots of interesting games, meet and greets with lots of characters and the most interesting thing was lots of shops themed around children's favorite characters like Minion, Shreek, Elmo, etc.

name: user_4850
review: Awesome. Been waiting to visit this place for sometime now. Wasn't disappointed. Items in the gift/souvenir shops are kinda pricey though (due to MYR to SGD rates).

name: user_4851
review: Good attractions, some exclusive to Singapore like the Sesame Street ride, the Puss in Boots rollercoaster, or the Battlestar Galactica coasters. But the service is quite bad. We were there on a very slow day, with most of the park empty, and the Battlestar Galactica coasters were operating with only one train - which brought waiting time to 30, 40 minutes when the other attractions had a maximum waiting time of 10. Felt like they were slowing down operations to sell more Express Passes. Service is very slow in restaurants as well, and most photo stands for the attractions were not working. Theres also no nighttime show, neither a lot of street entertainment. The major show in the park - Waterworld - happens once a day only. Its the smallest Universal park in the world, and it couldve been so much better if operations were good, and if there was more entertainment and showtimes.

name: user_4855
review: Brilliant family day adventure with something for everyone & the entertainment lasted right until the end of the day - AWESOME!

name: user_4856
review: Very fun! Loved the human, the mummy and the transformers ride! 9/10

name: user_4860
review: The game is a bit slow, in 3/4 hours you can go around all the universals

name: user_4862
review: fun place to play, please visit

name: user_4865
review: The size of Universal Studio is not as big as the one in LA, USA, but it is still enjoyable.

name: user_4869
review: We went for an impromptu visit to Universal Studios Singapore and had already expected a high crowd as it was a day before Christmas. The overall experience at Universal Studios Singapore was a mix of excitement and frustration. Despite the thrilling rides and attractions, - ticket prices were jaw-breaking expensive, costing almost 200 for 2 adults and 1 child - dining experience was hectic with long queues and limited seats especially over at Mel's Drive. This made it challenging for us to enjoy a relaxed meal with our kids. Restaurants could have offered food with various texture suitable for all ages (e.g. porridge) to enhance its family-friendly atmosphere. Food and drinks are also outrageously pricey (which is expected). - push carts could have offered a wider range of halal food options to accommodate a more diverse visitor base with various dietary preferences. - there were significant wait times for the rides/ shows. Additionally, lack of child-friendly activities, limiting options for families with younger children. - outcome of the photo-taking at "Sci-Fi City" with "Optimus Prime" was a disappointment as the image turned out to be dark. The low visibility at night hindered the clarity of the photo and this was captured using both our phone and even with their camera. - restrooms appeared to be inadequately maintained, with dirty toilet cubicles and lack of toilet paper. - drying pod can be too warm for tall people (could have indicate a sign outside to warn users of the heat they might expect upon use). Nonetheless, it was still a memorable experience for us as we did not hold any expectations on experiencing the rides and shows with the high crowd (which finally settled down late afternoon). We were impressed that: - there was a prayer space provided for Muslims, - almost every attraction has a water cooler, - the performances were energetic and lively, - there was good crowd control for character meet-and-greet. We hope this feedback can contribute to improvements in the overall experience at Universal Studios Singapore and we also hope to see a more variety of shows and activities suitable for various age groups.

name: user_4870
review: Had a blast at USS, went on both the battlestar galactica rides and they were very thrilling, a must do! Dont miss the Trolls show, Donkey live, a stand out for us. Also the transformers and revenge of the mummy rides were very good too

name: user_4871
review: Recommended for family & thrill seekers. Go on weekdays if you want to avoid long wait or paying extra for express pass, Halloween Night is recommended too, but it can be extremely crowded (especially weekend).

name: user_4872
review: Small but packed with fun, enough to visit all the attractions in a day

name: user_4874
review: Awesome place...you need enough time to visit. The shows are exciting

name: user_4876
review: I'm sure all positive ratings for this one. It's definitely an experience for all those who like theme parks associated with films. Range of rides for kids and adults and a number of great attractions and side activities. Lots of food options, though not all are great.

name: user_4877
review: It's an expensive experience, you should only bother every 10 years or so. In SG, it's hot, humid, food choices are limited and expensive. 4 stars only because the staff are polite, the park feels safe and it's clean.

name: user_4878
review: It was a Fun filled day with enjoyment for the entire family, the right mix of entertainment and experiences to please every age group in the family. It was worth spending the money, and value is given back at the venue in many forms of rides and experiences. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance. the ticketing system onsite is horrible because of long queue and automatic machines that do not work at any given time.

name: user_4880
review: It is recommended that children under 6 years old not come because many amusement facilities have height restrictions, and many are roller coaster-style, and the level of excitement is not suitable for children.

name: user_4882
review: Suggestion to visit : weekday. We visited USS while Singapore rain all day long so the visitor was not busy enough. Queueing line wasn't long, about max. 20 minutes

name: user_4884
review: A relaxing family walk...

name: user_4886
review: Really fun albeit a bit small. I recommended the express pass to get full enjoyment from the rides.

name: user_4887
review: Must been visited. Express option recommended.

name: user_4892
review: If you can afford, buy Universal Express tickets for less waiting time

name: user_4894
review: Many ride are closed when it near raing. so i missed many of them. Transformer is the best i play it twice Food are in high price

name: user_4895
review: Great place for kids. The rides are amazing. You can easily spend a day here and lot of nice places to eat. Be prepared for sudden rains, would definitely recommend an umbrella or a raincoat from one of the stores. The places to eat were pretty good. The best rides were Cyclone and Jurassic park. Far far away is a lot of fun for kids. Dont miss the water world show, its awesome. Overall a great place but would highly recommend getting an express pass as the wait can get quite frustrating.

name: user_4900
review: Never miss this place.. Especially with kids . Min height is 122 cm for entry in rides for kids.

name: user_4902
review: This is very good entertainment place. One can enjoy the complete visit and cherish

name: user_4903
review: I highly recommend Transformers: The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle. You can enjoy it all day long.

name: user_4905
review: A great day out with plenty of rides. Not being able to take your own food and drinks is a big downside but we managed to get a voucher online which made it much more reasonable. Also, they didn't actually check our bags so you could risk it! They have lockers which you have to use for some rides which are free for 45 minutes and they extend the free time when the queues are really long so we avoided paying extra there.

name: user_4907
review: An EXPRESS PASS FOR ALL THE RIDES IS A MUST

name: user_4908
review: It's really fun to use... that's great

name: user_4909
review: The famous uss. Of course it is good. But for me, i think its not too big. Purchase express pass with my 3 brothers on the new year holiday. And get to play all of it in just 1 day or less.

name: user_4910
review: Buy your tickets in advance & plan the whole thing out please.

name: user_4911
review: It is not recommended for children under 6 years old to play. In addition to height restrictions, many amusement facilities are not suitable for stimulation.

name: user_4912
review: It was excellent. Get there early, buy the fast pass. Ride the rides with no lines, then once it gets busy use the fast pass.

name: user_4914
review: Thanks sis, you can come here too Good place

name: user_4915
review: It's really small! You can quickly see it all in about 3 hours. The group I went with tried to buy express tickets, but they were already sold out. They say they were sold out within 2 hours of opening. I think it's because it's the end-of-year season. There was also a VIP ticket that included an express and private guided tour, but it was about 400 per person, so I thought about it but decided against it. In the end, it was a good thing I didnt buy it! Because it was a rainy day, there were times when people flocked to certain attractions. If you download the Universal Map app (required) and watch the real-time waiting times (make sure to bookmark things to ride, see, and eat in advance), you will be able to enjoy the experience efficiently. Since a lot of children come here, if you get the timing right, you can ride without having to wait, and if you're not afraid of rain, you can ride even more comfortably haha. Attraction Recommendations & Recommendations - Siron is more fun than Human - I didn't like Shrek 4D... - Transformers 3D front row seat recommended - Highly recommend the Water World show! - Mummy Recommendation - Jurassic Park Rapids recommendation (everything is wet. Everything is wet.) - Spaghetti is completely for babies haha. Recommended if you like cute things. -The Indian restaurant was delicious. - Most souvenirs are available at the universal shop at the entrance, so there is no need to stop by each shop. Additionally, Sentosa Island has ziplines and luges, so it would be nice to spend a day enjoying them all. After getting wet and raining, it got cold as the sun went down, so I bought a Shrek blanket and covered myself with it. I think it would be a good idea to bring a raincoat, towel, and blanket if you can. You never know when it will rain in Singapore.

name: user_4917
review: Vip Express ticket's help us for best experience. Otherwise you have to stay in the long queue & With children's that is not good at all.

name: user_4918
review: The right place for holidays, entertainment, experience adventure things. Cost high but very interesting place.

name: user_4920
review: My son love this place. All the game are fantastic

name: user_2277
review: Quite small but a modern and clean facility with a good range of rides, experiences, and food outlets. Expect to wait 40-60 minutes for a ride during peak times. Most areas are undercover which is convenient with Singapore weather

name: user_4925
review: Well done. Great for the family

name: user_4930
review: Must one time watchable place!! First timers ll have fun for sure. We took tickets from a kiosk machine. There was crowd for every attraction inside it. For Transformers I waited 1:30mins. No wait time for Mummy Revenge. For jurasic theme waited for an hr

name: user_4931
review: I went with my 5-year-old child during the peak season at the end of the year. When we arrived 15 minutes before opening, entry had already begun. Immediately after the park opened, there were almost no people lining up for the attractions, so I was able to ride Jurassic Park twice in a row with zero waiting time. It was busiest around noon and the wait for the Transformers was about 2 hours. After 6pm, it became empty and the wait for the Transformer was about 40 minutes, and after 7pm, the wait was about 10 minutes, so I rode it twice in a row. For food, the Malaysian food court on the right after exiting the USS may be a little cheaper and better. There is also a manned counter on the right side as you enter, so you can pay with cash. Also, I was able to buy the tickets a little cheaper because I paid with a coupon or PayPal, which is recommended for advance purchase. PayPal payments can only be used in Japan, so if you have a fixed schedule, I think it's a good idea to buy in advance.

name: user_4933
review: This place is spectacular. Truly a place to get more lifelong memories. I recommend coming to this place. The entertainments vary from the highest adrenaline-seeking to your family-friendly comedy shows. Pictures! Pictures could be taken anywhere especially with the merchandises that you could buy there. Now, on to the critiques and advices. Of course, every place has its flaws and these reviews are here to help build it for the better First of all, the queues. The queues will take you 15-60 minutes for only about 5 minutes of entertainment. That's why I would HIGHLY recommend getting the express ticket. You could upgrade your regular ticket to an express in the ticket booth up front. It is pricy at first sight, but the amount of rides you could experience and the amount of time you save is worth it. But note that not all rides accept express in the way that you need to wait as of the others. I would recommend bringing a change of clothes as it would often get hot, you'd get wet while riding a ride. In my case, I forgot to bring an extra change, so I had to buy one _. Last but not least, bring your family, friends, wife or husband, relatives, and so on. They will make the trip even better. That is all. Enjoy uss

name: user_4934

review: Universal Studios is a very fun family tourist destination, there are various playgrounds and games here. To be able to enter Universal Studios Singapore, you can buy tickets directly when you arrive at the location or you can buy them through a travel agent such as Traveloka. The entry price is indeed quite premium, but it is very commensurate with what we can get here. Inside Universal Studio, we can get really delicious food and drinks, and at every rest point there are free refills of drinking water that we can get as much as we like. Various games such as rollercoasters, 5D rides and water games are also available here. All complete films made by Universal. So don't delay any longer, when on holiday in Singapore, don't forget to stop by and play on all the Universal Studio rides.

review: During holiday periods it is not advisable to visit Universal studio. 1. Entrance fee too expensive 2.The queues for mist rides are at least 2 hours . 3.The prices in foodcourt and eating places are atrocious.

name: user_5009
review: It's a total rip off, the waiting time is so long on some rides, like the Transformers, that it makes you wonder, what's the point getting into the theme park without express pass. But then, on some rides I have seen there was no point getting express pass either, as the queues were too long for both, normal and express pass, and people with normal tickets were seen cheating to enter through the express queue (or encouraged to get in by the staff as they need one or two personnel to start the ride). 3 stars are for helpful staff, facilities (toilets, water fountains, etc) at strategic locations and cleanliness at the venue. Restaurant like Mel's Dine In is tricking customers with pricing, esp. with refill of drinks!

name: user_5010
review: Tickets can be bought on the spot, waiting in line takes about 5 minutes. Inside, however, 30-50 minutes everywhere!!! Horrible!! They shower you in several places and you can dry yourself for money?!! Does the park close if it rains??! The staff is just there, unmotivated. There are many people, it is not organized. This could be done better. Expensive so not fun rather disappointing!

name: user_5011
review: I recently had the pleasure of visiting USS, it was an absolutely fantastic experience. I recommend to visit at least once in a lifetime. Its not so big, but for me it deserved as world-class theme park that combines entertainment, thrills, and magical moments into a truly unforgettable experience.

name: user_5012
review: Must be there even once visit in your life..

name: user_5013
review: it is better to buy an express ticket so that you don't have to queue for a long time to get on the ride

name: user_5014
review: Okay, what I recommend is that you bring raincoats or umbrellas cause it rains sometimes. The timings are 10am to 9pm! it seems it went from 6pm to 9pm. Me and especially my family were aware that there were 24 rides ( might be more in the future ) so we got up early and arrived at 10:40 which was a very bad decision since the wait time at mornings are WAY more then in evenings. so I recommend going in afternoons or evenings since there's too much crowd in the mornings. The ride WORTH going is the transformers ride! It's very good and even me and my family went to ride it TWICE! don't worry about the height requirements of your child's cause even if they are short they just need to be accompanied by a Parent/Guardian. We finished most of the rides that we wanted to try by 7pm! Recommended rides : Transformers ride Mummy ride Accelilator ( it's not dizzy at all and you just need to keep your neck towards the seat so you have no pain! )

name: user_5015
review: Super cool amusement park, with lots of attractions and especially roller coasters. The 4D Transformers cinema is amazing and Jurrassic Park is also very well done. What we liked best was Waterworld's live show (musical style).

name: user_5016
review: Beautiful place, worth a whole day with kids Most of the games for adults and children are 92 cm long, and the train and dangerous games are over 125 cm. In many restaurants I recommend downloading the application to get times for shows, games, and everything something Advice: Buy the express and save your head from the crowds There are two types, each game once, 100 Singapore dollars The multiple is 130 Singapore dollars

name: user_5018
review: Its thrilling . Visit to Singapore is incomplete without this . Weekdays there is less rush so prefer going then . Plenty of food outlets but too expensive .

name: user_5019
review: Universal Studios Sentosa, while smaller than its counterparts, offers a pleasant theme park experience. With fewer rides, lines were manageable even on a weekday, peaking at around 40 minutes and dwindling later in the afternoon. I highly recommend buying tickets online in advance, because it is slightly cheaper to do so and you can buy a combo ticket package with other nearby attractions. We didn't find a need to buy the Express pass to skip lines, but it may be very useful during the holiday season and weekends. Despite a brief interruption due to rain and lightning, the adjacent aquarium provided a convenient and enjoyable diversion. Food and drinks are on the pricier side, but stumbling upon an unadvertised happy hour for drinks was a pleasant surprise. The policy of free lockers for an hour, with reasonable charges afterward, adds a practical perk. The park's cleanliness and organized lines contribute to a positive overall atmosphere. The staff's friendliness and helpfulness, combined with the variety of kid-friendly attractions, make Universal Studios Sentosa a great destination for families.

name: user_5020
review: I have never been to Universal Studios Japan (USJ), but I went to Universal Studios Singapore (USS)! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! It was my first time visiting Universal Studios, so I had a lot of fun thinking, "Wow! This is Universal Studios!!!" (LOL) I went there quite a while ago... However, when I close my eyes, I can still vividly remember how much fun I had at that time! ! ! ! ! !

name: user_5021
review: Many people wonder if they can enjoy all the rides without an Express Pass, and the answer is yes. Ensure you visit on a weekday, like Thursday and be right on time before the opening time, and the trick is to avoid entering the rides near the entrance first. Start with those in the back or the ones with high demand, such as the Transformers ride. In the evening, the rides near the entrance are always empty, so that's the perfect time to go there. Use the Universal Studios app to check wait times and navigate accordingly, rather than following a set order. Mark down the meet and greet times and spots to arrive right on time. The roller coasters are worth it, and lockers are free for a duration of around 30-40 minutes. We checked roller coaster wait times, selected lockers, finished the ride, switched lockers, and went to the next ride, so we didn't pay for lockers at all. If you still lack time you can skip the enchanted airways and magic potion spin which looks less exciting after riding the main roller coaster rides. Yes, the food and drinks are expensive, but having a big breakfast outside and the motivation to try all the rides meant we barely felt hungry, so we didn't dine there at all. You can take water inside, so no need to buy their overpriced water and drinks. All the rides and shows were excellent, providing a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Buy the tickets online in a site like Klook which is cheaper.

name: user_5022
review: Recommend the mummy and transformer! So excited! Elmo street is very so pretty

name: user_5035
review: Encourage to buy tickets prior, and if upgrade is necessary, we could do it in the counter. Went on a weekday and decided to risk it by not upgrading, but luckily, it wasn't crowded, so it didn't make a difference between all day, express, or vip tickets. Went in as early as 10 am. The map gained through scanning the qr code was a little help to plan to meet and greets, rides, and shows. Advised to bring ponchos or raincoats and a change so it saves cos not to buy a poncho and queue up for dryer. Sunscreen cream, if needed and water bottles, will be good. Kids below 122cm should always be accompanied by parents otherwise you can leave your little ones to have a little adventure. Enjoyed the rides especially the sci fi was my favourite and fortunate to go twice. Toilets were ample.and clean, ample.finger food though pricey and minion ride will be an added adventure in 2024 as its under construction.

name: user_5057
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling blend of cinematic magic and exhilarating rides. The park's impeccable design and immersive attractions, like Battlestar Galactica and Transformers: The Ride, offer an unforgettable experience. Despite occasional crowds, the park's diverse entertainment and attention to detail make it a must-visit destination for any theme park enthusiast.

name: user_5058
review: AVOID AT ALL COST!!! SCAM OUTDOOR RIDES ALL CLOSED WHEN RAIN. AND IT RAINS A LOT. SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE. Poor experience due to non-shelter connections when it rains. And it rains a lot. Just poor planning and park experience. Doesnt take a lot to do up some shelter walkway. Frustrating experience stucked in one area and cant get anywhere else even to indoor park areas or gift shops during heavy rain. Please go to other Universal Studios, avoid this one. Cant even get to other side as whole place is not shelter connected. Dont waste money here. Spend the money for your family and go Japan. The staff are rude and grumpy as if not paid a living wage. Looks young and exploited. Typical Genting and Resort World standard of the Lim family. Low end parks standard. If I can give negative 5 stars I would give this one the full negative stars.

name: user_5077
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers various unique features, including themed zones like Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, Lost World, and Far Far Away. It's known for attractions like the Battlestar Galactica dueling roller coasters, the Transformers ride, and the immersive experience of the Universal Studios Singapore's Halloween Horror Nights. The park also features shows, live performances, and character meet-and-greets, providing a diverse and entertaining experience for visitors.

name: user_5086
review: I recently had the pleasure of visiting Universal Studios Singapore, and I must say it was an absolute blast! The park offers a perfect blend of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and a magical atmosphere that transports you to different worlds. The attention to detail in each zone is remarkable. From the Hollywood glamour to the sci-fi wonders of Sci-Fi City, every section is uniquely crafted and provides an immersive experience. The highlight for me was the iconic Jurassic Park area, where I felt like I was walking among dinosaurs.

name: user_5098
review: This was an overwhelming experience! Many WOW! moments. A few things to be aware of, which would have helped if we knew it before we went. Buy an Express ticket, it may be more expensive but it allows you to skip the very long queues. Some you need to stand in for two hours! The express ticket will cut that down to 15 minutes. So it will mean you will be able to experience more rides for your money. The resort is very big so be prepared to walk and stay hydrated in the heat. Toilets are paid.

name: user_5103

name: user_5109
review: Good for a whole day. We were lucky because there wasn't much going on. If it's crowded I would advise against it as there aren't that many attractions. When the rain comes, the outdoor activities are closed, which was the case for us from 1700 onwards. Normally it is open until 2000. If you go in early in the morning and take the train, the gondola is very expensive. Food is not too expensive. You get very wet during the whitewater action. Also in the front rows at Waterworld

Some rides, such as the Mummy and Battlestar Galactica, are a must-try, but other than that, food is served there, and if there is no long queue you will be able to complete the park in a whole day.

name: user_5135
review: I enjoyed the day overall, but man it was small. I got an express pass thinking I would like to avoid the queues. I managed to do literally everything twice, only walked 5 miles, and was out by 2.30p...
