Battlestar Galatica is still the bomb, with Cylon being one of the best coasters in the world.

name: user_5138
review: I recommend visiting early as it gets crowded in the afternoon. Bring your own water bottle. Stay hydrated.

name: user_5142
review: Food for dinner is limited to fast meals, no Chinese restaurants. Not all activities were open at night.

name: user_5143
review: Pretty fun rides,great walking weather,minimal crowds and wait times

name: user_5144
review: 1- Prices have become expensive compared to before, and there is also renovation work that may end in 2025. I bought a fast track bracelet for my family for all the games and I was surprised that there are games that do not include fast track. In one of the games I asked an employee on the fast track because the track board was not clear, unfortunately. He put me in a queue where I sat for an hour, and it turned out that the employee had racial fanaticism and deliberately put me in the wrong lane and did not put me in the express entry lane. There is poor regulation of express entry, meaning that There is a card that you buy to enter some games, fast entry, and this is the reason for its crowding and the lack of clarity about those who have the fast entry bracelet from the card. There is chaos, some of them enter the fast lane without having a card or bracelet, and they enter the game without any supervision from the organizers. 2- I also bought an express entry card for offers, although it was previously part of the express entry bracelet, but they separated it. Unfortunately, its price was very expensive, and entry was poorly organized because they were sorting people outside, but inside the hall the situation was chaotic. You would find everyone sitting in the express entry area, so I absolutely do not recommend buying it. Come ten minutes before the show and after you enter because there are no organizers inside, sit in the front where those who have... Express entry cards. 3- Previously, the studio opened at 10 p.m. and closed at 7 p.m., meaning (9 hours) and at an acceptable price, but now it opens at 11 a.m. and closes at 6 p.m., meaning (7 hours), at a high price, and a third of the studios games are closed. 4- It was a very bad experience and I was disappointed in Universal Studio due to the chaos, the negligence of the organizers inside, the restoration work, and the high prices. I do not advise anyone to visit it due to the presence of restoration work, as well as the presence of restoration work on Sentosa Island, and many of the events that were free on the island have become expensive and have become Concern is money, not tourist entertainment.

name: user_5145
review: Happy happy happy park day with friends!! Tried out roller coaster for the first time and they were actually pretty fun and not scary. HUMANs drop made me feel a bit uncomfortable but CYLON was pretty smooth, even though it looks a lot scarier (hanging seats, 360 rotation etc). Would recommend! CYLON had almost no queue so we got in real fast. Some other attractions had slightly longer queues but mostly within 20mins

name: user_5146
review: Never-failed theme park..

name: user_5147
review: The neat Universal Studio in the world with several theme parks inside. 1 day tour is enough for kids and parents, enjoying the facilities with the imagination you have from comics or movies. The weather is hot most of time, water refilling station is close to toilets or some designated locations. Some facilities are old with the renovation and some are brand new. Kids love transformers, minions and dinosaurs for sure. Queueing takes time for those pop and hot parks always. Be patient since some people do not enter the studio after 2 to 3pm. Just come and have 1 day tour for fun. Enjoy.

name: user_5148
review: Really an amazing place to visit ! Worth every penny! Had a very amazing unforgettable experience here must visit ! With almost all studios and sets of Marvel Transformers lot more ....

name: user_5149
review: Great place! Great time! Fun and beautiful!

name: user_5152
review: Overrated and over priced in our opinion. While there is much to see, we truly did not feel that it was worth the price we paid. It's a relatively small place and if you are not someone who enjoys rides or shows, this would be a waste of time and money. The rollercoasters and rides we tried were good. We do recommend going for Transformers and Revenge of the Mummy. Please expect long wait times for most rides unless you have a express or unlimited pass, for which of course, you shell out more. The show at WaterWorld was the highlight of our trip to USS. Definitely one of the best, if not the only thing we felt was worth going for. The prices for food and drinks are simply exorbitant inside. So prepare accordingly. There are lockers conveniently provided outside every ride to keep your bags. We also recommend going on weekdays. Even though we went on a Monday, there was still quite a crowd. So weekends are likely to be worse. All in all, it is probably worth a one time visit to see what the fuss is all about, but it is unlikely we will return.

name: user_5160
review: Awful experience. 1/4 - 1/3 of the park is closed Probably due to the new Minion attraction which would only be completed in 2024. Yet we are being charged full price for only 2/3 of the service. And speaking of service, Terrible customer service!! i'm ashamed to find out the attitude of the staff is so bad. I would assume the staff being Singaporean would have been be better educated. it really shames me being a Singaporean. what happens to "Excuse me Sir/Mdm"? the 1 ride that really piss me, was at Sesame street, apparently there's a booster seat on 1 of the back row seat of the cart, i try to remove it, unaware that i wasn't suppose to do so . no staff usher me to the cart nor advised me not to do so. then 1 of the attending staff, tall, lanky and bespectacled , actually told me off in a stern and rude manner" don't remove it!, don't touch that, move to the front row". i'm old enough to be his dad, where's the basic courtesy? Management of Universal Studio, you seriously have to relook at the coaching of the staff. On a general note, I observed that 70% of the staff displayed poor customer service. They portrayed a aura of being disgruntled and have no sense of belonging to Universal Studio. I feel really bad as a Singaporean as this isn't the Singapore experience that I would like our foreign visitors to witness. Genting RWS, I understand that you are expanding but before that, pehaps relook to the education of the staff and more walking of the gound by management. 2 stars for the remaining staff which didn't makes it a total disappointment for my family and me.

name: user_5163
review: Always a good time when visiting Universal Studios. Lots of souvenir shops and rides and attractions to see and experience. Will definitely come back again.

name: user_5167
review: Amazing park! All attractions are top quality and merchandise are good too. They loose a star purely due to the attitude of the staff. For a place that attracts many children, they are absolutely rude and short with us whenever we asked basic questions. We are only asking questions because your app didn't work, curtly telling us to read the app does not help anybody, not to mention their sour expressions the entire time. Not all staff were like this, for example the performers and some people on the rides were absolutely fantastic, however majority were very rude and ruined the mood for us.

name: user_5168
review: Awesome experience, very good rides with all safety majors

name: user_5170
review: Quite small ngl but it's still a fun place

name: user_2596
review: I went to the park on a Tuesday, they opened at 11 am. Bought the ticket at the park entry and asked if it will be busy today. The lady at the cash desk told me that there is no waiting time as the park just opened so decided not to get the additional fast pass ticket which was a good idea. There was no waiting time in the morning for the rides and if its busy the fast pass ticket can be bought afterwards in the park (which I didnt as I left at around 3 pm when it became crowded). Stayed 4 hours and did several rides, the mummy ride is the best in my opinion. The park is clean and I liked the food there. The park can not be compared to the one in the US but its definitely worth a visit.

name: user_5172
review: Must visit place when traveling to Singapore..... great activity for a whole day ...... lovely rides ........ Transformers is the best!

name: user_5173
review: Universal Studios is a blast of excitement, with jaw-dropping rides and enchanting shows that transport you into movie magic. But hey, be ready for some waiting in lines the queues can test your patience. And, oh, the weather can be a little unpredictable during this time of the year; it might sprinkle unexpectedly. Despite that, the joy and wonder of the park make it all worthwhile. Just grab a poncho, put on a smile, and dive into the cinematic adventure. It's a rollercoaster of fun, rain or shine!

name: user_5174
review: Very very entertaining...so much to explore...class apart...but some continental food places are over crowded...

name: user_5175
review: The theme park is super well decorated like all of the group's. The problem is that it was summer and the number of people was horrible. More than 1 hour per attraction. It's a shame we couldn't make the most of our day. At the last minute, people drop out a lot and we were able to ride more or less 2 attractions with a 15-minute queue. The food is very expensive, much more than in other universal

name: user_5176
review: Awesome experience with full of fun and adventure for all ages

name: user_5178
review: Had been to the USS ON 10Nov Had pre-booked Admission tickets and express pass Go early as the crowd is less and with express pass you can enjoy all the experiences pretty fast !! All the rides and shows r good!! Worth going !!!

name: user_5180
review: The visitors are never empty

name: user_5181
review: No. 1 attraction in Singapore so it is always crowded but totally worth it. Do not miss the Human ride.

name: user_5182
review: We went there on Friday and we arrived at 11:30 PM, it was crowded but we took the advice of the travelers to start from the last part of the park (called Far away side - sth like this) and move towards the entrance, as almost all people will use the rides near the entrance door. This tip helped as so much and we did not have to wait long, Only in 1 game and I managed to play all the games (except 1 and for the kids) without express ticket. I also advice whoever want to go there to download their app to check the waiting time for each ride to avoid the lines.

name: user_5184
review: Universal Studios Singapore is located on Sentosa Island. This time I went alone. The park is large enough that you can walk around it in about 20 minutes without riding anything, so it was great that you didn't get tired of walking. Attractions can be navigated better using a single rider. There are no attractions to take photos of, so there were quite a few young people who were enjoying themselves as single riders, even if they came in groups. In addition, I thought the prices of goods in the park were well, this is what it is'', but the food is expensive. Even if the portion size is the same, I felt that the prices were different depending on the location, such as restaurants, cafes, and outdoor stalls, so I think it's a good idea to walk a little bit to find what you want to eat.

name: user_5187
review: Quite fun although some rides had long lines which is understandable. There is some clamer rides so i could still have fun.

name: user_5188
review: Great place to visit. Please plan full day to enjoy all the activities.

name: user_5189
review: The water world shoe is closed and the Madagascar exhibit is being renovated to minion city. That makes 2 of the best attractions to USS under repair. Yet the cost of the ticket does not change. There should be a prorated price if a significant part of the park is under repair.

name: user_5190
review: I went to here not on holiday but there still a lot of people there, but the waiting time is less than 45 minutes. There are lots of rides and it's really exciting, I hope I can play here again

name: user_5191
review: The place is nice but if you want to take photos it will be crowded with people, after the pandemic free entry into SG will be even busier with tourists

name: user_5192
review: Beyond expectation, thought will be okay but actually pretty good.

name: user_5193
review: best experience ever, made me relive my childhood

name: user_5195
review: World class holliwood shooting studio all kids show shooting done here,vey nice

name: user_5196
review: Start times are late. Need more time for getting the full experience.

name: user_5198
review: Every word: beautiful

name: user_5199
review: This was an awesome experience for not just my kid but also for us. Be prepared to walk. Also if you are thinking about not getting the Universal Express pass, then my suggestion is to get it. We took the normal tickets and had to wait for 60 mins for some attractions in a weekday. With the pass, you'd have a different queue with little to no wait time. Do visit as early as you can do that you can enjoy all the shows as well as the different meet and greet. If you are visiting Singapore, then Universal Studios is a must visit attraction.

name: user_5203
review: Wonderful themed and amusement park. Wait-time is too much for almost every ride, which is disappointing.. If you don't want to wait, then you need go for an express ticket, which is like double the entry fees. If you really want to experience all rides, then go for it. Otherwise, normal ticket should be fine. Overall, it is a nice place to have fun with family and kids.

name: user_5204
review: I really enjoyed and came back multiple times even for my birthday and was very thrilling ride I got the express pass and the queuing time was very short

name: user_5205
review: Once in a life time experience, so much fun with partner. Crew explain everything so well.

name: user_5206
review: Overpriced.

name: user_5207
review: Very expensive Rides are good Children above 122 cm are eligible Indian restaurant ,Oasis spice food is very bad.. An insult to all Indians..very bad food and very expensive also..

name: user_5208
review: Is it a Halloween set if I buy tickets online in advance? It came with an entrance fee, a hamburger exchange ticket (about 2000 yen), and a 1000 yen voucher to use at the store, so I had a great time! I thought I could go around once because it was small, but there were surprisingly many people and I couldn't go around itHalloween night only seems to be on Saturdays and Sundays, not on weekdays But it was fun to have rides that aren't available in Japan!

name: user_5209
review: It's really nice to spend time here. It is recommended to go early so it is not too crowded. And bring a hat because it's a bit hot. Enter from Vivo station towards Sentosa Express to get cheaper costs

name: user_5210
review: It's very fun Testimonials that are worth the money

name: user_5211
review: Tourists must buy a fast pass and remember to bring an umbrella

name: user_5212
review: Lovely place! In the heart of Sentosa, the rides are all of good quality and has a good balance of children friendly and adult friendly rides! Overall, the staff are also effective and efficient! Great experience!

name: user_5214
review: Nice place ever had! Dont say tou come to singapore if you didnt come here!!

name: user_5215
review: Easy to travel, there are both taxis and electric trains. Taking a taxi is very convenient. During November, there is a lot of rain. Whoever comes to travel must plan and look at the weather forecast well.

name: user_5218
review: For such small park is the entrance fee of 63 dollar to much. In 1 day you can see everything. Negative was the opening and closing time. Opening time was from 11.00am untill 6.00pm.

name: user_5219
review: good complete facilities, suitable for recreation with the family

name: user_5220
review: Universal Studios Singapore on Sentosa Singapore is a popular spot for international visitors. and Singaporeans themselves as well Recommend things in the Klook app before coming, get a ticket price of about 1,800 baht in Thai money. The park opens around 10:30 a.m. Waiting in line for the rides is about 20-30 minutes, the longest for some rides is 10-15 minutes. Because the amusement park is not very big. It is recommended that you do not need to buy an Expess Pass. It is not worth it. Every ride has a shop and shopping area. It is considered very convenient. There are many plans for walking. You can take a taxi, train, or cable car.

name: user_5221
review: I went to Sentosa Island on Saturday and Monday. It's crowded on Saturday because it's the weekend and there are too many people. I visited again on Monday and entered Universal and tried the rides, but I was a little disappointed. The ride time felt short and it was less thrilling than the ones in Korea....

name: user_5224
review: Can get crowded but all in all an amazing time with the place

name: user_5226
review: Its small. I would t get the express oass. Ride the less popular stuff when its. Busy. At the end of the day you can ride pretty much anything within 5 minutes. My express pass was pretty much wasted money

name: user_5227
review: I was left with mixed feelings. Park is generally fun, attractions are good and were pretty surprising in a positive way. Zones are well designed and don't look fake. Staff is professional as well. Queues were not long, so we were able to visit almost everything (some of attractions multiple times). What was disappointing is the food - relatively expensive, poor choice, bad quality. Soft ice cream was crunchy because it's over frozen. Overall eating here felt like rip off. Another big issue (might be local specifics, since we met similar problem at the hotel) are visitors. Around 60% of them belong to specific group that probably got to the park on a donkey straight from their remote village. Meaning they do not understand personal space, queues and personal hygiene. I personally get annoyed being around such type of people, but might be my personal view. So probably overall if you approach it smart - eat a lot before, take some snacks and go to attractions early or before closure, it could be a great experience. Otherwise you will be half exited half annoyed.

name: user_5230
review: not fun at all and not worth money. you have to queue at least 40 mins. Nothing upgrade since my last visit 10 years ago

name: user_5231
review: GO and see the best well kept entertainment value for money for the whole family, friends, colleagues and even lovers. And enjoy every second of the wonderful activities.

name: user_5232
review: Once in a lifetime experience and swings, after onetime paid entrance you can enjoy any ride or show for free , you won't have enough time to experience all the rides and shows for sure , have to visit again. But lots of thrilling and fun experience rides including 4D cinema, 4D rides and real scary lives

name: user_5233
review: I bought tickets in advance through My Real Trip and went to Universal, and when I arrived around 11:30, I was able to enter right away without waiting. It is very hot and humid and the sun is so strong that parasol sunglasses are a must.

name: user_5234
review: I worth to buy the ticket in advance and express ticket is almost obligatory, the only bad attraction is the treasure hunter, doesnt worth the wait. Jurassic park and Mummy is great, 2 amazing rollercoaster, and unfortunately no Battlestar galactica shop

name: user_5239
review: Enjoyed a lot. Fun filled place. Sea aquarium also awesome . For vegetarians "Oasis spice" is the best food option. Must visit again as one day is not enough

name: user_5241
review: Some rides are worth it. Specially transformer ride.

name: user_5243
review: Should go on a non peak day. They close early Quite small Some attractions are not available Should see: waterworld, transformers 4d, 1,2,3 lights?, ask show times or you might miss it

name: user_5246
review: It is a small theme park with Friendly staff & great rides. Recommend to install the USS app for park related info ( wait times, rides, meet & greet , shows ) To cover the park quickly, recommend to buy express pass. Not many options for vegetarian food. PS: Park suspends rides during rainy weather

name: user_5247
review: Delicious mint ice cream, super spacious, can play all day to finish the game, check in with the famous universal studios ball

name: user_5249
review: Universal Studios is always fun to explore however I am trying not to be very critical since I am trying avoid comparing this location to the one from California. It is a lot smaller than I expected but it was still very enjoyable! Unfortunately I came in with one section of the park was under construction. I wouldn't mind coming back again for sure to see it continue to grow! A lot of entertainment and the park would lead you in a circle which will bring you back out. So do not worry about being a maze since it is very easy to navigate. Keep an eye out in many events and the time when it starts! You do not want to miss those! I highly recommend those! Go in and have fun, take your time and do rush it! Enjoy!

name: user_5250
review: Take priority pass much coolers

name: user_5251
review: Amazing time with the family on Friday. Took the express queue and it was worth it! Special shout out to the kind ushers and service staff. Always nice to be treated extra special as a local:-)

name: user_5252
review: The various Universal Studio rides in Singapore are the same as at several other Univ Studio locations. The Globe logo with the words Universal Studio is one of the photo spots most often used by visitors to immortalize all their holiday activities there. What I like the most is the Water World ride which is packaged in a dramatic and interesting story...

name: user_5253
review: worth exploring and great experience in all sections, specially Transformers. Manage your time and have blast with Meet & Greet area with various CHARACTERS across sections

name: user_5255
review: Is a good place for kids, teenager and family to play around.

name: user_5257
review: Magnificent park, doable entirely in 1 day, choose a weekday: no queues, even without a fast pass.

name: user_5258
review: I was really looking forward to it and was very disappointed in the end. Not every amusement park is just for children. In my opinion, Universal Studios in Singapore does. The park is very small and the attractions only appeal to children. As an adult you can really save yourself the visit. For children, however, it is certainly a unique experience.

name: user_5259
review: I think it worths the price although the park was not as huge as others. Entering the park was just SIMPLE. I pre purchased my tickets through Klook, and Klook issued me the ticket with QR code. All I need to do was to scan the ticket QR code at the entrance, done! There were minimum crowds during my visit on a Tuesday during a non peak season. Although the opening hours was 11-6pm compared to 10-8pm (peak seasons), I still managed to finish playing all the attractions before 4:30pm (I enter the park at 11:30am). The wait time for popular attractions were up to 30-45 minutes during peak hours of the day (12-3pm). The crowds got less towards late afternoon, and there was almost no wait time at all for most attractions after 4pm. Most of the attractions (expect for kids ones) were very exciting!! Make sure you have a strong/fearless heart!! HAHAHA Everything was fantastic, but the weather - Its HOT!! Like seriously, that wasnt a very nice experience for me, and the sun ,could be overwhelming during a sunny day. You dont want to get a heat stroke, so make sure you stay hydrated, stay indoor while you can, and get your skin well protected from the sun!!

name: user_5261
review: The best place in Singapore, but the disadvantage is booking early tickets Fast Pass because waiting is not normal it is better to book online, which gives a discount of 10 per person on the Fast Pass

name: user_5262
review: Can't wait to bring my family.

name: user_5267
review: Honestly, never ever come to this Place without Express Pass. I come when Non Peak Season on Tuesday, still wait for more than 45 minutes on every Rides. Very bad experience

name: user_5268
review: Wonderful experience. However there arr long queues in every activity. Better come early as soon as it opens. Install there app and check the waiting time in each activity. If you have kids, start from the kids section first to avoid intial rush at transformer show or roller coster. A must watch is transformer sgow, revenge of the mummies, Shrek 4D show, Dinosaur lost world ride. If you can spare SGD 90 more per person besides the entry ticket, take it to avoid the long queues so that you can cover everything in a single day.

name: user_5271
review: Great experience sadly the drizzle caused none of the outdoor theme park games are allowed to be played. I understand the safety are important but please allow us to get a refund or something resort getting provide 50% refund if it's rains. The place also was extremely hot.

name: user_5273
review: Very fun experience, make sure you have planned the activities that you want to do in advance since it has so many to choose and the lines are long for the popular rides.

name: user_5274
review: A busy place but a good place to visit too. A lot of rides to try to. Good place for children. Watched of some the shows it's quite entertaining. Got a picture with Shrek. It was a good experienced.

name: user_5275
review: Always fun. Recommend tge fast pass.

name: user_5280
review: Wow.. what an amazing place for fun.. People who love thrilling rides.. this is a must visit place.. This is my first time experience in rides.. i was initially afraid.. after one ride I couldnt resist riding.. went almost all the rides and some multiple times also.. like 1. Cylon ( Roller Coaster true Fun ) 2. Mummy ( Excellent one) 3. Transformers ( Amazing experience) 4. Enchanted 5. Puss in the boots 6. Water park .. Other rides also Gud but not like the first six 1. Jurassic park ( ok kinda ) 2. Treasure Hunt ( One Of the most boring ride in the entire Universal ) 3. 4D Movies ( ok types) Overall an entertaining excellent experience

name: user_5281
review: Excellent for kids. Two to three hours needed if no crowd, Full day needed if public holidays. Transformers show is must see.

name: user_5282
review: The only way to enjoy js by buying express passotherwise keep standing in line

name: user_5283
review: My son is amost 2 years, although he could not play the attraction but he really enjoyed the place, decoration and meet and greet with character. This place is kids friendly and has small shops inside for each theme. When he sleep, parents can switch to play attraction with Single rider

name: user_5287
review: Brilliant family day out and not stupidly expensive

name: user_5288
review: My first overseas theme park , amazing , giant , you need a properly sports or comfortable shoes so you can enjoy all corners of the studio , information and sign are perfect and washrooms are good , just a Singapore climate so be careful ,your gone sweat like a shower ! Carry hydration packets and vegetarians food is difficult

name: user_5290
review: Only 15 atractions

name: user_5294
review: As it is known by its name, Universal Studios is a global film production company A miniature city containing many, many activities, starting from shops, restaurants, games, and adventures related to the studios own characters, most of which are characters from the special animation films. Minions, Transformers and much more Worth a visit

name: user_5295
review: Decent enough , hot sun &high temperature kills your energy to enjoy so i would suggest only go when the climate is good n dont buy advance tickets

name: user_5296
review: Superb day out at Universal studios. Got soaked in the Jurassic Park ride!! Went on lots of rides, rollercoasters were awesome.

name: user_5297
review: If you like excitement, we recommend the Gray Line roller coaster

name: user_5298
review: The place is nice and beautiful for games for adults and children, and I advise you to take Universal Express, and you will have priority for the games.

name: user_5299
review: Just ok, nothing special.. ticket about 900 sgd.. i come on saturday.. open until 5 p.m only.. so sad! By the way if you exit on 5.p.m the queque of the train back is really long.. hahaha.. so sad too.. so many renovation while i come visit universal studios on 4th of november 2023

name: user_5300
review: USS is a must visit place in Singapore. Many fun and adventure activities to do. Kids love this place . Good place for family to enjoy and relax too as many shops are available after a long tiring day. Ticket are around S80 . Advisable to book in advance as the place might be too crowded and the ticket will sold out immediately.

name: user_5301
review: definitely a need to go if youre a tourist and havent been! super entertaining and halloween horror nights is so fun!!

name: user_5302
review: Great day out for the kids. Mornings are not as hot and crowded. Lots of food and drinks inside.

name: user_5303
review: Went for Halloween horror night, it was amazing. Highly recommend purchasing the fast pass as the queues can be up to an hour and because of all the covered spaces it can get pretty hot. Food is pretty expensive inside as to be expected. About half the rides are open at night and the lines aren't as long as during the day.

name: user_5306
review: A very impressive place.. The experience cannot be described in words.. Superb. Come see...

name: user_5310
review: Great place to go with Kids and relive your younger days. Nice and thrilling rides.

name: user_5311
review: Experience was good. Rides are really good. I loved the transformer 3D experience.

name: user_5312
review: Very Nice, super fun, but it was opened with almost 40 min of delay

name: user_5314
review: What an amazing experience. We booked the VIP tour, and we had the amazing Ghazali with us to manage 11 of us. We got detailed descriptions of the experiences and rides, managed to get photo opportunities with the characters we liked and managed to ride almost allll the rides in the park. The water show cannot be missed!!

name: user_5315
review: One must visit this place in their lifetime. Transformers experience is the best.

name: user_5316
review: Had a fun experience on this theme park. It actually opens at 10am to 5pm. Went early to enjoy more rides and attractions. The place was quite crowded even on weekdays. Be sure to use the Universal Studios Singapore app to know the wait times for the rides. It saved a lot of time waiting for rides and shows. Booked my entry tickets online on KLOOK and saved a lot.

name: user_5318
review: The Greatest Theme Park Ever, Have a fun arcade and the area is very clean and wide. No regret to try for release your stress.

name: user_5320
review: This is a nice theme park. It's quite small compared to Universal Studios Orlando but still nice. A big chunk of the park is currently closed as they're converting the area to Minionland. My family loves the Minions and is really looking forward to seeing it when I opens. Most of the park is well maintained, but some of it looks a little run down....especially the Shrek area (Far Far Away). There are a few really good rides here. I especially like the Revenge of the Mummy and the Human/Cylon rollercoasters. You need to empty your pockets for those rides and there are nearby lockers that are free for 90 minutes. Overall, I like Universal Studios Singapore, but mostly go here because of a lack of options in the area. This park is nicer than Legoland Malaysia, but also quite a bit more expensive. Our annual passes for Legoland expired recently, but at some point we're going to sign up again and probably won't visit Universal Studios until those passes expire again. Hopefully Minionland will be open by our next visit.

name: user_5321
review: Fun but looking a little tired

name: user_5324
review: Had an absolute blast here. Some cool rides and the queues werent stupid. Didnt bother with the queue jump pass. My favourite was the Jurassic park ride, mostly from nostalgia, but also the battle star roller coasters!

name: user_5329
review: Universal Studios offers an exhilarating experience for all. As a student, I used to enjoy the perk of a pass for six months with unlimited entries. It was my go-to place for both joy and stress relief. Whether I craved the thrill of roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica and Mummy, or the adventure of the Jurassic Park River Ride, Universal Studios had it all. It's a place where you can find happiness in the clouds and release stress with a scream. But be ready to wait superrrrr longggg queue if you are not holding express entry

name: user_5331
review: Because it is off-season in November, it is very comfortable. 7 rides without purchasing express...

name: user_5333
review: Amazing Rides. Can be a bit irritating if rides are shutdown due to inclement weather conditions. Need to prioritise more for disabled and wheelchair users. Please note wheelchair or disabled or special needs are not going in for rides and as a major theme park the least you could do is provide a free entry ticket to every special needs visitors. Management pls. Take note on the same.

name: user_5336
review: Perfect getaway place for weekend or day out with your friends or family. There are theme based roller coster rides,restaurants and stores.To name a few Jurassic Park, Ancient Egypt, Transformers, Sesame Street, Human and Cyclone roller coster rides were my favorites and there are many more. This place is a great experience for kids and make sure to wear comfortable pair of shoes because it has lots of places to explore. Entry fee was 82 SGD but it was worth every penny. There is no limitation of rides you take once you enter and the place is open till 5 PM Do not go for TREASURE HUNT ride because it has nothing exciting to offer and is just a waste of time. You will definitely regret taking this ride. You can do so many other things instead. This was our only disappointment during our visit.

name: user_5337
review: As a theme park it is beautiful, it is very well decorated, set, clean and they take care of every detail. If you are a fan of strong emotions you will only find something similar in HUMAN and CICLN but you will be left wanting more... It is advisable to buy tickets online and add the fast pass (limited)

name: user_5339
review: hhn ff4 is so worthy Will definitely come for this every year

name: user_5340
review: I had an amazing experience exploring the thrilling rides, creating unforgettable moments. From the sci-fi to the ancient and lost worlds, I highly recommend everyone to download the SG Universal app before your visit. Once inside, check for the rides with the shortest wait times and make sure to prioritize them. On weekdays, you won't need an express ticket for a fantastic experience.

name: user_5342
review: It was a very nice experience to be there and over all worth the price. We been on a weekday and at most attractions there were no lines. Some of them were way scarier than expected. Over all, I enjoyed the atmosphere a lot and hope to be back when the new rides open up.

name: user_5344
review: Universal Studio of Singapore is a great hotspot tourist destination with wonderful experience and beautiful feelings. This is my first time visit to see this wonder of art, science, architecture with colourful innovation. While waking through the lane of New York pavilion, I get a feeling like strolling through the soil if New York. Robot movement is a great attraction for all visitors including kids, children...

name: user_5346
review: It's exciting... it's just difficult because there's no place to pray

name: user_5347
review: It's smaller than other Universal Studios parks but has some great rides.Staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was good. We had express passes and were able to ride all the rides in the park multiple times. I would recommend you come during the week for fewer crowds. You can buy tickets online or right out in front of the park from a kiosk.

name: user_5348
review: Service quality is quite good with many adventure games. But perhaps Vietnam is almost equal

name: user_5349
review: Looks good from outside but not well from inside. One can finds the activities in local place also.

name: user_5350
review: Adventure games and fun activities with world's tallest dueling coaster

name: user_5352
review: Came USS for their Halloween night. It was really nice. It was scarier than I thought it would be. Some rides were open also so it was quite worthy.

name: user_5353
review: If you willing to go to rides Book universal express tickets. For normal you need to wait minimum 30 minutes for each ride.

name: user_5354
review: Huge queues, no limit on the number of visitors, attractions break down

name: user_5355
review: Bought the ticket in advance & went there on Friday. Need to queue for all rides on morning (install USS apps. They show u the waiting time there). But after 3.30pm, waiting time was super short. Some rides no need to queue at all.

name: user_5358
review: Universal Studios doesn't make queuing very comfortable. Most facilities have air-conditioning for queuing. Although it is relatively thin, it can easily be played for half a day and then left.

name: user_5361
review: There is something to play, there is something to eat, and the games are attractive

name: user_5362
review: Amazing thriller fun and what not . One place to get each and every moment

name: user_5363
review: Good experience. But most of the rides are different versions of rollercoasters. Few are scary too. People who suffer from motion sickness should watch the videos first before going ahead getting the tickets for Universal Studios.

name: user_5364
review: Better to take express tickets for people who will attempt to go on all rides

name: user_5367
review: Its huge, and so awesome. Long walk. Water stations on the eay plus there r many restaurants on the sides. Great rides

name: user_5373
review: Fantastic family day out great rides and entertainment

name: user_5374
review: Crowded but there are sufficient places to rest, eat, drink, shop and play in USS. It is wheelchair and strolley friendly. There are electric mobility scooters for rent too. There are water cooler everywhere to refill your bottles.

name: user_5378
review: Every Halloween there are more than a month of nighttime Halloween activities Event tickets need to be purchased in advance and separately Halloween event features haunted house exploration Well worth playing Only a few day facilities will be open and not all districts will be open.

name: user_5379
review: Universal Singapore is a shock. Frankly, I did not like it. I find it beautiful, but it is not comparable to America and Japan at all. There are very few sweet toys around it. We enjoyed the day, but it is forbidden for her for the amount, according to the singer. A big shock. Next to it is a place of luxurious hotels and restaurants and markets. A wonderful place for walking and watching. Transportation is free. Closed and open buses, locomotives, and even golf cars. We rode it for free for transportation. Free restrooms and cold water are available. Everywhere, even in the middle of the games, there are food and sweets stalls everywhere, halal and non-halal restaurants are available

name: user_5381
review: Still good. Been here twice. I hope the park time is extended though.

name: user_5382
review: Weekend getaway spot for singaporean is sentosa island. Universal studios in sentosa is perfect place to spend quality time with family especially kids. I would recommend you to purchase ticket in advance through pelago ( by singapore airlines) or klook etc. You have food trucks inside and malaysian hawker center as well. Dont miss rides such as mummy, transformers etc.

name: user_5383
review: Really enjoyed the day here at universal from rollercoasters to rapids. If you do intend to go on the water rides they do offer ponchos and air blowers which was so very handy. Loads of options on food and gift shops have many trinkets to remember the day.

name: user_5384
review: visited Universal Studios Singapore today and I have to admit, I was left more disappointed than content. The themes and activities were very well planned, and as parents, my partner I were impressed with everything there was to see and do for us and our 3-year-old. However, the relentless humidity and heat made waiting in the long queues quite unpleasant. On a positive note, the staff were excellent and very helpful; we didn't encounter any unhelpful staff throughout the park. Our biggest disappointment came when we tried to grab some food. Unfortunately, all the food outlets had a technical issue and couldn't accept card payments. We didn't have any cash on hand, and without food, both our toddler and we couldn't fully enjoy all the rides and attractions. It's disheartening to know that a massive establishment like Universal Studios couldn't resolve a technical issue or organize an alternative for its visitors. At this point, I'm not sure if we'll be returning. It's frustrating that such an issue could significantly impact our experience. I hope that Universal Studios Singapore takes steps to address these kinds of technical glitches in the future to provide a more seamless and enjoyable experience for its visitors.

name: user_5385
review: I expected more from Universal Singapore. Universal could have at least tried to compete with Disneyland, otherwise it would be a disgrace. Park was upset because she wasted time and money on it. For me, the Dutch Efteling is currently the leader among the parks I have seen, where the guys did their best both in terms of emotions and scenery.

name: user_5386
review: Very disappointed. Lots of areas closed. Charge you 4 to use lockers they demand. Shows are not good.

name: user_5387
review: Must enjoy this place...if with a toddler I suggest to cover up the shows so that they don't get bored,rest time can explore the rides..useful app was studios app,which will give time for all ridesa dm shows.

name: user_5393
review: Universal Studios Singapore visit has been thrilling theme park experience. Has diverse range of attractions, it's a must-visit for both tourists and locals. It has division into various zones, including Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, and more. Each zone had unique experiences, the most heart-pounding rides has to be the cylon and Transformers, revenge of the mummy are must. For children it has many shows, Shrek 4-D and Madagascar: A Crate Adventure are must. The park's atmosphere is vibrant, and there are plenty of dining and shopping options although disappointed a little with the food. But one thing is sure, Universal Studios Singapore promises a fun-filled day for all ages. If going on weekends , for people with time constraints its better to take the quick pass. All the rides and shows will be closed sharp at 5 pm

name: user_5395
review: Really awesome one. Must visit with children's. Especially terminator game is really awesome

name: user_5396
review: Amazing experience! Make sure the clothes you are wearing are comfortable since the weather is very hot.

name: user_5399
review: Absolute thrill embodied, id went for a day trip then found out there were Halloween festivities as well so i bought another round of ticket for night as well! Express passes are a must if you don't want to wait one hour at least for each ride!! Staff is gentle and helpful. Beware not to visit in rain otherwise you won't be able to enjoy open rides such as Rollercoasters etc. The parade is a bit over rated but that's just my thing if you're happy to wait in a crowd of 10k people for a Lil show is your very own desire. All in all best experience you could have in singapore.

name: user_5400
review: Place is good, no matter how you try time flies here and you cannot enjoy all the things in a single visit... Specially for us since it was weekend it was bit crowded... So people better try visit this place on weekdays

name: user_5402
review: 1. The size is really small 2. Preschool children, especially short children, have nothing to ride. 3. Will it be half as large as Osaka? (Scale) 4. The size is so small that it feels like I walked around five times before returning home. 5. Weekdays are the answer. On the weekends, there is no answer if there are locals plus groups. 6. If traveling with children is difficult due to the weather, we recommend IX on weekdays as well. 7. The restaurant is really bad (pizza) 8. Technical problems occur frequently overall. 9. During my visit, Minions was under construction Water World performance was canceled due to technical issues Puss in Boots attraction was closed. 10. Once was enough, no repeat visits.

name: user_5406
review: Be there early to get on rides if you do not have express you can get through every ride (not weekend). The rides were on a different level, definitely worth the trip

name: user_5408
review: The food so expensive

name: user_5409
review: We picked a great day to go. Very quiet so minimal lines for any of the rides. Food is very expensive and the only thing that I could find in the park that seemed vegan was the Mushroom burger at Mel's diner with no cheese.

name: user_5410
review: Great Universal park, with 3-4 good rollercoasters. Went during the week, with special coupon deal tickets for my birthday! Arrived at opening, went straight for Transformers - waited 10 minutes. The longest wait was for Cylon (Battle Star Galactica) - 30 minutes. Loved the Water show.

name: user_5413
review: World-class theme park. Went there on a Tuesday without the express pass (it doubles the price), but we managed to ride as much as we can, using the app. We strategized by going against the flow of people (start at Shrek instead of hollywood) and using the app to check queue estimates My fave areas: * Revenge of the Mummy - rode this 3x! Once during lunch and 2x again when it's about to close so there's no queue. Best ride ever! I will go back to USS just for this. * Waterworld stunt show - really amazing performance and stunts by the actors. It was 130pm * Human battlestar galactica - a compromise if your companion is scared of the Cylon one but I like the mummy more * Spaghetti space chase - gosh this is the cutest ride ever! Made me feel happy as if I'm five years old Cons - Transformers was closed when we went there - Lines are really super long, as much as 45mins per ride - the walkalator to cross to USS was not working/under maintenance so we had to walk - Lockers are of limited time only, so you have to take into account the long queue and hurry back to retrieve things at the locker to make sure you don't get charged more. It's like a workout - Food is very expensive so eat a lot before going there.

name: user_5414
review: An amusement park that uses the word fun to waste a lot. Anyone who likes this kind of activity can tell you that you will not regret it.

name: user_5417
review: Universal Studios is a hot attraction and by hot, I mean popular but also HOT! There isnt a lot of shady spots and if you know Singapore, the heat is a scorcher. That said, Universal is still great for thrill seekers and those that are 6 and above. Young kids will still enjoy the sights, meet n greets and the shows but there wont be as many rides for them. Ride lines can be long too, so if you dont have some patience, youll be in for a hell of a ride. If you have been to Japan and visited Universal Studios, Im led to believe this is a lot smaller, a bit more outdated and not as fun, so manage your expectations. Its also definitely no Disneyland but once again, manage those expectations and youll have fun!

name: user_5419
review: Complete disappointment. Old franchises no longer needed by anyone. The surroundings are very tired and require renovation. There is almost no merch. The only attractions are roller coasters and carousels. It's better to spend money on the zoo and gardens.

name: user_5421
review: Fun place. But the q is always ridiculous

name: user_5422
review: you have to come here, the place is spacious, lots of photo spots, culinary and fun

name: user_5423
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling theme park that brings the magic of movies to life. From iconic movie-themed attractions to exhilarating rides, it offers a diverse range of entertainment for all ages. The attention to detail in recreating beloved movie worlds is impressive, making it a memorable experience. While the park can get crowded, particularly on weekends and holidays, the quality of the rides and shows justifies a visit. Universal Studios Singapore is a fantastic day of fun and cinematic adventure, placed on the beautiful Sentosa Island, visited during the month of January.

name: user_5424
review: Went during halloween. Same as before but with additional thrill of halloween rides. Plus with the new show featuring the trolls.

name: user_5427
review: Had a great experience. Need to stop charging for locker when they are already charging so much for the tickets and express passes. Need to work on extending their closing time and if possible the opening time. It gets really hot in Singapore, starting off early would be more conducive.

name: user_5429
review: Order tickets online in advance and you'll save 20. The park was full on a Sunday, but you wouldn't have to wait forever for the attractions. No bag checks were carried out during our visit.

name: user_5430
review: A fun park to do! Special mention to the buoys on the water with the Jurassic Park atmosphere, and the Revenge of the Mummy train, to be done several times! We had the fast passes and we actually had almost no wait. The world of Minions under construction looks promising. The WaterWorld show is a must-do, but remember, upon entering, to note the times and come 30 minutes before. If you go close to the stage, plan to get soaked (which is okay because it's usually super hot and muggy). Great stunts and acting. Dining inside is quite expensive. Have a nice day!

name: user_5431
review: Superb place for family outing for people from all ages. Excellent rides and shows. Easy accessibility for all kind of individual. Wide range of food options. However park closes at 5pm which is too early in my opinion.

name: user_5432
review: Really good fun. Great rides but very outdated. Im sure when Minionsland opens in 2024 it might bring some more life to the Park. It started to rain around 3 oclock and the rides shut in storms so we just left as there wasnt many places to get out of the rain but shops shops shops. Hint: Get an unlimited express pass, you wont regret barely waiting to get on anything

name: user_5433
review: Its fun and has many various attractions though with short opening hours and having to wait say one attraction for say one hour so you do not have sufficient time to play most of the attractions. I think we queued at Transformers for over 1.5hours alone. I personally feel this place is not quite suitable for senior citizens due to the need to walk a lot and limited seating options with the crowd (we went around 11am on a Monday in October btw) as well as the long standing needed in queues.

name: user_5434
review: Loved the park. Variety of rides for older and younger children. Would be better with more shade but other than that no complaints.

name: user_5435
review: I went there in October 2023 with my backpacking friends. It was crowded but somehow attractive. Book your ticket to make sure you get a chance to enjoy the breathtaking and/or fun rides. The souvenir shop was one of our must-visit place. And taking a picture in front of the globe is a MUST! Ah, if you travel with your toddlers, make sure to bring a stroller. Oya, one more! DO visit Hershey's store and the wide selection of food trucks around. You won't regret!

name: user_5437
review: Had such a great time amazing food a relaxing and thrilling place so fun I wish to go their again and very very welcoming staff members

name: user_5438
review: Fun and fun to interact with the characters

name: user_5440
review: Very good place for knowledge and amusement. Long queues for boat ride and the alien fight place, more than 1hr in the queue s.

name: user_5442
review: Having so much fun in USS! The most recommended ride is Transformers The Ride: 3D. If you don't buy an express ticket, you have to be patient in queuing. But it's worth the wait. If you want to enter the Jurassic Park ride, it's better to prepare a disposable raincoat or if you don't bring your own, you can buy one on the spot. Came on a weekday, but still busy

name: user_5443
review: They are a well set out park however the lines for most things can be 1 to 2 hours long. They also need better crowd management

name: user_5444
review: Taking turns with children, its pretty fast to go through the level alone haha

name: user_5445
review: Halloween Horror Nights is an experience I will never forget. However, it's a shame that Express is a permanent card that allows you to skip the queue again and again. It should instead be a clipboard. We saw carriages that consisted almost exclusively of people with Express cards, which meant that the regular queue rarely moved.

name: user_5447
review: If you are planning to use the lockers, do keep a credit card/ cash card with you or else you may not have means to pay for the locker should your wait take more than the complimentary 60mins. And some rides like the BG does not allow you to bring anything in. The machine does not accept cash despite having a cash and coin slot. If you are hoping for someone to help you when you are stuck like me, good luck - the locker attendant was not present for a good 15 mins and when she finally arrived, there were so many other people facing the same issue. And by then, my fee had increased again. So in total I spent 90 mins queuing for the ride, and another 60 mins before getting my items from the locker - all for a 1 min ride.

name: user_5449
review: This is regarding Mel's Diner in USS. Your food prices understandably is on the high side. But at least put in the effort to adjust the taste. At Mel's diner, your portobello burger is so salty! Salt is to enhance the taste of food but I only tasted salt after biting into the burger. I presumed there are some hardened bacon bits inside it but I threw them away.

name: user_5450
review: It was fine. Lots of broken and/or not working rides. Very small. Overpriced. Halloween horror nights are fun. Great one-time experience

name: user_5451
review: Nice place. You definitely have to be on time. Then you can enjoy a fun day out. Hopefully I can visit soon.

name: user_5453
review: The number one entertainment facility in ASEAN... complete facilities even though the prices are a bit expensive.

name: user_5456
review: Small park. A bit drab compared to other Universal sights. We bought express tickets but on the day that we went 4 of the ore adventurous rides were closed. Disappointing to have to pay an extra premium only to have rides closed. Best to check what is open prior to buying.

name: user_5458
review: Loved it, great rides, purchased the unlimited express passes & felt it was well worth the extra money, went on all rides, a few multiple times.

name: user_5461
review: We cannot cover the studio in a day, as it takes at least 2 days to finish all the rides, aquarium, and waterworld. And it takes a long time to go in the queue. And all the time is wasted there only. I think instead of spending money only for one or two rides, it's better we visit a studio in our own country with a lesser price.

name: user_5466
review: Nice Universal park. Surprisingly small, but theyve packed a fair bit in here. Highlights definitely include The Mummy, and Waterworld show. Two bigger rollercoasters, but this feels more like a family-oriented park than a thrill-seekers park. Expansion for Minion Land is taking shape, Im sure this will add to the experience. Overall, good park. Lockers are a bit of a pain logistically.

name: user_5467
review: Wow this people really working hard to meet customer requirements all the time

name: user_5469
review: It was smaller than Unipa in Japan. It's empty in the morning, and you can ride as many things as you like. Water World is exactly the same as Japan. The performance is flashy!

name: user_5471
review: A complete one day to spend inside the studio. Plan well before visiting the place, get details about the shows and rides and visit the locations accordingly. Go early by around 10-10:30 AM to take some good pictures with the globe and they will allow entry before 11 AM. Carry an umbrella with you and an empty bottle, water can be filled inside the studio free of cost. Plan to enter into rides in the Single line queue if wait time is too long (more than 30 min). Download the Universal Studio application to know about the live wait time and map. The Waterworld show is a must watch and don't miss it. There is an Indian restaurant near to Mummy (Egypt) which has decent Biriyani. Do not plan entering the roller coaster just after the lunch. No need to hurry in visiting the places and always plan the visit on a week day for relaxed view and enjoyment.

name: user_5472
review: I'm disappointed with the studios. It's just a fun park. Many attractions and other options closed. I know the original from Los Angeles. No comparison. I'm just talking about rip-offs here.

name: user_5473
review: Don't go without a universal express pass be it a weekday or a weekend. There is so much to do you leave guilty not watching enough shows or taking enough rides but paying full. They really need to work on improving park timings. 10am is too late to open considering the influx of tourists

name: user_5475
review: It was the worst amusement park i have been to so far. We visited on a weekday in Oct 2023 when the park was hosting Halloween night in the evening. As such, they had changed It's timing to 10am - 5 pm so that it could sell separate tickets for Halloween of the same park from 6 pm. There are only about 15 rides including children's rides as such queue for each ride was huge. The average waiting time for each ride was nearly 60 minutes for general tickets (costing about 5,000/- INR) and 20 minutes for express pass (about 10k INR). The ride time was between 40 seconds to 2 minutes max. So we had to wait for an hour for a minute long ride. By 5:30 pm the staff started forcing people who didn't have Halloween tickets out of the park. Their entire focus was only on money unlike rest of singapore. Would never visit again.

name: user_5484
review: The must visit place if you are in Singapore. We visited on a weekday(tuesday) and had wait times no longer than 10 mins. Could enjoy all the rides without a miss. Started with the Far Far Away, The Lost world zone and came to Sci-Fi at the end. The Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic Park Rapids and the Transformers ride were the best ones for us. Kids loved being here. Shrek 4-D show was also very much fun.

name: user_5485
review: Universal Studios Singapore(USS) is the South East Asia's only universal studios theme park. This park is located in a man made island called Sentosa. We can reach USS by metro/Bus/cab The USS is divided in to 6 Themed zones I personally recommend USS is for those who really loves adrenaline rush by exploring the different roller coasters viz; Revenge of mummy Battle star Galactica - Human Battle star Galactica - Cylon The USS also have meet and greet in all their themed zones and also have their own premier shows. USS open on 10Hrs and all activities/shows will get closed sharply by 17Hrs. Ticket price is 80SGD for adult. Additional Express ticket fare is 90SGD(to bypass the long queue)

name: user_5487
review: Everything there is overpriced and wait times are crazy long

name: user_5489
review: An amusement park in all its splendor. Really too noisy for my taste. My teenagers really liked it. They managed to do 10 attractions during the day by optimizing expectations and without a priority pass

name: user_5490
review: Definitely smaller than Japan. It was convenient to purchase admission tickets in advance. You can go in and purchase an express ticket. It's small, but you can spend a lot of time just by using the express ticket. Worth going at least once when you come to Singapore.

name: user_5491
review: Transformers is the best ride in the world

name: user_5493
review: The beginning of Universal Studios Singapore can be traced back to 2006, when the Singapore government announced that Genting International had won the bid to build Singapore's second integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa. Universal Studios Singapore was a key component of Genting's bid, and it was initially announced that the park would open in 2010. Construction on Universal Studios Singapore began in April 2008, and the park had its soft opening on March 18, 2010. The official grand opening was held on May 28, 2011, and the park was an instant success, attracting more than 2 million visitors in the first 9 months of operation. Universal Studios Singapore is Southeast Asia's first and only Universal Studios theme park. It is home to seven themed zones, each of which is based on popular movies and television series, including: Hollywood New York Sci-Fi City Ancient Egypt Madagascar Far Far Away (based on the Shrek franchise) The Lost World (based on the Jurassic Park franchise) The park features a wide variety of rides and attractions, including roller coasters, water rides, dark rides, and live shows. Some of the most popular attractions include: Battlestar Galactica Human vs. Cylon Revenge of the Mummy Transformers The Ride: Ultimate 3D Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure Minion Mayhem Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase Universal Studios Singapore is a popular tourist destination for both locals and visitors alike. It is a great place to experience the excitement of Hollywood and experience some of the world's most popular movies and television series in a whole new way. In the years since its opening, Universal Studios Singapore has continued to grow and expand. In 2019, the park opened its eighth themed zone, Minion Park, which features a variety of rides and attractions based on the popular Despicable Me franchise. The park has also added a number of new rides and attractions in recent years, including Jurassic World VelociCoaster, Transformers: The Ride-2, and Sesame Street in Hollywood. Universal Studios Singapore is a vibrant and exciting theme park that offers something for everyone. It is a great place to create lasting memories with family and friends.

name: user_5495
review: Best Experience Ever. Pre booked tickets are recommended. Long queues for all the rides.

name: user_5496
review: Express pass can help to cover all activities and attractions.

name: user_5497
review: Be prepared to wait in line for up to 2 hours

name: user_5498
review: Very disappointed. I used to have a membership before COVID, it was my first visit after 3years, paid about 500 for 3 with the unlimited express pass. I was so disappointed to see so many shops and attractions closed or not in used: - all Madagascar segment in upgrade to host Minions - Lights, Camera, action was closed - Sesame Street was down for 1-2hrs due to technical issues - 3 rides cannot go with Express (including canopy flyer, Ferris wheel, Egypt) - lot of restaurant closed like food court around Jurassic world - many souvenirs shop closed like in Mummys ride or Jurassic World...

name: user_5499
review: Lifetime experience Always buy express tickets.

name: user_5501
review: As a nearly 50-year-old man might say, it's not worth paying 82 to enjoy it. The yen feels expensive, even more so than the weak yen. More and more people get on the express train, and regular ticket holders wait patiently. However, I don't think I want to buy an express train and ride it a lot. What do you mean you have to pay to use a locker?

name: user_5507
review: It's fun, but with long queues! If you're in Singapore, don't miss it!

name: user_5508
review: Great day, all attractions were fantastic.

name: user_5509
review: Riding the roller coaster for more than an hour Finally arrived But because of bad weather And take a break Waited for more than ten minutes I want to say dont waste time waiting Just leave and go to the bathroom. After the results came out, it started operating again. spent so much time and money but didnt experience it

name: user_5511
review: Such a fun amusement park! We visited on a Sunday in September (with forecasted rain) and we were very lucky since the park wasnt crowded at all and we didnt have to wait in any of the attractions! I absolutely loved Shrek World and just that made the visit absolutely worth it! Perhaps the theme food options can be a little bit improved but we had lunch at Mels Drive-In and it was delicious!!

name: user_5512
review: Visited on Oct 21, 2023, Sat for Halloween Horror Nights 11. Overall not bad, but a couple staff seem unsure of retail shop closing time. And one stationed outside Transformers ride said he had no idea where another live show is. Outside Matriach haunted house a bespectacled guy staff told me cannot go in because many people inside. I looked but don't see any queue. But other haunted houses many people all queueing, is Return of the Matriach haunted house kinda special?i found it weird he told me return after 30 mins. Came by again asked a lady and guy staffs can go in now, they seemed confused. Some youngster staff like anyhow one. A bit dissed about only universal express plus ticket holders can take rides, but universal express cannot, unlike last time. Overall quite fun experience and monster icecream is awesome!

name: user_5513
review: Quick trip from downtown, 30 minutes by bus , lots of rides and attractions to keep everyone excited and entertained. Well worth the price of admission.

name: user_5514
review: It was awesome . But I want to share a crazy experience. . . My friends along with some people were stuck in the transformer attraction. And it took literally 1hr to rescue us from the transformer which was having some technical difficulty. So, I don't suggest any of u guys to ho there.. Rest everything was ok...

name: user_5516
review: Should be clearer on ride and big sized people queued for an hour or more to find out I was too big. RECOMMEND THE special q jumping pass if your only visiting for a day other wise you will not have enough time to do all the rides. Also the jurrasic park river ride U Will get Wet.... I REPEAT you will get wet.

name: user_5518
review: No second thought... Express ticket is must if one wants to have more fun and less waiting. We have covered 4-5 rides maximum

name: user_5523
review: Only Transformers are fun!

name: user_5527
review: No Harry Potter or Minions yet, but I loved the express ticket experience. Unfortunately only got to spend 2.5 hours here as we had a flight to catch later that evening. Even so, we managed to get in 6-8 rides. I strongly suggest allocating more time, especially if you dont have an express ticket. I liked that it also wasnt super packed or busy so that was a nice extra.

name: user_5528
review: Nice place but I'm disappointed. I waited in line for an attraction for an hour and they closed it right in front of me without giving me a specific reason. During this time, I saw that many carousels were not working. For this kind of money, this shouldn't happen. The whole arrangement is great, but I thought it would be bigger. Many attractions are closed, the castle is covered with a cloth... queues everywhere, food very expensive. I wouldn't go a second time.

name: user_5530
review: It's a nice place for all age groups,some tips for making more comfortable is 1 take a water bottle with you ,Refil tap are easily Available inside, 2check the waiting time clock which is on entry point that is variable time by time plan accordingly,3 don't forget to explore full part all part is different and easily enjoyed in a day, 4 Take express pass if you are going at weekend or Holiday time , Regular you can cover max

name: user_5532
review: Fantastic place to be. Great rides and shows. Lots of things to do. Popular rides are Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy, Cylon and Human. Don't miss the Water World show. However, the wait time for the popular rides is very high. It was 40 - 50 minutes on a weekday. Imagine on a weekend. It is impossible to see the Universal Studio in a day. I believe, you would need at least two days. There is an express ticket available which gives you instant entry to the rides. However, it comes with a cost. If you can afford it, buy it. It helps a lot. You can manage many rides. These tickets are available in the food stalls/carts.

name: user_5534
review: Had a terrific day filled with thrills spills and fun at the USS Singapore.

name: user_5535
review: Very long waits, some are traumatizing rides for kids, most are boring, but very fun indeed! Go here pls if ur a teen or adult! (I recommend dont go here with kids to the mummy ride)

name: user_5537
review: It's a great theme park with rides The shows are great. You just have to drink enough water. We were there on Sunday and practically didn't have to queue. You can use the lockers at the cable cars for free.

name: user_5538
review: Best place in Singapore. Food and beverages sold in the theme park are insanely overpriced though.

name: user_5541
review: Nice. Having really good time there

name: user_5544
review: Universal Studios Singapore, 29 September 2023 Hiii, this is my first time playing far away from Singapore exploring alone in someone else's country. Starting from the accommodation at 10.00 Dunloop Street, walk towards Little India to take the MRT to Vivo City. Arriving at Vivo City we go straight to the bus stop, there is a special stop for Sentosa - HarbourFront Stn, about 30 minutes with views of the city across the bridge until we arrive at USS yeaaaaaa.. Alone on the USS? yup, explore on your own, (noted: you have previously ordered USS tickets on OTA, guys) so when you arrive at USS, take a photo first in front of the Universal Studios Singapore icon. Erm, because I was alone, I was brave enough to ask another tourist to take a photo, hehehe... armed with it, Hi miss, can you help me to take a picture here? Luckily they want to, or sometimes take photos instead. Wait, if you go to USS, your provider doesn't have a signal, don't worry. Because at USS there is public wifi that can be used. It's a good idea if you go to USS to download the Universal SG app, why? because with this application you can know the location of rides and waiting times in line. Very useful for those of us who want to try all the rides. Because I'm alone, I can really queue at Single Rider, a queue that complements the regular queue where they usually want to ride at the same time as friends or family, honestly this saves a lot of time. Yes, although not all rides can do it. Every certain time there is a show like that, you can check the app for the schedule, so we can take photos with several icons, come here Minnion tunes, transformers etc. There are several rides where it's best not to bring luggage (for example hats, glasses, cellphones) you can store them in a locker first, it's free within a certain time limit. You can try all the rides, the most impressive one is of course the Sci-Fi City ride on the Human Battlestar Galatica, I wanted to try the Cylon one but the queue was 80 minutes at that time, it was really long, The second ride that is a must try is in Ancient Egypt, you have to enter through a long corridor with a very mummy atmosphere, you get a really scary feel, riding a train in the dark. At the end there will be a photo of us taken while riding the ride, you can also ask for a print, hello. The third ride is at Lost World, Canopy Flyer and again it is great for single riders. Really like the Far Far Away location, the location is really beautiful.

name: user_5545
review: Although it was a weekday, it was crowded. I should have bought a Fastpass.

name: user_5550
review: Good for both kids and adults. Cant wait for Minion coming in 2024

name: user_5554
review: It is all good but each theme took lot of time to wait. Everything you eat inside is expansive. People are enjoying rides like anything.

name: user_5555
review: In general was fun, but honestly not very efficient park in regards to queues - very slow big queues even when the park is not at peak. Staff very annoyed and unfriendly. A park you go once sand thats it - in comparison with thr parks i have been yet around the world i would rate it the worst.

name: user_5556
review: No visit to Singapore is complete without a visit to Universal Studios Singapore / USS. One of the most visited family tourist destinations, the games are fun, but there are some games that are not allowed for children under 100 cm tall. Transportation to USS is easy. It is recommended to buy entrance tickets online.

name: user_5557
review: Great experience but roller coaster is very different experience after completion we again come back like new born

name: user_5558
review: I'm thrilled to share a fantastic review of the 2023 Halloween Horror Night, now in its 11th year! This spine-tingling event features five haunted houses, each with its own unique theme. From the chilling "Weekend" with a clubbing vibe to the haunting "All of Us Dead" inspired by Netflix, and even a school-themed experience, there's something else for everyone to explore. In addition to the haunted houses, there are three scare zones that provide perfect opportunities for video capture. Explore the eerie Hindu and Chinese themes, and discover the mysterious XXX theme as shown in my video. For the regular admission (peak times), it's 89 dollar per person. But for an unforgettable experience, consider the Halloween Horror Night RIP Tour at 349 dollar per person. This VIP package includes fine dining, express access to all haunted houses and facilities, even the rollercoaster with unlimited rides! Moreover, you'll get the 6D photos printed during a private meet and greet with the selected ghosts, and a tour guide will accompany you for 3 hours, explaining all the chilling themes. With the RIP tour, you won't miss any haunted house, and you'll finish early, making it well worth it. I've already attended for 2 years! This year's Halloween Horror Night deserves a solid 4.5/5 rating. Don't miss this thrilling event it's a scream!

name: user_5559
review: Rides are amazing and worth the wait..if you want to jump the lines..but the express tickets

name: user_5560
review: must go there for transformer..

name: user_5566
review: The kids had a lot of fun. Every time I come, it's fun. Very good player, give 5 stars

name: user_5567
review: [General review] It was quite empty compared to USJ in Japan. It's small, but you can have plenty of fun. I used it on a weekday in early October, and I was able to enjoy it enough even without the Express, probably because there were fewer people on the move early in the morning. If you want to enjoy it for a short time, we recommend purchasing it, but if you have 5 or 6 hours to enjoy it, you may not need to purchase it. Please note that outdoor attractions will be closed if it rains [Accessibility] This time I used Grab from near MBS. It takes less than an hour to get there by public transportation, so if you have a large group, it may be more cost-effective to take a taxi. [Food facilities] It's not cheap. watermelon cup for 7 I remember the ramen being around 17.

name: user_5569
review: The Transformers attraction is one if the best rides in the world. The rest of the parc nice but not very special. Needs an update

name: user_5571
review: There are lots of interesting photo spots even though they haven't entered Universal Studios yet

name: user_5576
review: I have been there on Monday, but there were a lot of people there. The most i like is Transformer. Everything is expensive! Horror night theme park looks interesting.

name: user_5579
review: Wonderful experiences with some amazing movie characters. Lots of rides and attractions inside. Worth every taka

name: user_5582
review: Should go early in the day to avoid long queues at the rides. If you have an express pass, you can skip them, but be sure to buy the express pass in advance as at the park, they had run out of them by 12PM. Book online via apps like Klook and the admission ticket would be much cheaper. The longest lines are at the Canopy flyer, Jurassic world and Cyclops. So Id recommended to anyone to get done with these rides as early as possible in the day before the queues start to get lengthy. A hack that nobody seems to have mentioned is: on some rides, you have a single rider line which is about 70-80% shorter than the regular queue and about 50% shorter than even the express queue. If youre visiting solo, or if youre in a group that is willing to split up for the ride, use these lines. Itll save you time and money. The people in this queue are used to fill up the empty seats on the rides after groups have boarded.

name: user_5583
review: Who would want to miss this place ? The prime reason to visit Singapore.

name: user_5584
review: Lovely place but hourly long queues for every ride. Make sure u buy express pass if u want to enjoy all the rides otherwise max u can do 5 rides in whole day...

name: user_5588
review: The theme zoning is reasonable, but the circulation lines are very unclear. It takes a long walk to find that you have taken the wrong path or run to the exit of the facility. The toilets and smoking areas are clearly marked, which is more friendly to families traveling with children.

name: user_5589
review: Smaller than other universals but good to play
