name: user_5591
review: Wonderful experience!!! The lines are long, try to get an express pass if possible

name: user_5593
review: My first experience at a universal studios. We bought tickets in advance. Place opens at 10 am and it was crowded. There was significant waiting time which extended up to 60 minutes for roller coasters which were mainly there for most of the places. I would like to suggest you to go to the last and distant places first and come towards the entrance because it will save your time as peoples are gathering at the closest places to the entrance. For most of the roller coasters you ahve to keep away all the loose items, cameras etc. There are times displayed for live shows like encounters with various film characters like optimus ,bumble bee, raptors, scorpion king etc. The jurrasic park water experience missed because the waiting time was 80 minutes when I was there. Mnay places to buy souvenirs and food which are bit expensive and if you want you can have printed photos of you for 35 SGD per each. Shows end by 5 pm. There is another ticketing method called universal express which has smaller ques and fast access to activities.

name: user_5595
review: We had a fun time at the Egyptian booth, Water World, which is more impressive than Japan, Jurassic Park, which is slimmer, Starbucks in the park, and pre-purchased premium passes so we didn't have to wait!

name: user_5596
review: Amazing theme park so much fun and great rides and meets and greets! My favourite ride was Cylon shame its so much better than Human! Also Megatron insulted me!! :)

Most height restrictions are at least 122cm, which is more suitable for playing. 2. Drinking water can be filled everywhere There are usually very few people in the daily shooting team. There is a small path at the entrance that leads to the kingdom that is too far away. You can try playing backwards to avoid queuing.

review: First of all, I felt the high quality of the Japanese staff when I saw them working boringly. The guidance was also slow and I felt like I was working in silence. I was used to USJ, so the gap may have been a lot bigger, but I don't think I'll ever go to USS again.

name: user_5628
review: For the entrance ticket, 900 thousand if converted to rupiah. Each ride is free but it takes time to queue to enter each ride. There are also maps in the app, so you don't need to hold paper maps, just open the app. On the app you can also see stands/places for eating and shops for shopping for souvenirs

name: user_5630
review: Be sure to buy tickets in advance. It's much cheaper. WAUG seemed to be the cheapest. And as of Monday (there were a lot of people), the express would be a waste of money. Even if it is a Sunday weekend, there are more than 4 rides even if you wait, and those 4 rides are all here. As for the show, LA Universal has a plane flying in, but here it's a bomb boom. But the actors' acting is really good. The rides are similar to other places.

name: user_5631
review: I think the name alone, the world-famous Universal Studios, is reason enough to visit, but since this was my second time, I didn't have great expectations. I think it would be a good idea to visit if you have children.

name: user_5632
review: Universal Studios Singapore is Southeast Asia's first and only Universal Studios theme park, part of Resorts World Sentosa on Sentosa Island. The amusement park consists of 7 themed lands (Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi City, Ancient Egypt, The Lost World, The Long Haul and Madagascar) located around a lagoon and includes 24 rides and shows

name: user_5634
review: Lots of fun, lots of toys, lots of people.

name: user_5635
review: Good management, rest, food, shopping, travel, like

review: Great Place for enjoyment n rides... But don't bring kids under 4 years. Tickets are free for under 4 years but you can't bring on rides with you due to height requirement for them. unless you all go with friends and big family to takecare your kids while you go for rides...

name: user_5639
review: One of the world themepark nearest from Indonesia

name: user_5640
review: Your day here will be fantastic, with numerous thrilling rides, adventures, and captivating shows. Personally, I loved the Mummy ride. Be sure to book your tickets in advance, and if you're visiting on the weekend, consider getting the Xpress pass to avoid long lines. You'll find plenty of food carts throughout the park. Don't forget to download the Universal Studios app, which includes a map showing waiting times for rides and shows

name: user_5641
review: That's great... it's also worth paying for the entrance... the choice of games is a variety of roller coasters (*sorry if I spelled it wrong), for those who like to get their adrenaline pumping, it's suitable here but you won't necessarily be able to try them all, unless you've eaten before entering... so It's enough to save time playing inside... just prepare first, your time inside is only from 11am and ends at 6pm... for those of you who are Muslims, well I haven't seen the prayer room yesterday, is it a coincidence or not? pray, if you're just going to eat, get ready, you'll spend at least IDR 150 thousand for one meal inside... not to mention if you like souvenirs... well, just be prepared... if access there is easy... besides, public transportation is well managed so you won't it's hard to get to/from any destination... happy holidays...

name: user_5644
review: Best day.. Go on a weekday to avoid long queues. Weekends have long waiting hours and won't be able to make all the best rides. Can carry food and drinks inside.

name: user_5645
review: Went for HHN11 on the 2nd day of the opening. I have been going every year (except Covid times) and guess what, you have to visit. The haunted houses are good this time round. Its worth your visit!

name: user_5647
review: Like everyone says, it's an amazing place so much to explore, see and experience. Had a fulfilled time with family, every penny you spend in Singapore is just worth it, the finest places I have ever seen.

name: user_5648
review: Hope they can extend the hours so people can enjoy more especially on times when it's raining.

name: user_5651
review: Welcome to the world of cinema!! Very beautiful amusement park on the theme of cinema. Lots of rollercoaster/roller coaster type attractions. A magnificent day where we lose track of time

name: user_5654
review: Its been three times since I visited Universal, and this time I participated in the Halloween event! The fare on Kkdays is about NT2,000, and the express customs clearance is about NT2,000. The admission ticket and the express pass are purchased separately. The admission ticket also comes with an additional six yuan of Singapore dollars that can be used to purchase souvenirs or food and drinks in restaurants. It cannot be consumed at roadside stalls and specific areas. The Halloween event is from 7:30-00:30 in the evening, so you can arrive early to take photos. There was no queue for us to enter the park, we only had to queue to enter the facilities inside. In addition to five haunted houses, three horror experience areas, and two music performances at night, almost half of the amusement facilities are open for fun. The most exciting thing is the roller coaster. There are many kinds of roller coasters in the park with different ways to play. The difference between a haunted house and a horror experience area is the indoor haunted house and the outdoor haunted house. There are occasionally some staff dressed as ghosts or zombies on the roadside in the park, but they are very calm and will not chase them. The makeup is not particular, and they basically just wear masks and costumes. The style of haunted houses is much different from that of European and American haunted houses in the United States, Canada, etc. Maybe its because everyones physical and mental health needs to be taken into consideration? Although the event is not recommended for people under the age of 13, no children that young were seen participating. In short, this amusement park is suitable for first-time haunted house visitors.

name: user_5655
review: After having a terrible time at universal studios osaka because it was so busy and so unorganised it was so fun to come here. Ran much better cleaner and more organised 10/10

name: user_5656
review: The price is right... the games and architecture of the film characters are cool...

name: user_5658
review: Amazing place for fun and rides. But only if you enjoy all these rides. But you need one full day for this. Waiting time is a lot for each rides. Few rides are just waste like treasure hunting.

name: user_5661
review: Loooved this place! We went there on Monday and there were almost no waiting times. Especially if you take rides as a single rider. My favourite was, of course, the Far far away, as I love Shrek, but everyone will find something to enjoy. The only thing I didn't like is that you have to pay extra for the drying pod at the Jurassic park ride. It is really not worth it as I was still soaking wet after. Also, there is not much healthy options of food and drinks, only fried or fast food.

name: user_5662
review: Your run of the mill Universal Studios, nothing interesting in my opinion. Though a must visit if you are the ones that itch for a small adventure and recreation.

name: user_5663
review: The WOW factor was long gone, yet RWS still existed and persisted in clinging to the popular US Hollywood-themed aging rides to bring in the hoardes. If you think you wanted to give your parents a treat with a trip to USS, think again. Many of the rides involved hard twists and abrupt stops. The Mummy and Transformers are examples. Anyone with the slightest neck, backbone, problems, or vertigo. The youngsters may find the rides exhilarating. But anyone with the slightest neck, backbone, or vertigo should think twice, better off staying away. I am saying this at risk of incurring the wrath of SDC and flag waving locals. Clearly, I am not of the targeted customers' profiles. But SDC and RWS and Gentings should take note that Singapore is into a super aged era.

name: user_5665
review: We went for the Halloween Horror Night and werent able to visit any of the haunted houses due to over an hour wait for each one. Paying S89 to just walk around the park at night was a huge waste of money.

name: user_5667
review: Had an awesome time with my kids! Frankenstein was so scary!!

name: user_5668
review: I ate this coffee cake in Starbucks, Universal Studios, Singapore. I found it expensive in Singapore dollars yet it was a worth try.

name: user_5670
review: - one of the best places to visit in Singapore - lot of adventure rides - best rides were BG human , BG cyclone , Revenge of the mummy and Transformers - cleanliness was observed everywhere - personally recommend for people above 10 years - waiting time is long for regular pass - Express pass recommended to enjoy the rides frequently - some rides were closed due maintenance - food quality average and less options for vegetarian - lockers are provided to keep your belongings - Start for universal studio early/on time - easily accessible by MRT from any part of Singapore

name: user_5672
review: I highly recommend buying an express ticket. I came on weekdays and the queue was amazing, especially for Transformers with a queue time of 1 hour . For operational hours 11.00 - 17.00 I think it's a shame that the time is up for waiting. If you want to buy an express ticket, buy it in advance, because when I wanted to buy it on the spot, the express ticket had already run out But it wasn't bad, I got 5 rides (Sesame Street, Transformer, Human, Cylon, and Mummy) and 1 show (Water World)

name: user_5675
review: USS is now having renovation to make way for the new minion attraction and part of the Far Far Away area is closed for maintenance and missed the Shrek 4D movie. Will recommend to reach USS at least 15mins just before the opening hour as they will normally allow entry into USS 15mins before opening time. You can immediately venture into the popular rides (e.g. Transformer ride, Mummy ride, Battlestar Galactica etc.) to avoid long waiting time later. Do note that the opening hours during the Halloween period is slightly earlier and it is opened from 1000H to 1700H instead of the usual 1100H to 1800H. In addition, try to avoid bringing too much stuffs as some of the rides do not allow any handcarries. You can either place your stuffs at the lockers provided (never used it before but it is quite expensive) or leave it with a non-rider. Lastly, I will recommend to have your meals outside of USS as there are cheaper options at RWS or near the USS entrance. You can request for re-entry as long as you hold on to your tickets. Overall quite an enjoyable experience if you are going with your family or a bunch of friends.

name: user_5676
review: Fortunately, there were not many people around. The queues for the rides did not exceed 30 minutes, and some even lasted for 10 minutes. I had a lot of fun.

name: user_5677
review: So busy recommend doing the rides first, while the queues for the haunted houses are 80mins then do the haunted houses after, then everyone's doing the rides. Noticed wait times were shorter for the houses later in the night while the queues for the rides became much longer.

name: user_5678
review: Some areas of the park are under renovation. You probably only enjoyed 3/4 of the park. Unlike the USS in US or Japan, Singapore USS needs to improve alot. I have visited USS in Japan and US, they have the characters mascot seen everywhere and children enjoyed seeing and taking photographs. Singapore USS is so boring where I finished the whole park within 2 hours. I feel they should reduced the price since some attractions are under maintenance and some areas undergoing renovation. Very disappointing.

name: user_5679
review: It is fun and good to avoid queue I suggest buy a ticket and express time in advance

name: user_5682
review: Halloween light was awesome! Worthy the ticket but some of the temporary atractions the wait LINE was insane! 70 to 80 minutes!

name: user_5683
review: Great fun and excitement

name: user_5688
review: I thought it wasn't scary in the Mummy Exploration review, but it was really scary.

name: user_5690
review: Customer service above and beyond. Reasonable pricing and all-around fun

name: user_5691
review: Really good place if you want to have fun , this place is super fun but the queue is always long.The ticket is reasonable and there is alot of nice shops there. I rode on one of the roller coaster, Amazing!

name: user_5692
review: The Transformers ride was insane!

name: user_5694
review: Transformers should be a must visit place in USS

name: user_5698
review: Amazing studio with different theme and attractions. Nearby Sentosa island and beach a must to visit.

name: user_5699
review: The way they estimated the waiting time for rides is horrendous. Hard to trust them when they wrote there 30 min which turned out to be more than an hour wait. Compared to the past where the left side of the park had Madagascar etc, now that entire part of the theme park is closed for development of Minion land. Easily 1/3 of the park closed up? And many shows were available like twice a day only and if u miss those timings then too bad for u. So end up u miss many shows and miss the 1/3 of the park, and I dont see the ticket prices being reduced by 1/3 the usual. Note last time Covid they closed the Shrek 4D show. Now its still closed. Used to go a restaurant just opposite Jurassic land. Food was quite good. I think discovery something. It was closed too! And as u walk everywhere in the theme park, many wagons/stalls were closed too. And sgp weather is scorching hot, every queue is minimally 30 min long on a Friday. PLEASE DONT WASTE MONEY BUYING ICE CREAM THERE. Within 5 seconds of buying your ice-cream, its already 1/4 melted and dripping down your hands. Within half min, I can say its a terribly messy sight and mood dampener. Buy ice cream if you want to spoil your day and stain your clothes. Walking around u can see frowns on everyones faces due to the heat and many staff wore frowns on their foreheads plus giving a rude and cold attitude. Oh please. How do u expect guests to enjoy if most of your staff look so grumpy.... I dont mean all staff though. Some were nice and friendly but really only a few in numbers. Overall, I wont go back unless there is 1/3 price reduction until the minion land opens and all the attractions/shows and stalls/restaurants open. Then I think its justifiable. P.S. standards of toilets are a far cry from what you can see in Tokyo Disneyland although Tokyo Disneyland is much older than USS.

name: user_5701
review: Loved The Mummy, Battlestar Galactica, and Transformers! It was a rainy day, so I think there were fewer people, though it was Sunday. Would love to have an annual pass to try the rest of the other rides. One day is definitely not enough to try everything.

name: user_5702
review: Going an a tuesday but its still very crowded, waiting time rides almost 45 minutes

name: user_5703
review: Very fun place to go with family, it's small though.

name: user_5704
review: A place for a fun filled day with family or friends! Pros: - Numerous activities & attractions - Rides are well maintained - Spacious for a number of tourist - Events around the clock around the park - Sufficient facilities - Good locker space - Surau available on site Cons: - Expensive food with so-so food quality - Long waiting time for those without fast pass (1-2 hours wait time) - Entrance can be quite crowded even early morning - Not a lot of benches to sit down

name: user_5706
review: To do justice to your visit to Universal Studio, buy express tickets. Transformers, Mummy Returns, Shrek, Jurassic World and Lights, Camera, Action are the best attractions.

name: user_5708
review: Long queue for transformers but worth the wait. If you want to ride in Jurassic Park you need to bring a poncho. We highly suggest purchasing an express pass to skip the long lines.

name: user_5709
review: Loved every experience in the theme park. Help was good, food is good, and rides are very calculated. Worth every penny There are things I'd like to point out though: - The area in Far Far Away is very, very vulnerable in peak daytime (12 - 1 PM) as the sun hits the area very directly. Very few people walk around this area in this time of day, as some are seen taking shelter in the doorways of a shop or a restaurant (blocking the ways). I suggest adding more chairs & umbrellas for them to take shelter in. - I noticed some parts were not finished yet, like the magnificent far far away castle was still covered in facade. And a close path just in front of Minion Land was too, vulnerable to peak daytime. - Please add more chairs / sitting places to some areas, many people are sitting in the floor to wait or resting.

name: user_5711
review: This is an amazing place to be and loads of things to do. But the waiting time for some of the shows and rides are high.

name: user_5713
review: Universal Studios is an amusement park. All the rides are enjoyable but if you have really young kids from age group of 6-10, then many rides are scary for them. The donkey and Shrek show and Trolls show is enjoyable for the above mentioned age group. Jurassic park is another attraction that children of the above mentioned age group will enjoy especially if they can identify various dinosours. Don't make the mistake of thinking that one can complete Universal Studios, Sea Aquarium and Dolphin island on the same day. It's not possible to do all properly in 1 day One day plan for Universal Studios, 2nd day for Sea Aquarium and Dolphin Island.

name: user_5715
review: We had the opportunity to visit this theme park during our vacation. A very nice surprise from an originality and decoration point of view. The decorations are magnificent and impressive, particularly the Egyptian part... The attractions offered are relatively calm except for the two flagship thrill attractions... which also see their queues very long... The attractions present are new, not seen in any case at DisneyLand Paris. 3 stars because despite this environment, there are many negative points. Firstly, the opening hours of the park, it only opens at 10 a.m. and closes very early (6 p.m.)... when you want to enjoy the two most popular attractions, you have to wait 1h30 on average... which means that there is little time left to explore the park when you spend 3 hours waiting for two attractions. As a result, this makes the cost of entry quite significant: 82 Singapore dollars for an adult... you have the option of taking a VIP PASS, allowing you not to have to queue for the attractions, price per person in addition to the ticket: 80 dollars... help!!! Finally, the last black point, the lockers. The attractions cannot be taken with your bags and personal belongings, mobile phones are also prohibited in the attractions and in queues, so very few souvenirs... Lockers are then positioned for each of the attractions for a maximum period of use and then paying for it... which means that it is almost impossible not to have to reach into your wallet if you want to do the main attractions.

name: user_5716
review: Had a Thunderstorm the day I went which meant the cyclon and human coasters were closed most of the afternoon. The lack of big ticket rides in this park means that an express pass is likely not needed.

name: user_5717
review: Totally useless place. Only the Jurassic ride is good, but it's too short, only like 3mins that's it. Treasure hunt is a joke, even 3 year old kids will get bored. Lights camera action show is also nothing great, it's bearable but again too short. Water world was not available when we went. Trolls show in the end was big joke unless you are a teenage girl. Mummy ride is good if you don't have motion sickness, remaining rides are garbage. Overall don't spend more than 4 hours here.

name: user_5720
review: It was a lot smaller than I was expecting. Definitely worth getting the express passes too.

name: user_5722
review: An enjoyable and not too busy place. Definately recommend the express pass

name: user_5724
review: Good place to bring kids to for amusements and beach when in Singapore.

name: user_5725
review: There are a lot of people, but it is very fun. It is recommended to go on weekdays.

name: user_5728
review: Too warm... needed more shelter. Long queue for ride... and mostly under the hot sun. However, the ride is good when you got there.

name: user_5729
review: One of the must visit places at Singapore. People of all age groups will enjoy. Human and cyclone roller coaster, Mummy, Transformers ride are must visits.

name: user_5730
review: Nice place to spend the day. Couldn't go on many of the rides since my 5yr old daughter is too small for them.lots of areas being renovated. Gift shop and food is expensive inside,went a couple of rides with less wait time.

name: user_5732
review: I visited the universal studios on 28th September and I felt that the park timings from 11am to 5pm (rides close at 5pm sharp)is very very less. Ideally it should be atleast for 8 hours. Secondly entering without an unlimited express pass serves no purpose as there is a minimum of 40-60mins waiting time on average for every ride. Also most of the rides and shows were closed due to service issues. Although the rides are good ...they are vv few compared to other parks and the entry fees they charge Overall it's not at all worthy.

name: user_5734
review: Visited on a weekday in mid-September. I arrived around 11:30, but the entrance gate was empty. I got in without lining up. After passing through the arcade, you will reach the attraction area. There aren't many, but I get the impression that there are a lot of screaming ones. When riding the Sekyou-kei, you must leave all your luggage in a locker. This will be strictly checked. From bags to sunglasses and smartphones. Lockers are located near the attraction and are free for 45 minutes. First, operate on the touch panel The locker number to be used will be displayed Put your luggage in Be careful with Jurassic Park Rapid Adventure. People coming down were soaking wet. Some people were drying their shoes in the sun, and there were hair dryers for people. There were also people in swimsuits. The attractions we rode on were Sesame Street's Spaghetti, Canopy Flyer, Revenge of the Mummy, and Puss in Boots. Each wait time was 20-30 minutes. We ate, went shopping, and had fun until about 5:30 pm. Very compact. There seem to be few visitors. And since there are many things that USJ doesn't have, I really enjoyed it. Due to the weather, it rained in the evening. Is it because it's almost rainy season? There is a tempting souvenir shop near the entrance. This place deals with all sorts of characters. There are some things you don't see in Japan, and it might be a good idea if you forget to buy them. Purchase tickets online in advance. You can enter the park by scanning the barcode on your smartphone.

name: user_5737
review: Everything was wow except the roller coaster was under maintenance during my visit. Too bad! Also, queues were quite long for some popular rides even in a weekday.

name: user_5738
review: Crowd is too much even on weekdays. Most attractions were either closed or under maintenance.

name: user_5739
review: Visited on a Tuesday/Wednesday as a non-resident. Pros: -No queue while buying admission tickets at the self-service kiosks with card payment (during my time of visit). -USS was very empty when I visited. No queues for any of the rides (during my time of visit). -Rides are maintained. Shrek 4-D was under regular maintenance during my visit. Downsides: -Very expensive for the same rides since I visited many years ago. SGD 82 per adult (online purchase or at the kiosks). -It's small.. there aren't too many rides and it didn't take long to finish walking around the venue.

name: user_5742
review: The facilities are all accessible quickly and the waiting time is not long.

name: user_5743
review: All we can see is grumpy face and rude staff, i am guessing no proper trainning from the management.

name: user_5746
review: Very good experience...thanks to F1 race, place was not busy even on sunday

name: user_5747
review: Amazing! We got the Universal Express Tickets which definitely worth it to avoid the long queue.

name: user_5748
review: You have to be very careful with the ...

name: user_5750
review: It's the most happening place in Asia, I will recommend it you everyone , always pre-book tickets ...one day is not enough to cover everything , jurassic Park raide , mummy ride is awesome...ofcourse mummy ride not recommended for kids , stroller is needed for roaming with kids , it is advisable to bring drinking water bottle , we can refill, it's neat and clean everywhere, express pass tickets may be recommend in busy season

name: user_5753
review: One of the most popular location in singaopore. Whole day trip. Many free rides availble.

name: user_5754
review: Be sure to use express. Since there aren't many attractions, there was usually a wait of about 50 minutes for popular attractions. I'm so tired of waiting but it's so much fun Water World was also good.

name: user_5755
review: Park closes at 5pm youre lucky to get on 3 rides due to que times. There is an express ticket but sell out fast. Really not worth the visit unless you enjoy standing in a Que for over an hour in 32 deg sun with young kids for every ride. Its absolutely not worth the ticket price. Much better things to experience in Singapore.

name: user_5756
review: The transformer ride is highly recommended, has a very long queue but worth it. Didn't disappoint

name: user_5757
review: An excellent fun place with the only downside being the fact that they do close and that at 5pm. Just amazing and a wonderful place to be experienced!!!

name: user_5758
review: After visiting the Universal Studios in Orlando, I have to say that Singapore unfortunately can not compete with them. The theme worlds are too small to really get the feeling of being in a different world, the coasters are OK but nothing extraordinary.

name: user_5761
review: I went on a family trip. It was the day of the F1 Singapore Grand Prix, and the official website said it would be crowded. I was wondering if I should buy an express pass, but I was able to enjoy the attractions without having to wait at all. It was fun to see all the attractions and worldviews that Universal Studios Japan doesn't have. However, it is smaller in scale compared to Universal Studios Japan. I felt that the admission fee was high considering that many of the attractions were monotonous.

name: user_5763
review: Excellent place and a visit for those who come to Singapore. Vibrant place but loaded with crowd for each ride. Need to plan better or sacrifice a few. Also the dry pads were not working which is essential to be in operative state when you are done with Jurrasic Park ride. Be ready to get soaked if not.

name: user_5764
review: Its nice but quite expensive and small. If you avoid the weekend the waiting time is fine. You can do everything in a day. Food wise you can go outside, its a little cheaper

name: user_5766
review: The rides are extra ordinary however if u are not an Universal Express Holder, be prepared to wait minimum an hour to complete a ride. Express Pass should be purchased along with Admission ticket. Express Pass carries additional price

name: user_5768
review: One of the branded playgrounds closest to where I live in Indonesia, so the theme is interesting and we definitely know it if we like watching it. As of 28.09.2023, a new ride is being built with a Minions theme. It is recommended to buy an Express Pass if you go here during peak season, so you can play more rides if the crowds are busy

name: user_5769
review: No wait time on a rainy Sunday. We got in at 10:50am, finished by 2:30pm. 7rides in just 1.5hrs!

name: user_5770
review: The transformers is a must. Don't miss it

name: user_28
review: Tips for your visit: - Bring an umbrella - Current wait times for the rides can be found in the park's app - You can bring food and drinks - Leave your large backpack at home - On the way home, there's a long line for the tram; right next to it, you can queue for the other direction without waiting and still board the tram towards Harbour Front

name: user_5772
review: 84 SGD per adult for one day pass. Under normal circumstances it would be OK but quite a number of attractions were closed so value for money wasn't there.

name: user_5773
review: This the worst theme park of my life. If you dont wanna waste of time and money in Singapore, you should go somewhere different.

name: user_5774
review: For normal entry at-least we have to wait 1hr to enter each ride. Better enter through single ride. Too hot. If u r planning to go with baby then it is a bad idea.

name: user_5776
review: During weekday: 60 mins jurassic park 5-30 mins others

name: user_5777
review: Terrible memory, Better to go Mal save your time and money and skins

name: user_5778
review: Had a memorable experienced with this place!! One of the best experiences at Universal Studios ever, as well as a MUST SEE tourist attraction in Singapore. Rollercoaster rides, mummy rides, and the Jurassic Park water ride are all incredibly thrilling experiences that you must try. Some of the interior cafes and restaurants are rather pricey. Can we spend the entire day here? Children and adults can each choose their favorite spot to ride. To avoid lines for any ride, try to visit during the weekdays.

name: user_5781
review: Good place. 5 or 6 good rides out of 14 for adults. 5 or 6 will suit kids. If I had known prior would have taken express pass to take rides without much waiting. Good place to experience. Well curated rides. With an express pass, which is sold at counter and places within, we could cover this place in less than 4 hours and keep the rest of the day to explore other attractions within the Sentesa Island..

name: user_5782
review: Visited here on a Wednesday, it was moderately crowded, didn't have to wait long for the rides, average wait time was less than 10 minutes.

name: user_5783
review: Suitable for a family holiday, don't forget to bring lots of snacks

name: user_5790
review: That was best experience i had in my life. its like a altogether new world. rides are amazing, scary some times but had to try. will comeback for sure.

name: user_5797
review: Very good, very fun, come with the kids to visit.

name: user_5800
review: Everything is very beautiful, nice vibes, the roller coaster are super(!) The only thing, I'm suggesting buy the Express tickets cause there is a lot of waiting...

name: user_5802
review: Visited post-Formula 1 race and bought tickets online ahead of time, along with the Universal Express pass. Familiar with the crowds of the Universal parks in the US, the lines in Singapore were nearly non-existent by comparison. That said, the UE pass made it a breeze to walk onto most rides. Transformers is an excellent motion ride that nearly everyone can enjoy. The Mummy Returns is phenomenal, so much so, that I rode it twice-mostly a themed dark roller coaster ride, I loved the suspense of not knowing exactly what was coming next. The intertwining "Human" and "Cylon" coasters are lackluster compared to nearly every US coaster I've ridden. Especially, please, do not wait more than 10 minutes for the "Human" side; even with my UE pass, I waited nearly 1 hour and for the incredibly short, non-inverting, non-helixed ride, it was far from worth it. Unfortunately, the only other rides operating during our visit were meant more for kids and not much to report on. Shrek 4D still "under renovation". A comedy hour was canceled due to technical difficulties. We grabbed a single order of onion rings (4 large rings and a sauce) and an iced tea to bide our time. There were a few stage performances as we walked around, but nothing that grabbed our attention. I'm happy that we visited, as I love a well-done themepark, but I will wait a while until we make a return visit, hopefully with more rides and functioning shows.

name: user_5805
review: Fun experience at Universal. Disappointed that the transformer ride was closed when I went. Got through most of the rides in a day without express pass. Wish there were more rides and activity. The lines where decent. The most I waited was an hour.

name: user_5806
review: Was hot in September, but the Queues were almost non-existent. Even the tranformer ride only had a 5 min wait. I have heard the wait can be up to 1 hour. Overall, it was a worthwhile experience.

name: user_5808
review: Been here and the best ride that I will never forget is the Transformer. Looking forward to bring my kids on this awesome place.

name: user_5809
review: The management needs to install a water vapor fan outdoors, because the air is hot...

name: user_5810
review: Time to roller-coaster. I love roller-coaster.

name: user_5811
review: Very fun place. We got lucky with the queue because it was raining. We played transformers 3 times and one time we got no one with us. Dang! Most of the ride are from a bit scary for small kid to very scary. Only treasure hunter and Jurassic boat ride that are ok for small kid. Still none is boring. Love to see more costumes walking around. The food court is well organized.

name: user_5812
review: Quite an experience. The thing is, when you got there don't just blindly follow long queue to particular game, ask the staff for detail then get in queue once it suits your expectation. I would recommend the roller coaster and Revenge of the Mummy (mummy tomb ride). Recommend the express queue for the roller coaster, no wait. It took around 1 and half an hour to get in ride in the regular queue. I INSIST you to take the mummy tomb ride, the entrance was very quiet it really add the horror ambience, I thought it was like the sesame street galaxy ride turn out to be extreme ride and exciting storytelling, better than the roller coaster IMO (not recommended for the faint hearted for both ride). I'm planning to visit this place again soon.

name: user_5813
review: Back here 3rd time, somehow the places show some aging especially the building. Anyway, still had lots of funs especially the children!

name: user_5814
review: Good day out..but a lot under construction which they don't tell you about Great if you have young children.

name: user_2067
review: Came on a weekday to avoid the long wait to enter, you can buy the ticket on the spot in a cashless way. Don't forget to bring a raincoat with you when you play the Jurassic Park games. There are many payment rented lockers with a price of 4 for 1 hour, and there is 1 free rented locker for 1 hour near the mummy games

name: user_5818
review: Was good fun, some rides were closed but the ones we went on were enjoyable.

name: user_5819
review: I had wonderful experience there and enjoyed a lot but you need to buy express ticket because without it you just can go for one ore two game there

name: user_5820
review: Very little attraction. There are only two rollercoasters offering a little sensation even if they are very short. Very disappointed with the price of the ticket.

name: user_5821
review: The staff service was friendly, but have to queue for at least 30 minutes for the popular rides.

name: user_5826
review: Highly recommend to be there already just before opening at 11am. Visiting Mid-Sep we did not have to wait more than 10min to enter. Additionally no or just limited waiting time for attractions, so definitely can save money on the express pass this way. Jurassic world was amazing and worth to start with, just as the reverse rollercoaster that will pump your adrenaline to the limit! There are lockers around bigger attractions and for some, you can just leave your stuff with the staff members. Clean toilets and water fountains to refill your bottle. There was maintenance e.g. in the Far far away castle, with no previous information about that.

name: user_5827
review: One of the best amusement park the world. Lots of experience with great memories.

name: user_5828
review: Its very fun, Jurassic Park is also good, I think the most fun is the roller coaster from Transformers to Egyptian themeAwesome

name: user_5829
review: Most thrilling and breath taking experience...one of the best place to move with family in Singapore

name: user_5830
review: The place is nice, fun to gather and take selfies

name: user_5832
review: Pls buy a universal express pass to avoid queues. Transformers and you must try.

name: user_5838
review: Very long queues for all the rides. Organisers sell tickets without any limit on number of tourists inside the park. The whole park is overcrowded and no change in rides for years now.. without express tickets it's waste of money..much better parks in Dubai and abu dhabi and they are well organized. Infact genting outdoor theme park is better and less crowded than universal. Indians should exclude universal studios from there tour package. It is just waste of money.

name: user_5839
review: Approx 6 hours minimum are needed to cover the place on a weekday without priority paas. Express pass helps you skip the lines (more than double the price for an ordinary entry ticket). Thrill rides to try are revenge of the mummy, transformer, cyclones, human. Other good family rides are jurassic world, shrek 4D show. There are 6 theme parks- Hollywood, New york, sci fi city (transformer), Lost world (Jurassic park theme), Far far away and minions ( currently in the making and will be operational from 2024). Indian vegetarian food options are available inside the universal studio. Sentosa express can be used to travel to siloso beach/ vivo mrt station ( return from universal is free of charge).

name: user_5840
review: If you want to play everything, you should go from the opening. There is a long line for almost every ride. Even though it's not a holiday.

name: user_5841
review: Great variety of rides. Highly highly recommend getting the express pass. If not expect to spend 30-60mins waiting for rides each time. With the express pass, we never waited in lines and was able to go on each ride multiple times. Food can be a hit and miss. I would recommend leaving universal studios and having lunch or dinner at the Sentosa food trucks & restaurants instead.

name: user_5844
review: Lots of waiting in lines without the express pass. If you want to enjoy all the attractions in the same day. It's worth opting for the express pass, as there was around a 40 minute wait at most attractions.

name: user_5845
review: Universal Studios Singapore offers a thrilling and entertaining experience with its wide array of amazing rides and attractions. From heart-pounding roller coasters to immersive 3D shows, there's something for everyone. However, on regular admission, be prepared for potentially long wait times, which might limit your ability to enjoy all the attractions. To maximize your visit, consider investing in an express ticket, which allows you to bypass the queues and make the most of your day. The park's attention to detail in creating themed zones is commendable, offering visitors an immersive experience. Additionally, the staff are generally friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall experience. Dining options are varied and cater to different tastes, though they can be a bit pricey. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit for fans of theme parks and movie enthusiasts, but be sure to plan ahead to make the most of your visit.

name: user_5848
review: Incredible, we are transported into the world of universal, the superb spectacle. We went during the off-peak week, there was no one there, we were able to ride all the rides several times. Be careful, extremely expensive on-site catering!!!

name: user_5851
review: Loved this place everything was so amazing

name: user_5852
review: The place is heaven for children who loves this kinda thing to explore and enjoy.

name: user_5854
review: It was nice but Madagascar area is being renovated until 2024 and the Jurassic Park ride kept stopping. Food is expensive inside. Still nice but wouldn't go in again anytime soon

name: user_5855
review: There are lots of things to do here - all really pricey though. It is an 80 entry fee, not to mention all the food being overpriced. It's a really touristy destination, but if you have kids it might be worth the trek out onto Sentosa.

name: user_5856
review: Self-abuse itinerary. The park is not very big, but several themes are quite interesting.

name: user_5859
review: You spend more time queuing than playing but I guess that is normal for amusement parks. Tickets are expensive, limited and expensive food. Merchandise are expensive too. Most underwhelming thing would be the size of USS, it's minuscule. Since it is the only amusement park in Singapore, I guess I have to rate it at least 3/5 stars.

name: user_5861
review: Nice theme park. It is not that big though. I recommended buying ticket and possibly excited pass as some rides can have very long wait times. Plan your day well to cover most rides and shows. Few rides were closed due to maintenence when we went. Skip basic rides like treasure hunt and save time for more thrill rides like mummy returns, transformers, battle star Galactica, Cylon, etc.

name: user_5862
review: I went in two hours before closing time and had a great time running around! There were lots of places to take pictures and it was fun! I got the express pass so I could get around very quickly! Luckily, it also overlapped with the showtime. If you're going to go, I recommend getting the express pass!!!

name: user_930
review: Meh, it's universal, it's alright. I'm spoilt though I have been to Orlando and California a few times so this place had a lot to live up to and unfortunately it did not come close to its competing relatives over the ocean. Its much smaller and the thrills just don't come close. Its just OK. If you're in Singapore and you're a fan of the brand and it's offerings then it would be rude not to but if you've been to Orlando then I'm afraid you need to be prepared to be hugely disappointed

name: user_5867
review: I bought express, but there are some that don't apply to express. Make sure to check

name: user_5868
review: It is very popular among tourists and is a must-see when visiting Sentosa Island.

name: user_5869
review: If you would like to experience some thrilling rides , then universal studios in Singapore is the go to location for quenching your adventure thirst ! I absolutely loved all the rides in this theme park. Mummy , Transformers & jurrassic world are my favorites ! Visited on a weekday and the crowd was okayish but still opted for an express pass to try all the rides. No regrets ! Moreover, you can choose cable car/mono rail to reach this place.

name: user_5870
review: Nice to spend a different day It has only 4 "adult attraction" Too costly for what it offers but if you want to do something different,it is not that bad

name: user_5871
review: I had a fantastic time at Universal Studios in Singapore. From thrilling rides like the Battlestar Galactica coasters to the magical world of Harry Potter, I enjoyed every moment of the immersive attractions and entertainment. The themed zones, engaging shows, and delicious food options made it a memorable adventure for me and my family.

name: user_5880
review: Cyclone was fun. Not much else than that...

name: user_5882
review: Amazing experience, I enjoyed my holiday there super, recommend for everyone, Singapore

name: user_5885
review: Open every day for 7 hours (from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.). Some attractions have a wait time of over an hour. This means you can only use 5-6 attractions during one visit. Absurd food prices, even for Singapore.

name: user_5887
review: Returned to USS Singapore after 7 years. Able to attend each ride at least twice. Had lunch. No express pass required.

name: user_5889
review: My visit to Universal Studios in Singapore was an exhilarating experience filled with thrills and excitement. The park offers a wide array of attractions that cater to various tastes and age groups. One standout attraction was the phenomenal Transformer ride, an absolute must-try for any visitor. The attention to detail and immersive experience truly brought the Transformers world to life. On the positive side, the park's themed zones were brilliantly designed, immersing visitors in different universes, from Hollywood to Sci-Fi City. The entertainment shows and live performances were engaging, adding to the overall festive atmosphere. Additionally, the convenience of booking tickets online and utilizing the express counter significantly reduced waiting times, ensuring more time to enjoy the attractions. However, the only downside was the occasional long queues, which is quite common for popular attractions. To make the most of your visit, I highly recommend booking tickets online in advance and opting for the express counter to bypass long queues. This allows you to maximize your time and enjoy a seamless experience at Universal Studios. Overall, a thrilling adventure that's perfect for fans of movies and theme park enthusiasts alike!

name: user_5890
review: A very good theme park to spend your free time! Would recommend it.

name: user_5891
review: It looks like you can go around the park in a day. How many rides will you ride? How many times will you ride each ride? It's a matter of deciding these things... It's so hot that I can't stop drinking water. I found myself trying to choose as many events (rides) as possible inside the museum. In any case, it's hot in Singapore. Please be careful of heatstroke.

name: user_5892
review: I liked this theme park...well I'm quite disappointed as one of the important ride( Transformer) was closed for maintenance...In my opinion if you are taking money full then we should be able to attend all or we should get discount informing that its closed on open days.

name: user_5894
review: Try to go in the weekdays , if planning on weekend then better to take express pass . Thats when you enjoy all the rides . Better to carry food inside as you have to walk and water is available in many places you can fill your water bottles . You have lockers avaliable for all the rides and they free for certain period of time , once you exceed that you have to pay

name: user_5895
review: Very nice place and good experience. Definitely will come back.

name: user_5898
review: We bought our ticket at Klook. We didnt avail an express pass and we managed to ride all the rides we wanted to try. The longest time we have to wait is around 45 minutes and the rest is like 10 minutes to 20 minutes only. We super enjoy the place and we get to meet the minion when were about to head out to eat. Many water fountains so you can bring your water bottle.

name: user_5902
review: The place is cool, but the price is very high. We took Express tickets and it cost 118 euros each. The park is very beautiful, but for that kind of money you expect more, only 2 extreme slides. If you are an extreme sports enthusiast, it is better to go to Spanish Port Aventura

name: user_5906
review: Third time here. Tons of rides to do - some relaxing suitable for families and kids, some are fast suitable for those seeking thrill. Lots of stalls selling a variety of food and drinks to quench your thirst and savor the hunger in the scorching heat. Cleanliness is still well-maintained over the years, and the staff are still working hard ensuring we had a good time. Definitely recommended to visit at least once!

name: user_5907
review: the happiest place ever where the kid in you is alive

name: user_5908
review: Obviously oversold on the day we went there. We were there for 5 hours and only got to take 2 rides, the rest of the time was spent waiting in a queue. Ride wait times were nearly 3 times what was shown at the entrance, even express pass holders were waiting for an extended period of time. Food was expensive and poor quality. I have visited previously last year and 2017 and didn't face this issue but this visit to Universal Studios was a total waste of money and I wouldn't recommend the park to anyone until the overselling of tickets issue is resolved.

name: user_5909
review: One of the best experiences ever at universal studios and must visit places in Singapore TOURISM Spot. Should Try rollercoaster rides , mummy Ride are highly thrilling moments ever and also Jurassic Park water ride is so much adventures. Some of the cafes and restaurants are inside but highly expensive . Can we spend a whole day at this place from kid to adult can choose our spot ride. Try to visit on weekdays to avoid queues on every ride.

name: user_5913
review: Evertything is very clean. But when we're here, so many people, we have to queue to enjoy the game. Surau is very clean and proper, but for women you have to bring own mukena.

name: user_5918
review: Van Gogh "The Immersive Experience" at Resort World Sentosa offers a captivating and enchanting journey into the world of the iconic artist. The use of cutting-edge technology, meticulous attention to detail, and immersive multimedia installations bring Van Gogh's masterpieces to life. The gallery provides insightful information about Van Gogh's life and artistic journey, deepening our understanding and appreciation for his work. The layout, ambiance, and knowledgeable staff contribute to a truly unforgettable experience. Whether you're an art enthusiast or curious about Van Gogh, this gallery is a must-visit that will leave you inspired.

name: user_5919
review: We had so much fun I recommend downloading the universal SG application

name: user_5920
review: I bought our tickets 1 week ago from Headout application with a great deal. I like the rollercoasters restaurants and shows in the park. However There are only 4 roller costers at the park. The other part was more for the children not for adults. This park is smaller than the other universal studios. It is highly recommended to buy the express ticket. Although it is almost double the price, it is really worth it. We didnt wait more than 10 mins in any of the lines on a saturday. They have the same universal studios quality in this park as well. One of the best place to spend some time in Sentosa island.

name: user_5922
review: The park, compared to those in Orlando, Florida, is small with fewer attractions. But that doesn't mean it's bad, quite the opposite, it's very immersive and is located on Sentosa Island, which is a spectacle in itself. The park's opening hours are a bit restricted (11am - 6pm) and since it sometimes rains and there are lines, I recommend buying the express ticket so you can skip the lines for the rides. I did this and I don't regret paying a little more. Otherwise, if you're in Singapore, it's worth going!

name: user_5923
review: I absolutely got on the express without having to wait!

name: user_5925
review: Visited the park on an average monday but it was too busy. With "express pass" still waiting times of 90 to 120 minutes for the most popular rides.

name: user_5927
review: Very fun, tourist attraction, suitable for the whole family

name: user_5929
review: You should buy tickets in Thailand if you go to buy them at an event where there is a long line. There are a lot of play equipment. During festivals, some rides have long lines. There are many exciting and fun rides. But Singapore rains a lot.

name: user_5933
review: Visited three times so far..looking forward to coming back on 2024 when the new rides open

name: user_5934
review: I had a great expectation while visiting Universal studio Singapore, but I got a little disappointed. Some of the attractions were out of service, like transformers. The only plus point I felt was the way it was built. I visited the area in a weekday, and in spite of that I was not able to enter into the attractions. The queue was very long in all the stations. The studio was built long back to accommodate less tourists. Now the tourism has developed and the crowd I enormous. I was not able to get the special pass too. So finally I got little disappointed.

name: user_5935
review: The game is all same since i was little but everything well maintained

name: user_5940
review: I visited this legendary studio this Augest. I kindly advise you to take Express pass along with your normal entry ticket if you wish to cover this studio completely within the 6 pm mark. Avoid booking tickets on weekend, on week days express pass will do. A life time experience

name: user_5943
review: Awesome experience... Never before rides! Food is expensive inside (For Indians).... There is no other option though .... Carry some quick bites & drinks... The Jurassic Park ride can make you 80% wet in the last lap... Bring a poncho or buy one for 5 dollars at the ride entrance...

name: user_5946
review: Perfect place to visit and enjoy you leisure time.

name: user_2175
review: This place doesn't have enough attractions for the amount of visitors it gets. Most attractions are at least 1-1.5hr long queues and there's about 10 of them? We were stuck waiting in one because the ride was down. Close to the beginning of the queue and we just left after 30mins of further waiting. They did give us the option of waiting or leaving but we should have gotten an express pass to another ride imo Whole ticketing thing was stupid too. We bought tickets at the train station going to sentosa island. Got lined up at the gates, 1hr goes by and we're told these aren't tickets to enter, they're tickets to get entry tickets so we had to line up at a different place again for about 1hr. Frustrating to say the least. If you want to actually enjoy this place then an express pass is a must. It's actually funny that a taxi driver we had a couple of days later told us Sentosa Island sucks. He and all the other drivers had an acronym for Sentosa

name: user_5951
review: The place is entertaining and fun. Rides are not as many as other universal studios. Waiting lines are too long, so either get a fast track ticket or use the single rider path. Best rides for me were the jurassic park, the transformers, revenge of the mummies, shrek show, and the dragon roller coaster.

name: user_5953
review: So I could have managed without the express ticket but hard to buy time when you aren't around for very long. I could have managed without it, but it did come very useful. It is unfortunate that you actually cut the line. The areas are fantastic. Was really impressed with the indoor rides. The transformer lights camera action and the Egyptian ride. So there are options when it rains. There are 2 big roll coasters. And a few smaller but exciting rollercoasters. Overall a fantastic experience. But again it is pricey.

name: user_5957
review: Buy tickets in advance only!! Even if you go on a rainy day, tickets are still sold out. Downloading the app to see the time in line helps a lot. I played it all and collected it all even though I didn't have express.

name: user_5958
review: Place to go when going to Singapore Very wonderful The game is very good

name: user_5962
review: I went there on a Sunday and there was a lot of people. I barely am able to play all the games I wanted even if I arrived at 11am. A few tips to all the people who are going there: 1. If you are going to play the Transformers Galactica roller coaster, go line up at once. I had to line up for 90 minutes even if I went there first. 2. Check if the rides require you to store your bag into the lockers. You have to requeue if you have to put your bags in the locker. 3. The queue for Revenge of the Mummy is very quick in later hours as there are multiple cars. 4. For all the lone wolves going to the USS alone, check if there's a single-rider line. As I went there alone, I saved a lot of time queuing. 5. Download the USS app. It is very helpful as it has a map and all the wait time. 6. Eating lunch in the Malaysian food court is quite cheap, so if you want to save money, consider going there. I was a bit disappointed as the Transformer 3D ride had an error and was closed when I went there. I wasn't able to play that. But overall my experience in there is quite good, and the staff are helpful and enthusiastic.

name: user_5963
review: Universal Studios is possibly what you're going to Singapore for!!! It does not disappoint so many fantastic rides, and please do buy the express tickets so there are no wait times and you can finish all rides in one day! It was rainy the day we went, and some of the rides were stopped for a while, but it reopened soon, and the express tickets paid off for the time gone!! As soon as you step out of the universal studios, there are more attractions, in the evening time, food, and music, and it was just a very happening day! Great entertainment, must must must visit

name: user_5972
review: The smallest of all the Universal Studios, without a doubt, it's cool!

name: user_5974
review: Beautiful Place in Singapore, Specially good for kids above 6 years, There is lot of walk while visiting universal studio, Lot of rides big & small, Beautiful live Street shows, Amazing 5D theatre, Great Animation, must visit place

name: user_5975
review: I was filled with joy as I roamed Universal Studios Singapore, laughing and screaming with excitement on thrilling rides. The colorful parade dazzled my senses, and I indulged in delicious treats. From magical moments to unforgettable adventures, my day at Universal Studios was pure bliss. ,,,

name: user_5977
review: Had a wonderful time. No long ques for the rides we wanted to go on. We entered just after opening at 11.

name: user_5981
review: Street near from sultan mosque.... Amazing of singapure.

name: user_5982
review: Universal Studios on Sentosa Island in Singapore is one of the most breathtaking places in the world. It will change your thinking. How is a theme park!!! You won't understand if you are not here. It will take a whole day just to see it. There are many segments inside. You can get Universal Studios Full Pack from Pilago for S60. If you come here to buy tickets, the price will go up. So it is advisable to buy in advance.

name: user_5984
review: Only 3 big roller costers were open. In the afternoon was the best time to go there, there was nearly no queue

name: user_5985
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling theme park with immersive movie-themed attractions, exciting rides like Battlestar Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy, and fantastic attention to detail. It's a must-visit for movie fans and adventure seekers. It opens at 11 AM so go as early as possible to enjoy every ride. Few suggestions: 1. Going on Weekend or Public Holiday, don't forget to add an express pass to your entry ticket else most of your time will waste waiting in queue. 2. Do heavy breakfast before going as rates of food in universal studios is quite expensive 3. Keep water bottle with you. Bottle can fill as there are many drinking water outlets

name: user_5986
review: Even though I went on a weekday, there were a lot of people. Express is a must

name: user_5987
review: It had ticket deals and it was so fun

name: user_5992
review: Enjoyed the fun for the day

name: user_5993
review: Must visit place in Singapore. The day we visited witnessed 3 shows and few rides because of crowd, if you're planning for Universal Studio all rides get express pass or it would take nearly half an hour for a ride.

name: user_5995
review: The park was extremely crowded, the students had to line up for a long time.

name: user_5996
review: Kids paradise, a must visit place in Singapore. Just be mindful of bringing water bottles for kids. Avoid long queues and go for rides towards end first. You can take umbrella to avoid sunburn and rain.

name: user_5998
review: By far the best during my trip to Singapore!! I wanted to ride more rides, but... It's a pity

name: user_6000
review: We went on a Monday and there were so many people. I can imagine how packed it would be on weekends. The kids looked very tired from waiting on queue. The rides were good but the waiting time is the game changer especiay when you see people having the EXPRESS PASS which allows them to skip the queue for a price. I love that there are water drinking fountains but I hope there would be more seating areas as people were slumped on the floors.

name: user_6003
review: Super long queue. You really need the express pass, otherwise you will be in the queue a loooonnnngggg time!

name: user_6004
review: My recent visit to Universal Studios Singapore was a mix of excitement and nostalgia. While the park had its moments of fun, it left me with the impression of a slightly dated and smaller version of the Universal Studios I've experienced in other locations. We chose to visit on a Tuesday, hoping for a quieter day, but to our surprise, the park was sold out. Unfortunately, express passes were also sold out before the park even opened. Nevertheless, we developed a strategy to make the best of our day. Our plan was to start with the Battlestar Galactica Cylon Ride as soon as the park opened. This decision paid off, allowing us to avoid the initial crowds and kick off our day with a burst of excitement. We then explored the rides at the far end of the park, including the Jurassic Park ride. With the help of the park's mobile app, we managed to keep our wait times to around 30-60 minutes per ride. A noteworthy part of our visit was the Battlestar Galactica Human Ride. I closely monitored the queue times and, when they dropped to under an hour, we joined the line. This is where the absence of express passes became a significant drawback. The ride had only 16 seats, and the express line consistently monopolized the coaster. Non-express pass holders, like us, were left waiting for extended periods while watching the express queue zoom past. This experience was undoubtedly the low point of our day. As the day progressed, the crowds thinned, allowing us to enjoy the Cyborg ride once more. This time, we secured seats in the front cart, which provided an incredible view and an exhilarating experience. In summary, Universal Studios Singapore offers a mix of thrilling rides and nostalgic attractions. However, I must note that the park is showing signs of wear and age, and it's noticeably smaller compared to other Universal Studios locations. It may be considered a lesser cousin to its counterparts, especially the one in California. I recommend planning your visit carefully, particularly if you want to avoid long wait times for popular rides.

name: user_6006
review: It was so much fun The action in Egypt was scary and I wasn't good at it The action in Jurassic World will get you wet, but it's perfect for the hot Singapore weather

name: user_6008
review: Even outside of holidays, there are lots of tourists like now.

name: user_6011
review: Expensive, not many games, not good. I went on weekdays and had to wait for each game about 30 to 1 hour. For some games, I even had to wait 3 hours.

name: user_6016
review: A spacious theme park features many rides and attractions. Make sure to bring a raincoat cause several attractions get riders wet. You can also buy a raincoat here for SGD 5. I think it'll be wise also to download the USS app before coming here to check out the waiting time, access the map of the park, etc. I came here on the weekend and the queue was insanely long. It was very tiring to wait but the rides were fun. Probably worth it to purchase an express pass, otherwise you have to spend so much time in the queue and not be able to complete all the rides.

name: user_6017
review: Big lines in the beginning, i recommend walking in the opposite direction (leftwards). In the last hour, no / hardly any lines, so you can go on the popular rollercoasters then. They are expanding and some stuff was closed so it didnt feel as much of an immersive experience as the one in LA.

name: user_6019
review: Definitely use express. Its great.

name: user_6020
review: I have been a frequent traveler to Singapore. This round i was in Singapore with my family and at the same time i brought my kids to the universal studio. Honestly speaking, we didn't enjoy the experience this round as the left wing after entering the main entrance is still under renovation (Minion Land). Meaning the left portion of the entire land is not able to access due to the minion land construction. On top of that, many of the stores also not opening unlike previous experience.

name: user_6021
review: If we didn't purchase the express line tickets, we would have only been able to ride a few rides in the limited time we had, however having the tickets we managed to ride most of the attractions. I visited here 7 years ago and very little has changed, no new rides so felt it was a waste of money, felt like there was unnecessary queuing for the amount of people in the park, some rides could have extra trains running to better manage the ride wait times, one ride was 3 hour wait time with very slow on and off boarding and 1 train running.

name: user_6023
review: Rides and entertainment was superb but had long ques which was turn off

name: user_6025
review: If you think of the USS, it's very small. Smaller than Lotte World. Express.... Ambiguous. It's not like the express that rushes in like in our country. We spent about 300,000 won for two people's admission tickets, Minions area is under construction, Transformers is closed... Of course, you don't come to Singapore to come here, but it's ambiguous to the point where you have to come to Singapore to see it. Take a picture of the globe in front and go somewhere else.

name: user_6026
review: Play area for children and adults with many exciting thrill games

name: user_6028
review: Avoid weekend and public holiday, manage to only go on 3 rides and if you have kids below 4 ensure to bring a stroller and carrier, Lastly do ensure to purchase the express pass in advance it was sold out on the day we went.

name: user_6031
review: It's become bad now. Why open 11 to 6 ? When there is no way anyone can finish all the rides in the given time. This is my 2nd time and will not go anymore. The average wait time for mian rides were 60 to 90 mins. They should incense the operating hours

name: user_6032
review: This place was just amazing!! I went there with my 2 kids (7 and 18) and they both had so much fun! There are lots of rides and stuff to do. The Queues are so short ( maximum 30 minutes). Both my kids loved the rollercoasters and were very sad to go home. There is a large variety of rides from slowly and small to extreme and fast which were perfect for kids any age. The food is so cheap and very tasty and we had lots of fun buying some souvenirs at the many shops. I hundred percent recommend this place and if you just read all of this: DO NOT GO THERE AND SAVE YOUR MONEY IT WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD!

name: user_6033
review: Luckily, I went on a Sunday and there weren't many people. The wait wasn't long, the longest one was 45-50 minutes, but many attractions were closed, including the Minions and Transformers. It's good to check first during this time. And what you have to be careful of is that it is very hot. Be careful of fainting.

name: user_6035
review: Visited the theme park on Monday and it was super packed! Transformer ride was not open. Other main rides has to wait for 1.5hrs per ride. They got to improve the condition of the waiting queue line. It was too narrow and uncomfortable. Shoulder to shoulder with strangers is very unpleasant. Especially when you are queueing with someone that talk loudly non-stop. I hope there won't be any incidents of stampede if something went wrong. The cylon ride queue you have to queue on the narrow and tight steep stairs. You can buy food from the many stalls available but no place to sit to eat. Super limited seating. The park is quite well maintained and clean. If you are driving, just peaking at the basement. Parking fee is reasonable.

name: user_6036
review: incredible place, there is no way to finish all places there in one day.. i enjoyed all games. Queueing for some games were 180 mins. try to not to go on weekends or public holiday ;)

name: user_6041
review: The place is so fun, we had a very good time!

name: user_6042
review: Transformer ride which is the best ride here was closed . They should give discount on ticket price

name: user_6047
review: For better deals, purchase your tickets online well in advance. Consider getting an express pass, but be prepared for certain areas to be closed for maintenance or upgrades. Arriving early is recommended and avoid weekends & public holiday.

name: user_6049
review: Must visit place in SG. Loved the egyptian ride, Humane roller coaster, transformers and Jurassic park rapids ride. There was lot of waiting for ride so we went as single riders and wait time reduced to 15mins max

name: user_6051
review: It was so exciting and fun to explore at USS. Not Boring i may say...

name: user_6052
review: it was good but too crowded and pricey

name: user_6053
review: Opening hours 11:00-18:00. We recommend buying tickets from Klook. Convenient, no need to print tickets. You can show it from your mobile phone. It is recommended to purchase express tickets to avoid wasting time. One ride takes an average of 1 hour or more to line up. Unfortunately, the day we went to the Transformers attraction was closed for maintenance (25/08/23).

name: user_6058
review: A cool amusement park to visit with or without children. The rides are of an average level of fear, 1 is really fast and scary, the rest are less scary and for children too. There are various shows in the park, you can follow their schedule through an application on your phone or ask the park employees - they answered fluently in English. We took an express pass to enter the attractions without queues, I advise everyone to pay a little extra and enjoy the moment, and not stand in queues. In general, it was very cool, I was left with a lot of positive impressions.

name: user_6059
review: Very nice attractions with no surprises for the waiting times but that's the price to pay. Food is overpriced but as always. Each sensational attraction has its own lockers to store your small belongings during the attraction and this is free. If you are in Singapore it is great to come here.

name: user_6063
review: Universal Studio Singapore (USS) is one of the main attractions in Singapore. Better to purchase the ticket online to get some discounts plus avoid the long queue at USS. One need to plan really well to cover the most of shows and attractions as the time is just 7 hrs from 11 AM to 6 PM. You can download the USS app to check out the waiting time for all the rides and all other relevant information for USS. You can buy the express ticket at extra cost to avoid the long queues for the rides.

name: user_6064
review: Visited on August 24th. It was only open from 11:00 to 18:00, but it's not that big so I was able to get around most of the time. However, it got pretty crowded after noon, and there was a 90-minute wait for things like Rapids Adventure. In the evening, it became a little empty and I was able to get on right away after waiting for 30 minutes. If there were more attractions, it might be worth buying the Express Pass, but when I checked on the day, the unlimited ride Express Pass was about 12,000 yen, so I think it's a bit too expensive.

name: user_6066
review: This was always on my bucket list. Worth visiting. Rides like Revenge of Mummy, Adventures of Jurassic Park and Cyclone are a must to do. Dont visit on Sunday or any holiday as it will rush .

name: user_6067
review: Right amount of raids with huge waiting time for each .

name: user_6072
review: It's best to go on a weekday because it's not too crowded. Coincidentally when we went, many games were being renovated. Luckily we still had time to go visit SEA.

name: user_6074
review: Magical place to spend a day is enough The park is not very big

name: user_6075
review: The park is not very big, but it is very clean and well maintained. The queues at the attractions are very long, the ideal is to purchase tickets online in advance with priority access (Universal Express or Universal Express Unlimited. The best are the VIP tickets, but they are very expensive). Although priority tickets are more expensive, they save a lot of time that you otherwise waste waiting in endless queues, with little chance of being able to benefit from all the attractions. There are also some attractions where Universal Express tickets are not valid. It's also good to know that if it rains, the outdoor attractions stop. A great place for lovers of this kind of entertainment.

name: user_6078
review: Completed a trip in here today. Bad experience and would not come to here again. First, no paper based map as promoting eco friendly Understand. As US based Corp, where is the EDI issue? i have a problem in reading documents through cellphone, but no any assistance would be available in this park. Not favor for people with special needs. Just passed the entrance gate no more than 3 mins, my wife asked one staff on how to use the map. This female staff then asked her to check all tickets for security issues. How dare it is. My family is a big group, and had been checked in the gate. How did such staff suspect our family to cheat the park? Bad experience, never recommand universal studio in anywhere

name: user_6079
review: The park is beautiful and fun and also well done, but the offer of attractions is not up to the cost of the ticket. I recommend it only if you have one more day to spend in Singapore and you don't know where to go, even if it's difficult not to find something to do in this city.

name: user_6082
review: It is relatively the most boring Universal Studios.

name: user_6087
review: Booking tickets online and self scan at the counter later. The Cylon & mummy ride is a must try. Remember to download UNIVERSAL STUDIOS APPS before going.

name: user_6088
review: I imagine it's about half the size of USJ. It's quite busy and there may be some waiting time. I didn't use it, but the Express Pass has super priority, so considering the time, it might be worth purchasing. For the main coaster, I recommend Cylon because the wait time is short. It is not good for people with bad cervical vertebrae. Also, the signal from my smartphone is extremely poor. There is also WIFI.

name: user_6089
review: This is my 2nd time to come here after at least 10 years. I think there were fewer people this time, yet the queueing seemed longer. And this was on a Monday, btw. They opened at 11am. We were there a few minutes past 11 and immediately went to the cyclon and human rides. Both were being tested and no assurance was given of being able to ride either. We went to transformers, it was closed. We then lined up for the Mummy and had to wait 100 minutes to get our ride. The ride itself was nice and exhilarating. The lonnnnnggggg wait was not. Cyclon and human were open by the time we finished the mummy but the waiting time was 2 hours! Single riders was not entertained either. No way! We were able to get to a jurassic ride, lights show, and then water world. Obviously, we wanted to experience more but the queueing time is such a downer. Had lunch in between. The hot weather does not help with the mood. They used to have water sprays back then. On our way out, we saw Panda mascot needing to be washed. For the price paid, the Universal Studio experience itself was a huge disappointment. It even failed to excite me to shop. Testing of rides should have been done before opening. Unavailable rides are also upsetting. Sadly, I'm most likely not coming back; nor am I likely to recommend this place. Does not seem to be value for money for me, and the "fun" aspect of being a theme park simply was not sufficient.

name: user_6090
review: The park is not big, but the crowds are overwhelming. It is listed as a tourist attraction that I will not visit again.

name: user_6091
review: Wrost experience. Too much of crowd. I hardly used just 3 to 4 rides max. Because of waiting time. For roller coaster alone it is took 4hrs plus. Management team have to take necessary plan for this issue to avoid waiting time.

name: user_6092
review: Some main rides were closed. Not enough Express tickets to be sold.

name: user_6094
review: Long waiting times, had to waiting for cyclone ride for 3 hours to then have it cancel on us due to technical difficulties

name: user_6096
review: Beyond crowded. So many people. Multiple rides closed. Massive wait times. As someone else stated. Basically good for merchandise and overpriced food. We managed 2 Street performances, the space spaghetti and Indiana Jones. X3 rides closed. It was a costly and uncomfortable experience with our 4&5year old.

name: user_6097
review: Almost nothing to do. Most attractions closed or broken. We made sure to book tickets in advance, and we're at the park doors 30min before opening. The transformers ride was out of order.
