BOTH big scifi rollercoasters we're almost constantly broken (the black one entirely, the red one made 10 runs in about 20min before breaking again) Too many people with fast pass around, almost all other attractions (waterraft and the one remaining (indoor) adult rollercoaster were overcrowded and had a minimum of 2h waiting time. Lots of smaller shops, restrooms and miscellaneous stuff was closed as well. Do not recommend at all!

name: user_6098
review: If your wanting too go on the bigger rides, I wouldn't go today as they pretty much all closed hahah waste of money I guess unless you have younger kids

name: user_6104
review: We had a wonderful time. Although we did not purchase an express pass, the waits for the rides were quite tolerable. Get there when it opens at 11:00 AM. It is advisable to go to the Lower Lot first and do the rides there such as Cyclon, Mummy and Transformers. Do the Jurasic Water Ride of you wish to get wet. Don't miss the shows.

name: user_6105
review: Super crowded, I mean omg. But it was a great day.

name: user_6108
review: Complete package tourist attraction, can be reached from Vivo City. Hot weather, make sure you have sunscreen and a hat, open from 11.00. Before 11 o'clock, people were already queuing. Bring a Tumblr, you can fill it with water as much as you like. Eat first before entering the arena, because inside the arena it's really expensive, but the place is really top

name: user_6109
review: Best for family travel! Came on Friday so I was satisfied playing here with the kids. Almost all the rides were tested, except for the outdoor ones, some failed to ride because it suddenly rained. Even though I've been dreaming of flying on the Battlestar Galactica. I can only walk when I'm tired, around 6am when I'm about to close. Next trip! The strategy remains, go from the furthest first and focus indoors first.

name: user_6112
review: USS's rides are fun. Only down side are the waiting time and the weather.

name: user_6113
review: Get express pass without a second thought if you are visiting on a holiday. Cylon is the best ride and mummy is the second best. If not for these two rides, I would be very much disappointed. Water park was closed during the visit.

name: user_6115
review: Universal Studios Singapore Date: 2023/08/24 Purchase tickets online in advance: You can purchase tickets (e-Ticket) in advance at KLOOK to save money Transportation: The connecting BUS and MRT in Sentosa Island are free. From ONE15 Marina Sentosa Cove Singapore, you can take BUS B to Beach Station, then take MRT and get off at Resorts World (2 stops) Thoughts: After the park opens at 11:00 in the morning, go to the left and start playing. There will be fewer tourists. However, after 12:00 noon, you have to wait for an hour to queue for almost every ride. Until around 3:00 in the afternoon, the crowds are still quite large. Unless you have purchased an Express pass, it is simply impossible to finish every ride. It is recommended to download the Universal SG APP first. You can instantly see the queuing time for each amusement facility in the park, as well as the start time of each show, to help you plan your itinerary in the park.

name: user_6116
review: Small but ok. Many attractions closed. The waiting times are very long despite the express pass, something is definitely going wrong with the employees organizationally. You could see the park in 3-4 hours. There is only one rollercoaster that comes close to the Hulk track in Orlando. Anyone who has visited the real Universal Studios will not miss anything in Singapore. I was rather a bit disappointed.

name: user_6118
review: It's good but too crowded. But I enjoyed

name: user_6119
review: So many joyrides. Many joyful places for family. Wonderful place. Students can join. Family can visit. Also, couples can visit. Also tge old age people will have fun with this place. But It's next to impossible to complete all rides within a day. Opens at 11am. So crowded so all have to wait. But you have to choice what would you like to ride or see. There are lot's of things to br visited. Food park is also available within the place. One of the most important thing is to keep it clean and clear.

name: user_6120
review: It is a great place for youngsters with amazing roller coasters and other rides. But it was too much crowded and the wait time was really long. Recommended to get Express Pass if you want to enjoy the whole Universal Studios in one day.

name: user_6121
review: If you want to have fun, go to an amusement park. This one is really cool. There are themed areas like Hollywood and New York. The first attraction I recommend going to is the twin roller coasters. They are extreme and I liked the inverted one the most. The roller coaster in the dark in the Egypt section is also really cool. The movie theater attraction is really cool. It's worth it. Take the opportunity to take lots of photos and buy gifts.

name: user_6125
review: I have been to Universal Studios in California so I was a little hesitate to come to the Singapore, because I heard is small, but after todays visit today I think Singapore studio is wonderful because it is small and neat. I get to play all the rides without too much walking, without too many people, and CT with a little bit cheaper price. So I think Universal Studios Singapore is definitely worth a visit.

name: user_6129
review: Awesome but big wait for rides, can't do everything in one day

name: user_6130
review: Great fun for all. A few of the main rides were out of action due to maintenance however, still plenty to do for the day. Arrived at 11am and left at 6pm. Queues can be quite long so recommend the Express Pass

name: user_6131
review: No express tickets available and was too crowded on a Thursday

name: user_6138
review: All facilities are good

name: user_6141
review: If you want to take a picture with the Universal Globe before entering, I recommend coming at 7am. Although you won't have the fog and so on around, you will be able to take pictures yourself. Otherwise, you have to wait a long time for attractions, so I recommend buying Universal express to skip the queues.

name: user_6142
review: Make sure to visit on weekday with an express pass if you want to do all activities. Great place for kids and adults alike. Consider buying tickets and express pass inadvance from Klook .

name: user_6144
review: What a long day ! We went there with my daughters, 2 and 5 years old. ANY ride take 30 min to 120 min waiting time.. that's an horrible experience, if you don't take the express pass (you have to pay twice the price) , don't go at all. It was a weekday... not to mentioned that transformer ride is closed and a big part of the park is not accessible (Madagascar) which was very nice for small kids... in conclusion, the website should have mentioned all that, we are all very disappointed. Never again.

name: user_6145
review: Super busy. 2 hour long queues for most rides which lasts 20 seconds. Nice to look at though with lots of food and shopping options. But

name: user_6146
review: Too crowded. Waiting times were ridiculous. Opening hours far too short

name: user_6147
review: A very beautiful world for adults and children. It is often crowded. I strongly recommend taking an Express card (Fast Pass) because it will save you a long time in the waiting line. The waiting line ranges from 50 to 60 minutes for a regular ticket, but for the Express it is from 10 to 20 minutes, and this is on weekdays, not holidays. The price of the entry ticket is 82 Singapore dollars per person, and the price of the Express is 82 60 per person. There is There are two types of Express, one is a one-time Fast Pass for each game. The other is a Fast Pass more than once for one game and its price is 82 90 per person. I recommend regular express once Working hours are from 10 am to 6 pm

name: user_6148
review: It opened on Tuesday, and there was a line for over 120 minutes at the popular Rollco. Putting all my belongings and bags, including my phone, in the locker and waiting for over 2 hours was a struggle. The locker is linked to the waiting time and is free to use, but because of this, you have to repeatedly put it in and out of the locker every time you ride the ride. If you only ride one of the Rollcos, I recommend the Cylon. Human was mediocre for a 120 minute line.

name: user_6150
review: It seemed quite small to me but had enough activities for the hours it is open. You can get around it in 6 to 7 hours but you definitely have to have an express pass because even with that there is a long wait. The food is very expensive. It is good to have waterproofs with you because many toys throw water and waterproofs are very expensive and disposable.

name: user_6152
review: For those visiting SG for the first time probably a must go... But for those who's on a budget I think you may let go. For around 82 sgd USS opens at 11 am and closes at 6 pm, depends on the day.. during peak you won't be able to ride all attractions due to long queue especially those most sought after like the Mummy, Battlestar Galactica Rollercoasters etc. Food are quite expensive as meals costs from 18 sgd. Many parts of the park are undergoing renovations including the Transformer ride. No fireworks as 6 pm is still very bright when USS closes.

name: user_6153
review: Very hyped, waiting time of 30-150 minutes for rides even on weekdays. Not worth the money. The Transformers ride which everyone raves about was not working, they should atleast inform in advance. Expected much better from this experience. 2-3 rides were not working.

name: user_6156
review: It is recommended to start from the innermost part of the park. Although it is the smallest amusement park, it is crowded with people. Bring extra bottles of water and a small fan to wait in line to get really hot

name: user_6157
review: Only because I cant give 0! Waiting times of 2h30 for 1 min rides... not even that scary... tried to get the express but there is also a huge line even if you pay 90 euros... also they force you to pay for lockers with these huge waiting times...

name: user_6160
review: Admission begins 10 minutes before admission time. I stood in the innermost line and got in quickly, so I got on the roller coaster without having to wait. It's not as big as you think, so 4-5 hours is enough.

name: user_6162
review: With the extra pass, I was able to ride the attractions without having to wait in line. The souvenir shop was also well stocked, which was nice.

name: user_6163
review: Good for first time visitors. But need to improve some new rides. Must buy Express pass to avoid queue each and every ride waiting period Minimum 90 mins during weekdays. Disappointed with transformer ride under maintenance.

name: user_6165
review: It was ok. Go here once and probably never go back.

name: user_6166
review: Nice park but Extremely crowded. More than 1-1,5 hour of waiting time at every single attraction. At most of the attractions it isnt allowed to bring with you your personal belongings and they force you to lock them up in a locker free of charge for up to 45min but they keep you waiting in one attraction for more than 1 hour so unfortunately we were charged 12Sd for no reason at all. If you dont want to wait for so long, an advanced ticket EXPRESS is obligatory! But you have to book it like two weeks in advance.

name: user_6168
review: Get an express ticket if you want to play more attractions

name: user_6169
review: Nice place for family holiday, but reconstruction of some attractions causes big queues on others. Cyclon roller coaster is the best one, but Transformers attraction is main star of the park. Shrek attractions is quite good for a kids, my nieces love that ones. Didn't ride on Mummy attraction, because my relatives saying that its quite scary, and i'm not really fan of horror and screamers. For better experience buy Express tickets, you can avoid quite big queues for expensive price, but on my opinion - that's for the best. Express tickets could be bought online only one day before visit.

name: user_6172
review: It was a place to watch people... It was hot, so I had to wait in line... It was a small place to look around... A place I wouldn't visit again if I go to Singapore again.

name: user_6173
review: a lot of people, queues to each attraction after 40-60 minutes. piston. some attractions were closed. not many attractions. profit over customer satisfaction. I do not recommend.

name: user_6175
review: If you are a tourist in Singapore and planning to visit only once , then pl book express pass in advance Less time for queue and more rides can be enjoyed For normal tickets minimum 1 hr wait.

name: user_6177
review: If you wish to explore the whole park, it is better to buy the express passes. You can wasily beat the queues on most of the rides and shows.

name: user_6178
review: We used Klook to book tickets very early. We opened the app and scanned the ticket that day to enter. It was very convenient. Unfortunately, the weather was not good. There was a heavy thunderstorm right after taking pictures of the earth. It didnt rain until the evening. There was a service center near the entrance for borrowing carts and rain shelters. Because of the bad weather, we didnt play much. I highly recommend Shrek 4D. My sister can also go in and play together. I really think you should pay attention to the time when the characters appear so that you can have a chance to take photos! ! !

name: user_6179
review: I've been here a couple of times, but this time, I tried their VIP Experience Package instead. The lady who serves us - Ms Huda - was the best guide I could ever ask for. She is very friendly and professional. I have been throwing her a lot of questions, and she is able to answer every one of it. She makes sure that our requests are taken care of and gives us suggestions when required. I am impressed. The only feedback that I have is that USS could provide a much better VIP card for us customers. Something like a credit card type of card. Even Universal Studio in California provided those and gave us a good lanyard. They even gave us a small purse with sunblock and wet wipes. I am sure USS can do better.

name: user_6181
review: - I went on Saturday so there was a large group. It's ok to go 10am early to go to the Aquarium first and then go to Universal. - It's just a pity that USS opens late and closes early so there aren't many games to play. - You should buy tickets online in advance to get in faster. - Even though the queue is very long (about 1 hour), most people will queue inside with air conditioning and each place they pass is decorated beautifully so it doesn't get boring, the waiting time doesn't feel too long. Trust me )) - Playing from noon to evening, 5 games are called the most unique in USS, so it's worth a try. - Those who travel on their own can book on Klook because I find that buying a Klook pass package allows you to choose a combo of many locations and the price is cheaper than tickets to other places. I don't care )) Why do you say that? - Singapore is safe and has very convenient transportation, so it's worth going on your own

name: user_6182
review: It's not very big but it's very nice and fun to visit.

name: user_6183
review: We came on a Monday and the place was overcrowded. Minimum waiting time was well over an hour at ever roller ride. Also all the places that you could eat were packed. It was a terrible experience. Universal should put a limit to how many people can enter daily because this makes it a bad situation for everyone..

name: user_6185
review: The place was magnificent my husband and I enjoyed the rides. But make sure to come early they open up to 11 am but still all tickets are already sold out at universal make sure to buy tickets at klooky or in line so you won't end up waiting for 30 to 60 minutes in line. ?

name: user_6186
review: Went on a Sunday. I'm glad the park is open to all again. Might want to think of cooling spots for Parents to rest with kids. Restaurants Far far away Restaurants have far too few seats for the crowd that you would receive at an amusement park. Food is so so and expensive for what it is. Lol. Rides Are ok, if u have Vip access. Otherwise a 40 min queue for a 5 min-ride is, to me, not worth it. But that's just my opinion. Pls dont grill me for it..lol. Safety checks are excellent. Variety is good for all ages. Location Easily accessible and plenty of spots for picture taking, especially by the docks..(Hollywood Area) good spots to chill with Waterview. Notes for travellers: Bring a mini fan(one that can be attached to phones or powerbanks). Be in nice-looking clothes that are light. It is Singapore, humid. A little towel, a pair of sunnies or a hat. Parents- bring water bottles with ice for kids. Enjoy!!

name: user_6187
review: I was super excited take my 3 kids to Universal studios in Singapore but I felt it was not worth the excitement. There weren't that many excting rides to go on just average rides with long waiting times. There are beautiful surroundings for pictures and shops to buy things but overall my experience was just average. I would recommend to buy tickets in advance and plan your trip in advance to avoid disspointment at the entrance. We experienced that on a Saturday. I think it is pretty crowded on weekends. So it's good if you can avoid a weekend.

name: user_6188
review: Amazing rides, cylon is a great ride.

name: user_6189
review: Absolutely like the place, the sets of each theme are immaculate, the details are exquisite, didnt go on the roller coasters because waiting time is too long, but i'd still recommend to go even only outside on the park, from the entrance the aisle is very pretty and once you enter the studios you feel the happy energy and all the characters doing shows, food is very creative, they have amazing topics. You must try the monster cookies from Sesame Street. Price is high but so I guess in all attraction parks. Favorite set one is far far away (from shrek)

name: user_6190
review: Cool place, many of the rides and attractions were out of service, the few working had hour long cues. Some even two hour and half cue. Even people with express pass had to wait more than an hour for the galactic human ride. They're selling way above capacity and not maintaining existing rides. The ticket is not cheap so it wasn't worth it.

name: user_6192
review: The wait for everything is way too long unless you pay extra for a fast pass (150 extra on top of entry per person) The rides are great... but the day we visited The Mummy said 20 mins and we were an hour and a half in the line.

name: user_6194
review: Incredible place. Want to come back one day

name: user_6196
review: Very busy and quite small actually. Pricey and the lines are very long! 3 hours!

name: user_6200
review: I wouldnt say the best theme park, but yeah does its job in attracting crowds and for kids the main attraction is their fav animation characters coming alive.

name: user_6203
review: Southeast Asia's first and only Universal Studio

name: user_6206
review: The park is clean and spacious. Wish they could add more attractions. Restrooms are clean. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. (Book your ticket with Klook ahead of time to avoid long lines and for an extra 5%discount). I really enjoyed the Mummy and Transformers attractions.

name: user_6207
review: Really good fun as a group but I wish they had more adult rides! Does get too busy and sometimes we would go as single riders. The Cyclon, Mummy and Transformers are good rides We were there from 11am - 6pm and we got to try most of the attractions without an express pass but think if it was open it would be better and reduce the crowds.

name: user_6208
review: I visited Here Saturday means weekend. As it is weekend I knew that it will be very crowded, but i didn't expect that much. There are approximately 5-6 lines before every ride. If you don't take any VIP ticket then you cannot go faster. You should have to wait minimum 40mins to do a ride. But even if it is very much crowded the rides are awesome! They are very impressing after a long waiting time

name: user_6213
review: We had so much fun here. The rental lockers are a great idea and we made use of them at multiple locations. Wear a poncho on the Jurassic Park raft ride!

name: user_6214
review: Love the overall great experience. A little bit sad on extreme rides that has long lines. Go for an express ticket if aiming to queue in a short time. Standard still

name: user_6215
review: I really like Jurassic Park and Transformers

name: user_2845
review: A fun place to go. The rides and games will make you busy through out the day.Specially Battlestar Roller Coasters, Transformers ride, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic Park, Far Far Away.

name: user_6217
review: Title: Thoughts on Univa in Singapore Rating: Review details: UNIVA in Singapore was not at all fun compared to USJ in Japan. I couldn't feel the passion of the staff, and I felt the service was a little lacking. Also, the surrounding atmosphere felt tacky. Furthermore, it was extremely hot and I noticed more body odor. However, Univa also had some fun attractions. However, overall it was disappointing. If you have been to USJ in Japan, you may be a little disappointed with Univa in Singapore. In terms of areas for improvement, I felt that the passion of the staff, the service, and the surrounding atmosphere needed to be improved. Also, I would like you to consider measures against heat and body odor. I felt that Univa in Singapore had room for improvement. If you are planning to visit, we recommend that you keep your expectations in check.

name: user_6218
review: Universal Studios Singapore Enters at 11am and exits at 4pm. The average queue is 30 minutes on Sundays. Quick pass without purchasing. It is a small Universal Studios and you can experience it. Klook tickets are NT1,800

name: user_6222
review: Very nice, not a large number of attractions, even in the rain it works (on the other hand it's dead if there's a storm)! So I bought a pretty Universal Studio Singapore poncho! The worst tourists are not Europeans, I would have learned that too

name: user_6225
review: Lot of renovations happening, not a great time to visit! Average queue for normal ticket is 1 hour! Advised to fast track to save time and to save energy Always buy in advance, no tickets on walk in

name: user_6227
review: The game is complete... many choices of rides which are certainly very impressive for playing with adrenaline... and many choices of relaxing places to eat

name: user_6230
review: A magnificent park, although not on the same scale as the one in Florida. Around ten charming attractions specially adapted for children of different ages. You will have the opportunity to meet many characters, and it is quite easy to approach them. Prices remain affordable. Please note that the park is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Our visit on a Saturday went well. As a couple or family, spend a pleasant day here, especially since there are many candy and chocolate shops near Universal.

name: user_6231
review: It is very disappointing to note that having brought tickets online that we still have to get a paper ticket and waiting for almost 90minutes in a queue this is very unfair and we also couldnt get express add-on as we were in the queue for so long. Having spend on tickets at SGD 82 each I felt they should have managed this differently.

name: user_6233
review: Magical place in SG. Even if you have nothing to do, you can still enjoy the vibe. Bring you more positivity

name: user_6236
review: Better to visit on weekdays if you dont want to wait for long in queue for rides..! Well maintained place.. What so may be, please dont miss the Water stunt shows.. it is must watch show..

name: user_6237
review: Compared to price - I will rate it 2 stars only. Too much crowd. Lack of ACs and cooling places. Long queues everywhere. It wasnt kid friendly. Many toilets werent clean. I am not sure what are they doing with 5k INR amount. Buy tickets in advance otherwise you might not get an entry. How to reach - take MRT toll harbour front - go to level 3 of vivocity mall - buy 4 dollar ticket for mono rail (surprisingly costly for one stop) it is ticket of round trip) - go down to resorts station in mono rail - walk down towards universal studio. There is an option in far far away land near dinosaur/lost park for halal food.

name: user_6238
review: You cannot miss it!! Have the time of your life here

name: user_6239
review: Excellent marvelous but long queue and full tired after two rides waiting..very disappointed in the ticket counter system...we already purchased tickets but we wait for 2.5 hrs in the queue ...you can allow direct entry those who tickets already..please consider these points

name: user_6244
review: We bought tickets few days before our arrival to Singapore (recommended). In the day of your visit, we came one hour earlier (before opening US) and immediately we stood into queue. Because we were in a front of queue, we could later enjoy atleast two attractions without bigger waiting time. Normal waiting time is about 50-60 minutes (in the most popular attractions you can wait about 120 minutes). We also found out that many of the places we wanted to see were closed. During the hot day we got some icecreams to cool down(12S and 10S). Beware, prices of meal are 16S and more. Luckily for everybody there are station with tap water so you can fill your water bottle. After the experience from previous 2 attractions we wanted to see show "Waterworld" which should be - how they say on their website "Based on the blockbuster film, Waterworld, this spectacular reveals a tidal wave of death-defying stunts, along with thrills and spills from real explosions of fire and water." ... in real world it was a wave of heat on direct sun for two hours in queue (even for express access), along with human sweat and no space. This show was postponed for 30min already, but we waited here (because we wanted to see the show). When the crowd was getting bigger, stuff let us to a small place closer to the entrance on a direct sun where we waited for 1.5 hour more...after this hell (sun, no shade, a lots of people around, no bench) came one guy and told us the show was cancelled (without no explanation). This experience ruined all day in US so we came to Guest service and kind lady offered us express access or free popcorn. But after waiting for two hours for nonexistent show we definitely didnt want to spend any minute in another "express" queue, or dry our mouth more with popcorn. We left sad, angry and without 300S.

name: user_6245
review: A waste of time and money. Waiting time for most rides are above 1h, and only few waiting places are cooled do you are left waiting in the heat. We could only ride 3 rides. Fast-track is a must but it is even more expensive than the entrance ticket itself. If raining most rides are closed, and they dont reopen until 1h after the storm is gone.

name: user_6247
review: Hundreds of people stayed in line in the noon for the water park show at 2pm but it cancelled 5 min before the show open without explanation! You got to refund my ticket!

name: user_6248
review: Arrive early and buy tickets in advance. Tooo crowded sometimes

name: user_6249
review: A fantastic modern park. Recommended to by the skin the line tickets

name: user_6253
review: Go for universal express pass else plan it on weekday and cover the galactic roller coaster in a way that you don't kill time standing in que. Go for single rider options to skip the que wherever possible.

name: user_6254
review: One of the top spots in Singapore, highly crowded because of its popularity, is highly recommended for adrenaline junkies. Suggestion: Spend a Lil more to save time because of the long queues, buy an express pass.

name: user_6256
review: It's fun, but smaller than in Japan.

name: user_6260
review: Book well in advance if going as express passes run out and aren't available on the day. Use Klook to book tickets. You need an express pass to go on all the rides or expect up to 2 hour wait on some. Food is standard theme park stuff but there is a curry place next to the Mummy ride

name: user_6262
review: Had a great time with my boy and wife. But the food here is over priced and not that great.

name: user_6266
review: The most important express tickets to access all the games in one day

name: user_6269
review: I recommend going to Universal Studios Japan... It's really small and really expensive... I realized that Everland is a really well-made amusement park.

name: user_6270
review: First suggestion is kindly make sure you get express Ticket only. Don't go without that else every ride and show you have to wait 1hr min to enter. Also first plan to go to Jurrisca Park water adventure and then plan to go to Mummy adventure. After that you plan for the rest of the activities. Lunch have in oasis opp to mummy adventure. Its good indian food they have options Mutton and Chicken. The universal studio stop the shows at sharp 6pm. So plan accordingly. Water they will allow. Overall good experience but the queue is very long.

name: user_6271
review: Go either during weekdays OR if weekends I would recommend to minimise long queues. Starting with; 1.30pm - water world show 2pm - catch all the 'shows' and less popular rides 4pm - 6pm - all the popular rides

name: user_6274
review: From ten in the morning, I stopped taking pictures of the globe at the entrance. Waiting and waiting in line. At 11 a.m., admission begins, and whether you are European, Indian or Korean, Even Singaporeans start running. During the rainy off-peak season My son, who leisurely surpassed 10 sports, was able to experience only three things at this time because it was a senior citizen charity program. The food was very expensive. Hamburger index is twice as high Very .

name: user_6276
review: beautiful & fun

name: user_6277
review: Great experience but I wish they had more adult rides! The cyclon and human rides are definitely something you won't want to miss. The Mummy and Transformers were also good. We were there from 11am - 6pm and we got to try most of the attractions without regrets and without an express pass. Enjoy!

name: user_6278
review: The place is superb for kids. Lots of places to visit and the food from the restaurant is really good.

name: user_6279
review: Express tickets buying is always the better... can avoid long queues....

name: user_6280
review: Amusement park on Sentosa Island, Singapore Purchase tickets in advance. It's smaller than Japan, so it's quick to go around once, but the wait for popular attractions like Mummy and Transformers was less than an hour. In the end, I stayed for more than half a day.

name: user_6281
review: There was a lot of waiting, but I had a great time all day.

name: user_3855
review: Queued to get in having already bought tickets online (good thing too as there was a big queue for those). Queued to get a wheelchair and our express unlimited bands. 1 hour gone already. Queued anyway in the express queues which for the amount we paid was a joke. There's a *serious* over capacity issue going on. For those without express tickets, the current waiting time for one ride is two and a half hours I kid you not. Might as well call it Universal Queue World. Won't be coming back.

name: user_6285
review: Although Universal Studios Singapore is small, its still fun! Both adults and children love it!

name: user_6286
review: Tickets are priced to attract massive crowds with probably 10% who pay for express actually getting to ride comfortably. Wait times in the heat were ridiculous. Handful of rides with moderate thrill factor, bear in mind there's only 7 hours of operating time.

name: user_6287
review: Don't believe YouTube channels that say you have to come early to get all the rides. Most of the rides will have a long queue when the park opens. After 3:00 p.m., the queue will be less than during the first period. I've played Transformers 4 times with almost no queue. Anyway, if you want to start early, you should go to the indoor attractions or the air-conditioned rooms. Save your energy and go after 3:00 p.m.

name: user_6288
review: Good theme park. It's busy, but that is to be expected. It would be better if the lineup estimate in the app was more accurate. It's not even close at times which makes it difficult to plan meeting up with the rest of your group.

name: user_6289
review: Try to go there not in high seasons, otherwise you'll have to wait for a long time to try the attractions, or you have to spend more to buy Express ticket. The whole attractions are amazing. Worth it to go.

name: user_6290
review: Universal Studios, the world's smallest, is open from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m., and there is already a long queue at the door after 10 a.m. Even on weekdays, there are still a lot of people. If you don't buy express passes, it may be a bit difficult to visit all the facilities.

name: user_6291
review: I visited at around 1 p.m. on Friday, and the waiting time for popular rides was over 80 minutes. We rode the rides about three times until the end. It was a fun time because there were many things to see even if it wasn't a ride. The downside is that it's very hot outside

name: user_6292
review: Such a amazing palce. Higherly recommend for all ages. I love universal studio in singapore

name: user_6295
review: A very wonderful place for the family and the games are beautiful, but I could not play them because I arrived at the end of the afternoon and the wait for each game took a full hour. I spent my time walking and shopping from the existing stores. It is worth repeating the visit.

name: user_6296
review: A must do in Singapore! Its not really that much of a big amusement park but its offers a lot!

name: user_6297
review: A very pleasant experience visiting this palce. The theme park was fabulous a great fun place for kids and children.

name: user_6299
review: If you want to take your children to play at last minute, it is recommended to buy tickets on travel platforms such as klook or kkday. The price difference is not big, but you may get meal vouchers when you buy tickets online. I have been to Universal Studios in Japan and the United States, and Singapore is really much smaller! If you are just taking your children and dont want to play any exciting rides, you dont necessarily need to buy a quick pass. Ps. The summer weather in Singapore is very hot all year round. You should drink more water and pay attention to the physical condition of yourself and your companions.

name: user_6305
review: Enter only if you have an express pass. It does not make any sense if you just get the admission ticket and wait in hourly queues. Ticket prices are premium so even if taken from any sites like Klook etc would not make any difference. For Indians, ticket prices from Klook, with admission express, will be around 9,500 per person which as per Singapore standards is reasonable. Plan to buy tickets in advance. The queues at the spot are very long. Arrive 20 minutes before the starting time and skip long entry queues by showing your express pass at the entry counter. Try to complete either Jurassic ride or Mummy returns first. There will be no queue when the park opens. Later even the express queues get long and would be at least 30 mins of waiting. There are a few rides like Treasure Hunt (Ancient Egypt) and Jurassic Canopy rides that don't have express entrance but are in demand. If you are with a kid, you may want to spend some time during peak afternoon time at Far Far Away land and see some of the shows. Remember to carry Umbrellas and Sunglasses. By 4 30 pm, the queues we saw were less in Express and hence could visit Transformers ride almost with no queue in express. Overall, an okay experience. Nothing great if you have visited the LA Universal Studio. SG Universal Studio is a smaller, compact entertainment park. We didn't see any angry crew. In fact, all the staff were very friendly and helped in answering queries on directions. Tips 1. Do not visit without the Express Pass 2. Carry Sunglasses, umbrellas 3. Jurassic ride you will get wet. 4. Canopy rides in Jurassic, Puss n Boots, enhancement airways can be a bit scary for kids , but is okay for adults. 5. Mummy returns is a must scary ride 6. All rides are about 1 min max 7. Lights Action Camera, New York ride, Shrek 4D are okay for small kids too. 8. Staff are friendly. Ps: photo shows the rush for Mummy returns in the express lane. About 30 mins waiting at around 1 pm.

name: user_6309
review: Universal Studios Singapore was magical.

name: user_6311
review: Very poor experience, somewhere I regretted going at all. Its official website looks amateur and contains very little information. You have to dig out simple info like stroller rental from the long list of FAQ. And there are many outdated FAQ that they don't even have the manpower to delete them. Map is not available in printer friendly version and outdated. And there is no basic info like where toilets are. The restaurant is extremely slow. It was only 1/3 full when we ordered food (some burgers and drinks) and it took them 30min to prepare such fast food! Waterworld is usually named as the best show. I appreciated the stunt performers a lot, but that's it. The show has been the same for over 20 years, at other Universal Studios. It was fun 20 years back then, but are these effects still amazing now? The show was stopped in the middle due to a lightning. I support the stop as this is safety. But that's what you have to expect, the shows or rides may stop anytime, since lightning is common here. Donkey Live was also a waste of time, talking to Siri is funnier. Talking about the rides, who would want to wait like 60min in the heat for a 5 min ride? Arrived 30min early and waited to enter at 11am, the first ride still took 40min wait. There are Express tickets, but most rides are just normal roller coaster rides available in any amusement park, only a ride or 2 is special. Does these worth the extra money? hm... There are many people holding Express tickets, so Express lane also has a queue. Thought you rented a stroller so your young kid could rest while waiting? Sorry, you have to leave the stroller outside and queue. Singapore is hot all year round. And this is a small Universal Studio, very man-made, few trees around, making it especially hot, since there is also no wind. The steaming heat, outdated feeling, few attractions but pricey tickets make this a place I won't visit again. I actually left early, cause I already lost the money buying tickets, I would also lose my time if I stayed any longer. I'd better cut my loss.

name: user_6313
review: Most games on the day of the visit are suspended for 2 hours. Although you can continue to play after 6 o'clock, there are still some facilities that cannot be used before leaving.

name: user_6314
review: Nothing exciting to me. Water stunt ok

name: user_6317
review: As wonderful as ever. More attractions added already. Filled up during weekend.

name: user_6318
review: Over busy Full day just to see half of the park The food from inside very expensive

name: user_6322
review: Really bad experience today....queues for everything.....

name: user_6323
review: Long waiting times, sometimes 1,5 hour but was very cool. I recommend the revenge of the mummy.

name: user_6324
review: A fast pass is definitely worth it. Does not matter if you are buying the ticket in advance or not, you still need to be in line for the fast pass. And the ticket counter machine is there for people paying with a credit card.

name: user_6326
review: Great place for the family.. its fun and there are interesting rides. its quite busy during the weekday as well.. make sure you purchase the express ticket

name: user_6327
review: Its especially fun to go on public holidays. You need to buy a priority pass in advance, otherwise there will be many people.

name: user_6330
review: Enjoyment and Fun at Peak except for long queue in the morning during opening hours! Good place to spend for whole day!!

name: user_6333
review: Visited on a weekday, arrived before 11 - but still couldnt do more than a few rides because of the insanely long wait times. Theyre only open 11-6, and with an upto 2 hour wait time for a 2-5 minute ride - you can do 4-5 rides at max. They really need to extend their times at the prices they charge. To deal with the insane wait times, they expect you to buy an Express pass which costs more than the ticket itself. -Prepare to wait upto 2 hours for each ride -If you get your ticket from Sentosa, youll have to wait in other line and redeem them before you get in -Food is rather expensive -The transformers ride was quite nice, and the Shrek show was good too. Overall, I wouldnt recommend USS to anyone visiting - its just too exhausting having to wait hours for a quick ride

name: user_6334
review: Can it really be that fun?

name: user_6338
review: It sucks. All the food and drinks are so expensive. You pay 130 for a standard ticket and you can only ride 1-2 rides after waiting 4 hrs or so. It is a total ripoff and it is humiliating to singapore. It is so overrated and you should never once come here. You can go to adventure cove or something but please don't waste so much money to come here. I wanted to give 0 stars but I don't have a choice

name: user_6340
review: Be sure to buy express tickets It opens at 11 o'clock, so if you ride clockwise at the first intersection to the left, it's worth the morning and afternoon express ticket.

name: user_6341
review: I have been one of the earliest visitors of the theme park when it first opened. I visited from Myanmar for it. Today i visited it park again for my Honeymoon, And i am sorry to say it was one of the worst experiences. 1. The waiting time and queues are mostly 2 hours for the main rides. How are guests supposed to cover the attractions? The closing time is so early at 6. The entire day is being spent standing in queues only whereas the Express pass guests get to go immediately. I tried buying an Express pass but it was sold out . But when i arrived I saw that Express queues are about 10 times shorter. For instance , for general guests we had to wait 120mins for BattleStar roller coaster - the Express is just about 10mins I strongly suggest you to increase the Express price to about 2 or 3 times the regular ticket and make the regular ticket a bit cheaper . In that way the regular ticket guests can have a better experience and those who want express service , can pay premium price for it. It seems guests who pay 82 for regular tickets are only visiting to suffer. And barely experience 2 or 3 main attractions in a day. And ideally the operating hours should be a little longer than current. It is impossible for guests to have a satisfactory day within 11am to 6pm. It feels like a giant waste of time and money to visit as a regular guest. 2. Customer service is so poor. The waiting times for the rides are highly inaccurate and unlike some other theme parks around the world - the waiting times are just shown outside before entering the attraction instead of also in some other points in the queue. The fans are shut in most areas where guests are queing outdoors. For instance i was 70mins queing in the outdoor area in the heat for Battlestar yet all the electric fans were shut. 3. Charging 5 for the drying pod outside the Jurassic world rapid adventures seems like a very lowly move. I understand there should be a nominal fee so that only guests who need it - use it but 5 for this is like a rip off . This is similar to how everything is overpriced in the theme park. A lot of guests visiting USS are foreigners but I am afraid to say USS brand image is not living up to expected standards. Piece of advice to visitors - dont visit if you do not get an Express pass . If they are sold out (because they are on quota) do not visit until u get it .

name: user_6342
review: Small park but has upto 7 themed rides. And new minion park is under construction. Overall the rides were good but the food inside the park is extremely pricey and just not worth it. So I recommend to eat outside the park in foodcourt instead. Mummy roller coaster ride and transformers ride is a must try!

name: user_6344
review: Universal torture. It's too small, too crowded and not enough rides so everything is busy. I know lining up for rides at theme parks is normal.. but not like this, not like these ones.. I only made it on 3 rides for the whole day.. Battlestar Galactica (human side), the Mummy.. both were fun but only for 1-2 minutes (2 hour wait?).. and Transformers which was less wait and longer so actually worth it.. Lines for food and drink at every vendor. So yes this is the worst theme park experience I have ever had. Waste of time, energy and money, a little bit like Singapore in general..

name: user_6345
review: It was really amazing experience in Universal Studio Singapore. So many thrillers rides available there. Specially Battlestar Roller Coasters, Transformers ride, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurassic Park, Far Far Away. One of my best ride was Transformers. Must visit, highly recommend.

name: user_6346
review: We spent almost 300 on entry for a family of 4 (kids age 7 & 4) and due to the incredibly long wait times for rides we only got to go on 3...each lasting between 3 and 5 minutes. We were there for 3.5 hours and all but about 20 minutes was spent standing in queues in the heat. We felt terrible for the kids and cant believe we spent so much money on what was nothing but a frustrating and uncomfortable experience. Im not a natural cynic but this just seems like a blatant money making scheme as if every ride has a minimum of 40 minutes wait (some up to 2 hours!!) surely there are too many people in the park for anyone to get any value out of their ticket price? We would have spent a further ?200 for the express pass, just to give our kids a more fun experience - but they were sold out (at 12.30pm, park opens at 11am). So disappointing.

name: user_6347
review: Was hot, fast pass was sold out and the standard wait time was over a hour for every ride we arrived at 1130 left at 6 and managed 4-5 rides. There was only a handful of rides in the whole park suitable for younger kids We'd recently done euro disney in school holidays and the wait times were way more reasonable .. I'd go a water park at least u wouldn't be sweating in line for hours

name: user_6349
review: Between 3 and 4 stars. Expensive, long waiting times at attractions. Mediocre rollercoasters. Starting to become a bit outdated.

name: user_6350
review: Likes: 1. Ambience 2. Thrilling rides and shows Severe dislikes: 1. Wait time at most rides on a weekend/public hoiliday is around 90 -100 mins. It feels like a punishment to stand in the queues everywhere for such long periods of time to enjoy the attractions if one doesn't have an Express pass. Suggestion: Proper seating arrangements should definitely be made in the waiting areas. 2. Due to this, even if one has reached early at 11 am at the opening time, it will be impossible to cover everything on a hoiliday by 6 pm when the Studios closes. 3. Entry passes are fixed to a single date. Anything can go wrong with anyone anytime and it is fully likely that due to those circumstances, one cannot make it on that particular day when the tickets are purchased. Suggestion: Passes should be open for 6 months or atleast a month. Tourists can then go to enjoy the attractions at their convenience in that time frame. 4. Express passes are not available online. Also, the price of those passes is more than the entry pass cost. Overall, after our visit to The Universal Studios, we remember our legs aching by standing in long queues MUCH MORE than the fun we got from the rides and the shows. It seems fun comes at a huge punishment - that too after paying through our pockets. Highly disappointed. Hence, the 2 star rating.

name: user_6351
review: The waiting time is also quite long, unlike netizens who said there is no need to queue after 3 o'clock.

name: user_6352
review: Although the cinema is small, the layout inside is unambiguous! Because its small, you dont have to wait in line for too long! You dont have to get up too early because the park doesnt open until 11 oclock! Its just that the items are a bit sparse and the repetitiveness is a bit high, so even if you want to make a big purchase! Anyone who wants to go for a walk in Singapore must not miss this trip!

name: user_6353
review: Definitely worth going once! I also highly suggest you purchasing tickets online because there is a massive line at the entrance and they also typically tend to sell out fast. We opted for the vip pass instead and had a lovely guide with us. Although it was expensive, I recommend this option as we were able to cover the entire park without standing in any lines. If you love adrenaline, make sure you sit on both the the red and black rides.

name: user_6355
review: bring an umbrella, it's hot, for white rice lovers, go to the chicken in the Shrek Palace area, there they provide rice for 5 SGD, and chicken for around 18 SGD, don't forget to check the show times, especially the Water World via the Us Singapore app, you can check real time. The number of queues

name: user_6357
review: dream come true visiting Far Far Away we landed in Singapore at 12, and were at universal by 1pm. Unfortunately I wasn't able to see more, but we were able to go on 3 rides and have some lunch if I went back, I'd stay longer to have more time to go on the rides

name: user_6360
review: Firstly the lines are soooooo long. There were so many people maybe because I came during weekend (Sunday). If anyone can afford the express ticket then just go for it. Next, I love the rides. All of the rides are very secure. Eg. I didnt feel like I was turning upside down when I rode the galactica. The single riders queue is definitely helpful a lot because it literally makes the queue faster, eg. we only queue for 15 mins instead of 50 mins. However not all of the rides have single riders line. But it was still fine. There are designated lockers for certain rides, and there are limits for time where it would be free. If we exceed the limit for the time then we have to pay for the locker.

name: user_6361
review: Awesome place.. Always crowded. But especially avoid Fri and weekend. Though express tickets are pricey it is better to purchase it depending on the queue, otherwise you will not be able to complete all rides. Carry water bottle. There are many free water station where you can fill Ur water bottle. Mainly do not forget Ur sunscreen!!! Food are expensive.

name: user_6362
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park located within the Resorts World Sentosa integrated resort at Sentosa in Singapore. It features number of rides, shows, and attractions in seven themed zones. Do visit this place,if you love adventure.

name: user_6364
review: Went on weekend and got the unlimited express pass from the counter. It was totally worth it as the longest time I waited in queue was max around 15 mins only. Tips: - if express pass not available online on your preferred date, you can purchase from guest services at USS - bring your own water bottle and hand fan to stay hydrated and cool (singapore is hot all the time) - free time-limited locker at mummy ride (no bag allowed) and cylon/human ride(no bag and loose items in pockets allowed). other rides, there will be a place to put your stuff or you can carry it with you.

name: user_6365
review: To many people and literally only got to go on 2 rides. The lines to buy food was ridiculously long. Waited over half an hour to buy drinks.

name: user_6366
review: There were many closed rides, restaurants were closed, the staff was unfriendly, and it was the worst of my 5 visits.

name: user_6369
review: Many facilities have been waiting for too long It is compulsory to place lockers but the free time is too little. I want to charge more.

name: user_6371
review: Great great great! Get fast track to not wait in the queue. Its always busy. But kids loved it!

name: user_6374
review: I can only recommend the two roller coasters to everyone

name: user_6375
review: Awesome attractions

name: user_6376
review: There are so many people, and there are rich people and poor people when playing with the equipment. Those who pay more will line up faster.

name: user_6379
review: Good facilities for family Huge place and area But some places not active!

name: user_6382
review: The worst universal park ever... I have visited universal parks both in Orlando and Los Angeles, and I can easily say that this park has nothing to do with Universal. They have no idea how to manage the lines, the maintenance, etc. - The park is open only between 11am-6pm, even on a weekday, you can only visit max 3 rides because of the longest queues - The wait times are minimum 2 times more than whats written on the ride entries. - The lockers give you the option to use for free for only 80min, but the waiting time for a ride is around 150 min!! In reality it is more than 180 min! - They dont have max number of the tickets they sell on a daily basis, but they have limits for express. So, you will end up seeing zero queue for the express ride while 180 min for the normal line. This is unbelievable... They cant even do the maths to solve this imbalance issue. - The vip experience for 2 adults and 1 kid is more than 1200 dollars which is amazingly expensive - The money you pay is only for the park entry, because there is no way of you waiting in a line for 3 hours. Express ride option is more expensive than the ticket itself which clearly shows that the ticket price is for just walking around the park. - Even the restaurants or ice cream shops have very long queues, and you will also see there express lines are empty and the staff is not helping others even when empty - If you decide to buy express in the morning of the day you visit, you will see it is sold out and there is no way of buying it. You are basically trapped because you paid the tickets which are nonrefundable but then you will need to wait hours and hours for literally everything in the park. You can visit any other theme park globally, and this one will stay the worst experience ever. Dont even waste your time and money with this park. My daughter was so excited and waited for days, and in the second queue we were in - she decided to leave and see other places. She even says now she doesnt want to go to any universal park again. Its really disappointing to see that this park only uses the name of Universal. It has nothing to do with it.

name: user_6384
review: Too crowded, rides are amazing. If you want to experience all rides, then purchase express pass. otherwise, you can cover more than half of the rides without pass. Children love it.

name: user_2661
review: Weekdays are likely preferable due to long waiting times. Get the express pass, if available!

name: user_6387
review: Heavy long line in minimum 2 Hours waiting to one events...so people's are Very tired.... So you correcting the line timing 10 to 15 minutes waiting the events watching.. pls immediately... Please help me in people .

name: user_6388
review: Although it was a weekday in August, there was a long line before the performance. If you don't have an express pass, which costs about 10,000 yen per person, you will have to wait forever to even enter. If you have a pass, you can easily enter from the left hand side, but the directions were confusing and we ended up waiting in line for a while. Even if you buy an express pass, you will have to wait in line for 20 to 40 minutes for all rides. If you don't buy it, you'll end up waiting for hours under the scorching sun, listening to different languages and stuffed with sushi. Express passes sold out within 30 minutes of the performance. There were a lot of people with bad manners trying to pass me in the line, but I'm glad the staff warned me properly. Transformers and Mummy are must-sees. Singapore is as hot as Japan at this time of year, so be sure to bring plenty of ice water from your hotel.

name: user_6389
review: Make sure to book tickets in advance.

name: user_6394
review: it has so much rides but you can take only 4-5 rides because of the crowd and long row. so if you want all the rides the use express that cost you same the ticket price (total pricedouble).

name: user_6396
review: Great and wonderful experience, one day is not enough to see all things. Must see the Hollywood show

name: user_6397
review: Toilet is dirty, half the place is closed.. dont bother

name: user_6398
review: Been there twice. There will be a third time too.

name: user_6400
review: Nothing much changed, rides and attractions barely changed. Still fun nonetheless, very accommodating to seniors and pwds. Easy transportation to and from Food options need more diversity though

name: user_6401
review: Waiting all my youth to play :) If possible, you should buy express tickets to reduce waiting time by half. You are not allowed to bring in outside food, food in universal is a bit more expensive than average

name: user_6402
review: super! We were on a super busy day, even on a Saturday. Apart from the first queue of more than 100 minutes (where the discouragement had now reached us) all the others were quite smooth. Too bad it's closing so soon! But it is precisely at the last minute that one must take advantage of it because many people already leave after 4pm. If you want to avoid queuing too much, definitely get tickets in advance, but also go there just before it opens.

name: user_6403
review: Magical space! Huge theme park with so many things to do but you need all day to go around it all! Of course you should definitely visit it, but it has two "bads". Firstly the ticket should be a little lower in cost and secondly and most importantly everywhere you will encounter a wait which in some cases translates to 2 hours!

name: user_6404
review: Thoroughly enjoyed.Need a minimum 5-6 hours . Water World waz superb.. better to have an express ticket to save time.

name: user_6406
review: There are so many tourists that you have to endure queuing for more than 30 minutes for various rides.

name: user_6408
review: I don't imagine that my review will have much effect but hey. We were there on Sunday and you should perhaps calculate what you will see. The waiting time per ride is around 45-60 minutes for the more exciting roller coasters. People with priority tickets ruin the waiting time even more. This means that you might get 4-5 trips for your money and for the most part you just wait. The food in the restaurants is bad and expensive. The connection to public transport is pretty mediocre. Even for this you have to wait in line for an endless amount of time.

name: user_6412
review: Don't come during peak season. Queued up to 4 hours for Galatica. (And even those who bought express tickets also queued for around 1 hour to almost 2 hours) But if you've already bought it, it's better to play to the very end first, just give it a go.. Yesterday, luckily I was able to play something else... so I didn't lose much.

name: user_6414
review: Disappointing Theme Park Experience Having visited Universal Studios Hollywood, Disneyland California, and SeaWorld Orlando, I was eagerly anticipating a comparable level of enjoyment at this theme park. Regrettably, my experience fell short of expectations. Unlike the engaging atmosphere I encountered at Universal Studios Singapore, this theme park left much to be desired. A notable absence of cheerful staff and a seeming lack of concern for visitor satisfaction were evident throughout my visit. Given the park's size, the quality of staff interactions, and the overall program, I find the admission price to be disproportionately steep. Consequently, I cannot wholeheartedly recommend this theme park to others.

name: user_6415
review: Cheating. You bought the tickets and spent from 1:30h to 2h waiting for each game, while those with Express tickets can enter without waiting

name: user_6417
review: We visited on Monday 24 July with family of 4 and we were touring Singapore for just 3 days It was way too crowded for Monday Each ride wait time was 1 hour There was a power breakdown for 2-3 hours and few rides got reduced due to that and wait time for others got increased to 90-120 minutes Its a great place to visit , but tickets are oversold and for that price , it didnt feel worth it, skip the line tickets were sold out and we had no choice but do just few rides I wouldnt go there again in Singapore If you are going and have enough time and said Get there when it opens and based on crowd buy tickets in kiosk

name: user_6420
review: Universal Studio Singapore is very interesting to visit. Apart from the exciting games, there are many places that are suitable for taking photos. It's just that the queue for some games is quite long. Like Transformers where you have to queue for 2-3 hours. Apart from that, the Jurassic Park ride also requires queuing for 1-2 hours. If you go to the Jurassic Park, prepare a rain coat if you don't want to get soaked. Then prepare your adrenaline to try the very exciting mummy rides.

name: user_6423
review: Too long wait for attractions

name: user_6425
review: Long queues everywhere and poor air-conditioning. Would recommend you to save the 80 bucks

name: user_6428
review: There are a lot of people. Anyone who can buy an express card would recommend it. If you play all of it, it's worth it. Waiting in line is something you have to deal with for the rides that are the highlights. Food is considered expensive. But the burger shop is very delicious and the price is almost 500 baht per piece. There were fries burger and water.

name: user_6429
review: The place is beautiful and family-friendly. I advise everyone to buy Fast Pass tickets, because once we were separated without them, I expect you will wait more than an hour for each game. Most games are forbidden for pregnant women to play in. If a pregnant woman does not buy a Fast Pass, she will not benefit. As for children of a certain height, some games as well. I heard there were sites that sell tickets at a lower price, but I did not try them. I bought them at the gate and there was no waiting because it was self-service.

name: user_6431
review: Lots to do you won't be bored for sure. A must visit if you're in Singapore.

name: user_6432
review: Went during the weekday in off season. The hot weather didnt help but it was little disappointing due to the rides being 1-2hours long and express sold out within first 90min of opening?? Hopefully they will re access there structure/more rides/ride times etc and make it more accessible and enjoyable

name: user_6433
review: Had a great time here even if I almost got a heart attack from a ride.

name: user_6434
review: Queued whole day just played one game. Why USS does not have number limit

name: user_6435
review: Be sure to purchase an express ticket. I regret it

name: user_6437
review: Unfortunately, we did not enter the games area because the tickets were sold out. It is better to buy them online

name: user_6439
review: The rides are fun but expensive and the wait is very long.

name: user_6442
review: Poor. We were there for more than 6 hours and could fit only 5 rides in, the rest of the time was spent lining up (which was a nightmare) or eating. We would have taken the express option but they were sold out before midday on a Friday. Frankly never again. It's hot and there are so many people taking selfies, walking backwards and leaving on closing time is a nightmare logistically. We found a pub nearby but it was hosting a private function. Poor! Express is a waste of time when the waiting time is 180 mins and the "express" ticket takes 60 mins. Sixty minutes!!!!! My god!

name: user_6443
review: Good place, but too crowded. Almost every ride needs 120 minutes to wait. We went on Tuesday, not on holiday season but the queue was too long. Makes sure you buy express ticket.

name: user_6444
review: Be prepared to spend your time on the line for those rides. If you want a fast lane, you should try their VIP or Express ticket so that you won't spend most of the time on the line. You just have to pay some extra bucks for that privilege.

name: user_6445
review: , extremely crowded, pure rip off. Literally had to fight for food, Mummy show was closed shutdown for the day. Some queues were 2 hours Sesame Street was longest and worst experience, . The team was not polite Especailly Shafique. He was rude, getting down from the cart, I hit my head, he dint show any empathy or an apology, just rushed me out with my 6 YO If you have a Kid Don't visit, not kid Friendly place ..

name: user_6446
review: I have been to America before. This place is much smaller than there. But the crowd is the same here. If you do not have the right of express pass, your job is very difficult.

name: user_6449
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a great place to be if you are a lover of amusement park and high speed thrilling rides, the rides are designed on popular Universal Studios themes and the way it is planned is superb you will definitely have a great time out there

name: user_6454
review: Visit Transformers Mummy Jurassic in that order. It is convenient to rotate counterclockwise. There are 9 people on the Jurassic, but 1 or 2 unlucky people get hit by water. Please note that even your shoes will get soaked. There are so many Chinese people that I can't tell if it's Singapore or China...

name: user_6456
review: Its not good.... I need wait 1 hour Absolutely disgusting...

name: user_6457
review: I waited 40 minutes for the human roller coaster for 90 for Express. If it wasn't there, it would be dizzy.. As long as you prepare well for the heat, you can enjoy it!

name: user_6458
review: A day of fun @Universal studios singapore. The highlights were the transformer, the mummy and the 2 battlestar Galactica roller coasters. For lunch I recommend you try the neopolitan pizza @Loui's NY Pizza Parlor

name: user_378
review: Very nice and need to come here if you never be here. But it is too many people and waiting time is way too long.

name: user_6461
review: Lots of people, but really fun

name: user_6463
review: It's hot. It's hot. It's Thursday and there are a lot of people. When I passed by on the monorail the day before, it looked like there were no people, but there were many. It seems like all Singapore j people have gathered here. If you're going to ride Transformers, it's best to go there first. Waiting time never decreases. Then it was now Human and Cyclone? I ride Imton Rollcos and enjoy the rest as a single rider. What is that, free pass? Anyway, there's a wait to buy it, but if he doesn't, how long will it be? Since Universal is the only event of the day, he spends a lot of money. Be careful that the rice is not tasty. Since I can re-enter, I have to go out and eat.

name: user_6468
review: If you want to experience all rides, you gotta buy their express ticket a regular ticket's waiting time can last up to 2h per ride

name: user_6470
review: Amazing rides. On those transformers ride is really exceptional.

name: user_6471
review: USS is located in Sentosa Island, SG. You can find lots of shops and dine area, you can also find lots of machines to purchase the pass with no long waiting line!

name: user_6472
review: It's small, but there are a lot of people, and although it's hot, there's quite a bit of shade while waiting. 4D style looks good in houses with children

name: user_6473
review: if u want to do all the rides in a day, take a premium ticket

name: user_6474
review: Opens late, closes early, so you will be in a rush to do the rides because they are only open for 7 hours. Other U.S. have longer opening hours. Cue was very long too, so you will spend most of your short time inside in the cue, rather than enjoying the rides. Park is small too compared to others U.S. Visited Monday, not even holiday.

name: user_6476
review: Too overrated with those kind of entertainment, kids under 4 years can ride just a very few entertainments, the staffs had a bad behavior, and with that price that was not a worth experience. Definitely won't come back and won't recommend to anyone.

name: user_6480
review: Worst place in Singapore. Need to wait 2 hrs for each attraction. No sitting places, mismanagement, no good facilities and exorbitant prices of everything. More than 5 hrs into the park and managed only 2 rides. Total waste of money and time.

name: user_6482
review: Incredible experience that I will remember forever. It was extremely fun and interesting. I loved meeting the characters around the park and loved the rides. I bought the express pass, and I think that it is an absolute necessity. The rides got up to 2 hours without an express pass, and I was able to skip half the waiting time consistently and even the entire line a couple of times. The lost world was my personal favorite feeling, truly like a dinosaur adventure, with fun rides to go with it.

name: user_6483
review: There were many visitors at the amusement park. We didn't get to enjoy all the attractions because of the long queue. If you're planning to go there, I suggest you buy a ticket in advance and purchase the express ticket. all in all it's been a wonderful experience

name: user_6484
review: A large theme park on Sentosa Island. One of the theme parks at Universal Studios. Entrance ticket cost approximately 2,000.- baht/person. There are various types of play equipment. There will be a lot of people when the amusement park opens in the morning. But if you want to collect all kinds of toys You may have to purchase an Express ticket in addition to your theme park admission ticket, or there will be fewer people in line near closing time. You can line up and play one thing at a time. However, if you go on a rainy day for safety Many rides may be out of service. Inside, there's everything: a themed restaurant, a photography corner, and a souvenir shop. And some additional parts will be opened in the future as well.

name: user_6486
review: I think opening at 11 o'clock on weekends is too late. I think it would be nice if it opens at 10 o'clock. Due to the Minions Park construction, there are only a few attractions worth riding.

name: user_6488
review: -better buy online ticket before you go. Because when we came, ticket at counter ticket on the spot has sold out -use universal studio application at your mobile to know how long the queque for each ride and what time the meet and greet and parade -don't missed transformers ride. It was awesome. -for moslem not hard to find halal food. and there is praying room behind the giant roller coaster -bring empty bottle. you can find drinkable tap water in many places negative point : -toilet a little bit dirty and bad smell, no bidet as well -The souvenir price a little expensive

name: user_6494
review: fun to play but the staff there were very rude not even simple respect to tourists which a theme park should have

name: user_6495
review: Open at 11am and closed at 5pm, it s automatically u cant got all the rides. About 40 - 100 minutes for queue

name: user_6497
review: Dissapointing. Large parts of park closed or in development leaving very long ques for other attractions.

name: user_6501
review: Nice service and facilities.

name: user_6504
review: Was small compared to the Orlando Universal, but enough to keep your family occupied for the day. Would suggest to get the Express pass in advance

name: user_6505
review: Amazing park!! A whole day that the children are busy. Don't lose the Transformers

name: user_6507
review: I've heard the park is not as great as before covid. When we visited, some areas were closed. There are some nice rides (the mummie, jurassic water ride, e.g), but for me all the other rides were not that special. Overall not really worth the money in my opinion. I did really like the way they decorated the park though!

name: user_6508
review: I've been here many times, but it was my first time on the weekend. The attractions are about as crowded as Japan. Also, it was quite difficult to find a place to eat for lunch. Also, although it was hot, there were no chairs, so everyone was sitting on the floor near the souvenir shop and taking a break. (Because it's cool because of the air conditioner) Revenge of the Mummy and Shrek-type attractions that are not available in Japan are recommended. When it's crowded, I think it's a good idea to ride as a single rider as a family. You can check the waiting time on the app, so I think it's more efficient to check it while playing. However, it's about half the size of Japan, so it's easy to move around.

name: user_6513
review: A fun place to spend the day with family. Lots of rides available with different thrill levels...

name: user_6521
review: Not recommended if you don't buy the express pass. Insane waits and not that many rides. They don't have a studio tour or Harry Potter world here.

name: user_6523
review: If you want to find faults, it should be people, more

name: user_6524
review: Small park. 1 hour in line per game minimum. Except the mummy one, which is faster. The ideal is to buy the fast pass. But I don't know if it's worth it for the small number of games they have. If you went to Disney you will notice a big difference. Entrance costs approx. 75 dollars. The food inside the park is very expensive! Hours from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. They close super early.

name: user_6525
review: Quite disappointed because the crew's attitude wasn't good in a themepark that brings happiness to visitors. Especially when I enter "The Lost World", Rapid Adventure facility wasn't operating due to technical issue. The Jurassic dinosaur show blocked outside WC and make visitors unable to find where is the restroom, visitors wants to go WC must pass by the dinosaur , the crew shouted at visitors and say "Hey! Don't cross here!" but there are no sign to mention visitors are not allowed to passby

name: user_6526
review: Even though its a weekday, there are a lot of people. When staying at Sentosa Village, you only need to take the monorail 1 stop. The monorail is of course free. There is also a Lego store at the entrance.

name: user_6529
review: fun ammusement park that has long queues but worth it for the wait as the rides are fun

name: user_6532
review: Honestly, it has the best rides, themed restaurants, and architectural designs The lines for the rides can take a while, but it is honestly worth it. Their staff are also very helpful, a group tried to cut in line and a staff member actually sent them to the back. There is nothing that makes me appreciate a place more than the integrity of their staff.

name: user_6534
review: Its a fun, safe and reliable place where children can have fun!

name: user_6536
review: Very bad park. Park is only open for 7 hours, waiting times of three hours are no exception. Too many people are allowed in the park, the price is too high. Too few attractions.

name: user_6537
review: Without a doubt, of all the parks I have visited, this has been the worst in its classification as an experience. Negatives: -Up to more than 2 hours to get on an attraction. -Few bathrooms. You can pee waiting to get on an attraction. -The shows are poor and a bit boring. -Junk food and very expensive. Nor do they offer hardly any healthy food. -The park is not too big. -The park gets boring every time you have to wait. -Tremendous sounds from the expanding minions construction. -The operation of the lockers in some attraction creates a queue instead of making it simple and speeding up the process. -It closes too early and even if you go very early you will have a lot of waiting to get on the attractions. Even the simplest. -Too many people. The amount of people inside the park is overwhelming. -Bad organization by the park management. -Little variety of attractions and a bit old. -The que on after close park to take train its so long. Positive aspects: -The park is decently well-kept and there is no trash on the ground. -It is very easy to navigate. -If you like photography, it offers beautiful views with all the props and decorations. -The design of the park is beautiful. -The pets for kids. -Variety stores. In summary: I do not recommend visiting this park for the price of admission at the moment. It' boring cuz you have to wait a lot and everything is very slow. The shows are not good enough. Recommendations: -They should give a wake-up call to the entire management responsible for the park. It has many things to improve. -Its a bit scam to pay and not be able to enjoy. You can feel a bit frustrated or angry. -The number of people per day must be less so that the waiting lists at the attractions are not so long, although that means having to reserve the ticket time before. -The express pass is too expensive, 88 normal prize express (more than 100) so its around 200 each. Better separate the normal prize and the express. -Lower the price of food and improve the quality of food. -This park should add Singapour part that represent the culture and history of the country with nice rides and shows about country. I don't recommend waste your money in this park if you have in your priority list. July 2023.

name: user_6540
review: Ticket counter opens at 11:00am all tickets get sold out at 11:30am

name: user_5511
review: Very bad experience. Waiting time about 2 and a half hours per atraction.

name: user_6547
review: My third time here! The rides were almost the same with some new additions, which were thrilling and fun, especially the transformers and battle star galactica However a section of the theme park was blocked off for new rides to be constructed, opening in 2024. Would recommend getting the express pass as there are sizable queues for each ride, an average of 30mins to an hour of waiting during peak seasons.

name: user_6548
review: My day at Universal Studios Singapore was nothing short of amazing! From the moment I stepped into the park, I was captivated by the magical atmosphere and the attention to detail in every corner. The thrilling rides and attractions catered to all ages, making it a perfect destination for families and thrill-seekers alike. The highlight of my day was undoubtedly the thrilling roller coasters and 3D simulator rides that left me exhilarated and wanting more. The Transformers ride was an absolute blast, and I couldn't get enough of the adrenaline rush on Battlestar Galactica. The staff at Universal Studios were incredibly friendly and helpful, adding to the overall pleasant experience. I also appreciated the various dining options available throughout the park, offering a wide range of cuisines to satisfy any craving. The themed zones, like Ancient Egypt and Hollywood, were brilliantly designed, transporting me to different worlds with their immersive set designs and live performances. The WaterWorld show was an absolute spectacle, leaving me in awe of the stunts and special effects. To top it all off, the evening parade and fireworks show were the perfect way to end the day. The colorful floats, energetic performances, and breathtaking fireworks lit up the night sky, leaving me with a sense of wonder and joy.
