In conclusion, my day at Universal Studios Singapore was an unforgettable experience. It's a place where dreams come to life, and I can't wait to visit again to create even more incredible memories. If you're looking for an amazing day filled with fun, adventure, and magic, Universal Studios Singapore is the place to be!

name: user_6550
review: Out of the world rides. Difficult to complete all rides in one day in regular fare. Express way with additional cost of preferable to complete all rides.

name: user_6552
review: there was a power shortage 50 minutes into our queue, we had to leave

name: user_6556
review: One of the worst experience I had so far. It was poorly managed and taken care of since almost every rides I queued up were somehow had technical problem. I lined up for the Revenge of Mummy for almost two hours, and when it was my turn, it was closed due to some issues and we had no choice other than give up and wasted my two hours. However, some rides were fun but it still did not compensate for the negative feelings I had. So, if you plan to visit here, don't expect too much from it. And I would say you don't have to waste a whole day like me since you can enjoy most of the attractions with less than 30 minutes wait time when the park is about to close (I got to get on three rides in a role around 5PM) Friendly reminder: You are required to keep your bags in a provided locker for most of the rides.

name: user_6559
review: Awful experience.... We went there on a week day and the rides were super crowded... 90 minutes waiting time for each ... after waiting for 1 hr they said that the ride was not working ... we went for other rides only to find that none were working...WaterWorld show, Battlestar Galactica (Rollercoaster) and Madagascar were all closed ...The refund queue was a mile long..Food is ridiculously expensive inside...French fires for 8 is just day light robbery...The whole park had a rundown feel... I feel so sorry for the overseas tourists who paid huge money to come here....such a fraudulent practice to charge full money when half the park is closed...They seriously need to renovate this place before opening to guests... this is really not worth your hard earned money folks, atleast in 2023 .. plz avoid this place

name: user_6560
review: 24/7 that day. I bought a ticket and came in, but something broke down not long after queuing. Then it was repaired until 5 pm, a full 3 hours. It was a complete waste of tickets. The staff didn't know what to ask and had a perfunctory attitude. I had such a psychological shadow when I came here for the first time. The price and service are really not equivalent. The result is a complete waste of time and a disappointment. The refund service is also very negative. Just treat tourists like leeks and take advantage of them!

name: user_6561
review: It's really exciting to come here, even though it's full on weekdays, the vibe is very pleasant, you can take photos in front of the iconic globe before entering.

name: user_4429
review: Poor management of the Locker System. 1.Spaces between locker cabinets are too small for visitors especially for those opened locker doors, visitors & backpacks need spaces. 2.Notices for visitors are not clear. I was requested repeatedly by the gate staff to lock up my small waist bags after backpacks are locked up. Does the Universal Ltd. be money minded? Hats are allowed but not waist bags?

name: user_6563
review: There's always so many people in this place almost everyday so be patient for a long que to enter in some attractions.

name: user_6568
review: I was so excited to visit Universal Studios Singapore for the first time. I had been planning this trip for months, and I was finally here. I arrived at the park early in the morning on 24 July 2023, and I was eager to start exploring. However, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment when I learned that there had been a power disruption earlier in the day. As a result, many of the rides and attractions were closed. I was also disappointed that there was no communication from the park about the power disruption. I had to find out about it from other guests. I was also disappointed by the fact that the park did not seem to have a contingency plan in place for a power distribution. It seems like they were not prepared for this kind of event, and it showed.

name: user_6569
review: A small city compared to other countries Important note (two areas) are closed far far away The lost world We were not informed of this information until after purchasing the tickets Unfortunately, the amount paid is very high compared to the number of games available

name: user_6571
review: Awesome! I had so much fun. Buy tickets online in advance and you won't wait to enter. Some tips to make the best of your day: research what rides are and which ones you want to do, GO EARLY and during the week. Go early to the busiest rides (roller coasters, transformers). Download the app of the park to see the waiting times. I had a great time did all the rides, didn't wait any longer than 20min. Some rides they do offer single rider, great way to go fast. Variety of food options, good prices too.

name: user_6573
review: It is a small amusement park, so remember to bring a water bottle. There are many drinking fountains in the park that can be filled with water, and many movie characters can be taken with you. It is very fun.

name: user_6575
review: A very beautiful city for Universal Studios. It is enjoyed by both young and old. It is preferable to visit it on weekdays because of the crowding during the weekend and standing for hours to enter the rides. For those who want to go to the games at the end of the week, it is preferable to book a ticket with Express for quick passage, and of course it is more expensive.

name: user_6577
review: Mostly you have to wait about 2 hours to enjoy the atraction which doesnt last long.

name: user_6579
review: note - weekends queue is high If you are in singapore, Sentosa is a must. if you visit sentosa, universal studio is a must Would suggest to go earlier around 11. Better to have lunch on the way since inside USS, food is pricey. We went around 11.45 and covered these. 1. Transformers - just wow (1 hour queue time) 2. Outside Roller Coaster - Scary but must try (30 min queue time) 3. Roller coaster inside Pyramid - Outside roller coaster experience darkness (20 min queue time) 4. Jurasic Park water boat journey- don't miss that 5. 5D (as I remeber) movie in the far far away land - nice way to finish your USS journey For the pyramid and outside roller coasters you have to keep all the loose items in one of the lockers outside. better to keep the phones also for those two

name: user_6580
review: You will probably predict on what I am going to say with that one star. It was awful. We came to Universal Studios at 11:00 since thats their opening time. And now it has been very very very crowded. Multiple lines with over hundreds of people. We went to the first ride which was the spaghetti chase and we waited for 1 hour for it and it had technical difficulties and the ride could not go on. The second one was the Accelerator which was also a very very long line so we decided to leave the line. The third one was the only ride I took. It was the Battlestar Galactica with an 2 hour wait time. My legs were very sore and tired after 2 hours but we at least tried one ride. Will not come back again. If you want to not line up dont come. If you have the VIP pass maybe you have a chance in riding every single ride.

name: user_6581
review: The park is small and somewhat old, so some rides have technical problems. Anyway, it's fun and worth the money to experience. But you need to plan carefully because there are many customers

name: user_6586
review: Good experience, just that a part of the location is under construction right now, and that day I went there was no show at the Jurassic Park

name: user_6588
review: This is the only place that is a Universal Studios. The content is too sparse, it's old, and it lacks amenities for the crowds. We didn't realize until after we entered that there were no Water World shows, and most of the attractions closed around 2pm. Definitely avoid eating inside! Minus 5 Stars!!!

name: user_6589
review: Visited twice before today. However today's experience was the worst visit of all. Theme park was unusually overcrowded on a weekday. Believed that they sold beyond their maximum capacity that makes most of the waiting time for most rides beyond 1 hour. To make things worst, many of the rides broke down in the afternoon and the hot and glaring sun did not help the situation either. Food was way beyond overpriced but regardless, every food kiosks were snaking long queues to suck tourists' money. 4 for a can drink is basically daylight robbery.

name: user_6591
review: This was my worst experience at a universal theme park. Most rides ( all expect kids rides ) were broken between 1-5pm. The park opened for 2 more hours so people can play the rides but this made us unable to visit the Van Gogh museum that we had to pay for before we can enter the park. Then again some rides got broken again at 7:30 and people got stuck in the speedy ride for 10 min and some got panic attacks while stuck in it before they helped them and told us nobody can ride in it. Other stuff is the same as usual universal parks but the problems mentioned before made it the worst one ever.

name: user_6595
review: Technical issues are a good excuse. It seems that Singaporeans have also learned bad things. I am so afraid of being caught and caned

name: user_6598
review: I came for 1 day and all the rides were closed with all tickets sold out. worst experience do not recommend.

name: user_6600
review: The worst Universal Studios I have ever been to.. very crowded no control, waiting time for each right 110 minutes then suddenly the rides are not working technical issues..

name: user_6601
review: Worst experience. Waiting time is 1 to 2 hrs

name: user_6604
review: Paid more than 100 and in 3h30 at the park I managed to do one attraction with my partner. Waited 1h15 in the Jurassic Park to then get the announcement that the attraction was facing unexpected technical issues.. not enough food services for a overcrowded park (the food court was closed, insane!)

name: user_6607
review: A relatively small park. Lots and lots of people, a 45-minute line just to get in (for those who ordered a ticket in advance). Very long queues for all facilities. It is highly recommended to book a ticket in advance online and if possible then also express because this is the most popular attraction in Sentosa.

name: user_6608
review: Visiting Universal Studios was a dream come true for me. We had a fantastic time as we experienced almost all the rides, and each one was thoroughly enjoyable. The size of the park is impressive, and it truly requires a full day to explore everything it has to offer. The variety of rides cater to all age groups, and there are plenty of excellent dining options available as well. Among all the rides, the Transformer ride stood out as a personal favorite. Its excitement and thrill left a lasting impression on me. I'm already looking forward to the opportunity to visit Universal Studios again in the future.

name: user_6609
review: As you would expect visiting Unicersal, the experience was off the dial. Rides were great and all the side show stuff was good too. I would recommend the fast passes for sure, the queues first thing at 11am were only 10 mins or so, but at lunch the ride wait times increased massively so the fast passes allowed us to go on everything multiple times. It was cashless on the park so I paid on Apple Pay which was good. Overall a brilliant day and would definitely return.

name: user_6610
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an absolute blast! The theme park offers an incredible array of thrilling rides, captivating shows, and immersive attractions based on beloved movies. From adrenaline-pumping roller coasters to family-friendly adventures, there's something for everyone to enjoy. The attention to detail in each themed area is impressive, transporting you to different worlds. Be prepared for crowds, especially during peak seasons, but the overall experience is well worth it. Whether you're a movie buff or seeking a fun-filled day with family and friends, Universal Studios Singapore won't disappoint!

name: user_6611
review: The rides were good. But too many people

name: user_6613
review: The staffs are very helpfull. Not too long for queing. Very good service

name: user_6614
review: A little bit too crowded since I visit on Public Holiday. Some of my friends did not get the tickets since they did not book in advance, so if you go on school holidays esp the weekend, you MUST buy the tickets in advance. The queue on popular rides are long, but the single rider queue is still reasonable. Pricey food and snacks but still worth it for once in a while experience. Overall clean park. Facilities are also well maintaned.

name: user_6617
review: Universal Studio Singapore offers an incredible experience with breathtaking attractions! Although I wasn't able to go in due to the crowds, just the atmosphere outside was fantastic. The stunning settings, captivating shows and thrilling rides create a magical atmosphere. I can't wait to return at a less busy time to fully enjoy this wonderful adventure. The park is a must-see for all thrill-seekers and fun-seekers. Congratulations to Universal Studio Singapore for their well-deserved success!

name: user_6618
review: Rides are great and free. Must go for roller coasters and Egyptian tour. Be ready for a lot of walking. Not a pram friendly place.

name: user_6620
review: I couldnt ride the outdoor equipment because of the rain. Madagascar and Water World are also under construction. There's nothing to do, there's just a lot of people. Shops in front of Din Tai Fung are under construction. There are many places closed.

name: user_6621
review: Probably the most expensive and at the same time the most boring, crowded and hottest theme park in the world! I totally regret coming here!!!

name: user_6623
review: This is the smallest universal in the world One thing to remind everyone is that kid under 4 years old dont need a ticket or a fast pass to play here. Baby can come with parents for free.

name: user_6624
review: This was my first experience to a Universal Park. I was pre warned that its the least exciting of all the parks. We had express passes which really helped! And made the ride wait times super minimal. Now for the Park. Its fun, nostalgic. But extremely tired and quite neglected. Faded facades and cracks, broken rides and many closed for renovation signs. The Mummy, battlestar (besides the extremely rude ticket scanner guy at the cyclon) were awesome, transformers too. And then... one of my most anticipated Jurassic world this was so deflating. A dinosaur mall display would be more exciting. The dinosaurs hardly move, are falling apart and some werent even functioning. In conclusion, kids would like it but film fans looking for that Universal movie magic day would find it a very tired and somewhat sad experience. Its as if no one takes care of the park. And with the high prices and amount of ppl, I find it hard to believe that they are not making enough to keep the park fresh and updated. I did enjoy myself but definitely looking forward to Osaka and the US parks in the future.

name: user_6625
review: Few games and tickets are too expensive. Compared to Univer Studio Japan, it's a waste of money and time.

name: user_6628
review: I loooved this place so much, core memory forever. The rides are incredibly crowded in the morning, with over one hour wait times for most of the rides, but after lunch time the wait time significantly decreases and the overall experience becomes more enjoyable. some rides I enjoyed were: -Mummy ride -Shrek 4d adventure -Transformers ride (my favourite fs) -Elmo spaghetti space adventure (for children) If you're thinking of going, have the time of your life, make memories, and have fun !!

name: user_6633
review: Best place to spend your whole day, all day, everyday!!!

name: user_6635
review: Okish place. Limited set of rides but unlimited people! Most places had a 60-120 minute wait time. Some rides dont allow carrying backpacks and loose items with you and theres a locker storage available next to those rides entrances. And they charge 4 for that ! Pro Tip : use the singles lane wherever possible. As the name indicates, youll be pushed into the empty seats on the rides but not with your group. Youll be able to avoid the crazy waiting period.

name: user_6637
review: Biggest playground in Singapore.. Fun playground for all ages.. But for those who can't stand the queue...

name: user_6638
review: 2 hrs waiting queue for Transformer and similar for other shows..... Advise to visit on weekdays

name: user_6640
review: We had a very good trip to it , If you dont want to be late take the tickets online better

name: user_6642
review: Super long wait for rides. Lovely hangout on weekdays but absolutely give USS a miss on weekends especially since USS removed the annual pass option. Even with express, its a long wait and unlimited express was sold out at 11am.

name: user_6643
review: Had great time moment though its weekend still many people come to visit. Buy an express pass, very helpful to skip the long queues n get two extras rides..

name: user_6645
review: The city is beautiful The number of all games is 15. Play it according to the map The problem is that it receives more than its capacity I entered 11 o'clock. And I went out 6. I played. 3. Games and the rest are queues. Two hours Water is 4. There are refrigerators at every game forbidden. Neither I nor my children played except 4. Games due to crowding

name: user_6647
review: Visited on Tuesday 4th of July. First of all, buying tickets beforehand does not give you any advantage. Your online tickets will have RFQ code but at the gate they cannot read it, they will ask you to issue tickets from the ticketing office with BAR code. That would take up to 60min on a weekday if you are lucky. 1-Try to be there before 11am to avoid any delays. 2-Download the Universal Studios Singapore app to track which attraction has how many minutes of waiting time. 3-The attractions are all close to each other, so, dont worry about losing any chance to ride any of your favorite attractions. 4-I highly recommend that you tour the attractions a day before on YouTube to check what you like and what you dont. 5-Start with the ride you like which has 40min or less waiting time. You will be able to get there faster than 40min. 6-I did not see it worth to buy the faster access which is S90.00 additional to your adult ticket (which is S82.00)!. 7-All attractions are accessible from outdoor so in any case have rain coats and be prepared for a rainy day. 8-We were able to ride 7 out of 9 rides we planned to ride. 9-It is worth visiting and you can still have some more time to spend your evening somewhere else inside Sentosa island or back to the city. Finally, prepare a list of what you wish to do there and you will enjoy the experience. Thank you for reading so far.

name: user_6648
review: Awesome.. but too busy and many people during that day . 1 game have to queue waiting almost 1 hr

name: user_6649
review: It was raining heavily at the time we went. However we got a chance to play both human and Cylon with zero waiting time. Overall it was amazing. Will definitely come back

name: user_6651
review: The place is too crowded and the waiting period for any ride is a minimum of 1-2 hours. Its open from 11-6 and we can play only a max of 3 rides for which the price of the ticket is 82. Way too overpriced and overhyped. Such a waste of time and energy waiting in those never ending queues. Theres no limitation on the number of tickets that are sold. Im writing this review while Im in the queue waiting for the last ride which is my third one for the day and its already going to be 6pm. If you want to avoid waiting lines, I would definitely suggest you to buy express tickets so that it is much much faster and it costs double of the normal ticket. Food and water is allowed.

name: user_6652
review: Express tickets are definitely recommended if you hate queuing for rides. Cylon, Human, Mummy and Jurassic ride are a must. Transformer only if you do not have motion sickness with 3D glasses. (or you could not wear it - lesser immersion)

name: user_6655
review: A very nice place in Singapore for both adults and kids. It takes more than a day to cover everything. There is lot to explore from different themes to amusement park things like roller coster ride and Madame Tussade's, a man made beach, mono rail, cable car, food, shops, etc

name: user_6658
review: Except for the rain it was really fun. Return of the mummy was easily the best ride. Closed too early for an amusement park (6pm)

name: user_6662
review: Make a holiday with children okay

name: user_6663
review: Good Fun to spend a Day. Some rides are closed. Advised to buy Express Tickets, if you are fully into rides

name: user_6664
review: Rides are packed, and the wait time is so long that you can only do 3 rides per day . Express tickets are out of order or 90 per ride, which i found it super expensive . Need an extra 8 rides to reduce the waiting time.

name: user_6665
review: Been here multiple times and it never gets old! Not to be missed rides include the battle-star, mummy and Jurassic. Make sure you spend the whole day there. If youre pressed for time, getting the express pass is definitely worth it to bypass the long queues. Many eateries with plenty halal options too.

name: user_6666
review: We had a hard time securing our tickets because of demand. We got our tickets from the Resorts World Sentosa website. We only tried to ride the Transformers due to long queue in the other attractions. Better to go here on weekdays.

name: user_6667
review: Good, I didn't go in, just took a photo in front of it. Because I don't really like riding rides. If you just take photos outside, it's free, but if you go in, you have to pay.

name: user_6668
review: Mind blowing experience. Kids loved it the most. Make sure to set aside an entire day for Universal Studios, as many rides have long queues. Consider bringing some snacks and drinks, but keep the load manageable.

name: user_6669
review: Universal Studios is amazing. A few tips to make it more memorable. 1. If you don't want to do rollercoaster rides then you can avoid buying the express ticket. If you do, then it's a must. 2. Water inside is very expensive so carry a bottle and refill at the water taps. 3. There are lots of shows and meet and greet. You can take pictures with them once it's over. Always stand in the right to avoid the queue. 4. Download the Universal Studios app to check the wait time. 5. Whatever you do, don't miss the Transformer ride.

name: user_6671
review: Waiting lines are ridiculously long, 2 hour wait or more for a 3 minute ride is absurd. The rides are really nice, but for the price of the tickets it's totally not worth it. Maybe if you add the additional "express" tickets, which are an additional 90 per ticket making the price around 170 per person, you will be able to do more rides. The people with the express tickets skip the line making the wait for "normal" ticket owners even longer. As a family of 4 spending 280 for 4 rides totaling 12 mins of fun is a waste of time and money. The place is really nice, I am not complaining about the venue, but with no limit on the amount of visitors being let in it feels like a total money grabbing ripoff. And of all parcs of this kind I have visited in the past, this one is not the one to go to.

name: user_6672
review: Compared with the one in Osaka, the Singapore park is small and beautiful, with many photo spots. It was a big mistake that I didnt buy the express pass, so I could only say goodbye to some popular facilities.

name: user_6674
review: Visited today and due to heavy rain, all outdoor rides were closed for a long period in the morning. Queues to rides were mostly 80 minutes, but up to 180 minutes for the best roller coaster. Frequent technical problems closed/emptied the Mummy ride several times during the day. Too many people and too long queues everywhere. The park has a very short opening time, 11-18. Also dont recommend the diner, no beef burgers, fries were not good. Stressful environment with loud buzzes when orders were ready. I would not book a visit to the park in advance, you need to check the weather forecast before deciding to go.

name: user_6676
review: Really crowded couldnt play long queue some 70 minutes some 140 minutes really wast of time and money

name: user_6677
review: Express ticket must b bought...otherwise looooon waiting time fr 10min show n u miss so many rides

name: user_6678
review: I had the worst experience at Universal studios Singapore ! It was over crowded to the extent that every other ride had a wait time of 1.5-2.5 hours ! The arrangements for the wait areas were pathetic, if they expect these many people they should atleast make the whole waiting area air conditioned ! It was hot & humid in the queuing areas with a very few fans and people were literally dying of heat ! The park should limit the number of people allowed so everyone can enjoy who has paid this much amount to get a ticket. The people with express ticket obv had an edge at the expense of people with regular tickets, but the express ticket prices are ridiculous ! We were only able to get on 2-3 rides in the whole day and kids were exhausted and bored due to long queues. Many food courts were closed and the ones that were available had average food, out of stock and priced at a level of fine dine ! It was supposed to be a fun day but turned out to be a torture !

name: user_6680
review: When it rains, admission is delayed by one hour. This is understandable for safety reasons. However, there is only one staff member outside each facility, and most of them are just standing guard. Unlike Universal in other countries, there are very clear queuing instructions and waiting time signs outside the facilities. Some lights indicate that the waiting time is 40 minutes, but the actual queue time is more than 1.5 hours. It can be seen that the staff are not updating, which is really incredible!

name: user_6682
review: While everything is so expensive here, you get a decent experience riding the attractions. Long queue may happen in some of the parks most anticipated attractions like battlestar galactica and lost worlds. Before arriving at the park, make sure youve planned what attractions you wanted the most since its almost impossible to ride all the attractions. At peak attendance, most of the people can only ride 4-5 popular attractions. Or you might buy the express ticket which is also expensive. Singapore is so hot and humid, make sure you bring umbrella and apply sunscreen to your face/body.

name: user_6684
review: Every ride is exciting one. The 3d shows are lovable too. But Waterworld show of pirates is not showing, which is the must see one.

name: user_6685
review: When I came here it was raining and it was quite full of visitors and only a few the game being ridden

name: user_6686
review: It's not really big inside, but the rides are fun

name: user_6687
review: Opens at 11am and closes at 6pm. There is not enough time to see all the attractions

name: user_6690
review: Amazing theme park, great food, great attractions, will definitely visit again. Tickets are a bit pricy though considering you have to pay to get your pictures from the meet and greets and the food isn't free.

name: user_6691
review: 5 min of fun/5 hours of standing in a queue. Overpriced food and too many souvenir shops. Minions pavilion is closed for a rework, but the ticket price is still the same. Many people said about attention to details, however, I wasnt able to condo it by myself. While queuing at Transformers, lab design looks good, but its not interactive at all. There are some control panels, which are not working. And if you see closer, its easy to see all the false nature of objects. Maybe its technically difficult to repeat 3D Max cinema experience in attractions, but graphics looks very cheap and unreal, with poor quality, what prevents you from believing in the reality of wha is happening around. Im disappointing in USS experience in common with the current level of quality of service and ticket price.

name: user_6692
review: Quite good but this is our 3rd time. Some shows never change. Open time is a bit too short for theme park

name: user_6693
review: The place is super well built, the transformer rides and the mummy is definitely my favs! I feel like im actually there Food definitely is on the pricey side, average taste and long line. It's Understandable since there is a-lot of people. 9/10 place! Been there since I was a kid...

name: user_6694
review: Go in the afternoon, waiting in line for the rides isn't long.

name: user_6696
review: Was very disappointed with the wait time on most rides.. ridiculously long, waited 80 minutes each for two of the rides. Tried to get the fast pass when I arrived at 11am but they were sold out. I wouldnt rush back.

name: user_6697
review: Worst place.. For every ride waiting time would be 40 to 100 mins. Very less number of rides are there and water area got closed. It's waste of your time and money.

name: user_6699
review: One of the most favorite amusement parks for children There are many activities to do, there are 7 zones to enter. If you want to play hit rides such as Transformer, Mummy, Cylon, Human, you must hurry to get there before others. Because people are going to queue up a lot. The various shows were fun. The kids especially liked the minions. Make sure to download the USS app to view player information. and waiting time for playing each rides zone as well. I'm sure everyone love this place!!!

name: user_6700
review: Crowded, but enjoyed. Lot of energy at this place...tried new rides this time, for me at this age was scary, but my kids made it look easy...

name: user_6701
review: It was an awesome experience and an awesome place to be. But yes, do check the weather conditions before you plan to go. You can shop for your favorite animation characters, for Universal Studios souvenirs and alot more. You have some of the amazing eating outlets. The rides are great, the set ups are just amazing. If in Singapore you must not miss Universal Studios at all.

name: user_6703
review: Worst experience ever.. So so long queue for a single activity. You end up with standing in queue for two to three hours for a single ride. Like transformer, 4D. Jurassic world. Don't like the arrangement and management for crowd control... Poor very poor..

name: user_6705
review: Not worth your time unless you buy fast passes. 2 hour queues for nearly all rides. Expensive day not worth your money.

name: user_6709
review: Great place to have fun. Although a couple of the attractions were closed for maintenance, the rest of the place was good enough. It was a bit small, in size. I thought we would not be able to experience everything. But we did, in about 7 hours. Overall, I would recommend people to go visit. It's good if you have the express pass. It avoids all the long lines. Good place for families.

name: user_6710
review: I have visited on weekend and it was crowded. There are quite long queues for some of favorite rides, like Jurassic park and coaster. There are easy access to USS, like buses and MRT.

name: user_6712
review: detailed in design. came in saturday morning and the crowd is very busy - no joke. queue for transformer the ride takes 2 hours but still recommended to try after the mummy & rapids adventure. better buy add ons unlimited express ticket to shorten the queue or coming in week day. Tried Mels restaurant, delicious food & it super fast serving. gelato nasty monsters in a booth cookie monsters also worth to try.

name: user_6713
review: Express pass on high season school holiday is a must

name: user_6714
review: Be sure to buy a fast pass

name: user_6716
review: Tip: The convenience store closest to Universal is 7-Eleven. Go out the exit and go left. Go left until you reach the bathroom. When you come out of the restroom, turn left a little beyond that and go straight until you reach the corner, there is a fairly large convenience store. I went on a weekday, but there were a lot of people, probably because it is a country where many travelers come from all over the world. Since the operating hours are short for a theme park, I recommend purchasing an express ticket, although it is expensive, if you want to enjoy everything, see everything, and ride the rides. If you can withstand UV rays, heat, and humidity for 1 to 2 hours and enjoy 2 minutes of happiness, you don't have to buy enough. And you can leave Universal and come back in. (You must stamp your arm before leaving) I think Pharaoh has such a strong impact... I recommend it!! Even though I went through the express line, I had to wait quite a while. What can I say about Universal Details? It was so good and I was so glad I was able to enjoy it without thinking about anything else. It was really fun too

name: user_6717
review: Awesome place to visit with you child. Transformer ride is the best but it has long waiting queue which last upto 2hrs which is quite boring and irritating if you are with child. Most of the rides has long waiting and you will end up spending 5 to 6 hrs riding only 3 rides.

name: user_6720
review: It is located on Singapore's Sentosa island. If you haven't been to this type of entertainment center before, you should go. We paid 82 Sgd per person, but if you buy fast track, it is a bit salty and the price is 186 Sgd. Otherwise, you have to wait at least 45 minutes for each activity. There are entertaining shows every hour, you should spare at least 5-6 hours. Do not think about buying the ticket on the same day, the tickets may sell out early (11.30). For this reason, the opening time should be earlier.

name: user_6721
review: Fun. It is definitely the worst to visit at least once. If you plan to visit more attractions - buy express enter tickets. Queues are really long

name: user_6722
review: Yes, it was quite fun, but it took a bit long to wait in line to play the game items. Most of the fun items took about an hour!

name: user_6726
review: Just bad, dont go! To long wait time on the rides

name: user_6728
review: Superb Themepark but it's very overcrowded, the queues are very long, the rides are of maximum 2 minutes but the waiting is 1-1.5 hrs. Recommended to use passes to skip long queues. Must ride the Transformers and The Revenge of The Mummy rides.

name: user_6729
review: The place is good but rides are very short and the waiting times even in express lines are disproportionately long

name: user_6734
review: The overall park is small, but there are still many people and queues during holidays. If you use the Single Rider, you basically dont have to wait! The only one that lasted the longest was Transformers Coaster.

name: user_6735
review: Simply Amazing! The kid in you will definitely like it. Nostalgia hits when you see Jurassic Park entrance. Good food restaurants. Only con is the wait time for the rides.

name: user_6737
review: Very very bad experience. And disappointed with the staff and management. I bought two tickets there via cc in kiosk machine and we didnt know we have to collect entry pass as well. We only collect receipts at that moment because in our country we dont have such system and and i m unknown abt such things. Ok I accept it was my mistake not to take entry pass but at least they should have considered about this . They didnt allow us to go in.we requested so many times even we have ticket purchased receipts and informed all the scenarios but they didnt let us to go in. Very unfair rules. Universal studio you should focus on customer service.

name: user_6738
review: Fun place to spend time with kids. Better buy tickets online and in advance. Express lane tickets are also worth to buy if you dont want to waste time in the long waiting line.

name: user_6743
review: The rides were awesome even though there is a lot of people. But the problem that some people had overcome was that some people that is queueing seems to not pay attention. What I mean by that is that these people did not follow the queue properly and froze like a statue where there is a big gap between these people and the queue in front on of them. Whereas there some kids that get some people on nerves as they left the queue but they went in back and go to their previous position of the queue. I mean they are cut queueing!

name: user_6744
review: Too much wait time, from 7 hours you will lose 3hours in waiting

name: user_6745
review: Way to crowded. More than 1h waiting time per attraction minimum

name: user_6748
review: The park is great, but the opening hours are restricted, as it is always crowded and rains. We didn't like the snack we had at Mels Something, both the burgers and fries weren't good.

name: user_6749
review: Attractive but too crowded, waiting in line for a long time

name: user_6751
review: After all, it is Universal Studios. It is smaller than expected, but it is convenient as it has good rain protection facilities even when it rains. In the case of the external attraction, you couldn't ride it because it was raining, but if you are prepared to get wet, it will run, so give it a try. When viewing indoors, The Mummy was the most fun, and Transformers was also fun. I also recommend Shrek 4. Since we used the express separately, we didn't have to wait long, and express tickets are also sold at the general souvenir shop inside. Please note that re-entry is possible and a UV stamp will be issued. The restaurant was busy, so I went out, ate, and then re-entered. It was possible because there was an express service. Even if it rains, there are a lot of people, so it's not easy to take a photo.

name: user_6753
review: It was ok.... very busy on the train to get there and took a while....lots of building work going on... not as big as i imagined but fine for young kids... queues are horrendous so be prepared... we queued for 2.5 hours to go on the 4 minute transformers ride !!!... most queues where between 1 hour and 1.5 hours... and its very hot... no aircon. Lots of small eating places but hardly nowhere to sit and eat... over all very over priced for what it is...we bought our tickets in advance to save queuing which helped...

name: user_6754
review: Universal Studios in Singapore is a popular tourist destination, offering an array of thrilling rides and attractions. When we visited with our 5-year-old toddler, we couldn't resist joining in on the excitement ourselves. With so much to do inside, the limited operating hours from 11 am-6pm makes it challenging to experience everything. Despite the expensive base ticket prices of 80SGD for a child and 109SGD for an adult, additional costs of 70SGD per person for the Express pass might be necessary to avoid long queues, although it may not be valid for all rides. Setting aside the time constraint, the overall experience is incredibly immersive and inviting. It's important to note that even with a regular or Express pass, a single day wouldn't suffice to fully explore the park. If you have the budget, consider visiting twice to make the most of this remarkable attraction.

name: user_6756
review: Very good theme park but not much ride open on the day I visit

name: user_6758
review: Great experience! Trained and helpful staff. Long queues that consumed half of our time there. Overall good value for money and time spent.

name: user_6759
review: No words can describe the experience you get in Universal Studios Singapore. Queue up for meet and greet in all the 7 worlds and get some excellent pictures. Never miss the roller coaster ride. Such a fabulous place. Dont forget to try pizza, japanese rice cake in lost world, and turkey leg. There are many amazing toy stores where you can purchase minions, gudetama, and most of your favorite movie characters. Important note - Please buy tickets in advance using official website or klook. It's hard to get tickets when there is queue.

name: user_6760
review: Horrendous crowds on latest visit. Oversold. No chance of riding without express pass. Food court closed and big lines for food and drink. Little shade and few places to sit. Hugely expensive.

name: user_6764
review: Universal studio singapore is situated in santosa island. This is a fantasy world where people need to come and enjoy. There is huge queue and waittime for a 2 minute ride. Universal studio sells express tickets that has to be purchased with 90 more than the base ticket that cna bypass the queue. Planning the rides efficiently will help. Their roller coaster is a must try and the best ride based on theme battlestar Galactica and Cylon. There are 2 rides human, cylon. The human is a simpler ride and Cylon is the crazy one. The crowd management was very poor. Suggestion is to start with the Jurassic park and Far far away followed by ancient egypt. the mummy ride was very good. The transformers was a 3d experience which gives immersive experience.

name: user_6765
review: Its so fun but u have to be patient when queue for rides. Spent all day in here from 11am to 6pm with family. They selling express tickets but i think its not worth it because u must spent more money, sold separately with regular tickets.

name: user_6766
review: We were promised a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 2 hours and the ride wasnt good at all. They also make you pay extra for everything. e.g. .5 off a8 for going over the locker time only because the line was too long. Everything is extremely overpriced (10 for a slice of pizza and 8 for a slurpee) they lacked shaded areas, seating and food. I dont recommend buying a ticket and if you do make sure to get an express ticket.

name: user_6770
review: I think you should find out how the ride is (like galactica, mummy, is a high speed roller coster which is not for everyone) before you going to take a ride. My bad when i take a queue of mummy, turns out i know that a very high speed roller coster when i was a couple queue to in, and the rest is history After all is a nice experiences for being there, i hope the minions will release so soon!! And please Harry Potter too!!

name: user_6771
review: Great place for the family to enjoy the rides and entertainment together. The mummy ride is super exciting. Of course, in the park, food is a bit more expensive. Now it is undergoing some renovation.

name: user_6773
review: Must be nice but couldn't experience it. open only from 11 to 6 and waaaaaay to many lines. And in this heat that's not something I would recommend to anyone

name: user_6775
review: One of the things to go when coming to Singapore, however you should buy priority tickets when participating in the games, even though you have to pay extra, you don't have to wait. The good thing is that each game records the number of minutes you need to wait. And it's best to buy tickets in advance, if you don't want to have to queue for a long time. KLook is a good place to buy tickets.

name: user_1887
review: Ok, so after Japan and USA universal this was a little bit disappointing. Rides were very good, its the people and the express pass and I guess food that lead me to this review. Lets start with the people (staff). Omg, hideously rude and grossly disorganised. This was across most rides...unreal. I think these people are in the wrong job. Clearly not enjoying dealing with the general public. Ride operators, Barking orders at people ...yikes. Ive never seen anything like it. Awlful. I didnt engage but observing this I can only shake my head. Express pass. Excellent idea, poorly executed. Battlestar galactica. 1.5 hour wait in express...ummm unacceptable. Also, would pay to give accurate wait times then give people the opportunity to continue to wait or abort. Or even better get staff to communicate proactively. Complete shambles. Also worth noting dont buy food there. Its terrible. Eat first. How hard is it to get good food? Sports stadiums can do it with basic food reasonably well, why cant universal? So for me, great park and rides but the staff killed it. What a shame. Lift your game universal. Start by getting management to observe the poor attitudes of staff.

name: user_6778
review: The atmosphere is nice but.... It opens from 11am to 6pm, which is not enough time at all It is crowded on holidays and also on normal days, so it is preferable to take a fastpass... and buy tickets beforehand to ensure that you get the fastpass before it runs out.. Many of the games are not working due to rain and maintenance Waiting time ranges from 20 minutes to 80 minutes

name: user_6782
review: Actually, its okay. Its really not big inside, but there are so many people. Every facility has to be queued for a long time, and prices in Singapore are really higher than in Taipei... quite a lot I feel that Universal in Osaka is better, at least the park is bigger, even if I dont want to Queue up and sit on the street. There are parades or performances of characters on the street to watch. However, there are no parades on Global Street in Singapore. There are only sultry weather, huge crowds and traffic jams

name: user_6784
review: For those who want to experience exciting facilities frequently, remember to purchase a quick pass!

name: user_6785
review: I will say it is a nice theme park, but it got too many people during the weekend. They closed the Waterworld, so people just squeezed into all other areas. Everything has to line up for 1-2 hours and even shows around have many people waiting. This theme park created a vibe that most people have thought advanced to get a fast pass, but actually, you have to queue with the pass as well, it basically becomes two lines waiting for the ride at the same time. The fast pass is double the entire ticket price which I think is expensive but it seems like you wont experience a lot without it as there are crowded. The opening hours are short as it only opens 11am to 6pm and without the fast pass we only be able to play two rides and watch two shows. All the attractions close at 6pm as well as all the gift shop which is kinda weird for me as I expect we can get something after playing rides.

name: user_6786
review: They should be embarrassed & ashamed of themselves for charging people so much when so much of the park is closed or out of order due to technical issues. Bought express priority tickets which resulted in 2 rides & 2 shows..... absolutely terrible! The 2 rides we went on were good but were certainly not worth the cost of the ticket we paid for. You cannot keep charging people when a lot of the park is not operational! Just disgusting!!

name: user_6790
review: The most remarkable place to visit in Singapore. It's worth every penny.

name: user_6792
review: It was really fun hanging out with the kids, really enjoyed every game, it's just that the queue to get in on Wednesday was incredibly large, there were lots of visitors, and on the afternoon it rained heavily so many of the games didn't run.

name: user_6793
review: This recreation park is visited by quite a lot of tourists in Singapore, whether they want to just take photos in front of Universal landmarks or go in to try out the rides inside, to access Universal, you can walk maybe 2-3 km from Vivo City, boarding. Sentosa Express tickets are 4 or via bus depending on each of you, just adjust your holiday budget.

name: user_6794
review: Always buy universal Express ticket

name: user_6795
review: Too much waiting time for each ride. After getting there the ride is too short

name: user_6797
review: 1 Star is too much for my experience. Queued for 2 hrs to ride the battlestar coaster. They insist no loose items so bags, phones water bottles forced to be in locker. Then queue for 2 hours to ride. What is even more disheartening is seeing the same express queue people going on it a couple of times without waiting. Unless you are willing to pay the express ticket you will have insane wait times for rides. After standing for 2 hours plus waiting and become dehydrated and feeling sick and tired left park. What a total waste of money it was!

name: user_6800
review: This is the 2nd time I came this time after Covid picked up almost all the rides and there weren't many people

name: user_6802
review: I took the time to queue up 2 rides, and when both were about to arrive, it was best to pause due to technical issues. Do you need to straighten it out? Its a real waste of time for people waiting in line

name: user_6806
review: Thought universal studios will be great visit, but unfortunately most of the time went in waiting in the queue. Wait time is more than 60 mins in most of the rides And rides are also very less. Recommend visits : Mummy and then Transformers

name: user_6809
review: Pathetic experience, totally mis-managed and very rude staff especially towards Indians. Extra long queues for each ride even after taking express tickets. Only 1-2 person managing the rides/queues at such a renowned place. Totally disappointed. They charge good 100 SGD for 5 printed and all digital photos, but their photographers are hardly available at 2/3 points, at the end we were handed over only 21 digital photos. Will not recommend anyone to visit this place.

name: user_6810
review: I will visit again in 2023. Some scenes of Transformers have faded and need to be maintained as soon as possible. It is recommended to spend an extra 300 to enter the park 30 minutes early. In addition to the exclusive entrance channel, you can also take photos with the cartoon characters. If you have extra time, you can walk to the front of Transformers and wait for admission. After Transformers is over, the crowds at the gate begin to enter the park. This is because there is no one in the Jurassic area behind. You can go to the waterway very quickly without queuing. Compared with the price of express pass, this is an investment with a very high CP value.

name: user_6812
review: Very busy. One ride can queue for a very long time. It's best to buy a VIP ticket. Lots of places to eat and bars. There are casinos etc. Kids will definitely love it here.

name: user_6813
review: It's a bit small , though it is nice to visit The shows needs to be more often And from 11 till 6 is not an enough time Especially when it is raining

name: user_6815
review: USS open 11 am - 6 pm.. just 7 hours to enjoy.. I queue about 1,5 hours for 1 adventure.. it wasnt worth it.. too expensive bcause we just play about 3-5 adventure.. not recommend!!!! Not recommend if you go to Sesame Street Ride..

name: user_6816
review: Visited an adventure cave.

name: user_6818
review: Still excellent but very crowded and peicing could be better.. waiting time ranges from 15mins to 1hr

name: user_6819
review: Be prepared to wait around 2 hours on average for each ride. Definitely not worth it and the park should seriously consider the number of visitors they allow each day. The long wait times ruins the experience and you end up exhausted from standing in the heat. It makes worse when you see people with "VIP Express" pass skipping the line, very bad practice compare to other theme parks around the world!.

name: user_6820
review: We went on a Monday, yet it was super crowded. Strongly recommend you to buy the express pass. Get the express pass in advance through look as its cheaper. Buying there directly will cost 70 SGD and higher based on the crowd Rides was fun, it was a good

name: user_6824
review: Holidays with my children who are excited to try the rides available at Universal Studios Singapore, but because of the school holiday season the queues for tickets and entry to each ride are incredibly long, almost 1 hour more to queue. I suggest bringing an umbrella or raincoat because not all queues have a roof, and the season in Singapore is unpredictable, the hot heat can turn into heavy rain, there are several rides you should use waterproof footwear, or you will go back to the hotel with soaked shoes and socks

name: user_6831
review: It's nice just the waiting time for rides with regular tickets takes forever

name: user_6832
review: This is a must-visit place in Singapore. But always remember, there is a long queue every day. They told us there is a waiting of 30 minutes but it took us 2 hours in the queue.

name: user_6833
review: Really enjoyed our visit, the theming was on point and the rides were great. Cant wait to bring my son here one day. My only hope is that he turns to me one day and says one more ride? Of course, lets go!

name: user_6834
review: Very fun experience. Recommended during weekday for less queue time

name: user_6835
review: Pack yourself up for the most amazing and the most thrilling experience of your life! Universal Studios houses the most enjoyable rides having the themes of different movies and shows of Hollywood . But yeah, don't forget to try out the Waterland, the VR ride of Transformers and the Madagascar Ride. They are musts. And I don't recommend to buy any items or foods from this amusement park. It will be a waste.

name: user_6839
review: It's best to come in the morning so that your game is satisfied

name: user_6842
review: The queque is to long so we only enjoyed few attraction in there. We enter -around 10:00 singapore time until closed only got 3 rides

name: user_6845
review: After the epidemic, I finally came again on July 5, 2023, but unfortunately the opening time was postponed and changed to 11 o'clock. The queue line that day was very chaotic. It was obvious that Universal Studios did not plan well at all, and I could only see one. There were a lot of people crowded together and slowly moving forward to enter the park. However, during this period, many Indians would silently jump in line. When they finally entered the park, they found that many of the amusement facilities were under maintenance, so it might not be cost-effective to buy tickets to play this year.

name: user_6847
review: Easy stroll, sun protection required!

name: user_6848
review: This time I went to Universal Studios. I arrived around 12 noon on weekdays. There are really not as many tourists as Osaka and Beijing, so there is no need to get a ticket early in the morning. Several facilities have single-passenger access, especially in Singapore. The park is really not big, so you can basically play in all the facilities before closing. I really like the human version of Transformers, and the other hanging roller coaster ride makes me feel dizzy and makes me want to vomit

name: user_6852
review: The entertainment facilities are fun. If you dont buy a quick pass, you will have to wait for more than an hour!

name: user_6853
review: Visited during new year, & it was super crowded. Even after taking express pass had to wait for 15-20 mins for each ride.

name: user_6855
review: - an awesome place ... !!! - bought ticket by online before going to this place - i had information that this place close every tuesday - open hours 11.00 to 18.00 - bring umbrella in case the weather is very sizzling or rain - you'll get wet or soaked when riding jurassic park rapid adventure - fried chicken and rice at goldilock resto is nice - shrek 4D was fun

name: user_6858
review: Universal studios is one of the most attractive and expensive place in Singapore.this is my 2nd visit at universal studios.I would like to advise, if anyone go there in weekend try to buy express tickets to avoid long queues.otherwise not enough time to explore all the rides due to long & long queues. I wasted my five hours plus time for following queue (I didnt buy express tickets )in future i will buy express ticket and some dry food for save money. Thanks.

name: user_6859
review: Although expensive, it is fun. Thrilling rides and joyful experience. Weekdays will be better.

name: user_6860
review: We went on a Friday and it was busy! Luckily we stayed on the island as we tried to get tickets for the Thursday and found that they were sold out. So buy tickets early or online before showing up to avoid disappointment. The kids loved the rides. In particular the two Battlestar Galactica rides. Queues were extremely long so next time we might get the kids the express pass. We also did the Jurassic Park water adventure ride and when they warn that you will get wet (or saturated), they mean it! Make sure to bring a poncho and shoes that you dont mind getting soaked.

name: user_6861
review: Great time with family!! We visited most of the rides, however since it was cloudy, it dint even RAIN it was just cloudy, they closed most of the rides

name: user_6863
review: Long que even if you buy express and VIP tickets , Rides are good but be ready for long ques

name: user_6867
review: I really want to come here again hahaha

name: user_6868
review: Although it is small, it has several activities and games. Getting there by subway is very easy and everything is very careful and neat.

name: user_6869
review: Definitely buy tickets in advance. The first day we went tickets were sold out at 11:20am, so we got tickets for the next day instead. Rides for all thrill seaker levels. Not a large park compared to Universal Studios Orlanda, but well put together and very clean. Definitely use the Universal Studio app to work out wait times. We purchased express passes to ensure that we could get on all the rides. We all had a great time ... definitely recommend to thrill seakers!!

name: user_6870
review: Charging steep price even though 1. 1/6th of the park is under construction 2. Most of the live shows are still closed ( including the underwater world) 3. Park is usually overcrowded and the only way to ensure you get to play all rides is to top-up for the Express pass. Plus they stopped selling annual pass in the name of COVID-19 and are yet to bring it back.

name: user_6872
review: It was good, I tried the Egyptian Theme ride thrice as there was less queue and the other rides took 2 hrs for queue. But I really enjoyed the aesthetic and ambiance. Things are costly and most of the shops close at 6 pm

name: user_6874
review: Horrible place, horrible service, horrible rides. People are extremely unfriendly with attitude problems and the rides so lame with long waiting hours including the express queues. Dont waste a minute of your stay visiting this theme park. I dont even know how a great theme park like Universal Studios would open up here and ruin their reputation like that. Horrible experience never again.

name: user_6875
review: The day I went to the amusement park, it closed very early and there were a lot of people. The rain prevented me from enjoying all of it. If anyone likes to play games. It is recommended to buy a fast pass ticket. You won't have to wait in line. Very worthwhile.

name: user_6877
review: Good place.... 2 days required to complete all the events

name: user_6878
review: Opened at exactly 11am. And it already full of people despite its a weekday, anticipated that the park would be flooded by visitors on weekends. But, the express ticket did gave me an advantage. Yeah, I understand its kinda pricey, but you are indeed paying for time; no more long lines. Its been a while since I got back. October 2011 was my first time. I remember the iconic ride; cylon. A lot has changed. Indeed. Bring you own water bottle, the June heat is no joke. There are water fountains around the park. Sorry fellas. No photos for sharing. Im pretty sure there are a lot in the net.

name: user_6884
review: Very small, many people, attractions with hour-long queues in which only 10 people enter at each turn... Poorly designed for large crowds. Well-designed attractions keep wait times minimal, but there is only one like this in the park: the mummy attraction in the Egypt section. (Many "cars" and many people per "car" but without affecting the sensations, out of 10). The food is expensive (to be expected) but they serve it incredibly quickly and it's not bad (not Michelin star, but edible). If you are considering going, ask for the Universal Express ticket or die of despair in endless lines...

name: user_6885
review: Total only 3 rides, not much exciting. Prepare to get wet. Buy express pass else waiting time is long.

name: user_6887
review: Had best day in Singapore.. Must Visit.. get express pass so no need to wait for rides ..

name: user_6889
review: I visit this place everytime i come Singapore. Hope that they will appear in VN soon

name: user_6893
review: There's no doubt about it Oh yes... before you enter the USS, it is recommended that you first read/look at the map of the area and rides on the USS So that our time inside doesn't get confused because it's so big and everything is so good, hehehe My suggestion is to go straight to the Transformer ride and go to Water World because I don't think we can go to USS if we haven't tried this ride, hehe I swear it's really cool And every time you want to try the rides you have to queue And one more thing, you can install the Universal Studio application to find out everything about the rides on the USS Kereeen....

name: user_6894
review: if you're just there for the atmosphere then its great, but if you want to ride the rides without the fast pass just be prepared to wait atleast an hour or two for each ride. also in my experience the rides got suspended without any explanation after i waited for hours

name: user_6896
review: You will get the worth of the money spent by you. The rides are excellent. I visited on a weekday on Tuesday and there were no long queues. On weekend expect a lot of crowds and long queues. This place will make you a child once again if you are a grown up.

name: user_6898
review: Worth a visit especially for teenage kids, please take ticket in advance as they close the gate if the capacity is reached. One can take express pass on reaching the resort if there is a long lime

name: user_6901
review: A very busy place for an adventure to test your courage on certain rides

name: user_6905
review: There are no proper options for restaurants and food. Vegetarian food is not available. We ate French fries and Onion ring as a lunch. Always remember to book the ticket online or before arriving to the Universal park.

name: user_6907
review: Question: Do you want to get scammed? If yes, visit the one and only Universal Studios at Sentosa! Everything is a scam. Purchased a ticket in Sentosa, only to go in a queue to "covert" my QR coded ticket to a Barcoded ticket because the entry scanners can only scan the barcoded tickets. Well, that is not all. The operating times are ridiculous. Starts at 11 am! Who starts at 11 am? Anyways, just to convert the ticket, it takes 1 hour. The express tickets were all sold out which is equal to a normal ticket price. So basically paying double per person to access the rides quickly and not wait for 1 hour to access one ride. Well... if you feel that is it, then nope... majority of the rides are outdoor! If it pours, those rides are closed and no refund is given. We went in, paid extra for express, only for it to rain at 1 pm and all rides closed. Came back home super disappointed. A pure money making scheme.

name: user_6908
review: Crowded, but still manageable Fun experience too And got so many thing to do while my time not that much left at the tine

name: user_6909
review: Children under 4 years old should not go yet. Because it's large - hot and quite tiring. Some 8/10 games are limited to the child's height. You should research carefully before buying tickets. Tickets are also reasonable for the money spent. However, the best time to go is 14pm - 6pm. Going early is very crowded, queuing is tiring and drains a lot of energy. You should bring drinking water with you, because it will be more economical and delicious and cleaner, so you won't have to travel to buy water If the area is a bit live, just come back and play later, don't try to queue for a while. In the first part, I waited in line for 70 minutes - after 2 hours, I just went in to play. Very very fast!! In general, next time I will go again because I have money Love Singapore

name: user_6918
review: took me 3 days to enter. must ensure ticket from online. every tickets sold out offline. pretty big line of buying tickets.

name: user_6920
review: One of the besr experience at Singapore. Roller coster ride was one hell of an experience. There are two roller coster - Human and Cyclon. Human is much more friendly compared to Cyclon. Awesome experience. Then we saw other rides like Lights, Action, Camera by Steven Spielberg, Revenge of Mummy ( roller coster, which is little bit scary), transformers which is a 3D show, Shrek 4D show and Jurassic park. You need to reach around 10.30AM before the queue gets too long for entrance. Every show we had a waiting time of around 1 hour. It was so crowded when we visited. Roller coster we had to wait for 90 minutes. Lot of food stalls also. Overall once in a life time experience at Singapore which you never want to miss.

name: user_6923
review: Highly recommend getting the express pass!

name: user_6928
review: One of the best places to visit when you are in Singapore Located in the sentosa island of Singapore You must visit the below rides - 1. Mummy ride 2. Transformer ride. 3. Roller coaster ride 4. Lost world rapids These rides can't be missed Download their app before hand and will help you navigate through the park Do try to visit on a weekday and get the express pass otherwise you won't be able to cover all the rides because of the long queues Reach max by 1030 to the place

name: user_6934
review: You have to go there from the beginning to enjoy in everything, i prefer the express tickets to save time and add more joyful Due to waiting time sometimes could 2 hours Which is make you tired and nervous Overall, everything was excellent

name: user_6935
review: So disappointing. Sold out tickets first try, second try sold out fast pass after being told there will be plenty, half the attractions were closed so the park was minute, lightning shut down the outside rides, lines were hour plus wait, marketed theme foods weren't available. Save your money and time. Don't go.

name: user_6939
review: The place is not big, everything is neat, the rides are also fun, especially the roller coaster, it's great (the track is just not long enough hehe...), I haven't been able to try some of the rides because some of them are not operational that day (*based on information from the staff it's there), but overall its perfect.

name: user_6940
review: There are long wait times for rides. You can either buy express ticket or go early. You can also check the wait times for different rides on the app, to help plan the day.

name: user_6941
review: Disastrous. This is the worst experience I had of any theme park. We had to wait for almost 3 hours to just experience 1 ride. The queue was never-ending and it felt that the queue itself was some game. I would not recommend anyone to visit here. After spending so much money, all we could do was sit on just 1 ride ????? They should really think of some enhancement in this queue system and wait time. Really waste of time. They should learn from other theme parks where they display the average wait time outside the game area, which was not there for every game here.

name: user_6942
review: Maybe because I went on a Monday, there weren't as many people as expected. The rides didn't have to wait for a long time until about 1 or 2 o'clock, but if you don't mind, you can queue for single admission and save a lot of time.

name: user_6944
review: I recently visited Universal Studios in Singapore with my family and close family members with high hopes of an unforgettable day filled with excitement and adventure. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by one glaring issue: the absurdly long queues. It's disheartening to say that my overall impression of Universal Studios was one of frustration and disappointment. Upon arrival, it was immediately evident that the park was overcrowded. The lines for popular attractions stretched endlessly, resembling a never-ending labyrinth of waiting. It felt like the park management had completely overlooked the importance of efficient crowd control and guest satisfaction. Even with a carefully planned itinerary, I found myself spending the majority of my time (more than one or 2 hours)standing in lines rather than enjoying the attractions. It was disheartening to see families and children growing increasingly tired and restless while waiting for their turn, dampening the excitement that should have been synonymous with a theme park visit. To make matters worse, the queuing experience was poorly managed, resulting in excessive wait times that far exceeded any reasonable expectation. I understand that popular attractions will naturally attract larger crowds, but the sheer lack of organization and inefficiency at Universal Studios was astounding. As a paying customer, I expected a more seamless experience. I had eagerly anticipated immersing myself in the magical world of Universal Studios, but instead, I spent most of my time standing in line, growing increasingly disillusioned by the minute. I sincerely hope that Universal Studios addresses this significant issue and takes steps to improve their crowd management system. The park's reputation and the satisfaction of its visitors are at stake. Until then, I cannot recommend Universal Studios to anyone seeking a hassle-free and enjoyable theme park experience. In conclusion, my visit to Universal Studios was marred by interminable queues, overcrowding, and a lack of organization. The park failed to deliver on its promise of a thrilling and magical adventure, leaving me and my family with a sense of regret and frustration. Unless significant improvements are made, I would caution others against wasting their time and money at Universal Studios.

name: user_6948
review: Overrated place. If you are a fan of roller coaster then you may enjoy this place with different themed roller coasters. Otherwise it will just a waste of Time. Also, if you aren't holding an express pass, you end up queue for at least 70 minutes for every ride. The place closes at 6pm and there aren't any fireworks etc. Unlike Disney lands. Not many varieties are available if you are looking for vegetarian food. Also, you cannot bring your own food from home. The lego store and chocolate store is amazing outside the Universal Studios.

name: user_6950
review: Great adventure park. It has so many good rides and shows. I would definitely recommend getting an express ticket if you want to complete all the rides in a single day. For people coming outside of Singapore to reach here take the train to Vivo city mall station and take Sentosa walk. It's just a 1km walk with a good view. You can take the tram on the way back.

name: user_6952
review: Strongly recommend buying express pass to avoid up to 70 min wait times.

name: user_6953
review: Worth the visit especially when with kids they will enjoy it. They had some rides to do since they couldn't ride the scarier roller coaster rides. Was great to see 4d shrek movie

name: user_6954
review: Amazing Roller Coaster ride. Dinosaur park ride, Egypt theam ride all are amazing. Must visit.

name: user_6957
review: If Disney Land is the happiest place on Earth, Universal Studios is the worst place on Earth. Attractions are mid at best. Lines to rides are the very meaning of biblical hell. Two words: never again.

name: user_6958
review: Really I'm Excited when entering into Universal Studio... The only place that everyone must see... Fabulous Entertaining Zone with lot and Lot of Funzz.. Its a Great Experience in Mummy and Start Camera Action.. Want to enjoy more... surely I will visit again to Universal Studio Singapore...

name: user_6960
review: Nailed it so much. Very good place for adventures and rides

name: user_6962
review: Brilliant place for the kids. Gets crowded and insane long queues for the rides. Better to get the record pass tho. Designed not to completely cover it in one day

name: user_6970
review: Even a weekday this places is packed and you will spend more than an hour in line for a 5 min or less ride but its worth the wait. For adults transformers is a must. I would recommend visit post lunch as queues get less crowded and you will be able to cover more rides. At 6 pm there are multiple live shows which are worth attending.

name: user_6973
review: Every rides have to que min. 35min. If possible, probably can invest on express pass which is about double the ticket price.

name: user_6975
review: Fun experience, although there were a lot of people, and most of my time was taken up by the long lines. That's why i would recommend getting an express pass if you have extra money. There are a lot of places to eat and many things to see! Take a picture with all the cool sights and figures you see everywhere. Would also recommend bringing a fan with you or those mini fans powered by battery if you're too lazy.

name: user_6979
review: I like it and my children love it, but i hate that some games are closed and the water wold also, a small advice for how want to visit in future, without the "fast past" its impossible to finish the universal studios in one day.

name: user_6980
review: Certainly the weather was hot and sweltering in the last week of June, the bathrooms were dirty towards the end of the day, the queues were very long but the staff also worked hard and quickly, the rides were in good condition. Like the show.

name: user_6984
review: Universal Studios is a small but beautiful place. It is recommended to start from the left. There is almost no need to queue and there is no need to buy a quick pass!

name: user_6985
review: If you are interested for roller coaster ride then and only then invest your money to went there if you feel scary to take roller coaster then this is not good place to throw money. If you are planning to go with ordinary pass during holiday/weekend please try to reach there before 11 AM so you could enjoy most of the rides because you must be in queue for average 60-70 minutes for all majority rides. For weekdays visit avoid to buy express pass as just reaching there before 11 AM is enough which can save your money.

name: user_6986
review: We really enjoyed our USS experience better to book your tix ahead of time. I booked thru kkday.

name: user_6987
review: If you go on a weekday on a Monday, you will have to wait about 60 minutes for popular places.

name: user_6988
review: Good rides But limited options. The lines too long on rush days. So take Priority access. Worth the extra buck. Nice. Colourful. Good time spend.

name: user_6989
review: We had the express ticket, hence the waiting time i overall for us was way lesser than general tickets

name: user_5433
review: Not Friendly for Disabled Wheelchair bound people / who can't walk. There's No lift from Car drop area to ground level. If you carry your own wheelchair then it's ok but shifting to Rides not easy. On rental manual wheelchair available Such an advance Country but No motorised wheelchair surprisingly

name: user_6990
review: Decade old themes and IP with signs and facades that are totally fading. Feels like we're being ripped off with full ticket prices with half the park closed for renovation, and 4 cans of soda.

name: user_6993
review: Super adventure rides with themes of Transformers and The Mummy. Caution for people with heart, neck and vertigo issues and for pregnant ladies.

name: user_6994
review: Fun theme park with a variety of attractions, just be careful of the heat around June - very hot and humid

name: user_6995
review: It's quite small, and it takes about 10 to 20 minutes to walk around it. There will be more people in the morning, but there will be fewer people queuing in the afternoon. It should be because in addition to Universal, this station also has casinos and other facilities outside, so everyone will go out after playing what they want to do. Ive been to Universal Japan, but its not as immersive compared to here, and I cant get the urge to shop randomly. And the types of guests are different... so the queuing order will also be different... Well, you know what I mean, there are Indians jumping in the queue, and a whole group of Americans asking to get on the first bus... and so on. situation. But the facilities are still fun. If you come to Singapore and wish to visit Taosha, you can definitely stay a day to visit this stop. Adult fare is currently 82.

name: user_6997
review: In peak holiday season its full with people, queing for two hours standing without chair at every main attractions, and 1 hour with universal express. all games and show stop at 5.00, its too soon. Even with universal express, you cant play all the games or show. They should extend game hours until at least 7pm. Put the canopy in the main road walk, so guest can walk the park without getting wet by rain or burn by scorching sun. More eating place with air conditioner please, all the seat and table is always full in every restaurant we visited. We are not satisfied because cant play all the games and show even after buying universal express before entering universal studios singapore.

name: user_6998
review: Very crowded buy express entry if u are going on weekends

name: user_6999
review: Refund My money! A Disappointing Journey: Universal Studios Singapore fails to live up to its once enchanting reputation. Unforeseen Ride cancellations like mummy and sphagetti space chase without Lack o Prior Notice Leaft us Frustrated. Poor Guest Treatment: Staff Rudely Chased Visitors After Ride Cancellations, instead of being apologetic. Saving grace was Jurassic park ride, but it is not worth 82sgd.

name: user_7000
review: AMAZING RIDES. I recommend going early morning so that rush is low. MUST GO ON BATTLESTAR GALACTICA ROLLERCOASTER

name: user_7001
review: Universal Studios Singapore is undoubtedly one of the attractions in Singapore. It's an experience that can't be missed, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting. Really really recommend!!!

name: user_7002
review: Very worth the money, although each person costs over 1400k, it is worth experiencing this thrilling game area. Waiting in line to play is a bit long, but it's fun to play.

name: user_7003
review: My first visiting the theme park. It was super crowded but the rides were fun! I enjoyed myself totally and the staff were friendly. Definitely recommend!

name: user_7007
review: Very, very excellent. I advise every visitor to Singapore to come to this place for unlimited enjoyment

name: user_7013
review: Compared to few years ago, the list of attractions and ride is now smaller, waterworld was not on, but somehow the queues were quite ridiculously long plus now with the mere 7 hours of opening, there's no way to finish the park. If it comes to a point that to enjoy the park entirely, you must buy the express pass which is literally paying the equivalent of another full price ticket just to finish all the rides, then in the first place what is the meaning of getting normal tickets at all?
