Say For a normal family of 4 who wants to enjoy the park fully, they will have to spend close to say SGD720 (including express passes) for a 7 hour session........?! This is assuming that they don't even take time for meals at all. The app wasn't accurate as well - we went to queue for a ride that said 20 min wait, but halfway into the queue, the physical signboard was changed to say 50 min while the app still said 20 min. Mel drive in burger only was 16 bucks but some Mcdonald gourmet burgers are bigger, juicier and better. And there were only 4 selection of burgers, a terribly limited menu. The pizza place was selling a large pizza at 50 bucks!!! I get that food in there is expensive, but it has gone ridiculously off the chart. Did we enjoy it? My girl who leveraged on the single rider lanes whenever they were opened went a few times on certain rides. But it wasn't possible to be able to experience everything. She was happy, but to me who's seen the park during the hey days with more rides yet somehow more time to cover most attractions, and food that were already expensive but still had some standards back then... nah, I think there are better places to spend the money. This was on a Thursday, school holiday yes but surprisingly, more tourists than locals. But I guess it would still be a magical experience for first timers or kids who are still relatively new to theme parks.

name: user_7016
review: The rock and roll coasters were just nerve wrecking and butterflying

name: user_7018
review: 1. Wear comfortable shoes. Can't stress enough 2. Carry a change pair of clothes for kids and yourselves 3. If you can afford - buy the universal express tickets 4. If you're single - you don't need to bother with universal express. You'll get faster access naturally 5. Install some low battery using time pass games (sudoku etc) as you'll be waiting in many lines 6. Shop for souvenirs and anything else at last after you're done with all the rides. 7. Install the Universal Stuios app BEFORE you enter to plan the day well. 8. Try and leave before 5 if you want to use the mono rail. 9. If you're 3 or more traveling together get a cab. It's more or less the same charge to Vivo city

name: user_7020
review: Nothing to say to one of the best theme park of the world. 70% of attractions are the same of Los Angeles and they are also opening the Minion Area that will have more rides too. Buy in advance the Universal Express ticket to skip queues!!

name: user_7023
review: Great experience, friendly staff Cost for adult : 82 SGD For child : 61 SGD For express pass : 100 SDG, it is a must if you plan to visit for one day only as waiting time is long in some activities however if you visited similar activities at Dubai it is match higher standard.

name: user_7024
review: We had a good time in Universal in June 2023. However, some rides were not operating due to Cyclone prediction (in Jurassic Park), Jurassic Park Rapids, but a must try are- Battlestar Galactica (go only if u love adventure and if you are not scared of height), Revenge of the Mummy, Transformers-SD, Shrek show if you are Shrek lover like us:). Things to keep in mind- better to fix a meeting spot and time with your family, as you are not allowed to carry phone and other items with you, so, tracking becomes an issue. Take a locker, keep your belongings there, fix a meeting time & spot, so, that you all can meet after a few rides....full day is needed, so, better to start early, carry a water bottle as you need to walk alot, so, staying hydrated is must. Wear sneakers or comfortable shoes, in which you can walk more and more....wear a cap and sunglasses, wear lot of sunscreen, as it is sunny most of the time and everyone in the family, keep some cash, so, that, even if you are away from other members, you can enjoy the yum food in Universal. A must in your Singapore trip, though we had been to Ferrari world- Dubai, but this surely was fun. *Tips- You can take an express pass, if you do not like to wait much and ready to pay double the price, Express que is separate, but relatively less waiting. We took the normal ticket and had to wait for 30-45min per ride.

name: user_7027
review: Had one of the worst experience in my life. Paid 330. Timing was 10 am to 6 pm. 2 of the rides had interruption. Waited for more than 90 minutes for each these rides. Other rides had more than 40 minutes. So for the whole day 5-6 rides. Not worth the dollar. There was obviously no capacity forecast or crowd control. Each ride were running very inefficiently. The could have increased the headcount and made it bit more efficient Capitalism at its best. Charging the customer but not providing the service. I would not suggest it to anyone if you have access to other decent parks in your country.

name: user_7029
review: Very crowded and long waiting time and better take express pass if you are visiting from outside Singapore

name: user_7030
review: The park has many rides, shows, and attractions that cater to people of all ages. One of the major highlights of the park is the various roller coasters that visitors can experience. The most popular roller coaster in the park is the Battlestar Galactica: Human vs Cylon, which is a dueling roller coaster that has two tracks. The ride is well-known for its intense and thrilling experience and is the perfect ride for adults and adventure lovers. Another popular roller coaster in the park is the Canopy Flyer. It is a suspended roller coaster that provides visitors with a bird's eye view of the park and the surrounding area. The ride is gentle and allows visitors to enjoy the scenery around them. Small children can also enjoy some of the rides in the park, such as the Treasure Hunters ride, which is a family-friendly roller coaster in which visitors ride along in a jeep. Another popular ride for young children is the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase, which is a dark ride that takes visitors on a journey through space with Sesame Street characters. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is an excellent destination for families and adventure lovers. It offers a range of roller coasters and other rides that cater to visitors of all ages. The park is constantly expanding, and visitors can expect more excellent rides and attractions in the future.

name: user_7031
review: visited shops just outside Universal Studios... nice shops for branded items.

name: user_7035
review: I m so excitement for universal studio n every ride is advantures..

name: user_7037
review: I visited Universal Studios Singapore today, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The park is quite small, and the entrance fee is quite expensive, especially considering the limited number of attractions. Even on a Monday outside of the school holidays, the wait times for all the rides were long, ranging from 50 to 120 minutes. One major issue I noticed was the poor maintenance of the park. The exterior paintwork was faded, and many attractions had broken elements, from minor things like malfunctioning TV screens in the queues to more significant issues like the broken robot dinosaurs in the Jurassic Park ride. Furthermore, all the attractions in this park felt like inferior versions of similar rides in other parks worldwide. It seemed like little effort was made to provide something unique. Additionally, the toilets were unclean, and the food was expensive. The staff seemed to put minimal effort into ensuring efficient queue management. Platforms were overcrowded, and the staff was unfriendly on multiple occasions. It felt like they were simply going through the motions. One aspect that added to the frustration was the necessity to purchase an express pass. The regular queue lines moved at an excruciatingly slow pace, making it feel almost mandatory to buy an express pass to avoid spending the entire day waiting in line. Overall, I got the impression that little attention was given to visitor experience. Hopefully, the park can make improvements in the future to meet visitor expectations and enhance the overall quality of attractions and service. Please feel free to make any further adjustments to the text if desired.

name: user_7040
review: Currently at 1h 40 mins waiting in line for transformers. We will probably manage 2 rides today in total. There is literally NO warning what the waiting time is for each ride. You keep thinking the next corner is the last but they have just hidden the queue in lots of different rooms. If you only have a day or two to enjoy Singapore, dont spend it in line here.

name: user_7045
review: Awesome place to spend time with children... we will become child along with children...

name: user_7049
review: Sort of compulsory to buy the express park for individuals who will sit in all the rides. Go anti clockwise in park direction, i.e far far away then to jurassic world to go against the flow of the rest of the crowd. Book tickets advance online & just walk in scanning the qr code. Express pass can be purchased at end moment outside universal studios. Roller coasters were insane.

name: user_7050
review: Fun and exciting rides and shows for all young and old. Good for a one whole day for families. Mon-Sat 12-7pm and Sun 10am to 6pm.

name: user_7051
review: DETAILED REVIEW Second visit after 9 years. There isn't much of a difference. Offered rides are still the same. Except for two changes: Madagascar ride has been removed. I also saw a new ride in Shrek land. It is kid-friendly. They are now building a new section with Minions as the theme. Still has not been completed. For reference to travelers, presently, not all areas in the place are open. The restaurant in Jurassic Park and Mummy souvenir shop were closed. New rules for new travellers: (1) Place operates at new time from 11am to 6pm only (2) Express Unlimited is not applicable to all rides. There are 4 rides that you won't be able to use this privilege. If you are able to find it in your plans to arrive earlier, I suggest to add-on Express Unlimited instead of purchasing it online since it is more convenient: they give you a wrist band whereas if it is online, you need to constantly show your e-ticket bar code which can cause delays. The place is kid-friendly. There are enough rides, but of course, there are more adult rides. RIDES: 9 year difference and rides are practically the same. Most rides last for 5 minutes or less. If you're curious if Express Unlimited is worth it, it is IF you want to maximize your stay there and get the most out of the rides. Lines tend to be long despite how I came back on a weekday. This second experience was not as crowded as my first but there were still long queueing. If you're not the patient type then getting the express ticket is worth it, especially during peak season. FYI just like any other theme park anticipate that waiting for the rides would most likely take up majority of your stay if you choose to not take express ticket add-on. During our first time, we had to wait for as long as 2 hrs just to ride the Transformers. Lastly, many rides don't make use of Solo rider lines. I haven't even seen anyone make use of it as compared to my time during Disneyland. FOOD: don't expect much. It's tolerable enough to fill your stomach but it isn't good enough to match it's price point. If you're up for it, you can request to get a re-entry ticket and eat outside.

name: user_7052
review: Its a fun place to be, suggest to buy express pass to avoid ling queues and waiting time, make sure to check weather before buying tickets as if it rains all outdoor rides are closed and it creates rush on all indoor rides too....

name: user_7053
review: Loved every bit of it...the shows..the rides..the ambience...its just awesome..must visit for kids.

name: user_7072
review: Love the transformer ride. But food very pricey

name: user_7074
review: Nice theme park for the family, more suitable for adults and teenagers. Fun and exhilarating rides! Be prepared for queues!

name: user_7075
review: It was an ok experience. I would have started with a poor rating but eventually with the time spend and realization how to navigate the experience improved a bit. A few suggestion to improve anyone's experience here- 1. Better go alone or with people who are of the same age, so that if you have a bad time it is a social experiment. 2. If you are going with kids and spending substantial money to get in, spend a bit more always get a express ticket to cut short the line time for the rides.(coz a kid would not understand that one needs to wait in queue to get a spot on the ride) 3. Always get the universal studios Singapore app as it keeps you posted about the ride time in different regions of the park. It also tell you about your real time position and relative distance to a nearest ride. 4. Better to go the park as early as it open. It gets hot and humid so be prepared for that.

name: user_7076
review: We visited Universal studio on a weekday but it was very crowded. Buy the tickets in advance and to skip the long queues buy the express pass otherwise you have to wait in long queues.

name: user_7077
review: Amazing place just very packed these days since it's one of the most popular tourist spot. So a long time goes in the queues rather than on the ride itself still quite magical in itself.

name: user_7080
review: The rides give you a once in a lifetime opportunity to experience thrill on a different level. The theme parks are well constructed and well maintained.

name: user_7084
review: Dont go weekends & peak hrs. Not worth the due to the waiting time for the ride. Atleast 45mins to 1hr. Sigh... wasted!

name: user_7085
review: Paradise for roller coaster lovers

name: user_7086
review: Lot's of fun, I won the free express passes during the gate opening ceremony. We had a great time.

name: user_7087
review: Typical theme park. Wait times were pretty bad and it was too hot. Scorching. So plan well, bring a tumbler and extra clothes.

name: user_7088
review: Hot and busy - as expected during the school holidays but the weather held up which is most important! **Note to management** I've been to USS numerous times over the years but noticed recently that the queue cutting at the rides is becoming more frequent. Unfortunately each time it appears to be from the same group of visitors that flagrantly cut the Q. Perhaps this can be addressed somehow to make it more enjoyable for everyone. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

name: user_7090
review: Apart from the snaking queues and the scorching hot afternoon sun, we had loads of fun. The rides were fantastic and were some of the best I've ridden for a long time. Would definitely re-visit for a wholesome time!

name: user_7094
review: Beautiful place but very over crowded. One must buy the premium pass to avoid long serpentine queues

name: user_7096
review: Revenge of the Mummy ride seat size is not for Western adults - they're made for short people. I'm 5 feet 10 and my legs felt uncomfortable in the narrow gap between seat and safety bar so I got out. This ride should be upgraded if overseas tourists will go.

name: user_7097
review: Fun, but too tired to queue. I feel not so fun like i'm in Disneyland. Only can play 5 or 6 adventure in this place. Because they close at 6 PM, very short time.

name: user_7099
review: A wonderful place for family with Kids to visit and enjoy all the fun the theme parks has to offer for visitors.

name: user_7101
review: Great fun. Bought the fast pass. It was hard to part with the 100, but when we were walking past the long queues, it felt worth every cent

name: user_7102
review: The second Universal Studios in life Personally, I feel that Singapore has too few themes and can be completed in one day. But I still like it very much and may want to play again in a few years

name: user_7103
review: Was here 11 years ago, hasn't gotten any better. Very long queues, from 1-2 hours waiting time. Reached 3 attractions at 17:10 and arrived at 11:15 It won't be a 3 day trip to Universal studio, not worth the price of 82sgd for an adult when you spend 3/4 of the day queuing..

name: user_7109
review: It's less crowded than Japan, so it's less stressful. It's fun because there are rides that don't exist in Japan.

name: user_7112
review: Going in peak season in June, so crowded , long queue for any ride . You will feel not good at all after waiting 2hr although some rides is really interesting . 2.5 hr for a ride then you will wanna to go home. These rides must to try: Mummy, Transformer, Capony but long queue so it's better to buy Express ticket in peak season unless you may feel sick on waiting . Another option is always available is 4D film.

name: user_7114
review: it awakens my inner child. i didnt know i was able to scream just because i saw an elmo mascot hajajaha and transformer ride is a must see!

name: user_7115
review: This place was in my bucket list for long and I am glad that I could visit it. The rides were a surreal experience. Life like interactions with Transformers and Minions was icing on the cake. I was sure not to miss out the ice creams and some souvenirs. For sure, I will be back again with my family next time.

name: user_7116
review: The player waited a long time. cylon / human / transformer / mummy Even if you have an express card, you might have to wait a while. But it's fun even if it's only for two minutes per round, haha. Lockers are free to rent, but for a limited time. When you're done playing, come take them out and rent a new one. Sherk 4D is fun. The air conditioning is cool too. Sesame can sit and chill. Rafting: If you bring a raincoat from Thailand, it will be a lot cheaper than buying it there. If you don't play the rides, there are many shows to watch. Restaurants are expensive and water is expensive. If you don't want to waste money, you can carry a water bottle and refill it inside. When I went to the food court at Jurassic, it was closed, which was a pity. It is recommended to buy tickets online. Cheaper than the entrance Use the barcode to scan in. P.S. 2024 there will be a new minion land zone opening as well.

name: user_7117
review: Amazing, but relatively small than what I'd expected. Loved all the theme rides and coasters. Definitely you need an express pass or you'll end up going to just one or two rides in the whole day

name: user_7118
review: This is crazy, really cool From space planning, design, decoration Made very interesting really amazing An unforgettable experience with friends Unfortunately, I captured very few moments there Because I was too excited to try the various rides there I have tried 14 rides and attractions That's not all because there isn't enough time, there are some who aren't interested, and There are still several rides there that are closed, either repaired or not yet finished There are several rides there where luggage must go into a locker which is 90 minutes free. If more than that, pay a few dollars depending on the length. My advice is to change lockers every 90 minutes to get free ones There are indeed some adrenaline-pumping rides, but not all of them But the point is it's all cool There are several zone themes there There are Jurassic, Transformers, Animation World, etc There are regular tickets for around 1 million And around 3 million are executives Later, at each vehicle the queue lines will be differentiated The queue could be up to 10-40 minutes at that time, because I wasn't there during the holidays and it wasn't the weekend So it's still really good If I'm not mistaken, it opens from 10 am to 7 pm local time The parking area is very spacious, it's downstairs In my opinion... this is a must try once in your life It's truly an unforgettable experience Good luck for the future

name: user_7119
review: the place is nice so beautiful... 1 thing that we dont like was most of the food stalls dont give change... they always saying in a loud voice no change no change... especially on mels drive in the cashier is shouting very rude

name: user_7121
review: You go with you family and children so you enjoy lot

name: user_7122
review: Quite nice experience I had... Lots and lots of rides available Prices high but worth it Slow Service

name: user_7127
review: The entertainment area is diverse, wanting to go to all of it takes all day and is relatively expensive.

name: user_7129
review: The Mummy roller coaster is fun! A little thrill! Each item basically queues for more than an hour, and there are quite a lot of people

name: user_7130
review: The first time I came here, the place was very big, and the movement lines were not obvious. The service staff kindly asked for directions and gave clear instructions. Many areas of the park are being renovated.

name: user_7133
review: it was a great experience! I loved the shows, rollercoasters, dinosaur blue and the movie about Shrek and Fiona - this is a must-do!

name: user_7136
review: At about 17:30 there is only 5 mins waiting time for transformers!!!

name: user_7137
review: If you have some free time in your itinerary, this is a great place to visit. My favorite rides are The Mummy Returns roller coaster (completely indoors) and the Jurassic Park water ride. You can bring a water bottle from home with you and there are hydration stations around the park where you can refill your bottle.

name: user_7138
review: It wasn't as fancy as I thought. Even though it was Monday, there were a lot of people, the Human Battlestar Galactica attraction was out of order, so it was delayed, and the free locker room time expired, so I put cash in the locker and almost couldn't find my luggage. Fortunately, the staff was flexible enough to get over it, but I ended up having a not-so-pleasant experience.

name: user_7143
review: Weather is a bit too hot at this time.

name: user_7144
review: Currently, I think Disneyland is more fun, maybe because there are so many people and the opening hours are short (11:00-18:00), and some parks are still under construction.

name: user_7150
review: Rides are thrilling and fun but major problem is the operating time which is very short 11am to 6pm,so its best to have express pass otherwise you cannot ride more than 3-4 rides due to hot climate and time constraint. I went there on weekdays, and most of the eating places were closed, and the queues were very long with waiting times of 30-120 min, which is so much frustrating for a maximum of 2-3 min ride...

name: user_7152
review: USS, has been a great fun amusement for all ages, for the fun and thrill seekers. Rides indoor and outdoor, shows and performances. There are even fast-food restaurants which you could'nt find outside USS. If they could extend their timing and close at 9pm, currently 9am -7pm. They will operate during Halloween Night which falls on October. During this period you could find themes haunted houses, characters and performances. Afterall worth the money.

name: user_7155
review: Sadly, not enough time and some ventures were closed

name: user_7158
review: A very awesome place for young kids and adults. There are many rides in this theme park. This theme park has four sections: 1. Rides 2. Shopping 3. Sea aquarium 4.Sentosa Resort There are many good rides in this place. But you might not want to go on that big roller coaster because many people will get dizzy. It is so dangerous for small kids to ride this. If you want to know about all the rides. You can directly go to sentosa world resorts website. Sea aquarium was very good and clean maintained. As there were many species to see. You might have to spend your time so short on one thing.

name: user_7160
review: Fun with the rides even with the rain lots of photos

name: user_7162
review: One of the most adventurous and beautiful theme parks in the world. Waiting time will be a bit longer. Install Universal studios Singapore and Plan the rides before hand

name: user_7163
review: It was ok. Queuing to get in was not great. If youre staying on Sentosa Island then I guess its worth it for something to do but I wouldnt travel from Singapore for it. Park tickets werent too bad but expect to pay a fortune for food & drinks (it was expected as its a theme park). Was surprised that after a certain period (20 minutes I think) you then need to start paying for lockers which Ive never experienced before and obviously as you will be queuing for rides then it will cost you extra. On the whole an ok day but wouldnt rush back.

name: user_7165
review: Each rides will take you 2hours falling in line poor universal studios

name: user_7168
review: Had a great time at the Universal Studios!

name: user_7169
review: The atmosphere is beautiful. Many rides and supporting facilities. For those who are thirsty, there is water ready to drink anywhere. Just be ready. Just wait in line

name: user_7171
review: In comparison to my first experience in USS 10 years ago, the park is less crowded now even it was during weekend. It means less waiting time for each ride, but it's still highly recommended to purchase the Express pass for a more pleasant experience. It's also better to purchase entry ticket in advance on website so no waiting time to enter the park. It was raining half of the day but it didn't stop us to have fun. Some rides were closed during the rain, but some were still available. Best to prepare disposable raining coat from home for the Jurassic World ride or in case of raining, so no need to buy from the shop inside. For Muslims, there are variety of Halal food available and praying room inside the park.

name: user_7174
review: Definitely not worth the price. I went there on the 15th June at around 10.30 a.m. Best to arrive early to make most of it. I was able to try 12 rides out of 15 without an express ticket. The wait time was about 15-30 mnts for most rides but closer to an hour for the transformers ride. Almost all the rides were roller coasters but it was somewhat enjoyable. Purchase tickets in advance via klook that way you can save so much time. Waterworld was shut down entirely and the much awaited Transformers meet and greet was cancelled off without notice.

name: user_7175
review: Some attractions are deceiving, the wait before the attractions can be more than an hour. Not recommended for small children and the elderly. Think before entering.

name: user_7177
review: You have to get the express pass or the wait is almost unbearable. Surprisingly, food was good.

name: user_7178
review: We have lots of fun. So many heart-throbbing rides and many more activities are there. And wait time is depend upon crowd.

name: user_7183
review: Height restrictions for toddlers, book tickets in advance, and buy express pass for hassle free and wait free ride times.

name: user_7188
review: Changing my rating from 5 stars to 3. It seems like the owner really hasn't been keept up... Animatronic mummies in The Mummy were only working on the left side, the 3D (4D) video in The Transformers rice where unfocused, especially on the larger screens, the cafe at Jurassic Park was closed without notice, Waterworld is permanently (?) closed... It's sad really.

name: user_7192
review: I really enjoyed this place but I was extremely devastated by the waiting time of the transformers ride. I waited about 2 hours and there was still a long path ahead. I think I saw more people come out than go in for the ride. It felt very unprofessional and what about the elderly? This place is good but their prices are exorbitant and they charge more for express rides to get to rides faster but that queue is also pretty long. Waiting a long time for rides that are 5 to 10 minutes or even less is very time consuming. Now coming to the parts I did enjoy, the mummy ride was incredible. It was an indoor roller coaster ride. I liked the details put into the ride from the mummy movies. It would have been 5 stars if the queue was significantly shorter. Recommended if you want to experience this place and you can buy the express tickets. If not, it is pretty much impossible to explore most of the rides. If we wait too long for one ride, we can't explore the others.

name: user_7193
review: One day is sufficient for this theme park. It's not as big as others but I liked that. Food outlets good and not too crowded. Queues for rides were the usual 20-40 mins even with express pass. Jurassic Park rapids ride was fun and not scary so I enjoyed that. Would be improved with places to sit outdoors in the shade.

name: user_7195
review: The place seemed run down. Needs a good paint. Loads of construction going on. Poor food choices. Would recommend investing in a express pass

name: user_7197
review: Good place to visit ! With your special one, or family.. if you wish to play all, you need go on weekdays.. BIG NO for weekend..

name: user_7199
review: When we arrived it was raining, so many rides were closed. We went to look at the Van Gogh exposition during that time. When we came out, many rides were still closed. After 3pm the rides were opening, so we rushed to them. Lucky we had the express pass, so we succeeded in doing many, without it, we would never have succeeded in doing most of them as without the express pass, the lines were sometimes far over 1 hour per ride. The rides itself were really exciting and fun. For many rides, you need to put your bags in lockers, at first I felt uncomfortable putting my phone and money etc in the lockers, but all went well. With the express pass, we also could get out belongings out in time, as after 40 minutes, the locker is payable. Overall we had a good time and my son loved it a lot.

name: user_7200
review: A handful of attractions were under maintenance, and many rides waited long, but my kids and I had fun!!

name: user_7203
review: We visited in June 2023. Two zones are completely closed. Further, the waterworld show and all are closed. Also, the express pass is not valid for all rides now. Do not visit till December 2024.

name: user_7204
review: Really busy area I just buying priority tickets so you dont wait

name: user_7205
review: Giving 1 star because the second time I came back, the service quality was even worse. The only specialty is queuing. You will be deceived when you look at the game list here and decide to buy tickets. In fact, the opening hours are extremely short, the service capacity is too low compared to the number of customers, so at most one person can only play 3-4 games. It's not worth spending 1-2 hours in line just to experience the game for 10 minutes. The staff is both lacking and unable to assist guests at all. Coming here costs money to buy tickets and buy miscellaneous items. In general, time is better spent on other activities.

name: user_7209
review: It wasn't that big, and it was the perfect size to take elementary school and kindergarten children around. The longest waiting time for the attraction is 60-90 minutes, which is acceptable. The app lets you know the waiting time in real time, so you can travel more efficiently.

name: user_7214
review: Every ride waiting time very high

name: user_7220
review: Awesome place. Surely expensive, but worth the money you spend for a ticket. You can ride any available ride as many times as you want. And there are two types of queues; a general audience, an express audience. The express tickets allow you to get to the rides faster and henceforth you have to pay an additional amount for each ride. Food is surprisingly not very expensive, and is really good. Definitely a must visit if ever in Singapore.

name: user_7221
review: Worth of visited if this is your first time to come to Singapore, i would like to recommend you to spend your whole day here! And also better to come on weekday than weekend on weekend mostly of arena took 20-45 minutes waited, that really wasting your time. If you are Indonesian you can book ticket in advance at Traveloka. Definitely will come back in future

name: user_7222
review: Half of attractions under construction or not available, and food quality is low. Significantly poorer as a comparison to the visit 6 years ago.

name: user_7224
review: No one can miss this place but be ready to pay extra to save time in long queues like buy express vip pass

name: user_7229
review: Better to get Express Pass...

name: user_7231
review: went there on saturday, and i was pregnant. it was so crowded. suggest to avoid weekend, or if you are going during weekend, get ready with express pass. also, if you are pregnant, save ur money and go next time. most of the ride is not suitable for pregnant ladies.

name: user_7237
review: USS has really exciting and thrilling rides! My favourite would be the Cyclon ride on Battlestar Galatica!! Has water coolers so people can bring their own bottles to refill instead of buying drinks which may be costly!! Has many pop up stands with courteous staff who will do everything to cater to your needs !

name: user_7245
review: Amusement park which we quickly tour. Lots of roller coasters with more or less sensations. 11 a.m. / 6 p.m., so people arrive after noon. 57 euros entry at the daily rate. For the exotic and if you really like it.

name: user_7246
review: Amazing rides and great experience for a fun filled family trip. Must visit place during Singapore visit. It takes a day to complete all attractions, plan accorded travel light as you are supposed to go empty hand for most rides.

name: user_2786
review: Fun but lot can be done for crowd management.

name: user_7249
review: Wooowww...... amazing trip this location is so beautiful you go Singapore must watch n enjoy this don't miss it guys ThankYou @universal studios Singapore

name: user_7252
review: I'm spoiled as I've been to Orlando Florida many times. This park is tiny and is spoiled by queue jumping by large groups who hold the line at each ride and allow their group to push towards the front, the staff don't stop them. If you've been to California or Florida then you will be disappointed with this park, but if this is your first Universal trip and you happen to already be in Singapore then it's worth a visit.

name: user_7253
review: Lots of adventurous rides. List of rides one must try Human vs clones (grey one) is the most thrilling one Human vs clones (red) is a bit easier. Transformer is a 4D ride The mummy Space one is for kids, one can take kids there. Hidden treasure again for kids. Overall a full day is required here to try all the rides. Get in early to try all the possible rides

name: user_7255
review: Just leave your backpacks at home. On Galactica you are not even allowed to take your cell phone with you, no wallet or anything. Everything must be included. The lockers are free for 40 minutes only. Afterwards you have to pay a fine of four Singapore dollars. A little further away, when the mummy returns, the lockers are free for 60 minutes and later even for 90 minutes. You can even take your cell phone with you on the roller coaster. But neither are backpacks. When the mummy returns there is a single line. But if it is too full it will also be closed. I was there when the park opened and managed to ride Galactica seven times and the Mummy six times. After that the park became so full that queuing was no longer fun. I also really liked the 4D animation Shrek... all in all a very nicely laid out park but quite small. No comparison to Euro Disney Europapark or Parque Aventura in Spain... If you decide early, you can get cheaper tickets from some providers. You can also book at the park on the day itself

name: user_7257
review: we have a wonderful time but the lines are so long that average is around 30 minutes to 1 hour. if you the extra cash, go for the express which is double the value. the time given which is only 7 hours is not long enough to see all the attractions. so if you wanna really enjoy all of it, RUN!

name: user_7258
review: Our first and best experience! The weather is mad hot and we brought along our own water as water is super expensive inside.. everything was basically expensive inside. My kids had a fantastic time although my youngest couldnt sit for many rides as shes still too small.

name: user_7263
review: Don't missed the chance to visit and explore USS when it's your first time in Singapore. Absolutely amazing! I highly recommend to book your ticket in advance to avoid the queue lines. The park will open at 11 am and closes at 7 pm or rather check the timeslot on their official website. Taking monorail, cable car and grab are the most easiest way to get to USS. Take the whole day tour to enjoy & experience USS, ride all the rides! Test your adrenaline rush and conquer your fear upon riding the cyclone rollercoaster! the most craziest one! Enjoy and have fun!

name: user_7264
review: Had lots of fun at USS! I went during the Singapore school holidays. Even though I didnt buy the express tickets, the queues were not as long as I expected and the longest I had to queue for was only 45min. The rest of the queues were much better and only took around 5-15min! Towards the end, at around 4pm, most of the people had left and there was barely any queues. Even though waterworld was not open, there was still a decent number of rides I could go on. I really enjoyed the roller coasters! For those tho like extreme rides, they are definitely recommended. But for those who are ok with a bit of extreme, but not too much, Mummy is a perfect ride. But I dont recommend Mummy to those who are scared of the dark. Transformers is a really thrilling 3D ride which is suitable for all ages. It is not scary but mainly exciting. Everyone should try transformers! As for Enchanted Airways I think is it alright for ages 7 and above. It honestly depends on how brave your child is It is actually a mini roller coaster and its super fun! I really enjoyed Canopy Flyer too! You can choose to either sit facing forwards or going backwards. The view is really nice from up there and I recommend to everyone! Lastly, there is the Jurassic water ride . (Im not sure what its called) A super thrilling and exciting ride where you are seated with a few other people in this circle like boat. Then, you will go down a river with occasional waterfalls, small drop-downs and dinosaurs which spray water at you! At the very last part, there is a pretty big drop that will get everyone soaked!! (If you want to go on this ride but you do not want to get wet, I recommend bringing your own raincoat! Because the raincoats they sell there are super expensive at 5SGD each!!) I would definitely recommend eating outside of USS (for example at the malaysian food centre) because the food and drinks inside USS are really expensive! One small bottle of drinking water can be 4SGD and one cup of slushee was around 8-12SGD Lets not talk about how expensive the food was too. The staff were really friendly overall but there was one time when it was my turn to go on the Human roller coaster, the staff which helps scan our pockets was not so friendly. After she had scanned my pockets, I kindly asked her if I could sit at the last row but she looked irritated and just nodded her head. The second time I went on Human, I also asked if I could sit at the last row again. This time, the lady literally rolled her eyes at me and didnt even reply me. I was super disappointed and really annoyed at her behavior. After that, I didnt want to go on Human again because of that staff. But overall, the rest of the staff were friendly and helpful! Another recommendation I have for those who have not visited before is to arrive about an hour before the park opens. This way, you can quickly queue at the gate and you would be one of the first few people to enter the park. Then you can quickly rush to the rides so that you would not have to queue so much at the beginning. Overall, I had a really great time at USS. I definitely recommend coming here. If you are afraid that there would be many people, I think you should really get the express unlimited tickets. You would be able to go on the rides many more times. :)

name: user_7267
review: Loved the place, those who love the thrilling rides are must go. I bought an express ticket which helped in less waiting time and short queues due to which I enjoyed more rides in less time.

name: user_7268
review: Please note post COVID timings have changed and if you plan to cover universal in a day please opt for priority ticket for sure.

name: user_7270
review: Wooow a fun park. Must visit ones in lifetime

name: user_7273
review: Went here during peak season (school holiday in Singapore) so the park was really packed. We have to wait almost half an hour just to enter the park itself, and queueing for at least 1 hour for each attraction. But the park & attraction are reallg nice. Many food options, and the facilities are great.

name: user_7275
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an exhilarating theme park that offers a thrilling experience for all ages. From exciting rides and immersive shows to themed areas and beloved characters, it's a haven for entertainment enthusiasts. The attention to detail and overall atmosphere make it a must-visit attraction in Singapore.

name: user_7277
review: The place is spacious, clean and well maintained. To have a holiday with family

name: user_7281
review: Best place to feel your kids the best place to bring kids and have fun with all those games and and rides ith a lot of character and fun place to go

name: user_7283
review: Incredible, like each and every one of the Universal parks. A much smaller park than the namesake in Orlando. Fewer people but opening later and closing earlier than in Orlando

name: user_7286
review: Awesome park! I've been here 2 times, yeah of course it's kinda crowded, but it's SUPER FUN!

name: user_7287
review: Best place in Singapore. The rides here are too amazing. The mummy ride. The rolar coaster. The transformer ride. This are one of the best rides. The only thing is if you are visiting. Go for express ticket. Or else stand hours in the line. For your turn.

name: user_7289
review: It's really busy, the rides are fun, but the smell of the armpits is already at a high level... it's better if you want to come here, bring inhealer

name: user_7292
review: My visit to universal was awesome. I didnt had to wait much to enter as I was attending a private event, however there were queues for the rides. Overall great place to hangout with friends and colleagues. Had a lovely experience.

name: user_7293
review: Some of the best rides I've ever experienced. Definitely recommend rollar coster rides like: Revenge Of The Mummy and Cylon for brave souls who really want to challenge themselves to more intense rides

name: user_7294
review: Fun and interactive, but the que is very long, better but the express ticket if you go on holidays or weekends..

name: user_7299
review: 3rd time coming here. It was pretty fun, the same as before. No more madagascar ride now. They're currently building the minion ride, which is expected to open in 2024. Quite a small park compared to overseas. Only need maximum 1 day to complete all the rides.

name: user_7301
review: Extremely overcrowded. Each attraction had a minimum waiting time of 45 minutes, some an hour or more. The Express Pass lane was equally busy for most of the larger rides. Not worth the price, especially when you come with a small child (ours is 2)

name: user_7302
review: When entering, there is order amidst chaos. The employees do not form a line, but the line starts to form where someone starts to stand. If you are good at guessing and lining up, you can get in quickly without having to go 30 minutes early. Definitely Transformers, Mummy Jurassic, and Cyclone? Get on Human first. The moment I glance at it and think it's not much, I can't ride it. For Human and Cyclone, ride after riding the Jurassic Transformer Mummy. The line was already long, so while I was waiting, the others were late. I think TranceMummyJurassicHumanCyclone are good.

name: user_7304
review: Brought my little one to Universal Studios Singapore on a weekend and we managed to take amazing photos. I am thankful that USS Is child friendly and I could push her pram through the whole park. Will revisit again.

name: user_7307
review: There are a lot of activities to do and see for both adults and for kids. Good facilities along all the park, well designed and good entertainment. The kids are all excited trying all the different rides but my favourites are always the Mummy Roller Coaster Ride. Beautiful to see all the light when is darker in the evening. All the staff was friendly. However, it can get too hot during the day in this weather.

name: user_7311
review: There were a lot of people but it was fun! Universal Singapore is small and crowded, so I heard a review saying you didn't need to buy the Magic Express, so I just went there and there were a lot of people If you have a tight schedule, be sure to buy it..

name: user_7313
review: Very busy with long wait times for short rides. Spend the money and get express pass or don't bother going at all. Would not return or recommend to family and friends.

name: user_7317
review: It's small so there aren't many attractions, but you can still enjoy it. If a squall is about to fall, you won't be able to ride any of the outdoor attractions at once, but if you go right after the rain returns, you can ride the attractions that usually have long waits in a short time (lol) If you don't want to ride with your companion, you can enter as a single rider and ride without having to wait too long.

name: user_7320
review: If you come here, I suggest you buy a VIP pass so you don't have to queue for a long time, because the place is large and there are lots of attractions, it's a shame if you run out of time just queue.

name: user_7323
review: Very very good place to visit One of the best cities that is hygienic and very near country Definitely recommend it

name: user_7325
review: Recommend to get an express pass. There are 2 options for express pass 1. One time and 2. Unlimited. Reach as soon as the park opens for spending quality time at all rides. Top rides - Transformers, Canopy, Rapids Adventure, Mummy roller coaster.

name: user_6271
review: Universal Studios is not bad, suitable for bringing children to play

name: user_7328
review: Very nice experience although we bought the express and queued

name: user_7336
review: Its a great place to have fun with friends if youre thrill seekers. The rides are fun and thrilling although you have a few chill rides options if you visit with children. You may spend most of your time queuing if you go on weekends so I dont really recommend going there on weekends or public holidays, unless you buy an express ticket for a hefty price. Definitely recommend on weekdays though. In the evening, you can even repeatedly catch rides with normally long queues such as mummy or battlestar galactica. Go there on weekdays.

name: user_7337
review: Fun times at USS, weather is crazy hot.

name: user_7338
review: Where is the option of 0 stars whole day I couldn't do a single ride I don't recommend wasting time here

name: user_7339
review: Not worth the hype, to much crowd, waste of time in long queues, express pass to costly and rate keeps on increasing as day passes. SUGGEST TO BUY EXPRESS PASS IN ADVANCE IF YOU CAN AFFORD.

name: user_7341
review: Very very very crowded, buy only express tickets , with normal tickets it's just a waste of time, they should learn somethings from Abu dabi Warner brothers theme park

name: user_7342
review: Not as lively and exciting as it used to be. The waterworkd show is closed as well as the Madagascar ride and area. We were there on a Friday and it was packed. Unfortunately they close rides if there is rain and thunder so be prepared for that.

name: user_7343
review: I recently had the opportunity to visit Universal Studios Singapore, and I must say, it was an absolutely incredible experience. From the moment I stepped foot into the park, I was transported into a world of magic and wonder. Universal Studios Singapore truly lives up to its reputation as one of the most exciting theme parks in the world. First and foremost, the park's attention to detail is simply astounding. Every corner of Universal Studios Singapore is meticulously designed to recreate the iconic movie sets and bring them to life. The themed areas, such as Hollywood, New York, and Ancient Egypt, are so immersive that you feel like you're actually in those places. The park's vibrant atmosphere and beautifully landscaped surroundings add to the overall charm. The rides at Universal Studios Singapore are nothing short of thrilling. From heart-pounding roller coasters like Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon and Revenge of the Mummy, to family-friendly adventures like Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure and Transformers: The Ride, there is something for everyone. The attention to detail in each attraction is remarkable, making the experience even more enjoyable. One of the highlights of my visit was the spectacular live shows. The Waterworld show, in particular, left me in awe with its breathtaking stunts and special effects. The performers were incredibly talented, and the entire production was a true spectacle. The other shows, such as the Hollywood Dreams Parade and the Sesame Street Stage Shows, were equally entertaining and showcased the park's commitment to providing diverse and high-quality entertainment for all ages. Food and dining options in Universal Studios Singapore were impressive as well. There is a wide range of cuisines available, from local Singaporean delights to international favorites. I particularly enjoyed the themed restaurants that provided an immersive dining experience, such as the Jurassic Park-themed restaurant. The quality of the food was excellent, and the service was friendly and efficient. Universal Studios Singapore also caters to families with young children. There are numerous attractions and shows designed specifically for kids, including the adorable Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase and the Shrek 4-D Adventure. The park's commitment to providing a safe and enjoyable experience for families is commendable. In terms of operations and organization, Universal Studios Singapore excelled. The park was clean, well-maintained, and the staff members were friendly and helpful. The queue management system was efficient, minimizing waiting times and maximizing enjoyment. The overall experience was seamless and stress-free. In conclusion, Universal Studios Singapore is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a thrilling and unforgettable adventure. The park's attention to detail, incredible rides, spectacular shows, and diverse dining options make it a truly world-class theme park. Whether you're a movie buff, an adrenaline junkie, or a family looking for fun, Universal Studios Singapore has something for everyone. I cannot recommend it highly enough, and I can't wait to return for another magical experience.

name: user_7344
review: Must do Transformers Ride, Mummy Ride, Jurassic world ride.

name: user_7345
review: Open too late, close too early, weather too hot, line too long, overall an experience to forget...

name: user_7346
review: All rides are fantastic out of the world

name: user_7350
review: Approx 5k per person for ticket and additional 5k per person for Express pass . With express pass we could manage only 10 to 12 rides out of 15 main attractions. Too much crowd and ques. Buy express before only to avoid wastage of time inside.

name: user_7352
review: For better experience of this place, buy express ticket in advance or else one may have to wait hours to play any rides

name: user_7359
review: This place has seriously gone downhills in recent times. With an entire section under renovation for the next year, the size of the park is equivalent to Malaysias legoland. Perhaps even smaller. A lot of the shows arent even available. The ticket price is not justified. Most of the park staff seem pretty rude and makes me feel like they do not want to even be working there. Perhaps the park is not paying them enough. I do feel like theres a lot of cost cutting everywhere. I recommend spending your time and money at other parts of Sentosa. Universal Studio Singapore is not worth it. A real shame.

name: user_7363
review: Unfortunately some attractions were closed but I'm already dying to go back.

name: user_7367
review: The park was a good timepass. Unfortunately, you spend more time in the queues than for the rides. The express pass almost doubles the cost. Nonetheless I would highly recommend it if you are visiting Singapore with a 11 kid. USS is not as big as the LA one, still big enough for 1 day. It was crowded on a weekday, even though Singapore school vacation had not started. So plan your visit accordingly.

name: user_7369
review: Amazing rides! I'd suggest everyone not to wait in the queue for the transformer ride. Move straight to the roller coasters Human and Cylone or the Revenge of the mummy ride! Later you can come back to the transformer as the waiting time would be less. Jurassic park zone also has some good rides but make sure you keep rain wear along with you.

name: user_7371
review: The park is not big, but you dont have to queue up like crazy like Japan Universal, but the weather is too hot... Walking in the park, you can smell the smell of sweat...

name: user_7374
review: Lots of fun... I highly recommend buying the express pass. Regular tix S82 each, unlimited express pass was another S100 each... but worth every penny!! Wait time for rides with express pass was 10-15 minutes vs. 45-90 minutes!! Splurge and just buy the express pass. Otherwise, you may not be able to enjoy all the rides. This park opens at 11 am and closes at 6 pm!! We also bought our tickets online, so no waiting at the park. When we realized that express passes were the way to go, we found out you can buy them at any of their retail stores! Also recommend the honeydew ice cream with fruity Pebbles toppng.... so yummy!!

name: user_7376
review: Lots of activities for children and adults. One full day have to spend. Best ride is Transformers ... Family visit place Buy entry ticket and express pass also.

name: user_7379
review: I visited early and was in the front row during the open run, so Puss in Boots came and made me shout left and right and gave the express ticket to the person who shouted the best on the winning side. Yes, of course, I took it and wrote it down. I think there will be plenty of time when I arrive at the Universal entrance around 10:30. And I went on Sunday

name: user_7381
review: Awesome place to have fun, rides are great and the attention to detail is amazing. Recommend not to go during public holidays or weekends as it gets really crowded. Purchase the express pass if you cant make it any other time, it will save you a lot of hassles.

name: user_7382
review: Definitely a place that is worthwhile to go if you are travelling to Singapore for sightseeing, or if you want to spend the day with friends and family for an enjoyable time. I would recommend spending an entire day here to fully enjoy the USS experience. The main highlights of the theme park are the roller coaster rides, such as the Mummy, Cylon and Enchanted Airways. The other rides are also enjoyable and friendly for those who have a fear of roller coasters like me, such as the Transformers Ride, the Sci Fi accelerator Adventure, as well as the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure.

name: user_7383
review: Buy Santosa express unlimited ride pass . Circle in anti-clockwise direction to access adventure rides and show 1st . Pls do home work to understand rides and shows . Plan and than go to get most out of it . Avoid treasure hunt , it is time killer and utter waste , this ride should not be there . For u veggies . There is options for Samosa and Veg Biryani opposite Ancient Egypt . Two roller coaster are excellent and worth experience. Reach 30 mins before park opens up to be in que . Unlimited Express pass get your band before entering theme park .

name: user_7386
review: half the attractions were closed it looks half finished. definitely buy the fast track passes.

name: user_7387
review: You have to queue for a long time for each game and the variety of games is not really high, many shops are not open. Lower than expectations

name: user_7390
review: Nice to visit on weekdays. If you have limited time buy an express ride ticket.. within 23, hrs you finished your rides with lots of enjoyment.

name: user_7401
review: Quickly fading out as a must-visit destination. Still has its magic but its aging facility and hardly thrilling shows are not what it used to be - or what the many beloved brands and franchises set out to be. The pandemic's shadow is still lingering. Express ticket is almost necessary if you don't want to melt in the heat with agonising amount of wait time.

name: user_7408
review: I recently visited Universal Studios at Sentosa Island and was blown away by the latest features and attractions. I thoroughly enjoyed the rides - Jurassic park adventure. Shrek 4-d and not to forget the adrenaline pumping Galactica roller coaster. My kids loved the Transformers and the Minion land. I should applaud the park staff who ensure all the areas were well-maintaned. I will definitely make another trip to Universal Studios for the dine-in experience.

name: user_7409
review: Nice Universal movie themed games. Suitable for all ages

name: user_7411
review: Must visit place in Singapore. We need full day to cover maximum attractions. Well maintained. King queues are boring but worth waiting. Food options are less once we moved inside near Disney land area. Egyptian ride is too hyped. It could have been beeter designed. Transformer ride will make any human being excited even if they have not watched this flim series. But we had to wait for 90 minutes in a queue. Similarly long queues for roller coaster will eat you time. So one has to move to the last attractions quickly and come back to main attractions in the evening. A dance show was so great It is ok for kids. We did not have time to visit Jurassic park. The food court outside the Universal studio is pocket friendly and have lot of options. We wanted to cendol, the dessert but disappointed.

name: user_7413
review: This is one of the most amazing theme park.. Would recommend to buy express pass before going there.The rides are very enjoyable. A must visit place if going to Singapore .

name: user_7415
review: Nice place to visit if u like adventure rides, suggest to pay premium pass to skip queues for rides so that can cover a lot in a day

name: user_7416
review: USS is a good place to visit in Singapore. I've been there twice, once for Halloween Horror Night, and it was amazing! During Halloween, the park turns into a spooky wonderland with haunted houses and scary zones. The actors did a fantastic job at scaring people, and I had a blast. If you enjoy being scared and having a great time, I highly recommend going to USS during Halloween. It's an exciting experience that you don't want to miss!

name: user_7417
review: The fast pass is worth it. As of May 2023, 2 of the worlds are closed but it is still worth going at least one

name: user_7418
review: It was my first visit to Universal, and even though it was small, I wasn't able to see everything. (I couldn't even see the part with Shrek and Puss in Boots) The waiting time for the rides was quite long. I definitely recommend purchasing the express ticket to save time and ride all the rides at least once. For reference, I went on a Friday and there were a lot of people. There is a lot of waiting time at the beginning, but if you go later, the waiting time will be 10 minutes, so try something else first.

name: user_7420
review: Must-visit fun park in Singapore

name: user_7422
review: skip this if you have been to any foreighn parks like disney or universal or WB anywhere. service is poor rides are very average

name: user_7425
review: Great place for both kids and adults. The park was quite big and very clean, the attractions were great, loved the transformers. We came on a holiday term and rainy day, so either long queue or temporary closed attractions, but after rain the queue was actually ok and we managed to see most of them. Definitely will visit again one day we visit Singapore.

name: user_7426
review: If you go when it opens in the morning, there won't be much of a wait. If you are alone, you will be able to ride faster. But it's very hot in Singapore. Please plan your schedule keeping in mind that you will get tired quickly. The only place to rest is the Starbucks near the entrance.

name: user_7428
review: Don't waste your time!!

name: user_7429
review: While theres no waiting to enter universal studios, theres extremely long waiting time for individual attractions and rides. I strongly recommend to buy the express pass if its affordable to save unnecessary hours waiting in lines.

name: user_7430
review: Express pass is must

name: user_7431
review: Waste of time.. they opens at 11am and closes at 6pm / by the time we complete three attractions 4 to 5 hours over .. every where 90min to 120min wait time.. If you have money take express entry that may help..

name: user_7432
review: It is recommended to wait 1-2 hours before opening because the queue is very long. When you get to the fence, sit and wait for the exact same place you entered because if you don't notice, just a moment before opening 1 hour, the queue will be very long.

name: user_7436
review: Kids loved this. Worth a visit during non school holidays and on weekdays if you want to avoid long queues and not pay for express pass.

name: user_7437
review: Come at 11.30 because operating hours are only from 11.00 to 18.00. 30 minutes late because the queue to enter the train was very long. There you can only ride 4 rides because you have to queue for 1.5-2 hours per ride. Better don't go there on a public holiday. Not worth it.

name: user_7440
review: There are always some attractions that are closed, so travelers should be prepared. It's smaller than USJ, so you can enjoy it even if you enter in the afternoon.

name: user_7443
review: One of the Best memories in my life Roller coasters were amazingly thrilling Totally worth !!! We had to buy Express passes because of long queues.

name: user_7444
review: Good place for theme park but hot and humid during day time

name: user_7445
review: Great Experience! Express Pass is better because queues is too long

name: user_7446
review: Had an amazing time. Queues for the rides can be long though depending on how busy it is so get there early if you want to try all the rides.

name: user_7447
review: Hello Friends Chinese Newyear 2021. Me and my friend planned to chill the CNY holidays we discuss to go Universal studios Sentosa such a nice place to visit & chill many photo shoot that day me and my friend take games also very interesting and joyful my favorite game is Egypt mummy ride and Transformer.Roller coaster very scary and worthful for the money,that day lion dance also perform there looking so good( CNY year of Tiger). Next day my friend and me visit the sea aquarium. Many types of fishes we saw place so nice. In future i plan oneday my family take to sentosa

name: user_7448
review: A must visit for all the adventure lovers. There are 4 amazing rides - Cylone, Human, Mummy (amazing experience), transformers. Apart from this, the Shrek 4D adventure movie is also good. Overall, a great experience.

name: user_7449
review: I'm seriously not recommending this place, this has just become a business. First of all no matter which pass you buy, You will not enjoy, because almost every ride has a waiting of nearly 1 to 2 hours minimum. Secondly if it rains which is very common in Singapore, the money you spent is a total waste. As they shut all the rides. They have locker system, which they give for 40 mins free, but since every ride has a waiting of nearly 2 hours. You end up paying the fees after 40 mins. Which makes no sense. Rides aren't that great. The one's that are mostly shut all time. If the park is flooded like this, none can enjoy. A sheer waste of money. There are barely any cafes serving veg options.

name: user_7450
review: I have been here for 2 times now and I really enjoy my experience here, it is amazing to see such fun expeirence created from movies and a place full of wonderful. the ride and drink are expensive but the rides are totally worthed with how much fun it is and even without fast pass it is still worth the wait as almost every ride is super fun and very thrilling. personally I really enjoy the Sci-fi and Jurassic zone in the park. The transformer ride might be my favourite for how creative it is and how they use 3d movie mixing with real assets. and for the Jurassic zone the ride there is also a lot of fun and good if you need to get a break from the heat. just know that you can get very wet easily. Overall it is an amazing and thrilling park to go and have fun with either friends or family

name: user_7451
review: It was an amazing experience at Universal Studios. The ambience and rides were amazingly fun. Please do check out their 3d rides it was mindblowing.

name: user_7453
review: The amusement facilities were out of order and the queues took a long time. The only announcement was to advise tourists to experience other facilities first. Please follow the instructions of the staff when going to the exit. As a result, the staff were hiding inside and could not guide the exit route. If you wanted to go out, you had to push forward and ask how to get out. I had no idea how long it would take, and I wasted all my time waiting in line. It was such a bad experience. I couldnt understand how an advanced country could have such a bad crisis management model.

name: user_7455
review: Not much thrills except a few(Cyclon,Human) But overall nice ambience

name: user_7457
review: Theres something lacking cant say what is it but the area surrounding it seems abandoned for some reason. Hoping they could renovate it again. Used the board walk from Vivo City but the automated walkways were broken so had to walk in humid air.

name: user_7461
review: Very good and well organized amusement park. Good rides but long waiting lines. Well with a visit.

name: user_7462
review: The attractions were great and the lights camera action was fantastic too.

name: user_7463
review: Best place to play with your family and your friends

name: user_7464
review: Perfect experience. Need one full day to complete all the rides. Main attraction include Mummy, Human, Cylon, Light Camera Action all roller coaster riders, 4 D movie. Take left and start the rides as the crowd will be moving towards right from entrance. This will avoid much queue for the initial rides

name: user_7466
review: Nice experience. Wait times are more for each rides (approx. 50 to 80 mins).

name: user_7470
review: Good place to hang around with family. Enjoy the ride so much!

name: user_7471
review: No where else to sit and it's very hot They don't even let you sit Overall other attraction is good I forgot to edit this my phone died too was low battery

name: user_7475
review: One of the must visit spot in Singapore Its suitable for both children and adults Waiting time for adult rides - 20 mins - 2hrs For kids ride - 20 to 30mins If you are planning to visit on weekends I suggest you to opt for express entry Carry extra water bottles

name: user_7476
review: Take your children to experience it during the summer vacation. Excellent, friendly organization and every waiter was patient and efficient. But the hot weather still made the experience somewhat flawed. You can imagine how it feels to wait in line while sweating under the sun

name: user_7479
review: Very nice and true Universal Studios experience. It is a quite small park though and as we were visiting during school holidays we had to buy the express pass to be able to skip the lines and see everything within one day. I felt bad for all the youngsters waiting in line for over 90 minutes. Several rides were closed, check that before you enter.

name: user_7481
review: The park is not big and you can complete a circle in one go It was a pity that the rafting facility was closed due to weather conditions after waiting for nearly an hour. We bought tickets online in advance When you arrive at the scene, just swipe the Qrcode and enter. Not many parade performances And the performance time will be repeated Before you go, you might want to arrange the order so that it's smoother.

name: user_7484
review: Must go... make sure you buy the express pass. You will have lots of fun.

name: user_7486
review: The telecommunications network is poor, there are many mosquitoes, the park is small, the opening hours are short, and the queue time for the rides is long. I will definitely not go there again.

name: user_7487
review: Amazing experience, so much fun not only for kids but also for adults as well. One of the must-visit places in Singapore. My picks were the Transformers ride, Jurassic Park Ride, mummy ride also Shrek 4D experience.

name: user_7488
review: One of the best amusement parks in the world. Each ride is just awesome in itself which gives you thrill and great experience. The roller coasters are just amazing the the Light Camera Action show is just awesome. The place offers a full day enjoyment along with good food and picture points where you can get yourself clicked. One suggestion to everyone, start your journey here by taking left from the entrance, doing so will help you cover every ride and you'll be able to enjoy the main rides early on. (Majority take a right after entrance which keeps the waiting crowded).

name: user_7489
review: Yeh, Universal studio, I went long time ready. That day weather is good. No rain . Families and couples can see everywhere. Children are happy to go here and there. We enjoyed it a lot. But the Q is long-way one place by place.

name: user_7490
review: This place is good for adventure rides! A place to visit with full family. Though we find it smaller as compared to Universal Studio USA. When we visited waterfront and some other rides were closed, which is very disappointing. Also we realised on week day also there was minimum 20 minutes waiting, for some rides the wait time goes even for 100 minutes, so we were forced to buy purchase express line ticket. Human and Cylon rides are for those who likes the roller coaster rides. Specially the Cylon is not for faint hearted people. Return of Mummy is also very good ride. At 6'00pm the park is closed and so all the eateries inside the park. So it's bit inconvenient, specially when you need food after the tiring day you have to walk all the way to the exit gates. The Steven Spielberg show is good, but there is no seating arrangements, you have to stand for 15 minutes. It's a not bad experience, but definitely not great!

name: user_7491
review: Universal Studio, Singapore is the best place for group gathering, specially if you're first time traveller in Singapore. Among all the rides, one of the best is MUMMY... Which will give you a feeling of underground roller coaster with a story where you're a part of it... I travelled here with my sister this time, I'd like to mention, we found "Madagascar" and "Water World" was under maintenence or closed for any other reason, which we didn't find any update before. Universal should update these kind of informations at least in Facebook and Instagram... Which will help travelers to have a note. Besides, everything is superb down here.

name: user_7493
review: Be prepared for long lines, even when it's not busy. It's looking a little tired these days. Not much variety and dated rides.

name: user_7495
review: USS is one of the must visit places in Singapore. Lots of fun around. Got exciting rides and live shows. Worth for the money that we spent

name: user_7496
review: Not too long wait for rides (only the big coaster was 90 minutes wait, everything else 15 minutes). not a massive park. Can definitely do everything in one day. Outstanding attention to detail across the whole park

name: user_7497
review: Very small amusement park, the tour is quick. Some attractions were closed for work or maintenance. It's absolutely not worth the price in my opinion.

name: user_7498
review: All trips have to be queued for a long time, and the food in the park is really expensive! ! ! ! !

name: user_7500
review: USS is a theme park located in Sentosa Island with many rides, shows and attractions. USS is visited by most tourists who come to Singapore. There are many rides, amongst it Transformers ride, Revenge of Mummy, Battlestar Galactica rides are good and exciting. Weekends rush is more and the wait time for rides is more. Average wait time for above rides is 80-120 mins during the morning time and reduces by evening. If you want to cut the queues, purchase express pass for the rides. There are various restaurants within the USS and many options for both Vegetarians and Non veg.

name: user_7505
review: I have been here so many times and after so many years been back last Mar. I'm just disappointed that some attractions are now closed like the Waterworld and Madagascar. Huge queues so be patient. Bring lots of water. SG has 2 weathers in 1 day.

name: user_7508
review: A great amusement park, but definitely not the best Universal Studios park. It has a great selection of world-class rides and attractions that is often marred by maintenances and bad weather. Definitely come for the experience, though.

name: user_7509
review: Lots of people and long wait for the queue as other universal studio. However, entrance ticket is cheaper compares to USA.

name: user_7510
review: Best to buy your ticket in advance then visit on a weekday to avoid the crazy long lines & crowd during weekends. If visiting on a weekend and pressed for time, get an express pass so you can enjoy all rides and repeat your favorites. There are a lot of rides and activities to enjoy for adults and kids. Our family loved the 4D Transformers, Revenge of the Mummy, Canopy Flyer, and Jurassic Park Rapids. We were also very lucky to see character shows such as from Transformers, Jurassic Park, Shrek, and Despicable Me (our favorite!!!). Definitely value for money and I hope USS can reconsider adding a Harry Potter-themed area similar to USJ so that it will be more accessible for everyone.

name: user_7511
review: The rides are fun and you could easily google in advance to find out which are suitable for you. The tickets are not cheap and with long queues for each ride, there was little time to try all rides, do some shopping, enjoy food, take photos. The queue time estimated was rather long , but in actual fact the time is shorter. I hope USS can have earlier open hours and close later. At 6-plus pm, we were " chased out" by Park staff.

name: user_7513
review: This is my second time that I have been here. It is really fun!! I recommend buying an express ticket to skip the long queue and get more fun!!

name: user_7514
review: Excellent park, decent ticket price, the fast pass is quite high but the unlimited one allows you to really enjoy all the attractions Price of souvenirs in store correct, landscape and theme very well done To do

name: user_7516
review: Rides already old & need new attractions

name: user_7519
review: Great Experience. Superb Rides. Best place for kids to enjoy and friends day out.

name: user_7523
review: Worth a visit if this is your first time coming to Singapore. Prepare to spend an entire day here. They open at 11am and queues stop at 6pm. You still can walk around the park to take pictures after 6pm. My issue is that queues are too long for the rides. I arrived at 12pm and left at 630pm and only had 4 rides, namely Mummy, Jurassic Waterfalls, Transformers and junior roller coaster. This was on a weekday. Each ride probably lasted at best 5 minutes. Transformers was also not updated and it was exactly the same thing I experienced 5 years ago. Hence, don't recommend it if you have come before. That aside, the vibes of the park were good and enjoyable. Definitely a must if you are coming with kids

name: user_7526
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an amazing theme park that offers an exhilarating and unforgettable experience for visitors of all ages. There are gentle rides for the weak of heart. Then the rollover coaster ride for the Adeline junkie in you. I especially loved the Battlestar galactica theme. The transformer ride is a must not miss no matter how long the Q ride :). Overall a must do in your Singapore itinerary. It will be a memory for life :).

name: user_7527
review: The transformer and the mummy rides was awesome. I was thrilled but bit scary.

name: user_7536
review: One of the best amusement parks in Southeast Asia, located on Sentosa island you can visit this place by MRT. You can take any MRT station to North-East Lime or Circle Line, lots of interesting rides for you to visit, one of my favorites is Battlestar Galactica.

name: user_7537
review: Ordered my tickets via online but somewhat messed up the vouchers code as duplication, wasted 1 hour calling the customer care centre to resolve the issue. Upon entering found, about 40% of the attractions are closed for renovation & upgrades. Coupled with tourist visiting, put the attractions queue waiting time exceeding 45 minutes in most rides and some 60-minute waiting time. The team park closing by 6pm.

name: user_7539
review: I was amazed by the transformer ride, it was so sureal yet so fun battling like transformer. The talking transformer too so humor. I was there during halloween festival and the exhibition was extremely well set up and worth a visit. For those doesn't like adventure games inside universal studio, you may opt to stroll around at mall or chill out at Cafe outside. Buy tickets online so you could skip the Q!

name: user_7540
review: Average waiting time for game is at least 100 mins, even on Monday. Not worth the money and wait, priority queue arent shorter too. Restaurants and snack bars are so expensive!

name: user_7541
review: It's too good but too much crowded. Once must purchase express pass if affordable. Otherwise nobody can avail all the must have activities.

name: user_7547
review: Fun Place but avoid during year end and public holidays as queue can be too long and beyond imagination. You can have more than thousand people ahead of you for a ride. Not well managed when it comes to rides and handling crowd. You will end up spending 2-3 hours on a ride collectively. With kids it can be exhausting and frustrating as there are no special lines for families with kids. They have express ticket which you have to buy on top of the existing entry ticket which is too pricy. You ll end up spending close to 150. Standing in a queue for 2 hours for a 2 min ride which is not worth it. Can take amazing pictures though.

name: user_7548
review: Lots of attractions closed. Long line times.

name: user_7550
review: Wonderful place for family specilly kids.... transformer ride is awesome

name: user_7553
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a world-class theme park that offers an incredible range of rides, shows, and attractions for visitors of all ages. Located on Sentosa Island in Singapore, the park is a must-visit for anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out. One of the highlights of Universal Studios Singapore is the range of thrilling rides that are available.
