Whether you're a fan of roller coasters, water rides, or 4D simulators, there's something for everyone. One must-try ride is Battlestar Galactica: Human vs. Cylon, a pair of intertwined roller coasters that twist and turn at high speeds. It's an exhilarating experience that's sure to get your heart racing. In addition to the rides, Universal Studios Singapore also offers a range of shows and attractions that are just as impressive. The Waterworld show, based on the Kevin Costner film of the same name, is a must-see, with jaw-dropping stunts and special effects. The Hollywood Dreams Parade, which takes place in the evening, is also a highlight, with colorful floats and beloved characters from movies and TV shows. The theming and atmosphere at Universal Studios Singapore are also impressive, with each area of the park designed to transport you to a different world. From the New York streetscape to the ancient temples of Far Far Away, you'll feel like you've stepped into another dimension.

name: user_7555
review: I went on Saturday. The wait time was listed as 60 minutes, but in reality we waited in line for over two hours. Leave the roller coaster in a locker. However, after 100 minutes, there will be an automatic charge of 4. I've been to UNIVA in Osaka before, so I compared it, but there weren't many staff members, it took a long time to get directions, and there were some people who couldn't get on because they couldn't use the priority pass because they didn't have proper explanations. I felt sorry for you I recommend going on weekdays.

name: user_7556
review: We reached the park after it had opened and had almost no queue to enter the park. But each major attraction/ride had wait time of 60 minutes. In many cases it looked like AC was off even in indoor waiting queue. Water fountains were not working, so drink up before you queue. All rides were fun and everyone thoroughly enjoyed. Jurrassic park ride really can drench you, and in my case even our shoes were soaked.

name: user_7558
review: Good selection of rides. A couple of rides were closed and a section of the park but there was plenty still to do. Decent food selection to choose from, friendly staff through out. Many rides had a single rider queue. Longest queue was 60 minutes through out the day.

name: user_7561
review: Very long ques. Unable to enjoy all the rides due long que on week day. Mummy ride was not operational due to technical issues, but people like us can't see that for a whole life as well are from India. Need to find ways to avoid disappointment to travellers

name: user_7566
review: Easily the must do activity in Singapore. Kids would love it and so would be Adult. Entire day is not enough to cover the entire park and rides

name: user_1190
review: The third time I came here, the service staff was not good, but it did not affect the experience of the facilities!

name: user_7567
review: Extreme roller coaster riders but be WARNED EXTREMELY HOT WEATHER! Wear loose clothing! Everyone was sweating through their pants!

name: user_7569
review: Universal Studio Singapore is undoubtedly one of the best amusement parks to visit in Southeast Asia. With its wide range of thrilling rides and attractions, it has become a top tourist destination for families and friends alike. I recently had the opportunity to visit the park, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. The first thing that struck me about Universal Studio Singapore was its impressive collection of rides. From heart-pumping roller coasters to interactive simulators, there was something for everyone. One of my personal favorites was the Transformer ride, which was an incredible 3D experience that transported me into the world of the Autobots and Decepticons. It was so realistic that I felt like I was part of the action. However, it's worth noting that the park can get quite crowded on weekends and holidays. This can lead to long wait times for the rides and difficulty navigating through the crowds. However, if you plan your visit during the weekdays, the park is significantly less crowded, and you can enjoy all the rides and attractions without having to wait in long lines. Despite the crowds, the overall atmosphere of the park is infectious. There's a palpable energy and excitement in the air that is hard to describe. The park is immaculately maintained, and the staff is friendly and helpful. One downside to visiting Universal Studio Singapore is that you'll need a full day to enjoy everything the park has to offer. In fact, it took me around six hours to explore the entire park and experience all the rides. That said, it's worth every minute, as the memories you'll make here are priceless. In conclusion, if you're looking for a fun-filled adventure, Universal Studio Singapore is an absolute must-visit. The park's fantastic rides, thrilling attractions, and energetic atmosphere make it a unique and unforgettable experience. Just remember to plan your visit during the weekdays to avoid the crowds and make the most out of your time here.

name: user_7574
review: I even went there with an express ticket, and it was a good thing I got the ticket. First of all, it was hard to stand in line because it was so hot. I rested at restaurants and cafes along the way. All the rides were fun! I especially recommend Cylon, Human, and Mummy.

name: user_7575
review: Universal Studios is good everywhere. In the case of Transformers, Mummy, and Jurassic Park, the waiting time is more than an hour, so we recommend open run or single rider ride. Even on weekdays, most wait times are over 40 minutes. Popular attractions have wait times of over an hour. Please note that many attractions will be canceled for safety reasons if there is rain in the forecast.

name: user_7577
review: Major portion of the areas around the'universal globe' is closed for maintenance.. Nothing to feel wow there..

name: user_7578
review: The park is old and tired with half of it closed. Express pass pre-purchased and still had to line up to get wrist band, it is so not worth it. Most of the park and the main show were closed, I went many years ago and it was a lot better, now I rate it as the WORST Universal studios I have been to, if not the worst theme park ... and I have been to many all over the world. It is definitely not worth the exorbitant price you pay, don't bother going!

name: user_7579
review: I have tried mummy, transformers and Jurrasic park rides.. That's all i could cover in 3 hours.. Out of three Mummy ride is scariest..The queues are long even on weekdays.. Light Action Camera is must try..

name: user_7580
review: Honestly not worth unless you buy an express pass. Waiting is too long . In few rides it's around 2 hrs. Ques take time. And it's frustrating. My kids only got to do 4 rides.

name: user_7583
review: Its a very nice theme park in an oven. I dont enjoy giving my own countrys theme park a one start esp when I can see theyve put in the effort to maintain the park and the staffs are very helpful and friendly. But its too hot! We cant even enjoy walking around the place. More shelter, more fan etc would be really helpful.

name: user_7584
review: Park was okay. Lots of renovations are taking place. No more Madagascar. And a majority of far far away is closed. Signage in the park still remains that now points to closed toilets. They provide free Wifi. I would try and hold off too renovations are completed or come during the week.

name: user_7585
review: Recommended to buy Single Time Express Pass and also there are many height restrictions for kids for the rides in Universal Studio.

name: user_7590
review: Best place for adventure activities

name: user_7593
review: Most vendors have no cash change, that sucks. Some items are extremely overpriced. 8 for a single scoop of ice cream. But park and rides are awesome. A day filled with fun.

name: user_7596
review: I highly recommend to visit the USS!! I really enjoyed the mummy and transformer rides!!!! Truly one of a kind experience

name: user_7600
review: No idea why anyone would subject themselves to the torture of coming to this place if they did not have children. We visited early on a Monday and the wait time for most of the rides was at least 40 minutes. In the New York and Hollywood sections there are hardly any attractions and you are basically walking between a bunch of shops with overpriced food and merchandise. The rides are fun, no doubt, but with only 2-3 rides in the busier sections there is just not enough to cater for the thousands of people that are milling around at any time. Even with the express pass you have to queue for ages. My kid had more fun in the hotel pool than standing in line in the heat. Totally not worth the entry priceeven the local priceand would not visit again.

name: user_7608
review: one of the best theme park i have been so far. the price is worth it and surely your family and friends will enjoy

name: user_7613
review: Waterworld and Madagascar are closed. You can walk around there without an express train, I wont say that its not at all interesting, but you cant ride anywhere, the queues are simply gigantic. We were lucky, we got to a lot of places, but due to the early closing at 6 pm, most of them had to be postponed.

name: user_7615
review: Absolutely loved it other than the long queues for the very popular rides, but if you can fork out a little bit more money, you can skip the lines and get to the ride faster

name: user_7616
review: An excellent day with the kids. Straight up, we paid for Universal Express Unlimited (UXU) passes, and we believe that they were worth every cent. The park was quiet (we went on a Thursday outside of SG school holiday) but there were still queues. The UXU passes got us to the front of the line without any wait almost every time. The kids got to enjoy front row seats on all the main rides multiple times throughout the day. And by multiple times I literally mean dozens... something that was only possible thanks to the UXU passes. I know that the cost of the UXU passes makes many question their value, but in hindsight we all agree that having them made the day truly spectacular. And to top it off, the passes also get you through the priority entrance at the front gates too, another bonus! The USS App was very useful for navigating. Strongly recommend that you download. The park is relatively small, and Waterworld remains closed at time of writing, which was sad. But that said, we spend the entire day there and only stopped for lunch! Understanding the locker system and using them efficiently is key to enjoying the day too. Can get a bit painful. But once you know the rules and get to know where the various banks of lockers are, then it all gets a bit easier. Drink outlets all sell the same, basically coke, lemonade, water and coconut water. Few other options but not much. Don't expect gourmet food, but it was fine, and the kids just wanted to get back to the rides anyway, so that was fine! All in all it was an awesome day out, the kids could not get the smiles off their faces.

name: user_7618
review: lovable place for relaxing with many 5 stars hotel packed with tourist. The most fun Universal studio I have visited . It Nice chill out bars along the beaches to chill and catch the sunset.

name: user_7622
review: I don't even know where to start writing a review. The place is highly overrated. Despite the fact that we bought an unlimited express pass, there were endless queues. To ride an attraction with an express pass, you wait in line for an average of 1 hour. There is no question of riding something twice there is no desire to stand in line for an hour a second time. And you stand in line in super tight corridors. I can't breathe. There are a lot of people. It is unclear how much longer to wait. At some point, after standing in line for an hour and already seeing the entrance to the attraction, it was simply closed. Because there were clouds in the sky and there was a risk of lightning. When we went outside, it turned out that at that moment all the attractions that were on the street were closed . Unreasonably expensive!!! Due to the fact that there are no restrictions on the number of visitors, there is just a mess of people there. Nobody really has time to look at anything. Even to buy water you have to stand in a huge line. I do not recommend visiting. A waste of money and nerves. If I could give minus 5 stars, I would do so.

name: user_7627
review: Great place to enjoy SG with young children! Express pass were really helpful!

name: user_7629
review: Best entertainment. Great rides Revenge of mummy and gallactica human are great.

name: user_7630
review: 2023-05-07 The park is much smaller than expected. In addition, the future water world is not open, Some facilities are not open either. So the whole range is very small. 4D Transformer is not bad, Although I still prefer 4D Spider-Man, But it seems like Transformers are only available here! The large roller coaster in the middle, There are humans and robots, Human beings are ordinary roller coasters, The robot's feet are suspended in the air. He would also be turned upside down, It is recommended to play both! Legend of Gods and Ghosts is also pretty good. Although it is not 4D! As soon as you enter the door, there is Mary standing in traffic so you can take photos. But there are no related facilities! I cant buy related clothes either! Tickets are not cheap; It costs more than 100 Singapore dollars during the holidays!

name: user_7632
review: Expensive but can go on less than 10 rides because waiting times are upwards of an hour, even on weekdays. Waste of money.

name: user_7638
review: Worst experience from the whole trip in sg. Do not go there unless you bought the unlimited pass ticket

name: user_7639
review: My first roller coaster ride was Cylon! Thats an achievement for me . The mummy ride was scary yet amazing. I was a solo riders, so it was great exploring the place alone. Except even on weekdays, it had a wait time of around 70-90 minutes. Even the express ticket wasnt much helpful for me and it was expensive at the studios than in online. Also the Minions are tooo cute . Met the Dinosaurs and watched movie making. Boated through the Sesame Street and took amazing photos!

name: user_7642
review: The jurassic Park water ride wasted alot of time but managed to complete the park in 6-hours. If you are a solo rider you can skip the que for some rides which helped alot.

name: user_7644
review: It was great. But I am not able to complete all rides in a day. Too crowded. Felt like they sell too many tickets than actual.

name: user_7647
review: Some attractions need 70min to 120min to q!!!

name: user_7648
review: Over-rated... waste of money, time, and energy. management simply sells tickets to ennumber of people and makes profits. Any activity waiting period was more than 3 hours... least bother about visitors. if possible, I would have given a minus rating....no professionalism at all

name: user_7650
review: My kids enjoy the fun and adventure We often go there because there's is no other place like sentosa

name: user_7651
review: Wonderful place to visit and enjoy rides n shows. If possible try to take express pass to cover major rides n shows

name: user_7653
review: The smallest Universal Studios in the world, with fewer people queuing up

name: user_7654
review: Only 3-4 major rides are good rest are for kids. Cyclone, mummy, transformers, jurrasic park. Can skip express pass. Que waiting time is general less in the evening. Plan accordingly.

name: user_7655
review: Worth the money, super fun, lots of attractions, a sufficient amount of stalls, accomodating staff, great location, has beauty on both morning and night

name: user_7657
review: Worst place in the world to visit. Pay 80 dollar to be in the queue for many hours. 3 hours queue for a ride ????? Dont have any other things to do in singapore ???.

name: user_7658
review: Super nice amusement park, with different universes like Shreck, The Mummy, Jurasic park, Transformers, etc. Too bad Waterworld was closed when I went.

name: user_7660
review: Crowded during holiday season, choose express pass if you have to. Or choose low season so you can ride many attractions. Bring sun block, drink a lot of water and use hat or shade whenever you visit.

name: user_7662
review: Extremely disappointed out if all activities at Singapore. Universal Studio is poor organized in managing guest after paying for all the rides each ride took 2. 30 hrs waiting time(3/5/2023)and on their own discreet they stop rides stating bad weather conditions when there is no rain, and only with a light cloud. We pre booked tickets week ago and yet we had to wait in queue for more than 2 hrs for each ride and out of which due to call off human roller coaster we have to leave and re do the same process after 40 mins including which made 3.5 hrs waiting time for one ride. This should be investigated by principal universal Studio, they should not accommodate crowds which they can't handle and make tourist locals wait on their pre planned trips, went twice to the place one after another couldn't complete all rides and it's very shame to see when looking at how the singapore is very well organized as a country and all other activities outside sathosa. Never recommended to go on weekends or weekdays.

name: user_7666
review: Since Madagascar is under construction, there isn't much to ride, so I feel like it's a bit of a waste of money considering the price, but it's a bit awkward not to come all the way to Singapore... I arrived at 12 o'clock on Friday and entered after only purchasing tickets on site. After checking the time on the app, I boarded most of the rides and there was no wait for more than 30 minutes.

name: user_7667
review: Its better to purchase your ticket beforehand. It saves money and time. Also if your money is not too tight then I suggest you to pay extra for express pass. It was too hot to line up with a bit extra money you can actually save on time and your energy. It was a bit of disappointment that they did not have JP dinosaurs egg popcorn. The operation time is a bit too short. It will be much nicer if they open earlier to avoid the hot weather and we will have more time to eat and get our gifts for love ones

name: user_7668
review: Great place for families. We spent nice time there. Ona disadvantage- there were long queues for all attractions.. be prepared for that. We visited that place on Monday.

name: user_7673
review: I was told it would be quiet on weekdays... Be sure to stop taking the express...

name: user_7678
review: I came to Universal Studios Singapore, it was closed

name: user_7679
review: Nice place for kids,must include in Singapore itinerary. Its in sentosa Iceland.

name: user_7683
review: Very long queues (120 min, sometimes 160 min). The express pass was sold out. Some of the zones were not available from the beginning. Most of the coasters were shot down due to the bad weather alert.

name: user_7690
review: It wasnt even raining and they closed all the rollercoasters. Very small park with not many attractions. Wait time for every attraction is over 1 hour then the ride only lasts a minute. Food not good and expensive. Very few vegetarian options

name: user_7691
review: Beware beware beware. Dont go to USS this month. Worst experience of all... more than half of the rides are closed... half of the rest they closed for lightening which never happened. Only open shows were Elmo and Light camera action.... what a waste... felt cheated..their ticket charges are higher than before.

name: user_7694
review: Trying to squeeze as many people, insane waiting lines and no activities for bad weather (typical rain). No vegetarian options. Waste of money and time. I wish the company would reimburse for the non used activity.

name: user_7699
review: Having the best day of my life!! Really enjoyed the rides extreme for sure!! If your looking for something thrilling, roller coaster is must try at Universal studios Singapore!

name: user_7701
review: Not as big as the one in the US or other places but still one of the better amusement parks in Asia. Must visit during Haloween.

name: user_7702
review: Worth buying the express pass as the queue for standerd pass was over 1.5 hours for certain rides.

name: user_7708
review: Extremely long waiting time for each ride , even the small rides average 1 hour wait time ... wont recommend to visit in this Singapore weather .

name: user_7709
review: Like to visit with family

name: user_7710
review: Definitely not worth to visit this place. Half of the park is closed for refurbishing attractions. And we were not notified when we bought the tickets online the day before. Also, the express pass cannot be used in 3 activities (and we were informed about it) but as there are closed attractions, we would have expected to be able to use it. Same it goes with some shops which are closed. At the end, the tickets are outrageously expensive for what you get, especially as the park is half closed, crowed, full of people, expensive and not organized at all. Complained with the Customer Service but with the usual Asian smile, they wont give a dam. Not a good service at all. A long way to get the organization level of Disney parks.

name: user_7711
review: Really good place to experience movies based themes in reality. Lots of enjoyable rides. A must go place for all movie lovers.

name: user_7712
review: Wow experience.. First visit there and it's amazing rides to food, shopping to shows loved every thing . Clean, hygienic lockers and washrooms. Whole dday passed like ZUPPPPP..

name: user_7714
review: Buy the Priority Pass to avoid the long queues for rides. It's way too hot to stand in a crowd!

name: user_7717
review: Fun rides. The wait for the Transformers ride is painful, 45mins of waiting in the poorly ventilated indoor maze, probably making it worthwhile to get express pass

name: user_7718
review: One of the best places I have ever visited in my life, period! It is my opinion that everyone should experience universal studios at least once in their lifetimes. The place needs a ticket to enter. It is always better to purchase these beforehand as tickets purchased outside tend to come cheaper than the one sold online by Sentosa. It is also an easy way to cut the wait time in getting the entry tickets. The place also tends to get crowded during the weekends and public holidays with lengthy queues. Please make sure to show up at 11 AM in order to make the most out of the place in one day. The rides were great in general. It will definitely take more than one day if you plan on covering every single ride.

name: user_7719
review: A great place for Adventure and thrill. If you plan to visit alot a full day to Universal Studios. Do visit the Transformers ride.

name: user_7721
review: Fun enough but lots of rides shut down, and an entire small section of the park! Im assuming for renos but still a bit sad because its already a small park. Also had to buy tickets twice as for some reason the ones we bought online directly through the park werent scanning!! Not cheap at all :( overall, really not worth it. Disney is only slightly pricier and 5 times the size.

name: user_7722
review: I think you shouldn't go there. I come here on Monday, but every race I join, I need to wait more than 2 hours, and then they said they have technical problem so we need to play another game.

name: user_7723
review: It is said on the Internet that the crowds are very small even on holidays, but the crowds on the day I came were exaggerated, and each facility takes at least 40 minutes to open!

name: user_7725
review: Awesome place but needs multiple visits as all rides and themes cannot be covered in a single day. Avoid public holidays as all rides have a minimum waiting time ranging from 45mins to 90 mins.

name: user_7729
review: Buy cheap tickets through Agoda. xpress buy in klook All shops inside accept cash or cash, except for ezlink. Small bags of water and snacks can be brought in without checking bags. Madagascar zone closed for a long time On days when there is no rain, it will be hot like a fire. If you come with many people, we recommend queuing for a single ride (some rides have one) which is faster than the xpress but with separate rides. /Playgrounds after 3 p.m. queue will be short 01/05/2023

name: user_7733
review: A small but well organized amusement park. They have special single rider queues in case you go alone, I went on a Saturday and it took no longer than 15 minutes at any attraction. I recommend buying tickets on the official website or directly at the park as there are many screens to do so. Advisable!

name: user_7736
review: Its fun place I personally visit there Over five times really enjoy alot,on my opinion 1 day is not enough for Finish every attraction and every corner of USS Try to visit in weekdays. try to check whether before Book Tickets i want to Recommend USS Team thet on weekend Try to Limities Pepole entry accordingly your convenient and attractions waiting time

name: user_7738
review: Nowhere near to the universal studios of los angeles. Very limited number of rides and if you visit on weekdays you cant cover all the rides if you dont have express pass because the studios open for only 7 hours. It is for the one who cant afford to go los angeles

name: user_7743
review: Not many activities (less than or equal to 5) for kids less than 5 yrs. Could have been more. Very less personnel to assist or provide information. No vegetarian in most of the hotels in Universal studios. Making it 3 star primarily due to the shrek 4 d show, sesame show, Egypt ride...

name: user_7745
review: Expectations were not met. Small, half of the park is closed, the theme is barely discernible. Probably, even this can delight children, but adults will not like it here like in Disneyland or PortAventura. Universal is worth a trip to Los Angeles. Just two more or less acceptable roller coasters. The line at the beginning of the day is more than an hour. And people with express passes also form a queue, Ive never seen anything like this anywhere! Simply because everyone stands there. A bunch of eateries, shops with cartoon characters, and thats all. Not just horror-horror. But when there is something to compare with, its obvious that its not worth it.

name: user_7746
review: Not sure am I just not lucky or it was the service . All the rides have extremely long que even though we came on monday (1-3 hours). We wanted to buy the fast pass but the quota of the day ran off so we couldn't. There was quite the discrimination between the pass holder and the 'peasants' especially at the transformer ride. The staff is very rude and allowing all the fast pass riders to ride EVERY TIME. I que at the single riders and she won't even allow me enter the ride even though there was 2 empty seats several times. She insisted to allow the fast pass or the group que to fill in the seat. Then what is the point of the single riders?? Glad that the other ride staff are not like the transformer. The fast pass also has a que even though is very little. BUT gives the 'peasants' chances too. If you enjoy rides BUY THE FAST PASS. The price is 100USD but worth it. Who has time to wait 2 hours for a single ride right? And on the shrek movie. From 200 people, why must it be our chair that is not moving , it only move the first time but it stopped. It's not even the stationary chair . It used to be very fun going here The que system had to be improved or not it will be hell for non fast pass riders. I don't think my last visit worth the money. I could only enjoy 3 attraction despite going there from 11 am to 6 pm because of the long que (shrek, transformer, human). Definitely regret not buying the fast pass online.

name: user_7751
review: One of the best places I have ever visited. Will go again.

name: user_7752
review: An incredible day. On the other hand, we must review the restaurant in "Far far away" the service was lousy and very expensive for the quantity. We had to eat on a table that was never cleared. There were 2 groups before us and we had to eat over their waste. I had to ask the waiter to clean up because he walked past us 3 times looking at us but at no time did he decide to clean it up himself.

name: user_7753
review: Awesome experience, but some attractions close for maintenance

name: user_7755
review: One of the best places to be when in Singapore! Its a great place with friends and family! The rides are amazing and the place have great food points! The highlight is the roller coaster transformer ride and the mummy! Its a must place to be have a great time also try to be there on weekday weekend you end up too much time in que

name: user_7757
review: The whole day spent at Universal and we were only able to get on 5 rides. The wait times are ridiculous. Definitely not worth the money paid . Would recommend express line tickets.

name: user_7758
review: Very good for bringing children, given 4 stars, because when we arrived there was a lot of renovation going on. It only costs 900 thousand

name: user_7761
review: Only come here if you have children under the age of 12 or the patience to wait in lines for 40 minutes. Most good rides take about 60-80 minutes in line, not to mention walking all over the place to get there. Restaurants are also ALWAYS full... We didn't even come on a weekend

name: user_7763
review: Had been to USS lots of time before covid period, really do enjoy the rides there. There is new minion ride now, would definitely bring my children there to test it out soon.

name: user_7765
review: It could be a really nice place to visit but you are spending most of your time waiting in line. For some of the nicest roller coasters you can't have anything in your pockets. You first need to go to the lockers which are free for a certain time. Then you need to go to the correct waiting line. I really dislike their system with the Universal Express tickets. Not only because you make people willing/able to spend more money more important, it also slows down the whole process as the staff first need to check those tickets, mark them, count the people they let in first before allowing the normal people waiting in line... it annoyed me more and more during the day. I know I can complain but there are a lot of people with enough money, seeing the number of people using it, so they never going to change this system We didn't see a lot of the rest of the park because there was no time for it. So spend your time wisely. We really liked the Battlestar Galactica, the Mummy and the Shrek movie.

name: user_7766
review: Worth a visit when in Singapore. Buy express ticket if going on weekends. Totally worth it. Do not miss out on 4 main attractions: Battlestar Galactica Human/Cylon, Transformers and The Revenge of Mummy...

name: user_7767
review: Wonderful time spent. The only challange is food

name: user_7768
review: Best place to visit in Singapore the rides are awesome and horrific. If you seek real adventure do visit this place. Had a blast there.

name: user_7769
review: Don't visit on weekend, it was very crowded. There is free ride train called: Sentosa Express, you can take it from Vivo City.

name: user_7770
review: Rides were good. but the ques were toooo long upwards of 2 hours on some. wouldn't go again. got to do 5 events all day 11-6pm

name: user_7773
review: Dont go this one if you can go to the one in Osaka . if has to go, the express definitely not worth it. Only three Rides are really worth it. super small park, boring attractions and food/snacks are horrible but expensive. Thrilling rides do not even allow a thin wallet in my zipped pocket! Just totally nonsense! Over priced and many waiting lines has no ventilators, visited in April, stinky like hell!

name: user_7775
review: Super heavy load visitor , 7000 visitor according to the staff, so what a useless premium unlimited access pass we got since the queue is nearly impossible

name: user_7776
review: Express ticket s a must to explore the universal studios completely..we had been in April n had to wait a min of 90 mins to enjoy each ride n that was highly irritating

name: user_7777
review: Not recomending to visit this attraction, most of the time we're spended in line in a hot weather condition which is 1h to 2 hour waiting time for the sake of 2 min ride. It shouldn't be just a poor copy of Disney land, it should be organized properly! The food court is overpriced, the meals is disgusting. Be careful they have lockers, that they're trying to make money while you waiting in line.

name: user_7780
review: A "worth it" experience. Would be better as an express pass buyer as waiting times are very long (about 60-90mins or more). Suggest to be there on weekdays and as soon as it opens so you can enjoy the main rides (battlestar galactica, mummies, transformers and jurassic rapids)

name: user_7781
review: Worth the money!! Shouldn't miss the balatica ride, revenge of mummy, jurrasic park ride, transformers etc., Good place for taking pictures too with universal studio characters!! Overall a wonderful experience.

name: user_7782
review: Tuesday close purchase ticket from counter only ..other options are expensive...

name: user_7783
review: Too many delays for most of the rides and the rides are only 2 minutes long not worth I wouldnt recommend coming here and I will never even think about coming here again worse experience Ive ever had

name: user_7786
review: I went on a Wednesday and the wait time never exceeded 20 minutes except for Jurassic! Although the park is small, it is good to enjoy leisurely. As of the end of April, there was no water show and Madagascar World was also being renewed. Jurassic World will get your hair wet, so be sure to take all the pictures and get on the last ride. You don't have to leave your luggage, so just say you'll keep it in your raincoat and take it with you. It costs 8,000 won for 1 hour and 15 minutes of storage. And I recommend buying food at Vivo City!

name: user_7787
review: The Jurassic ride is a must try!! Just make sure you don't have an extreme fear of water and darkness. Bring extra clothes and slippers or buy the raincoat for 5. You also have to pay for the locker which is 4/hour. Average wait time if you don't have the universal express pass is 1 hour and 30 mins, if you happen to have the pass wait time is around 30 mins.

name: user_7788
review: Live up to the recommendation. The services are well Organised. The rides are fun. The buildings are all nicely built and very instagramable. Overall we had an excellent experience. This is the place that you cannot miss to visit if you come to Singapore.

name: user_7789
review: Waste of Money. I visited during weekday considered it would be crowdy on weekends. This place was crowdy during weekdays too. Every kids ride has around 60 mins waiting time and adult rides was around 90 mins waiting time. If you enter at 11 AM, considering the closing timings you will hardly enjoy two or 3 rides. And with 90 mins waiting time you will get to enjoy only 2 to 5 mins ride. I felt the place was expensive and not worthy for it's price as we were not able to enjoy any rides properly during hot sun.

name: user_7792
review: Good for kids..much smaller..but enough to spend a good outing..usually crowded..start from the end to avoid queues..

name: user_7793
review: Park very small, although the park was said to be relatively empty. Incredibly long waiting times because there were only a few attractions (despite the express pass). Waiting areas sometimes have poor or no air conditioning. What's the nonsense with leaving loose objects (even smartphones) in a locker on some trains. This is better solved everywhere in the world.

name: user_7795
review: It's for youth and young person, for 47 years old just few attractions can be enjoyed... the food is rare, moreover the attractions are full.. Buy premium ticket must be a good idea for fast track...

name: user_7796
review: Universal Studios Singapore is an amazing theme park that offers a fantastic day out for visitors of all ages. The rides, attractions, shows, and dining options are all top-notch, making it a must-visit destination in Singapore. If you're planning a trip to Singapore, be sure to add Universal Studios to your itinerary.

name: user_7798
review: This is a must visit. Has something for all ages. Thrill-Seekers & Animation Lovers..don't miss this place. Dont miss these rides. 1. Transformers 2. Mummy Theme 5. Human & cyclon Long queues on most rides so we took express pass.(but we went on a public holiday) Overall experience was great & i highly recommend .

name: user_7799
review: Way smaller than I expected it to be. Two main rollercoasters were closed when I went there, so the waiting times at the other attractions were even longer because the visitors couldn't really spread themselves all over the park. I had to wait 3 hours for one rollercoaster. Try going there when all attractions are open, it will reduce your waiting times. It is a lot of fun, but really expensive.

name: user_7801
review: We do trip to singapore during 14th-17th april (songkran festival) Very good that its not too crowed and the weather it is humid as it should be but im from thailand which hotter, so i think weather is fine for me This place is amazing Singapore have such a many attractive spot Sadly USS we cnt ride all rides in uss All hve queue and take time Better to download USS app and check queue Next time i will be vip pass lol

name: user_7802
review: So excited Having fun

name: user_7804
review: Worst experience. There is no limit to the entry crowd. What a rip off. They just want to dump people inside. Not worth the money. Few rides are closed. The wait time for each ride is 60 to 90 mins. You can only enjoy like 2 to 3 rides if you have kids. After a wait time of nearly 1.30 hrs the rides(Battlestar Galactica) was closed due to technical issues. And another ride was stopped due to rain after a wait of 40mins.

name: user_7807
review: The best way to experience the Singaporean Queue. Come by if you dont mind standing under the scorching hot sun in an overtly crowded and cramped space. Queue for each ride is at least 60 mins wait but fret not, pay for the express lane and that will line you up for 30 mins wait. Opening hours is only from 11am to 6pm so do your math and you know how many rides you will be on. And dont forget the long queues at the restaurants. Also be prepared to queue up for meet and greets which can be cancelled at the last minute. Some rides are also closed without any notice in advance. Enjoy all!

name: user_7810
review: On weekdays, there are still a lot of people, and the average wait time for one facility is 60-90 minutes. The main reason is that there are too few facilities to disperse the crowd. It is recommended to go for the must-do activities as soon as you enter.

name: user_7812
review: Must visit place if you are in Singapore. It's worth to take "Express" as an add-on while booking ticket.

name: user_7813
review: Had a horrific experience. Most of the rides were under maintenance and wait time for rest of the rides was more than 90 mins. You can do way more that spoiling an entire day at Universal. If you still like to go, buy a priority pass that too early. We booked tickets at the last moment and priority pass were all booked.

name: user_7817
review: Not worth the effort. Save your money. The park is small, takes about 20 min to see it all. The design is lame, incomparable to Disney. We came in the middle of the week and the park was packed with people!!!! None of the rides is worth 150 min waiting. Food- at least 4 restaurants were closed. We had to eat a burger that the word disgusting is a compliment for it. Transportation to the park was even worse- crowded with hundreds on the train waiting in line for so long (again, *not* in weekend). Wifi stops working after 1 hour and the cellular data doesnt work inside the park, so calls/Whatsapp is unavailable. Save your money!!!!!! Go to the aquarium instead.

name: user_7826
review: Our first time to universal studios and we loved it. Having the option of the express pass was well and truly worth it for my daughter. I am not a ride lover but there is so much to see and do it was amazing. Having it avaible on the go city pass was super handy. The day we went they couldn't scan my pass but guest services was helpful. We were there for opening and didn't have to wait long after the park opened.

name: user_7827
review: The sky train makes it accessible to universal studio. Take selphies with minion and more

name: user_7828
review: Queues are crazy - really regret for waiting my time and money for that. About 1-2 hours of waiting! I wont go here anymore. But place is really beautiful, cant deny.

name: user_7829
review: A great experience..... but if u can try to get tickets with express lane if u intend to get on all rides........

name: user_7830
review: It was 80 singapore dollars and that gets you the basic pass. For another 80 you get a faster pass. On the basic we waited nearly 1 and half hours for a ride at the start of the day.

name: user_7831
review: Uss was the best place I ever visit n I really enjoyed myself .. its unbelievable and its amazing

name: user_7832
review: Super fun but crazy busy (as most theme parks are). Recommend doing the "single riders" option as much as possible otherwise you spend most of the time queuing (even with a fast pass). There are water fountains dotted throughout the park, so take an empty drink bottle if you don't mind carrying a bag. If I could change anything, I'd want the park to stay open until 8pm to allow for families with older children and adults to enjoy the park for longer.

name: user_7833
review: Its so fun

name: user_7835
review: Definitely yes to go here. Plan your rides. Can even purchase an express ticket wherein one do not need to stand in long queues for the rides.

name: user_7836
review: Great place for the family. Kids and kids of heart will enjoy this park to the nth level. You must enjoy the rides and the magical shows. You will entertain and amaze in the director's scene and all 3D effects and lights.

name: user_7837
review: Fast pass ticket is necessary the wait lines were too much other then that everything was great

name: user_7840
review: Many areas is closed and under maintenance! USJ is much more better! Many Indian people doesnt follow the line!

name: user_7841
review: Worst waiting times to get to the actual rides. For the transformers ride we waited more than 1h30mins. It was pretty much similar for all the popular rides.

name: user_7842
review: Lots of good rides..need full day ..few rides have long queues..if you are short of time recommend buying express tickets

name: user_7843
review: Buy tickets in advance or else huge line there and Klook will be the best place to book tickets in advance.

name: user_7844
review: Mummy rode, Cyclone roller coaster, and River Rapids are the best, world class. Recommend get an express pass to cut down on queue time.

name: user_7846
review: I love this place. Go here around the time the place opens as the crowd will be lesser to begin with. Both the roller coasters Human and Cyclone are an absolute treat. Sit in the front row to have a more crazy immersive experience. The other shows and 4D things are also very nicely done. Also getting the express tickets will help save a lot of waiting time

name: user_7849
review: Waterworld was closed, a few rides were also closed, a few food courts, eating areas were also closed. Just for the money, and wait times, it's not really worth it. I guess when there isn't really another theme park, they essentially have a monopoly - we just came from Disneyland in Paris, and for the price, attractions and rides - it was so much more worth it. Probably wouldn't do this again, unless they do some major upgrades. It's such a shame as universal studios could actually have so many more attractions given the movies they have. It's like they couldn't be bothered to try. The merchandise is also really limited and expensive. Overall we were quite disappointed.

name: user_7851
review: Bought a t shirt from one of the shops at universal studios and it was the worst quality I've ever had. As soon as I put it on there was a rip in it, even though it was the correct size. I tried to get a refund but they refused. Do not waste your money on any merchandise here.

name: user_7852
review: Nothing out of this world

name: user_7854
review: Less than my expectations. Overrated place very expensive. It costs 60 euros for ticket per person 50 euros per person for fast line. Low value with high price Do not buy fast line tickets , you can start backwards (the last world or even far far away) to avoid waiting, and the fast line ticket is useless after 03:00. another disadvantage it can be used only once for game. So if these games are suitable for your kids age and they want to play it again, you have to wait in line because the fast line can be used one time for each game.and this is not fair because there are many games not suitable for your kid age.

name: user_7855
review: It is a very suitable attraction for families, children and couples to travel together.

name: user_7857
review: Great variety of rides and food to eat. Not a long wait in the lines. Staff all very friendly. Lockers for bags great but have to pay in the Jurassic area. You will get wet on the Jurassic water ride

name: user_7860
review: You need minimum 2 days to enjoy all rides. Most of the rides have long queues.. so try to reach by 11 am and start in the reverse order. There is one app which shows waiting time for each ride and plan accordingly. The Jurassic world and transforms had some technical issues on the day I went there. So almost 1 hour wasted.

name: user_7863
review: Great attraction and comfortable for families enjoy the holidays here. Many choices of kids to enjoy they're meals and chocolate.. Hersey of course

name: user_7864
review: Universal Studios is where the magic happens! When in Singapore, for a fun, adventurous day, this HAS to be on everyones itinerary. Its A MUST VIST! From heart-pumping rides to thrilling games, I did it all! Especially the Transformer VR rollercoster was . You need to experience it. Trust me. It has something for everyone, open for all ages and you are sure to leave with forever memories!

name: user_7865
review: Amazing place to be when youre in Singapore. Youre missing something big if youve not made it yet to #USS The Transformers, Mummy the ride, Shrek 4D movie are some of my favourites

name: user_7866
review: Ok, but it does feel a bit tired in places. Not a lot of rides, youd expect more. Good food options.

name: user_7867
review: Waiting time was unrealistic with people jumping lines, standing out in the sun for 1 hour. Poor quality rides. Overpriced.

name: user_7868
review: The Theme park is not as good as it is marketed but the best thing you can doo is reach at 11 am (park opening time) on a weekday if you want to enjoy the park in peace.

name: user_7870
review: There are no words to describe the gameplay here, it's great. The only downside is that you will have to line up and wait a long time to play the game (15 mins - 2 hours) depending on the game. Very great experience here.

name: user_7871
review: Great rides but queue lines are horrible. Takes atleast 30mins for a queue. Popular rides takes about 45 to 70mins queue. A lot of attractions were not available during our visit. Some rides had issues while in queue so we had to waste 40min wait for nothing.

name: user_7882
review: I recommend to be there before the gate open and go on weekdays rather than weekends. If you were a fan of amusement park you should definitely buy express tickets it would save a lot of time. The theme park is not big you can go around in one day and there are a lot of shows such as taking photos with the characters and singing. I love all the decorations!

name: user_7886
review: found it a little over hyped. Don't visit on a public holiday. Even with express pass the queues are so long.

name: user_7887
review: Great experience. So well managed and the rides were amazing. Kids loved the experience too. Worth visiting. Take the express pass if you want to save time in the queues .. it's worth it.

name: user_7890
review: Amazing experience for people of all ages. Brings back nostalgia of childhood cartoons / movies. I would recommend purchasing the express unlimited pass in order to bypass the queues. On a standard ticket, expect to wait for 30-60 mins per ride. If you are still buying a standard ticket, reach early at 10:30am and wait in line. Run to the opposite side of the park and complete all the main attractions first like the cylon, human, transformers, rapids, canopy flyers, revenge of the mummy etc. Cylon was the best and you must sit multiple times. All rides close sharp at 6 PM, so plan your rides accordingly.

name: user_7892
review: It's definitely a happier place to enjoy your family's vacation spree.

name: user_7895
review: Good overall experience but I would recommend getting express lane tickets

name: user_7896
review: We both went to universal on a sunday. We both took the express unlimited pass. My suggestion : Dont take the pass. You can cover all rides in a day without the pass. Towards the end, there was no queue at all, with or without pass. Also another tip : early in morning the Transformer and Sesame street have huge lines, as they are right near entrance. At the end of they day, there was no queue here. The wait times of rides on other end of park like the mummy ride and jurassic park are low in beginning and high later. So if u come early (11-11:30 ish) start from other end of park and walk towards the entrance. The adventurous rides are mummy (we did 3 times), transformers, Jurassic park, and roller coaster. Accelerator ride, Canopy ride, and enchanting airways are medium adventure. Rest rides maybe good, but u wont get adrenaline rush. Light Camera action was the best show. For Jurassic park, canopy ride, and Revenge of mummy ride, u need to remove all bags and put it in a locker. Rent is 4 near jurassic park, and free for mummy ride for first 45 mins. Transformers is exactly same as in LA universal studios, and Revenge of mummy is slightly better here.

name: user_7898
review: It was an enjoyable place to spend time with a friend. We didn't purchase express tickets as we didn't expect to queue for too long as it was Tuesday. However, we ended up waiting in a long queue, but we were able to ride most of the rides. It's a lovely park with a lovely view.

name: user_7901
review: Too hot , queues are too crazy (like many other theme parks), save me please. I want my food and drinks and just to sit down somewhere

name: user_7903
review: So buy priority pass, very very crowded... definitely a must do in Singapore

name: user_7908
review: Went on a Monday at 12 in April( School Day). Unless you pony up for the express pass which makes it double the price it is absolutely not worth it. Average wait times was around 40-80 minutes per ride. Good luck going with young children I can only imagine the #show which is the weekend and public holiday There are far better adventures on Sentosa Island. This is not one of them. Not going to come back.

name: user_7910
review: Went during Songkran in Thailand. It was very hot, the sun was scorching, and there was no rain at all. The water inside is twice as expensive as the store in front of Universal. Lockers are 4 per hour. Popular rides, line up for 1.5 hours to play. I recommend playing mummy, transformer, human. If you don't want to wait, you should buy express from the klook app (thousand six) and you should download the app to check the location time in real time.

name: user_7911
review: I always go here with the family when Im in Singapore got some tips for you to go on weekdays. And I heard if your first in line before the park opens they give you a free ticket for you and your family.

name: user_7912
review: I recently visited Universal Studio Singapore and had a blast! The park is a paradise for movie fans and thrill-seekers alike. From the moment I entered, I was transported to a magical world filled with action-packed rides and stunning attractions. The park is also perfect for families with kids, with a wide range of child-friendly rides and shows. My personal favourite was the Revenge of the Mummy ride, which was a thrilling rollercoaster that took me through dark tunnels filled with fire, mummies, and sudden drops. I also loved the Hollywood Dreams Parade, which featured colourful floats and lively performances that left me dancing and singing along. Overall, I had an amazing experience at Universal Studio Singapore and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore. It's a world-class theme park that is sure to leave you with unforgettable memories.

name: user_7913
review: It was crowded even on weekdays. There is a discrepancy between application and actual latency. Food was expensive but fun

name: user_7914
review: This place is huge and very busy even on a weekdays, buying the tickets inside is very easy they use machines. The atmosphere was great. We spent 8 hrs here and did not manage to ride on all the rides as you had to queue up to 2 hrs per ride. There are plenty of food and drink stalls, but again, these can be expensive.

name: user_7917
review: The wait for each attraction may be between 30 mins to 2 hours long. Taking a day pass may not be worth it. To avoid the queue it may be useful to buy the express tickets which allows you to go in a separate line. You then have priority over others. The express ticket costs 90 sing dollars over and above the entrance ticket which we paid 82 sing dollars. Lack of low intensity rides! The information about each attraction is lacking. Difficult to understand the intensity of the rides to make a choice.

name: user_7920
review: It is recommended to prepare supplies in your bag because the contents are very expensive. But if you're really hungry, we recommend a burger restaurant. Full and delicious in one set (500) Buy the first glass of water for 5, refill for 3 per round. Please take the bag because even if you bring a small one, The rides that they didn't let me take away had to be taken to the locker anyway. Even the telephone, locker zone, human / cylon / mummy, free booth for 45 minutes, while in Jurasic, it costs 4/hour. Went on a Wednesday that coincided with Songkran in Thailand. I thought there weren't many people so I didn't buy express. I was wrong. There were a lot of people. India has a lot of Muslims. Waited for an hour per plane. The weather was very hot and there were a lot of crowded people queuing up. Most of them didn't wear masks but I did, and that's right. 3 days later I got Covid.

name: user_7922
review: When visiting Singapore, you cannot miss coming here to take virtual photos. There are many angles for you to take selfies. Surrounded by many other entertainment areas, including an aquarium to see fish and watch the mermaid show, which is also very impressive.

name: user_7927
review: The park was 40% closed, the majority of the restaurant were close. The attractions the staff was very slow, the park it was practically empty. Very disappointed.

name: user_7928
review: Bought the express pass which turned to be a good decision. Mase it to 12 rides.

name: user_7933
review: This place is amazing and must go. It has excellent rides like transformer, Cyclone, Mummy, human etc. I would recommend one must buy express line tickets if you are going on weekend. Shows are also good, it has something for everyone. 4D show, action camera was also good. It has some easy rides as well, one should must not miss it.

name: user_7935
review: I went on Good Friday...there was no wait to get in, but the waiting time was so bad...be sure to wear an Apple Watch, Galaxy Watch, or watch...check the time. It was difficult.

name: user_7936
review: The advantage is small, you can walk around quickly. Disadvantages: The park is small, there are not many games, there is no parade, and the opening hours are short enough (1100-1800)

name: user_7939
review: Good day out. Staff friendly and helpful

name: user_7941
review: Easy to travel, the weather is quite hot. Spacious place Beautiful theme park The roller coaster is thrilling and fun. There should be more drinking water stations due to the rather hot weather. But overall it is considered very good. Take the skytrain and arrive in front of Universal studios.

name: user_7942
review: This is the fourth time Ive visited USS. However I felt disappointed in this recent visit on 26Feb23. I bought the ticket via Klook in advance with USD 61/adult & USD 45/child. But can you imagine that I & my daughter sister could play only 2 Rides due to temporarily closed others??? Universal Studio Singapore has temporarily closed many Rides thought its Sunday (a crowded day of visiting) such as Water World show, Treasure Hunters, Enchanted Airways, Madagascar, Magic Potion Spin. Therefore, may I ask 61/adult that I paid just for 2 RIDES? Do you all think its worth? If you closed many rides like that you should change/discount the ticket price instead. SAME AS MY VISITING OF UNIVERSAL STUDIO HOLLYWOOD (on Oct22) Finally, this was my last time to visit the Universal Studio Singapore and do not recommend to my friends for sure.

name: user_7944
review: On a small piece of land, lies an amusement park completely packed with high quality attractions. 'Transformers The Ride' is the most innovative, 'Revenge of the Mummy' has the best theme, and the 'Battlestar Galactica' looks most iconic on the outside with its two intertwining tracks. Furthermore, I really liked the Shrek themed area, Far Far Away. Not so much because of the attractions, but mainly because of the atmosphere. Just like Singapore itself, every square meter of the park has its purpose. Every attraction is always within a few minutes walking distance. This makes the visit not as exhausting as visiting other amusement parks. Unlike Singapore, the food was expensive and did not look that good. Tip: go outside of the park to have lunch in the area just outside of Universal Studios. You can leave and come back for free, and the food outside is tastier and less expensive. The park is building new areas, which is needed because the current attractions might become a little outdated in the coming years. I will definitely come back once those areas are completed!

name: user_7945
review: Had the chance to only join for 4 rides only due to large ques on a friday 14/04/23. Had to spend hours on ques which was totally embarrasing. I recommend to buy express passes to cover all rides & also watchout for waiting time on rides otherwise time will run out as park closes at 6pm. Cant be satisfied with this when compared with universal located at hollywood which Myself & my family had a totally amazing experience in 2008. I expected more in 2023 in singapore but bit dissapointed in the end.

name: user_7948
review: Im comparison to other parcs actually quite small and looooonggg waiting times up to 100 min. Though we bought a express Ticket for a lot of money we had to wait up to 30 min this is for that Money Not worth it. Some Nice attractions though.

name: user_7951
review: No doubt it's just as wonderful as Disneyland or LEGO land found in different places across the world. Just wonderful.... but the only reason I have given it a rating of 4 stars is cause of the way the place is crowded and the wait time for certain rides can easily reach 90 minutes, it's jus not worth waiting for that amount of time. That's the reason the studios have an option of charging people an extra fare for express visits on all the rides which is charged more than the actual ticket price. Tip : You may not like waiting n want to rush through rides, think about it before entering the studios and upgrade your ticket to express visits. One more tip: You can consider upgrading your tickets after checking out the crowd just before entering the studios and if the crowd is not too much, you may want to save the upgrade for your meal n souvenirs.

name: user_7952
review: Rides were fun but queues were incredibly long for anything other than the kiddy rides. Luckily someone leaving gave us their express pass which made it much better. Disappointed that there is very little cover for when it rains, and most rides shutdown in the rain. Luckily we managed to do almost everything we planned to do even if we finished the day drenched from head to toe.

name: user_7953
review: This place needs some major change because there's not much excitement and its super small USS compared to japan or orlando.

name: user_7954
review: Too many people even on a Monday. Waiting times in rides were inaccurate. Add another 20-30 min

name: user_7956
review: Fun, nice place. But the setting is very good.

name: user_7958
review: very limited activities for todlers. Many kids were unable to participate because of the hight issue. Some taff members are acting very rude (specially indied the shows, if your toldler scared and you want to go out you will face this.)

name: user_7959
review: It was amazing I went all over SciFi land and the Egypt area overall very nice and I would recommend going here when you come to Singapore P.s always come on weekdays because it is less packed.

name: user_7961
review: Not too many atraction, better in the past when I come in, there is some maintenance

name: user_7970
review: Really poor theme park experience. Compared to competitors, Universal Studios Singapore is expensive and dirty, with unexciting rides and painful queues. They run out of express passes early, and without one, you'll be lucky to visit more than 3 rides in a day.

name: user_7971
review: Worst theme park ever. Most things were closed and that wasn't told to us.

name: user_7973
review: My main reason was Universal Studio to visit Singapore. You will enjoy a lot here. Many adventures and 3D(real 3D like you are in the middle of scene) rides. Also, a lot of activities for the children too. To skip the long queues you can get express pass.

name: user_7976
review: Although the majong is small, it has all the essentials. Except for a few popular items that take a long time to queue for, the rest can be queued in about 30 minutes. If you dont have budget considerations, you can go to the site to decide whether to buy a fast pass ticket.

name: user_7978
review: Great place to have fun with friends and family. Although the weather was kind of unpredictable nowadays do not forget to bring umbrella.

name: user_7979
review: The rides are fun, but the waiting time can be as long as 1 hour with the very expensive universal express pass. Some rides don't even have a separate queue for express.

name: user_7981
review: Superb place but has to wait 1hr for every ride only thing will irritate buying express pass on holidays is good

name: user_7982
review: Great selection of rides. A bit pricier on the hotel side, but that is kind of expected from tourist spot. Plan your ride within the apps for smoother experience

name: user_7984
review: Its such a small amusement park that you can finish it in 2 hours if you buy an express ticket

name: user_7985
review: USS is a fantastic place for the entire family! My kids love everything about this place. Its good to note that many of the rides have a height requirement so my kids couldnt ride most of them. Be sure to check out the show timings & schedule.

name: user_7987
review: I think travelers should have an express ticket. It's a bit difficult to wait in line in the hot weather, but it's still fun.

name: user_7988
review: I bought a cheap ticket online and went in. It was really fun.

name: user_7990
review: It is highly recommended to book your tickets in advance. It is a magical place for everyone and if you love roller coaster rides then this is the place for you. Our favourite ride was Transformers: The Ride 3D. It is a perfect blend of 3D effects and roller coasters. You will feel like you are in the movie while taking this ride. Also, revenge of the mummy is must try if you like speed and surprises

name: user_7991
review: For those 60 and about do not try even the simple rides. It scared the hell.

name: user_7992
review: Had alot of fun going on all the rides Transformer ride and cylon were definitely the highlights for the day Food quality could be better though

name: user_7993
review: Universal studios Most enjoyable place in Singapore . One full day not enough time to spend. If You are visiting with your family or friends you can make fun with enjoying. Tickets price also not to high but ok for us. If you are in Singapore must go and enjoy your day. Thank you

name: user_7994
review: It was nice to be able to have a small but unexpected experience. I felt like all the facilities were being managed safely.

name: user_7995
review: Some attractions like transformer ride took time but it's worth that waiting time.

name: user_7996
review: It is recommended to buy a one-time Express Pass to save a lot of time. There is no need to buy unlimited, which will not have enough time to play.

name: user_7998
review: Oversold. Very few attractions are actually worth it, so everyone is packed in those lines. We went for the entire day and only could ride 3 good attractions. 90% of the time was lost to being standing in line. I wouldnt recommend it unless you get the express ticket.

name: user_7999
review: The place is really fun for both adults and children. I highly recommend the rollercoasters. Will definitely come back.

name: user_8002
review: The first ride was transformers, and the queue was super long... It was almost 2 hours, and then the ride was over in less than 5 minutes, and I was exhausted... Personally, I think the most fun are the human and cylon roller coasters, especially the cylon ones. The roller coaster almost stopped my heart, and I originally wanted to play it a second time. In the end, because it was raining, I had to go play the mummy. It was very exciting and the queue was very long. In summary, I personally think the most worthwhile ride is the cylon roller coaster.

name: user_8004
review: Great place to go with family, vip pass strongly recommended

name: user_8005
review: There are so many people that you have to wait in line for 2 hours to play games.

name: user_8007
review: Had an amazing experience here, it beyond my expectation. We purchased priority access and admission tickets via klook. Priority access is totally worth it I suggest you get one, we never fall in line. The Revenge of the Mummy is the best ride for me. I also enjoyed the Jurassic ride, though we got wet at the end of ride. The theme park overall is great and well comeback if I visit Singapore again

name: user_8009
review: Lots of fun and excitement but 6pm closing time is too early considering the waiting time for most of the rides is more than an hour. It will be more satisfying if the rides is more than just a single round.

name: user_8010
review: Amazing place! Pro tip - Enjoy the outdoor rides when it's not raining. The outdoor rides shut down once it starts raining. Best rides - Cyclone, Human, Transformers, Revenge of the mummy

name: user_8012
review: What a wonderful transition! As soon as you see the earth at the door, you feel relaxed. It brings back childhood memories. Even if you go on weekdays, it is still recommended to buy a fast pass. Because tourists from all over the world gather here, many people buy fast passes, so they still have to queue for 20 minutes or more. But there is no fast pass and you have to wait in line for more than an hour. Be prepared to queue. The landscaping in the Egyptian area is very atmospheric, and the majestic mummy landscape looks great no matter how you take photos. The castle and pea tree landscape of Far Far Away Kingdom are a great way to turn fairy tales into reality. Each amusement facility is unique and full of sincerity. They dont just run once or twice and then end. Each one leaves people wanting more. There are various roller coasters, some with story plots, some with 4D, and they have twists and turns, giving people wave after wave of surprises. It is really fun. Appreciating the movie scene, I originally thought it was nothing special, but this is the most amazing thing. It is definitely not necessary to make this trip, you must play it. Although the Cylon roller coaster can rotate 360 degrees, it is actually similar to a human roller coaster and is not that scary. You will be thrown around just like a human, and there is not much downward sprint. In fact, everyone is encouraged to give it a try, it will be an unforgettable memory.

name: user_8015
review: Amazing experience, it feels like we are in the movie set of Universal productions... it took a full day to enjoy all rides. A theme park you will never get board! Dont miss it...

name: user_8018
review: Long waiting time for attractions, boarding is expensive. All attractions usually last about 3 minutes, it's not worth visiting if you don't have a free ticket.

name: user_8019
review: One of the best experience in Singapore! Must visit attraction. Its better to book entrance ticket online and also buy express pass too if you want to save time and experience the place at its best. Here the most exciting rides for me: 1. Transformers; 2. Revenge of the Mummy; 3. Jurassic park rapid adventure. If you are a thriller seeker, then the two battlestar galactica roller coasters are right for you! The facilities inside are complete, from clean toilet, prayer room, locker room and several restaurants

name: user_8021
review: A super fun filled day with crazy rides, the transformers ride being the best of all ! The long queues were worth the experience. Although the express pass makes the wait much shorter. The place is huge but can be covered in an entire day. Lots of options to shop from and take away some souvenirs.

name: user_8022
review: Amazingly well organized , clear signages and plenty of food options around. As with all theme parks, prices inside park are high..but the convenience provide makes it worth.

name: user_8024
review: Always buy express. It will be painful waiting 40-70 minutes each rides without express.

name: user_8025
review: The rides were enjoyable, and so was the food. It definitely was a bit expensive however.

name: user_8026
review: Interesting but long queueing in almost every arcade, especially the interesting ones.

name: user_8028
review: Just spend for the Universal Express Pass. It will be worth it. Even on a weekday you cannot ride or visit every attraction. Having a Universal Express Pass would help you greatly. Avoid the Elmo Spaghetti attraction, you would lineup 30 minutes up to an hour for a 10 minute ride.

name: user_8029
review: Very busy. We only managed to get on 4 rides all day as the lines were so long, Waterworld area was closed as was one of the Battlestar Galactica rollercoasters. Half the restaurants were closed as well, was disappointed as it cost us quite a bit for the family experience.

name: user_8033
review: It's fun to spend time at Universal Studios. It's more convenient to visit when it opens at 11 am, you must add an Express ticket so you don't have to queue for too long

name: user_8034
review: If youre planning to visit to Singapore, then you must visit place is to the universal studios. Whether you are a kid or not it doesnt matter. I will love the shoes the animated cartoons and that thrills at the roller coasters was something which one need to experience in their lifetime

name: user_8039
review: Both my partner and myself didnt even get on a ride. Who wants to wait 2 hours standing in a queue. Walked around and left. What a joke of a place. Free time limit on lockers which you have to leave your stuff in only covers a third of the time you have to wait. Lol. We truly felt like we had been cheated of our money visiting this #*% hole. Maybe lower entry cost and pay fee at the rides. Lots of stuff not even open and closed. No characters walking around. Gee, wish I could turn back time and give this place a miss. Big thumbs down from us. Please do yourself a favour and DONT GO

name: user_8040
review: At the big attractions you had to wait in line for a long time. That prompted us to watch the less popular shows. There were also things here that we had a lot of fun with. Attractions that also have to do with the film park concept. The short opening times of just 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. contribute to the effect that you can't do everything that might interest you in one day. These express tickets are available, but you pay more than double the entrance fee for one person. All in all, you can say that anyone who is used to waiting in amusement parks can have a lot of fun here with an entry price of 180 (express ticket) if not many others come up with the same idea. Then it's not worth it.

name: user_8041
review: Not much has changed in the 10 years since my previous visit. Universal Studios SG has the fewest offerings in terms of attractions, which diminishes any desire for return visits.

name: user_8043
review: Pro tip: Get an express pass. It is definitely worth it. You'll save a minimum of 3 hrs otherwise spent waiting in long lines for rides.

name: user_8053
review: Have fun in the USS. Spend whole day inside. Bring your kids together

name: user_8059
review: There are many places where you have to wait in line for an hour.

name: user_8060
review: American World Famous amusement entertainment located here in Singapore.

name: user_8062
review: Really good place to do some adventures and having fun once for awhile.

name: user_8069
review: I find this very frustrating experience. Manny rides was not working. Also many attractions are not in the working condition. We stand in line for almost 56 hours in a single day. Still was not able to finish all the rides. I think they are intentionally keeping people waiting just to sell express pass. It was a very frustrating experience when we ask for some concessions for the closed rights, they simply reject other request and told us there is nothing they can do. I shared the same experience from many people. They faced the same issue. So I think they are doing this intentionally to save some money.

name: user_8071
review: One of the best theme park I've ever visited. With reasonable price, it gives you a lot of very nice experiences to play with your family or friends. It seems this place is always fully crowded even on a weekday. You must to try transformers, the mummy, and galactica roller coaster for sure.

name: user_8074
review: Went there on a Halloween events : Halloween horror night 10 (HHN10) and i could say that this is one of the best theme park experience for me. As the event start at the sunset so the weather at atmosphere is good and not that hot. Also this place know to hype you up . The haunted house is good and you can also ride 6 main attractions. I had been here for a couple of time ( in the morning) and could say that the theme park at night is on another level !! If i had a chance i will come to HHN 11 again

name: user_8079
review: Still a lot of things shut, rides, shops, places to eat. Still had a good time.

name: user_8081
review: Overall not bad. With express pas everything is fast and without a queue. Without them, you stand in line for 30-40 minutes. Many attractions were closed for reconstruction. There are only about 5-6 attractions for adults, the rest are for children.

name: user_8082
review: IT'S A UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE If you love thrilling experience you need to visit Universal Studios. You cannot cover it in a day but with Express pass we covered all. Do not miss. 1. Transformers 2. Mummy Theme 3. Hollywood Theater Theme 4. Jurassic Park

name: user_8083
review: Super amusement park. I like thier Roller coasters, 3D rides, Newyork theme street. I recommend to top up Express ticket to cut the queue.

name: user_8093
review: Super long waiting times to enter attractions.. 60 for each of them. Even on raining monday On top of that, it was expensive. Regular ticket approx 60 express pass another 70 to skip ridiculous queues... With express pass waiting time was up to 20 min... Few attractions were closed and remaining ones had a lot of technical issues so time to time they were off for about 30 min. I was in Universal Hollywood, which was much much better for - same price. So all in all, do not recomend to waste time and money.

name: user_8094
review: Lot of wait time. Less number of rides.. mostly souvenir shop and short shows. Wait time for rides was 45 to 75 mons

name: user_8097
review: For every ride there will be a long queue. Recommended to buy the express ticket!

name: user_8099
review: It is undoubtedly a super fun plan for the whole family but some of the attractions were out of service, the entire area of Madagascar for example. I think this affected the waiting time since the lines to get in were on average 50 to 80 minutes.

name: user_8101
review: A very small park with few games for adults, but rather recommended for families with children under 12 years of age approximately... the express pass is a terrible experience. The only thing you get is to be in a separate row and 1 car from the normal row passes by, 1 express car. so it has nothing compared to other parks... for what you pay for the famous express it is not worth it at all... besides seeing that the spaces in the attractions are not used, one sees empty seats and in other parks they ask For example by a person who is alone to take advantage of that unoccupied space A very little park few attractions most of all for kids under 12 years the express pass was a sad disappointment cause of express has nothing compare other parks I've been in universal orlando and the express pass works as clock here the only thing you receive is to be in a different line but at the end to the attraction goes 1 wagon from normal line then 1 wagon of express pass so basically ends up being a joke... besides you see empty seats and instead to ask for a single ride the seat gets lost

name: user_8104
review: USS is a great themepark for people of all ages

name: user_8108
review: Good place and good studios

name: user_8109
review: small park you need to quick pass otherwise you have to wait.

name: user_8110
review: There is basically no need to buy an express pass when going there on weekdays. I went on time at 11:00 and played a lot of games and watched performances. For those who want to play JURASSIC, it is recommended to bring an extra set of trousers and sandals.

name: user_8113
review: Best experience for a vacation ever. Every ride has a high quality experience of a lifetime. Some rides are showing their age like transformers.

name: user_8114
review: One the best to visit in singapore that are nice view and should be try to make happy fun in our life in there. Have a safe trip and enjoyful great short trip.

name: user_8116
review: The main three-piece set is Mummy, Roller Coaster, and Transformer. It wasn't as scary as I thought. T Express Everland seems to be more thrilling

name: user_8117
