review: Grateful that the forecast for rain did not happen. We bought our tickets from Klook, which were non-refundable, so when we learned that there could be rain, we were quite worried. Unless there is a generous discount, best to buy your tickets on the day so you don't end up going to a largely outdoor theme park on a rainy day. They also close rides when it rains so even if you get in, there won't be much to do. We also bought Express tickets at the gate to skip lines, and I realized later that you can also buy them inside. That's a better option because when the lines and waits are manageable, you can save yourself between 60 or 90 (we paid for this unlimited option). We were here about 8 years ago I think, and sadly, not much has changed. Noticed some of the restaurants are closed, and stalls too. Plus, Waterworld was closed, and most of another section. I wish theme parks whose rides are not fully available would give 10 to 20 food vouchers at the gate on that day to visitors to make up for the disappointment. Finally, note they close at 6 pm - quite early if you enjoy Disneyland's all day trips. So if you want to maximize your over 80 entrance ticket, come at 11 am when they open.

name: user_8121
review: A must do theme park, its not cheap but what theme park is. As per usual meals arent cheap and wait lines are long. There is a McDonalds near front entrance and cheaper places to eat outside, the food quality and choices are good though, express ride pass is a good option and well worth the extra money spent. There is plenty to do that will keep you busy all day.

name: user_8122
review: Singapores only movie-theme park features 24 rides and attractions, and 18 attractions. I highly recommend purchasing the tickets online. It is much cosier to wait and queue at 82 (Adult Ticket) and 61 (Child Ticket). The Universal Studio is segmented into 6 zones which are The Lost World, including Jurassic Park; Ancient Egypt, including the Mummy; Sci-Fi City, including Transformer; New York, including Sesame Street, Hollywood, including meeting with the Minion and lastly, Far Far Away, including Shrek and King Julien from Madagascar. The park is relatively small, and compared to Overseas, you can explore all zones when you arrive. Suggested duration - You will be in the USS for over 3 hours. First issue: Waiting time - expect to wait more than 30 minutes or longer for popular rides. Second issue: Quality of the rides - if you have seen the latest Universal studio movies, the rides are during the first -release. Such as Shriek in the movie, Transformers. The mummy - when it was the first release. It is not the latest. The cost of the food. It is not justified - it might be cosier than buying the merchandise. Overall, if you are exploring Universal Studio SingaporeTM for the first time, you will enjoy your time and the time spent be memorable and fun.

name: user_8123
review: An awesome day of fun! The rides are great and the various themed sections really make you feel like you are in that time! I would recommend spending that little extra for the express tickets. Well worth it

name: user_8124
review: Just buy the 60-yuan fast pass, unless you want to play the game over and over again and then choose the 90-yuan fast pass.

name: user_8126
review: One of the best day i ever had! The queue for Transformers were insane though! Almost spent 2 hrs in queue only for this ride. But it was worth the wait! Although i couldn't feel my feet after that LOL. The Mummy are also awesome, rode that twice since the queue were not long. Battlestar Galactica are also a must when you're at this park!

name: user_8135
review: my kid had so much fun in here. my kid is 4 years old can entered attraction like sesame street spaghetti space chase, transformers, madagascar, and hulk 4D. i attended here on friday. an average of one hour waiting time for each ride.

name: user_8136
review: Great place and a definite "must go" if you are in the area and you haven't seen it before. Me and my family had a great fun exploring and trying out the rides. 5h is a minimum time required if you want to see most of the park.

name: user_8137
review: Entry to the Universal theme park opens at 11:00 a.m. and closes at 6:00 p.m. Tickets must be reserved in advance via the internet or purchased at the kiosk in front of the theme park. Currently, there is no sales service at tour centers. or at China Town since the post-COVID period If you buy online from any app, you must load the QR code to see it. No QR code will disqualify you. Just the payment transaction cannot be entered. Emphasize that you must have a coach QR or voucher ticket that the app sends via email. Player service is still normal, there are no new players.

name: user_8138
review: Very small park with only a few rides. Left after two hours. Waiting times aren't too bad if you come at 11am. No need to get the express pass if you go early or are a single rider. Corndog was terrible. Not worth coming here tbh.

name: user_8139
review: Half the rides were closed, everything was too expensive and the wait times were horrible. Save your money for something better.

name: user_8140
review: Plan a full day if possible till 9Pm because it's huge and if you missed anything you will regret it. Umbrella the temperature will make you down and you want to go back but don't. Lots of water because it's too hot there Try everything

name: user_8142
review: My arrival date is 25/3/2023 The park is really small, and there are still a few closed for maintenance. Few facilities and long waiting times It's a once in a lifetime thing, I don't recommend going a second time

name: user_8146
review: Great places to visit, lots of fantastic facilities i can played. It was exciting holiday to Universal studios Singapore. It is easy to access and the foods are great.

name: user_8148
review: Must visit places, especially the kids will enjoy a lot, seeing the transformers, Jurassic park, etc. Seasonal times are crowded, especially when you ride the metro.

name: user_8149
review: Start Early so that you will be able to cover all the rides

name: user_8153
review: Pretty disappointing experience. As others have outlined everything is VERY outdated, there is lack of communication with ride wait times, there are unexplained closures on significant rides. Staff were riding the roller coasters even though they said they were closed. Most of the shows were cancelled due to bad weather however it was not even raining and it was not communicated until the show was due to start. I would not recommend wasting your money.

name: user_8155
review: Surprisingly not crowded at weekend. We can even enter without any queue at some attractions. It's a very small universal studio. 2 hours enough to stroll here. The praying room is so small and doesn't have good air circulation.

name: user_8156
review: I love going there and playing all the fun rides!

name: user_8157
review: The best place i have ever visited.

name: user_8158
review: Great place to be with family or friends during the weekdays because the crowd is much smaller!!! Only went to 2 places, need to explore the area again but for longer hours!!!!

name: user_8159
review: Get your tickets in advance to skip the long lines. Read the fine prints regarding food vouchers to avoid confusion. Bring lots of water to drink. Do not visit during holidays because you will not be able to ride most rides because your time will be spent queuing and believe me it could take over an hour. If you can afford it get the fast pass. Kids and adults will enjoy the place. I highly recommend you try discovery cove too. Also within Sentosa just across Universal Studios. It is an extra ticket separate from universal studios. You will enjoy the slides and pools here. Do not miss the chance to snorkel with the fishes! You can also get a bus ride to another part of Sentosa and try the Skyline Luge. This will bring you lots of thrill as you speed downhill. Their catch phrase is right. Once is never enough!

name: user_8161
review: There is a lot to see and the rides are moderately fun

name: user_8162
review: Smaller than Hong Kong Disneyland. It's not big, so there's no problem getting on the ride with a basic admission ticket, but if you don't want to wait in line in a hot and crowded place, you can buy a fast pass. For lunch, it's better to get your arm painted and go out to eat it.

name: user_8164
review: A theme park thats catered for all ages. All you have to do is just hop onto the ride and let the ride take you away. Either for a rush of adrenaline or chill back ride. Take your time to enjoy all the rides, and let the adrenaline cool down before taking the next one such as the Revenge of The Mummy or Battle Star Galactic. Visit the in-store/s to grab your favourite plush toy or memorabilia for a walk down the memory lane in later years. If you are someone not for the waiting, grab your express pass tickets for shorter wait time. Hope you guys enjoy as I did.

name: user_8165
review: Alot of fun activities and rides. However most of the rides and attractions are old. Yet fun experience. Must visit if you are in Singapore. It was crowded even during the weekday.

name: user_8166
review: Fun place to be with your fun spouse ! We had a great time. We both acted like a happy child (forgetting our age for a while) ha ha ha. Humid weather but it was worth it. Must visit place with your family !

name: user_8167
review: An enjoyable day out but poor quality and quantity of rides. Very dated and small theme park. Wouldnt be paying for fast pass either or youd have done Everything within an hour.

name: user_8168
review: So the place is basically themed the same as the other parks in Florida, but when I visited there were many malfunctioning rides , third of the park is closed for renovation, so you miss out on a lot , but if the park was open in its entirety it would be fun, one day is enough

name: user_8170
review: Very long wait for most rides, between 40 minutes to an hour I found. Its great they dont charge for anyone under 4. Pictures are expensive.

name: user_8171
review: I have been to most of the attractions in Japan, but there is no aquarium that I specially visited. The Undersea Aquarium is very good, but the ticket price is a bit expensive.

name: user_8173
review: Good place to visit with family and frends , recommend for all age groups.

name: user_8174
review: Lovely attraction in Sentosa. Highly recommended for tourist and Singaporean. Plan to stay in the park for a full day to make your ticket price worthwhile. Need to expect some waiting time for each ride. Food price in restaurant are reasonable with ample sitting area.

name: user_8175
review: All the rides are subpar and, pretty much every rides are outdated. Price does not justify the quality of the rides.

name: user_8183
review: Not many activities for family with kids to explore. Rides waiting up to 90 minutes on queue on Monday normal day. Expected big place or similar to universal USA. You visited one that enough to see everything within 3 hours and the place not really make you want to come back the second, third so on. For me the place not really value for money if I have know.

name: user_8186
review: I didn't think it was that big, but I think you can cover it all in one day. The attractions are mediocre. I think it's well worth visiting and enjoying when you go to Singapore.

name: user_8187
review: We need the annual pass to be active again!

name: user_8189
review: Fun but recommend to extend opening hours.

name: user_8190
review: Great place. Roller coasters, movies and such. My favorite is the Transformers and the Jurrasic Park, because it hasn't changed in years and its just asal fun

name: user_8191
review: Good experience there. Staff are friendly and directions are clear. Good to visit during weekdays as there are less people

name: user_8193
review: Its Univarsal studio. A Theme park. What do you expect? Cheap food? Short que? Less crowd? If that falls in your category go uncle ringo. Anw 10 stars. No other words can describe. Like wise Univasal studios around the world.

name: user_8194
review: Good time had by all..

name: user_8196
review: Was at the Halloween Party at USS. Crowd was well managed and fun!

name: user_8200
review: I am a theme park person, so the thrilling rides in Universal Studio Singapore made me excited, especially the Galaxy, Mummy and Transformer rides, just need to bear with the long waiting time, or alternatively you may consider the express pass to skip the queue. I purposely chose a weekday to avoid the crowd too. Loving this place and plan to visit again during Halloween Night.

name: user_8201
review: The first time there. Place is amazing for families and friends for sure to go back

name: user_8203
review: Place was not bad, but weather is too crazy to actually enjoy the rides Everyone is just hot and sweaty, and smells once u start queuing. (especially the indoor rides) Some rides definitely needs maintanence as the power just shuts off suddenly.

name: user_8206
review: Didn't enjoy. Don't recommend. Not worth the price or the queueing despite an express pass.

name: user_8208
review: Out of all the theme parks I have visited, Universal Studios always comes on top. Whether in Japan, US (Hollywood and Orlando) or in Singapore. Must visit for thrill seekers!

name: user_8213
review: Going here once is never enough. The rides were fantastic!

name: user_8216
review: Enjoyed our family visit to USS alot. It is truly a place which brings a smile to everybody. Some rides are not suitable for children who are too young as there is minimum height limit - do check before making a beeline queue! Food is expensive but decent. Will be back again.

name: user_8217
review: Visited Universal studio as it is in Sentosa Island, entry was easy and fast and there are lot of trilled rides and the waiting time was not long.

name: user_8225
review: It was so hot, but it was fun. Its been a while since I went on a roller coaster.

name: user_8226
review: The most interesting place in singapore, not so many rides, 2 rides had problem, one ride (Jurassic park ride) causing the waiting line stuck longer, and another one (4D transformers ride) which is my favorite ride,close temporary due technical problem while we were waiting in line. You will need to queue for each ride for about 40-60 mins. Buy the ticket directly from the ticket machine on the spot, price just the same as online(even cheaper), no queue at all

name: user_8227
review: It's good, u can't really explore all of it within a day tho. The queue take too long, express ticket is the only way if u want to save some time. Must try restaurant the mel drive in. It just right ahead after the gate, u can get some meal here like 16 and some drink at 5. so expect 21 per person. Note that if u foreigner and purchase the online ticket through travel apps, u need to go to guest service first. U cannot enter directly. About ride, Transformed ride is the most worthed attraction, but the queue take 1 hours mostly. U can get quick snack throughout the park, the got small stall. Every stall have the same menu. Coke, canned drinks for 4 and corn dog for 6.

name: user_8228
review: Love the place as it's family friendly with lots of options rides for all ages. Best to go during non-peak period to save queuing time for any rides.

name: user_8237
review: If you wish to cover most of the stuff, then go for a weekday. Over the weekend, there is a long queue for each ride

name: user_8239
review: Good and fun experience. Will go again !

name: user_8240
review: The reason it missed out a star because the timing is very Very short...only 7 hours...with huge number of people...they should either extend the time or allow people to do only limited number of rides ...or else people pay full amount and can't even complete 3 rides...

name: user_7565
review: I recently visited Universal Studios Singapore and had an absolutely amazing time! The park is incredibly well-designed and offers a wide variety of attractions for all ages. From thrilling roller coasters to interactive shows, there's something for everyone. The staff at the park were all friendly and helpful, making the experience even more enjoyable. The theming throughout the park was spot-on, with each area feeling like a different world. I especially enjoyed the Hollywood and New York zones, which were incredibly detailed and immersive. The food and drinks available at the park were also delicious and reasonably priced, which was a nice surprise. Overall, I had a fantastic day at Universal Studios Singapore and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and exciting theme park experience.

name: user_8241
review: This theme park is a must-see for anybody traveling across Singapore. Boasting many different rides, shows, and attractions ranging from Transformers to Jurassic Park. You can easily spend a whole day enjoying them.

name: user_8242
review: Nice place however the operating time is limited from 11am to 6pmas of this time. Some renovation going on so less ride. We went on a thursday so it was not crowded. Express pass is still convenient to avoid the ling queue. Turkey leg was not available on the day of my visit

name: user_8243
review: Very nice. Just too big and empty for me.

name: user_8244
review: This is a wonderful amazingly built amusement park. Must visit rides - Cylon, Mummy, Transformer, Jurassic Adventure. Download the Universal Studios App- it shows wait time at each ride which is very helpful in planning the day. The wait time shown in the app are accurate. Usually late afternoon Mummy and Transformers are empty.

name: user_8245
review: Very bad park planning. First the queue to get in. There is line, but ppls cut queue left and right. Then there is priority queue, which also didn't work out very well. Rides are extremely long wait. the show on the street are nice, but that's about it. If only they do limited the number of rider every day would be great. Rather than just stuff every living soul into park. If you like stand and queue in line, this is for you.

name: user_8248
review: Loved the place, but to ensure less waiting time, express pass is must

name: user_8249
review: Amazing place to bring the family. Lots of fun and exciting rides. The food was great as well with a chill ambience. Will definitely come again

name: user_8250
review: USS was clean and well-maintained, with every attraction and ride in top-notch condition. The staff were friendly and helpful. They have thrilling roller coasters Battlestar Galactica "Human Vs. Cylon", and exciting simulators like the Tansformers, that made me feel like I was flying through the air. The lines were well-organized and moved rather quickly. In addition to the rides, the park offered a wide variety of entertainment options, including live shows, parades, and interactive exhibits. There were also plenty of food and drink options for you to choose from. Overall, I would highly recommend Universal Studios Singapore to anyone looking for a fun and exciting day out. It's the perfect destination for families, groups of friends, or anyone who wants to experience the thrill of a theme park. Can't wait to go back! Do note to go on a weekday if you would like to save some time queuing!

name: user_8251
review: If you are looking for a splendid place of attraction in Singapore, then this is it ! Fun rides, friendly staffs & there's food too !

name: user_8254
review: A fun-filled place that everyone should visit. My kids and myself had so much fun on the rides! Definitely will visit again soon!

name: user_8257
review: Some rides were closed and werent properly taken cared of. Place was a bit untidy and unclean especially the snack houses. We were looking forward to ride the Jurassic park ride but it was under renovation. Long lines to all rides too. Too many people and you will waste most of your time waiting in lines.

name: user_8259
review: Book your tickets ahead of time to skip the long queue.

name: user_8260
review: Rain can really get in the way of your full experience and delay outdoor rides. But, if you are optimistic, rain can make your moments even more memorable.

name: user_8261
review: I expected it to be better than this, except that it was sun and heat Played the Mummy and Open Sesame game and cinematography

name: user_8263
review: Always at last queue they shut down the ride. And closing time like working in an office. Aiyoooo jialat lah And always raining hahaha dont go to USS Singapore anymore guys

name: user_8264
review: For the first timer....go very very very worth it... I play all game 2x... But missed the show...sad hahaha.. Worth every penny

name: user_8265
review: Great place to bring family and to spend your weekend there!

name: user_8268
review: The Madagascar section is currently under construction. Human and Cyclone don't have single riders, so I used the Express Pass. Operating hours are too short. Restaurants have too few tables and seats. There is no place to sit and rest.

name: user_8272
review: Had a lovely day at USS! The whole experience was mind blowing and the mini performances were really exciting! Can't wait to come back again!

name: user_8276
review: Visited in March 2023! negative impression! There are only four attractions for adults in the entire park! Terribly long lines, I had to wait 20-40 minutes in line! an advertised place that actually doesnt even qualify for economy class in the province!

name: user_8279
review: First do buy express pass to save your time waiting in que...Amazing place to spend your day... It will be a great fun if you come with a group of energetic friends or family.. Indian stay tension free you have Indian food outlet opp. To return of mummy..

name: user_8282
review: I visited at 30mins past opening, Awesome time to visit, I do however suggest buying a fast pass, or going into the single person lane to go through lines faster

name: user_8283
review: The place has lost its glam. It looks so worn down. I would rather spend time elsewhere, felt like money wasted. Could have spent it on a nice meal with family.

name: user_8284
review: I purchased VIP passes for entry. I looooooved the experience and would love to go to Universal Studios every year. Waiting for Nintendo world to come in Singapore

name: user_8286
review: Recommended for 10 yrs old til 25 yrs old and kids at heart. It's my 3rd time at USS and theres really a big difference in experience maybe because I am a mom of 2 kids now (3 and 1 yrs old). We only tried the madagascar caruosell and Shrek 4D. Stroll a bit coz it's also raining. Recommended to get tickets online as it has discou t for SG residents incuding those holding work pass cause on the kiosk there is no discount. Kids 4 yrs old below is free. Some facilities are not availble and in renovation. Few street performer unlike in 2017 when I first enter USS. But there's still a lot to enjoyed there.

name: user_8287
review: Because large-scale construction was underway, all facilities were not available. I want to come back when construction is completed and the facilities are expanded.

name: user_8288
review: Great place to spend an entire day (11am - 6pm). Buying express Tickets highly recommended to reduce waiting time. Else the average waiting time can be 30 mins - 1 hour. The normal express pass gives one time access to each ride, which is sufficient as that itself would need whole day. The unlimited express pass is double the cost, so super expensive.

name: user_8289
review: The area is not very big but there are many fun rides. The weather may be a bit hot. The waiting time for each ride is not very long, maybe because it is a weekday.

name: user_8290
review: Really enjoyed the atmosphere. We had an issue which that we were not informed about a fast track ticket when we bought the normal tickets. It was not clear when you buy online or at the machine. Better to buy the ticket from the reception because you can ask them and make sure to find your right tickets. Other problem is that they clause at 18 which is quite early as you will not find enough time to enjoy the rides. Also that they close the restaurants too early which I find it very rude. At least open the restaurants for couple of hours after closing the place.

name: user_8292
review: Purchase the Unlimited Express Pass after setting aside some cash. Although the pass is very cheap, I was able to see the entire park, ride all the attractions, see all the performances, and attend every meet and greet! You should look around because some gifts may only be purchased at particular gift shops located within the park. When you use the lockers wisely, you can save a ton of money. But, the rides haven't altered much, if at all, during the previous ten years. I thoroughly loved my trip.

name: user_8295
review: It's small but all the fun stuff is inside so you don't have to walk a lot. The seal when you come out is so cool. It's transparent and you have to shine a light to see it. It's super cool.

name: user_8297
review: Fantastic price given the size of this Universal. Smaller compared to Floridas Universal with about three thrill seeker rides. Waterworld was closed during my trip. Entire park can be easily gone through in less than 3 hours.

name: user_8328
review: The hype of this place and people around the world, their activities makes it more vibrant. It's worth visiting and i enjoyed my vacation there.

name: user_6100
review: Fantastic place for visit with family. Great rides & well maintained. Truly world class.

name: user_8359
review: Had an amazing time with family. Rides, theatre absolutely amazing day

name: user_8363
review: Awesome place to visit. Feel like a fictional world we living in. Every thing is like a dream place. We'll go once again

name: user_8401
review: very small park, left within a few hours. indoor areas have good air conditioning and since I went on a weekday there were barely any lines

name: user_8405
review: There are some good attractions, that's for sure. But the customer is considerably neglected, given the price of entry, and even more so the fast pass. I hesitated a lot to buy it (family of 5, it's a budget!), and I ultimately didn't take it because we came on a weekday outside of school holidays. (Please note that you can buy it once there if necessary if you are hesitant). There are quite a few people but it's manageable (up to 50 minutes for certain attractions, or even a little more at the end of the day). You should carefully check the waiting times for attractions with the park app throughout the day. Times can vary quite a bit from one attraction to another throughout the day. So adapt your program accordingly. The most disappointing thing is that they don't always put wait times correctly. Sometimes it's right, sometimes it's not. Avoid backpacks as much as possible because some attractions (especially thrill rides) prohibit it and you will have to waste time putting your bags in lockboxes which may be chargeable depending on the time and/or the attraction you are doing. I would have avoided taking one if I had known. Overall, on a day like today (3/16/23), you can do almost all the interesting attractions (by which I mean either thrill rides if that's your thing, or softer ones, especially for young children). It's difficult, however, to do everything without the fastpass, even without a lunch break). If you don't have much time, or you prefer to pay the price to get the most out of it, don't hesitate to take the fastpass unlimited. Wifi is much appreciated to help pass the time in queues. The food there is quite expensive and not particularly good quality. (It is normally forbidden to bring food). For thrill rides, I recommend in order: Transformers, Battle Stars Cyclone, Revenge of the Mummy, Jurrassic Park Rapid Adventure. Shrek 4d and adventures airways aren't bad either. Enjoy!

name: user_6136
review: Extremely friendly and enthusiastic staff, the type that would go above and beyond to make your experience a memorable one, went on a weekday and booked tickets online in advanced, not a single need to queue to enter!

name: user_8408
review: Pretty great place for children and adults alike to have some fun! Can be very crowded though!

name: user_8409
review: It was a good experience. Place is always full even when we went on weekdays there were really many people. You can go out and just come back inside if you want to eat especially food inside universal is a bit pricey.

name: user_8410
review: Let's hurry and go travel. Whoever comes during this time, please prepare raincoat.

name: user_8411
review: It wasnt as big as the Universal Studios in the US but its still a fun place to visit.

name: user_8412
review: Great time, I loved it, easy to access. Tram.

name: user_8417
review: Amazing place. There is always a que for each rides so patience is necessary. Ticket prices are expensive. But overall an amazing experience

name: user_8418
review: Enjoyed the place, quite small but has enough for young kids and older people. Please try the transformers cyclone ride, absolutely amazing ! Food is quite pricey there and you cannot bring in your own food so eat well before heading in

name: user_8419
review: Enjoy every moment of it. Love the ride especially Jurassic park and transformer ride. Great family getaway too.

name: user_8420
review: What a place to be in Singapore, being a 90s kid the place did remember me my childhood. I enjoyed this place and kids would do the same too. They got some awesome ambience to take pictures, and the rides are totally amazing

name: user_8421
review: Well maintained attractions. Nice theme park

name: user_8422
review: It's always been a great place to be with friends to have fun and enjoyed the amazing place. It's mesmerizing! Hopefully to be back soon.

name: user_8423
review: Roller coaster is a very challenging ride, need to add food shop

name: user_8427
review: What a fascinating experience I have gotten through there A great place to visit for being a local or tourist!

name: user_8429
review: Very good amusement park with lots of rides available. Would come back again.

name: user_8430
review: Small but worth the ticket carefree day in Singapore

name: user_8431
review: It's not big and not so crowded. We bought express ticket so there is no queue. Kids love it.

name: user_8438
review: Nice but should book express tickets

name: user_8439
review: This is really cool...world class

name: user_8443
review: A beautiful studio built on the sentosa island is a interesting location in Singapore. A place to visit for everyone from kids to adults.

name: user_8453
review: It is an amusement park suitable for all ages. All fun toys Especially Transformers There are a lot of places to take photos. Using the pass is very fast. The food is a little expensive and there are a lot of people. Can't bring in food from outside.

name: user_8456
review: One quarter of the entertainment was closed. Waiting in line for 30-60 minutes

name: user_8458
review: Wonderful experiance. Waiting period is so high. Better to buy express tickets.

name: user_8459
review: USS is such a fun game that playing once is never enough. I recommend going before opening time at 11:00 a.m. and waiting from 10:30 a.m. to take lots of photos. There are a lot of things in various shops. Many children have gone in and taken many coins.

name: user_8462
review: Unfortunately, with the current renovation project, we couldn't enjoy all of the rides. But overall, it is an enjoyable place to be with your kids. Don't forget to try the turkey legs, the corn dog was a bit different than what I'm expecting

name: user_8463
review: It was unfortunate that I visited this place in March 2023 when some construction works were going on. That's why I rated it four stars not five. I am sure it will be a more amazing experience if you visit this destination when the construction works are over. The casino is connected to this place and located in the basement inside the shopping center. The whole place is just amazing and highly recommended to visit when you are in Singapore.

name: user_8464
review: I love ride of car and alot of game ....

name: user_8465
review: It is an unreal park!!! There are not many people in lines of no more than 20 minutes super!! It is a small park and the Madgascar attraction is about to open!!

name: user_8467
review: Number of attractions for kids from 7yeqrs of age. Have fewer rides for 4 year old kids.. I wish they put more rides for 3-5 year kids too.. overall, it's a lovely experience.

name: user_8469
review: It was raining but the rides still running perfectly If you come in the weekday, i think you don't need express pass ticket I played mummy, transformer, and sesame street with no queue

name: user_8470
review: One of Singapore's best tourist spot! This theme park offers something for everyone. There are thrillng roller coaster rides and water rides for the adrenaline junkies, exciting shows for families, rides for kids of all ages and some of the best themed play areas for children. Been here twice a year and never get bored of it with a variety of shows during the festive season. I personally recommend it as it is easily accessible to eateries, transportation, hotel stays and not forgetting shopping of course!

name: user_8473
review: Be prepared to walk ! Check the weather before you visit. Lot of adventure activities are there for all age groups! Make sure you download universal studios app prior to visiting. Food options are very less (especially for Indians). Fun to be once you are well prepared.

name: user_8476
review: The place is interesting, came back here after seven years even though I only visited the outside. There is a place that has been reconstructed, hopefully we can come back when everything is reconstructed.

name: user_8478
review: It's really fun to hang out here Very happy, from babies to even grandmothers

name: user_8480
review: Much like any other amusement park, it's a pleasant location to visit with children. The tickets are not expensive, but they will most likely require additional employees to handle the crowd. Few rides were not working, but We enjoyed ourselves, but we could have done better. You should get at least one time VIP tickets to experience the full excitement of the amusement park because it cuts down on a lot of the waiting time. After you have experienced all the rides to determine your favourite, simply continue queuing.

name: user_8481
review: Definitely overrated. We visited on 8/3/23. Many of the attractions were closed and there wasn't alot going on except loud music. The themed souvenir shops were good but pricey which is standard. For me the best part of USS was the Starbucks cafe. Unless you intend to go on most if not all the rides, it's not worth the 82 entry fee. It's good to take kids if you have them as they're easily impressed. If not, save yourself the let down and money.

name: user_8486
review: Visited alone on Thursday at 1pm. I think I rode the transformer as a single rider and waited 10 minutes for most of the remaining attractions? It's a pity that it's small. A great theme park for a day of light fun.

name: user_8487
review: Fun place. But one visit is enough cos there's no new attractions

name: user_8489
review: A fun fill place to spend time with your love ones. A different set of rides that can be enjoyed by both young and old. There's also a variety of shop's selling knick knacks, chocolates and souvenir shops. At the end of the day you leave with a wonderful feelings and memories.

name: user_8490
review: Very nice place for any family to engage in adventure activities. Lovely rides. Can do unlimited rides.

name: user_8494
review: go travel alone I got to play the player quickly. No need to buy a fast pass at all.

name: user_8495
review: When I queue for picture with characters, staff always said that the queue stop already. Even though the line is not long, and I line up very fast. The ticket is expensive while all the restaurants inside close. Madagascar still maintenance. Worst experience this time.

name: user_8497
review: A small Universal Studios. The attractions are a little old compared to the other parks but it's still a great visit.

name: user_8500
review: Must buy the universal express to enjoy all ride. there are 2-3 ride per area. The most extreme one is the hanging roller coaster called cyclone. Most rides are adult oriented better not to bring underage toddler here.

name: user_8501
review: The best theme park i have ever visited.the rides were amazing especially transformers and mummy.try to complete outdoor rides first because they will pause the operation of outdoor rides if it rains.better to take express pass because there won't be any wait for the people who have express pass.the maximum time we waited for each ride with express pass is less than 5 minutes.carry a poncho slong with you if possible because we will get soaked for one of the ride at Jurassic park theme.

name: user_8502
review: Remember don't go on Tuesday they are closed never knew theme Park got off day too...

name: user_8504
review: Great place to visit with your friends and family, if situation permits, come during weekday to avoid crowd and get to enjoy all facilities.

name: user_8506
review: Great theme park with lots of attractions to do. Get the express pass cause it's definately worth it even during the off season! The highlight was definately the galactic rollercoaster, most of the other rides were much smaller. The park opens at 11am and closes at 6pm (opened a bit later than I expected) and waterwold was not open. Far far away was also under construction a bit as you can see from the pictures. But it was still an enjoyable experience. I'd recommend to go on the jurrasic park rides first cause there's 1 that you get pretty wet from and then you can use the rest to dry off Having been to Japan's universal and disneyland it is definately a lot smaller but in comparison to Australia's movie world and dreamworld combined, it's about the same size with similar style rides. Definately still worth the exprience, would probably come back next time and stay a day at Sentosa to fully experience the island

name: user_8514
review: Only if you are into roller coasters- else total waste of money

name: user_8518
review: There were queues everywhere: at the entrance to the attractions, even for selfies with cartoon characters. You can visit it once. (Vinpearl in Phocua or Nha Trang is 100 times cooler and cheaper!!!).

name: user_8521
review: Not to be compared with Universal Studios in Florida. A check mark below. A few closed rides and 2-3 rides really for adults if not a little childish.

name: user_8522
review: extremely long quene, extremely long waiting time for all games, poor signage for waiting time. always trap you into the long quene for games, and no exit in the middle of quene even u want to leave the game. Ruining my day in Santosa.

name: user_8523
review: I've wonderful experience in here, so much fun!

name: user_8524
review: Bad weather ruined an already unpleasant experience. Too many hassles, right from not being allowed handbags to the very curt borderline impolite staff, no veg food options

name: user_8525
review: back here again after 10 plus years. expect a long queue for some rides if you dont have the express pass. however the waiting times of some rides are not representing the actual. the dino soarin was claimed to be 20 minutes, when the actual was more than 40. meanwhile the canopy flier was claimed to be 50 minutes, when the actual was only about 25. also it would be nice to introduce a Virtual Queue function on the app (similar to the one used in Skyworlds Genting).

name: user_8526
review: Nice place for holiday with family or friends.. Success Universal Studio Singapore

name: user_8527
review: A very nice place to enjoy with family. A Full day is required to cover all. 10-12 Thrilling rides that you can enjoy. Better to buy an express ticket, because depending on the crowd, you would end up waiting at all the rides. Tickets are expensive. S82 for a normal entry ticket.

name: user_8529
review: Went here when it's not a holiday/peak season, not so crowded but it's better to buy express pass so you don't have to queue. The food here is expensive, don't forget to bring your own water bottle because there are many water refill stations. The Mummy my favorite ride here!

name: user_8530
review: The facilities inside are super fun, but I dont mind if you go on national holidays or weekends

name: user_8533
review: The place is so beautiful. Even tho its raining. Highly suggest to check the weather first before buying a ticket on klook or in person. you can enjoy it fully if you where there in the morning.

name: user_8536
review: Such a great plan to go for ride with family or friends .. One day trip to be here won't get enough of the place

name: user_8537
review: Revenge of the Mummy is a must experience Xue Maos was also a surprise Remember to bring a raincoat and shoe covers. The afternoon thunderstorms are scarier and wetter than water facilities.

name: user_8538
review: Well universes studio and studio in Santos island is absolutely a Lan is absolutely a beautiful place I must say a must visit place in Singapore. A place that is full of beautiful structures structures greenery beaches island gives islands colours and all the systems. The travelling via beach buses, Santos express and other sources are free so that will make a people make it easy. I suggest travellers tourists to plan beforehand before visiting Santos island rather than getting there and being conclusive Because of because of that I missed feel of the case that I was supposed to do without under research

name: user_8539
review: A very good park with good rides. We went on a day when it started raining and they closed the outdoor roller coasters, but they reopened them later because the rain was light. It's a park with many rain-adapted rides and has indoor roller coasters that are very fun. I recommend the Mummy Coaster and the Shrek 4D and Lights, Camera, Action theaters, which featured special effects that mimicked a storm in a port. The staff was very friendly and helpful. You can buy tickets at the door from vending machines. I loved it.

name: user_8542
review: Great experience! I was not paying attention to the ticketing booth, but getting USS tickets in advance really helped us getting in easier. I didn't buy the express pass (because I thought it'd be not as crowded since I planned to visit USS on Monday), and I regretted it very much, because most of the attractions were so crowded with super long queue (the longest one was the one with the waiting time of 90 minutes). So, if you want to experience USS fully, I suggest you to buy the express pass. There are 2 kinds of express passes, but for me, Universal Express Day Pass is more than enough. Some attractions were closed when we visited USS. It's a shame, but fortunately we still could enjoy the other attractions.

name: user_8546
review: Fun place.have roller coaster rides..must to do is transformer ride which is simulation ride..don't go for treasure hunt ride..it's just a walk around in car

name: user_8548
review: It is a small universal, so in one day you have plenty of time to see it in its entirety. We decided to buy the express pass to avoid the lines and it is really worth it. Still, when we went on a Sunday in February there weren't many people. The express serves all attractions except 4 or so. And we bought the tickets in advance. The park has different themed areas and what has surprised me the most is the quality of many of its attractions due to the effects they have. In addition, its duration is quite long compared to other amusement parks. I recommend it!

name: user_8550
review: This rating a specific for the Jurassic park water ride. We have to wait for more than 90 minutes to get our turn. Understandable since it was a weekend. But here is my problem. Since it's a water ride, the park warns you of getting wet or even getting soaked. Now comes the fun part. To avoid getting wet you need to buy a 5 plastic cover. 5 for a small piece of plastic? I'd like it to be included in the 80 entry fee. If the ride has water, shouldn't we be entitled to a protective cover? Ok, let's say you're wet after the ride, Jurassic park got you covered. You have a drying station outside. Cool right? No..! You need to pay another 5 to get into the drying station. What a pathetic situation where the Park tries to extract as much money as they possibly can and they remind you every few minutes not to lean on the railing while waiting. The audacity..!

name: user_8551
review: So much is closed or cancelled at short notice . I was advised at entry when photo was taken, that there would be a lot of them from rides and meet and greets paid 50 for package, to receive 8 digital photos - told that none of the cameras work on the rides anymore. Was not impressed with the overall experience. Make sure that your not conned into this expensive joke.

name: user_8553
review: Transformer Ride is The Best! I wish it was 1hour long

name: user_8554
review: If youre looking for fun & wild adventure, this is the best place to be! I Had really the enjoyed a lot in USS! highly recommended.

name: user_8555
review: I bought ticket in advanced via KLOOK. Its very easy to enter, just show QR CODE in KLOOK application. Every times I visit Singapore, I always come here and never get bored!!!

name: user_8556
review: Really fun You must buy tickets in advance

name: user_8559
review: Went there on a Sunday in February. Doors open 10:55 am. Presented the codes and ran into the park. The park is not that big, very clean. Although there was a lot of people, waiting time for rides was never more than 5 minutes. Glad I didn't buy the express pass. Recommend the Battlestar Galactica , & the mummy rides. One of the Jurassic park rides closed right before we got there because of maintenance. The whole Madagascar section was closed. Had lots of fun but I wish there was more to see.

name: user_8562
review: Beautiful park, many rides and facilities for all ages. Loved it.

name: user_8563
review: Visited 3 times before, and it was still great. The queues for famous rides were still long as usual. Would recommend getting an express pass if you can afford it. If you have good patience, it was OK. The queue went by quite fast as the staffs were quite good in their job. However, this time, there were much fewer costumes walking around. The only one that we saw was the Cat during the opening of the gate. Food choices were also fewer than few years ago.

name: user_8565
review: Seems like whole park and the equipment requires a refurbishment as it looks very tired and worn out. Most of the attractions were out of order due to maintenance or broken down. No need to pay extra for express ticket as it only gives you limited advantage due to not many rides or attractions covered by it. I had a feeling that we were overcharged and not well informed about how available all the rides and attractions were.

name: user_8566
review: 1) Buy tickets online will definitely be cheaper than purchasing at the entrance. 2) Food and beverages are super expensive in USS. Best to have your breakfast/lunch first at vivo city before entering sentosa.

name: user_8567
review: These are the list of activities in Universal Studio Singapore (USS) we managed to cover: 1. Transformer The Ride: The Ultimate 3D Battle (Sci Fi) 2. Battlestar Galactica: Human (Sci Fi) 3. Accelerator (Sci Fi) 4. Revenge of the Mummy (Ancient Egypt) 5. Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure (The Lost World) 6. Shrek 4-D Adventure (Far Far Away) 7. Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase (Hollywood) 8. Lights, Camera, Action! (New York) Are we keen to come back to repeat the excitement? Yes. Definitely.

name: user_8569
review: We went on Sunday. It is recommended to download the app to see the time. And go play with the machine for a little time first, then come back to play Transformers. For example, we arrived at noon. The Transformers waited 50 minutes, but the Mummy only waited 15. We went to play with the Mummy. Jurassic Park zone first because it only takes 15-30 minutes to wait. Dad finished playing Transformers and only had 15 minutes left to wait. No need for a long time.

name: user_8571
review: The rides are fun. The staff are friendly.

name: user_8574
review: On weekdays, the longest queue at the express clearance facility is about 40 minutes. You can finish several major games in five hours

name: user_8576
review: Quiet a few rides are closed. Do buy express pass. Will save lot of time.

name: user_8577
review: Do not even bother wasting your time. The park is old and dated and you will spend half the day in lines. All the attractions have a minimum wait time of 30 minutes and the roller coasters up to 110 minutes. Pretty disappointing when the park is only open for 6 hours. You will also be stuck not able to ride any of the good rides if it rains. Add to that a lot of rides require locker hire, yes it is free for one ride but only up to 100 minutes which is useless when you are waiting in line longer than that. Fast pass is the only way you will be able to come close to doing the park but that doesn't account for rain delays and factoring in the cost to upgrade it is absolutely not worth it. This place has a long way to go before it comes close to Universal Studios in Orlando.

name: user_8578
review: On monday . 27 feb 2023 longest waiting time was 60 minutes on top rides. Others were around 30 minutes so express pass wasn't very much worthy.

name: user_8579
review: A must visit when in Singapore, a recreation area that is sure to be exciting. Follow Instagram @the_couple_traveling #the_couple_traveling

name: user_8580
review: Super fun! Worth the waits. The sets are really well made and great to look at. All the staff were lovely.

name: user_8581
review: Weekday ride queues are much much shorter. Managed to get on the mummy ride in 30 mins, usually it's a 3 hour queue. Only issue is overpriced food.

name: user_8583
review: Unfortunately, one of the good rollercoasters, Enchanted Airways, and the WaterWorld show were not available during my latest visit. The Cylon has had technical problems on both of my visits, and the delays hampered me from riding them more than once on both visits - these were in early 2021 & 2023. They have not implemented a long-term fix?! Some rides were kinda lame - the Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase, and the accelerator (akin to Sunway Lagoons boots ride thing) did not allow me to control the cups rotation. Some food outlets were just unavailable (Discovery Food Court, Oasis Spice Caf) on my latest visit. The theme park is due for an upgrade... and more automation of montonous operational tasks.

name: user_8588
review: A very beautiful integrated amusement park that is useful for adults and children, young people and families. It has restaurants and stores that sell goods for each cartoon character representing the city itself. It consists of approximately 15 games and more than 3 shows, but unfortunately all the shows are closed except for one show called The Dance for the Magic Beans (Cats). There are specific places for filming with specific characters and landmarks that you meet and take pictures with, and they have specific dates. Their number is approximately more than 8 characters and landmarks. I recommend going on weekdays and not on official holidays. If you want to go on official holidays, I advise you to buy an express entry ticket so that you don't wait too much for one game. Note: The express entry ticket includes approximately 4 or 5 games I advise you to visit it, it is very beautiful

name: user_8590
review: Rides were fun, wasn't too much of a queue, had a great experience! Though the food and drinks are overpriced, it was nice.

name: user_8592
review: This is the second visit to USS after 12 years and post COVID-19. Some of the shows were not available yet. So look forward to visit there again in near future. The best ride is roller coster

name: user_8593
review: It is a very suitable place for the whole family to play togetherThe park is not too big, so you will not feel tired while walking

name: user_8595
review: A place I want to visit again... The downside is that there are too many people...

name: user_8600
review: Several ride was off. Use express ticket really helpful especially for the mummy and jurasic ride.

name: user_8603
review: Travel and have fun all day, go to every zone, visit and play on some rides according to your age.

name: user_8604
review: It's really worth all the rides, unfortunately the hours from 11 to 18 don't feel like enough, it seems like it takes 2 to 3 days to experience all the games

name: user_8605
review: Most employees entertain consumers/tourists with an attitude of not wanting to go to work, making consumers feel like they are rushing to get off work. When we arrived on the day, the facilities were damaged on the way. Customers who bought express tickets just took them with them, while those who didn't buy express tickets were given free express tickets for the day. It is strongly not recommended to buy unlimited express because it is too small. Very disappointed with this journey

name: user_8607
review: I spend a whole day here. Have a nice time. Buying universal express is worth it. You can skip the line. And the food, is quite nice also.

name: user_8609
review: We always have a fun time whenever we visit USS. Waiting times for popular rides are okay and bearable. Food in restaurants are okay. Place is a bit small, though.

name: user_8611
review: A moderately sized park, its a lot of fun to bring children! It won't be too tiring either. Downloading the Global App in advance can arrange the order of attractions more efficiently.

name: user_8614
review: The game arena is quite numerous and interesting. On weekdays there are quite a lot of queues at every ride. If you want to go fast, you can buy an additional express ticket for 60 USD if I'm not mistaken

name: user_8615
review: Visited again after few years. Nothing change. Still long Q for most of the games/shows.

name: user_8616
review: The fairly small park simply offers far too little for entry including a simple express pass, which currently costs around 100 per adult. You walk past many closed attractions. Construction noise right in front of the main entrance. Waiting times are just bearable with an Express Pass. Organizing lockers is just messy and time-consuming. Here you are deliberately ripped off again and asked to pay. Drinks and food are just outrageously expensive. Overall, it is one of the less worth seeing attractions in Singapore.

name: user_8617
review: One of the best experiences Ive ever had in my life was visiting Universal studios Singapore. We pre booked the tickets in advance to avoid any delays in the queue and we were glad we did. It saved us quite some time. As soon as we enter, the whole atmosphere changes. It is recommended to buy Universal express pass to avoid the hour long queues for each and every theme ride. There are 2 types of passes one is of 60 and another is of 90. The first pass allows a person take each ride only once but the later allows unlimited rides which I regret that I didnt take. Each and every ride is awesome and gives wonderful experience. Among those rides Transformers theme and Mummy theme rides will give you goosebumps. We have locker services provided before we get on few rides so we dont loose our stuff during the ride. Overall it was a wonderful experience to have.

name: user_8619
review: You have to come here if you go to Singapore. It's really exciting, the average roller coaster, the queue for each ride is long. There is a prayer room near the Galactica, there is a prayer room there too. Tip: wear comfortable footwear. Bring a coat if you want to play in the water

name: user_8621
review: Its nice place to go, especially on the Hallows, every year has different theme! But suggest to go there in the morning.

name: user_8622
review: So much fun I visited this place before I had a kid. A few years later when I brought my son, he was veeery bored while waiting in line for some of the popular games. I think it's better to buy express tickets for those who bring children rather they won't get bored waiting

name: user_8625
review: It was a blast here! They have the best rides and best food. We can experience rides and fun with characters from the movies and the place always has beautiful ambiance, music and people around. Must visit when in Singapore. its also very very clean

name: user_8626
review: Expensive and huge queues (even midweek out of school holidays) 60 mins. Many areas not operational. A few good rides but not enough to really recommend it - particularly if you have been to Florida or California.

name: user_8632
review: Ive never been to Universal Studios before let alone Singapore and when I came there, I thought this place must be really amazing and I was right absolutely fun to be in. They have a lot of rides there food and things you can just admire tickets for about 80 apiece though, but I advise you if youre going into the park buy the express pass. Because on a regular day, you wont be able to get into many rides. If youre waiting the longest wait for a ride was around an hour and 30 minutes but the other rides for about 40 minutes but they have a lot of options you can go to for souvenirs how to get a dozen of them lol and all-around good for pictures

name: user_8633
review: First place in Transformers, second place in Mummy, third place in roller coaster, fourth place in white water rafting

name: user_8637
review: Although there are many people, the queue is very fast

name: user_8640
review: Visited on a Monday and it seemed to be a quieter than usual crowd. Despite this there were still some long wait times for rides so would recommend the express pass for families or parents with young kids. Apart from this, the park was great. Got lucky with the weather too, no rain at all.

name: user_8642
review: Not so Satisfied! I've joined universal studios during weekend in a rainy Saturday of february. Most of the attractions were closed due to the low-season and others open on air were temporarily closed due to the rain of that day. There remained open just a few games with lots of queque to enter. The most funny attractions were Advengers, Egyptian, which I suggest for large audience: teenager as well as family with child above middle age, And also rollercoasters. I've bought ticket before my arrival, enter were fast. I've opted for the skip-the-line additional ticket which is mandatory to test several attractions without using an eternity.

name: user_8643
review: Nice theme park, but therere to few activities or rides. Should buy an Express pass tickets to avoid waiting queue.

name: user_8644
review: I don't recommend it, but it's a famous tourist spot, so I think it's good to go once, but first of all, I think the entrance fee is high. The park is small and you can go around it in no time. Also, some attractions are old and poorly maintained, which can be disappointing. Moreover, it is common to wait in long lines for an hour or two. The small park was very crowded. Very poor cost performance. Especially for those who are familiar with other parks such as Universal Studios and Disney, Universal Studios here in Singapore is in a terrible state. I won't go there again, but if you're going there for the first time, I think it's good for the experience! I don't recommend it anyway.

name: user_8645
review: With so many people, every theme is almost like a roller coaster, but its just divided into speed and size.

name: user_8651
review: Enjoy the USS as much as the kids and have been many times before. On this recent visit however there were several areas closed, some hoarded off for renovations I assume. And it does indeed feel like it needs some upgrades now.

name: user_8652
review: Spectacular! Should carry extra clothes for water park . Egypt and Transformer and other rides should be done 1st.

name: user_8653
review: It is a fun and exciting place. It is recommended that you purchase tickets online first.

name: user_8654
review: This is the second Universal Park we have visited. The first one was in Orlando. It was interesting to compare! Yes, this park is certainly interesting, but we liked Orlando better. We purposefully brought the children here; of course, they were delighted. Goal achieved We easily walked around it in a few hours, which cant be said about the park in Orlando; to get around that one, you need to spend at least a couple of days) Certainly recommend a visit if you come to Singapore!!

name: user_8655
review: There are more attractions missing in the park. It is covered in a relaxed way in one day.

name: user_8661
review: Everyone in the family enjoyed the day, being the weekday not much rush.

name: user_8662
review: Best to visit on a weekday for less crowd. Consider eating at the Starbot cafe for a proper meal instead of buying snacks (e.g Turkey leg cost SGD 15 while a Rice meal with big serving in Starbot is at SGD 16)

name: user_8663
review: Many places are under renovation and the ticket price is not worth it.

name: user_8669
review: The iconic singapore universal studios! Several attractions inside.. nice and good for family holidays!

name: user_8671
review: the best experience with my familys and my friends. im so happy when can enter to universal studio. unfortunately its raining

name: user_8672
review: Unforgettable experience... even though I didn't get to try it... but at least I could take a photo in front of the GPP hahahah... the t4 is really cool, clean, and lots of foreign tourists from various countries also come here

name: user_8673
review: Enjoyed my time at Universal Studio Singapore, despite long queues and high prices. USS was a mixed experience. While the CYLON and HUMAN roller-coasters were great. The HUMAN roller-coaster was only open for half a day during my visit, and then queue was very long. Unfortunately, we didn't have a chance to ride it. Some attractions required lockers, which were either limited or costly. I recommend planning what to bring beforehand as one day is not enough to explore everything.

name: user_8675
review: The thrill is bigger compared to USJ, Announcements are made in English, so the worldview is strong.

name: user_8676
review: Fairly fun. All the theme were v beautiful designed, the rides were exciting and fun too. Went on a weekday so it is not crowded and manage to take all the rides before closing. Strongly recommended for teens and adults because most of the rides are thrilling. Children might not be suitable. Most of the rides are indoor so no need to afraid of wet weather.

name: user_8677
review: It was a little disappointing, since too many attractions were closed, but the park dues still charged the full price of 82. No comments in advance or at the entrance about this. You will know when you are in front of a closed attraction. So all visitors have to share the few attractions left. Waterworld closed, Madagascar closed and several smaller rides for kids was also closed. I would expect a lower entrance price, a food n drink voucher, a drinking flat or something like that. We were previously informed at the water park in Phuket that 2 sliders were closed. The gave us a voucher for a free locker as well a water refill flat for 99 Baht, instead of 399. My previous experience was not that bad.

name: user_8682
review: Superb park.. nice .. thrilling Rollercoasters. But nottt many to explore.. can get done in 5 hours if not mixh crowded we were lucky to not witness que and thus could finish all rides till 5 pm. Didn't but express tickets too

name: user_8683
review: It was an amazing experience at Resorts World Sentosa. One complete day required (as we were travelling with our 2 years old baby) to see everything at Universal Studio itself. Better to purchase express entry tickets to skip the long queue. Some rides may take 1.5 hours wait and even 2 hours. You can get the express entry tickets online or buy from the kiosk at the place. 60 SGD. If you are a solo traveller or without kids then you may can cover SEA Aquarium as well. You must try both the roller coasters (Human and Cyclone), transformers, Egyptian roller coaster is another level. Must visit place.

name: user_8684
review: I arrived 30 minutes early and waited. I felt like it went quickly. You can shorten the waiting time by riding the two roller coasters on the right first, then the Transformer ride, and then riding the rest. Its an amusement park that you cant experience in Korea.

name: user_8688
review: 1. Start as soon as the gates open. Recommended to spend entire day here. 2. If you are with a lot of little children, you can take a left when you reach the water body and start from the Shrek themed rides. If you are mostly teens/adults, take a right and first go to the Sci-fi city to go to the high speed rides. The Human, Ceylon, and Transformer rides are attractive here. The other high speed roller coaster worth your time is in the Pharoah themed land. 3. If you see a long waiting time for these rides, don't waste your time. Instead, go to these rides 45-30 minutes before the studio closes for the day so that you don't have to wait along with the tourists. 4. Jurassic Park has a Rapids based ride that will make you wet with splashes. Recommended to bring your raincoat. Also, you'll have to deposit your bags etc into locker. 5. If you are a vegetarian, you'll likely struggle. There are very less restaurants that actually serve vegetarian food. Since my company included people who had these constraints (along with no mushroom), we found the Pizza place to be suitable.

name: user_8690
review: Great place for a family trip. I recommend purchasing fast line tickets, otherwise it is not possible to visit all the attractions

name: user_8691
review: What a phenomenal place. Visited with my parents and we had a ball. All the rides were superb and everyone enjoyed the day. Perfect spot for a run outing. Kudos to all the crew members for their crowd management. It was perfect!

name: user_8692
review: Spend a whole day! Bags are prohibited in some attractions/rides so place them in the locker. Lockers beside revenge of the mummy offer first 45min free of charge. Sadly waterworld was closed when we visited. Wear comfy shoes and wear sunscreen! Oh and you'll get wet in jurassic park rapids have fuuuuuun

name: user_8700
review: Good and Interesting Entertainment Place

name: user_8707
review: Great theme park!! Worth to visit. Apart from universal studios, there are lot of other entertainments/attractions in Sentosa.. so one day is not sufficient to cover.

name: user_8713
review: The characters are so cute! The ride isn't very thrilling, but the details are great! I recommend going at least once! And I recommend getting an express ticket!

name: user_8715
review: Universal Studios Singapore is one of the top-notched theme parked I have visited. My friends and I were thrilled by the different themes - Transformer and Mummy were our favorites! The adrenaline-pumping roller coaster rides were exciting. It's highly recommended to visit the place with families and friends and make such worth-keeping experienxe and memories! 2 thumbs up and definitely 5 stars for USS!

name: user_8716
review: Been USS few years back and really having fun in it! Nice place to visit!

name: user_8718
review: Great day out, but the park is definitely showing its age. I came here about 9 years ago and the facilities appear to be pretty worn out. A portion of the park (Madagascar) was closed for upgrades and a lot of the attractions and services were closed. Don't make the mistake of getting on rides in long queues at the start of the day like we did. Transformers ride was a 100 min wait. By lunchtime they all drop to 20mins or less for the afternoon.

name: user_8720
review: If youre a person who loves rides, and Disney, you will definitely enjoy being here. There are also extreme rides you can try. Only downside is most of the rides has long lines and it will take some time for you get in and try.

name: user_8721
review: It feels good to be a kid again

name: user_8725
review: A great disappointment. 8 years ago when I was there it was really nice even though it could not compare to Universal Studio in USA. The park now is run down with few attractions and F&B outlets. Not worth the entrance fee charged. The wait for the rides were extremely long (30-40mins) so had to give up most of the rides after queuing for 20-30mins. I covered the park in 2hours with little to keep myself entertained.

name: user_8727
review: Located within Resort World Sentosa. Must visit if you travelling to Singapore.

name: user_8729
review: A place to enjoy when you're in Singapore. One day is not enough for enjoyment. So, maximize your time once you enter that remarkable Universal Studio entrance. Definitely I'll go back to this place, especially the water world. You're just like being involved in a movie. This place is for walks of life, children, adults, seniors, everybody. Looking for food inside? It's not a problem.

name: user_8731
review: express unlimited pass is very useful..

name: user_8733
review: if i had the option to rate 0 star I would! PLEASE DO NOT GO TO UNIVERSAL STUDIO SINGAPORE its a waste of time and money! we paid so much for absolutely nothing! ALL ALL ALLL ALLL ALLLL the main rides are closed without notifying! THEY DID NOT UPDATE THE RIDES AVAILABILITY! WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY DO NOT VISIT!!!! SO FREAKING DISAPPOINTED!! IT WAS SO BAD!!

name: user_8734
review: Unleash the adventurous self to enjoy these attractions... one of the wholesome entertainment places in Singapore... interesting rides and shows, most of them being updated periodically... new rides and shows added every now and then... 'Transformers' ride is the best and unmissable, might find long queue and longer wait but worth every minute of the waiting time... a day well spent, be prepared to walk a lot... Highly recommended...

name: user_8739
review: The best place to bring your kids for holidays. We had very good time.

name: user_8741
review: Omg an amazing day and highly recommend the VIP experience so good

name: user_8746
review: An amazing theme park.But the problem is there is huge waiting for every ride.If you want experience all the rides go for the fast ride.Or else you should wait for 1-2 hours for every 2-5 mins ride.The mummy ride was unexpected that was the best ride.And transformers was also good.

name: user_8750
review: Very fun. Some rides may require a long queue. If you don't buy an Expresspass card, you may have to wait for hours. But overall, I like it. There's a chance I'll definitely go back and play again.

name: user_8751
review: This is an amazing day out place with friends or family. Really lives up to the hype. Rides are awesome and they have got many options for children and adults. The plus point is that the budget is decent. The only issue was long queues for a couple of rides even on a weekday. So make sure to stay hydrated. Do not miss the Transformers, Mummy, cyclone, rides and also Wings of time. A must visit place in Singapore. Also, I would suggest avoiding going on weekends or public holidays.

name: user_8753
review: Surreal Environment!!! And absolutely enjoyed it to the core!! Unique place where we can enjoy even standing in long queues. I didn't even think of eating for a Whole Single Day which I have never been to!!! Felt thrilled whenever we felt the Fantasy environment which we used to see in movies, in real time over here. Felt like I was into the real Hollywood sets, and I recommend everyone to be here for at least a day!! Friend Groups, Couples, Kids, Elder ones and everyone can have their own moments. If you are on a short trip to Singapore and if you get a chance to visit Universal Studios - Don't ever miss Transformers !!!1 (My pick of the rides and enjoyed more than a kid !!) Don't care about the money spent (Not a very big money for tickets) and you will not regret it for sure!! Must visit for once in a lifetime at least!! Must Feel Environment & Worth Coming & Worth the Money!!

name: user_8755
review: Transformers and cyclone ride is awesome and other rides is like World's of wonder

name: user_8756
review: I sometimes go there for fun and walk is really beautiful place I like that place it's really cool and nice

name: user_8762
review: Currently 10 February 2023.. Sentosa Island is being renovated,.. so it's less exciting.. maybe March 2023 the renovation will be finished.. so it will be even more exciting for us to visit again..

name: user_8770
review: We had a lot of fun and joy until we were surprised by rain. Basically the theme park is great. However, we bought expensive express tickets, which were not accepted at some attractions (in retrospect it turned out to be the most boring ones with the longest queues). So we weren't able to use as many attractions before the rain and the park was closed afterwards. That's why there are only 4 stars.

name: user_8771
review: Very run down theme park. Lack of maintenance during covid has definitely taken its toll. Some of the attractions weren't running on the day and the food was terrible. Not ideal for young children as there is very little to entertain or stimulate them. Save the money and take them to 1 of the various great beaches on Sentosa instead.

name: user_8773
review: You can never go wrong with amusement parks and Universal Studios Singapore is definitely no exception. You have your day filled with the thrilling activities available. Time really flies when youre having fun. The set designs and immersive themes was one of the few things that caught my attention. My friends and I definitely made it our own fashion show. Worried about queues? When you visit with people you cherish, it really just brush off your shoulders! Definitely deserving of many visits!

name: user_8776
review: I have been here 4 times. 1st experience is the best. To fork out the money to go to this place, was money well spent. My family like the place. Weekday is better than weekend unless it a public holiday.

name: user_8779
review: Availed the tickets thru Klook. When we arrived by 1030H, we saw a ling queue and decided to buy the Express lane ticket on the spot. Tips: 1. advisable to buy the express ticket to avoid the long queues and dave time. 2. Bring extra shirts. 3. Outside Food and drinks allowed. (Not checked in the express lane) 4. Bring poncho or umbrella. Weather varies.

name: user_8780
review: The luge is really fun

name: user_8782
review: Very good experience of hi-tech rides and attractions

name: user_8784
review: Very pleasant place to visit this place . Children enjoy much here

name: user_8788
review: Had a good day out here... Was expensive for me. Buy hey, you can't visit Singapore without saying you've gone to USS

name: user_8789
review: Had a fun time here and all the thrill rides are great! However if youve been to other Universal Studios, dont expect this one to be as big, but on the plus side that means not as much walking. Still wear comfy shoes and I highly recommend you get tickets in advance so you dont need to wait in a long queue at the park itself. And if you dont want to spend extra for the express pass, then definitely get to the park early right before they open and go on all the thrill rides first before the queue waiting time gets insanely long... unless youre willing to stand in line for 60 mins for a rollercoaster. Because this park is not as big as the other Universal Studio parks Ive been to, we were able to get through most of the attractions before the end of the day and saved time for us to do more stuff around SG in the evening. Definitely a good visit especially for families and anyone with kids.

name: user_8790
review: Enjoying my day here. Taking all the rides by jumping from the end towards the entrance to avoid long queue. Even its raining, the rides were still open and there was short queue.

name: user_8791
review: I have always loved theme parks and USS is simply one of my favourites! My favourite ride is definitely the Mummy ride. Took family members there and they enjoyed it! Food wise, lots of food available! Favourite snack would be the churros! Good ol theme park churros. I recommend buying tickets earlier, and if youre going during the weekend or school holidays, pls consider buying the express pass!

name: user_8792
review: Arrived at gate at 1030am ready for 11am open. Gates opened at 1050am. Lots of water fountains around for drinks as its quite humid. Travelled with toddler almost 3 years old. Plenty of fun and safe activities and rides to do with him. Pre booking with klook was a good saving for us.

name: user_8794
review: the wait to enter was not too long for me! The waiting time for the rides can take awhile but I think that it is worth it to wait for your turn because each ride is unique. Overall, I had a good experience there.

name: user_8795
review: This is topmost attraction of Singapore. Will keep it at No.1. Full day entertainment. Buy tickets from Klook. Online tickets are cheaper than physical tickets at studio. It is entirely cashless. After 3:00 pm queues are shorter. You can take most rides again as queue are shorter after 3:00 pm. I do not recommend Express tickets, as u can take most rides without it also in one day.

name: user_8798
review: There are many rides to experience. Facilities were well maintained even though the park have been opened for awhile. My friends and I had a great time there. Will revisit

name: user_8800
review: Great rides - latest technology - if you actually get to ride them, as only 23 of the park is operational at any given time. Cost cutting measures? At least annoying. Express pass does not give access to 3 very popular rides. Super friendly staff. Avoid restaurants inside - there are plenty great restaurants just outside the park.

name: user_8801
review: Another place of Interest to go to In Singapore is The Universal Studio which is located inside Genting Resort World Sentosa. It is a Must To Go if you are traveling down to Singapore. Where Families with Kids and Adults can enjoy the rides and spend the whole day bonding. Advise having an express ticket to enter in, as the normal ticket you have to wait for long hours for rides due to many will queue the most popular rides. This is the most Instagram picture place taken in Singapore. Have Fun and enjoy a great day with family and with Love.

name: user_8803
review: this is hardly a universal experience. more like a rip off of universal that theyve just chucked the name onto. nothing about movies here like the hollywood one. just really bad rides. all of the theme parks on the gold coast are wayyyyy better. for 169 between my partner and i, we will never ever visit back to this theme park. disgraceful. worst experience ive ever had at universal. DO NOT GO AND WASTE UR TIME. all of the staff are so incredibly rude, not accommodating, and very mean. i used to love universal. id never been to this one before but now its ruined my view on universal forever.

name: user_8806
