review: Go there when it's quiet for adrenaline games, so you can try the rides many times... Last Christmas edition there was snow but there wasn't much of a parade...

name: user_8811
review: The relatively small Universal Studios has a good number of visitors on weekdays, and the queue time for the most popular games is within 30 minutes. Recommended: Transformers, Shrek 4D Cinema, Live Camera Action!

name: user_8812
review: Very fun. Recommend traveling with family. Or friends will have more fun. But I recommend that you read the warnings on the equipment a little before playing. Because some rides look like they don't have much from the outside. But actually it's quite scary. You could have a heart attack. Haha. I came on a Sunday. Surprisingly there weren't many people. It was just the right amount of time, not overwhelming, but not too crowded. Overall, I recommend it if you come to Singapore. You have to come here.

name: user_8821
review: Great Theme park with great vibes. The only things I need to say is the wait for rides is a bit long and the food and drinks are a bit overpriced. Other than that, it was great!

name: user_8823
review: Its very nice place to have fun with friends and family ... rides are really awesome..

name: user_8824
review: amazing experience! must go to Mummy things.

name: user_8830
review: I book the tickets through Klook, which were much more cheaper than at the gates. Entire layout was fantastic from the gift shops to the food outlets, different themes in the overall space. Awesome rides & ambience was fitting for young children to adults who are young at heart. Overall, I enjoyed the day at USS SG with my partner as part of our birthday trips

name: user_8833
review: If you come here again after the epidemic, it is recommended that you consider buying a fast pass during the holidays. The queue time for popular facilities ranges from about 30 to 90 minutes. Except for Jurassic Park, the facilities in the park all have their own characteristics. It is recommended that you dont miss this spot when you come to Singapore. Its worth spending a day here. PS. Pre-booking tickets through Klook will be cheaper than on-site/its better to eat before entering the park

name: user_8837
review: Amazing! Good mix of rides and we went on a Friday so the lines weren't so bad. Maybe a ten minute wait per ride? The park opens at 11 but the rides don't open till 12 which was annoying, but that's sleepy Singapore! The jurassic park ride is 10/10! The food is either very touristy/American or very expensive (40 steaks etc) but theres a hawkers market outside and the beach clubs nearby for good food.

name: user_8838
review: A weekend well spent. Fun! If you are visiting on a weekend, I would recommend to go for express pass as it is very crowded, and you dont want to spend time just waiting in line.

name: user_8839
review: Visited during Chinese New Year my tip is don't do it! Waiting times of 70-110 minutes. If it rains they close the carousel & say others are open so they don't have to sit around and wait. But must give great praise to the guy who helped take pictures at Puss in Boots he gave everyone a smile on his face and was absolutely a big part of the positive experience for our family. His colleague however not as positive!

name: user_8840
review: Went to to the S.E.A Aquarium and made a lot of great memories there! The sea life was thriving and taken care of, I loved seeing the sea creatures all around me, and the touch pool was interesting. I went there in 2019 and visited the Maritime Museum and the learnt a lot about Singapore's history and famous figures. I also went to the HeadRock VR Cafe and greatly enjoyed the games and rides thanks to the analogue and digital technology. Would visit again! I'm looking forward to any upcoming attractions.

name: user_8846
review: After visiting the one in Japan few years ago, finally got a chance to visit this theme park. Actually, the park is not that big and not so many choices for the ride compared to other theme parks. My favorites is transformer ride since I don't have enough courage to ride Human vs Cyclon.

name: user_8848
review: Had a fantastic day at Universal Studios Singapore with my family! The setup was fantastic, including the gift shop, the food stands, and the many themes across the entire area! The lines for the rides were absurdly long, and each ride required at least an hour of waiting. But the wait was totally worthwhile! The staff was helpful and polite, and they did not tolerate customers who didn't line up or tried to skip the line. I'd want to express my gratitude to Melinda for her excellent assistance to my family and I. She went above and beyond to guide us through the theme park. I had an absolutely wonderful time here altogether, and I will definitely come back!

name: user_8850
review: Toilets unclean and mouldy. At least half of the food areas were closed when I attended. Many areas of the park not open or construction works were taking place.

name: user_8852
review: A must-visit destination for movie and theme park enthusiasts. The park boasts a variety of exciting rides, shows, and attractions based on popular franchises such as Transformers, Jurassic Park, and Minion Mayhem. The park's stunning and well-themed environments transport visitors to different worlds and provide a truly immersive experience. Food options are also diverse and delicious, offering something for everyone. Overall, Universal Studios Singapore is a thrilling and unforgettable experience that shouldn't be missed!

name: user_8853
review: I went to Halloween Horror Nights 2022 and it was so poorly organised it was awful and at times dangerous. The night started off by letting everyone in but not any further than the Main Street, which resulted in thousands of people crowded into the street crushing each other as people kept trying to move forward. This disaster waiting to happen was all so people could watch a show that only the few people at the very front could see or hear (they didnt even have speakers down the street). We stood for twenty minutes in this crush of people, in the intense heat with no airflow (since Main Street is covered), and when they finally opened the park properly after the show people just took off, shoving and running with some literally tripping over each other. Inside was pretty underwhelming as there were no decorations throughout the park, not even projections. It was also SO hot, everywhere! The park is crowded with buildings and the streets are covered in areas so there is no airflow. The water from the water bottle filling stations is even hot. The only places with air conditioning are a couple of restaurants. When we got in the lines at least werent as bad as people said, so we only waited an hour in line rather than 2-4 like we expected. The haunted houses were good, but youre through in less than ten minutes. The scare zones were okay but even shorter. And that was all there was to do unless you wanted to wait over 2 hours to go on one of the regular rides. There was one quick show but it was shortly after the park opened so we missed it while waiting in line for a haunted house. We paid extra for the behind the scenes tour which cost as much as park entry and took less than half an hour. This was the most underwhelming part as it was just looking at 3 costumes, seeing some optical illusion equipment, a very cool but quick dance group dressed as zombies, and a haunted maze that was just a few metres of scary props. The host was very good though. Overall the whole thing was a disappointment.

name: user_8854
review: Universal Studios Singapore has a complete overall planning, including exciting roller coasters, 4D cinemas, and musical carriages, which are suitable for the whole family to have fun together.

name: user_8859
review: It was an wonderful experience with my friends. Most of the riders are very interesting and scary specially the Mummy.

name: user_8862
review: It's not as big as I thought. If you go on a weekday, there won't be a long line and you can use everything, which is nice.

name: user_8864
review: Currently as is now not worth going alot of things there are not opened fully yet also compared to the USA universal I would say it's not worth it 400 sgd for 2 tickets and fast passes finished all major rides in an hour and half also alot of food places are not opened. Might be worth it when the park is fully opened

name: user_8865
review: Memories 1 feb 23 Traveling alone, I have work, I'm bored walking to the mall. Universal Singapore It is a lively and fun place. There are a few toys. But it's not a problem. We played the first 3 and almost vomited. Transformers, we lost to 5D a lot. We went out to rest and eat burgers. Continue with the rides in the Egyptian zone. Nothing at all. This one is very funny. For small children, it would be more appropriate than the name treasure hunt. Continuing on with the rides that we thought the kids were going to have, the dragons took them on a roller coaster. We like the Egyptian zone, take beautiful photos. Forget to look and see if there is a souvenir shop in the Egyptian area. But the restaurant is beautiful. Some restaurant sections are a bit too small. Because there are a lot of tourists Even on weekdays When we eat, we feel hungry at the same time. Every store is full. Luckily we were hungry a while ago so we had a seat Traveling alone, I don't get many photos. But overall I really like it. Come capture the atmosphere. P.S. You can buy your own USS entrance ticket through the vending machine in front of the entrance. In simple English, we pay by credit card. On the way, take bus number 123 from Hotel Mirama. On the way back, take the Skytrain Sentosa, get off at vivo city mall, then take the purple line, north east line, get off at outtarm, then connect to the brown line to havelock, walk a bit to our hotel. The return trip is much faster than expected. Next time, it's better to come by subway

name: user_8
review: Great experience unlimited rides and full of fun

name: user_8872
review: Great fun place however it is probably over rated because it's giving a slightly beaten down look because of deteriorated colours of fixed structures like the Elmo manequin, it's red paint is not that bright red due to rain / sunlight, the place needs a regular uplift. Few staff members were quite gloomy looking and not welcoming like in other Universal Studios around the world. Mostly the staff is very helpful and give good safety tips, but they are not that enthusiastic like they seem to not like their job. The rides are fantastic especially, The mummy, transformers, shrek 4d, jurrasic park ride and roller coaster cylon. Recommended to download universal Studios app before going in, as it shows all rides actual waiting time so you can plan accordingly where to go when. Overall a memorable experience and the kids loved it. Thank you Universal Studio and please take the criticism positively, so that the place can improve.

name: user_8873
review: Buy the fast pass. The wait for the ride length isn't worth it. Had fun over all but can't say I would need to go a second time. Jurassic Park was the best!

name: user_8877
review: It's wonderful place you must go. specially roller coasters that make you screaming whole day.but I don't like all the waiting area for Roller coasters where are narrow and can't take breath specially now COVID timing need wear mask.

name: user_8879
review: Amazing place but a day is not enough, go for fast express tickets

name: user_8882
review: Just awesome....!! The theme park is inside resorts world santosa. We had visited the mai theme park of Universal studios in Lod Angeles, USA. They have put up exact same theme park here also. You better buy the tickets in advance online. Cause this place is always crowded with tourists. All rides and shows here are awesome. Roller coasters are awesome. There is something for every age groups. Special mentions are the Transformers and The Mummy 4D rides....they are just awesome . There are some small rides for kids also. Kids just love to see Bumblebee and Optimus Prime all dressed up and moving..... Toilets are everywhere, eateries and ice cream parlors, pizza shops. There is also a parade of all universal studio characters dressed up in the afternoon. Don't miss santosa and universal studios if you are in Singapore...

name: user_8885
review: I arrived at the 11 o'clock entrance, but there were a lot of people waiting. Transformers was a really good attraction, and Shrek 4D was okay, but the other attractions weren't as good. I was especially disappointed with Mummy. When there are a lot of people, it's really a continuous wait. At Disneyland, there are a lot of people, so there are a lot of fun things to do even if you wait or don't have to ride the attractions, but Universal Studios O seems to be a bit weak in that aspect. Still, Transformers was so much fun. So much so that I want to visit again to ride this.

name: user_8890
review: Must visit if you are on a holiday to Singapore. If you have never been on a rollercoaster ever in your life, then DO NOT start with CYLON. CYLON is the most craziest ride in USS. Start with mummy and then human or Jurrasic Park and then last CYLON if you still have the iron balls to do so. Get the express and it is a bloody worthy time saver. You can do more with express. USS needs a day entirely because SEA Aquarium closes at 5. Don't get both tickets for same day. Go visit all rides once you are in!

name: user_8891
review: Poor management of opening hours makes this park congested and frustrating to visit. I don't understand why, although the park opens at 11am, some attractions inside are only active from 2pm. This obviously has repercussions on the fact that thousands of people flock together into the only open activities, creating queues of no less than 60-70 minutes. In 5 hours we only managed to do 4 attractions lasting a few minutes. If it is true that time is money, it is absolutely worth taking the express pass together with the entrance ticket to skip (part of) the queues.

name: user_8894
review: Very dated theme park, rides were okay, had more fun just walking through each area.

name: user_8900
review: A place to enjoy holidays with family and adrenaline tests. unfortunately it's hard to find a place to pray for muslims.

name: user_8901
review: We recommend visiting during times when it is not crowded, such as weekends. If you rush in the morning, it won't take long to wait for the main attractions even if you don't use the express. However, the prices of the food you buy inside are extremely outrageous. It's tasteless. After you're done with your hunger, it's a good idea to buy some outside Sentosa Island.

name: user_8902
review: It was one of the main attractions to visit during this trip to Singapore. Unfortunately, the weather was not kind and it rained heavily. Indians love to jump in line

name: user_8906
review: Seems like a great resort but unfortunately we never had the opportunity to find out for ourselves. We were there for all of 5 minutes before my sister fell off a poorly marked curb and broke her arm. We had bought 6 tickets and vouchers for a combined cost of approximately 600. This ruined both our day and also our New Years Eve. A compassionate organisation would offer us return tickets at the very least. Unfortunately Universal Studios have not done so. They made a few bucks that day Im sure, so showing us some compassion and offering return tickets at the very least would not be too much to ask no? Unless they really are a heartless, unempathetic, corporate conglomerate? Avoid if you can, there are less artificial family days out in Singapore

name: user_8910
review: It is highly recommended to buy tickets in advance to avoid queuing on long lines. Without much patience, you may opt to buy the universal express add on to get priority access on attraction.

name: user_8914
review: I would recommend "Ancient Egypt".

name: user_8920
review: The place is ok There is entertainment for children & adults

name: user_8921
review: Universal Studios Singapore brings together the world's most popular movie themes: Transformers, Jurassic Park, Minions, etc., and realistically restores movie scenes! Universal Studios Singapore lets you immerse yourself in the action and experience the movies. Experience state-of-the-art rides, shows and attractions inspired by your favorite blockbuster movies and TV shows, including The Adventures of Brawler, Battlestar Galactica: Man vs. RobotTM, Transformers 3D: The Last Stand, Jurassic River AdventureTM, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Battle and more!

name: user_8922
review: No matter how many times you come, it's always fun.

name: user_8923
review: Most awful place I ever been. Small park that can't handle all people. You are in line for 1 to 2 hrs and can't make more than 4 rides on a whole day because of the que. Almost no restaurant and the one there is sell garbage to high place. I nearly vomit on a Cafe that sell food because it's so bad and overpriced. I don't recommend to spend time here except you want to waste time.

name: user_8924
review: Absolute rubbish. We never expected it to live up to Universal Florida, but this place is a joke. Does not open until 11a.m. We were straight in as we arrived 45mins early. Then we find that most the main rides dont open until 12, seriously. Then we find out waterworld is permanently closed as is 1/4 of the park. which is being remodelled. The rest of the rides are OK if youve never been to a theme park anywhere, but if you have dont expect too much. The park is also tired and not maintained well at all. Paint peeling off everywhere, and clearly not kept the way either the Florida or California parks are. A total waste of money. Shame on you Universal.

name: user_8925
review: Universal Studios, "where an Adult can be a kid!" Best ride, hands down, at Universal Studios Singapore is The Mummy! Don't matter me there, beat me!

name: user_8926
review: A fun tourist spot for wealthy families. Hehehe

name: user_8927
review: A lot of fun things to do but they aren't worth the time to wait in line

name: user_8929
review: I was able to buy an Express ticket, use it quickly, and save time.

name: user_8935
review: Pretty fun park that could use some updates. I'd come again when they update the rides.

name: user_8940
review: There are not as many attractions as you might think. There were many places under construction. Still, the roller coaster was fun, and the products were cute and nice.

name: user_8944
review: Having a great time here, better buy tickets online to avoid long queue. Also download Universal SG app by sentosa to know how long queue at each rides, so we can plan accordingly.

name: user_8948
review: The whole park is small During the Chinese New Year, renovations, and rain, many facilities were closed. The advantage is that there are not many people and every game can be played

name: user_8949
review: Great place for both kids and adults to enjoy. Please note that Universal Studios is closed on Tuesday, so plan your travel accordingly.

name: user_8954
review: Due to rain couldn't do some rides. 3d rides awesome We went on Sunday and that too Chinese new year, waiting time for rides more than 1 hr

name: user_8956
review: It's nice, but small compared to those in Orlando and Hollywood. In Singapore it rains a lot, that's why there are several covered areas. The castle from the Shreck movie is great and is not in other parks. To save time in lines, use the single rider line.

name: user_8958
review: Ahhh Universal. I've been to you 3 times and it's still not enough. I bought the express pass unlimited and can definitely say it was well worth it since I got to go on each ride 8 times. Previously without the pass I only got to go on rides once. So if you're an adrenaline junkie like me you will love it

name: user_8960
review: Great place to have fun with kids and family but its very crowded nowadays! Better to buy express entry tickets instead of normal tickets.

name: user_8961
review: Wonderful place. We saw that it had various amenities everywhere, though; the line could be better.

name: user_8962
review: singapore traveler are come from all parts of the world... recommend to get express ticket:)

name: user_8963
review: Dynamic attractions. Good. Second 6. My son is dizzy. It's a little less thrilling, but I think I've ridden the Hurum Ride(?) 5 times. Mummy and Human are a bit scary. It seems like it's full of thrills.

name: user_5749
review: Had the most fun with my friends here, if you're planning to ride the Jurassic Park, prepare change of clothes upper and lower. Even with poncho we still got wet. Ride the Mummy it is fun too and the Cylon Ride.

name: user_8969
review: It's really fun to play with kids, especially the many unexpected rides.

name: user_8970
review: A lovely place for family Fun and thrill. All rides are must go.

name: user_8972
review: Universal Studios Singapore 4.6 Theme park in Singapore

name: user_8973
review: Distinctive, beautiful and fun to spend a perfect day, but I recommend going on weekdays due to the extreme crowding on the weekends. Tickets for adults are 82 Singapore dollars and children are 70 Singapore dollars, but I strongly recommend that you purchase an Express Pass to avoid a long wait for the rides.

name: user_8975
review: Love universal Studios nice place if you love movies came here once years ago wish can come again but the rides kinda outdated, they need to update the rides quite old

name: user_8976
review: Rides, jurassic park are the center of attraction. It was superb. You can spend a day there

name: user_8978
review: Most of the rides are good but last time I went the queue was very long. I waited for an hour in the queue. The longest rides for me are the transformer and the roller coaster. If you don't want to wait you must buy an express pass. Express pass makes you just have to wait for the ride rounds. If you buy the normal one you must not forget to go to the toilet before getting into the queue.

name: user_8980
review: Really good theme park. Recommended - Transformers, Revenge of the mummy (Waiting time could be long, but worth the wait)

name: user_8989
review: Not that great...Just couple of exciting land games. Kids will love it but not an exciting place for teens and adults. Please go on weekends. If not, it will be more boring. Not worth the ticket price. Fast track entry is just a means of money waste. Over-all a good place to spend 5 hours and decent 5 restuarants with different cuisines.

name: user_8996
review: What can I say, you must be there to have a great day. Lots of rides, fun, suitable for all ages lots of walking so be prepared. Must spend one full day and must go for express pass as there are always long queues.

name: user_8998
review: Good place to visit having multiple option to roam around in Singapore, aquarium and casino is nearby

name: user_8999
review: Use KLook or Kkday to buy tickets cheaper in advance. The Universal Express Pass is very handy to make your money's worth.

name: user_9000
review: Some events not open. Food venues were limited, staffing? Not too crowded this Friday.

name: user_9001
review: Nice park. Not 5 stars because it lacks numbers of more thrilling attractions, and shows/performances. Also because it lacks proper food. Only 3 thrilling attractions: 1) Cylon 8/10 thrill 2) Human 7/10 thrill 3) Mummy 5/10 thrill Food very expensive and poor quality, as expected. Since they charge so much, at least they should offer good food. Express pass very expensive and not required during my visit (20.01.23). Pro tip- use single person queuing if you don't have the express pass, it saved me a lot of queuing time.

name: user_9002
review: It's small, but it's okay to play for a day. I recommend Shrek 4D!

name: user_9003
review: It's so much fun, you can bring your own food, and you can ride all of them. But you have to get fast to ride those because the universal studio is until 6 pm only, i dont know why its because Chinese new year is coming.

name: user_9006
review: On weekends, there may be some waiting time even if you purchase an express ticket.

name: user_9007
review: Roller coaster delay, jurassic Park delay. Expensive drink and food. Long Q. Not recommended. Not worth at all.

name: user_9008
review: We had great fun. Our to most features rides are Transformer and Egypt rollercoaster. My suggestion is if you want to enjoy the whole facility with waiting in line for hours in every Ride then get a Express Pass tick which worth it. Also buy tickets online before you go there.

name: user_9012
review: It was fun. But all attractions are under staffed and had to wait longer than it should. The experience should have been more exciting...

name: user_9017
review: Small version of Disney World

name: user_9018
review: The queue was short during weekday. Having fun with friends. Too bad madagascar theme park is closed for renovation.

name: user_9021
review: It's not too big, so I can play well from the time I go in at 1 o'clock until it ends at 6 o'clock. After finishing, I took pictures and left around 6:30.

name: user_9026
review: It is recommended that you start with Jurassic Park's Drift Boat ride, which will take a long time to queue up. On the other hand, Transformers, The Mummy, and Roller Coaster can queue up faster. The food is very expensive, and the park is more suitable for swiping cards. Be careful when using cash without change!

name: user_9031
review: Fantastic experience Very fun to go with friends and family. Alot of rides to enjoy and a good amount of spots to take photos

name: user_9032
review: Was overcrowded and half of the park was closed for renovation. The food was subpar and barely eatable.

name: user_9033
review: Extraordinary experience. Best place for movie enthusiasts. Transformers are the best. Although some rides are under maintenance and they are coming up with something new in the Madagascar section, its also quite good.

name: user_9034
review: The entrance ticket is expensive. If time is tight, just take a photo on this globe.

name: user_9035
review: Small but okay to visit. Express pass recommended

name: user_9036
review: One of the must visit place when you come to Singapore... Theme play ground for all age with complete game rides, not only the adrenaline rushing game but also a game that family friendly. Since many tourist come to here, so the long queues aren't avoided but you can buy the express ticket to cut the waiting time.

name: user_9037
review: Went when under renovation 01/23 so everything was a little limited, definitely buy the express pass.

name: user_9042
review: Woah..... if you miss this place than there is no pint in going in Singapore. I am thankful to god that it was not in my itinerary but still I managed to visit there. This place requires complete one day. Tickets are available online and preferably take online tickets only. Very well connected with buses , taxi and metro. You need to walk a little at this place. The public buses are extremely good and economical. If you want to take a taxi than download the grab app. This place is consists of various shows and rides. We were able to attend 7 shows out of probably 12 in complete day. And Transformer and Mummys return shoes are must must watch. These shows will bring breadth out of you. Simply mind blowing.

name: user_9048
review: The rides and overall experience was wonderfull. It brings out the child in you

name: user_9054
review: There are a lot of people there on Mondays. You have to wait for about 80 minutes for some rides, and you have to queue to death. The roller coaster you want to ride after 4 pm is said to be closed. Another Egyptian roller coaster is said to be repaired due to technical problems. It is a pain to pay for it. You cant play what you want. Not to mention that Madagascar is still under renovation and has not opened. It is recommended to come once and save lunch.

name: user_9055
review: I bet it's smaller but just nice for a trip day. Must try: Mummy ride, Transformer ride, Jurassic canopy and Jurassic splash. Can't recall the actual name.. but you'll know when you visit. Of course, human n cyclone if you are game. For citizen, buy online it's cheaper. I bought using phone just before going in.

name: user_9058
review: Great place for a weekend! Definitely book tickets in advance because it sells out on the spot. Would recommend getting the express unlimited pass to avoid queues for rides.

name: user_9059
review: Amazing ride experiance specially the Mummy and Transformer...

name: user_9060
review: Overall it is good, but the Madagascar park was closed.

name: user_9062
review: The wait was quite long because I went during New Year's. But it was fun and the place was beautiful.

name: user_9063
review: Open from 11 am - 6 pm, felt a bit short but still managed to go into most attractions. Longest queue time was Transformers and that took an hour or so. We went during a weekday so I imagine it will be much busier in the weekend. Overall we had a good time and enjoyed the time in the park.

name: user_9065
review: Madagascar area closed

name: user_9068
review: Not as busy as when it's school holidays. Although there are also school age children who come. There's no need to buy express tickets because the queue only takes around 10-30 minutes. Enter at 13.00, at 17.00 you can finish all the games, some even twice. Use the single rider route if you want to go fast.

name: user_9069
review: Meh experience, waiting long long lines and then having a 10 second ride. Not really worth it, they don't even go around twice. Just once then done. But what redeemed it was the special guests that were there. Elmo and friends as well as Kung Fu Panda

name: user_9070
review: Experienced less HALAL food outlets. Briyani rice per plate was priced at 16, relatively on high side. Should enticed visitors with reasonable price. Few merchandise items were old stock from pre-covid19 period. Some of the t-shirts design were to outdated but was priced at 38. Time was shortened compared to pre-covid19.

name: user_9080
review: The park is quite large and has many things to do. As a reminder, if you want to have more fun, be sure to purchase a fast pass ticket. Because there are too many tourists, there are basically a bunch of people queuing up for each event. If you dont buy a quick pass, you will have to queue for an average of two or three hours for each event. Your legs will become weak when you stand. When its your turn to play, you will no longer be in the mood. Quick pass is similar to jumping in line. Although it is more expensive, you still have to buy it if you have no choice.

name: user_9088
review: I bought admission tickets and express tickets in advance at Privia. You can print the entry barcode or show it as a PDF file on your smartphone to enter. As soon as you enter the front door, go to customer service on the far left and receive the wristband shown in the photo. Should I go for unlimited express rides or just one ride each? I thought about it and decided to go with unlimited rides, but in the end, it was a good decision. Although it was a burden in terms of cost, I had no choice but to continue riding one or two attractions due to the rain that started in the afternoon, but the regular waiting lines were quite long. I recommend The Mummy and Transformers. Especially Cylon! Humans are a bit childish. You can get there by monorail or cable car, but for a family of four, it is also recommended to take Grab. It costs about 18 Sing dollars when I go and when I come back. Just take a picture of Casino Area 2 and get off or get on!

name: user_9089
review: An unforgettable first experience. The rides are all fun

name: user_9090
review: If you go at the opening time, you can ride popular attractions with almost no waiting time.

name: user_9091
review: A disappointment if you go with kid younger than 10. Most place is closed. Not much to do with younger kid. Works on main heat hours. We arrver at 11 and finished everything till 14. Not recommended especially it cost a lot money and not worth it

name: user_9092
review: This place is highly recommended to visit. Provide sufficient time.

name: user_9095
review: Easy to navigate, short queues this time of year. Favorite rides Transformers, Revenge of The Mummy, and Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure.

name: user_9098
review: We had a great time. Lots of cool rides. Busy but no longer wait than 40 minutes. Transformers was the top ride. We were there early January. Bring an umbrella as there was a good downpour for 90 minutes in the afternoon but not a daily occurance. Get there at 11 as you will need the whole day. I recommend the samosas at the Ancient Egypt cafe.

name: user_9103
review: Great place! Kids loved it! Specially the Jurassic park

name: user_9105
review: It is ok, very smaller one compared to Florida or LA ones. Overcrowded that even the express pass takes more than 30 minutes for each attraction. If your group has only adults/grown ups then better try the individual rider option, it moves much faster than express and free!!

name: user_9108
review: Nice place to enjoy. Note that lockers are chargeable as per the time selected for which you are renting it. If by mistake you exceed the time, it will still be locked and when you are back you can pay for extra hours utilised.

name: user_9112
review: Bad attitude customer services around this park 5 years ago everything was better

name: user_9114
review: Need advance planning of which rides to go 1st in order to save time from queueing. Kids are enjoying the rides and meeting the cartoon characters

name: user_9116
review: Amazing place, must visit in SG if you love adventures in Rollercoaster.

name: user_9117
review: Worth visiting, be sure to book a day in prior, also get the fast pass because they sold out

name: user_9118
review: To cover all possible rides just enter the park and start with the rides that are far away from entrance then work you way back dont miss transformer ride ( but visit it last or later will be a long queue in the first )

name: user_9121
review: Best theme park I ever visit but so crowded during weekends

name: user_9122
review: It's not as big as I thought, but it's still good

name: user_9125
review: Definitely visit after Dec peak period is a good choice. Queues are shorter and we managed to cover all major rides in 6 hrs w spare for quick lunch. Buying tickets on the day last minute also saved us 5% discount.

name: user_9127
review: The place is great and the attractions look awesome. Unfortunately I chose the wrong time to visit the place (Christmas Eve) and the place was crowded and the queue was excessively long. Some planning is required to fully utilise the ticket price or cough up more money to buy priority queue (which I found hard to find).

name: user_9129
review: I realized we didn't have enough photos during our USS visit! We were so spent lining up in different attractions hahaaa! We went to Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure, Transformers 3D Ride, Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase, and Lights Camera Action. We almost tried the Ancient Egypt ride but we chickened out hahaha. A must-visit if you're touring SG!

name: user_9130
review: Amazing setup and joyful environment. Will take whole day to cover all attraction points. Among rides, Transformer & Mummy are amazing. Just reach here at the earliest otherwise will have to wait long in queues on entry and in rides.

name: user_9132
review: What a wonderful place, i've bee twice there

name: user_9134
review: One of the best place to visit. Indians feels entry cost high . If those who had already visit ramoji film City. They may feel it is deto but more rides and activities available in SG studio. Good place to for photo lovers.

name: user_9135
review: An entertainment venue for all the age. However the queques are mostly long long long Ang long

name: user_9144
review: The rides are awesome but worth buying the express tickets. Singapore is too hot to be waiting an hour to get on a ride. Also better to buy the tickets at universal.

name: user_9149
review: Don't go on Public Holiday. More pricey but most rides and shops are closed....

name: user_9150
review: Disappointing period. Only open for 7 hours, from 11am till 6pm. Couldn't enjoy much due to covid, i.e. no live show, Madagascar park is closed, queue will take way over 1 hour each, they allow unlimited passes for express now (thus expect 2 to 3 times from each customer and longer queue for normal pass)

name: user_9153
review: Universal Studios Singapore (abbreviation: USS) is a theme park located within Resorts Universal Sentosa in Sentosa, Singapore. It includes 28 rides, shows and entertainment destinations in seven themed areas. It is one of six Universal Studios theme parks around the world. It was a key component of Genting Singapore's bid to gain the right to build Singapore's second integrated resort (IR). On 8 December 2006, the Singapore government announced that the consortium had won the bid. Construction of the theme park and the rest of the resort began on April 19, 2007. It is the second Universal Studios theme park in Asia, the other being Universal Studios Japan in Osaka, and the first in Southeast Asia. Official plans for the park were first revealed to the public when Universal Studios Singapore released a map of the entire park on October 20, 2009. [1] Universal Studios Singapore attracted more than 2 million visitors in the nine months of its opening. [2] The park officially began operations on May 28, 2011. More than 3 million guests visited the park in its opening year. Since then, Universal Studios Singapore has received approximately 4 million visitors every year. Most visitors are local Singaporeans as well as tourists from other Asian countries in the area. It was marketed by Universal Parks & Resorts as a "unique theme park in Asia" and that the park was the only one of its kind in Southeast Asia for the foreseeable future. [3] According to the AECOM Theme Index Global Attendance Report, Universal Studios Singapore is one of the best visited theme parks/theme parks worldwide amendment Construction of Resorts World Sentosa and Universal Studios Singapore began on April 19, 2008. After nearly two years of construction, the park opened on March 18, 2010. Universal Studios Singapore was opened for a "sneak peek week" in light of Chinese New Year celebrations, from 5pm to 9pm every night between 14 and 21 February 2010. [5] Although visitors had to pay S10 to enter the park even though the rides were not operating, tickets for the week sold out in two days. On March 5, 2010, it was announced that the park would open at 8:28 a.m. (UTC8) on March 18, 2010 for the soft opening phase. As of March 13, 2010, Resorts World Sentosa team members and their families have had the opportunity to visit the park before the public has the opportunity to do so. [6] The park had a soft opening period from March 18, 2010 to October 26, 2010. [7] The park's official grand opening was held on May 28, 2011, along with a "Grand Opening Ceremony" held on the evening of May 27, 2011. There were Asian personalities Jet Li, Maggie Cheung, Chow Wei, and former American Idol judge Paula Abdul, who appeared at the ceremony, along with about 1,600 guests. [8] On 21 October 2011, Universal Studios Singapore began its Halloween Horror Nights events. [9] On 3 April 2019, Genting Group announced the expansion of Universal Studios Singapore to two new areas, Minion Land and Super Nintendo World

name: user_9154
review: Had a great time. There are many activities to do. Went during Christmas 2022 and got the chance to watch Santa's circus, it was delightful. Cylon ride is not for the faint of heart. I enjoyed the curse of the phero ride and the transformers ride. Definitely download the map with the QR code available at the entrace and check the waiting times. There were lot of meal options available at many places. During our visit the water world was closed. The jurasic world water ride was the best of all the jurasic world rides. Watched the 4D shrek movie at far far away. Definitely watch Lights Camera Action by Steven Spilberg. All in all a wonderful experience and worth the money spent.

name: user_9157
review: I probably just came here on a bad day because I left pretty disappointed. I came to Singapore Universal Studios a lot of times in the past but I can tell their standard has dropped quite a lot. Firstly, the transformers ride broke down not once, but twice! The first time I was in the roller coaster itself when it suddenly stopped working. We had to wait in our seats for a pretty long time (20 minutes)I did not queue too long for the ride because I went for the single rider line but I still waited for about 30 minutes before boarding the ride. There were people beside me that waited up to 100 minutes just for the ride to break down! Luckily the staff gave everyone a one time express ticket that could be used for other rides but honestly, I just wished that the ride was working. The second time happened when we were queuing. We decided to return to give the transformers ride another chance by queuing again. We queued for another 30 mins and right before we could board the ride, an announcement came informing us that the ride broke down AGAIN. We had to leave again disappointed as the transformers ride was one of my favourites. The food choices in USS was also pretty bad. The food tastes mediocre and extremely expensive! I recommend all of you to leave USS and eat at other restaurants that Sentosa has and return after you finished eating. Would not recommend eating in USS itself. Also the Madagascar ride and Waterworld is unavailable as the Madagascar ride is being changed into a minion ride. Waterworld used to be one of my favourite shows in USS but for some reason, they closed it Overall, I am extremely disappointed in USS, which used to be my favourite theme park.

name: user_9159
review: i had so much fun visiting here! went on all the rides & the 4D quality is truly top notch! especially love the transformers one, really felt like im meeting optimus prime

name: user_9161
review: So much fun activities here but the waiting time is too long.

name: user_9162
review: Seems to be good when you are single rider , I have been a single rider and completed all rides twice in a day. Rollercoasters Could be more better.

name: user_9169
review: The queue is too long. the child becomes restless

name: user_9171
review: Very crowded and lines everywhere. The express pass is another rip off. Shortens the queue a bit. Best attraction was transformers. Rest were just meh. So much commercialisation.

name: user_9173
review: Managed about 2 rides each. Waiting time over 40 minutes. Told little one was right height at door and after queuing told he wasnt. Poured heavily with rain and not possible to get to another ride without being drenched. Total rip off. So expensive and impossible to get any value from it. Ill stick to the Zoo in future.

name: user_9175
review: DO NOT go here during public holidays unless you have express pass. The wait time almost 1,5 hour for 1 attraction, the park opened from 11am to 6pm so you just have 7 hours to enjoy the attraction which is impossible

name: user_9176
review: Good for kids but do check the minimum height requirements for the rides to be sure. Check the USS site but a 120cm tall kid should be able to ride a lot of the rides, just depends how game they are. If they've never ridden a roller coaster before, the Jurassic Park's Canopy Flyer is a good introduction. My 6yo at the time of writing, who was excited to try "roller coasters", told me that's scary enough. Worth buying the express tickets too especially if you arrive some time after it opens. Note there are rides that you can't use it on, so do check the USS website. When we went, the Canopy Flyer was one of them, but we got in at the start of the day so there was no queue. Photos with the movie characters were ok but disappointed when they didn't turn up when it was raining. The photo taking place was under cover.... Food was meh and expensive, but expected of a theme park I guess.

name: user_9178
review: Was OK Not as big as expected but good enough I realize theme parks exploit parents with exorbitant food prices but even then universal was on another level Issue is not enough stalls to buy water You're forced into a full eatery and wait in line to just buy bottled water

name: user_9179
review: Great place to have fun with friends and family or even your loved ones! Will definitely be back with my family again to try other attractions we havent tried yet.

name: user_9185
review: Really disappointed with our family excursion to USS. Paid 349 AUD to enter. Spent over 3 hrs in queues to see 3 attractions. Transformers attraction was quite good, but not worth a 90 min wait at 11.15 am. Waited 65 min for Jurassic Park water ride which still way too long for that type of attraction. Waited 50 min for another Jurassic park ride that lasted maybe 20 seconds. Then we spent over 50 AUD on 4 tiny boxes of fries, 1 single ice cream and 3 coke floats. By 4pm I could not wait another 60 min to go on the large roller coaster. Too jaded by then. I've been to better amusement parks and Waited less time. I wasn't prepared to spend over 700 AUD to have express passes, where even some of those wait times were up to 40 min at some points during the day. There is no embellishments I'm my review, just exactly how we perceived our day at USS.

name: user_9187
review: Buy an Express Pass

name: user_9189
review: This is one of the best places I've visited in Singapore. There are so many fun-filled rides. The roller coasters such as "Revenge of the mummy", "Battlestar galactica" , "Canopy Flyer: jurassic park" were truly amazing. The "Transformers: the Ride 3d" was such an adrenaline rush. The "lights camera action!" by Steven Spielberg was great. "Shrek 4d" was really good. I went during the Christmas day 2022, the crowd was a bit large. So the wait time was a little long. But it was worth it.

name: user_9190
review: Must visit place with many attractions. Since visited in weekend and peak year-end wait time was more for all rides. Only one problem is that we don't have any veg food options here except for corn and watermelon. It would be great if they introduce some veg options for food here.

name: user_9191
review: Entertaining but unfortunately I am motion sickness and felt dizzy after the rides but my family enjoyed it

name: user_9195
review: very good vacation spot and lots of games

name: user_9197
review: Good ride options! Ive been to USS several times but each time I go theres some or the other renovations happening due to which I have been unable to enjoy my favourite rides. Some of the more popular rides have very long waiting times of more than 2 hours, which spoils the fun experience.

name: user_9198
review: Top much waiting time. Administration should either speed up the whole system or sell limited tickets. Otherwise, there is no use to visit this park

name: user_9201
review: first time visit. You need to purchase an express ticket if you are visiting before noon. in the afternoon around 3-4 pm visitors have decreased a lot, there are almost no queues. the mummy and transformers are the best for me. I visited during New Year so there was a Santa Circus event at 7 pm

name: user_9203
review: Awesome, but too much of crowd. 120mins queue for every ride

name: user_9204
review: Visited last in 2018. Had a great time. The Transformer's 3-D ride was amazing. Battlestar Galactica both rides, human and cylon, were also amazing. Among the old school rides The Mummy (based on the Brendar Fraser movie) was good. Food available inside the theme park was also pretty good. Go for the Express Pass if you want to enjoy the best rides.

name: user_9205
review: went during halloween horror nights, super fun

name: user_9206
review: It's a bit small. So its easy to move around. Even when it comes out, it just comes out haha. Admission ticket: Korea free pass (admission and rides are both available) Express (like the Korea Q Pass. It doesnt seem like you can make a reservation in advance. Theres no need to do that. This is just the waiting time) Since they said this and that, I just purchased the admission ticket online through a Korean website and went. There seem to be a lot of people when you enter, but how do you get on? There are fewer people around 3 or 4 p.m., so it's good. Just buy the admission ticket and eat with that money. The hot dog set is delicious. If you plan to stay all day, you can purchase an admission ticket. If you want to leave before 3pm, use the admission ticket express. It takes some waiting time in the beginning.

name: user_9209
review: We visited during the Christmas vacation time so there was a lot of wait time (1hr) for most rides. But its worth the visit. Most rides dont allow purse/ bags or loose items so its better to find a locker before you enter the queue (otherwise you lose your place in the queue). There are lockers at the entrance to the park and also at all the rides that have this requirement of no loose baggage.

name: user_9211
review: We're having so much fun but unfortunately some attractions was under renovation

name: user_9212
review: Theme parks are always tough. When we got through the gate we stopped at Starbucks to re-center ourselves after waiting in the heat. i would recommend buying the express/priority pass. Wait times were really long. We only rode one ride.

name: user_9218
review: To me its our Best attraction in Singapore.. try their halloween night. Its my bucket list of must try once in your lifetime

name: user_9224
review: please aware every Tue is closure. Weekday even takes 1 hr up for each game.

name: user_9227
review: Rides are of high quality and well-designed. Safety is number one in Universal Studio, so dont worry. Its quite crowded and queue can be up to an hour for a ride, so its recommended to get express ticket to make your time worth. Must visit when youre going to Singapore. Compared to other Universal Studio, Singapore one is quite small. I went here multiple times and here is my last visit for Halloween Horror Night.

name: user_9228
review: Fun rides.. don't miss the 5D ride. The only issue with this ride is the queuing process. The way the lane is constructed is so ridiculous. I felt so claustrophobic. There was no staff for assistance.

name: user_9236
review: Lots of games inside, mainly thrilling games. The play area is suitable for children. Ticket price is 110 Singapore dollars for adults

name: user_9238
review: Good place to visit with Family, kids will enjoy the theme parks, rides are ok.

name: user_9242
review: First, as a Thai person who doesn't like to wait in long lines. I recommend purchasing an Express ticket, as it helps a lot. If you don't purchase an Express ticket, you may have to wait in line for 2-3 hours on some rides. If you're only going to be able to ride a few stations, boredom will replace the fun. And that day will be the day you are not impressed. The most impressive player Egypt looks like a museum at first glance. But once you enter, it becomes an extremely thrilling roller coaster. Adding to the fear of darkness It's a plaything that isn't child friendly at all. Please prepare yourself for the thrill and fear first. Transformers the ride is a simulator that projects 3D images as if we were actually in the vehicle. It is very fun and realistic. Human vs. Cylon, this one is the most brutal, a rollercoaster. Human rides on a train, while Cylon hangs his legs and plays with his hands completely numb. The greatest thrill has to be these two. The three types above are my favorites, but there are many others that I'm also impressed by. But if you don't want to lose your temper and waste all day waiting in line. Don't forget to buy Express tickets before entering. Have a fun trip.

name: user_9245
review: Went during New Year's, 31-12-2022. The amusement park is open from 11:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Book tickets online easily and conveniently. It is considered that there are fewer people than expected. Most of them are willing to pay express. It turns out that for some rides, queuing normally isn't slow. There aren't many rides. Downloading the universal Singapore app helps a lot. You can definitely pick up all the rides in one day. Introducing Transformer (available only in Singapore, elsewhere it will be Spiderman) and Shrek 4D.

name: user_9247
review: I dont understand why you need to line up to buy a fast pass - seems to defeat the purpose of those willing to pay a premium not to wait. Clearly understaffed too, as on one of the busiest days of the year (26 Dec), at least half the food options were closed, leading to long queues for food

name: user_9248
review: The Rollercoaster was crazy (Battlestar Galactica- human) absolutely loved it! Nice atmosphere there

name: user_9249
review: Attractions are great! Revenge of the Mummy TRANSFORMERS the ride Battlestar Galactica:SYLON Battlestar Galactica:HUMAN The roller coaster will be lined up in a row after depositing luggage in a locker in advance The waiting time of the official app is a reference level The Christmas season is full of people and the capacity of restaurants is insufficient USJ

name: user_9252
review: 100% entertainment, some events were closed due to covid issues but it is fascinating to get to know this amusement park

name: user_9253
review: Really disappointed. After visiting Disneyland in Japan a couple of years ago we were looking forward to Universal Singapore. It was a huge disappointment. Too many people let in - even the fast pass was slow. 2 hour waits at all rides. The food line was ridiculous and the food revolting!!

name: user_9255
review: Marvelous! Although one day would never be enough for the main attractions, it is very worth it! Transformers, the best attraction ever!

name: user_9256
review: Full of people who want to enter U Studio..

name: user_1055
review: Lots of fun for all Please come early as there are huge lines but they move very quick. Highly recommended buying the express pass to by pass the wait lines

name: user_9264
review: Lack of rides allow Express Pass and the line up is still too long for some rides with express pass. Too expensive to purchase Express passes for only able to use for less than 5 rides.

name: user_9265
review: You can relive your childhood dreams here!

name: user_9270
review: Good to have one time experience. Food options can be better. Safety is given extreme importance (Rides are not allowed during heavy rain and lightings). Express pass is useful if you are short of time and not a local. River Rapids was great fun!!

name: user_9271
review: FOSSIL FUEL SCAM ALERT! Havent been to USS since 2020 March. Today when I went back, the service was horrible. Even the staff agreed that their menu was a scam. Waited 30mins to order my food and 20mins for the food to come. They changed the tater tots to fries without telling us. The fries didnt even come in a cup. The order came was nothing like advertised. Horrible experience at Fossil Fuel. The standard of service has dropped tremendously... Definitely will not recommend tourist to come.

name: user_9272
review: Needs an update. Wait times for everything are way too long.

name: user_9273
review: A must visit when in Singapore. Lots of rides and attractions, plus meet and greet with characters of Universal Studios movies such as Transformers. Recommended to buy express pass especially for first timers (note: a small number of rides doesnt have express lane).

name: user_9274
review: Christmas parade - nothing surprising though nevertheless being a nice show Number of visitors - seems reaching the max for the whole last week of 2022. Number of tourists seem to have increased quite significantly Most rides have relatively short queue from 4pm onwards. Really no point rush there early so to be in a 2 hours queue when you can do the same ride with 20 mins queue at 6pm

name: user_9275
review: Family Fun !! Located within resorts world sentosa at Sentosa. Features one of the best roller coaster rides! Cyclone and Human- not for the faint hearted. There are at least 5 themed zones attractions , unfortunately they dont have Harry Potter. Make sure when you come here always check the weather coz they will just postponed the highlight parade if its raining! Visited Christmas Day. 12.25.22

name: user_9277
review: It was very crowded. Rides took AT LEAST an hour of queueing before you can ride them and they are just short 2-3 min rides. The cost of the food is VERY VERY Unreasonable. A whole pizza costs 50? With one slice being 10. I recommend coming to have fun and spend quality time but should prepare food before hand so you don't have to pay so much :) Abit disappointing... You should buy tickets AND EXPRESS PASS before hand! :)

name: user_9278
review: All theme park are same, waiting time for each play is around nearly 2 hour especially roller coaster, or pay extra for express lane that would cost you like paying 2 ticket for your self..

name: user_9280
review: Rides are exciting. The events they had were exciting, and it was a good time.

name: user_9285
review: Must buy express ticket to enter the hole attractions. . If not? You need long long long way to entered. . Dont missed mummy, Sherk & transformer

name: user_9296
review: Must visit Nice attractions don't miss Transformers, Egyptian Mommy, Cylon, Human and Hurricane simulator.

name: user_9298
review: Ridiculous waiting times, waited an hour and twenty minutes for the 3 minute Sesame Street ride, just over an hour for the Transformers 4d experience and almost two hours for the Mummy rollercoaster. Glad to have ticked the box but never again

name: user_9300
review: My family of five and I were bitterly disappointed with the overall experience. Far too many people and the minimum queue time was 60mins, with the key rides at least 90-120min. The express ticket also created a two tier system and if without you will be waiting a very long time. Dont understand why USS cant create a booking system with allocated time slots for everyone to enjoy and not the privileged express ticket holders taking repeat rides. Would certainly not be recommending a visit, unless you are willing to fork out for the express ticket or purely there for the shops and sightseeing.

name: user_9301
review: Too much waiting time (Min 2 to 3 hours) for each and every ride. They did not set limit for entry tickets. They just try to dump as much as crowd as possible. Avoid traveling during season time. Especially if you are having kids AVOID this place during season, weekends, public holidays. Overall a very very bad experience.

name: user_9309
review: It really is worth the hype. There are many rides for different age groups, however it is more suitable for children aged over 7 since most rides have age/height restrictions. Some queues can be very long (up to 2 hours of waiting time on weekends and public holidays) There are attached photos and descriptions of some areas in the park. (Do note that these are not all of the areas of the park)

name: user_9314
review: So crowded, waiting line for rides was about 1hr. Bt at 7.30 during xmas there's a cool night parade!!

name: user_9318
review: Visiting on Boxing Day , busy as expected , services slow , even Starbucks seems to be at crawling pace .rides are average and you have to wait a while , seems like we spent more time waiting then enjoying . A fantasy theme park for the deluded .

name: user_9321
review: It was a great experience to be here.. roller coaster rides are so thrilling.. personal favorite is the Egyptian ride.. Only drawback is that few rides were closed and there was no intimation.. if the rides are closed then there must be reduction in price of the entry ticket..

name: user_9325
review: Nothing interesting, the food in the restaurant is terrible

name: user_9330
review: Save your money up, and get the Unlimited Express Pass! The pass is super expensive, but with it I covered the whole park, rode all the rides, watched all performances and did not miss any meet-and-greet! Some gifts are only sold at specific gift shops within the park, so you are encouraged to explore everything. Be smart about how you use the lockers, and you get to save a lot of money. But over the past 10 years, the rides generally havent changed much if at all. Definitely enjoyed my visit.

name: user_9333
review: The player is the same as before. But unfortunately, during this period there are many closed for repairs. Whoever comes may not be able to play everything they want.

name: user_9336
review: Best experience ever. Checkout their showtimes, really realistic and great experience.

name: user_9337
review: very magical and fun place to go! Went on a weekday 1l am was kinda crowded at first but later on around 3 pm there was barely any people all rides were like only 5 minutes wait there's nobody queuing neither! Remember bring some snacks as it can be alittle pricy (the food there) you can choose to go out from the park and have lunch then come back in to the park (just get a chop on your hand) Download the universal studio app for the map and the waiting time, show times and all pretty helpful! You can take the sentosa express from the vivocity station third level, just one stop to resort world station! Just walk awhile and you will arrive at uss! Rides are very fun and not that many there run in the park and please SKIP sesame chase unless you are a fan of it or have kids with you , then go on the transformers ride first then move to your right and go on the cylon ride! Take note many rides dont allow any items so you can put inside the locker its free for 40 minutes

name: user_9339
review: Horrible experience No erhics Everything expensive and no human values If you said express only Geiger preference , We can buy express ticket . Do you guys think we cant offer additional 20 dollars Totally horrible and worst experience

name: user_9341
review: Absolute rubbish- Tired rides from 10-15 yr old movie themes. Transformers 4D and cyclone the only 2 rides worth it. Waste of time (Q for pizza was nearly an hour), long Q despite fast pass, save your money - dont bother

name: user_9342
review: Avoid going on weekend and especially during school holiday. The queue is insane and waiting time is like 100mins for a ride.....anyway, kids enjoy it a lot. Worth every penny I paid

name: user_9343
review: The best ever. Amazing rides, pricey but tasty food and the experience itself is worth the money that is spent. Would recommend getting an extra set of dress as there are some water based rides as well. Also you can skip most of the queues if you go as a single rider.

name: user_9346
review: Too crowded. You spend more time in the queue rather than on rides. We spent 2 hours 15 minutes in one queue.

name: user_9348
review: It was a Very wonderful and enjoyable experience inside the USS (Universal Studios Singapore) . All the attraction was top notch and very fun . every show was excellent and too much fun to watch . do not miss the transformer ride and revenge of the mummy u must go to these rides first i would suggest u start with transformer in the sci-fi city areas then do revenge of the mummy in the ancient world area then go to rapid adventure in the lost world Jurassic park area as these rides will have a long waiting time if u go later overall it was very wonderful

name: user_9349
review: Bad service and procedures, you need to wait in long queue to exchange entry tickets after bought tickets online, it make no sense to buy tickets online

name: user_9350
review: Good attraction game, food, etc

name: user_9352
review: my first time. it's so exciting.

name: user_9353
review: All good there except they charged 5 for a raincoat. It should have been provided for free as a compensation because most of the attractions closed when it was raining.

name: user_9354
review: After visiting this is my thoughts on Universal studios. Gold digger studio. From selling tickets to Express pass & item sold inside, like goodies & item. Normal ticket 80 40-50 extra for express entry for rides only. For some these are used. Just for 9-10 rides. Wait time is increased during early hrs just to create the rush. If it rains all the outdoor rides are closed then only 3 rides are available inside. Rest are show. There are only 4 rides which you must try here is Transformers Battlestar Galactica Human Battlestar Galactica Cyclone. Mummy Ride. No money is refunded if the ride is suspended. Sorry try out next time.

name: user_9355
review: We rushed to get to the park, ran to ride after ride after ride to find out rides only start at 12pm. 11am opening 11am start all operation yo! Boos! Also difficult to DL the app due to poor recep in areas. Boos! Long long queues as well. Boos! Some cart stalls also closed early instead of the 7.30pm as promised and we couldn't get what we wanted even tho there was stock! On one of the rides, staff kept letting in express queue only and the normal queue was stagnant, like really stagnant. Boos! Rides are a tad too short for the effort of queueing and there aren't much good rides at all in totality

name: user_9357
review: Buy Express pass in advance.

name: user_9359
review: Really really disappointed , all the attractions machine beyond covid are spoiled, we waited for half an hour passboot attraction and got informed that maintenance make delayed unable to estimated into normal operation thus we moved to Jurassic park , after waiting about one hour , happened the same , the whole days nothing was enjoyed and just making us tired by waiting.

name: user_9360
review: Must visit place in Singapore. Make sure to do the Transformers 3d Battle and Jurassic Park Water Ride. Battle star Galactica and Revenge of the Mummy are roller coster rides.

name: user_9361
review: I felt like being in heaven. It contains fun which is zenith and limitless. Blissful memory is everlasting.

name: user_9362
review: Bot 2 express unlimited ticket for kids 12 and 9yo, and I can accompany them in all the activities except one at far far away. Have a super bad experience with the staff named Roxxsita. USS should train their staff to not only using the brain but also heart and logic.

name: user_9366
review: Service by Tour Guide Joyce is excellent. Attractions and Rides exciting. Thumbs down for service at Ice cream shop. Long queues to order then 20mins wait for collection. Not standard expected form hi tech Singapre.

name: user_9369
review: Must visit for traveler who loves theme park.... unfortunately some is under renovation when we came... Dec 2022

name: user_744
review: Extremely expensive - do not recommend! The wait for the rides are unbelievable- 1.5 hour wait for one ride in a week day! The rides are sometimes fun and exciting but some are pretty much not childish and boring Mismanagement and the unproportionate ratio of regular guests and fast pass ppl makes it a lot longer to play a game that it should have been. Even that how expensive it is, its not worth it really

name: user_9382
review: One of the long-awaited attractions! Although it is small inside, the rides are very fun and exciting!

name: user_9389
review: Must visit when you are in Singapore. The rides are super fun, highly recommend Transformers, Mummy, River Adventures and Roller Coasters. Express pass is a must. Do not waste your valuable vacation time without Express pass, waiting in the queues for hours together. Also purchase tickets online, you get some free vouchers to redeem inside.

name: user_9395
review: Visit during this period is sort of disappointing as they are in the midst of changing certain rides and theme in the park. Some of the restaurants in the park are also closed. We enjoyed the meet and greet the most and the staffs are friendly to assist. They are also good to take photos for us even when there is a photographer there. Attached are some of the meet and greet timings so look out for them and just queue for photos to be taken. The wait wasn't long to my surprise! Rides wait time are surprising short at around 5.20pm.

name: user_9400
review: Wasted place only can play 6 games ,que 1.5 hour waiting

name: user_9407
review: Best is to buy tickets from the actual site. Tourists should take the bus 123 or any other from their area. It drops in basement and 5 mins walk take you to entrance of all attractions including universal studios. McDonalds is located outside universal studios at 5 mins walk. Inside universal mostly snacks are available. Best is to start the rides from far far away to save time as everyone getting in universal straight away goes to transformer ride and its wait time is usually long. Cylon roller coaster was open till 2030 hrs. Best is to take the front seat in cylon and human roller coaster. Mummy ride is scary and dark , kids get scared. Rest other rides are moderate and good. Jurassic park water ride is good being a poncho or rain coat as its expensive - 5 per person. Some lockers are free for initial one hour so valuables can be stored before the ride. Cylon and human roller coasters dont allow anything in the pockets, glasses can be temporarily stored in boarding area.

name: user_9408
review: it was good experience with all rides in universal studio

name: user_9413
review: USS no more up to standard I just visited on last week, where most of the games are not open for the public especially on this school holiday season it seems unreasonable and the only game I was interested the transformers closed down after 40 min wait

name: user_9415
review: It's always fun to visit. The road shows was excellent. Since it was Christmas time we had quite a lot of road shows. Jurassic park was one which we wanted to... however it was closed.

name: user_9419
review: Queue time underestimated. Crowd management poor.

name: user_9420
review: Loved it. Much less people now than in 2019. Although very strange men (all single without children) take pictures there, looks very weird.

name: user_9422
review: Try to go early and start early.. Every rides here takes 40 minutes minimum.. Also find out the last ride times of all rides as some close early and some late.. You can opt for express pass incase you wish to jump queues and finish the whole thing in day one.. Most of the things close by 7.15 pm. From there you can take a monorail to a Beach Station and see Wings of Time fountain show which starts by 7.40 pm and finishes by 8.10.

name: user_9423
review: visit only during weekdays if possible...on weekends there are long ques for every rides

name: user_9431
review: Organized, magnificent,majestic truly mesmerized with the experience. Must visit.

name: user_9434
review: Really enjoyed for coming in here, especially in Christmas season. Lots of Christmas decorations and lights. The staff are so friendly. Some attractions are unavailable deu some renovation.

name: user_9435
review: I was in Universal Park on a Saturday but in the low season (November). So there were few waiting times. The longest was 30 minutes. That's why I would also advise against an express ticket. Practical are the lockers in front of the main entrance. They are a bit expensive, but so it's more practical if you want to drop off your luggage. The park is definitely much smaller than that in Japan. Nevertheless, you can have a lot of fun. The most potential is still in the shows. They can still be improved.

name: user_9437
review: Its been a wonderful experience at Universal Studios today.. its a very good go-to place with kids as its stroller friendly throughout the place. Waiting time for some of the famous rides like Transformers, Sesame Street, Mummy, Dino park etc are little high and express tickets may help in these cases. Overall a great experience for the family

name: user_9441
review: Universal Studios is a one of a kind experience in Singapore. It is on every traveller's list by default. Do not miss their special rides - Transformers, Ripples, The mummy ride and the 2 roller coasters. Book tickets in advance on Klook. Express entry tickets help you tour the entire park in a day's time, otherwise making it impossible to cover everything. If you're pressed for time, do opt for the express entry pass. Unless you're very keen on repeating rides, do not go for an unlimited ticket. Food options for vegetarians is very limited and equally expensive. We found an Afghani restaurant serving veg biriyani at SGD16 per plate! The number of restaurants inside the theme park seem to have significantly reduced over time, only adding to wait time and longer queues in the ones open. Keep some finger food handy for emergencies. Lots of options for souvenirs as well - every ride exit lands you into one! But the collection you find here is very unique and not available in the local markets of Singapore. So try to finish everything by 5 p.m and spend some quality time in these shops. Every ride, every shop and every eatery closes at 6 p.m sharp, so last minute hurry can be avoided with better planning. First time experiences at such places is always a good memory to cherish, enjoy yours while it lasts!

name: user_9442
review: It was fun and we really enjoyed the rides

name: user_9443
review: From Vivo city, take the free tram to Sentosa island (only 1 stop). In my opinion, this park is not suitable for babies under 5 years old. They cant play any ride. And the waiting time during peak, can reach 1.5 hours! Of course with some extra money, you can buy the express ticket. Toilets need more often cleaning during peak time.

name: user_9447
review: There is a light rail to the beach and VIVO MALL, which is very convenient. It feels very laid back here.

name: user_9458
review: Have a great memorable Family experience

name: user_9459
review: Price of tickets are high but many attractions were closed.

name: user_9460
review: Everyone only has negative things to say about this park but it's really amazing and you have about 7 hours of activity with the rides, plus the meet and greets and shows. I would definitely consider an annual membership.

name: user_9465
review: It was amazing. We visit at the weekend by the bus from our hotel at Grand copthorne waterfront. Arrived at USS we directly explore all place. For me all of the place was amazing but the most memorable for me are Mumi and Transformer.

name: user_9468
review: If there was less than one star I would pick it. More than 2 hours of waiting for a 2 minute ride. The food makes your stomach hurt. The waiting rooms for the rides put you in a small room with no air. Many small children were crying because of this.

name: user_9469
review: A fun family play area

name: user_9471
review: Very nice place for a family vacation. Awesome experience. The services are first class and friendly, safe and clean.

name: user_9472
review: Complete and solid game rides

name: user_9475
review: I had a good time with friends. Not many attractions but what few there are are nice attractions. Catering prices a little high but that's expected.

name: user_9476
review: This time was about Halloween Nights Horror 2022, I give 100% satisfied! Feeling scary and excited!!! Come early and take your time explore all night attractions and rides It gave me another feeling from the daylight time see you next year!

name: user_9478
review: Please reach well before time for entrance.

name: user_9479
review: Its so systematic now. We buy our ticket online and theres no waiting time at entrance. Enjoy all rides and Christmas show. Overall enjoy my trip

name: user_9482
review: Keep the entire day for Universal Studio, otherwise, there will not be enough time.

name: user_9478
review: Most popular place to visit Singapore

name: user_9489
review: have to wait a long time because of the long queue

name: user_9492
review: Need check weather before book ticket to check rainy or not. Better prepare time for whole day spend here. Its is recommend to have night stay at Sentosa too.

name: user_9496
review: Its a good experience water world was closed when I visited. Enjoyed it. The rides were all good and new to me

name: user_9499
review: very fun minimal wait times for most rides

name: user_9501
review: Great place to visit with family. Few Closed rides for maintemence were the only disappointment.

name: user_9507
review: Coming from the U.S., this place is definitely a little smaller, but still good nonetheless. Purchased the unlimited express pass, and it was definitely worth it, though towards the end of the day lines are definitely less. Overall, decent. Was a little sad that Waterworld was closed though.

name: user_9509
review: Very disappointing visiting Universal Singapore. Would not recommend even if you want to waste your money. The majority of attractions were closed. Shocking customer care! I have asked on numerous occasions for our refund. Please dont waste your money a complete fraud!!!!

name: user_9510
review: So interesting. Come by metro is the best way. Use fast track, you will gain time.

name: user_9512
review: France : There are a lot of firm attractions Almost half The food is very very cheap and very very expensive for the quality The park is small The park hasn't looked renovated for quite a few years. Disappointed

name: user_9516
review: The place need no description. It's one of the important and must visit attractions in Singapore. It has attractions for almost all age groups and interests. Especially thrilling with their roller coaster rides with theme of their characters or shows. There are lot of live activities by the characters themselves and allow you to click pics with them, with a good thing also being you can click using your own camera or phone as well apart from their official click. While their entrance ticket gives entry to pretty much all the attractions, a special pass called Express Pass will help you skip the long waiting lines of upto 40-60 mins on some of the attractions, especially the fast moving rides. You can buy the Express Pass over the counter which costs SGD 50 for one time use for applicable shows but can cost lesser sometimes if booked online. There are multiple food outlets too if different cuisines and named after some of their shows or themes. The park itself is divided into different zones basis their various shows. One would certainly need a whole day to explore the place fully.

name: user_9517
review: Must visit place. Go early and specially on weekday to avoid long queues on all the major attractions

name: user_9522
review: Not as good as expected. When we went the water rides were closed.

name: user_9523
review: Not my first time to visit USS, i went there for the christmas parade. Love being a single raider. And loooove cyclon roller coaster. I took 3 times in a row. Best ride.

name: user_9524
review: we went there on Thursday. yet its crowded. queues are long for the rides especially for the transformers. Shrek area was closed for maintenance. 4D movie from Far far away is never changed since about 10 years ago, and it looks no maintenance at all that water spray and spider simulation are not working. its our second time and i find its not as fun as first time.

name: user_9527
