review: A must-visit place in Singapore. There are many things to see and experience around universal studios. Free train service is available from the HarbourFront station.

name: user_10214
review: We went on a Thursday and the average wait time for rides was 20-30 mins. We bought the Express pass in advance just in case so we basically didn't have to wait for any of the rides. We did some rides like the Mummy one for like 4 times, still the first one in the queue every time. So my recommendation is to go on a weekday and try to enter by the time they open! Was a fantastic experience overall.

name: user_10221
review: The best experience i have ever had it was amazing. Go on week days or we cant try all the rides in a day. Transformer ride is my favorite

name: user_10229
review: It was a pretty good experience here & especially for kids who will get all characters of cartoon network and will be thrilled

name: user_10233
review: Buy entrance tickets at Klook and scan the barcode to enter. -Transformers, long line, long wait because the machine has a malfunction, can wait 2 hours. -Mummy is fun, very satisfying, good suspense, not gentle, I recommend it. -Jack's House, a roller coaster, light and cute, but a little strong. Little children can play. -The Madagascar carousel is smooth and loops 3 times. Little children love it. *Madagascar river cruise is being reworked.

name: user_10236
review: We spend 5 hrs here and was able to experience only 4 rides. The waiting time was ridiculously high. So rather than enjoying & relaxing, it felt tiring & frustrated.

name: user_10238
review: Had one of the best days ever!! Great place for kids and universal movie lovers. The rollercoaster rides were amazing. The transformer and the mummy returns rides were mind blowing. The only con I found was that the food options were quite limited and most of the shops were closed the day we visited. A wonderful experience overall.

name: user_10239
review: Overall experience was that it is quite overrated.... The rides were not really thrilling... Food extremely pricey... But great ambience

name: user_10240
review: Highly recommend it for family with children or just young adult that wants to have fun. It's still crowded, but not as crowded as before. Expect the queue time to be short.

name: user_10241
review: Best Rides to enjoy the day in USS, missed Jurassic water ride but great experience walking through every attraction inside it. Make sure you take express pass if you are planning to go in weekend to avoid standing in the long queue.

name: user_10242
review: Fantastic. Mummy, transformers, far far castle not to be missed. Mummy and transformers were awesome. Prefer noon for less wait times. Some rides were closed. Watch for all the packages before buying tickets. Lucky for us there was mastercard promo! Make sure you do your home work before buying tickets! Not for children who will get scared as most of the rides are roller coasters, and practically for above 68 yrs at the minimum! Upto you and children to decide based on rides!

name: user_10245
review: You just cannot miss this.. Best rides ever

name: user_10250
review: Excellent rides & well maintained. Value for money for the food. It could get crowded during peak hours.

name: user_10251
review: Interesting, but many games are temporarily under maintenance.

name: user_10254
review: Hmmm, that's not bad.. coincidentally I'm still in the mood... it's really fun.. thanks

name: user_10256
review: lvery big very beautiful

name: user_10257
review: It's smaller than other places, but that's why it's actually better? They say it's more kawaii because it's cute..www Because I go on a weekday, Monday There was a 5 minute wait in the morning!! Be sure to go on a weekday!!! Even Mira rode it with two people. The souvenir shop is worse than I thought. High prices are the default... After starving all day, I went to Sentosa and had a sandwich.

name: user_10262
review: Very nice, not many riders for adults but fun experience with kids

name: user_10263
review: Transformers, mummy rides are must go. Waiting time is almost an hour for these rides. Buy express entry pass if possible.

name: user_10264
review: Wonderful rides and fun filled experiences

name: user_10267
review: Thia is a must visit place in Singapore. You need one full day to complete all the rides and experience it. Usually the ticket cost you around S68 per Adult ,we tried using the mastercard offer and able to get the tickets at S106 for two peoples. It will be closed on Monday and Tuesday please plan accordingly. The Mummy ride was a huge surprise. Please check it or the suspense will break off.. The transformer ride is also good. The Roller coasters Human and Cyclone are super awesome..you need to wait for these rides.

name: user_10271
review: Parc is great, but most interesting main attractions are closed for maintenance, like Jurrasic Park, Water world and Madagascar are simply closed and also technical difficulties with Transformers. So rest of attractions of course large queues. We understand the need from r maintenance and safety, but not fair that ticket price is the same all over (78 at counter) Btw dan d file a complaint only to receive more explanation and no compensation

name: user_10272
review: I been here for second tine after 2012 , this time we had so much fun because i bring my son , he had so much fun . But im so diapointed the Transfomer we cant play the said have some technical issue , and will open it again but i can see people came out from that area . Idk what going on this is so frustrated at all . But overal it fine and no more free refill drinks u need to pay 3 per refill . Please buy ticket at klook or any website it more cheaper

name: user_10273
review: Great adventure with superb rides... Must try Transformers, Thr Mummy, Jurassic World rides for adults... For children also there are many rides... The whole family package... Enjoyed to the fullest...

name: user_10276
review: Great theme park, the transformer ride is a must try no mattet what.

name: user_10278
review: We were privy to special company access post 7pm, with access to few attractions, apart from the Steve Spielberg special effects show all were rides, I only took the transformer 3d one, was quite hurtful to my back and I didn't take any other. Overall, very disappointed.

name: user_10280
review: A really disappointing amusement park It's too small, but there's nothing to ride. I keep comparing it to LA Universal. There are almost no places selling snacks. There are not many types of souvenirs. It's too far to go for a ride... The employees are generally blunt and not exciting. I feel like our countrys friendliness is the best. Don't cancel the express ticket, just buy a regular ticket (there's no need to use it)

name: user_10282
review: It was great when you landed at Changi, immediately took the MRT to Harbor Front. Just cross over to Sentosa Island... until we arrive at Universal Studios... Thank God

name: user_10286
review: Incredible theme park! Has amazing studios attraction. Perhaps they have to extend their operational time . Overall impressive

name: user_10289
review: There are many corners to take photos. Various types of play equipment There are both suitable for children and suitable for adults. But the area is quite dirty. The walkway inside the building leading to the play equipment has trash, glasses, and water bottles left behind. Including a lot of dirt.

name: user_10291
review: A typical type of amusement park that have souvenir shops and all kinds of rides for everyone. Also there are shows available at specific times.

name: user_10297
review: Another wonderful place to visit in singapore Must have attractions Mummy ride Transformers Rollercoaster 360 Smurfs show ride Unchanted Jurasic park.

name: user_10298
review: ITS A UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE... Lovely Experience to have for any visitor to this wonderland. The rides, especially Cylon, Human, Transformers, Rapids and Revenge of the Mummy were Outstanding! The Hollywood theme, character meetings, various shows, infrastructure, locker provisions and tourist amenities were top. Very good amusement park with alot of attractions. The Cyclon and Human rides offered an amazing adrenaline rush. Not for the faint hearted.

name: user_10299
review: Some attractions closed, definitely a park for children and families (for whom it's fine) and for teenagers or adults. Small, I expected it to be bigger, Gardaland is huge in comparison. It didn't excite me at all, in 2 hours and a little more I did everything (no Human and the other one, the 2 rollercoasters with over 1 hour of waiting, for the rest super slim and well organized lines). However clean and tidy and very kind staff.

name: user_10300
review: Beautiful and thrilling place. Mummy and Terminator is a must.

name: user_10305
review: Nice experience would recommend to buy the express line ticket to skip the line

name: user_10306
review: Best place for family & kids. Lots of activities available here. Although the queue for the rides can be 2hrs long for regular access.

name: user_10316
review: We had a great time. We purchased VIP Experience tickets. So well worth it. A tour guide took us through on rides. No waiting. Plus photo shoots with characters. We loved it here.

name: user_10319
review: One of the best attraction in singapore. Every thing worth here. Suggest you to buy express for 1 day time visitor.

name: user_10325
review: Not really impressed long waiting in every single ride....

name: user_10326
review: One of the most interesting and fun tourist attractions in Singapore, which would be a shame if missed, has lots of play rides on offer for both adults and children. For those who visit there and remember that there are so many visitors queuing at each ride, it is recommended to buy a VIP season ticket to shorten the queue time. This place is very large and has many choices of locations, so you should prepare to go to this location for a full day and don't worry about eating and drinking. There are many places to eat and drink with a variety of prices that are adequate for an exclusive tourist spot.

name: user_10328
review: The park was absolutely amazing and fun! We had a blast! Must try the Transformer, mummy ride, and Jurasic Park. Those are the absolute best! I We completed the park by 4pm and had arrived at 11:30am. We were only able to do this because we had the express. I love this place! They always keep updating the attractions. There is a significant variety of food options to choose from. I would definitely try to avoid going there on the weekend if possible, especially during August. It gets super busy. But the thing that I love the most about this part is how efficient everything is. The people that work here are very good at making sure everything stays organized and moves quickly. Customer service is outstanding, if not exceptional. Everyone is very friendly. I would definitely recommend getting an express pass, especially on the weekend. It will save you a lot of time and misery, especially in the summer. Definitely recommend visiting here.

name: user_10329
review: I don't know where to start first. a magical landscape as if you are in a fairy tale as soon as you enter universal. we had booked tickets two days before. we went into all the rooms, we saw everything. all you need is to have time and do it as a full day trip. we entered the transformers we entered the mummy which I think was the scariest part. we saw how a real movie is shot, also scary it was real with real fire and scenery. we even saw which movies were shot at universal studios. it is forbidden to take videos inside the halls at any time, that's why I don't upload photos from inside. there is a special designated safe area to leave your personal belongings because in some it is forbidden to have things on you such as a bag, glasses, cell phone, etc. we got on a train that scared me too much, we went upside down with my head down, my feet up and it went to pieces very scary. we did a lot of walking, you should definitely wear sneakers and pants to be comfortable if you walk into everything. there is music all over the place places to eat or say something. I will definitely go again if I'm in Singapore. there were families with children who really enjoyed themselves. in all the rooms you wear 3D glasses and so you see everything in real time. we also watched a little old movie with 3D glasses with diona who is green. incredible experience we had an amazing time.

name: user_10330
review: Rides are Good but long waiting for the rides so busy priority passes for the rides.

name: user_10333
review: I loved it! So fun. Originally worth to get fun pass.

name: user_10335
review: Been here a few times, somehow they always manage to change new stuff all the time. Quite cool

name: user_10340
review: Really happy playing there. It's fun, it's funny... it's not just fun, it's also a lot of education. It's great to play there.. It's not just the little ones who are happy, the old ones are happy too hahahah.

name: user_10342
review: Such an amazing experience! The good points: 1) Its so easy to get there. Get to MRT station of Harbourfront and then a 5 minutes train directly to the park from Vivocity mall. 2) Price is just fair. 3) The park has a total of around 8 rides (some for kids and some for adults) in addition to some other activities (4D movies and etc.) 4) The park is convenient and quite small, so you can really have it covered in a full day. 5) The atmosphere and theme of the park are amazing. Everything is done really well and into the details. Some disadvantages: 1) Some of the rides might be closed randomly on days you come. You just have to find out(no worries though, the main ones are active) 2) I visited on a a moderately low day. In high season waiting can be over an hour and even longer for most rides. Honestly I dont think the most are worth waiting more than 45 minutes tops except for the top best rides. But thats a more personal thing. 3) The park is real fun, but having said point number 2, the best of the park really comes down to 3-4 rides (for those who love the adrenaline), which are always really busy and waiting is long. To sum up - Amazing experience, be prepared for some waiting on busy days. Dont miss it if you are in Singapore

name: user_10345
review: Although its not big, I still have lots of fun inside

name: user_10348
review: Of the 5 Universal Studios that there are, I would say that this is the weakest or the second weakest. We went on September 2 and the Jurassic Park rapids attraction was closed, a shame because it was one of the best. The Mummy and Transformers attractions are the same as the other Universal ones, the Battle Star Galactica roller coasters are good, the best one is the inverted one. Quite expensive food. There wasn't much of a line, but it didn't guarantee that there would be a lot of people on the weekend.

name: user_10354
review: If you're visiting Singapore for the first time, this has to be on your bucket list. The rides and the themes make the spent worth. It takes a whole day to explore the place.

name: user_10355
review: Go here on weekdays to avoid long lines, rides were so much enjoyable, bring extra clothes and try water rides for more adventure and enjoyable experience

name: user_10356
review: Too long wait time for rides which are not that great (despite going in off season on a weekday). Food is too overpriced.

name: user_10359
review: Horrible experience... Long wait for rides.. due to bad weather forecast all outdoor rides closed for 3hrs... No compensation by extending closing time . thanking my stars that I didn't waste money on express pass as it would hv been waste cause of sudden closure. Dissapointed

name: user_10365
review: Awesome theme park with many rides for all ages! I would suggest buying tickets in advance and if you can, buy the Express pass or the "Fast Pass" to get through lines at rides quicker to have more fun!

name: user_10366
review: A whole day's entertainment. Needless to say, Universal studios is the best place to visit if you are in Singapore. It's perfect for people of all age groups. From the rides like The return of the mummy, Transformers to the meet and greet with the Transformers this place is action and entertainment packed. The only downside is the waiting time as we had to wait close to 1.5 hours to be able to experience the transformers ride but it was absolutely worth it.

name: user_10367
review: If you can stand in line for 2 hours, there is no need for express. Don't go on weekends, or buy the express.

name: user_10370
review: It's wonderful location to enjoy the vacation holidays, the mummy roller-coaster is wonder full ,there have many entertainment program, water theme park also have . It nice place for the enjoyment

name: user_10373
review: Giving 2 stars for the rides, 2 stars for the food. I feel the restaurants there(inside USS) are just a rip off. Eventhough the staffs in the Shrek restaurant is friendly and nice despite the very long queues, but the price of the food is not worth it.

name: user_10375
review: Ultimate experience of Adrenaline rush in the studio. The rides are very very exciting. Don't forget to opt for Express card if you are going on weekends. Go for online booking of tickets and reach at early hours.

name: user_10379
review: Very fun, not many people anymore.

name: user_10385
review: We were a bit disappointed since the park only opened at 12:00 and already closed at 19:00. Unfortunately it rained for 2 hours and the attractions were mostly closed during that time. If you consider that for some rides you have to wait 90 minutes to get in, there is hardly enough time to see everything.

name: user_10386
review: The space is clean, convenient and fun.

name: user_10388
review: The place is nice, lots of games, and clean

name: user_10389
review: Brand like USS needs more than just hype, its very unorganized, not kids friendly many attractions closed, and for the once thats open wait time is like 40 min, they need to better organize the attractions by age groups so visitors know what attractions they want to pay for, I feel I wasted lot of money just to wait in the queue

name: user_10395
review: I advise not buying the ticket in advance. If it rains they close attractions and do not return the money. Better to check the weather and go if there is no rain forecast. Tickets can be purchased there through the box office or through ATMs.

name: user_10399
review: Must do in Singapore. Amazing place to go with friends and family.

name: user_10400
review: With the express tickets, we really enjoyed the rides without waiting

name: user_7231
review: Had to q more than 1hr per ride. Very pricey for the tickets!

name: user_10403
review: Place is overpriced for how much you can get out of one day. The queue estimate is deceiving, its always double that and it may look short from the outside but once you got to what you thought halfway, its actually a lot of hidden stair and zig zag fence inside(estimate for the transformer ride was 60 minutes but took us 2 hrs then technical problem shut the ride down right before our turn). Maybe worth it if you have express pass but will cost you nearly a full ticket extra. Biggest thing that upset me the most is their money grabbing scheme with lockers. Some of the best ride(cyclon vs human) wont allow loose items so you are FORCED TO RENT a locker before the ride. I dont understand why they just let you leave your items on the shelves like other ride. This place is so not worth it if you go to Malaysia later or before this. Their theme park(time square and genting) is so much better, less crowded, better system and friendly staffs.

name: user_1179
review: Loved the place, taking photos with the Minions, free of charge.

name: user_10404
review: Very good amusement park with alot of attractions. Please buy a express ticket of possible as it's very crowded in the weekends. I had to wait more than an hour for few rides. If you're a vegetarian please plan your food accordingly as there's no much veg options available. Try to cover all the rides as all are very unique comparatively.

name: user_10405
review: The food center is very difficult, waiting in line for a long time.

name: user_10414
review: Different pavilions with 4D cinematic experience, roller coaster rides, film shoot experience, space exploration....

name: user_10415
review: It is recommended to buy a fast pass ticket first, otherwise you will have to queue for a long time for everything!

name: user_10419
review: Must visit place. A keen advice if visiting with children age group should be 12yrs plus.

name: user_10422
review: Dont waste your money! This would have to be THE worst theme park in the world. 90 minute wait for buying tickets, 90-120 minute wait for rides, half park closed , no entertainment, food options are very limited and was very dirty. Food scrapes everywhere, toilets had no soap/paper and if youre lucky you may get help/directions from a staff member if you can find one. Very expensive, save your money and go to Disney in hong kong or universal in Japan. Wont be back x

name: user_10423
review: Awesome place for fun n entertainment be it with someone or alone wid family or wid kids... Just enjoy ur day...

name: user_10429
review: This is always a happy amusement park. Queuing is still a constant problem, but lets just have a happy experience!

name: user_10430
review: If you want to enter, you have to pay, if you take a photo at the Universal sign, you have to queue to get a good photo, especially on weekends, it's really crowded here.

name: user_10433
review: Entered on an express ticket and got through the open rides/shows in 3 hours. A fair few attractions were under renovations/closed which was disappointing. Enjoyed the day but there's not enough there to justify a repeat visit.

name: user_10434
review: Buy a express pass if you want to enjoy all rides

name: user_10435
review: Had a great time with family,rides are safe and good.mummy ride was really good.overall it was Fun and had good experience there.restrooms are clean, also they have locker rooms so that you can keep your belongings inside before going for a ride... universal studios is closed on Monday and Tuesday, open from Wednesday to Sunday,time 12.00 to 7.00 pm

name: user_10439
review: If you've been to Orlando before, disappointing. But Singapore doesn't offer much, so 1 day at Universal is quite fun. Large crowds, express ticket helpful, separate entrance at the park gate

name: user_10440
review: The smallest Universal I've been. With few main attattractions not working. Still a great fun for kids

name: user_10441
review: Due to the coronavirus, the operating hours are short (open at 12:00 and close at 17:00), but the park area is small, so you can fully enjoy it in 5 hours. You can check the waiting time by installing the app, but the actual waiting time may be longer as more Express people are added. Rides like Jurassic Park's Amazon Express have long waiting times. Instead, if you go to Transformer after 16:00, it is surprisingly crowded, so there is almost no waiting time. So I rode it twice.

name: user_10442
review: A must go place in Singapore! Everything about it is perfect even if youre an adult. All the rides are extreme My suggestion is go to Battlestar Galactic first bcs thats the longest waiting ride. After that all the rides are not gonna wait long. For now I would suggest to go next year or until Singapore easens its COVID restrictions cuz a lot of the rides and time is only from 12pm to 7pm

name: user_10444
review: this is one of the most dreamlands in singapore. located on sentosa island at the south of the mainland and connected with it with cable trams, sentosa express monorail and bus lanes. on most days this is very crowded, with average 30 to 60 minutes waiting time for individual sites in the theme parks, while some popular sites such as roller coaster may require more than 90 mins in busy days the theme park is not a large one, so i recommend you to go for those smaller sites in busy time such as morning and early afternoon, and come back to those big site after peak hours (i.e after about 4pm) and surely you will enjoy every site in a single day after sunset sometimes there are special activities such as theme dinner and parade, you can check out details on the seasonal map also, there are a lot of retail outlets selling themed souvenirs

name: user_10448
review: Big wait times on rides and not a massive range of "adult" rides. Be great for kids

name: user_10452
review: Well worth to visit. If youve the chance to buy the VIP experience youll enjoy all attractions with priority access and personal guide.

name: user_10456
review: Honestly, I know I'm too old to enjoy theme parks, but this one is really grand. Went with the family and our youngest is 12 years old. There's something to enjoy for everyone of all ages. The Transformers and The Mummy rides were our highlights, but some rides take very long to wait. Be wary though, food inside is a bit expensive, so I suggest to load up on carbs in Vivo City's food court before talking an entire day of walking. Transpo from Vivo City to and from Sentosa is free. I was tired, but all the fun was worth it.

name: user_10457
review: When coming to Universal Studios, it is recommended to buy priority access tickets. Otherwise, in Singapores weather, you will have to queue for several hours for each item and then the game will end in 1 to 3 minutes. There is really no experience at all. Although priority tickets are expensive, without priority tickets, it is almost impossible to experience most of Universal Studios' projects in one day, especially on weekends and holidays. Relatively speaking, the two types of priority tickets can only be used once for all items (except for a few). The unlimited priority tickets are not necessary unless you particularly love one of the items. The Battlestar Coaster is definitely the flagship of all the roller coaster projects at Universal Studios. If there are no health risks, this project is 100% recommended to experience. Of course, this project is also one of the projects with the largest queues (there is also a project with a large number of people queuing for Jurassic World Ride, which I personally think is very average). There is a sister roller coaster next to this roller coaster (red track), which has a lower difficulty level (no 360-degree rotation). Friends who want to ride a roller coaster but are afraid of it can experience this roller coaster first, and then consider whether to go to the Ace Coaster for fun. There is the only Starbucks not far from the entrance of the park. The other restaurants in the park can only be said to be quite satisfactory. The taste and price are not far different from those outside the scenic area. At least it is enough to satisfy your appetite. Compared with the catering in a certain country's scenic area, it is simply too conscientious. Compared with Universal Studios in other countries, the projects are single and the area is much smaller. It is also unbelievable that some products, including the parks sales stores, are out of stock. However, Universal Studios Singapore is still highly recommended as one of the must-see attractions when traveling to New Zealand. Finally, I reiterate that priority tickets are really worth buying if you want to really play. Finally, I wish you (we) have fun!

name: user_10458
review: Ideal for children aged 4 to 10. The attractions are great for small children, for adults I think it must be quite limited, apart from the 3 big ones. Fair value for money, too bad the park is not open longer during the day from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m. Be careful the times change depending on the day, check before going there, the time indicated on min ticket (get your guide) and on the site was not the same. Fortunately we had seen it before. The park is small but for a day it's good!

name: user_10459
review: heard a lot of the rides were not fully opened but all of them were when I visited on National Day! def go slightly earlier than 12pm as people were crowding the entrance pretty early on. cylon and human have staggered timings so do sit each as many times as you want while its still open! we sat cylon at 12pm once and by the time we wanted to ride again and walked back from the far far away zone, it was already closed D:

name: user_10460
review: Wow! what an experience, you can't miss this if you are in Singapore. Buy express pass if want to do all the riders and you are going on an weekend or public holiday. Check out for opening time as it changes basis type of day and reach 10 mins before opening time. Sci fi must be done first if you don't have express pass. The rides are so fun and interactive. If given a chance I am definitely going there again.

name: user_10463
review: Use express pass always if you want to have rides. And definitely in sunny days you won't like it because it's too hot. Great rides. Amazing places for photos. Great piece of work definitely.

name: user_10464
review: An Exhilarating Experience to have for any visitor to this wonderland. The rides, especially Cylon, Human, Transformers, Rapids and Revenge of the Mummy were Outstanding! The Hollywood theme, character meetings, various shows, infrastructure, locker provisions and tourist amenities were top notch. Only improvement needed is the Food quality and healthy food variety available within the park. No outside food is allowed and there are long queues for food too.

name: user_10465
review: I went there in August 2022. Due to the coronavirus pandemic, it is open from 12pm to 7pm even on weekends, all indoor shows are closed, some areas are closed due to renovations, there is no parade, and prices are high. The waiting time for popular attractions was displayed as approximately 40 minutes. When I looked at it, it was 15 minutes, which was not accurate. There were many photo sessions with characters instead of indoor shows. Most of the restaurants were open for short hours. It was quite unsatisfactory compared to normal business.

name: user_10466
review: RIPPED OFF!!! Went there on Wednesday, it was so freaking crowded! Lots of rides are UNDER MAINTENANCE!! like WTH!!??? Madagascar area was fully closed except the mary go round ride. 2 of the Jurassic rides WERE CLOSED AS WELL!! For the sake of my daughter happiness, I decided to buy the "one time ride each ride - express ticket" that costs freaking 70/person. Moreover, NOT ALL RIDES HAVE EXPRESS ACCESS!!!! I suggest u guys, DO NOT COME TO UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE!!! I repeat, DO NOT COME TO UNIVERSAL STUDIOS SINGAPORE!!!

name: user_10467
review: Pros : its universal so its always fun. Cons: - dont go for opening time, they make you like up, then open the first set of gates so you all get squished in the hot sun with no shade for another 20 mins. Not sun safe or covid safe. - No maps anywhere, staff unhelpful and just said its accessed online- but the wifi didnt work for me. Not even one map to take a picture of. - Xpress pass bought but some rides had no express lane. Seemed like there was 5 or so rides that were shut on the express pass. - Waterworld was shut and this wasnt said at time of purchase. - No where to re fill water bottles. Which is weird because of how hot it is. Would skip it if youre on the fence to go !

name: user_10468
review: Great place! Must visit if you ever go to Singapore. Merchandise and Soviners a bit costly but quality speaks. Be ready to walk a lot. The waiting queues are hours long. Express pass is highly recommended for tourists. It will save a lot of headaches and time. Worth the money. Not much food option available if you are vegetarian be sure pack something up!

name: user_10472
review: First of all, I went through the Klook Pass, but it is usually cheaper and more convenient to buy it online. You don't have to wait in line to get in, and be sure to buy the Express Pass. Even though there were no people, we waited 60 minutes for one of the wrong attractions and got on. It was so hot I thought I was going to die. I hope you all save time and body by buying a pass...

name: user_10474
review: Nice place but lots of waiting even during a non peak weekday. Vegetarian food choices & healthy food choices were very limited. We did only a couple of places (mainly Jurassic world) & because of the heat, my child was ready to head back to air conditioning.

name: user_10475
review: Hot, long wait time

name: user_10477
review: Always visit this place with the family when in Singapore. Great fun and great memories made. Love the Battlestar Galactic a rides, gutted that the Madagascar ride was being removed, or absolute favourite. Pretty bad that the VIP tour wasn't available as this made out trip to Universal in LA Get over to the island on the cable car to add to the visit. Also, get the fast pass!!!

name: user_10482
review: More organised system required. Unnecessary wastage of time for a 1st time visitor. There are no shows, would suggest some for parents bringing their children. Rides are fun. Jurassic area is fun for kids and pics.

name: user_10484
review: Ticketing price should be reduced for foreign travellers especially in Express tickets

name: user_10487
review: Wow I would love to go there again and again but I live in India. Amazing rides, shops were so nice with little little cute things in there, food was amazing too, I went with my family, and we enjoyed a lot. We spent a whole day at universal Studio. Buy tickets before you visit, and do check tickets because they have two types of tickets, one is normal and other is "express one", I guess I'm right, With the normal tickets you have to wait in a queue for rides, some rides may take you one to two hours to reach, other express tickets you Don't have to stand in long lines for rides, you just go straight to the front by crossing the line. yes these tickets may cost little extra. otherwise you may have to wait a little long time for some of the rides.

name: user_10488
review: The place was AMAZING But the Madagascar place was closed I can go on the Madagascar Mary go round but the shrek Rollercoaster were good everything was amazing the way they make the films behind the scenes was SO COOL but I didn't go on the human roller coaster and cyclone

name: user_10492
review: Kids loved spending the day here. We were lucky as the children managed to do most of the rides with little waiting time. However, would imagine that there are days when the waiting time for rides would be really long. Good thing, however, is that you do not have to commit to an Express Ticket until you get to Universal Studios and assess the crowd situation for yourself. There are machines inside the park area that seem to sell Express Tickets. Down side of the day... the park restaurants were not all open causing congestion in the few that were operating.

name: user_10494
review: Visiting again after 10 years and can see how bad it has turned now!! Many rides are closed and the overall park has become shabby, worn out and in a dire need of renovations! It might be an attraction for a first time visitor but for returnees it is an absolute disaster! Need better up-keep and new attractions ASAP! Staff are a gem however the overall emphasis simply is on racking more monies and not offering value against it now!

name: user_10495
review: More of a small amusement park, with the ticket you can take the train to the island for free. Entry wasn't until 12 noon, and when we arrived at 11:45 a.m. the lines were already quite long. We brought our own snacks as the drinks/food were rather expensive (as usual in such parks). Waterworld was under renovation and therefore closed. Otherwise there are lockers where you can lock your bag for 1-2 hours (a must for certain trains), for a fee of course.

name: user_10503
review: The happiest place in Singapore, had a great time every time visiting USS.

name: user_10504
review: Parts of the park were shut down including many of the dining shops and food stalls so getting lunch was impossible..... Super frustrating to be unable to get food to your starving family, we ended up leaving the park and eating outside. In addition obligating you to rent a locker for 4 an hour is outrageous. Quite disappointing overall experience of

name: user_10505
review: Very beautiful amusement park with very beautiful decorations. On the other hand, they clearly lack organization because the waiting times are incorrect (20 minutes announced, more than 60 minutes of waiting)...

name: user_2730
review: It was much smaller than I thought. Still, its the first Universal Studios in Asia, and I went there on a trip to Singapore! I'm a little anxious because I have to leave all my belongings (cell phone, wallet, and sunglasses) in the locker next to me before getting on the ride;; But I had a good trip without any accidents.

name: user_10514
review: If you want a thrilling ride that's a little different from the roller coasters the Mummy ride was my personal favourite.

name: user_10516
review: What I can say,this was the best experience and fun ever, recommend please buy the express pass or else wait in the q.. buy it from KLOOK in advance plan and travel wisely

name: user_10517
review: Bought tickets on klook as it is cheaper, went there on a Wednesday despite the wet weather. Had a good time

name: user_10520
review: Tourist attractions should not be missed when choosing Singapore as a holiday destination. The location is on Sentosa Island. Using the Sky Train is currently free until September 2022, to commemorate Singapore's 57th birthday. August 9 2022. There are several rides that disappeared in the US and were replaced with new rides, including Water World and Madagascar, one of the newest rides is Minions.

name: user_10522
review: It is one of the best places. The rides was way too good. Visited during December 2018. A must go place if anyone is visiting Singapore. Favourite ride was Cylon and Transformer.

name: user_10524
review: - Maximum rides are roller coaster with theme story. - Bags are not allowed in few rides due to which we need to keep the bags inside the locker which you need to rent for 2 to 4 SGD per hour or you can use locker near the Mummy returns ride. It has 1 hour free and later it will be 2 SGD. - Jurasic Park boating has an upsell of raincoat of 5 SGD. If you are from India you get it alaong with you. It is for Rs. 10 in India - Free Wifi - The Application of Universal studios helped a lot to quickly complete rides which have less waiting. - Complete the main attraction like transformer and mummy returns as they have higher wait time. Better to do it either in the start of the day or end of the day. It will have lesser wait time. - No Veg food options except for Margarita pizza, coffee onion rings and pasta. Soft drinks are 4 times thn regular local Singapore prices.

name: user_10528
review: While traveling, there are places to spend money and places to not spend money. Universal Express (tickets that allow you to ride rides faster) are definitely worth using. Universal Studios itself is small, so you can get around quickly.

name: user_10529
review: Singapore, which has slowly begun to open up to tourism, has not seen as many tourists as before due to the impact of the epidemic. We usually have to wait half an hour to an hour for facilities, but we can enjoy them in 5-20 minutes, which is a small blessing. The popular Little Soldier is still the protagonist, and there is also a show at its due time. The only pity is that Water Word is closed. The absence of this big show is a fly in the ointment. Singapores global fares are the most affordable in the world, and you dont need to buy a special express pass. You can play at least five games from morning to night. Although the area is not big, the majong is small, and the concept of all the internal organs is complete. Enter the venue at 12:00 and play until 7:00pm. One word: "It's cool" Played Transformers three times Mummy played twice Sesame Street Boat, Roller Coaster (feet in the air), Jurassic Ship, Pterodactyl Speeder, Puss in Shoes and the Three Musketeers, Shrek Theater The final conclusion is that the feet you walk on are not your own. The only complaint I have is that the Minions popcorn bucket doesnt have a new look

name: user_10538
review: Great place to have fun. There's not a lot of rides if you are going with a toddler/kids under 4 years old for obvious safety reasons. So if you have a toddler then go with someone who can watch them while you go for rides or just skip it for a couple of years till they grow up. Gets a bit crowded on weekends and had to wait a long time -so try their unlimited universal express pass to skip long queues or come by late afternoon.

name: user_10540
review: Huge lines at the beginning 12-2pm then the lines reduce by half, so if you dont want to wait all day, get to USS at 3pm ..

name: user_10543
review: Best theme based rides and best place to have fun with friends and family. It's very crowded on weekends and each ride would have a wait time of 1 to 2 hours. Would recommend to take express pass if you could afford the same to skip the long queues.

name: user_10546
review: Fewer products but many more There are a bunch of Minions merchandise But there is no park for Xiaobing Ha ha ha ha

name: user_10551
review: It was fun but unfortunately there wasn't enough time to see the other places and rides.

name: user_10555
review: Great park with lots of fun filled rides and activities. The different themed zones are also amazing. It brings joy to all ages alike. It's worth the visit.

name: user_10557
review: It's as good as when I went there first time 14yrs ago. But due to covid I guess, opening hours is shortened and waiting time for rides got too long. Not enough time to play and shopping and take photos. Must go with the right people, so every waiting time is not wasted.

name: user_10559
review: Price is little on the higher side and limited shows. Good for teens , not worth it for elderly or parents. Indian food options are not there so would recommend to pack something for lunch.

name: user_10565
review: This was my second visit to Universal Singapore after 9 years. It's still the same and hardly anything new has been added in almost a decade. As an adult, the rides which will offer thrill are very limited. I rode everything and I can say with surity that Battlestar Galactica, Transformers, and Revenge of the Mummy are the only rides which offers thrill. You can expect queue time of around 1 hr for each of these rides. The queue time will be lesser during evenings. Otherwise you can spend extra to get an express pass to skip the queue. These attractions are the first ones which come up as we walk through Universal Studios and so the queues are also long during the first half of the day. Apart from the above three, canopy flyer was also okay but the duration was too less I felt. The Shrek 4D show (15 mins duration) was some of the best effects I have seen in a 3d movie and worth watching. Food is pretty expensive here and I could find only one restaurant out of all the eateries here which was serving coffee.

name: user_10566
review: In single word it's Amazing

name: user_10570
review: Really not worth it. A lot of shop and attractions were closed. Line up indicate 15 minutes but you wait for at least 30 minutes. Fast lane for an extra cost?! Most of attraction looks outdated. The entire family left after one hour and half and we did only two attractions for the kids.

name: user_10571
review: Weekdays are only open for 7 hours, Saturdays and Sundays are 9 hours, not enough time to play because the queue is very long. You need to buy additional Express Univesal tickets to play all the games. Monday and Tuesday are closed, so Wednesday will also be crowded, so go on Thursday and Friday There aren't many street shows like in Japan

name: user_10576
review: For those who want to go here, you can take the Sentosa Express monorail, it's at the Vivo City Mall on the 3rd floor for free, just tell the officer, or just tap your ez link, for those who want to go for a walk, just enter Universal for free. For those who want to pray at Universal, there is no prayer room so you have to leave first

name: user_10578
review: It's another world

name: user_10579
review: Good without being outstanding. We visited on a relatively quiet day, outside of peak season making the express pass an unnecessary expense. The longest queue we waited in was 40 minutes, but we came back later for some rides - Transformers was 10 minutes at the same time Jurassic Park was 80. This is a key tip, the site isnt that big so carrying on to something else is easy (if the heat doesnt bother you). Many of the food halls were closed when we visited, and what was open was expensive however there were plenty of drinking water fountains. We managed everything in a day, youd be repeating rides if you went for two days.

name: user_10587
review: Here is the deal, DO NOT come here without an express pass if you are looking to enjoy the roller coasters. You will literally wait 2 hours to get on one ride, and we were there on a Wednesday, and the thing is, the design of the queue lines will fool you, you will think it is not that long, but once you get in and youre stuck waiting for a while, you will find out later on that there will be stairs and way longer lines inside that are hidden very well. Trust me it will be a very disappointing experience if you do not get an express pass for the rides. Other than that, if you are only there for the pictures, shopping and the vibes, it will be extremely beautiful and entertaining.

name: user_10592
review: It is recommended to download the Universal Studio application first. For Thai people, you can buy tickets in advance because you will get a discount and popcorn. I came here on a weekday and it was a rainy day. It is recommended to prepare rain gear and a portable umbrella. I want the sun to come out and suddenly it will rain. I stayed in the hotel there. The advantage was that I walked and waited from 11:30 a.m. because the place opens at noon. After scanning in, quickly run to the Transformer player. And continue running to Mummy. Step 3: Run to Jurassic World. Then stop for lunch first. The main rides that are fun are like this. The rest is just taking pictures. As for outside areas, you can go out and they will stamp your arm with a fluorescent substance, but you must prepare a ticket in case you come in again. Outside, there is international food available. Some luggage storage lockers cost money, sometimes they're free for 45 minutes, such as Rocker where you can enter the mummy. In the application, it will indicate how many minutes each ride will wait, which is quite convenient.

name: user_10595
review: Must visit if you are going for a trip to Singapore. You will need an entire day to enjoy all the rides. The queues for each ride is too big so i recommend that you buy an express ticket so u can cut the long queues and enjoy more rides. The must do rides are: The mummy, cyclon, The transformers ride, Jurassic park rapids adventure.

name: user_10598
review: If you are in Singapore, the one place you should go is Universal Studio.

name: user_10603
review: The park was mostly empty, and we didn't wait more than 10 minutes at each attraction. Madagascar world is closed, and each other world has many attractionns closed as well - which makes the entire experience not worth it. We left the park 4hours after entering after doing all the possible activities.

name: user_10605
review: Then you will like I have fun.

name: user_10608
review: If possible, it is recommended to purchase an express ticket.

name: user_10609
review: Already go to USS 4 times. Alot of good attraction close now. Not alot of food, even food court close

name: user_10611
review: My second time. The first time I was here, it was in January 2020. There were more shops and the Madagascar park was still open. Now, because of Covid-19, there are less street shows and shops. Also, the Madagascar park is closed to the public. Looks like they're also renovating. Still, it's still fun to visit.

name: user_10614
review: Good place, but the waiting times are insane, I wouldn't plan Universal next without an express tickets. More than half the time here will be spent waiting in line

name: user_10619
review: Visited on July 28, 2022. There are so many people, but because of the coronavirus, it opens at 12 o'clock. The scorching sun is very hot. I didn't buy the express ticket in Korea because I wanted to check the situation later, but if I hesitate, it's too late. It's so hot that you can't see it unless you buy an express ticket. It takes about 40 minutes for one machine. Sometimes luggage storage is free for an hour, but sometimes it costs 4.00. I thought I would leave it there for an hour and then went on one of the rides, but they told me I had to pay again because the time had expired... Is there a card in the machine? It's full of really embarrassing memories. During peak season, you have to shell out a lot of money. Still, Jurassic Park was fun It was fun, but annoying...

name: user_10620
review: Universal studios is the dad of theme park. A must visit place in Singapore. I might say the first priority should be Universal studios. Few tips I would like to share which I knew earlier which helped me a lot. 1. Bring some food. I would say a lot . You would be a very very hungry during all the rides and the food inside is bit costly 2. Take a big bottle of water. Be hydrated all the time. There is dispenser and wash rooms all over the place 3. Check your locker timing. After 120 minutes it's chargeable. So what you can do is takeout your stuff and place again with different a locker 4. Go for rollercoaster first. It will remain busy until the end. So be sure you make it there within the first few. Then comeback and enjoy the rest 5. I will suggest you take an express pass. But I found it useless if you are travelling alone or you guys have the vibe of going to every rides alone then you can save around 60 to 70 SGD. There is a line for single riders which is pretty quicker than express pass. But keep in mind it will not work in rollercoaster. 6. I would suggest you allways take someone with you so that you have someone who can take pictures for you since there is a lot to click. Also take a selfie stick which cost hardly 3 SGD. This also gives you a good company. 7. If rank then my order would be rollercoaster, mummy ride, transformers ride, Jurassic park ride, pic with talking transformers, minions, etc, pics in hollywood, newyork, etc. All above are my personal views from my personal experience yours might differ. Verdict : A day full of fun

name: user_10621
review: Brought the kids there on a weekday after the school holidays so as to avoid the crowds. But the wait times for the rides are unbelievable. A number of rides are not available. Or they rotate the rides, as in some available earlier half and others in the later half. Each rides a min. of 45min to 1hr 15min. Trying to find a place to feed the kids were also a nightmare cause only limited outlets are open. The que is super long. I enter when the place opened. And left around 6.30pm.. only managed to do about 5 different rides. The last time I went was before covid19 and was a weekend. The experience was definitely better. I won't advice visiting anytime soon.

name: user_10623
review: Try going on a weekday or a non holiday. Lots of crowd for the rides. Waiting time is way too much.

name: user_10625
review: You should buy express tickets to save time

name: user_10629
review: It opens at 12 and closes at 7pm which is very less time. Theres no Harry Potter ride and less rides overall. Universal in Japan is much better than this one.

name: user_10631
review: Had a lot of fun during my visit to USS. All the rides were very enjoyable that caters to all ages from chill to thrill rides. Queued for up to 45minutes for one of the roller coaster and they announced that the ride is suspended due to a lighting warning. However the ride was reopened not long after and managed to try it with relatively shorter queue. I would suggest to go for express ticket for a better experience

name: user_10632
review: We went in around 12:30. It's quite expensive, but it's a lot of fun. A lot of people were going around clockwise at first, so we went around from the left. We waited almost 100 minutes for Transformers at first, but when we went around 4:30, we were able to ride in 5 minutes. We waited almost 70 minutes for Battlestar Galactica until around 5:00, but when we went around 5:45, we were able to ride the one with our feet not dangling in about 40 minutes. We waited almost 80 minutes for the one in Jurassic Park that gets wet from around 2:00, but when we went around 6:45, we were able to ride in 15 minutes. The wait time for Revenge of the Mummy was about 30 minutes until around 2:00, but when we went at 2:20, we waited 60 minutes. We lined up alone next to a stranger and were able to ride in 10 minutes. If you go counterclockwise, you can ride the Puss in Boots attraction in 10 minutes, but if you go around 2 p.m., you'll have to wait for nearly 50 minutes. At first, I had to wait about 60 minutes for Sesame Street, but when I went around 5 p.m., I was able to ride in about 20 minutes. I was able to ride Shrek in about 15 minutes. I was able to ride the merry-go-round in about 10 minutes, and I was able to ride the merry-go-round with the penguins that I was looking forward to. Now I'd like to announce my rankings. 1st place: Revenge of the Mummy It was great with its unpredictable movements and thrills. 2nd place: Jurassic Park Rapid Adventure It was a little dizzying, but the thrill of not knowing when you'll get wet was great. 3rd place: Battlestar Galactica I was nervous at first, but when I got on, it wasn't as scary as I thought it would be. 4th place: Puss in Boots It wasn't thrilling, but the view was nice. 5th place: Transformers the Ride It was exciting and great 6th place: Shrek It was exciting and great. 7th place: Sesame Street I was glad to see Elmo. 8th place: Coffee Cup It was dizzying, but fun. 9th place: Merry-go-round It was great that there were so many different shapes. It was pretty crowded. I wish they'd add more attractions. I'd like to go again someday.

name: user_10637
review: Went this time for the 2nd time. feel very disappointed Had to queue for a very long time to get tickets that were purchased in advance. Conditions inside the amusement park look old. It's like it hasn't been updated at all. There are so few restaurants open that there aren't enough people to enter the theme park.

name: user_10639
review: Two of my favourite rides are the Battlestar Galactica and Transformer!

name: user_10640
review: The place is nice, clean, spacious, a place for family recreation

name: user_10642
review: Good place to enjoy with Family. Note Express pass is a must, else be prepared for long queues. Loads of rides and fun activities to do specially for kids.

name: user_10647
review: Amazing fun place. Very fun. The walkway, the sun is not too hot. If you buy tickets through Klook, you can enter faster and cheaper. Crowds are normal for Universal everywhere. There will be a very long queue for each ride. I recommend going early. When we go, this place opens at noon and closes at 7 p.m. There is no fountain light show near closing like at Disney. If you don't want to queue for long rides, you can buy tickets to skip the queue. If you want to take the cable car and see the view You can take the cable car. Then you can connect to the train to universal.

name: user_10650
review: 4 attractions, some restaurants & stores are still close. But we are having so much fun.

name: user_10651
review: Highly recommend to get the express pass otherwise you'll be waiting hours just to get one ride. This is probably the smallest US studio so there isn't much and the ride don't change that much either and best to go in good weather or bring umbrella as there's not a lot of rain cover if it does rain which tends to happen. The Battlestar Galactica and Rise of the Mummy is quite worth it to go and play. Food is quite expensive here and not all great. Toy store is quite good. There's also a regular parade which is fun. I believe they have a new Madagascar under construction.

name: user_10652
review: What an amazing place this is...something to do for all ages..i just love it

name: user_10661
review: Very good thame park

name: user_10669
review: A variety of rides for all ages. Love Shrek 4d and you can really get drenched at Jurassic park. Spaghetti monster , tea cup and flying dinosaurs are suitable for toddlers. Staff Nurhadiyah was very thoughtful to invite us to ride a second time at 5.55pm for the flying dinosaurs as the park shuts down with its last ride. The peak period is between 12.30- 2.30pm where you have to wait the longest. After that, its not as bad. Download the app to check for the waiting times. With the tourists returning, the wait can be 60 minutes during its peak but significantly reduced around 5pm. The animated characters also encapsulated our memories of the place with their beautifully crafted costumes and they interacted with the audience with a variety of poses.

name: user_10671
review: The queue time for each ride was appx 40mins on weekends!!!!

name: user_10672
review: Great! The attractions are great and the little shows are well put together. The employees in stores and at attractions are available and pleasant (a good point for us who did not speak their language). Waiting times were not very long and the spaces were clean and fairly ventilated. Finally, the reason for my 5th star: the public areas had practically no smokers (I didn't meet any to be honest) and having been with my children to Disney Land, this is more than appreciable.

name: user_10675
review: Traveling here is quite hot. Opens at noon, but I was told to wait in line for the Transformer ride. It's a very long wait in line, but overall it's good. There are quite a few rides.

name: user_10677
review: Must use express, despite it' very expensive in total. But what can you expect, this is Singapore, one the most expensive city in the world. Using express, cut the queue time more than 50%.

name: user_10678
review: It was shocking, granted not enough staff because of COVID but the staff that they had couldn't give a stuff wouldn't open the single line queues to help with the length of the lines 90 minute wait and why would you pay extra for a quick pass that when it rains you can't use anyway really poor l think that the American franchise needs to come over and show them how it's done Afterall it is their name and the only reason that we went.

name: user_10679
review: Some of rides were closed suddenly for maintenance due to technical issues when we were standing in the queue. Compared to USS Tokyo, the express pass were quite expensive.

name: user_10680
review: Experience with the theme park was pretty sub-par. The park was very small and have an entire section closed off. Most shows are no longer available and there were limited food places. Crowd and long queue is to be expected, but express pass was not nessesary imo unless you really cannot wait. The park was very small so you can pretty much cover the entire park even with the long queueing time. Go on single rider decreases wait time drastically.

name: user_10681
review: Long queues. Hot areas. Transformers 3d video not so clear

name: user_10682
review: Full of fun... galactica, revenge of the mummy, jurassic park, adrenaline-pumping roller coaster game

name: user_10690
review: They changed the opening hours to 12pm-7pm on weekdays. Even on a weekday it was packeddddd. We didn't get the fast pass however managed to get on cyclone, transformers, mummy rides. The waiting was crazzyyyy. If you have money to spend then I suggest do get the fast pass. Even with that the waiting time for fast pass can go up to 1hr plus plus. I suggest pick the ride you wanna ride first (cyclone was insane , but waited 2hrs for 50s of the ride haha) so you'll have the shortest waiting time for it. Then continue on with the rest. 1. Cyclone/human (human opens only at 4pm onwards) 2. Mummy 3. Transformer Remaining time can go explore the park. Have fun !

name: user_10694
review: absolutely amazing rides, attractions & food. extremely crowded during peak periods (weekends/public holidays) to avoid spending too much time in queues, purchasing an express pass is recommended.

name: user_10696
review: Great place for kids Buy express pass else not possible to do the place in a day Food is overpriced and quite limited

name: user_10698
review: This place is overrated, I have been to better theme parks. Approx 1 to 1.5 hour queue per ride for most rides. We would not come back here considering the amount of money we spent here as a family.

name: user_10703
review: Minion Too many people Need to queue

name: user_10706
review: Must go tourist attractions! With fast track pass, you can wrap up in 3 hours

name: user_10708
review: Best theme park experience so far, advice to go in earlier, and queue for those hot attractions

name: user_10709
review: A must do on a Singapore trip if you have time. Get the Universal Pass and skip the lines. Soooo worth the 90 extra !!!

name: user_10710
review: Nice place to play with my family... unfortunately the queue is more than 30 minutes, even though I came on Monday. The opening hours at 12. my vacation should be longer so I can enjoy every places in singapore

name: user_10714
review: Buy online tickets to skip the queue.

name: user_10716
review: It's my 3rd time and still great.

name: user_10720
review: I went to universal studio 2 weeks ago for the first time. It was quite nice. Although it was Thursday, the average waiting time for several popular venues were more than 1h. So we decided to go to less popular ones first and come back later. The strategy worked quite well. By the last hour, there was almost no queue anymore. The pity was that there were no minions gongfu show on that day. But we could still take photographs with minions together. They have a big Lego store at the exit which worths a visit. For families with kids, express pass might be helpful especially during the peak time.

name: user_10721
review: There are quite a lot of types of games or attractions, the queue for each game is very long even on weekdays. maybe the influence of the school holiday season. one day visit is not enough.

name: user_10723
review: If you're coming on the weekend, please buy the express. Please, please. It's like going to the regular once for every two times I go to the express. I almost burst into a fit of rage.

name: user_10725
review: Third time to USS Singapore. My last visit was in 2019 (precovid), and I remember vividly how exciting the rides were. This time around waiting time was awfully long, rides were cut short prolly due to the crowd, no proper ventilation to meet the demand of the crowd in the waiting area. Certain rides require you to wait in the scorching heat. Some of the staffs were also rude. Please improve your service as per your price.

name: user_10727
review: If I had a preview to see what I experienced I wont come in, even for free.

name: user_10729
review: We were disappointed, as it was not like the universal studio in LA. It's just an amusement park for childrens. Waterpark was also closed in high summer?!

name: user_10731
review: Animations are nice. Good weekend spot with kids

name: user_10732
review: Amazing for all age groups. Had loads of fun Some rides are scary though

name: user_10736
review: This is a theme park located on USS Sentosa Island, which is great because there are many other things to do on the island itself. The price is about 70,000 won per day for adults. Approximately 50,000 won for children It's not cheap at all. Express Pass tickets cost 20,000 to 30,000 won on top of the basic price. The line is quite fast. The scale felt the same or smaller than Lotte World. Because it is a franchise, the prices are quite expensive. If you don't go there just to ride the rides, people who like taking pictures or who like the universal world view will likely enjoy it. Even though it was a weekday, there were a lot of people. Depending on popularity without Express Pass, the wait can be as short as 30 minutes or as long as 2 hours. I was the worst because I didn't like waiting in line. The restaurants in the theme park are packed with people trying to order, and the prices are much higher than Singapore prices, so I recommend eating a good meal before entering the USS. For simple food and beverages sold at stands, the waiting line is long and stock runs out early. There is a card reader, but is it broken? There are many places that only accept cash. In conclusion, I think visiting once is enough.

name: user_10738
review: It was one of the best experience of my life!! As per me the best ride here is "Transformers". Make sure once you are in, you quickly go towards the rides or else get ready to wait for as long as 1-2 hours in queue.

name: user_10740
review: Extremely long queues, very hot. In many places you have to wait under direct sunlight. Drinking fountains doesnt work at half of places. And its very crowded here.

name: user_10742
review: It's nice and we enjoyed it, but it's not enough for one day of busy games

name: user_10743
review: Best for kids and we have a Wonderful time and happiness

name: user_2095
review: Must visit place for kids. Get the tickets in advance approx a week before Incase if you r visiting on Weekends. Nowadays tickets are fixed date Prioritize the below rides first 1. Transformers 2. Mummy Ride 3. Dinosaur 4. Rollercoaster ( 2 rides ) Note : Pack your snacks since most the restaurants are closed

name: user_10748
review: Recommends going here as soon as they open at 12nn. Then go straight to the extreme rides at Sci-Fi City and Return of the Mummy. You will save massive amount of time doing that. The waiting can be as long as 1-2hrs after the influx of people after that. Also try to ride the Rapids last or else you will be walking around the park wet All in all, a memorable experience for the kids and kids at heart

name: user_10749
review: Universal Studios is just like a James Bond movie experience, all the rides are fun and thrilling, every one will love the Studios. U have to buy the Universal express pass in order to cover all the rides and attractions otherwise you will end up enjoying 2 or 3 rides max because of the huge crowd and rush which would leave you waiting for hours for each ride, This Universal Studios is the best in Asia

name: user_10752
review: Mixed emotions. Be prepared for enormous lines and very limited food options x 3 times more expensive then outside. Hoping Food can improve.

name: user_10753
review: Worst place, waste of money, long queues, average 1 hour long. Most food shops closed, overcrowded, bad management.

name: user_10756
review: A wonderful theme park. It is one of kind. Very beautiful interiors. The rides were jaw dropping. It's just so fantastic . Kids to adults to everyone will just enjoy themselves. It's a must visit

name: user_10757
review: I will not recommend this place to anyone, save your money and go somewhere instead. Theres a min of an hour wait for each attractions. The place looks very old and rundown . A lot of food stalls are closed. Its just a very bad experience overall. They should just shut this place down and renovate.

name: user_10758
review: Universal Studios Singapore is a theme park for amusement rides and entertainment based on famous Hollywood films produced by Universal Studios. Such as Jurassic Park, Mummy, Transformers, Dinosaur, Human vs Cylon and other rides. This ride can be enjoyed by children and adults. Extreme, exciting and adrenaline-testing rides. The location of Universal Studio Singapore is on Sentosa Island, Singapore. The Universal Studio location is also equipped with restaurants, food and beverage outlets, shopping areas and also souvenir shops.

name: user_10762
review: I haven't played it yet, but the games here are really of good quality, but I have to wait a bit

name: user_10763
review: I was there on July 1, 2022. Despite what I read about rides being closed, poorly staffed and so on - I didnt find that to be the case. ALL rides were open and they extended the park hours till 7. Staff was friendly, rides were super fun, and had a wonderful experience. It was a Friday, and a bit crowded, to the Express Pass helped. Rode our favorite things multiple times. They had some character meet and greets available, no lines for food, and just a positive experience. Im so glad I went!

name: user_10770
review: Recommend to visit on weekday, avoid the public holiday and long weekend. Staff is very nice. The food is so so.

name: user_10776
review: Will describe more later, i really enjoy to spend time with my best friend here.

name: user_10777
review: i play the transformers 4D and the rollercoaster it is so fun

name: user_10779
review: Superb park not as big as the one in Florida. You have around ten attractions that are great for medium and small children. Lots of characters. And its easy to meet them. The prices are not too expensive. Just avoid eating in the retro restaurant at the entrance to the park because the meal is not good at all, cold and very expensive. They reheated our nuggets in the microwave. The park is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, please note. It was a Saturday and frankly it was manageable. Go there for a day with the family, there are lots of candy and chocolate stores near Universal

name: user_10781
review: Great place for holidaybut the express ticket is too expensive

name: user_10783
review: A lot waiting. Wasted a lot of time. Only go there if you can afford to buy the express pass

name: user_10785
review: Nothing like Orlando. Small and one whole section was closed with no warning, still at full price. The experience is nice overall! I wouldn't repeat. The food options are very limited and not great. The best was the roller coaster.

name: user_10788
review: Great fun day enjoyed the rides that we managed to get to. So many people arrived so really unfortunate to spend so much time just to stand in queues. My advice will just purchase the higher price tickets in advance to avoid the queues and use the fast lanes. Also the studio does not open until 12:00 which is ashame as 6 hours was not enough considering most of that time was spent waiting.

name: user_10794
review: Lots of people in this amusement park even though it is the middle of the week (a Wednesday). Many attractions, shops and restaurants closed. However, the price has not changed... Apart from these inconveniences, the park is nice to visit once with the children but a second time would certainly be too much. The attractions are rather successful (big plus for the Transformers attraction) even if the waiting times are worthy of Disneyland. You have to buy the fastpass for the day to be profitable but this makes for a very expensive entry for rather limited content. I only tried one fast restaurant there. I was extremely disappointed. The nuggets were of low quality, and the "hotdog" that was served to me did not deserve to end its life in my stomach but rather in a trash can. When you visit a culinary city like Singapore, it must be said that you fall from a very high place. It's best to bring your own food or eat at one of the restaurants outside the park. I was entitled to a voucher for popcorns but I was never able to use it... People are so hungry that there are always a lot of people in front of the only popcorn truck in the park. In short, do it once and then move on. Life is too short :)

name: user_10795
review: I went on Friday to visit the aquarium at the same time, but it was crowded and the hot weather made it difficult to fully use the rides. I misread the 1-day unlimited pass and mistook it for an admission ticket, but it's better to take the express for about 40,000 won. If you wait in line and ride it once, it's closing time, so ride it once without waiting in line and take a look around and buy a souvenir before leaving. The rides are fun enough, but the price is a bit expensive. Unless you feel catharsis from standing in line, get the express. The egg character t-shirts at the souvenir shop are cute.

name: user_10797
review: Wait times for rides much longer than advertised. Most restaurants were not open and what was had few choices. Very expensive and not worth the price.

name: user_10798
review: Overcrowded. 60 mins wait for most rides making it impossible to endure the wait in the hot tropical weather. Ideal for individuals with children and for those who love taking selfies and photographs.

name: user_10877
review: Buying an express ticket is highly recommended. Otherwise you will end up queuing at least an hour for each ride.

name: user_10896
review: What can I say..This is the Best..and I'm in no position to review The Universal studios.

name: user_10913
review: Buy tickets in advance online. If you can afford please also buy express pass which costs SGD 60 separately than ticket. Time required- 1 full day 12pm to 7pm are the open hours of theme park. Singapores only movie-theme park features 24 rides and attractions, including a pair of dueling coasters that brush past one another in several near misses in their aerial combat. Thrill-seekers can choose between a coaster where they are seated or the other where riders are suspended. Exciting loops, sudden turns, breathtaking drops and thrilling near-collisions will make you scream your heart out. Dinosaurs, lemurs, ogres and Egyptian mummies add to the thrills and adventures.
